analyzed: disā iti asuññāya iva mama sā disā tattha kāraṇam āha tava ovādaḥ buddhānam ovāda sadisaḥ ti
translated: Here is the reason: “Your advice is like the advice of the Buddhas.”

original: Vasituṃ na dassatīti ekagandhakuṭiyaṃ vāsaṃ na labhissatīti adhippāyo. Parammukhā
analyzed: vasitum na dassati iti eka gandhakuṭiyam vāsam na labhissati iti adhippāyaḥ parammukhā
translated: “He will not allow me to live with him” means: the intention is, “he will not allow me to live in the same fragrant hut.”🔽“Even if the Dhamma is taught to him with his face turned away” refers to the teaching of the suttas.

original: desitassāpi dhammassāti suttantadesanaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Abhidhammadesanā panassa
analyzed: desitassa api dhammassa ati suttanta desanam sandhāya vuttam abhidhamma desanā pana assa
translated: But the teaching of the Abhidhamma

original: parammukhāva pavattā pageva yācanāya. Tassā vācanāmaggopi sāriputtattherappabhavo.
analyzed: parammukhā ava pavattā pagā iva yācanāya tassāḥ vācanā maggaḥ api sāriputta thera ppabhavo
translated: and still more so when he was asked to do so. The method of reciting it was introduced by the Elder Sāriputta.

original: Kasmā? So niddesapaṭisambhidā viya therassa bhikkhuto gahitadhammakkhandhapakkhiyo.
analyzed: kasmā saḥ niddesa paṭisambhidā viya therassa bhikkhutaḥ gahita dhamma kkhandha pakkhiyaḥ
translated: Why? He was like the Elder in that he had taken up the aggregates of dhamma as the Elder had done, as if they were a basket of requisites.

original: Apare pana “dhammabhaṇḍāgāriko paṭipāṭiyā tikadukesu devasikaṃ katokāso bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: apare pana dhammabhaṇḍāgāriko paṭipāṭiyā tika dukesu devasikam kata ukāsaḥ bhagavantam
translated: But others say that the Elder, as the treasurer of the Dhamma, asked the Blessed One every day in turn a question about the triplets and couplets,🔽and the Blessed One answered his questions by giving him the method. So the Abhidhamma

original: pañhaṃ pucchi, bhagavāpissa pucchitapucchitaṃ nayadānavasena vissajjesi. Evaṃ abhidhammopi🔽satthārā parammukhā desitopi therena sammukhā paṭiggahitova ahosī”ti vadanti. Sabbaṃ
analyzed: pañham pucchi bhagavā api ssa pucchita pucchitam naya dāna vasena vissajjesi evam abhidhammaḥ api  satthārā parammukhā desitaḥ api therena sammukhā paṭiggahitaḥ va ahosi iti vadanti sabbam
translated: was taught by the Master to the Elder face to face, though indirectly, and was received by the Elder face to face.

original: vīmaṃsitvā gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vīmaṃsitvā gahetabbam
translated: All this should be investigated and then accepted.

original: Aggupaṭṭhākoti upaṭṭhāne sakkaccakāritāya aggabhūto upaṭṭhāko. Thero hi upaṭṭhākaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: aggupaṭṭhāko ti upaṭṭhāne sakkacca kāritāya agga bhūto upaṭṭhāko theraḥ hi upaṭṭhāka ṭṭhānam
translated: Foremost in service: the foremost in service because of his zealous performance of the duties of service. For the Elder, from the time he received the position of attendant,

original: laddhakālato paṭṭhāya bhagavantaṃ duvidhena udakena, tividhena dantakaṭṭhena, pādaparikammena,
analyzed: laddha kālataḥ paṭṭhāya bhagavantam duvidhena udakena tividhena danta kaṭṭhena pāda parikammena
translated: served the Blessed One with two kinds of water, with three kinds of wood for tooth-cleaning, with the duties of a saluting attendant,

original: gandhakuṭipariveṇasammajjanenāti evamādīhi kiccehi upaṭṭhahanto “imāya nāma velāya
analyzed: gandha kuṭi pariveṇa sammajjanena ati evamādīhi kiccehi upaṭṭhahantaḥ imāya nāma velāya
translated: “By sweeping out the Fragrant Cell and the surrounding verandah”: by attending to such duties as these.

original: satthu idaṃ nāma laddhuṃ vaṭṭati, idaṃ nāma kātuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti cintetvā taṃ taṃ nipphādento
analyzed: satthu idam nāma laddhum vaṭṭati idam nāma kātum vaṭṭati iti cintetvā tam tam nipphādento
translated: “By sweeping the Perfumed Cell and the surrounding verandah”: by attending to such duties as these. Thinking: “At this time it is proper to get this or that for the Master, at this time it is proper to do this or that for him,” he prepared this or that.

original: mahatiṃ daṇḍadīpikaṃ gahetvā ekarattiṃ gandhakuṭipariveṇaṃ nava vāre anupariyāyati.🔽Evaṃ hissa ahosi “sace me thinamiddhaṃ okkameyya, bhagavati pakkosante paṭivacanaṃ
analyzed: mahatim daṇḍadīpikam gahetvā eka rattim gandhakuṭi pariveṇam nava vāre anupariyāyati  evam hissa ahosi sace me thinam iddham okkameyya bhagavati pakkosante paṭivacanam
translated: Taking a large torch, he went round the Perfumed Cell and the surrounding verandah nine times during the night, thinking:

original: dātuṃ nāhaṃ sakkuṇeyya”nti, tasmā sabbarattiṃ daṇḍadīpikaṃ hatthena na muñcati. Tena
analyzed: dātum na aham sakkuṇeyyanti tasmai sabbarattim daṇḍadīpikam hatthena na muñcati tena
translated: “If I should fall asleep, I would not be able to give an answer if the Exalted One should call me.” Therefore he did not let go of the torch with his hand all night.

original: vuttaṃ “aggupaṭṭhāko”ti.
analyzed: vuttam aggupaṭṭhākaḥ ti
translated: Therefore it was said: “The chief attendant.”

original: 12. Pitumātujātanagaraparicchedo pitumukhena āgatattā “pitiparicchedo”ti vutto.
analyzed: pitu mātu jāta nagara paricchedo pitu mukhena āgata ttā piti paricchedo ti vutto
translated: The chapter on the city of the clan of the father is called “The chapter on the clan of the father” because it comes through the father.

original: Vihāraṃ pāvisīti gandhakuṭiṃ pāvisi. Ettakaṃ kathetvāti kappaparicchedādinavavārapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ
analyzed: vihāram pāvisi iti gandhakuṭim pāvisi ettakam kathetvā ati kappa pariccheda ādi nava vāra paṭimaṇḍitam
translated: “Entered the monastery”: entered the Perfumed Cell. Having spoken this much,

original: vipassīādīnaṃ sattannaṃ buddhānaṃ pubbenivāsapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ ettāvatā desanaṃ desetvā.
analyzed: vipassi ādīnam sattannam buddhānam pubbenivāsa paṭisaṃyuttam ettāvatā desanam desetvā
translated: and after teaching the story of the past life of the seven Buddhas beginning with Vipassī,

original: Kasmā panettha bhagavā vipassīādīnaṃ sattannaṃyeva buddhānaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ kathesi,🔽na buddhavaṃsadesanāyaṃ viya pañcavīsatiyā buddhānaṃ, tato vā pana bhiyyoti? Anadhikārato,
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha bhagavā vipassī ādīnam sattannam yeva buddhānam pubbenivāsam kathesi  na pañcavīsatiyāḥ buddhānam tatas vā pana anadhikārato
translated: Why did the Blessed One tell the story of the past life of only seven Buddhas beginning with Vipassī,🔽and not of twenty-five Buddhas as in the Buddha-vaṃsa, or of more than that? Because it was not the occasion,

original: payojanābhāvato ca. Buddhavaṃsadesanāyañhi –
analyzed: payojana abhāvataḥ ca buddha vaṃsa desanāyan hi
translated: and because there was no purpose in it. For in the Buddha-vaṃsa,

original: “Kīdiso te mahāvīra, abhinīhāro naruttama;
analyzed: kīdisaḥ te mahāvīra abhinīhāraḥ naruttama
translated: “What was your aspiration, Great Hero, Supreme Man?🔽In what time did you aspire, Hero, to the supreme enlightenment?”

original: Kamhi kāle tayā vīra, patthitā bodhimuttamā”ti. ādinā –
analyzed: kamhi kāle tayā vīra patthitā bodhimuttamā ati ādinā
translated: and so on,🔽the Blessed One, having made the question asked by the Elder Culla-Siva, which was the occasion for the Buddha-vaṃsa, the reason for it,

original: Pavattaṃ taṃ pucchaṃ adhikāraṃ aṭṭhuppattiṃ katvā yassa sammāsambuddhassa pādamūle
analyzed: pavattam tam puccham adhikāram aṭṭhuppattim katvā yassa sammāsambuddhassa pāda mūle
translated: at the feet of which Perfect Buddha

original: attanā mahābhinīhāro kato, taṃ dīpaṅkaraṃ bhagavantaṃ ādiṃ katvā yesaṃ catuvīsatiyā
analyzed: mahā abhinīhāro kataḥ tam dīpaṅkaram bhagavantam ādim katvā catuvīsatiyā
translated: he himself made the great aspiration, beginning with the Blessed One Dīpaṅkara, and in the presence of which twenty-four

original: buddhānaṃ santikā bodhiyā laddhabyākaraṇo hutvā tattha tattha pāramiyo pūresi, tesaṃ
analyzed: buddhānam santikā bodhiyā laddha byākaraṇaḥ hutvā tattha tattha pāramiyaḥ pūresi tesam
translated: Buddhas he received the prophecy of his enlightenment and fulfilled the Perfections here and there,

original: paṭipattisaṅkhāto pubbenivāso, attano ca paṭipatti kathitā, idha pana tādiso adhikāro
analyzed: paṭipatti saṅkhātaḥ pubbenivāso attano ca paṭipatti kathitā idha pana tādisaḥ adhikāraḥ
translated: The former existences described in the way of practice are his own practice. But here there is no such subject

original: natthi, yena dīpaṅkarato paṭṭhāya, tato vā pana purato buddhe ārabbha pubbenivāsaṃ
analyzed: na atthi yena dīpaṅkarataḥ paṭṭhāya tatas vā pana puratas buddhe ārabbha pubbenivāsam
translated: for discussion that he could describe the former existences of the Buddhas beginning with Dīpaṅkara or even before him.

original: katheyya. Tasmā na ettha buddhavaṃsadesanāyaṃ viya pubbenivāso vitthārito. Yasmā
analyzed: katheyya tasmai naḥ ettha buddha vaṃsa desanā ayam viya pubbenivāsaḥ vitthāritaḥ yasmā
translated: Therefore the former existences are not elaborated here as they are in the Buddha- lineage teaching.

original: ca buddhānaṃ desanā nāma desanāya bhājanabhūtānaṃ puggalānaṃ ñāṇabalānurūpā, na attano🔽ñāṇabalānurūpā, tasmā tattha aggasāvakānaṃ, mahāsāvakānaṃ, tādisānañca devabrahmānaṃ
analyzed: ca buddhānam desanā nāma desanāya bhājana bhūtānam puggalānam ñāṇa bala anurūpā na attanaḥ  ñāṇa bala anurūpā aggasāvakānam mahāsāvakānam devabrahmānam
translated: And since the Buddhas’ teaching is in accordance with the strength of the knowledge of the persons who are fit vessels for the teaching, not in accordance with the strength of their own knowledge,🔽therefore the teaching is elaborated there in accordance with the chief disciples, the great disciples, and such gods and Brahmas,

original: vasena desanā vitthāritā. Idha pana pakatisāvakānaṃ, tādisānañca devatānaṃ vasena🔽pubbenivāsaṃ kathento sattannameva buddhānaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ kathesi. Tathā hi ne bhagavā
analyzed: vasena desanā vitthāritā idha pana pakati sāvakānam tādisānam ca devatānam vasena  pubbenivāsam kathentaḥ sattannam eva buddhānam pubbenivāsam kathesi tathā hi ne bhagavā
translated: but here the Blessed One, describing the former existences in accordance with ordinary disciples and such gods,

original: palobhanavasena samuttejetuṃ sappapañcatāya kathāya desanaṃ matthakaṃ apāpetvāva
analyzed: palobhana vasena samuttejetum sa ppapañca tāya kathāya desanam matthakam
translated: described the former existences of seven Buddhas. For the Blessed One did not bring the teaching to its conclusion with a detailed account in order to inspire them by way of enticement.

original: gandhakuṭiṃ pāvisi. Tathā ca imissā eva desanāya anusārato āṭānāṭiyaparitta- desanādayo pavattā.🔽Apicettha bhagavā attano suddhāvāsacārikāvibhāviniyā uparidesanāya saṅgahatthaṃ vipassīādīnaṃ
analyzed: gandhakuṭim pāvisi tathā ca imissā eva desanāya anusārataḥ āṭā nāṭiya paritta desanā ādayaḥ pavattā  apica ittha bhagavā attanaḥ suddhāvāsa cārikā vibhāviniyā upari desanāya saṅgaha attham vipassī ādīnam
translated: and he entered the Fragrant Cell. And it was in accordance with this teaching that the Āṭānāṭiya Discourse, the Paritta Discourses, and so on, were delivered.🔽Herein, the Blessed One related the past lives of the seven Fully Enlightened Ones beginning with Vipassī in order to include them in his own teaching, which reveals the wanderings in the Pure Abodes.

original: eva sattannaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ kathesi. Tesaṃyeva hi sāvakā tadā ceva
analyzed: eva sattannam sammāsambuddhānam pubbenivāsam kathesi tesam yeva hi sāvakā tadā ca iva
translated: For the disciples of those Buddhas, as well as of the Blessed One himself, are established in the Pure Abodes both then and now,

original: etarahi ca suddhāvāsabhūmiyaṃ ṭhitā, na aññesaṃ parinibbutattā. “Siddhatthatissaphussānaṃ
analyzed: etarahi ca suddhāvāsa bhūmiyam ṭhitāḥ na aññesam parinibbuta ttā siddhattha tissa phussānam
translated: but not those of the others, because they have attained final Nibbāna. “The disciples of the Buddhas Siddhattha, Tisya, and Phussa,

original: kira buddhānaṃ sāvakā suddhāvāsesu upapannā upapattisamanantarameva imasmiṃ sāsane
analyzed: kira buddhānam sāvakāḥ suddhāvāsesu upapannāḥ upapatti samanantaram eva imasmim sāsane
translated: it seems, were reborn in the Pure Abodes, and immediately on being reborn they reached Arahantship in this dispensation, like Upavāṇa and the others,

original: upakādayo viya arahattaṃ adhigantvā nacirasseva parinibbāyiṃsu, na tattha tattha
analyzed: upaka ādayaḥ viya arahattam adhigantvā nacirassa iva parinibbāyiṃsu na tattha tattha
translated: and they attained final Nibbāna without remaining there for long. They did not remain there for the whole of their lives as did the disciples of the other Buddhas” .

original: yāvatāyukaṃ aṭṭhaṃsū”ti vadanti. Tathā yesaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ paṭivedhasāsanaṃ ekaṃsato
analyzed: yāvatā āyukam vadanti tathā yesam sammāsambuddhānam paṭivedha sāsanam ekaṃsataḥ
translated: And they say that the disciples of those Buddhas whose dispensation was one of penetration remained in the Pure Abodes for the whole of their lives.

original: nicchaye na ajjāpi dharati, na antarahitaṃ, te eva kittento vipassīādīnaṃyeva bhagavantānaṃ
analyzed: nicchaye na ajjā api dharati na antarahitam te eva kittentaḥ
translated: If he does not remember even now, then he is not extinct. The same kittens are the past lives of the Blessed Ones Vipassī, etc.,

original: pubbenivāsaṃ imasmiṃ sutte kathesi veneyyajjhāsayavasena. Apubbācarimaniyamo pana
analyzed: pubbenivāsam imasmin sutte kathesi veneyya ajjhāsaya vasena pana
translated: which he related in this sutta according to the dispositions of those to be trained. But the rule that the former births must be in the same world-sphere

original: aparāparaṃ saṃsaraṇakasattavāsavasena ekissā lokadhātuyā icchitoti na tenetaṃ virujjhatīti
analyzed: apara aparam saṃsaraṇaka satta vāsa vasena ekissā lokadhātuyā icchito ti na tena itam virujjhati iti
translated: is not contradicted, since it is held that the beings who pass on from one existence to another are in the same world-sphere.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Nirantaraṃ matthakaṃ pāpetvāti abhijātito paṭṭhāya yāva pātimokkhuddeso
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam nirantaram matthakam pāpetvā ti abhijātitaḥ paṭṭhāya yāva pātimokkha uddeso
translated: “He would have to carry it on his head without interruption”: the construction is that he would have to carry it on his head from the time of his conception until the recitation of the Pātimokkha,

original: yāva tā buddhakiccasiddhi, tāva matthakaṃ sikhaṃ pāpetvā. Na tāva kathitoti yojanā.
analyzed: yāva tā buddha kicca siddhi tāva matthakam sikham pāpetvā na tāva kathitā iti yojanā
translated: until the success of the Buddha’s task. “He would not have to carry it” is the construction.🔽“The Dhamma drum”: the drum of the Dhamma. The meaning is: the drum of the True Idea.

original: Tantinti dhammatantiṃ, pariyattinti attho. Puttaputtamātuyānavihāradhanavihāradāyakādīnaṃ sambahulānaṃ atthānaṃ vibhāvanavasena pavattavāro sambahulavāro.
analyzed: tantim ti dhamma tantim pariyattim ti attho putta putta mātu yāna vihāra dhana vihāra dāyaka ādīnam sambahulānam atthānam vibhāvana vasena pavatta vāraḥ sambahulavāraḥ
translated: The section dealing with many matters is the section that occurs by way of the elucidation of many matters such as the donors of sons, daughters, wives, dwellings, wealth, etc.

original: Sambahulavāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: sambahula vāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The section dealing with many matters

original: Kāmañcāyaṃ pāḷiyaṃ anāgato, aṭṭhakathāsu āgatattā pana ānetvā dīpetabboti taṃ dīpento
analyzed: kāmam ca ayam pāḷiyam anāgataḥ aṭṭhakathāsu āgata ttā pana ānetvā dīpetabbo ti tam dīpentaḥ
translated: Although this is not given in the text, it should be brought in and demonstrated because it is given in the commentaries. So, demonstrating it,🔽he said: “The section dealing with many matters is this.”

original: “sabbabodhisattānañhī”tiādimāha. Kulavaṃso kulānukkamo. Paveṇīti paramparā. “Kasmā”ti
analyzed: sabba bodhisattānam hi itiādim āha kula vaṃsaḥ kula anukkamaḥ paveṇī iti paramparā kasmā iti
translated: “The lineage of all Bodhisattvas” and so on. The lineage of the family is the succession of the family. The line is the series. “Why?”

original: puttuppattiyā kāraṇaṃ pucchitvā taṃ vissajjento “sabbaññubodhisattānañhī”tiādimāha,
analyzed: putta uppattiyāḥ kāraṇam pucchitvā tam vissajjentaḥ sabbaññu bodhisattānam hi iti ādim āha
translated: Having asked the reason for the birth of a son, he answers, “The lineage of all Bodhisattvas” and so on.

original: tena tesaṃ jātanagarādi paññāyamānaṃ ekaṃsato manussabhāvasañjānanatthaṃ icchitabbaṃ,
analyzed: tena tesam jāta nagara ādi paññāyamānam ekaṃsataḥ manussa bhāva sañjānana attham icchitabbam
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that their birthplace and so on are known as one in the human state,

original: aññathā yathādhippetabuddhakiccasiddhi eva na siyāti dasseti, yato mahāsattānaṃ carimabhave
analyzed: aññathā yathā adhippeta buddha kicca siddhi eva na siyā ti dasseti yatas mahāsattānam carima bhave
translated: otherwise, it would not be possible to accomplish the duties of a Buddha as they should be, as shown. Because for the Great Beings,🔽in their last existence,

original: manussaloke eva pātubhāvo, na aññattha.
analyzed: manussa loke eva pātubhāvaḥ na aññattha
translated: they appear only in the human world, not elsewhere.

original: Sambahulaparicchedavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sambahula pariccheda vaṇṇanā
translated: Explanation of the section on many

original: Candādīnaṃ sobhāvisesaṃ raheti cajāpetīti rāhu, rāhuggaho, idha pana rāhu viyāti
analyzed: canda ādīnam sobhā visesam raha iti cajāpeti iti rāhu rāhu gahaḥ idha pana rāhu
translated: Rāhu is so called because it seizes and devours the special beauty of the moon and so on. Here, however, it is like Rāhu.

original: rāhu. Bandhananti ca anatthuppattiṭṭhānataṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tathā mahāsattena vuttavacanameva
analyzed: rāhu bandhananti ca anattha uppatti ṭṭhānatam sandhāya vuttam tathā mahāsattena vutta vacanam eva
translated: Bondage is said with reference to the place of the arising of misfortune. Thus, having taken the words spoken by the Great Being,

original: gahetvā kumārassa “rāhulo”ti nāmaṃ akaṃsu. Athāti nipātamattaṃ. Rocinīti rocanasīlā,
analyzed: gahetvā kumārassa rāhulo ti nāmam akaṃsu atha ati nipāta mattam rocinī iti rocana sīlā
translated: they gave the prince the name Rāhula. Then is merely a particle. Rocinī means having the nature of shining,

original: ujjalarūpāti attho. Rucaggatīti rucaṃ pabhātaṃ āgatibhūtā, ga-kārāgamaṃ katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ujjala rūpā ti atthaḥ rucaggatī iti rucam pabhātam āgati bhūtā gakāra āgamam katvā vuttam
translated: the meaning is, ‘having a radiant form.’ ‘Having come to the light’ means having come to the light, having come to the radiance, the ‘ga’ being used for the ‘ra’ sound.

original: Itthiratanabhāvato manussaloke sabbāsaṃ itthīnaṃ bimbapaṭicchannabhūtāti bimbā.
analyzed: itthi ratana bhāvataḥ manussa loke sabbāsam itthīnam bimba paṭicchanna bhūtā ati bimbā
translated: Because of being a treasure of women, she is the foremost of all women in the world of men, and because of being hidden by her beauty, she is ‘Bimbā.’

original: Jhānā vuṭṭhāyāti pādakajjhānato uṭṭhāya.
analyzed: jhānā vuṭṭhāya ati pādakajjhānato uṭṭhāya
translated: Having arisen from the jhānas: having arisen from the basic jhānas.

original: Aṭṭhaṅgulubbedhāti aṭṭhaṅgulappamāṇabahalabhāvā. Cūḷaṃsena chādetvāti tiriyabhāgena🔽ṭhapanavasena sabbaṃ vihāraṭṭhānaṃ chādetvā. Suvaṇṇayaṭṭhiphālehīti phālappamāṇāhi
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgulu bbedhā ti aṭṭhaṅgula ppamāṇa bahala bhāvā cūḷaṃsena chādetvā iti tiriya bhāgena  ṭhapana vasena sabbam vihāra ṭhānam chādetvā suvaṇṇa yaṭṭhi phālehi iti phāla ppamāṇāhi
translated: Eight inches in thickness: having a thickness of eight inches. Having covered the whole monastery site: having covered the whole monastery site by means of the breadth of the cloth.

original: suvaṇṇayaṭṭhīhi. Suvaṇṇahatthipādānīti pakatihatthipādaparimāṇāni suvaṇṇakhaṇḍāni.
analyzed: suvaṇṇa yaṭṭhīhi suvaṇṇa hatthi pādāni iti pakati hatthi pāda parimāṇāni suvaṇṇa khaṇḍāni
translated: With golden posts: with golden posts the size of a phālu. With golden elephant’s feet: with pieces of gold the size of natural elephant’s feet.

original: Vuttanayenevāti cūḷaṃseneva. Suvaṇṇakaṭṭīhīti suvaṇṇakhaṇḍehi. Salakkhaṇānanti lakkhaṇasampannānaṃ sahassārānaṃ.
analyzed: vutta nayena iva ati cūḷaṃsena iva suvaṇṇa kaṭṭīhi iti suvaṇṇa khaṇḍehi sa lakkhaṇānam ti lakkhaṇa sampannānam sahassa arānam
translated: In the same way as before: with the same breadth of cloth. With golden beams: with pieces of gold. With a thousand pillars: with a thousand pillars endowed with the characteristics .

original: Bodhipallaṅkoti abhisambujjhanakāle nisajjaṭṭhānaṃ. Avijahitoti buddhānaṃ tathānisajjāya
analyzed: bodhi pallaṅko ti abhisambujjhana kāle nisajja ṭṭhānam a vijahito ti buddhānam tathā nisajjāya
translated: The seat of enlightenment: the place where he sat down at the time of his full enlightenment. Not abandoned: not abandoned by the Buddhas, because of their sitting in that way.

original: anaññatthabhāvībhāvato apariccatto. Tenāha “ekasmiṃyeva ṭhāne hotī”ti. Paṭhamapadagaṇṭhikāti
analyzed: anaññattha bhāvībhāvataḥ tena āha ekasmiṃ yeva ṭhāne hoti iti paṭhama pada gaṇṭhikā ati
translated: and it is not set aside because it does not become otherwise. Hence it is said, “It is in one place only.” The first step:

original: pacchime sopānaphalake ṭhatvā ṭhapiyamānassa dakkhiṇapādassa patiṭṭhahanaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: pacchime sopāna phalake ṭhatvā ṭhapiyamānassa dakkhiṇa pādassa patiṭṭhahana ṭṭhānaṃ
translated: it is the place where the right foot is put down when standing on the last step of the staircase.

original: Taṃ pana yasmā daḷhaṃ thiraṃ kenaci abhejjaṃ hoti, tasmā “padagaṇṭhī”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ
analyzed: tam pana yasmā daḷham thiram kenaci a bhejjam hoti tasmā padagaṇṭhī iti vuttam yasmin
translated: But that is firm and stable and cannot be broken by anyone, and so it is called “the first step.”

original: bhūmibhāge idāni jetavanamahāvihāro, tattha yasmiṃ ṭhāne purimānaṃ sabbabuddhānaṃ🔽mañcā paññattā, tasmiṃyeva padese amhākampi bhagavato mañco paññattoti katvā “cattāri
analyzed: bhūmi bhāge idāni jetavana mahāvihāro tattha yasmin ṭhāne purimānam sabba buddhānam  mañcā paññattā tasmin yeva padese amhākam pi bhagavataḥ mañco paññatto ti katvā cattāri
translated: In the place where the Great Monastery of Jeta’s Wood now stands, it was in the very same place that the beds of all the Buddhas of the past

original: mañcapādaṭṭhānāni avijahitāneva hontī”ti vuttaṃ. Mañcānaṃ pana mahantakhuddakabhāvena
analyzed: mañca pādaṭṭhānāni honti iti vuttam mañcānam pana mahanta khuddaka bhāvena
translated: were set up. And because it was in that very place that our Blessed One’s bed was set up, it is said, “The four places where the feet of the bed rested were not separated.” But because of the difference in the size of the beds,

original: mañcapaññāpanapadesassa mahantāmahantatā appamāṇaṃ, buddhānubhāvena pana so padeso
analyzed: mañca paññāpana padesassa mahanta amahanta tā appamāṇam buddha anubhāvena pana so padeso
translated: the places where the beds were set up were of different sizes, and so they were of immeasurable size. But by the Buddha’s power that place

original: sabbadā ekappamāṇoyeva hotīti “cattāri mañcapādaṭṭhānāni avijahitāneva hontī”ti vuttanti
analyzed: sabbadā eka ppamāṇaḥ yeva hoti iti cattāri mañca pādaṭṭhānāni honti iti vuttan ti
translated: always remains the same size. Hence it is said, “The four places where the feet of the bed rested were not separated.”

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vihāropi na vijahito yevāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Purimaṃ vihāraṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam vihāraḥ api na vijahitaḥ yeva ati ettha api esa iva nayo purimam vihāra ṭṭhānaṃ
translated: and the dwelling-place is not abandoned either. The same method applies here. The former site of the dwelling-place

original: na pariccajatīti hi attho.
analyzed: na pariccajati iti hi atthaḥ
translated: and the dwelling-place is not abandoned either. The meaning is that he does not give up the place where the dwelling-house was.🔽They are “distinguished” because they are “matted” , and “matted” is the same as “matted together” , the meaning being “different.”

original: Visiṭṭhā mattā vimattā, vimattāva vemattaṃ, visadisatāti attho. Pamāṇaṃ āroho. Padhānaṃ dukkarakiriyā. Rasmīti sarīrappabhā.🔽“Sattānaṃ pākatikahatthena chahattho majjhimapuriso, tato tiguṇaṃ bhagavato sarīrappamāṇanti🔽bhagavā aṭṭhārasahattho”ti vadanti. Apare pana bhaṇanti “manussānaṃ pākatikahatthena
analyzed: visiṭṭhāḥ mattāḥ vimattāḥ vimattā ava vemattam ati atthaḥ pamāṇam ārohaḥ padhānam dukkara kiriyā rasmi iti sarīra ppabhā  sattānam pākatika hatthena cha hatthaḥ majjhima puriso tatas tiguṇam bhagavataḥ sarīra ppamāṇam ti  bhagavā aṭṭhārasa hatthaḥ ti vadanti apare pana bhaṇanti manussānam pākatika hatthena
translated: The “height” is the measure of the height. The “effort” is the difficult action. The “rays” are the light of the body.🔽“The Blessed One is eighteen cubits tall, since the measure of the Blessed One’s body is three times the measure of an average man, who is six cubits tall, with a hand-span counting as one cubit” .

original: catuhattho majjhimapuriso, tato tiguṇaṃ bhagavato sarīrappamāṇanti bhagavā dvādasahattho🔽upādinnakarūpadhammavasena, samantato pana byāmamattaṃ byāmappabhā pharatīti upari
analyzed: catu hatthaḥ majjhima puriso tato tiguṇam bhagavataḥ sarīra ppamāṇam ti bhagavā dvādasa hatthaḥ  upādinnaka rūpa dhamma vasena samantataḥ pana byāma mattam byāma ppabhā pharati iti upari
translated: But others say that the Blessed One is twelve cubits tall, since the average man is four cubits tall, with a hand-span counting as one cubit, and the Blessed One’s body is three times that measure.

original: chahatthaṃ abbhuggato, bahalatarappabhā rūpena saddhiṃ aṭṭhārasahattho hotī”ti.
analyzed: cha hattham abbhuggataḥ bahalatara ppabhā rūpena saddhim aṭṭhārasa hatthaḥ hoti iti
translated: But the light of the body extends all round for a distance of a fathom, and it rises up to a height of six cubits, and so with the light it is eighteen cubits in height.

original: Addhaniyanti dīghakālaṃ.
analyzed: addhaniyanti dīgha kālam
translated: “For a long time” means for a long period.

original: Ajjhāsayapaṭibaddhanti bodhisambhārasambharaṇakāle tathāpavattajjhāsayādhīnaṃ, tathāpavattapatthanānurūpaṃ🔽vipulaṃ, vipulatarañca hotīti attho. Svāyamattho cariyāpiṭakavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayeneva
analyzed: ajjhāsaya paṭibaddhanti bodhi sambhāra sambharaṇa kāle tathā apavatta jjhāsaya adhīnam tathā apavatta patthanā anurūpam  vipulam vipulataram ca hoti iti cariyā piṭaka vaṇṇanā ayam vutta nayena iva
translated: “In accordance with the underlying tendency” means in accordance with the underlying tendency that has arisen in the way already stated, in accordance with the aspiration that has arisen in the way already stated,🔽at the time of accumulating the requisites for enlightenment. The meaning is that it is extensive and more extensive. This meaning should be understood here in the way stated in the commentary to the Cariyāpiṭaka.

original: veditabbo. Ettha ca yasmā sarīrappamāṇaṃ, padhānaṃ, sarīrappabhā ca buddhānaṃ visadisāti
analyzed: veditabbaḥ ettha ca yasmā sarīra ppamāṇam padhānam sarīra ppabhā ca buddhānam visadisā ati
translated: And here the size of the body, the range of the supernormal power, and the range of the light are not mentioned in the text because they are different for the Buddhas.

original: idha pāḷiyaṃ anāgatā, tasmā tehi saddhiṃ vemattatāsāmaññena āyukulānipi idha āharitvā🔽dīpitāni. Paṭividdhaguṇesūti adhigatasabbaññuguṇesu. Nanu ca bodhisambhāresu, veneyyapuggalaparimāṇe
analyzed: idha pāḷiyam anāgatā tasmā tehi saddhim vematta tā sāmaññena āyu kulāni api idha āharitvā  dīpitāni paṭividdha guṇesu iti adhigata sabbaññu guṇesu nanu ca bodhi sambhāresu veneyya puggala parimāṇe
translated: Therefore, together with them, the differences in the duration of life are also brought in here and shown.🔽“In the qualities that have been penetrated”: in the qualities of omniscience that have been attained.🔽But isn’t there a difference in the requisites for enlightenment and in the number of disciples to be trained?🔽It is true that there is no difference in these two, but they are included in the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: ca vemattaṃ natthīti? Saccaṃ natthi, tadubhayaṃ pana buddhaguṇaggahaṇena gahitameva🔽hotīti na uddhaṭaṃ. Yadaggena hi sabbabuddhānaṃ buddhaguṇesu vemattaṃ natthi, tadaggena
analyzed: ca vemattam natthi iti saccam natthi tat ubhayam pana buddha guṇa ggahaṇena gahitam eva 🔽hoti iti na uddhaṭam yad aggena hi sabba buddhānam buddha guṇesu vemattam na atthi tad aggena
translated: Therefore they are not mentioned. Since there is no difference in the qualities of the Buddhas of the past, present, and future,

original: nesaṃ sambodhisambhāresupi vemattaṃ natthīti. Kasmā? Hetuanurūpatāya phalassa, ekanteneva
analyzed: na īsam sambodhi sambhāresu pi vemattam natthi iti kasmā hetu anurūpa tāya phalassa ekantena iva
translated: There is no difference in their requisites for enlightenment. Why? Because the fruit is in accordance with the cause.

original: veneyyapuggalaparimāṇe vemattabhāvo vibhāvito. Mahābodhisattānañhi hetuavatthāyaṃ🔽sambhatūpanissayindriyaparipākā veneyyapuggalā carimabhave arahattasampattiyā paripositāni🔽kamalavanāni sūriyarasmisamphassena viya tathāgataguṇānubhāvasamphassena vibodhaṃ
analyzed: veneyya puggala parimāṇe vematta bhāvaḥ vibhāvitaḥ mahā bodhisattānam hi  sambhatūpanissaya indriya paripākā veneyya puggalā carima bhave arahatta sampattiyā paripositāni  kamala vanāni sūriya rasmi samphassena tathāgata guṇa anubhāva samphassena vibodham
translated: The difference in the number of disciples is due to the difference in the field of the roots of goodness of the Buddhas.

original: upagacchantīti dīpesuṃ aṭṭhakathācariyā.
analyzed: upagacchanti iti dīpesum aṭṭhakathā cariyā
translated: The teachers of the commentaries point out that the Buddhas’ disciples, who are the field for the roots of goodness of the great bodhisattvas, are fully developed by the power of the Tathāgatas’ special qualities, like a bed of lotuses by the rays of the sun, and attain arahatship in their last existence.

original: Nidhikumbhoti cattāro mahānidhayo sandhāya vadati. Jāto cāti. Ca-saddena katamahābhinīhāro cāti ayampi attho saṅgahitoti daṭṭhabbo. Vuttaṃ hetaṃ buddhavaṃse –
analyzed: nidhi kumbhaḥ ti cattāraḥ mahā nidhayaḥ sandhāya vadati jātaḥ ca ati ca saddena kata mahā abhinīhāro ca ati ayam pi attho saṅgahito ti daṭṭhabbaḥ vuttam ha etam buddhavaṃse
translated: “Nidhikumbho” is said with reference to the four great treasures. “Born” : the word “ca” should be understood to include “having made the great aspiration.” For this is said in the Buddhavamsa:

original: “Tārāgaṇā virocanti, nakkhattā gaganamaṇḍale;
analyzed: tārā gaṇāḥ virocanti nakkhattāḥ gagana maṇḍale
translated: “The multitudes of stars shine in the firmament of the sky;🔽The constellation Visākhā is united with the moon;

original: Visākhā candimāyuttā, dhuvaṃ buddho bhavissatī”ti. ;
analyzed: visākhā candima āyuttā dhuvam buddhaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: The Buddha will surely appear.”

original: “Eteneva ca sabbabuddhānaṃ visākhānakkhatteneva mahābhinīhāro hotī”ti ca vadanti.
analyzed: etena iva ca sabba buddhānam visākhānakkhattena iva mahā abhinīhāraḥ hoti iti ca vadanti
translated: “And it is by this very constellation of the Visākhā star that the Great Aspiration of all Buddhas comes to be fulfilled” .

original: 13. Ayaṃ gatīti ayaṃ pavatti pavattanākāro, aññe pubbenivāsaṃ anussarantā iminā ākārena🔽anussarantīti attho, yasmā cutito paṭṭhāya yāva paṭisandhi, tāva anussaraṇaṃ ārohanaṃ🔽atītaatītataraatītatamādijātisaṅkhāte pubbenivāse ñāṇassa abhimukhabhāvena pavattīti
analyzed: ayam gatī iti ayam pavatti pavattana ākāraḥ aññe pubbenivāsam anussarantāḥ iminā ākārena  anussaranti iti atthaḥ yasmā cutitaḥ paṭṭhāya yāva paṭisandhi tāva anussaraṇam ārohanam  atīta atītatara atītatama ādi jāti saṅkhāte pubbenivāse ñāṇassa abhimukha bhāvena pavatti iti
translated: This is the way: this is the occurrence, the mode of occurrence, of the remembering. The meaning is that those who remember past lives do so in this way.🔽And because the remembering occurs with the face turned towards the past lives called “former existences” from the time of death backwards as far as the rebirth-linking,🔽it is called “ascending” .

original: katvā. Tasmā paṭisandhito paṭṭhāya yāva cuti, tāva anussaraṇaṃ orohanaṃ pubbenivāse🔽paṭimukhabhāvena ñāṇassa pavattīti āha “pacchāmukhaṃ ñāṇaṃ pesetvā”ti. Cutigantabbanti
analyzed: katvā tasmā paṭisandhito paṭṭhāya yāva cuti tāva anussaraṇam orohanam pubbenivāse  paṭimukha bhāvena ñāṇassa pavatti iti āha pacchāmukham ñāṇam pesetvā iti cuti gantabbanti
translated: And because the remembering occurs with the face turned towards the past lives from the rebirth-linking backwards as far as death,🔽it is called “descending” .

original: yaṃ panidaṃ cutiyā ñāṇagatiyā gantabbaṃ, taṃ gamanaṃ bujjhananti attho. Garukanti
analyzed: yam pan idam cutiyā ñāṇa gatiyā gantabbam tam gamanam bujjhananti atthaḥ garukanti
translated: That which has to be gone to by the knowledge of death is called “the way of death” . The meaning is that it is the going that has to be known by the knowledge of death.🔽Heavy:🔽difficult, hard. Hence he said “as though setting a footprint in the air” .

original: bhāriyaṃ dukkaraṃ. Tenāha “ākāse padaṃ dassento viyā”ti. Aparampi kāraṇanti chinnavaṭumānussaraṇaṃ
analyzed: bhāriyam dukkaram tena āha ākāse padam dassentaḥ viyāti aparam pi kāraṇam ti chinna vaṭuma anussaraṇam
translated: Another reason:

original: pacchāmukhaṃ ñāṇaṃ pesanato aparaṃ acchariyabbhutakāraṇaṃ. Yatrāti paccattatthe,
analyzed: pacchāmukham ñāṇam pesanataḥ aparam acchariya bhuta kāraṇam yatra ati paccattatthe
translated: The knowledge that is turned towards the rear is the other reason for the marvel. Yatrā means “in which” in the sense of “in a certain place.”🔽Nāma is a particle in the sense of marvel. The word hi is meaningless. Therefore he said, “The Tathāgata, who is called.”

original: nāmāti acchariyatthe nipāto, hi-saddo anatthako. Tenāha “yo nāma tathāgato”ti. Evañca🔽katvā “yatrā”ti nipātavasena visuṃ yatra-saddaggahaṇaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti. Papañcenti
analyzed: nāma ati acchariya tthe nipātaḥ hi saddaḥ anatthakaḥ tena āha yaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ ti evam ca  katvā nipāta vasena visum samatthitam
translated: Thus🔽the separate mention of yatra is justified by the word yatrā being a particle. They extend the continuity of beings in the round of rebirths, thus they are papañca .

original: sattasantānaṃ saṃsāre vitthārentīti papañcaṃ. Kammavaṭṭaṃ vuccatīti kilesavaṭṭassa
analyzed: satta santānam saṃsāre vitthārenti iti papañcam kamma vaṭṭam vuccati iti kilesa vaṭṭassa
translated: The round of kamma is called papañca .

original: papañcaggahaṇena, vipākavaṭṭassa dukkhaggahaṇena gahitattā. Pariyādinnavaṭṭeti sabbaso🔽khepitavaṭṭe. “Maggasīlena phalasīlenā”ti vatvā tayidaṃ maggaphalasīlaṃ lokiyasīlapubbakaṃ,
analyzed: papañca ggahaṇena vipāka vaṭṭassa dukkha ggahaṇena gahita ttā pariyādinna vaṭṭā iti sabbaso  khepitavaṭṭe magga sīlena phala sīlena ati vatvā tayā idam magga phala sīlam lokiya sīla pubbakam
translated: The round of kamma is called papañca because the round of kamma is included by the word papañca and the round of kamma-result by the word dukkha.🔽The round that is exhausted is the round that is completely destroyed.🔽After saying “by the virtue of the path and the virtue of the fruit,” he said “by the virtue of the world and the virtue of the supramundane” in order to show that this virtue of the path and the fruit has the virtue of the world as its forerunner,

original: buddhānañca lokiyasīlampi lokuttarasīlaṃ viya anaññasādhāraṇaṃ evāti dassetuṃ “lokiyalokuttarasīlenā”ti
analyzed: buddhānam ca lokiya sīlam pi lokuttara sīlam viya anañña sādhāraṇam eva ati dassetum lokiya lokuttara sīlena āti
translated: and that the virtue of the world of the Buddhas is not shared by others, like the supramundane virtue.

original: vuttaṃ. Samādhipaññāsupi eseva nayo. Samādhipakkhāti samādhi ca samādhipakkhā ca
analyzed: vuttam samādhi paññāsu pi esā iva nayaḥ samādhi pakkhā ati samādhi ca samādhi pakkhā ca
translated: The factors of concentration and wisdom are the factors of concentration and the factors of wisdom.

original: samādhipakkhā, ekadesasarūpekaseso daṭṭhabbo. Tenāha “maggasamādhinā”tiādi, “vihāro
analyzed: samādhi pakkhā eka desa sarūpa ikaseso daṭṭhabbo tena āha magga samādhinā atiādi vihāro
translated: and the factors of concentration should be seen as the remainder of the various kinds of materiality in one part. Hence he said “by means of path concentration” and so on, and “the abiding is included” .

original: gahito vā”ti ca. Samādhipakkhā nāma vīriyasatiādayo.
analyzed: gahitaḥ vā ati ca samādhi pakkhāḥ nāma vīriya sati ādayo
translated: The factors of concentration are energy, mindfulness, and so on.🔽They lie in themselves.

original: Sayanti attanā. Nīvaraṇādīhīti nīvaraṇehi ceva tadekaṭṭhehi ca pāpadhammehi, vitakkavicārādīhi
analyzed: sayanti attanā nīvaraṇa ādīhi iti nīvaraṇehi ca iva tad ekaṭṭhehi ca pāpa dhammehi vitakka vicāra ādīhi
translated: In the hindrances and so on: in the hindrances and in the kinds of states that are associated with them, and in applied thought, sustained thought, and so on.

original: ca. “Vimuttattā vimuttīti saṅkhyaṃ gacchantī”ti iminā vimutti-saddassa kammasādhanataṃ
analyzed: ca vimutta ttā vimutti iti saṅkhyam gacchanti iti iminā vimutti saddassa kamma sādhana taṃ
translated: By “they are reckoned as liberations because of liberation” he shows that the word “liberation” is a gerund.

original: āha aṭṭhasamāpattiādivisayattā tassa. Vimuttattāti ca “vikkhambhanavasena vimuttattā”tiādinā
analyzed: āha aṭṭha samāpatti ādi visaya ttā tassa vimutta ttā iti ca vikkhambhana vasena vimutta ttā iti ādinā
translated: It is so because it has the eight attainments, and so on, as its domain. And by “because of liberation” he means “because of liberation by suppression” and so on.🔽In each case: in the case of each contemplation of impermanence, and so on.

original: yojetabbaṃ. Tassa tassāti aniccānupassanādikassa. Paccanīkaṅgavasenāti pahātabbapaṭipakkhaaṅgavasena.
analyzed: yojetabbam tassa tassa ati anicca anupassanā ādikassa paccanīka ṅga vasena ati pahātabba paṭipakkha aṅga vasena
translated: By the opposite factors: by the factors opposed to what is to be abandoned.

original: Paṭippassaddhante uppannattāti kilesānaṃ paṭippassambhanaṃ paṭippassaddhaṃ, so eva
analyzed: paṭippassaddhante uppanna ttā ati kilesānam paṭippassambhanam paṭippassaddham saḥ eva
translated: The end of that: the end of that is the end of the defilements’ oppression,

original: anto pariyosānabhāvato, tasmiṃ sādhetabbe nibbattattā, taṃtaṃmaggavajjhakilesānaṃ
analyzed: antar pariyosāna bhāvataḥ tasmin sādhetabbe nibbatta ttā tad tad magga vajjha kilesānam
translated: which is called “the end” because it is the final end. It is produced in the sense that it is accomplished in the object.

original: paṭippassambhanavasena pavattattāti attho. Kilesehi nissaṭatā, apagamo ca nibbānassa
analyzed: paṭippassambhana vasena pavatta ttā ti attho kilesehi nissaṭa tā apagamaḥ ca nibbānassa
translated: The escape from defilements and the unconditioned element are

original: tehi vivittattā evāti āha “dūre ṭhitattā”ti.
analyzed: tehi vivitta ttā eva ati āha dūre ṭhita ttā iti
translated: quite secluded from them. Therefore it is said, “because of being far removed.”

original: 16. Dhammadhātūti dhammānaṃ sabhāvo, atthato cattāri ariyasaccāni. Suppaṭividdhāti
analyzed: dhammadhātu uti dhammānam sabhāvaḥ atthataḥ cattāri ariya saccāni suppaṭividdhā ti
translated: The Dhamma element is the individual essences of dhammas, and in meaning it is the four noble truths.

original: suṭṭhu paṭividdhā savāsanānaṃ sabbesaṃ kilesānaṃ pajahanato. Evañhi sabbaññutā, dasabalañāṇādayo
analyzed: suṭṭhu paṭividdhā sa vāsanānam sabbesam kilesānam pajahanataḥ evam hi sabbaññu tā dasa bala ñāṇa ādayo
translated: Well penetrated: well penetrated by the abandoning of all defilements together with their underlying tendencies.🔽For in this way the Blessed One attained all the qualities of a Buddha, such as omniscience, the ten powers of a Buddha, and so on.

original: cāti sabbe buddhaguṇā bhagavatā adhigatā ahesuṃ. Arahattaṃ dhammadhātūti keci. Sabbaññutañāṇanti
analyzed: ca ati sabbe buddha guṇāḥ bhagavatā adhigatāḥ ahesum arahattam dhammadhātu uti keci sabbaññuta ñāṇan ti
translated: Some say that the Dhamma element is arahatship. Others say that it is the knowledge of omniscience.🔽With two phrases: with two sentences.

original: apare. Dvīhi padehīti dvīhi vākyehi. Ābaddhanti paṭibaddhaṃ taṃmūlakattā uparidesanāya.
analyzed: apare dvīhi padehi iti dvīhi vākyehi ābaddhanti paṭibaddham upari desanāya
translated: Bound up: connected, because the higher teaching has that as its root.

original: Devacārikakolāhalanti attano devaloke cārikāyaṃ suddhāvāsadevānaṃ kutūhalappavattiṃ
analyzed: deva cārika kolāhalanti attanaḥ deva loke cārikāyam suddhāvāsa devānam kutūhala ppavattim
translated: The commotion of the gods’ visit: showing the commotion of the gods of the Pure Abodes in his own god-world during his visit,

original: dassento suttantapariyosāne vicāressati, atthato vibhāvessatīti yojanā. Ayaṃ desanāti
analyzed: dassentaḥ suttanta pariyosāne vicāressati atthataḥ vibhāvessati iti yojanā ayam desanā ati
translated: he will investigate, will explain the meaning, at the end of the sutta. This is the teaching.

original: “ito so bhikkhave”tiādinā vitthārato pavattitadesanamāha. Nidānakaṇḍetiādito desitaṃ
analyzed: itas saḥ bhikkhave tiādinā vitthārato pavattita desanam āha nidāna kaṇḍa iti āditaḥ desitam
translated: “Bhikkhus, it was from here” : he said this in order to tell in detail the way in which the turning took place.🔽The “Introduction Section” : he said this in order to tell the recitation of the setting forth,

original: uddesadesanamāha. Sā hi imissā desanāya nidānaṭṭhāniyattā tathā vuttā.
analyzed: uddesa desanam āha sā hi imissā desanāya nidāna ṭṭhāni yattā tathā vuttā
translated: which was taught beginning with the words “Thus have I heard.” For that is called the “Introduction” because it is the basis for this teaching.

original: Bodhisattadhammatāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: bodhisatta dhamma tā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the qualities of a Bodhisatta

original: 17. “Vipassīti tassa nāma”nti vatvā tassa anvatthataṃ dassetuṃ “tañca kho”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vipassī iti tassa nāman ti vatvā tassa anvattha tam dassetum tat ca kho tiādi vuttaṃ
translated: “Vipassi was his name” : after saying this, in order to show his lineage, he said “And he was a prince” .

original: Vividhe attheti tirohitavidūradesagatādike nīlādivasena nānāvidhe, tadaññe ca indriyagocarabhūte
analyzed: vividhe atthe ti tirohita vidūra desa gata ādike nīla ādi vasena nānāvidhe tad aññe ca indriya gocara bhūte
translated: In various meanings : in various kinds of objects, such as hidden, distant, etc., as blue, etc., and in other objects that are the domain of the faculties,🔽and in the various meanings that are accepted as such, and in the determinations of usage.

original: te ca yathūpagate, vohāravinicchaye cāti nānāvidhe atthe. Passanakusalatāyāti dassane🔽nipuṇabhāvena. Yāthāvato ñeyyaṃ bujjhatīti bodhi, so eva sattayogato bodhisattoti
analyzed: te ca yathā upagate vohāra vinicchaye ca ati nānāvidhe atthe passana kusala tāya ati dassane  nipuṇa bhāvena yāthāvataḥ ñeyyam bujjhati iti bodhi saḥ eva satta yogataḥ bodhisatto ti
translated: In the skill in seeing : by means of the cleverness in seeing.🔽The knowable is awakened to as it really is ; thus it is enlightenment . He who is endowed with that is a Bodhisatta .

original: āha “paṇḍitasatto bujjhanakasatto”ti. Sucintitacintitādinā pana paṇḍitabhāve vattabbameva
analyzed: āha paṇḍita sattaḥ bujjhanaka satto ti su cintita cintita ādinā pana paṇḍita bhāve vattabbam eva
translated: Therefore he said “a wise being, a being who is awakening” . But in the quality of wisdom, which is expressed by the words “well-considered thought,” etc., there is nothing to be said.

original: natthi. Yadā ca panānena mahābhinīhāro kato, tato paṭṭhāya mahābodhiyaṃ ekantaninnattā🔽bodhimhi satto bodhisattoti āha “bodhisaṅkhātesū”tiādi. Maggañāṇapadaṭṭhānañhi sabbaññutañāṇaṃ,
analyzed: natthi yadā ca pana anena mahā abhinīhāro kato tatas paṭṭhāya mahābodhiyam ekanta ninnattā  bodhimhi sattaḥ bodhisatto ti āha bodhi saṅkhātesu itiādi magga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam hi sabbaññuta ñāṇam
translated: There is not. But when he had made this great aspiration, then, because of his complete devotion to the Great Bodhi Tree,🔽he is called a being in the Bodhi, a Bodhisatta, in the words “In the Bodhi called” and so on. For the knowledge of omniscience has the path knowledge as its proximate cause,

original: sabbaññutañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca maggañāṇaṃ “bodhī”ti vuccati. “Sato sampajāno”ti iminā
analyzed: sabbaññuta ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam ca magga ñāṇam bodhi iti vuccati sataḥ sampajānoti iminā
translated: and the path knowledge has the knowledge of omniscience as its proximate cause. It is called “Bodhi.” “Mindful and clearly comprehending”

original: catutthāya gabbhāvakkantiyā okkamīti dasseti. Catasso hi gabbhāvakkantiyo idhekacco
analyzed: catutthāya gabbha avakkantiyāḥ okkamīti dasseti catasso hi gabbha avakkantiyaḥ idha ekacco
translated: he entered the fourth conception. For there are four conceptions:

original: gabbho mātukucchiyaṃ okkamane, ṭhāne, nikkhamaneti tīsu ṭhānesu asampajāno hoti,
analyzed: gabbhaḥ mātukucchiyam okkamane ṭhāne nikkhamane ti tīsu ṭhānesu asampajānaḥ hoti
translated: one is unconscious in entering the womb, in remaining there, and in emerging from it;

original: ekacco paṭhame ṭhāne sampajāno, na itaresu, ekacco paṭhame, dutiye ca ṭhāne sampajāno,
analyzed: ekaccaḥ paṭhame ṭhāne sampajānaḥ na itaresu ekaccaḥ paṭhame dutiye ca ṭhāne sampajānaḥ
translated: one is conscious in the first and second, but not in the third; one is conscious in the first and third, but not in the second;

original: na tatiye, ekacco tīsupi ṭhānesu sampajāno hoti. Tattha paṭhamā gabbhāvakkanti lokiyamahājanassa
analyzed: na tatiye ekaccaḥ tīsu pi ṭhānesu sampajānaḥ hoti tattha paṭhamā lokiya mahājanassa
translated: one is conscious in all three. Herein, the first conception is that of the world of men;

original: vasena vuttā, dutiyā asītimahāsāvakānaṃ vasena, tatiyā dvinnaṃ aggasāvakānaṃ, paccekabuddhānañca
analyzed: vasena vuttā dutiyā asīti mahāsāvakānam vasena tatiyā dvinnam aggasāvakānam paccekabuddhānam ca
translated: The second is the eighty great disciples, the third the two chief disciples and the Paccekabuddhas,

original: vasena. Te kira kammajavātehi uddhaṃpādā adhosirā anekasataporise papāte viya yonimukhe🔽khittā tāḷacchiggaḷena hatthī viya sambādhena yonimukhena nikkhamantā mahantaṃ dukkhaṃ🔽pāpuṇanti, tena nesaṃ “mayaṃ nikkhamāmā”ti sampajaññaṃ na hoti. Catutthā sabbaññubodhisattānaṃ
analyzed: vasena te kira kamma ja vātehi uddhaṃpādā adhosirā aneka sata porise papāte viya yoni mukhe  khittā tāḷa chiggaḷena hatthī viya sambādhena yonimukhena nikkhamantā mahantam dukkham  pāpuṇanti tena nesam mayam nikkhamāma ati sampajaññam na hoti catutthā sabbaññu bodhisattānam
translated: the fourth all the Bodhisattas. They are thrown into the womb, it seems, with their feet first and their heads last, as if into a deep abyss many hundreds of fathoms deep.🔽And as they come forth from the womb, which is a very narrow passage, they suffer great pain, as if an elephant were being crushed by a mountain. Therefore they have no consciousness of “I am coming forth.”

original: vasena. Te hi mātukucchimhi paṭisandhiṃ gaṇhantāpi pajānanti, tattha vasantāpi pajānanti,
analyzed: vasena te hi mātukucchimhi paṭisandhim gaṇhantā api pajānanti tattha vasantā api pajānanti
translated: The fourth is the case of all the Bodhisattas. For they are conscious when they take rebirth-linking in the mother’s womb, and they are conscious while they stay there,

original: nikkhamanakālepi pajānanti. Na hi te kammajavātā uddhaṃpāde adhosire katvā khipituṃ
analyzed: nikkhamana kāle pi pajānanti na hi te kamma ja vātāḥ uddhaṃpāde adhosire katvā khipitum
translated: and they are conscious when they come forth. For the winds that bring about kamma do not succeed in turning them round feet uppermost and head last,

original: sakkonti, dve hatthe pasāritvā akkhīni ummīletvā ṭhitakāva nikkhamantīti. Ñāṇena
analyzed: sakkonti dve hatthe pasāritvā akkhīni ummīletvā ṭhitakāḥ vā nikkhamanti iti ñāṇena
translated: but they come forth with their two hands outstretched and their eyes open.

original: paricchinditvāti pubbabhāge pañcamahāvilokanañāṇehi ceva “idāni cavāmī”ti cutiparicchindanañāṇena
analyzed: paricchinditvā ti pubba bhāge pañca mahāvilokana ñāṇehi ca iva idāni cavāmi iti cuti paricchindana ñāṇena
translated: Having discerned: having known by discerning with the five great surveys in the prior stage and with the knowledge discerning death in the words “Now I am passing away”

original: ca aparabhāge “idha mayā paṭisandhi gahitā”ti paṭisandhiparicchindanañāṇena ca paricchijja jānitvā.
analyzed: ca apara bhāge idha mayā paṭisandhi gahitā ati paṭisandhi paricchindana ñāṇena ca paricchijja jānitvā
translated: and with the knowledge discerning rebirth in the words “Here I have taken rebirth” in the subsequent stage.

original: Pañcannaṃ mahāpariccāgānaṃ, ñātatthacariyādīnañca satipi pāramiyā pariyāpannabhāve🔽sambhāravisesabhāvadassanatthaṃ visuṃ gahaṇaṃ. Tattha aṅgapariccāgo, nayanapariccāgo,
analyzed: pañcannam mahā pariccāgānam ñāta attha cariyā ādīnam ca sati pi pāramiyā pariyāpanna bhāve  sambhāra visesa bhāva dassana ttham visum gahaṇam tattha aṅga pariccāgaḥ nayana pariccāgo
translated: Although the five great relinquishments and the practice of the knowledge of what is good and useful, etc., are included in the pāramīs,🔽they are mentioned separately in order to show their special nature as requisites. Herein, the five great relinquishments are the relinquishing of limbs, the relinquishing of eyes,

original: attapariccāgo, rajjapariccāgo, puttadārapariccāgoti ime pañca mahāpariccāgā. Tatthāpi
analyzed: atta pariccāgo rajja pariccāgo putta dāra pariccāgo ti ime pañca mahā pariccāgā tattha api
translated: the relinquishing of self, the relinquishing of a kingdom, and the relinquishing of children and wife.

original: kāmaṃ aṅgapariccāgādayopi dānapāramīyeva, tathāpi pariccāgavisesabhāvadassanatthañceva
analyzed: kāmam aṅga pariccāga ādayaḥ api dānapāramīya iva tathā api pariccāga visesa bhāva dassana ttham ca iva
translated: Herein, although the relinquishing of limbs, etc., are also just the perfection of giving,🔽nevertheless, the great relinquishments are mentioned separately in order to show their special nature as relinquishments and

original: sudukkarabhāvadassanatthañca mahāpariccāgānaṃ visuṃ gahaṇaṃ. Tato eva ca aṅgapariccāgatopi
analyzed: su dukkara bhāva dassana attham ca mahā pariccāgānam visum gahaṇam tatas eva ca aṅga pariccāgataḥ pi
translated: in order to show their extreme difficulty. And the relinquishing of limbs is mentioned separately

original: visuṃ nayanapariccāgaggahaṇaṃ, pariccāgabhāvasāmaññepi rajjapariccāgaputtadārapariccāgaggahaṇañca🔽kataṃ. Ñātīnaṃ atthacariyā ñātatthacariyā, sā ca kho karuṇāyanavasena. Tathā sattalokassa
analyzed: visum nayana pariccāga ggahaṇam pariccāga bhāva sāmaññe pi rajja pariccāga putta dāra pariccāga ggahaṇam ca  katam ñātīnam attha cariyā ñāta attha cariyā sā ca kho karuṇāyana vasena tathā satta lokassa
translated: The mention of the giving of the eyes is to include the giving of other things, and the mention of the giving of the horse and the giving of the children and wife is to include the giving of the same things in general.🔽The performance of what is beneficial for kinsmen is the performance of what is beneficial for kinsmen; and that is by way of compassion. Likewise, the performance of what is beneficial for the world is the performance of what is beneficial for the world of beings

original: diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthānaṃ vasena hitacariyā lokatthacariyā. Kammassakatāñāṇavasena,
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthānam vasena hita cariyā lokattha cariyā kammassaka tā ñāṇa vasena
translated: by way of the highest good in this life and the next. The performance of what is beneficial for oneself and others by way of the knowledge of the ownership of kamma,

original: anavajjakammāyatanasippāyatanavijjāṭhānavasena, khandhāyatanādivasena, lakkhaṇattayāditīraṇavasena
analyzed: anavajja kammāyatana sippāyatana vijjāṭhāna vasena khandha āyatana ādi vasena lakkhaṇa ttaya ādi tīraṇa vasena
translated: by way of the fields of blameless kamma, the fields of skill, and the fields of learning, by way of the aggregates, sense bases, etc., and by way of the investigation of the characteristics of impermanence, etc.,🔽is the performance of a Buddha by way of the knowledge of the establishment of mindfulness. But in meaning it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: ca attano, paresañca tattha satipaṭṭhānena ñāṇacāro buddhacariyā, sā panatthato paññāpāramīyeva,🔽ñāṇasambhāravisesatādassanatthaṃ pana visuṃ gahaṇaṃ. Buddhacariyānanti bahuvacananiddesena
analyzed: ca attano paresam ca tattha sati paṭṭhānena ñāṇa cāro buddha cariyā sā pana atthato paññāpāramīyā iva  ñāṇa sambhāra visesa tā dassana attham pana visum gahaṇam buddha cariyānam ti bahuvacana niddesena
translated: The separate mention of it is to show the distinction of the equipment of knowledge. The performance of a Buddha is the performance of a Buddha. By the indication of the plural case🔽all the previous practices, such as the practice of former lives, the practice of the knowledge of previous lives, etc., should be understood as included. Therein, the practice of a Buddha is the practice of a Buddha. By the indication of the plural case🔽all the previous practices, such as the practice of former lives, the practice of the knowledge of previous lives, etc., should be understood as included. Therein, the practice of a Buddha is the practice of a Buddha. By the indication of the plural case

original: pubbayogapubbacariyādhammakkhānādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Tattha gatapaccāgatavattasaṅkhātāya
translated: all the previous practices, such as the practice of former lives, the practice of the knowledge of previous lives, etc., should be understood as included. Therein, the practice of a Buddha is the practice of a Buddha. By the indication of the plural case🔽all the previous practices, such as the practice of former lives, the practice of the knowledge of previous lives, etc., should be understood as included. Therein, the practice of a Buddha is the practice of a Buddha. By the indication of the plural case🔽all the previous practices, such as the practice of former lives, the practice of the knowledge of previous lives, etc., should be understood as included. Therein, the practice of a Buddha is the practice of a Buddha. By the indication of the plural

original: pubbabhāgapaṭipadāya saddhiṃ abhiññāsamāpattinipphādanaṃ pubbayogo. Dānādīsuyeva
analyzed: pubba bhāga paṭipadāya saddhim abhiññā samāpatti nipphādanam pubba yogaḥ dāna ādīsu yeva
translated: The prior effort is the prior development of the jhānas and direct knowledges together with the preliminary part of the path. The prior practice is the practice of giving, etc.,

original: sātisayapaṭipatti pubbacariyā. “Yāva cariyāpiṭake saṅgahitā abhinīhāro pubbayogo,🔽kāyādivivekavasena ekacariyā pubbacariyā”ti keci. Dānādīnañceva appicchatādīnañca
analyzed: sa atisaya paṭipatti pubba cariyā yāva cariyā piṭake saṅgahitā abhinīhāraḥ pubba yogo  kāya ādi viveka vasena eka cariyā pubba cariyā ati keci dāna ādīnam ca iva appiccha tā ādīnam ca
translated: carried out to excess. “The prior effort is the aspiration included in the Cariyāpiṭaka,

original: saṃsāranibbānesu ādīnavānisaṃsānañca vibhāvanavasena, sattānaṃ bodhittaye patiṭṭhāpanaparipācanavasena
analyzed: saṃsāra nibbānesu ādīnava anisaṃsānam ca vibhāvana vasena sattānam bodhi ttaye patiṭṭhāpana paripācana vasena
translated: and the prior practice is the single practice consisting in the seclusion of the body, etc.,” say some. The exposition of the Dhamma is the teaching that occurs in order to reveal the drawbacks and benefits in the round of rebirths and in Nibbāna, and to establish and mature beings in the three vehicles, in regard to giving, etc., and fewness of wishes, etc.,

original: ca pavattakathā dhammakkhānaṃ. Koṭiṃ patvāti paraṃ pariyantaṃ paramukkaṃsaṃ pāpuṇitvā.🔽Sattamahādānānīti aṭṭhavassikakāle “hadayamaṃsādīnipi yācakānaṃ dadeyya”nti ajjhāsayaṃ
analyzed: ca pavatta kathā dhammakkhānam koṭim patvā ati param pariyantam param ukkaṃsam pāpuṇitvā  satta mahādānāni iti aṭṭhavassika kāle hadaya maṃsa ādīni pi yācakānam dadeyyanti ajjhāsayam
translated: and in regard to the drawbacks in the round of rebirths and the benefits in Nibbāna. Having reached the limit: having reached the ultimate, the highest.

original: uppādetvā dinnadānaṃ, maṅgalahatthidānaṃ, gamanakāle dinnaṃ sattasattakamahādānaṃ,
analyzed: uppādetvā dinna dānam maṅgala hatthi dānam gamana kāle dinnam satta sattaka mahā dānam
translated: The seven great gifts: the gift given with the aspiration, “Even my heart’s blood I would give to petitioners,” which is mentioned in the Aṭṭhakanipāta; the gift of the auspicious elephant; the seven sets of seven gifts given when he was about to set out to live the contemplative life;

original: maggaṃ gacchantena dinnaṃ assadānaṃ, rathadānaṃ, puttadānaṃ, bhariyādānanti imāni
analyzed: maggam gacchantena dinnam assa dānam ratha dānam putta dānam bhariyā dānam imāni
translated: the gift of the horse, the gift of the chariot, the gift of the son, and the gift of the wife.

original: satta mahādānāni datvā.
analyzed: satta mahādānāni da tvā
translated: and after giving the seven great gifts.

original: “Idāneva me maraṇaṃ hotū”ti adhimuccitvā kālakaraṇaṃ adhimuttikālakiriyā, taṃ bodhisattānaṃyeva,
analyzed: idānā iva me maraṇam hotu uti adhimuccitvā kāla karaṇam adhimutti kāla kiriyā tam
translated: The death of one who resolves, “Let me die now,” is called death by resolve. This is found only in Bodhisattas,

original: na aññesaṃ. Bodhisattā kira dīghāyukadevaloke ṭhitā “idha ṭhitassa me bodhisambhārasambharaṇaṃ
analyzed: na aññesam bodhisattā kira dīgha āyuka deva loke ṭhitāḥ idha ṭhitassa me bodhi sambhāra sambharaṇam
translated: not in others. Bodhisattas, it seems, live in the world of the Long-lived Divinities. There they think, “I cannot complete the equipment for enlightenment by living here.”

original: na sambhavatī”ti katvā tattha vāsato nibbindamānasā honti, tadā vimānaṃ pavisitvā
analyzed: na sambhavati iti katvā tattha vāsataḥ nibbinda mānasāḥ honti tadā vimānam pavisitvā
translated: Then, becoming dispassionate towards that life, they enter their palaces,

original: akkhīni nimīletvā “ito uddhaṃ me jīvitaṃ nappavattatū”ti cittaṃ adhiṭṭhāya nisīdanti,🔽cittādhiṭṭhānasamanantarameva maraṇaṃ hoti. Pāramīdhammānañhi ukkaṃsappavattiyā tasmiṃ🔽tasmiṃ attabhāve abhiññāsamāpattīhi santānassa visesitattā attasinehassa tanubhāvena,
analyzed: akkhīni nimīletvā itas uddham me jīvitam na ppavattatu iti cittam adhiṭṭhāya nisīdanti  citta adhiṭṭhāna samanantaram eva maraṇam hoti pāramī dhammānam hi ukkaṃsa pavattiyā tasmin  tasmin atta bhāve abhiññā samāpattīhi santānassa visesita ttā atta sinehassa tanu bhāvena
translated: close their eyes, and sit down thinking, “Let my life end here and now.”🔽Immediately their death comes about. For the mental continuum of Bodhisattas, who have reached the peak of perfection in the qualities of the perfections,🔽is distinguished by the higher functions of direct knowledge and attainment in each rebirth, and their self-love is weak because of the great strength of their compassion for all beings.

original: sattesu ca mahākaruṇāya uḷārabhāvena adhiṭṭhānassa tikkhavisadabhāvāpattiyā bodhisattānaṃ
analyzed: sattesu ca mahā karuṇāya uḷāra bhāvena adhiṭṭhānassa tikkha visada bhāva āpattiyā bodhisattānam
translated: Therefore their resolve is very sharp and clear.

original: adhippāyā samijjhanti. Citte, viya kammesu ca nesaṃ vasībhāvo, tasmā yattha upapannānaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyā samijjhanti citte viya kammesu ca na isam vasībhāvaḥ tasmā yattha upapannānam
translated: and their intentions are fulfilled. And they have mastery in kamma-formations as they have in consciousness. Therefore, wherever they are reborn,

original: pāramiyo sammadeva paribrūhanti. Vuttanayena kālaṃ katvā tattha upapajjanti. Tathā
analyzed: pāramiyaḥ sammat eva paribrūhanti vutta nayena kālam katvā tattha upapajjanti tathā
translated: they can fulfil the pāramīs properly. Having died in the way described, they are reborn there.

original: hi amhākaṃ mahāsatto imasmiṃyeva kappe nānājātīsu aparihīnajjhāno kālaṃ katvā brahmaloke
analyzed: hi amhākam mahāsattaḥ imasmin yeva kappe nānā jātīsu a parihīna jjhānaḥ kālam katvā brahmaloke
translated: For our Great Being, in this very aeon, after dying in various births with his jhāna undiminished, was reborn in the Brahmā-world,

original: nibbatto, appakameva kālaṃ tattha ṭhatvā tato cavitvā manussaloke nibbatto, pāramīsambharaṇapasuto🔽ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ “bodhisattānaṃyeva, na aññesa”nti. “Ekenaattabhāvena antarena
analyzed: nibbattaḥ appakam eva kālam tattha ṭhatvā tatas cavitvā manussa loke nibbattaḥ pāramī sambharaṇa pasuto  ahosi tena vuttam bodhisattānam yeva na aññesanti ekena atta bhāvena antarena
translated: and after remaining there for a short time, he passed away from there and was reborn in the human world, and he was intent on fulfilling the pāramīs.

original: pāramīnaṃ sabbaso pūritattā”ti iminā payojanābhāvato tattha ṭhatvā adhimuttikālakiriyā
analyzed: pāramīnam sabbaso pūrita ttā ti iminā payojana abhāvato tattha adhimutti kālakiriyā
translated: Therefore it is said, “only for bodhisattas, not for others.” “Because the pāramīs are fulfilled entirely in a single existence” — by this he shows that there is no such thing as dying with fixed intention while remaining there, because there is no purpose in it.

original: nāma nāhosīti dasseti. Api ca tattha yāvatāyukaṭṭhānaṃ carimabhave anekamahānidhisamuṭṭhānapubbikāya
analyzed: nāma dasseti api ca tattha yāvatā āyuka ṭṭhānam carima bhave aneka mahā nidhi samuṭṭhāna pubbikāya
translated: Moreover, there is no such thing as dying with fixed intention while remaining there, because the time of remaining there is fixed. For the time of remaining in the Brahmā-world is fixed according to the amount of merit one has.

original: dibbasampattisadisāya mahāsampattiyā nibbatti viya, buddhabhūtassa asadisadānādivasena🔽anaññasādhāraṇalābhuppatti viya ca “ito paraṃ mahāpurisassa dibbasampattianubhavanaṃ
analyzed: dibba sampatti sadisāya mahā sampattiyā nibbatti viya buddha bhūtassa asadisa dāna ādi vasena  anañña sādhāraṇa lābha uppatti viya ca itas param mahāpurisassa dibba sampatti anubhavanam
translated: and as if he were acquiring an incomparable gain, such as giving, etc., when he has become a Buddha.

original: nāma natthī”ti ussāhajātassa puññasambhārassa vasenāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ayañhettha dhammatā.
analyzed: nāma natthi iti ussāha jātassa puñña sambhārassa vasena ati daṭṭhabbam ayam ha ittha dhamma tā
translated: It should be regarded as due to the accumulation of merit in one who has become elated with the thought: “From now on there is no more experiencing of the divine destiny for the Great Man.” This is the natural order here.

original: Manussagaṇanāvasena, na devagaṇanāvasena. Pubbanimittānīti cutiyā pubbanimittāni.🔽Amilāyitvāti ettha amilātaggahaṇeneva tāsaṃ mālānaṃ vaṇṇasampadāyapi gandhasampadāyapi
analyzed: manussa gaṇanā vasena na deva gaṇanā vasena pubba nimittāni iti cutiyā pubba nimittāni  a milāyitvā iti ettha a milāta ggahaṇena iva tāsam mālānam vaṇṇa sampadāya api gandha sampadāya api
translated: by human reckoning, not by divine reckoning. Signs of death: signs of death.

original: sobhāsampadāyapi avināso dassitoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Bāhirabbhantarānaṃ rajojallānaṃ lepassapi
analyzed: avināsaḥ dassito ti daṭṭhabbam bāhira bbhantarānam rajojallānam lepassa api
translated: Without fading: here the non-fading should be regarded as showing the undiminished excellence of the colour and the undiminished excellence of the scent and the undiminished excellence of the beauty of the garlands.

original: abhāvato devānaṃ sarīragatāni vatthāni sabbakālaṃ parisuddhappabhassarāneva hutvā
analyzed: abhāvataḥ devānam sarīra gatāni vatthāni sabbakālam parisuddha ppabhassarān eva hutvā
translated: Because there is no dust or dirt either outside or inside, the garments worn by the devas remain pure and bright all the time.

original: tiṭṭhantīti āha “vatthesupi eseva nayo”ti. Neva sītaṃ na uṇhanti yassa sītassa paṭikāravasena
analyzed: tiṭṭhanti iti āha vatthesu pi esā iva na iva sītam na uṇhanti yassa sītassa paṭikāra vasena
translated: Therefore it is said: “The same method applies to the garments.” Neither cold nor heat: cold is the reason for the use of

original: adhikaṃ seviyamānaṃ uṇhaṃ, sayameva vā kharataraṃ hutvā abhibhavantaṃ sarīre sedaṃ
analyzed: adhikam uṇham sayam eva vā kharataram hutvā abhibhavantam sarīre
translated: If it is used in excess, it becomes hot and, by itself, becoming very sharp, it overcomes the sweat in the body.

original: uppādeyya, tādisaṃ neva sītaṃ, na uṇhaṃ hoti. Tasmiṃ kāleti yathāvuttamaraṇāsannakāle.
analyzed: tādisam na iva sītam na uṇham hoti tasmin kāle iti yathāvutta maraṇa āsanna kāle
translated: If it is used too much, it becomes hot and, becoming too strong by itself, it produces sweat in the body. It is neither cold nor hot like that. “At that time” means at the time of death as described.

original: Bindubinduvasenāti chinnasuttāya āmuttamuttāvaliyā nipatantā muttaguḷikā viya bindu🔽bindu hutvā. Sedāti sedadhārā muccanti. Dantānaṃ khaṇḍitabhāvo khaṇḍiccaṃ. Kesānaṃ
analyzed: bindu bindu vasena ati chinna suttāya āmutta mutta āvaliyā nipatantā mutta guḷikā viya bindu  bindu hutvā sedāti seda dhārāḥ muccanti dantānam khaṇḍita bhāvaḥ khaṇḍiccam kesānam
translated: By drops means like drops of urine falling from a torn piece of cloth.🔽Sweat flows in streams. The state of broken teeth is called “brokenness.”

original: palitabhāvo pāliccaṃ. Ādi-saddena valittacataṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Kilantarūpo attabhāvo
analyzed: ādi saddena saṅgaṇhāti kilanta rūpaḥ atta bhāvaḥ
translated: The state of grey hair is called “greyness.” The word “etc.” includes wrinkles.🔽The intention is that the body becomes weak, but not broken, grey, etc.

original: hoti, na pana khaṇḍiccapāliccādīti adhippāyo. Ukkaṇṭhitāti anabhirati. Sā natthi🔽uparūpari uḷārauḷārānameva bhogānaṃ visesato duvijānanānaṃ upatiṭṭhahanato. Nissasantīti
analyzed: hoti na pana khaṇḍicca pālicca ādi iti adhippāyaḥ ukkaṇṭhitā ati an abhirati sā natthi  upari upari uḷāra auḷārānam eva bhogānam visesataḥ duvijānanānam upatiṭṭhahanataḥ nissasanti iti
translated: Discontent means dissatisfaction. That does not exist

original: uṇhaṃ nissasanti. Vijambhantīti anabhirativasena vijambhanaṃ karonti.
analyzed: uṇham nissasanti vijambhanti iti an abhirati vasena vijambhanam karonti
translated: because of the continuous appearance of ever more excellent enjoyments, especially for the twice-born. “They pant” means they pant for heat. “They gape” means they gape due to dissatisfaction.

original: Paṇḍitā evāti buddhisampannā eva devatā. Yathā devatā sampatijātā “kīdisena puññakammena
analyzed: paṇḍitāḥ eva ati buddhi sampannāḥ eva devatāḥ yathā devatā sampati jātā kīdisena puñña kammena
translated: “The wise deities”: the deities who are endowed with understanding. Just as deities who have newly arisen think, “By what kind of meritorious deed

original: idha nibbattā”ti cintetvā “iminā nāma puññakammena idha nibbattā”ti jānanti, evaṃ
analyzed: idha nibbattā iti cintetvā iminā nāma puñña kammena idha nibbattā iti jānanti evam
translated: have we been reborn here?” and then know, “We have been reborn here by this meritorious deed,”

original: atītabhave attanā kataṃ, aññadāpi vā ekaccaṃ puññakammaṃ jānantiyeva mahāpuññāti🔽āha “ye mahāpuññā”tiādi.
analyzed: atīta bhave attanā katam aññadā api vā ekaccam puñña kammam jānantiyā iva mahā puññā ati  āha ye mahāpuññāti ādi
translated: so too they know the meritorious deed that they themselves have done in a previous existence or that someone else has done.🔽They know only a great deal of merit, not a little.

original: Na paññāyanti ciratarakālattā paramāyuno. Aniyyānikanti na niyyānāvahaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: na paññāyanti ciratara kālattā parama āyunaḥ a niyyānikam ti na niyyāna āvaham sattānam
translated: They do not know the life span of beings because it is too long.🔽“Not leading to deliverance”: not conducive to deliverance for beings🔽because they are not vessels.

original: abhājanabhāvato. Sattā na paramāyuno honti nāma pāpussannatāyāti āha “tadā hi sattā
analyzed: abhājana bhāvataḥ sattāḥ na parama āyunaḥ honti nāma pāpussanna tāya iti āha tadā hi sattā
translated: Beings are not called “of long life” because they are full of evil.

original: ussannakilesā hontī”ti. Etthāha – kasmā sammāsambuddhā manussaloke eva uppajjanti,
analyzed: ussanna kilesāḥ honti iti ettha āha kasmā sammāsambuddhāḥ manussa loke eva uppajjanti
translated: Here it may be asked: Why do Perfectly Enlightened Buddhas arise only in the human world,🔽not in the divine or Brahmā worlds?

original: na devabrahmalokesūti? Devaloke tāva nuppajjanti brahmacariyavāsassa anokāsabhāvato,
analyzed: na deva brahma lokesu iti deva loke tāva nu pajjanti brahmacariya vāsassa anokāsa bhāvato
translated: They do not arise in the divine world because the life of celibacy has no scope there,

original: tathā anacchariyabhāvato. Acchariyadhammā hi buddhā bhagavanto, tesaṃ sā acchariyadhammatā
analyzed: tathā an acchariya bhāvataḥ acchariya dhammāḥ hi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tesam sā acchariya dhamma tā
translated: and so too in the matter of the non-wonderful. For Buddhas are wonderful, and that is their wonderful quality.

original: devattabhāve ṭhitānaṃ na pākaṭā hoti yathā manussabhūtānaṃ, devabhūte hi sammāsambuddhe
analyzed: devatta bhāve ṭhitānam na pākaṭā hoti yathā manussa bhūtānam deva bhūte hi sammāsambuddhe
translated: But it is not obvious to those who are gods that they are gods, as it is to those who are human beings. For when the Buddhas are gods,

analyzed: dissamānam buddha anubhāvam deva anubhāvataḥ lokaḥ dahati na buddha anubhāvataḥ tathā sati
translated: the world attributes the appearance of the Buddha’s power to the power of the gods, not to the Buddha’s power. And so

analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ iti na adhimuccati na sampasīdati issaragutta gāham na vissajjeti
translated: it does not believe and have faith in the Buddha’s power, and it does not give up the view that the world is ruled by Īśvara, etc.,

analyzed: devatta bhāvassa ca cira kāla adhiṭṭhānataḥ ekacca sassata vādataḥ na parimuccati brahma loke
translated: and it does not escape from the eternalist view that has been long held by the gods.🔽The same method of explanation applies to the words “in the Brahmā-world.”

analyzed: nuppajjanti iti ettha api esa iva nayaḥ sattānam tādisa ggāha vinimocana attham hi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: For it is in order to release beings from such views that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: manussasugatiyaṃyeva uppajjanti, na devasugatiyaṃ. Manussasugatiyaṃ uppajjantāpi
analyzed: manussa sugatiyam yeva uppajjanti na deva sugatiyam manussa sugatiyam uppajjantā api
translated: are reborn in the human world, not in the divine world. And when they are reborn in the human world,

analyzed: opapātikāḥ na honti sati ca opapātika upapattiyam vutta dosa an ativattanataḥ dhamma veneyyānam
translated: they are not spontaneously born, because if they were, the aforementioned faults would occur. And it is because they have disciples to be trained in the Dhamma

original: dhammatantiyā ṭhapanassa viya dhātuveneyyānaṃ dhātūnaṃ ṭhapanassa icchitabbattā ca.
analyzed: dhamma tantiyāḥ ṭhapanassa viya dhātu veneyyānam dhātūnam ṭhapanassa icchitabba ttā ca
translated: and because it is necessary to assume that the relics of those who are to be guided by relics are deposited in the same way as the relics of the Enlightened One.🔽For there are no relics of those who attain Nibbāna without residue of clinging.

original: Na hi opapātikānaṃ parinibbānato uddhaṃ sarīradhātuyo tiṭṭhanti. Manussaloke uppajjantāpi
analyzed: na hi opapātikānam parinibbānato uddham sarīradhātuyaḥ tiṭṭhanti manussa loke uppajjantā api
translated: But when those who are to be guided by relics are reborn in the human world,

analyzed: mahā bodhisattā carima bhave manussa bhāvassa pākaṭa bhāva karaṇāya pana dāra pariggaham pi
translated: the great Bodhisattvas, in order to make their human state of existence manifest,🔽take a wife and live in the world until they see their son named Rāhula.

original: karontā yāva puttamukhadassanā agāramajjhe tiṭṭhanti, paripākagatasīlanekkhammapaññādipāramikāpi🔽na abhinikkhamantīti. Kiṃ vā etāya kāraṇacintāya “sabbabuddhehi āciṇṇasamāciṇṇā,
analyzed: karontā yāva putta mukha dassanā agāra majjhe tiṭṭhanti paripāka gata sīla nekkhamma paññā ādi pāramikā api  na abhinikkhamanti iti kim vā etāya kāraṇa cintāya sabba buddhehi āciṇṇa samāciṇṇā
translated: But even though they have perfected the pāramīs of virtue, renunciation, wisdom, etc., they do not go forth into homelessness.

original: yadidaṃ manussabhūtānaṃyeva abhisambujjhanā, na devabhūtāna”nti. Ayamettha dhammatā.
analyzed: yat idam manussa bhūtānam yeva abhisambujjhanā na deva bhūtānam ti ayam ettha dhamma tā
translated: Or what need is there to speculate about the reasons? It is the invariable rule that Buddhas become enlightened only as human beings, not as deities.

original: Tathā hi tadattho mahābhinīhāropi manussabhūtānaṃyeva ijjhati, na devabhūtānaṃ.
analyzed: tathā hi tad atthaḥ mahā abhinīhāraḥ api manussa bhūtānam yeva ijjhati na deva bhūtānam
translated: For the great aspiration for Buddhahood succeeds only for those who are human beings, not for those who are deities.

analyzed: paccekabuddhānam ca nibbattiyā sāvaka bodhisattānam sāvaka bodhiyāḥ abhinīhāraḥ sāvaka pāramiyāḥ

analyzed: sambharaṇam paripācanañca buddha khetta bhūte imasmin cakkavāḷe jambudīpe eva ijjhati  na aññattha veneyyānam vinayana atthaḥ ca buddha uppādaḥ ti aggasāvaka mahāsāvaka ādi veneyya visesa apekkhāya
