translated: since no other field for the arising of Buddhas is mentioned in the ninefold scriptures.

original: jambudīpeyeva nibbattantīti dīpaṃ passī”ti. Iminā nayena desaniyāmepi kāraṇaṃ nīharitvā vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: jambudīpe iya iva nibbattanti iti dīpam passi iti iminā nayena desa niyāme api kāraṇam nīharitvā vattabbam
translated: Therefore it is said: “Buddhas do not arise in the three continents; they arise only in the Rose-Apple Continent. Thus he saw the continent.” In the same way, the reason for the rule of the teaching should be deduced and stated.

original: Idāni ca khattiyakulaṃ lokasammataṃ brāhmaṇānampi pūjanīyabhāvato. “Rājā pitā bhavissatī”ti kulaṃ passi pituvasena kulassa niddisitabbato.
analyzed: idāni ca khattiya kulam loka sammatam brāhmaṇānam pi pūjanīya bhāvataḥ rājā pitā bhavissati iti kulam passi pitu vasena kulassa niddisitabbato
translated: Now, the royal race is the most highly regarded in the world, and it is worthy of veneration even by the brahmans. “The father will be a king” : he saw the race, because the race is indicated by the father.

original: “Dasannaṃ māsānaṃ upari satta divasānī”ti passi, tena attano antarāyābhāvaṃ aññāsi, tassā ca tusitabhave dibbasampattipaccanubhavanaṃ.🔽Tā devatāti dasasahassicakkavāḷadevatā. Kathaṃ pana tā devatā tadā bodhisattassa
analyzed: dasannam māsānam upari satta divasāni iti passi tena attanaḥ antarāya abhāvam aññāsi tassā ca tusita bhave dibba sampatti paccanubhavanam  tāḥ devatā ati dasa sahassi cakkavāḷa devatā katham pana tāḥ devatā tadā bodhisattassa
translated: “Seven days after the completion of ten months,” he saw, and so he knew that there was no obstacle for him and that he would experience the divine excellence of the Tusita plane.

original: pūritapāramibhāvaṃ, kathaṃ cassa buddhabhāvaṃ jānantīti? Mahesakkhānaṃ devatānaṃ🔽vasena, yebhuyyena ca tā devatā abhisamayabhāgino. Tathā hi bhagavato dhammadānasaṃvibhāge
analyzed: pūrita pārami bhāvam katham ca assa buddha bhāvam jānanti iti mahesakkhānam devatānam  vasena yebhuyyena ca tāḥ devatāḥ abhisamaya bhāgino tathā hi bhagavataḥ dhamma dāna saṃvibhāge
translated: The deities: the deities of the ten thousand world systems. But how did those deities know that the Bodhisatta had fulfilled the pāramīs and that he would become a Buddha?

original: anekavāraṃ dasasahassacakkavāḷadevatāsannipāto ahosi.
analyzed: aneka vāram dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa devatā sannipātaḥ ahosi
translated: Through the deities of great influence, and because most of those deities were destined for the realization of the noble paths. For on many occasions the deities of the ten thousand world systems assembled to share in the Blessed One’s gift of the Dhamma.

original: “Cavāmī”ti jānāti cutiāsannajavanehi ñāṇasahitehi cutiyā upaṭṭhitabhāvassa paṭisaṃviditattā.
analyzed: cavāmi iti jānāti cuti āsanna javanehi ñāṇa sahitehi cutiyā upaṭṭhita bhāvassa paṭisaṃvidita ttā
translated: “I know”: he knows because he is aware of the presence of death through the knowledge that accompanies the thought of death’s nearness.

original: Cuticittaṃ na jānāti cuticittakkhaṇassa ittarabhāvato. Tathā hi taṃ cutūpapātañāṇassapi
analyzed: cuti cittam na jānāti cuti citta kkhaṇassa ittara bhāvato tathā hi tam cutu upapāta ñāṇassa api
translated: He does not know the death consciousness because it is momentary. Thus it is said:

original: avisayova. Paṭisandhicittepi eseva nayo. Āvajjanapariyāyoti āvajjanakkamo. Yasmā
analyzed: avisayaḥ uva paṭisandhi citte pi esa iva nayaḥ āvajjana pariyāyaḥ ti āvajjana kkamaḥ yasmā
translated: The order of adverting is the order of adverting.

original: ekavāraṃ āvajjitamattena ārammaṇaṃ nicchinituṃ na sakkā, tasmā taṃ evārammaṇaṃ dutiyaṃ,
analyzed: eka vāram āvajjita mattena ārammaṇam nicchinitum na sakkā tasmā tam eva ārammaṇam dutiyam
translated: Because the object cannot be discerned by adverting to it once only, he discerns it by adverting to it a second time and a third time.

original: tatiyañca āvajjitvā nicchayati. Āvajjanasīsena cettha javanavāro gahito. Tenāha “dutiyatatiyacittavāre🔽eva jānissatī”ti. Cutiyā puretaraṃ katipayacittavārato paṭṭhāya “maraṇaṃ me āsanna”nti
analyzed: tatiyam ca āvajjitvā nicchayati āvajjana sīsena ca ittha javana vāraḥ gahitaḥ tena āha dutiya tatiya cittavāre  eva jānissati iti cutiyā puretaram katipaya cittavārataḥ paṭṭhāya maraṇam me āsannanti
translated: And here the impulsions are included in the adverting. That is why he said, “He will know only in the second and third consciousnesses” .🔽Because he knows that his death is approaching from the time of two or three consciousnesses before death, it is said that he knows, “I am dying at the death moment” .

original: jānanato “cutikkhaṇepi cavāmīti jānātī”ti vuttaṃ. Paṭisandhiyā pana apubbabhāvato🔽paṭisandhicittaṃ na jānāti. Nikantiyā uppattito parato “asukasmiṃ me ṭhāne paṭisandhi
analyzed: jānanataḥ cuti kkhaṇe pi cavāmi iti jānāti iti vuttam paṭisandhiyā pana apubba bhāvato  paṭisandhi cittam na jānāti nikantiyāḥ uppattitaḥ paratas asukasmin me ṭhāne paṭisandhi
translated: But because the rebirth-linking consciousness has not occurred before,🔽he does not know the rebirth-linking consciousness. After the arising of the cleaving, he knows, “Rebirth-linking has been taken up by me in such a place” .

original: gahitā”ti jānāti. Tasmiṃ kāleti paṭisandhiggahaṇakāle. Dasasahassilokadhātu kampatīti
analyzed: gahitā iti jānāti tasmin kāle iti paṭisandhi ggahaṇa kāle dasa sahassi lokadhātu kampati iti
translated: At the time of taking rebirth-linking: at the time of the occurrence of the rebirth-linking. The ten-thousandfold world system shakes:🔽the reason for the shaking has already been given in the description of the Brahmā-world .

original: ettha kampanakāraṇaṃ heṭṭhā brahmajālavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttameva. Atthato panettha yaṃ
analyzed: ettha kampana kāraṇam heṭṭhā brahmajāla vaṇṇanāyam vuttam eva atthataḥ pana ittha yam
translated: But in meaning it is this.

original: vattabbaṃ, taṃ parato mahāparinibbānavaṇṇanāyaṃ āgamissati. Mahākāruṇikā buddhā bhagavanto🔽sattānaṃ hitasukhavidhānatapparatāya bahulaṃ somanassikāva hontīti tesaṃ paṭhamamahāvipākacittena
analyzed: vattabbam tat paratas mahā parinibbāna vaṇṇanāyam āgamissati mahā kāruṇikāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ  sattānam hita sukha vidhāna tappara tāya bahulam somanassikāḥ va honti iti tesam paṭhama mahā vipāka cittena
translated: The Enlightened Ones, the Blessed Ones, are Greatly Compassionate.

original: paṭisandhiggahaṇaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Mahāsivattheropana yadipi mahākāruṇikā buddhā🔽bhagavanto sattānaṃ hitasukhavidhānatapparāva, vivekajjhāsayā pana visaṅkhāraninnā
analyzed: paṭisandhi ggahaṇam aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttam yadi api mahā kāruṇikāḥ buddhāḥ  bhagavantaḥ viveka ajjhāsayā pana
translated: They are greatly concerned with the provision of welfare and pleasure for all creatures. They are mostly cheerful. So it is said in the Commentary that they take rebirth-linking with the first great resultant consciousness.

original: sabbasaṅkhāresu ajjhupekkhanabahulāti pañcamamahāvipākacittena paṭisandhiggahaṇamāha.🔽Pure puṇṇamāya sattamadivasato paṭṭhāyāti puṇṇamāya pure sattamadivasato paṭṭhāya,
analyzed: sabba saṅkhāresu ajjhupekkhana bahulā ati pañcama mahā vipāka cittena paṭisandhi ggahaṇam āha  pure puṇṇamāya sattama divasataḥ paṭṭhāya ati puṇṇamāya pure sattama divasataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: But the Elder Maha Siva said that although the Enlightened Ones, the Blessed Ones, are greatly compassionate and greatly concerned with the provision of welfare and pleasure for all creatures, they are nevertheless inclined to seclusion and are bent on non-formation and are mostly indifferent to all formations. So he said that they take rebirth-linking with the fifth great resultant consciousness.🔽From the seventh day of the waxing of the moon: from the seventh day of the waxing of the moon in the past,

original: sukkapakkhe navamito paṭṭhāyāti attho. Sattame divaseti navamito sattame divase āsaḷhipuṇṇamāyaṃ.
analyzed: sukkapakkhe navamitaḥ paṭṭhāya ati sattame divase iti navamitaḥ sattame divase āsaḷhipuṇṇamāyam
translated: from the ninth day of the waxing of the moon, is the meaning. On the seventh day: on the seventh day from the ninth day of the waxing of the moon, on the full-moon day of the water-lily month .

original: Idaṃ supinanti idāni vuccamānākāraṃ. Majjhimaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “anotattadahaṃ netvā
analyzed: idam idāni vuccamāna ākāram pana netvā
translated: “This dream”: the form of the dream that is being told now. But in the Majjhima Commentary it is said: “They took them to the Lake Anotatta,

original: ekamantaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu. Atha nesaṃ deviyo āgantvā manussamalaharaṇatthaṃ nhāpetvā”ti
analyzed: ekamantam aṭṭhaṃsu atha nesam deviyaḥ āgantvā manussa mala haraṇa attham nhāpetvā ati
translated: and after standing them on one side, the goddesses came and bathed them in order to remove the human impurities.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha nesaṃ deviyoti mahārājūnaṃ deviyo. Caritvāti gocaraṃ caritvā.🔽Haritūpalittāyāti haritena gomayena kataparibhaṇḍāya. “So ca kho purisagabbho, na🔽itthigabbho, putto te bhavissatī”ti ettakameva te brāhmaṇā attano supinasatthanayena
analyzed: vuttam tattha deviyo ti caritvā iti gocaram caritvā  haritūpalittāya ati haritena gomayena kata paribhaṇḍāya saḥ ca kho purisa gabbhaḥ na  itthi gabbhaḥ putto te bhavissati iti ettakam eva te brāhmaṇāḥ attanaḥ supina sattha nayena
translated: Herein, “their goddesses” are the goddesses of the great kings. “After wandering for alms”: after wandering for their food.

original: kathesuṃ. “Sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasissatī”tiādi pana devatāviggahena tamatthaṃ yāthāvato pavedesuṃ.
analyzed: kathesum sace agāram ajjhāvasissati itiādi pana devatā viggahena tam attham yāthāvato pavedesum
translated: “In a green-turfed shed”: in a shed with a floor of green grass. “And that is a male embryo, not a female embryo, and it will be a son for you” is all that the brahmans told him according to their own method of interpreting dreams. But “If he stays at home” and so on was told by the deities in order to make it clear to him exactly what would happen.

original: Dhammatāti ettha dhamma-saddo “jātidhammānaṃ bhikkhave sattāna”ntiādīsu viya pakatipariyāyo,
analyzed: dhamma tā ti ettha dhamma saddaḥ jāti dhammānam bhikkhave sattānam ti ādīsu viya pakati pariyāyaḥ
translated: “The natural state of things”: here the word dhamma in the phrase dhammatā hesā has the meaning of “nature” as in such passages as “Bhikkhus, beings subject to birth” ,

original: dhammo eva dhammatā yathā devo eva devatāti āha “ayaṃ sabhāvo”ti, ayaṃ pakatīti attho.
analyzed: dhammaḥ eva dhamma tā yathā devaḥ eva devatā iti āha ayam sabhāvaḥ iti ayam pakatī iti attho
translated: and dhammatā is simply dhamma. It is like the word “deity” in the phrase “the deity of fire” . So he said “this is the nature of things” . The meaning is: this is the nature of things.

original: Svāyaṃ sabhāvo atthato tathā niyatabhāvoti āha “ayaṃ niyāmoti vuttaṃ hotī”ti. Niyāmo
analyzed: svā ayam sabhāvaḥ atthataḥ tathā niyata bhāvo ti āha ayam niyāmo ti vuttam hoti iti niyāmo
translated: This nature is in fact the state of being fixed thus. Hence he said: “This is what is called the fixed particular nature” .

original: pana bahuvidhoti te sabbe atthuddhāranayena uddharitvā idhādhippetaniyāmameva dassetuṃ
analyzed: pana bahuvidhaḥ ti te sabbe attha uddhāra nayena uddharitvā idha adhippeta niyāmam eva dassetum
translated: But the fixed particular nature is of many kinds. So, in order to show the fixed particular nature intended here by extracting all the kinds by the method of extracting the meaning,

original: “niyāmo ca nāmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha kammānaṃ niyāmo kammaniyāmo. Esa nayo utuniyāmādīsu
analyzed: niyāmo ca nāma atiādi vuttam tattha kammānam niyāmo kamma niyāmo esa nayaḥ utu niyāma ādīsu
translated: he said: “The fixed particular nature is called” , and so on. Herein, the fixed particular nature of kamma is called the fixed particular nature of kamma. The same method of explanation applies in the case of the fixed particular nature of season, etc.,

original: tīsu. Itaro pana dhammo eva niyāmo dhammaniyāmo, dhammatā.
analyzed: tīsu itaraḥ pana dhammaḥ eva niyāmaḥ dhamma niyāmaḥ dhamma tā
translated: but the fixed particular nature of states is simply the fixed particular nature of states, the way things are.

original: Kusalassa kammassa. Nisento tikhiṇaṃ karonto.🔽Arūpādibhūmibhāgavisesavasena utuvisesadassanato utuvisesena sijjhamānānaṃ rukkhādīnaṃ
analyzed: kusalassa kammassa nisentaḥ tikhiṇam karontaḥ  arūpa ādi bhūmi bhāga visesa vasena utu visesa dassanataḥ utu visesena sijjhamānānam rukkha ādīnam
translated: Of profitable kamma. Sitting down, he makes a sharp one.🔽Because of the seeing of a particular season due to a particular kind of state of the earth’s surface, etc., such as the formless, etc., the taking of the flowers, fruits, etc., of trees, etc., that succeed through a particular season,

original: pupphaphalādiggahaṇaṃ “tesu tesu janapadesū”ti visesetvā vuttaṃ. Tasmiṃ tasmiṃ kāleti
analyzed: puppha phala ādi gahaṇam tesu tesu janapadesu iti visesetvā vuttam tasmin tasmin kāle iti
translated: is specified by “in this or that country” . In this or that time is

original: tasmiṃ tasmiṃ vasantādikāle.
analyzed: tasmin tasmin vasanta ādi kāle
translated: in this or that season, etc.

original: Madhurato bījato tittato bījatoti yojanā.
analyzed: madhurataḥ tittataḥ yojanā
translated: The construction is: from the sweet, from the seed, from the bitter, from the seed.

original: 18. Vattamānasamīpe vattamāne viya voharitabbanti “okkamatī”ti vuttanti āha “okkanto
analyzed: vattamāna samīpe vattamāne viya voharitabbanti okkamati iti vuttanti āha okkantaḥ
translated: It should be spoken of as if it were occurring in the vicinity of what is occurring. Hence he said: “It is said ‘it enters upon’ because it is entered upon” .

original: hotīti ayamevattho”ti. Evaṃ hotīti evaṃ vuttappakārenassa sampajānanā hoti. Na okkamamāne
analyzed: hoti iti ayam eva atthaḥ ti evam hoti iti evam vutta ppakārena assa sampajānanā hoti na okkamamāne
translated: this is the meaning.” So his full awareness is of the kind already stated.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇassa duviññeyyatāya. Yathā ca vuttaṃ “paṭisandhicittaṃ na jānātī”ti.
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇassa du viññeyya tāya yathā ca vuttam paṭisandhi cittam na jānāti iti
translated: because the rebirth-linking is hard to know. And it is said, “The rebirth-linking consciousness does not know.”

original: Dasasahassacakkavāḷapattharaṇena vā appamāṇo. Ativiya samujjalanabhāvena uḷāro. Devānubhāvanti
analyzed: dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa pattharaṇena vā appamāṇaḥ samujjalana bhāvena uḷāraḥ
translated: or it is immeasurable with the ten-thousand world-element as its extent. It is sublime with the extreme brilliance of its manifestation.

original: devānaṃ pabhānubhāvaṃ. Devānañhi pabhaṃ so obhāso abhibhavati, na tesaṃ ādhipaccaṃ.
analyzed: devānam pabha anubhāvam devānam hi pabham saḥ obhāsaḥ abhibhavati na tesam ādhipaccam
translated: The splendour of the gods: the gods’ radiance is outshone by it, not it by theirs.

original: Tenāha “nivatthavatthassā”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha nivattha vatthassa atiādi
translated: Hence it is said, “It is as though clothed in raiment fine,”

original: Lokānaṃ lokadhātūnaṃ antaro vivaro lokantaro, so eva itthiliṅgavasena “lokantarikā”ti🔽vutto. Rukkhagacchādinā kenaci na haññantīti aghā, asambādhā. Tenāha “niccavivaṭā”ti.
analyzed: lokānam lokadhātūnam antaraḥ vivaraḥ lokantaraḥ saḥ u eva itthi liṅga vasena lokantarikā ati  vuttaḥ rukkha gaccha ādinā kenaci na haññanti iti aghā asambādhā tena āha nicca vivaṭā ti
translated: The space between the worlds is the interval between the world-spheres. That is called “the space between the worlds” in the feminine form.🔽It is unhampered, not obstructed, by trees, creepers, etc., and so it is “unimpeded.” Hence it is said, “It is ever open.”

original: Asaṃvutāti heṭṭhā, upari ca kenaci na pihitā. Tena vuttaṃ “heṭṭhāpi appatiṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: a saṃvutā ati heṭṭhā upari ca kenacid na pihitā tena vuttam heṭṭhā api appatiṭṭhā ti
translated: It is uncovered, not closed in above or below by anything. Hence it is said, “It has no support below.”

original: Tattha pi-saddena yathā heṭṭhā udakassa pidhāyikā pathavī natthīti asaṃvutā lokantarikā,
analyzed: tattha pi saddena yathā heṭṭhā udakassa pidhāyikā pathavī natthi iti asaṃvutā lokantarikā
translated: Herein, the word “also” indicates that just as there is no earth as a damming-bank for the water below, so the space-element is not dammed by anything above it either.

original: evaṃ uparipi cakkavāḷesu viya devavimānānaṃ abhāvato asaṃvutā appatiṭṭhāti dasseti.
analyzed: evam upari pi cakkavāḷesu viya deva vimānānam abhāvataḥ asaṃvutā appatiṭṭhā ati dasseti
translated: Herein, the word “and” shows that just as there is no earth-holding water beneath it, so there is no world-sphere above it, thus it is “unbounded.”

original: Andhakāro ettha atthīti andhakārā. Cakkhuviññāṇaṃ na jāyati ālokassa abhāvato, na
analyzed: andhakāro ettha atthi iti andhakārā cakkhu viññāṇam na jāyati ālokassa abhāvato na
translated: And it is “dark” because there is no eye-consciousness there, not because there is no eye,🔽since it is said, “They recognize each other by their voices” .

original: cakkhuno. Tathā hi “tena obhāsena aññamaññaṃ sañjānantī”ti vuttaṃ. Jambudīpe ṭhitamajjhanhikavelāyaṃ
analyzed: cakkhuno tathā hi tena obhāsena aññam aññam sañjānanti iti vuttam jambudīpe ṭhita majjhanhika velāyam
translated: At midday in Jambudīpa,🔽the sun’s disk appears half-veiled to those who live in Pubbavideha,

original: pubbavidehavāsīnaṃ atthaṅgamanavasena upaḍḍhaṃ sūriyamaṇḍalaṃ paññāyati, aparagoyānavāsīnaṃ🔽uggamanavasena, evaṃ sesadīpesu pīti āha “ekappahāreneva tīsu dīpesu paññāyantī”ti.
analyzed: pubbavideha vāsīnam atthaṅgamana vasena upaḍḍham sūriya maṇḍalam paññāyati apara goyāna vāsīnam  uggamana vasena evam sesa dīpesu pi iti āha eka ppahārena iva tīsu dīpesu paññāyanti iti
translated: and it rises and sets for those who live in Aparagoyāna.🔽The rest of the continents should be understood in the same way.

original: Ito aññathā pana dvīsu eva dīpesu ekappahārena paññāyantīti. Ekekāya disāya nava🔽nava yojanasatasahassāni andhakāravidhamanampi imināva nayena daṭṭhabbaṃ. Pabhāya
analyzed: itas aññathā pana dvīsu eva dīpesu eka ppahārena paññāyanti iti ekekāya disāya nava 🔽nava yojana sata sahassāni andhakāra vidhamanam pi iminā ava nayena daṭṭhabbam pabhāya
translated: The dispelling of the darkness should be understood in the same way.

original: nappahontīti attano pabhāya obhāsituṃ anabhisambhunanti. Yugandharapabbatappamāṇe
analyzed: na appahonti iti attanaḥ pabhāyaḥ obhāsitum an abhisambhunanti yugandhara pabbata ppamāṇe
translated: They do not shine with their own light: they are not able to illuminate with their own radiance.

original: ākāse vicaraṇato “cakkavāḷapabbatassa vemajjhena vicarantī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Vāvaṭāti khādanatthaṃ gaṇhituṃ upakkamantā. Viparivattitvāti vivattitvā. Chijjitvāti
analyzed: ākāse vicaraṇataḥ cakkavāḷa pabbatassa vemajjhena vicaranti iti vuttam  vāvaṭāti khādana attham gaṇhitum upakkamantā viparivattitvā ati vivattitvā chijjitvā iti
translated: They wander in the sky to the height of Yugandhara: they wander in the middle of the Cakkavāḷa mountain.🔽They are seized: they are seized for the purpose of being eaten.🔽They are turned round: they are turned over. They are cut up:

original: mucchāpattiyā ṭhitaṭṭhānato muccitvā, aṅgapaccaṅgachedanena vā chijjitvā. Accantakhāreti
analyzed: mucchā āpattiyā ṭhita ṭṭhānataḥ muccitvā aṅga paccaṅga chedanena vā chijjitvā accantakhāreti
translated: they are cut up after they have fallen down from the place where they stood before they lost consciousness, or they are cut up after they have been cut into pieces. The water is boiling hot:

original: ātapasantāpābhāvena atisītabhāvameva sandhāya accantakhāratā vuttā siyā. Na hi taṃ
analyzed: ātapa santāpa abhāvena ati sīta bhāvam eva sandhāya accanta khāra tā vuttā siyā na hi tam
translated: the extreme heat is mentioned because of the extreme cold due to the absence of the heat of the sun and moon. For that water

original: kappasaṇṭhahanaudakaṃ sampattikaramahāmeghavuṭṭhaṃ pathavisandhārakaṃ kappavināsakaṃ🔽udakaṃ viya khāraṃ bhavituṃ arahati. Tathā hi sati pathavīpi vilīyeyya, tesaṃ vā
analyzed: kappa saṇṭhahana audakam sampatti kara mahā megha vuṭṭham pathavisandhārakam kappavināsakam  udakam viya khāram bhavitum arahati tathā hi sati vilīyeyya vā
translated: is not able to be boiling hot like the water that arises from the great cloud that rains at the end of the aeon and which destroys the world.🔽If it were, the earth would melt. Or just as the water of the river

original: pāpakammabalena petānaṃ udakassa pubbakheḷabhāvāpatti viya tassa udakassa tadā khārabhāvāpatti
analyzed: pāpa kamma balena petānam udakassa pubba kheḷa bhāva āpatti viya tassa udakassa tadā khāra bhāva āpatti
translated: Vaitaraṇī becomes pus and blood for the petas through the power of their evil kamma, so too that water becomes boiling hot for those beings through the power of their evil kamma.

original: hotīti vuttaṃ “accantakhāre udake”ti.
analyzed: hoti iti vuttam accanta khāre udaka iti
translated: “In water that is very hot” is said.

original: Ekayāgupānamattampīti pattādibhājanagataṃ yāguṃ gaḷociādiuddharaṇiyā gahetvā pivanamattampi kālaṃ. Samantatoti sabbabhāgato chappakārampi.
analyzed: eka yāgu pāna mattam pi iti patta ādi bhājana gatam yāgum gaḷoci ādi uddharaṇiyā gahetvā pivana mattam pi kālam samantataḥ ti sabba bhāgato cha pakāram pi
translated: “Even for a moment” means even for the time of drinking a bowl of rice gruel taken with a ladle, etc. “All around” means in every direction.

original: 19. Catunnaṃ mahārājānaṃ vasenāti vessavaṇādicatumahārājabhāvasāmaññena.
analyzed: catunnam mahārājānam vasena ati vessavaṇa ādi catu mahārāja bhāva sāmaññena
translated: “Under the influence of the four great kings” means by the commonality of the state of the four great kings, Vessavaṇa, etc.

original: Yathāvihāranti yathāsakaṃ vihāraṃ.
analyzed: yathāvihāranti yathāsakam vihāram
translated: “In their respective abodes” means in their respective abodes.

original: 20. Pakatiyāti attano pakatiyā eva. Tenāha “sabhāvenevā”ti. Parassa santike gahaṇena
analyzed: pakatiyā iti attanaḥ pakatiyā eva tena āha sabhāvena iva ati parassa santike gahaṇena
translated: “By nature” means by their own nature. Therefore it is said, “by their own nature alone.” Without taking it in the presence of another,

original: vinā attano sabhāveneva sayameva adhiṭṭhahitvā sīlasampannā. Bodhisattamātāpīti amhākaṃ
analyzed: vinā attanaḥ sabhāvena iva sayam eva adhiṭṭhahitvā sīla sampannā bodhisatta mātā api iti amhākam
translated: they themselves, by their own nature, resolved and became endowed with virtue. “The mother of the Bodhisatta” means

original: bodhisattamātāpi. Kāladevilassāti yathā kāladevilassa santike aññadā gaṇhāti, bodhisatte
analyzed: bodhisatta mātā api kāladevilassa ati yathā kāladevilassa santike aññadā gaṇhāti bodhisatte
translated: our Bodhisatta’s mother. “The god of death” means that just as she took it on another occasion in the presence of the god of death, so too the mother of Vipassi Bodhisatta …

original: pana…pe… sayameva sīlaṃ aggahesi, tathā vipassībodhisattamātāpīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: panape sayam eva sīlam aggahesi tathā vipassī bodhisatta mātā api iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: she herself took the virtue. This is the purport.

original: 21. “Manussesū”ti idaṃ pakaticārittavasena vuttaṃ, “manussitthiyā nāma manussapurisesu🔽purisādhippāyacittaṃ uppajjeyyā”ti. Bodhisattassa mātuyā pana devesupi tādisaṃ cittaṃ🔽nuppajjateva. Yathā bodhisattassa ānubhāvena bodhisattamātu purisādhippāyacittaṃ
analyzed: manussesu iti idam pakati cāritta vasena vuttam manussitthiyā nāma manussa purisesu  purisa adhippāya cittam uppajjeyyāti bodhisattassa mātuyā pana devesu pi tādisam cittam  nuppajjate iva yathā bodhisattassa ānubhāvena bodhisatta mātu purisa adhippāya cittam
translated: “Among human beings” is said in terms of ordinary conduct. “In the case of a human female, a human male’s mind would arise with the intention of a male.” But in the case of the Bodhisatta’s mother, such a mind did not arise even in the case of gods.

original: nuppajjati, evaṃ tassa ānubhāveneva sā kenaci purisena anabhibhavanīyāti āha “pādā🔽na vahanti dibbasaṅkhalikā viya bajjhantī”ti.🔽22. Pubbe “kāmaguṇūpasaṃhitaṃ cittaṃ nuppajjatī”ti vuttaṃ, puna “pañcahi kāmaguṇehi
analyzed: nuppajjati evam tassa ānubhāvena iva sā kenacid purisena an abhibhavanīyā iti āha pādā  na vahanti dibba saṅkhalikāḥ viya bajjhanti iti  pubbe kāma guṇa upasaṃhitam cittam na uppajjati iti vuttam puna pañcahi kāma guṇehi
translated: Just as, by the power of the Bodhisatta, the mind of the Bodhisatta’s mother did not arise with the intention of a male, so, by his power alone, she was not overcome by any man. Therefore it is said: “They carry her feet as if they were fetters of the gods.”

original: samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāretī”ti ca vuttaṃ. Kathamidaṃ aññamaññaṃ na virujjhatīti
analyzed: samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāreti iti ca vuttam katham idam aññam aññam na virujjhati iti
translated: Previously it was said: “A mind associated with the strands of sensual pleasure did not arise,” and again it was said: “She enjoyed herself furnished and endowed with the five strands of sensual pleasure.” How is it that these two statements do not contradict each other?

original: āha “pubbe”tiādi. Vatthupaṭikkhepoti abrahmacariyavatthupaṭisedho. Tenāha “purisādhippāyavasenā”ti.
analyzed: āha pubba itiādi vatthu paṭikkhepaḥ ti abrahmacariya vatthu paṭisedho tena āha purisa adhippāya vasena ati
translated: He said: “Previously” and so on. “The prohibition of the basis” is the prohibition of the basis of unchastity. Therefore he said: “By the intention of a male.”

original: Ārammaṇapaṭilābhoti rūpādipañcakāmaguṇārammaṇasseva paṭilābho.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paṭilābho ti rūpa ādi pañca kāmaguṇa ārammaṇassa iva paṭilābhaḥ
translated: The obtaining of the object is the obtaining of the object consisting of the five strands of sense pleasure beginning with visible forms.

original: 23. Kilamathoti khedo, kāyassa garubhāvakathinabhāvādayopi tassā tadā na honti eva.
analyzed: kilamatho ti khedaḥ kāyassa tassā tadā na honti eva
translated: Fatigue is weariness. And heaviness of the body, stiffness, etc., are not found in it then.

original: “Tirokucchigataṃ passatī”ti vuttaṃ. Kadā paṭṭhāya passatīti āha “kalalādikālaṃ atikkamitvā”tiādi.
analyzed: tiro kucchi gatam passati iti vuttam kadā paṭṭhāya passati iti āha kalala ādi kālam atikkamitvā atiādi
translated: “He sees it in the womb” is said. As to when he sees it, he says, “After the first week, etc., have passed.”

original: Dassane payojanaṃ sayameva vadati. Tassa abhāvato kalalādikāle na passati. Puttena
analyzed: dassane payojanam sayam eva vadati tassa abhāvataḥ kalala ādi kāle na passati puttena
translated: He himself states the purpose of the seeing. He does not see it in the first week, etc., because it is not yet formed.

original: daharena mandena uttānaseyyakena saddhiṃ. “Yaṃ taṃ mātū”tiādi pakaticārittavasena
analyzed: daharena mandena uttānaseyyakena saddhim yam tam mātu uti ādi
translated: With a child, a fool, a supine invalid. “What is the mother’s” is said according to the mother’s conduct.

original: vuttaṃ. Cakkavattigabbhatopi hi savisesaṃ bodhisattagabbho parihāraṃ labhati puññasambhārassa
analyzed: vuttam cakkavatti gabbhataḥ pi hi sa visesam bodhisatta gabbhaḥ parihāram labhati puñña sambhārassa
translated: For the Bodhisatta’s womb is more distinguished than that of a Wheel-turning Monarch because of the abundance of his merit.

original: sātisayattā, tasmā bodhisattamātā ativiya sappāyāhārācārā ca hutvā sakkaccaṃ pariharati.
analyzed: sā ati sa yattā tasmai bodhisatta mātā sappāya āhāra ācārā ca hutvā sakkaccam pariharati
translated: Therefore the Bodhisatta’s mother is very careful in her choice of food and conduct.

original: Sukhavāsatthanti bodhisattassa sukhavāsatthaṃ. Puratthābhimukhoti mātu purimabhāgābhimukho.
analyzed: sukha vāsattham ti bodhisattassa sukha vāsattham purattha abhimukhaḥ iti mātu purima bhāga abhimukhaḥ
translated: For the comfort of the Bodhisatta. Facing east: facing the eastern side of the mother’s abdomen.

original: Idāni tirokucchigatassa dissamānatāya abbhantaraṃ, bāhirañca kāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ “pubbe🔽katakamma”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Assāti deviyā. Vatthunti kucchiṃ. Phalikaabbhapaṭalādino
analyzed: idāni tiro kucchi gatassa dissamāna tāya abbhantaram bāhiram ca kāraṇam dassetum pubbe  kata kamma nti ādi vuttam assa ati deviyāḥ vatthum ti kucchim phalika abbha paṭala ādinaḥ
translated: Now, in order to show the internal and external reasons for the fact that the child is seen while in the womb, it is said: “Previously done kamma” and so on. Assa means of the queen. Vatthu means the womb. Phalikabbhapatala, etc.

original: viya bodhisattamātukucchitacassa patanubhāvena ālokassa vibandhābhāvato yathā bodhisattamātā🔽kucchigataṃ bodhisattaṃ passati, kiṃ evaṃ bodhisattopi mātaraṃ, aññañca purato ṭhitaṃ
analyzed: viya patanu bhāvena ālokassa vibandha abhāvataḥ yathā bodhisatta mātā  kucchi gatam bodhisattam passati kim evam bodhisattaḥ api mātaram aññam ca puratas ṭhitam
translated: Now, in order to show the internal and external reasons for the fact that the Bodhisatta was visible while in the womb, it is said: “Previously he had done this kamma” . “Assa” means the queen. “Vatthu” means the womb. Because of the power of the Bodhisatta’s maturity, there is no obstruction to light as there is with a wall, a fence, a cloth, etc.,🔽so the Bodhisatta’s mother sees the Bodhisatta in her womb.🔽But does the Bodhisatta also see his mother and other visible forms that are in front of him?🔽“The Bodhisatta, however, does not see” .

original: rūpagataṃ passati, noti āha “bodhisatto panā”tiādi. Kasmā pana sati cakkhumhi, āloke🔽ca na passatīti āha “na hi antokucchiyaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ uppajjatī”ti. Assāsapassāsā
analyzed: rūpa gatam passati no ti āha bodhisatto pana atiādi kasmā pana sati cakkhumhi āloke  ca na passati iti āha na hi antokucchiyam cakkhu viññāṇam uppajjati iti assāsa passāsā
translated: Why does he not see, when there is an eye and light?🔽“For eye-consciousness does not arise there” .

original: viya hi tattha cakkhuviññāṇampi na uppajjati tajjassa samannāhārassa abhāvato.
analyzed: viya hi tattha cakkhu viññāṇam pi na uppajjati tad jassa samannāhārassa abhāvato
translated: For just as in-breath and out-breath do not arise there, so too eye-consciousness does not arise there because the necessary stimulation is absent.

original: 24. Yathā aññā itthiyo vijātappaccayā tādisena rogena abhibhūtāpi hutvā maranti,
analyzed: yathā aññā itthiyaḥ vijāta ppaccayā tādisena rogena abhibhūtā api hutvā maranti
translated: As other women, after giving birth, are overcome by a corresponding sickness and die,

original: bodhisattamātu pana bodhisatte kucchigate tassa vijāyananimittaṃ, na koci rogo uppajjati,🔽kevalaṃ āyuparikkhayeneva kālaṃ karoti, svāyamattho heṭṭhā vutto eva. “Bodhisattena
analyzed: bodhisatta mātu pana bodhisatte kucchi gate tassa vijāyana nimittam na koci rogaḥ uppajjati  kevalam āyu parikkhayena iva kālam karoti heṭṭhā vuttaḥ eva bodhisattena
translated: But when the Bodhisatta is in the mother’s womb, no disease arises in her as a sign of her delivery,

original: vasitaṭṭhānañhī”tiādi tassa kāraṇavacanaṃ. Aññesaṃ aparibhoganti aññehi na paribhuñjitabbaṃ,
analyzed: vasita ṭṭhānam hi itiādi tassa kāraṇa vacanam aññesam a paribhogam ti aññehi na paribhuñjitabbam
translated: she dies only through the exhaustion of her life-span. This matter has been stated below. “The place where the Bodhisatta dwelt” and so on is the statement of the reason for that. “Not to be used by others” means not to be used by others,

original: na paribhogayogyanti attho. Tathā sati bodhisattapitu aññāya aggamahesiyā bhavitabbaṃ,
analyzed: na paribhoga yogyanti attho tathā sati bodhisatta pitu aññāya aggamahesiyā bhavitabbam
translated: the meaning is, not fit to be used. If that is so, then the mother of the Bodhisatta must be the chief queen of the Bodhisatta’s father,

original: tathāpi bodhisattamātari dharantiyā ayujjamānakanti āha “na ca sakkā”tiādi. Apanetvāti
analyzed: tathā api bodhisatta mātari dharantiyā ayujjamānakam iti āha na ca sakkā ati ādi apanetvā iti
translated: but even so, it is not proper for the Bodhisatta’s mother to be carrying another man’s child, therefore he said “and it is not possible” and so on. “Excluding” means

original: aggamahesiṭhānato nīharitvā. Attani chandarāgavaseneva bahiddhā ārammaṇapariyesanāti🔽visayinisārāgo sattānaṃ visayesu sārāgassa balavakāraṇanti dassento āha “sattānaṃ
analyzed: aggamahesi ṭhānataḥ nīharitvā attani chanda rāga vasena iva bahiddhā ārammaṇa pariyesanā ati  sattānam visayesu sārāgassa balava kāraṇanti dassentaḥ āha sattānam
translated: removing from the position of chief queen. “Seeking for an object outside” means seeking for an object outside through desire and passion for oneself,🔽showing that the strong cause of beings’ passion for objects is the passion for their own bodies, he said “passion for one’s own body is strong in beings”

original: attabhāve chandarāgo balavā hotī”ti. Anurakkhituṃ na sakkotīti sammā gabbhaparihāraṃ
analyzed: attabhāve chanda rāgaḥ balavā hoti iti anurakkhitum na sakkoti iti sammā gabbha parihāram
translated: “cannot protect” means cannot properly protect the embryo,

original: nānuyuñjati. Tena gabbho bahvābādho hoti. Vatthu visadaṃ hotīti gabbhāsayo visuddho
analyzed: na anuyuñjati tena gabbhaḥ bahu ābādhaḥ hoti vatthu visadam hoti iti gabbha āsayaḥ visuddhaḥ
translated: and she is not over-tired. The womb is clear: the womb is pure.

original: hoti. Mātu majjhimavayassa tatiyakoṭṭhāse bodhisattagabbhokkamanampi tassā āyuparimāṇavilokaneneva🔽saṅgahitaṃ vayovasena uppajjanakavikārassa parivajjanato. Itthisabhāvena uppajjanakavikāro
analyzed: hoti mātu majjhima vayassa tatiya koṭṭhāse bodhisatta gabbha ukkamanam pi tassāḥ āyu parimāṇa vilokanena iva  saṅgahitam vayaḥ vasena uppajjanaka vikārassa parivajjanataḥ itthi sabhāvena uppajjanaka vikāro
translated: The Bodhisatta’s descent into the womb and his remaining there are included in the mother’s middle period of pregnancy, which is the third quarter of her pregnancy.🔽The changes that occur in a woman are avoided by the Bodhisatta because he is concerned with the changes that occur in a man.

original: pana bodhisattassa ānubhāveneva vūpasamati.
analyzed: pana bodhisattassa ānubhāvena iva vūpasamati
translated: But the changes that occur in a woman are allayed by the Bodhisatta’s own power.

original: 25. Sattamāsajātoti paṭisandhiggahaṇato sattame māse jāto. So sītuṇhakkhamo na hoti🔽ativiya sukhumālatāya. Aṭṭhamāsajāto kāmaṃ sattamāsajātato buddhivayavā, ekacce pana🔽cammapadesā vuddhiṃ pāpuṇantā ghaṭṭanaṃ na sahanti, tena so na jīvati. “Sattamāsajātassa
analyzed: satta māsa jātaḥ ti paṭisandhi ggahaṇato sattame māse jātaḥ saḥ sītuṇha khamaḥ na hoti  aṭṭha māsa jātaḥ kāmam satta māsa jātataḥ buddhi vayavāḥ ekacce pana  camma padesāḥ vuddhim pāpuṇantāḥ ghaṭṭanam na sahanti tena saḥ na jīvati satta māsa jātassa
translated: Seven months old: born after seven months from the time of conception. He is not able to bear cold and heat🔽because of his extreme delicacy. Eight months old: his faculties and his mind are more developed than those of one seven months old, but some parts of his skin are not yet fully grown and cannot bear rubbing,

original: pana na tāva te jātā”ti vadanti.
analyzed: pana na tāva te jātā ati vadanti
translated: and so he does not live. “But they are not yet born in one seven months old” is said.

original: 27. Devā paṭhamaṃ paṭiggaṇhantīti “lokanāthaṃ mahāpurisaṃ sayameva paṭhamaṃ paṭiggaṇhāmā”ti
analyzed: devā paṭhamam paṭiggaṇhanti iti lokanātham mahā purisam sayam eva paṭhamam paṭiggaṇhāma ati
translated: The gods receive him first: “We will receive the great man, the lord of the world, first of all ourselves.”

original: sañjātagāravabahumānā attano pītiṃ pavedentā khīṇāsavā suddhāvāsabrahmāno ādito paṭiggaṇhanti.
analyzed: sañjāta gārava bahu mānā attanaḥ pītim pavedentā khīṇa āsavā suddhāvāsa brahmānaḥ āditas paṭiggaṇhanti
translated: and the Pure-Abodes Brahmās, who are free from the cankers, receive it first, expressing their appreciation and respect.

original: Sūtivesanti sūtijagganadhātivesaṃ. Eketi abhayagirivāsino. Macchakkhisadisaṃ chavivasena.🔽Aṭṭhāsi na nisīdi, na nipajji vā. Tena vuttaṃ “ṭhitāva bodhisattaṃ bodhisattamātā🔽vijāyatī”ti. Niddukkhatāya ṭhitā eva hutvā vijāyati. Dukkhassa hi balavabhāvato taṃ
analyzed: sūtivesanti sūti jaggana dhātivesam eke iti abhayagiri vāsinaḥ mad śakkhi sadisam chavi vasena  aṭṭhāsi na nisīdi na nipajji vā tena vuttam ṭhitā ava bodhisattam bodhisatta mātā  vijāyati iti niddukkha tāya ṭhitāḥ eva hutvā vijāyati dukkhassa hi balava bhāvataḥ tam
translated: “Sūti” is the same as “sūti-jagganadhāna” (see Dhp 107). Some say that the skin of the mother of the Bodhisatta is like a fish’s skin.

original: dukkhaṃ asahamānā aññā itthiyo nisinnā vā nipannā vā vijāyanti.
analyzed: dukkham a sahamānāḥ aññāḥ itthiyaḥ nisinnāḥ vā nipannāḥ vā vijāyanti
translated: She stood, neither sitting nor lying down. Therefore it is said: “The mother of the Bodhisatta gives birth while standing.” She gives birth while standing because of the absence of pain. For other women, who cannot bear the pain, give birth while sitting or lying down.

original: 28. Ajinappaveṇiyāti ajinacammehi sibbitvā katapaveṇiyā. Mahātejoti mahānubhāvo. Mahāyasoti mahāparivāro, vipulakittighoso ca.
analyzed: ajina ppaveṇiyā ti ajina cammehi sibbitvā kata paveṇiyā mahā tejaḥ iti mahā anubhāvaḥ mahā yaso ti mahā parivāraḥ vipula kitti ghoso ca
translated: “Ajinappaveṇi” is a litter made of deer-skins. “Mahātejo” means “of great power.” “Mahāyāso” means “of great retinue” and “of great fame.”

original: 29. Bhaggavibhaggāti sambādhaṭṭhānato nikkhamanena vibhāvitattā bhaggā, vibhaggā
analyzed: bhagga vibhaggā ti sambādha ṭṭhānataḥ nikkhamanena vibhāvita ttā bhaggā vibhaggā
translated: “Bhaggavibhagga” means “broken” and “shattered” because of being split by the difficulty of coming out.

original: viya ca hutvā, tena nesaṃ avisadabhāvameva dasseti. Alaggo hutvāti gabbhāsaye, yonipadese
analyzed: ca hutvā tena nesam avisada bhāvam eva dasseti alaggaḥ hutvā iti gabbha āsaye yoni padese
translated: and he shows that they are not contaminated by anything. As if he were a snake: as if he were a snake in the womb, in the place of birth,

original: ca katthaci alaggo asatto hutvā, yato “dhamakaraṇato udakanikkhamanasadisa”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ca katthaci alaggaḥ asattaḥ hutvā yatas dhama karaṇataḥ udaka nikkhamana sadisanti vuttam
translated: in some place. For it is said that “he is like one who emerges from the water through a hole. ”

original: Udakenāti gabbhāsayagatena udakena. Amakkhitova nikkhamati sammakkhitassa tādisassa🔽udakasemhādikasseva tattha abhāvato. Bodhisattassa hi puññānubhāvato paṭisandhiggahaṇato
analyzed: udakena ati gabbhāsaya gatena udakena amakkhitaḥ uva nikkhamati sammakkhitassa tādisassa  udaka semha ādikassa iva tattha abhāvataḥ bodhisattassa hi puñña anubhāvataḥ paṭisandhi ggahaṇato
translated: In the water: in the water in the womb. He emerges unsoiled: because there is no such water as that, such as the water of a flood, etc.,

original: paṭṭhāya taṃ ṭhānaṃ pubbepi visuddhaṃ visesato paramasugandhagandhakuṭi viya candanagandhaṃ vāyantaṃ tiṭṭhati.
analyzed: paṭṭhāya tam ṭhānam pubbe pi visuddham visesataḥ parama sugandha gandhakuṭi viya candana gandham vāyantam tiṭṭhati
translated: for one who is so. For the place where the Bodhisatta is reborn, being purified by the power of his merit, remains pure, especially like a fragrant chamber perfumed with the scent of sandalwood.

original: Udakavaṭṭiyoti udakakkhandhā.
analyzed: udakavaṭṭiyā ti udakakkhandhā
translated: The water-basin: the mass of water.

original: 31. Muhuttajātoti muhuttena jāto hutvā muhuttamattova. Anudhāriyamāneti anukūlavasena
analyzed: muhutta jātā iti muhuttena jātaḥ hutvā muhutta mattaḥ uva anudhāriyamānā iti anukūla vasena

original: nīyamāne. Āgatānevāti taṃ ṭhānaṃ upagatāni eva. Anekasākhanti ratanamayānekasatapatiṭṭhānahīrakaṃ.
analyzed: nīyamāne tam ṭhānam upagatāni eva ratana maya aneka sata patiṭṭhāna hīrakam

original: Sahassamaṇḍalanti tesaṃ upariṭṭhitaṃ anekasahassamaṇḍalahīrakaṃ. Marūti devā. Na
analyzed: sahassa maṇḍalanti tesam upari ṭhitam aneka sahassa maṇḍala hīrakam devāḥ na

original: kho pana evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ padavītihārato pageva disāvilokanassa katattā. Tenāha “mahāsatto
analyzed: kho pana evam daṭṭhabbam padavī tihārato pagā iva disā vilokanassa kata ttā tena āha mahāsatto

analyzed: hi iti ādi ekaṅgaṇāni iti vivaṭa bhāvena vihāra aṅgaṇa pariveṇa aṅgaṇāni ekaṅgaṇa sadisāni  ahesum sadisaḥ api na atthi iti tumhākam idam vilokanam visiṭṭhe passitum idha tumhehi
translated: Ekaṅgaṇāni means that they were like one courtyard, like the courtyard of the monastery and the courtyard of the surrounding wall, by reason of their open nature.

original: sadisopi natthi, kuto uttaritaro”ti āhaṃsu. Aggoti padhāno, kena panassa padhānatāti

translated: Therefore it is said: “By his qualities.” The word paṭhama here has the sense of chief. But the chiefness of the Bodhisattvas

analyzed: ettha ca mahesakkhā tāva devā tathā ca vadanti itare pana kathanti mahāsattassa
translated: And here, the gods of great dignity say thus, but how do the others say? The Great Being

analyzed: ānubhāva dassana ādinā mahesakkhānam hi devānam mahāsattassa ānubhāvaḥ viya tena sadisānam pi  ānubhāvaḥ paccakkhaḥ ahosi iti itare pana tesam vacanam sutvā saddahantā anuminantā

translated: “Here, bhikkhus, just as soon as the Bodhisatta

analyzed: abhibhūtaḥ kenacid an abhibhūtaḥ ahosi tena āha mahā janam ajjhottharitvā abhibhavitvā
translated: and he was not overcome by anyone. Hence it was said: “The going after overcoming and outshining a great crowd” is a premonition of the going after overcoming and outshining the great crowd of Māra’s army.

original: gamanassa pubbanimitta”nti. Tathā sattapadagamanaṃ sattapadabojjhaṅgasampannaariyamaggagamanassa.
analyzed: gamanassa pubba nimittan ti tathā satta pada gamanam satta pada bojjhaṅga sampanna ariya magga gamanassa
translated: Likewise the seven steps are a premonition of the going of the Noble Eightfold Path endowed with the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: Suvisuddhasetacchattadhāraṇaṃ suvisuddhavimuttichattadhāraṇassa. Pañcarājakakudhabhaṇḍasamāyogo🔽pañcavidhavimuttiguṇasamāyogassa. Anāvaṭadisānuvilokanaṃ anāvaṭañāṇatāya. “Aggohamasmī”tiādinā
analyzed: su visuddha seta chatta dhāraṇam su visuddha vimutti chatta dhāraṇassa pañca rājaka kudha bhaṇḍa samāyogaḥ  pañcavidha vimutti guṇa samāyogassa an āvaṭa disā anuvilokanam an āvaṭa ñāṇa tāya aggaḥ ham asmi iti ādinā
translated: The bearing of the white parasol of pure white cloth is a premonition of the bearing of the parasol of the pure deliverance. The array of the five royal treasures is a premonition of the array of the five factors of emancipation.

original: achambhitavācābhāsanaṃ kenaci avibandhanīyatāya appavattiyassa saddhammacakkappavattanassa.🔽“Ayamantimā jātī”ti āyatiṃ jātiyā abhāvakittanā anupādi…pe… pubbanimittanti veditabbaṃ
analyzed: a chambhita vācā bhāsanam kenaci a vibandhanīya tāya a pavattiyassa saddhamma cakka ppavattanassa  ayam antimā jātī iti āyatim jātiyāḥ abhāva kittanā pubba nimittam ti veditabbam
translated: The surveying of the four quarters without turning the body is a premonition of the surveying of the four establishments of mindfulness without turning the knowledge. The utterance of the words of fearlessness, “I am the chief,” etc., is a premonition of the setting in motion of the Wheel of the True Idea, which is not to be turned back by anyone, because it is irreversible.🔽The proclamation of the non-existence of future birth, “This is the last birth,” is a premonition of the non-occurrence of future birth.🔽It should be understood as a premonition in the sense that it is the invariable sign of the particular distinction to be obtained in the future.

original: tassa tassa anāgate laddhabbavisesassa taṃ taṃ nimittaṃ abyabhicārīti katvā. Na āgatoti
analyzed: tassa tassa anāgate laddhabba visesassa tam tam nimittam abyabhicāri iti katvā na āgataḥ iti
translated: “Not come” means not come to the world of men.

original: imasmiṃ sutte, aññattha ca vakkhamānāya anupubbiyā na āgato. Āharitvāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ🔽sutte, aṭṭhakathāsu ca āgatanayena āharitvā dīpetabbo.🔽“Dasasahassilokadhātu kampī”ti idaṃ satipi idha pāḷiyaṃ āgatatte vakkhamānānaṃ acchariyānaṃ🔽mūlabhūtaṃ dassetuṃ vuttaṃ, evaṃ aññampi evarūpaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tantibaddhā vīṇā cammabaddhā
analyzed: imasmim sutte aññattha ca vakkhamānāya anupubbiyā na āgataḥ āharitvā ati tasmim tasmim  sutte aṭṭhakathāsu ca āgata nayena āharitvā dīpetabbaḥ  dasa sahassi lokadhātu kampi iti idam idha pāḷiyam āgata tte vakkhamānānam acchariyānam  mūla bhūtam dassetum vuttam evam aññam pi evarūpam daṭṭhabbam tanti baddhā vīṇā camma baddhā
translated: and it is not given in the order in which it will be given in the present sutta and elsewhere. “Should be brought in” means that it should be brought in by the method given in the relevant suttas and commentaries and demonstrated.

original: bheriyoti pañcaṅgikatūriyassa nidassanamattaṃ, ca-saddena vā itaresampi saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo.🔽“Andubandhanādīni taṅkhaṇe eva chajjitvā puna pākatikāneva honti, tathā jaccandhādīnaṃ
analyzed: bheriyā iti pañcaṅgika tūriyassa nidassana mattam ca saddena vā itaresam pi saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo  andu bandhana ādīni eva chajjitvā punar pākatikān eva honti tathā
translated: “The ten-thousandfold world system shook” is said in order to show the basis for the wonders that will be mentioned, even though it is given in the text here. The same method should be followed in other cases too. “The lute strings and the drum skin” is a mere illustration of the five-piece musical instrument. Or the word “and” should be understood to include the other instruments as well.

original: cakkhusotādīni tathārūpakammapaccayā tasmiṃyeva khaṇe uppajjitvā tāvadeva vigacchantī”ti
analyzed: cakkhu sota ādīni tathārūpa kamma paccayā tasmin yeva khaṇe uppajjitvā tāvat eva vigacchanti iti
translated: “The bonds on the fingers and so on snapped at that moment and became as they were before. Likewise the eyes, ears, and so on of the blind and deaf arose and disappeared in that very moment through the conditions of such action.”

original: vadanti. Chijjiṃsūti ca pādesu bandhaṭṭhānesu chijjiṃsu. Vigacchiṃsūti vūpasamiṃsu.
analyzed: vadanti chijjiṃsu iti ca pādesu bandha ṭṭhānesu chijjiṃsu vigacchiṃsu iti vūpasamiṃsu
translated: They say that this is so. “Snapped” means that they snapped at the places where they were bound to the feet. “Disappeared” means that they ceased.

original: Ākāsaṭṭhakaratanāni nāma taṃtaṃvimānagatamaṇiratanādīni. Sakatejobhāsitānīti ativiya
analyzed: ākāsaṭṭhaka ratanāni nāma taṃ taṃ vimāna gata maṇi ratana ādīni saka tejaḥ bhāsitāni iti

analyzed: samujjalāya attano pabhāya obhāsitāni ahesum nappavatti iti na sannipātaḥ na vāyi iti
translated: and they shone with their own radiance. The wind did not blow,

analyzed: kharaḥ vātaḥ na vāyi mudu sukhaḥ pana sattānam sukha āvahaḥ vāyi pathavi gatāḥ ahesuṃ ucca ṭṭhāne
translated: and there was no rough wind. A gentle, pleasant wind blew, bringing happiness to beings. The earth was covered with water,

original: ṭhātuṃ avisahantā. Utusampannoti anuṇhāsītatāsaṅkhātena utunā sampanno. Apphoṭanaṃ
analyzed: ṭhātum a visahantā utu sampanno ti anuṇhā sīta tā saṅkhātena utunā sampannaḥ apphoṭanam
translated: and the water was covered with flowers. The water was not able to remain in high places. It was in season,

analyzed: vuccati bhuja hattha saṅghaṭṭana saddaḥ atthataḥ pana vāma hattham ṭhapetvā dakkhiṇena

analyzed: puthu pāṇinā hattha tāḷanena sadda karaṇam mukhena usseḷanam saddassa muñcanam seḷanam  ekā dhaja mālā nirantaram dhaja mālā samodhāna gatāya na kevalam ca etāni eva

analyzed: atha kho aññāni api vicittapuppha sugandhapuppha vassadeva upavassi sūriye dissamāne eva
translated: but also various flowers, fragrant flowers, and heavenly rain fell. As long as the sun was visible,

analyzed: tārakāḥ obhāsiṃsu accham vippasannam udakam pathavitaḥ ubbhijji bilāsayā ca tiracchānā
translated: The stars shone, the water in the wells welled up clear and pure, the wild animals came out of their hiding-places,

original: āsayato nikkhamiṃsu, rāgadosamohāpi tanu bhaviṃsu, pathaviyaṃ rajo vūpasami, aniṭṭhagandho
analyzed: āsayataḥ nikkhamiṃsu rāga dosa mohā api tanu bhaviṃsu pathaviyam rajaḥ an iṭṭha gandho
translated: and the lust, hatred and delusion of all beings were subdued. The dust on the earth settled down, the foul smell disappeared,

original: vigacchi, dibbagandho vāyi, rūpino devā sarūpeneva manussānaṃ āpāthaṃ agamaṃsu, sattānaṃ
analyzed: vigacchi dibba gandhaḥ vāyi rūpinaḥ devā sa rūpena iva manussānam āpātham agamaṃsu sattānam
translated: and a divine fragrance spread. The devas of the sensuous worlds appeared in their own forms to the human eye, and the passing away and rebirth of beings became evident.

original: cutūpapātā nāhesu”nti evamādīni yāni mahābhinīhārasamaye uppannāni dvattiṃsapubbanimittāni,
analyzed: cutūpapātāḥ evamādīni yāni mahā abhinīhāra samaye uppannāni dvattiṃsa pubba nimittāni
translated: All these thirty-two signs appeared at the time of the Great Aspiration.

original: tāni anavasesato tadā ahesunti.
analyzed: tāni anavasesataḥ tadā ahesunti
translated: And all of them appeared then without exception.

analyzed: tatra api iti tesu pi pathavi kampa ādīsu evam pubba nimitta bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ na kevalam sampati jātassa  ṭhāna ādīsu eva ti adhippāyaḥ sabbaññuta ññāṇa paṭilābhassa pubba nimittam sabbassa ñeyyassa
translated: And the same should be understood as the signs that appeared on the occasions of the earth’s trembling, etc.,

original: titthakaramatassa ca cālanato. Kenaci anussāhitānaṃyeva imasmiṃyeva ekacakkavāḷe
analyzed: titthakara matassa ca cālanataḥ kenaci anussāhitānam yeva imasmin yeva eka cakkavāḷe
translated: and not only on the occasion of the attainment of the supreme enlightenment. This is the meaning. The sign of the acquisition of omniscient knowledge was the shaking of the whole of the knowable world-system and the world-sphere of the brahmas,🔽because it shook the view of the brahmins that the world was produced by Brahmā. Without being invoked, the Four Kings of the gods,

original: sannipāto kenaci anussāhitānaṃyeva ekappahāreneva sannipatitvā dhammapaṭiggaṇhanassa🔽pubbanimittaṃ. Paṭhamaṃ devatānaṃ paṭiggahaṇaṃ dibbavihārapaṭilābhassa, pacchā manussānaṃ
analyzed: sannipātaḥ kenaci anussāhitānam yeva eka ppahārena iva sannipatitvā dhamma paṭiggaṇhanassa  pubba nimittam paṭhamam devatānam paṭiggahaṇam dibba vihāra paṭilābhassa pacchā manussānam
translated: The gathering of the people, without anyone’s having invited them, all at once, to receive the Dhamma,

original: paṭiggahaṇaṃ tattheva ṭhānassa niccalasabhāvato āneñjavihārapaṭilābhassa pubbanimittaṃ.
analyzed: paṭiggahaṇam tattha eva ṭhānassa niccala sabhāvataḥ āneñja vihāra paṭilābhassa pubba nimittam
translated: is the premonition of the acceptance of the Dhamma by the deities. The people’s acceptance of the Dhamma is the premonition of the attainment of the imperturbable abiding in the immovable state of the site.

original: Vīṇānaṃ sayaṃ vajjanaṃ parūpadesena vinā sayameva anupubbavihārapaṭilābhassa pubbanimittaṃ.🔽Bherīnaṃ vajjanaṃ cakkavāḷapariyantāya parisāya pavedanasamatthassa dhammabheriyā🔽anusāvanassa amatadundubhighosanassa pubbanimittaṃ. Andubandhanādīnaṃ chedo mānavinibandhabhedanassa
analyzed: vīṇānam sayam vajjanam para upadesena vinā sayam eva anupubba vihāra paṭilābhassa pubba nimittam  bherīnam vajjanam cakkavāḷa pariyantāya parisāya pavedana samatthassa dhamma bheriyā  anusāvanassa amata dundubhi ghosanassa pubba nimittam andu bandhana ādīnam chedaḥ māna vinibandha bhedanassa
translated: The self-playing of the lutes is the premonition of the attainment of the successive abidings without the prompting of another.🔽The playing of the drums is the premonition of the beating of the drum of the Deathless by the proclamation of the Dhamma to the assembly that extends to the boundaries of the world systems. The cutting of the bonds of the feet is the premonition of the breaking of the bondage of conceit.

original: pubbanimittaṃ. Mahājanassa rogavigamo tasseva sakalavaṭṭadukkharogavigamabhūtassa
analyzed: pubba nimittam mahājanassa roga vigamaḥ tassa iva sakala vaṭṭa dukkha roga vigama bhūtassa
translated: The people’s recovery from disease is the premonition of the recovery from the disease of the entire round of suffering.

original: saccapaṭilābhassa pubbanimittaṃ. “Mahājanassā”ti padaṃ “mahājanassa dibbacakkhupaṭilābhassa,
analyzed: sacca paṭilābhassa pubba nimittam mahājanassa ati padam mahājanassa dibba cakkhu paṭilābhassa
translated: and the acquisition of the divine eye by the multitude.

original: mahājanassa dibbasotadhātupaṭilābhassā”tiādinā tattha tattha ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ.
analyzed: mahājanassa dibba sota dhātu paṭilābhassa ati ādinā tattha tattha ānetvā sambandhitabbam
translated: The word “of the multitude” should be construed in each case with the words “of the divine eye,” “of the divine ear element,” and so on.

original: Iddhipādabhāvanāvasena sātisayañāṇajavasampattisiddhīti āha “pīṭhasappīnaṃ javasampadā
analyzed: iddhipāda bhāvanā vasena sa ati saya ñāṇa java sampatti siddhī iti āha pīṭha sappīnam java sampadā
translated: The success in the attainment of the higher knowledge of speed through the development of the bases of success is the reason why the king’s seat was comfortable.

original: caturiddhipādapaṭilābhassa pubbanimitta”nti. Supaṭṭanasampāpuṇanaṃ catupaṭisambhidādhigamassa🔽pubbanimittaṃ. Atthādianurūpaṃ atthādīsu sampaṭipattibhāvato. Ratanānaṃ sakatejobhāsitattaṃ
analyzed: catur iddhipāda paṭilābhassa pubba nimittan ti su paṭṭana sampāpuṇanam catu paṭisambhidā adhigamassa  pubba nimittam attha ādi anurūpam attha ādīsu sampaṭipatti bhāvataḥ rata nānam saka tejaḥ bhāsi tattam
translated: The success in the acquisition of the four discriminations is the reason why the king reached Supaṭṭhāna.

original: yaṃ lokassa dhammobhāsaṃ dassessati, tena tassa sakatejobhāsitattassa pubbanimittaṃ.
analyzed: yam lokassa dhamma ubhāsam dassessati tena tassa saka tejaḥ bhāsita ttassa pubba nimittam
translated: The reason why the sun and moon shone forth with the radiance of his chariot is that he will show the light of the Dhamma to the world.

original: Catubrahmavihārapaṭilābhassa pubbanimittaṃ tassa sabbaso veravūpasamanato. Ekādasaagginibbāpanassa
analyzed: catu brahmavihāra paṭilābhassa pubba nimittam tassa sabbasas vera vūpasamanataḥ ekādasa aggi nibbāpanassa
translated: The reason why he completely pacified all enmity is that he will attain the four divine abodes.🔽The reason why he extinguished the eleven fires is that he will extinguish the eleven fires of the world.

original: pubbanimittaṃ dunnibbāpananibbānabhāvato. Ñāṇālokādassanassa pubbanimittaṃ anāloke🔽ālokadassanabhāvato. Nibbānarasenāti kilesānaṃ nibbāyanarasena. Ekarasabhāvassāti
analyzed: pubba nimittam dunnibbāpana nibbāna bhāvataḥ ñāṇa ālokā dassanassa pubba nimittam an āloke  āloka dassana bhāvataḥ nibbāna rasena ati kilesānam nibbāyana rasena ekarasa bhāvassa ati
translated: The first sign of the light of knowledge is the appearance of the light of knowledge in the darkness of ignorance.🔽The first sign of the nibbana-taste is the appearance of the taste of nibbana in the world.

original: sāsanassa sabbattha ekarasabhāvassa, tañca kho amadhurassa lokassa sabbaso madhurabhāvāpādanena.
analyzed: sāsanassa sabbattha eka rasa bhāvassa tat ca kho amadhurassa lokassa sabbasas madhura bhāva āpādanena
translated: The first sign of the single taste is the appearance of the single taste of the Dispensation everywhere. And that is the appearance of the sweet taste everywhere in the world which is by nature unsweet.

original: Dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhigatabhindanassa pubbanimittaṃ sabbaso diṭṭhigatavātāpanayanavasena.
analyzed: dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi gata bhindanassa pubba nimittam sabbasas diṭṭhi gata vāta apanayana vasena
translated: The first sign of the shattering of the sixty-two views is the removal of the heat of the views.

original: Ākāsādiappatiṭṭhavisamacañcalaṭṭhānaṃ pahāya sakuṇānaṃ pathavigamanaṃ tādisaṃ micchāgāhaṃ🔽pahāya sattānaṃ pāṇehi ratanattayasaraṇagamanassa pubbanittaṃ. Bahujanakantatāyāti
analyzed: ākāsa ādi appatiṭṭha visama cañcala ṭṭhānam pahāya sakuṇānam pathavi gamanam tādisam micchāgāham  pahāya sattānam pāṇehi rata nattaya saraṇa gamanassa pubba nittam bahu jana kanta tāya ati
translated: The first sign of the going for refuge in the Triple Gem with the body is the birds’ going to the earth after abandoning the unstable, uneven, and insecure places such as the sky, etc.

original: candassa viya bahujanassa kantatāya. Sūriyassa uṇhasītavivajjitautusukhatā pariḷāhavivajjitakāyikacetasikasukhappattiyā
analyzed: candassa viya bahu janassa kanta tāya sūriyassa uṇha sīta vivajjita otu sukha tā pariḷāha vivajjita kāyika cetasika sukha ppattiyā
translated: The first sign of the Triple Gem’s being dear to many people is the moon’s being dear to many people. The attainment of bodily and mental happiness free from heat and cold is the attainment of happiness free from the defilements.

original: pubbanimittaṃ. Devatānaṃ apphoṭanādīhi kīḷanaṃ pamoduppatti bhavantagamanena, dhammasabhāvabodhanena
analyzed: pubba nimittam devatānam apphoṭana ādīhi kīḷanam pamā uduppatti bhavanta gamanena dhamma sabhā avabodhanena
translated: The first of these is the sign heralding the arising of the rapture that comes from the gods’ playing and rejoicing with one by slapping their arms and so on, from one’s going to the divine world, and from one’s understanding of the nature of dhammas.🔽The second is the sign heralding the arising of rapture by means of the utterance of the expression of appreciation.

original: ca udānavasena pamodavibhāvanassa pubbanimittaṃ. Dhammavegavassanassāti desanāñāṇavegena🔽dhammāmatassa vassanassa pubbanimittaṃ. Kāyagatāsativasena laddhaṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ🔽katvā uppāditamaggaphalasukhānubhavo kāyagatāsatiamatapaṭilābho, tassa pana kāyassāpi
analyzed: ca udāna vasena pamoda vibhāvanassa pubba nimittam dhamma vega vassanassa ati desanā ñāṇa vegena  dhamma āmatassa vassanassa pubba nimittam kāya gata asati vasena laddham jhānam pādakam  katvā uppādita magga phala sukha anubhavaḥ kāya gata asati amata paṭilābho tassa pana kāyassa api
translated: The third is the sign heralding the pouring of the deathless by means of the rain of the Dhamma, that is, by means of the knowledge of teaching.🔽The fourth is the attainment of the deathless by means of mindfulness occupied with the body, which is the experiencing of the bliss of the path and fruition arisen by making the jhāna obtained by means of mindfulness occupied with the body the basis. The sign heralding this is the absence of the affliction of hunger and thirst, since the body is refreshed by the bliss of the deathless.

original: atappakasukhāvahattā khudāpipāsāpīḷanābhāvo pubbanimittaṃ vutto. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃpana
analyzed: atappaka sukha āvaha ttā khudā pipāsā pīḷana abhāvaḥ pubba nimittam vuttaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam pana
translated: But in the commentary the sign heralding the attainment of the deathless is given as the absence of hunger and thirst.

original: khudaṃ, pipāsañca bhinditvā vuttaṃ. Tattha pubbanimittānaṃ bhedo visesasāmaññavibhāgena,
analyzed: khudam pipāsam ca bhinditvā vuttam tattha pubba nimittānam bhedaḥ visesa sāmañña vibhāgena
translated: Herein, the distinction between the signs should be understood by the analysis of their particular and general characteristics,

original: gobalībaddañāyena ca gahetabbo. “Sayamevā”ti padaṃ “aṭṭhaṅgikamaggadvāravivaraṇassā”ti
analyzed: ca gahetabbo sayam eva ati padam aṭṭhaṅgika magga dvāra vivaraṇassa ati
translated: and by the way in which they are grasped by the ordinary man and the noble disciple. The word “himself” in the words “he himself” is to be construed with “the exposition of the door of the path with eight factors.”

original: etthāpi ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. Bharitabhāvassāti paripuṇṇabhāvassa. “Ariyaddhajamālāmālitāyāti
analyzed: ettha api ānetvā sambandhitabbam bharita bhāvassa ati paripuṇṇa bhāvassa ariyat dhaja mālā māli tāya ati
translated: Here too it should be brought in and connected. “For the sake of the fullness of his being”: for the sake of the fullness of his perfection. “Wearing the garland of the noble banner”:

original: kāsāyaddhajamālāvantatāyā”ti keci, sadevakassa lokassa pana ariyamaggabojjhaṅgaddhajamālāhi
analyzed: kāsāyat haja mālāvanta tāya ati keci sa devakassa lokassa pana ariya magga bojjhaṅgat haja mālāhi
translated: Some say that he was wearing the garland of the yellow banner. But this is the foretoken of the garland of the noble path and its factors of enlightenment,

original: mālibhāvassa pubbanimittaṃ. Yaṃ panettha anuddhaṭaṃ, taṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: māli bhāvassa pubba nimittam yam pana ittha anuddhaṭam tam su viññeyyam eva
translated: which he will wear as the banner of the world with its gods. What has not been explained here is easy to understand.

original: Etthāti “sampatijāto”tiādinā āgate imasmiṃ vāre. Vissajjitova, tasmā amhehi idha🔽apubbaṃ vattabbaṃ natthīti adhippāyo. Tadā pathaviyaṃ gacchantopi mahāsatto ākāsena🔽gacchanto viya mahājanassa tathā upaṭṭhāsīti ayamettha niyati dhammaniyāmo bodhisattānaṃ🔽dhammatā ti idaṃ niyativādavasena kathanaṃ. Pubbe purimajātīsu tādisassa puññasambhārakammassa
analyzed: ettha iti sampati jātaḥ iti ādinā āgate imasmin vāre vissajjitaḥ uva tasmai amhehi idha  apubbam vattabbam na atthi iti adhippāyaḥ tadā pathaviyam gacchantaḥ api mahāsatto ākāsena  gacchantaḥ viya mahājanassa tathā upaṭṭhāsi iti ayam ettha niyati dhamma niyāmaḥ bodhisattānam  dhamma tā ti idam niyati vāda vasena kathanam pubbe purima jātīsu tādisassa puñña sambhāra kammassa
translated: “Here”: in this section beginning with “As soon as he was born.” “He was set free”: therefore we have nothing new to say here.🔽The intention is that when the Great Being walked on the earth, he appeared to the people as if he were walking in the sky. This is the fixed rule, the natural law, the regularity of the Buddhas.

original: katattā upacitattā mahājanassa tathā upaṭṭhāsīti idaṃ pubbekatakammavādavasena kathanaṃ.
analyzed: kata ttā upacita ttā mahājanassa tathā upaṭṭhāsi iti idam pubbekata kamma vāda vasena kathanam
translated: This is the explanation in terms of the doctrine of fate. “Because he had previously, in his previous births, done and accumulated such kamma consisting of the requisites of enlightenment,” this is the explanation in terms of one’s own previous kamma.

original: Imesaṃ sattānaṃ upari īsanasīlatāya yathāsakaṃ kammameva issaro nāma, tassa nimmānaṃ
analyzed: imesam sattānam upari īsana sīla tāya yathāsakam kammam eva issaraḥ nāma tassa nimmānam
translated: The kamma of these beings is called “lord” in the sense of being their ruler, since it creates them in accordance with their respective kamma.

original: attano phalassa nibbattanaṃ mahāpurisopi sadevakaṃ lokaṃ abhibhavituṃ samatthena
analyzed: attanaḥ phalassa nibbattanam mahā purisaḥ api sa devakam lokam abhibhavitum samatthena
translated: The Great Man was born with a great meritorious kamma that enabled him to surpass the world with its gods.

original: uḷārena puññakammena nibbattito, tena issarena nimmito nāma, tassa cāyaṃ nimmānaviseso,
analyzed: uḷārena puñña kammena nibbattitaḥ tena issarena nimmitaḥ nāma tassa ca ayam nimmāna viseso
translated: Therefore he is called “created by a lord,” and this is the special creation of that lord,

original: yadidaṃ mahānubhāvatā, yāya mahājanassa tathā upaṭṭhāsīti idaṃ issaranimmānavasena🔽kathanaṃ. Evaṃ taṃ taṃ bahulaṃ vatvā kiṃ imāya pariyāyakathāyāti avasāne ujukameva
analyzed: yat idam mahā anubhāva tā mahājanassa tathā upaṭṭhāsi iti idam issara nimmāna vasena  evam tam tam bahulam vatvā kim imāya avasāne ujukam eva
translated: namely, his greatness, by which he was so helpful to the people. This is the explanation🔽by way of creation by a lord. After speaking in this way in various ways, he concluded by saying,

original: byākari. Sampatijāto pathaviyaṃ kathaṃ padasā gacchati, evaṃ mahānubhāvo ākāsena🔽maññe gacchatīti parikappanavasena ākāsena gacchanto viya ahosi. Sīghataraṃ pana
analyzed: sampati jātaḥ pathaviyam katham padasā gacchati evam mahā anubhāvaḥ ākāsena  maññe gacchati iti parikappana vasena ākāsena gacchantaḥ viya ahosi sīghataram pana
translated: “What is the use of this roundabout talk?” He was born and immediately walked on the earth with his feet. But he was so great that he seemed to walk🔽through the air. He seemed to walk through the air because he was thought to be walking through the air. But he was seen walking with a stride of seven

original: sattapadavītihārena gatattā dissamānarūpopi mahājanassa adissamāno viya ahosi. Acelakabhāvo,
analyzed: satta padavī tihārena gata ttā dissamāna rūpaḥ api mahājanassa a dissamānaḥ viya ahosi acelaka bhāvaḥ
translated: steps because he walked more quickly.

original: khuddakasarīratā ca tādisassa iriyāpathassa na anucchavikāti kammānubhāvasañjanitapāṭihāriyavasena
analyzed: khuddaka sarīra tā ca tādisassa iriyāpathassa na anucchavikā ati kamma anubhāva sañjanita pāṭihāriya vasena
translated: and the smallness of his body was not suitable for such deportment. So he should be understood to have been attended upon by the great crowd as if he were a marvel produced by the power of kamma,

original: alaṅkatapaṭiyatto viya, soḷasavassuddesiko viya ca mahājanassa upaṭṭhāsīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: alaṅkata paṭiyattaḥ viya soḷasa vassuddesikaḥ viya ca mahājanassa upaṭṭhāsi iti veditabbam
translated: as if he were a statue set up in a shrine, as if he were sixteen years old.🔽But it was only by the power of the Great Being’s merit that he was attended upon in this way at that time.

original: Mahāsattassa puññānubhāvena tadā tathā upaṭṭhānamattamevetanti. Pacchā bāladārakova
analyzed: mahāsattassa puñña anubhāvena tadā tathā pacchā bāla dārakaḥ uva
translated: Afterwards he was like a foolish child,🔽and he was not like that.

original: ahosi, na tādisoti. Buddhabhāvānucchavikassa bodhisattānubhāvassa yāthāvato paveditattā
analyzed: ahosi na tādisaḥ ti buddha bhāva ānucchavikassa bodhisatta anubhāvassa yāthāvataḥ pavedita ttā
translated: And because the power of the Great Being, which was suitable to his state as a Buddha, was properly proclaimed,

original: parisā cassa byākaraṇena buddhena viya…pe… attamanā ahosi.
analyzed: parisā cassa byākaraṇena buddhena viyape attamanāḥ ahosi
translated: the assembly was satisfied with the explanation as if with a Buddha.

original: Sabbadhammatāti sabbā soḷasavidhāpi yathāvuttā dhammatā sabbabodhisattānaṃ hontīti veditabbā puññañāṇasambhāradassanena nesaṃ ekasadisattā.
analyzed: sabba dhamma tā ti sabbā soḷasavidhā api yathā vuttā dhamma tā sabba bodhisattānam honti iti veditabbā puñña ñāṇa sambhāra dassanena nesam eka sadisa ttā
translated: All dhammas: all the sixteen kinds of dhammas mentioned above should be understood as the dhammas of all Bodhisattas, because of their equality in the accumulation of merit and knowledge.

original: Dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇavaṇṇanā
translated: The Thirty-two Characteristics of a Great Man

original: 33. Dukūlacumbaṭaketi daharassa nipajjanayogyatāvasena paṭisaṃhaṭadukūlasukhume.
analyzed: dukūla cumbaṭaka iti daharassa nipajjana yogya tā vasena paṭisaṃhaṭa dukūla su khume
translated: Soft and tender like a tuft of cotton: soft and tender like cotton wool, which is made up of the fine filaments of the cotton plant, and is suitable for a baby to lie on.

original: “Khattiyo brāhmaṇo”ti evamādi jāti. “Koṇḍañño gotamo”ti evamādi gottaṃ. “Poṇikā cikkhallikā
analyzed: khattiyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ti evamādi jāti koṇḍaññaḥ gotamo ti evamādi gottam poṇikā cikkhallikā
translated: “Khattiya, brahmin” , etc., is birth. “Koṇḍañña, Gotama” , etc., is clan. “The Poṇikas, the Ckhallikas,

original: sākiyā koḷiyā”ti evamādi kulapadeso. Ādi-saddena rūpissariyaparivārādisabbasampattiyo
analyzed: sākiyā koḷiyā ti evamādi kula padesaḥ ādi saddena rūpi ssariya parivāra ādi sabba sampattiyaḥ
translated: the Sakyans, the Koḷiyans” , etc., is the designation of family. The word “etc.” includes all the kinds of excellence such as beauty, fame, retinue, etc.

original: saṅgaṇhāti. Mahantassāti vipulassa, uḷārassāti attho. Nipphattiyoti siddhiyo. Gantabbagatiyāti
analyzed: saṅgaṇhāti mahantassa āti vipulassa uḷārassa ati atthaḥ nipphattiyā ti siddhiyā gantabba gatiyā ati
translated: “Great” means extensive, abundant is the meaning. “Achievement” means success. “The goal to be reached”

original: gati-saddassa kammasādhanatamāha. Upapajjanavasena hi sucaritaduccaritehi gantabbāti
analyzed: gati saddassa kamma sādhanatam āha upapajjana vasena hi su carita duccaritehi gantabbā ati
translated: shows that the word “goal” is the object. For the good and bad conduct are to be reached by rebirth,

original: gatiyo, upapattibhavaviseso. Gacchati yathāruci pavattatīti gati, ajjhāsayo. Paṭisaraṇeti
analyzed: upapatti bhava visesaḥ gacchati yathāruci pavattati iti gati ajjhāsayo paṭisaraṇā iti
translated: therefore they are called “goals” . The special kind of rebirth-existence is the goal. “The goal” is the inclination, because it goes , it occurs according to inclination. “The refuge”

original: parāyaṇe avassaye. Sabbasaṅkhatavisaṃyuttassa hi arahato nibbānameva taṃpaṭisaraṇaṃ. Tyāhanti te ahaṃ.
analyzed: parāyaṇe avassaye sabba saṅkhata visaṃyuttassa hi arahataḥ nibbānam eva tat paṭisaraṇam te aham
translated: is the ultimate resort, the reliance. For the Arahant, who is free from all conditioned things, only Nibbāna is his refuge. “I say to you” : I tell you.

original: Dasavidhe kusaladhamme, agarahite ca rājadhamme niyuttoti dhammiko. Tena ca dhammena
analyzed: dasavidhe kusala dhamme aga rahite ca rāja dhamme niyuttaḥ ti dhammikaḥ tena ca dhammena
translated: “In the ten kinds of profitable things and in the ten royal virtues” . He is “righteous” because he is devoted to the ten kinds of profitable things and to the ten royal virtues. And by that righteousness

original: sakalaṃ lokaṃ rañjetīti dhammarājā. Yasmā cakkavattī dhammena ñāyena rajjaṃ adhigacchati,
analyzed: sakalam lokam rañjeti iti dhamma rājā yasmā cakkavattī dhammena ñāyena rajjam adhigacchati
translated: He delights the whole world, thus he is a “Dhammaraja.” Since a world-ruling monarch obtains his kingship by the Dhamma, by justice,

original: na adhammena, tasmā vuttaṃ “dhammena laddharajjattā dhammarājā”ti. Catūsu disāsu
analyzed: na adhammena tasmā vuttam dhammena laddha rajjattā dhamma rājā ati catūsu disāsu
translated: not by injustice, it is said: “He is a Dhammaraja because he has obtained his kingship by the Dhamma.”

original: samuddapariyosānatāya caturantā nāma tattha tattha dīpe mahāpathavīti āha “puratthima…pe…🔽issaro”ti. Vijitāvīti vijetabbassa vijitavā, kāmakodhādikassa abbhantarassa, paṭirājabhūtassa
analyzed: samudda pariyosāna tāya catur antā nāma tattha tattha dīpe mahā pathavī iti āha puratthimape  vijitāvī iti vijetabbassa vijitavā kāma kodha ādikassa abbhantarassa paṭirāja bhūtassa
translated: The four continents are so called because they are surrounded by oceans on all four sides. The great land-mass in each of these continents is called a “subcontinent.”🔽He is a “lord” of these.

original: bāhirassa ca arigaṇassa vijayi, vijetvā ṭhitoti attho. Kāmaṃ cakkavattino kenaci
analyzed: bāhirassa ca ari gaṇassa vijayi vijetvā ṭhitaḥ ti attho kāmam cakkavattino kenacid
translated: He is a “conqueror” because he has conquered what is to be conquered, that is, the internal enemies such as lust and hatred, and the external enemies such as rival kings and robber tribes. The meaning is that he has conquered and is established.

original: yuddhaṃ nāma natthi, yuddhena pana sādhetabbassa vijayassa siddhiyā “vijitasaṅgāmo”ti
analyzed: yuddham nāma na atthi yuddhena pana sādhetabbassa vijayassa siddhiyā vijita saṅgāmaḥ ti
translated: Although a world-ruling monarch has no war with anyone, it is said that he is “victorious in battle” because he has achieved victory, which is to be accomplished by war.🔽The people have become his servants,

original: vuttaṃ. Janapadova catubbidhaacchariyadhammādisamannāgate asmiṃ rājini thāvariyaṃ
analyzed: vuttam janapadaḥ uva catubbidha acchariya dhamma ādi samannāgate asmim rājini thāvariyam
translated: unshakable, unassailable, and firm, because of the four kinds of marvelous qualities possessed by this king.

original: kenaci asaṃhāriyaṃ daḷhaṃ bhattabhāvaṃ patto, janapade vā attano dhammikāya paṭipattiyā
analyzed: kenaci asaṃhāriyam daḷham bhatta bhāvam pattaḥ janapade vā attanaḥ dhammikāya paṭipattiyā
translated: Or else, because of his righteous conduct, he has become a lord of the people.

original: thāvariyaṃ thirabhāvaṃ pattoti janapadatthāvariyappatto. Manussānaṃ ure satthaṃ ṭhapetvā
analyzed: thāvariyam thira bhāvam patto ti janapada thāvariya ppatto manussānam sattham ṭhapetvā
translated: He has attained stability, firmness, in the sense of being the support of the country, for he is the support of the country.

original: icchitadhanaharaṇādinā parasāhasakāritāya sāhasikā.
analyzed: icchita dhana haraṇa ādinā para sāhasa kāritāya sāhasikā
translated: He is a robber because he robs others by the use of force, taking their desired wealth, etc.

original: Ratijananaṭṭhenāti atappakapītisomanassuppādanena. Saddatthato pana rametīti ratanaṃ.🔽“Aho manohara”nti citte kattabbatāya cittīkataṃ. “Svāyaṃ cittīkāro tassa pūjanīyatāyā”ti
analyzed: rati janana ṭṭhena āti atappaka pīti so manassa uppādanena saddatthataḥ pana rameti iti ratanam  aho manoharanti citte kattabba tāya cittīkatam su ayam cittīkāro tassa pūjanīya tāya ati
translated: It is a delight because it gives rise to the rapture, happiness, and exaltation of non-remorse. But in the sense of the meaning of the word sutta, it is a delight because one delights in it.🔽It is a wonder because it causes the thought “Oh, how beautiful!” to arise in the mind.🔽They say that the meaning of “wonder” is “venerability,” for it is to be venerated.

original: cittīkatanti pūjanīyanti atthaṃ vadanti. Mahantaṃ vipulaṃ aparimitaṃ mūlaṃ agghatīti🔽mahagghaṃ. Natthi etassa tulā upamāti atulaṃ, asadisaṃ. Kadāci eva uppajjanato dukkhena
analyzed: cittīkatanti pūjanīyanti attham vadanti mahantam vipulam aparimitam mūlam agghati iti  mahaggham na atthi etassa tulā upamā ati atulam asadisam kadāci eva uppajjanataḥ dukkhena
translated: It is of great value because its value is great, extensive, and immeasurable.🔽It is priceless because it has no price, no comparison.🔽It is difficult to see because it is obtained with difficulty,

original: laddhabbattā dullabhadassanaṃ. Anomehi uḷāraguṇeheva sattehi paribhuñjitabbato anomasattaparibhogaṃ.
