original: kāmarāgarūparāgādibhedā sabbepi kilesabhūtā rāgā, sabbepi vā kilesā idha kilesarāgāti
analyzed: kāma rāga rūpa rāga ādi bhedā sabbe api kilesa bhūtā rāgā sabbe api vā kilesā idha kilesa rāgā ati
translated: All defilements, such as lust for sense desires, lust for form, etc., or all the defilements, are here called “defilement-lust,”

original: veditabbā, na lobhavisesā eva cittassa viparītabhāvāpādanato. Yathāha “rattampi cittaṃ🔽vipariṇataṃ, duṭṭhampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ, mūḷhampi cittaṃ vipariṇata”nti virajjantīti
analyzed: veditabbā na lobha visesāḥ eva cittassa viparīta bhāva āpādanataḥ yathā āha rattam pi cittam  vipariṇatam duṭṭham pi cittam vipariṇatam mūḷham api cittam vipariṇatanti virajjanti iti
translated: not just the different kinds of greed, because they cause the mind to be perverted. As it is said: “A lustful mind is perverted, a hating mind is perverted, a deluded mind is perverted” .

original: attano sabhāvaṃ vijahanti. Sabbaṃ dukkhanti jarāmaraṇādibhedaṃ sabbaṃ vaṭṭadukkhaṃ.🔽Bhavena bhavanti tena tena bhavena bhavantaraṃ. Bhavanikantibhāvena saṃsibbati, phalena
analyzed: attanaḥ sabhāvam vijahanti sabbam dukkhanti jarā maraṇa ādi bhedam sabbam vaṭṭa dukkham  bhavena bhavanti tena tena bhavena bhavantaram bhava nikanti bhāvena saṃsibbati phalena
translated: “They become dispassionate” : they abandon their own nature. “All suffering” : all the suffering of the round of rebirths, classed as aging-and-death, etc.🔽“By becoming” : by means of becoming, they become another becoming. “By clinging to becoming” : by the state of clinging to becoming, they are bound up with kamma and its result, because one who has craving becomes a being in the future by means of kamma.

original: vā saddhiṃ kammaṃ sataṇhasseva āyatiṃ punabbhavabhāvato. Tato vānato nikkhantaṃ tattha🔽tassa sabbaso abhāvato. Ciranisajjācirabhāsanehi piṭṭhiāgilāyanatālugalasosādivasena
analyzed: vā saddhim kammam āyatim punabbhava bhāvato tatas vā anataḥ nikkhantam tattha  tassa sabbasas abhāvato cira nisajja a cira bhāsanehi piṭṭhiā gilāyana tālu gala sosa ādi vasena
translated: “From that” : from that, from the state of being bound up with kamma and its result. “Having gone forth” : having gone forth from that, because of the complete absence of that.

original: kāyakilamatho ceva kāyavihesā ca veditabbā. Sā ca kho desanāya atthaṃ ajānantānaṃ,
analyzed: kāya kilamatho ca iva kāya vihesā ca veditabbā sā ca kho desanāya attham a jānantānam
translated: “Physical fatigue and mental worry” should be understood as physical fatigue and mental worry due to the fatigue of the body and the fatigue of the mind, respectively, in the teaching of the long and the short, in the teaching of the deep and the shallow, in the teaching of the backache and the sore throat, etc.🔽And that is for those who do not understand the meaning of the teaching,

original: appaṭipajjantānañca vasena, jānantānaṃ, pana paṭipajjantānañca desanāya kāyaparissamopi
analyzed: appaṭipajjantānam ca vasena jānantānam pana paṭipajjantānam ca desanāya kāya parissamaḥ pi
translated: and in the case of those who do not practice, and in the case of those who practice knowing, the Teacher’s body is not wearied by teaching.

original: satthu aparissamova. Tenāha bhagavā “na ca maṃ dhammādhikaraṇaṃ vihesesī”ti. Tathā
analyzed: satthu aparissamaḥ uva tena āha bhagavā na ca mama dhamma adhikaraṇam vihesesi iti tathā
translated: Therefore the Blessed One said: “But you should not trouble me with questions on the Dhamma.”

original: hi vuttaṃ “yā ajānantānaṃ desanā nāma, so mama kilamatho assā”ti. Ubhayanti cittakilamatho,
analyzed: hi vuttam yā a jānantānam desanā nāma saḥ mama kilamathaḥ assa ati ubhayanti citta kilamatho
translated: For it was said: “That which is called teaching for those who do not know is my fatigue.”

original: cittavihesā cāti ubhayaṃ petaṃ buddhānaṃ natthi, bodhimūleyeva samucchinnattā.
analyzed: citta vihesā ca ati ubhayam petam buddhānam natthi bodhi mūleya iva
translated: Both: both mental fatigue and mental trouble are absent in the Buddhas, for they were cut off at the root at the foot of the Bodhi Tree.🔽“Anubrūhanaṃ sampindanaṃ” means “repetition and summarizing.”

original: 65. Anubrūhanaṃ sampiṇḍanaṃ. Soti “apissū”ti nipāto. Vipassinti paṭi-saddayogena
analyzed: anubrūhanam sampiṇḍanam saḥ ti nipātaḥ vipassin ti paṭisadda yogena
translated: “So” is a particle. “Vipassissa” means “of Vipassi.” The prefix paṭi is used in the sense of lordship.

original: sāmiatthe upayogavacananti āha “vipassissā”ti. Vuddhippattā acchariyā vā anacchariyā.
analyzed: sāmi atthe upayoga vacananti āha vipassissa ati vuddhi ppattā acchariyā vā an acchariyā
translated: “Vipassissa” is said. They are either extraordinary or not extraordinary.🔽The letter a is used in the sense of increase, as in “asekkhā dhammā” .

original: Vuddhiatthopi hi akāro hoti yathā“asekkhā dhammā”ti. Kappānaṃ cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni
analyzed: vuddhi atthaḥ pi hi akāraḥ hoti yathā asekkhāḥ dhammā ti kappānam cattāri asaṅkhyeyyāni
translated: For four incalculables and a hundred thousand eons,

original: satasahassañca sadevakassa lokassa dhammasaṃvibhāgakaraṇatthameva pāramiyo pūretvā
analyzed: sata sahassam ca sa devakassa lokassa dhamma saṃvibhāga karaṇa ttham eva pāramiyaḥ pūretvā
translated: he fulfilled the pāramīs only for the sake of sharing the Dhamma with the world of gods and humans.

original: idāni samadhigatadhammarājassa tattha appossukkatāpattidīpanatā, gāthātthassa acchariyatā,
analyzed: idāni samadhigata dhamma rājassa tattha appossukka tā āpatti dīpana tā gāthā atthassa acchariya tā
translated: Now, the meaning of the verse should be understood as follows: the Blessed One shows how, after attaining the supreme state of a Dhamma King, he was able to abide in ease; the marvel of the meaning of the verse;

original: tassa vuddhippatti cāti veditabbā. Atthadvārena hi gāthānaṃ anacchariyatā. Gocarā
analyzed: tassa vuddhi ppatti ca ati veditabbā attha dvārena hi gāthānam anacchariya tā gocarā
translated: and the way in which his virtue was enhanced. For the marvel of the verse lies in its meaning, not in its words.🔽“They became his attendants”: they became his attendants in the sense of being worthy of being attended upon.

original: ahesunti upaṭṭhahiṃsu. Upaṭṭhānañca vitakketabbatāvāti āha “parivitakkayitabbataṃ pāpuṇiṃsū”ti.
analyzed: ahesunti upaṭṭhahiṃsu upaṭṭhānam ca vitakketabba tā vā iti āha parivitakkayitabba tam pāpuṇiṃsu iti
translated: “They became worthy of being reflected upon”: they became worthy of being reflected upon in the sense of being worthy of being attended upon.

original: Yadi sukhāpaṭipadāva kathaṃ kicchatāti āha “pāramīpūraṇakāle”tiādi. Evamādīni duppariccajāni
analyzed: yadi katham āha pāramī pūraṇa kāla itiādi evamādīni duppariccajāni
translated: “If the way of practice is pleasant, why is it difficult?” The answer is: “At the time of fulfilling the pāramīs.” These and similar statements are difficult to understand.

original: dentassa. Ha-iti vā byattanti etasmiṃ atthe nipāto, “ekaṃsatthe”ti keci. Ha byattaṃ,
analyzed: dentassa ha eti vā byattanti etasmin atthe nipātaḥ ekaṃsatthā iti keci ha byattam
translated: “Ha” is an indeclinable particle meaning “indeed.” Some say that it means “one-sidedly.” “Ha byattaṃ” means “indeed it is so.”

original: ekaṃsena vā alaṃ nippayojanaṃ evaṃ kicchena adhigatassa dhammassa desetunti yojanā.
analyzed: ekaṃsena vā alam nippayojanam evam kicchena adhigatassa dhammassa desetun ti yojanā
translated: “Ekaṃsena vā alaṃ nippayojanaṃ” means “one-sidedly it is useless.” The construction is: “It is difficult to teach the Dhamma that was attained with difficulty.”

original: Halanti “ala”nti iminā samānatthaṃ padaṃ “halanti vadāmī”tiādīsu viya. Rāgadosaphuṭṭhehīti
analyzed: iminā samāna attham padam vadāmi itiādīsu rāga dosa phuṭṭhehi iti
translated: “Halanti” is a word synonymous with “ala” .

original: phuṭṭhavisena viya sappena rāgena, dosena ca samphuṭṭhehi abhibhūtehi. Rāgadosānugatehīti
analyzed: phuṭṭha visena viya sappena rāgena dosena ca samphuṭṭhehi abhibhūtehi rāga dosa anugatehi iti
translated: As if touched by a snake, by lust and hate that have touched and overwhelmed them. With lust and hate following after them:

original: rāgadosehi anubandhehi.
analyzed: rāga dosehi anubandhehi
translated: With lust and hate pursuing them.

original: Niccādīnanti niccaggāhādīnaṃ. Evaṃ gatanti evaṃ pavattaṃ aniccādiākārena pavattaṃ.
analyzed: nicca ādīnam ti nicca ggāha ādīnam evam gatam iti evam pavattam anicca ādi ākārena pavattam
translated: With the views of permanence, etc., : with the misinterpretations of permanence, etc. Thus gone: thus occurred, occurred in the mode of impermanence, etc.

original: “Catusaccadhamma”nti idaṃ aniccādīsu, saccesu ca yathālābhavasena gahetabbaṃ. Evaṃ
analyzed: catu sacca dhamman ti idam anicca ādīsu saccesu ca yathā lābha vasena gahetabbam evam
translated: The Dhamma of the Four Truths: this should be taken in regard to the impermanent, etc., and the truths, respectively, according to the context.🔽Thus gone: thus gone by me and by other Perfectly Enlightened Ones, having penetrated it by way of the definite conclusion “impermanent, etc.”;🔽the meaning is, thus known and penetrated. They are infatuated with sensual lust and with lust for continued existence. Because their minds are covered by the hindrances,🔽they are infatuated with the lust for views. Because of their adherence to perversions, they will not see this Dhamma as it really is; they will not penetrate it.

original: gatanti vā evaṃ “anicca”ntiādinā abhinivisitvā mayā, aññehi ca sammāsambuddhehi gataṃ,
analyzed: gatanti vā evam anicca nti ādinā abhinivisitvā mayā aññehi ca sammāsambuddhehi gatam
translated: Thus gone: thus occurred, occurred in the mode of impermanence, etc. Thus gone: thus gone by me and by other Perfectly Enlightened Ones, having penetrated it by way of the definite conclusion “impermanent, etc.”;

original: ñātaṃ paṭividdhanti attho. Kāmarāgena, bhavarāgena ca rattā nīvaraṇehi nivutacittatāya,
analyzed: ñātam paṭividdhanti kāma rāgena bhava rāgena ca rattāḥ nīvaraṇehi nivuta citta tāya
translated: the meaning is, thus known and penetrated. They are infatuated with sensual lust and with lust for continued existence. Because their minds are covered by the hindrances,🔽they are infatuated with the lust for views. Because of their adherence to perversions, they will not see this Dhamma as it really is; they will not penetrate it.🔽Thus gone: thus occurred, occurred in the mode of impermanence, etc. Thus gone: thus gone by me and by other Perfectly Enlightened Ones, having penetrated it by way of the definite conclusion “impermanent, etc.”;🔽the meaning is, thus known and penetrated. They are infatuated with sensual lust and with lust for continued existence. Because their minds are covered by the hindrances,

original: diṭṭhirāgena rattā viparītābhinivesena na dakkhanti yāthāvato imaṃ dhammaṃ nappaṭivijjhissanti.
analyzed: diṭṭhi rāgena rattāḥ viparīta abhinivesena na dakkhanti yāthāvataḥ imam dhammam na paṭivijjhissanti
translated: they are infatuated with the lust for views. Because of their adherence to perversions, they will not see this Dhamma as it really is; they will not penetrate it.🔽Thus gone: thus occurred, occurred in the mode of impermanence, etc. Thus gone: thus gone by me and by other Perfectly Enlightened Ones, having penetrated it by way of the definite conclusion “impermanent, etc.”;

original: Evaṃ gāhāpetunti “anicca”ntiādinā sabhāvena yāthāvato dhamme jānāpetuṃ. Rāgadosaparetatāpi🔽nesaṃ sammūḷhabhāvenevāti āha “tamokhandhena āvuṭā”ti.
analyzed: evam gāhāpetum ti aniccanti ādinā sabhāvena yāthāvataḥ dhamme rāga dosa pareta tā api 🔽sammūḍha bhāvena iva ati āha tamaḥ khandhena
translated: the meaning is, thus known and penetrated. They are infatuated with sensual

original: Dhammadesanāya appossukkatāpattiyā kāraṇaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “kasmā panā”tiādinā sayameva
analyzed: dhamma desanāya appossukka tā āpattiyāḥ kāraṇam vibhāvetum kasmā pana ati ādinā sayam eva
translated: In order to show the reason for the Blessed One’s failure to teach the Dhamma, he himself raises the question, “But why?”

original: codanaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Tattha yathāyaṃ idāni dhammadesanāya appossukkatāpatti sabbabuddhānaṃ🔽āciṇṇasamāciṇṇadhammatāvasena, sabbabodhisattānaṃ ādito “kiṃ me aññātavesenā”tiādinā
analyzed: codanam samuṭṭhāpeti tattha yathā ayam idāni dhamma desanāya appossukka tā āpatti sabba buddhānam  āciṇṇa samāciṇṇa dhamma tā vasena sabba bodhisattānam āditas kim me aññāta vesena ati ādinā
translated: Herein, just as the Blessed One’s failure to teach the Dhamma is a fact of nature that has been realized by all Buddhas,

original: mahābhinīhāre attano cittassa samussāhanaṃ āciṇṇasamāciṇṇadhammatā vāti āha “kiṃ
analyzed: mahā abhinīhāre attano cittassa samussāhanaṃ āciṇṇa samāciṇṇa dhamma tā vā ati āha kim
translated: so too the great aspiration of all Bodhisattvas from the time of their first production of the thought of enlightenment is a fact of nature that has been realized by all Bodhisattvas, namely, the resolution of their minds in the great aspiration, “What is there for me in the unknown state?” That is why he says “What is there for me in the unknown state?”

original: me”tiādi. Tattha aññātavesenāti sadevakaṃ lokaṃ unnādento buddho ahutvā kevalaṃ buddhānaṃ🔽sāvakabhāvūpagamanavasena aññātarūpena. Tividhaṃ kāraṇaṃ appossukkatāpattiyā paṭipakkhassa
analyzed: mā itiādi tattha aññāta vesena ati sa devakam lokam unnādentaḥ buddhaḥ a hutvā kevalam buddhānam  sāvaka bhāva upagamana vasena aññāta rūpena tividham kāraṇam appossukka tā āpattiyā paṭipakkhassa
translated: Herein, in the unknown state means in the state of being unknown, by becoming a Buddha’s disciple in the sense of going forth to become a Buddha’s disciple without being a Buddha who has made the world resound with his fame.

original: balavabhāvo, dhammassa paramagambhīratā, tattha ca bhagavato sātisayaṃ gāravanti
analyzed: balava bhāvaḥ dhammassa parama gambhīra tā tattha ca bhagavato sa atisayam gāravanti
translated: The three reasons for the failure to teach the Dhamma are the strength of the opposite qualities, the extreme profundity of the Dhamma, and the Blessed One’s extreme respect for it.

original: taṃ dassetuṃ “tassa hī”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha paṭipakkhā nāma rāgādayo kilesā sammāpaṭipattiyā
analyzed: tam dassetum tassa hi itiādi āraddham tattha paṭipakkhāḥ nāma rāga ādayo kilesā sammā paṭipattiyā
translated: In order to show these, he says “For if he had taught the Dhamma,” and so on. Herein, the opposite qualities are the defilements of lust, etc.,

original: antarāyakarattā. Tesaṃ balavabhāvato ciraparibhāvanāya sattasantānato dubbisodhiyatāya🔽te satte mattahatthino viya dubbalaṃ purisaṃ ajjhottharitvā anayabyasanaṃ āpādentā
analyzed: tesam balava bhāvataḥ cira paribhāvanāya satta santānataḥ  te satte matta hatthinaḥ viya dubbalam purisam ajjhottharitvā anaya byasanam āpādentā
translated: Because they cause obstruction. And because they are strong, because they have been long cultivated, because they are hard to purify from the continuity of beings,🔽they overwhelm beings like a herd of mad elephants overwhelming a weak man, and they bring them to destruction.

original: anekasatayojanāyāmavitthāraṃ sunicitaṃ ghanasannivesaṃ kaṇṭakaduggampi adhisenti.
analyzed: aneka sata yojana āyāma vitthāram su nicitam ghana sannivesam kaṇṭaka duggam pi adhisenti
translated: They lie heavy on beings, who are like a thicket, a wilderness, a tangle, a net, a snare, a barb, a prison, a chain, a fetter, a yoke, a halter, a burden, a crushing.

original: Dūrappabheda ducchejjatāhi dubbisodhiyataṃ pana dassetuṃ “athassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha🔽ca anto āmaṭṭhatāya kañjikapuṇṇalābu ciraparivāsikatāya takkabharitacāṭi snehatintadubbalabhāvena🔽vasātelapītapilotikā; telamissitatāya añjanamakkhitahatthā dubbisodhanīyā vuttā.🔽Hīnūpamā cetā rūpappabandhabhāvato, acirakālikattā ca malīnatāya, kilesasaṃkileso
analyzed: dūra ppabheda ducchejja tāhi dubbisodhiyatam pana dassetum athassa atiādi vuttam tattha  ca antar āmaṭṭha tāya kañjika puṇṇa lābu cira parivāsika tāya takka bharita cāṭi sneha tinta dubbala bhāvena  vasā tela pīta pilotikā tela missita tāya añjana makkhita hatthā dubbisodhanīyā vuttā  cetā rūpa ppabandha bhāvataḥ ca malīna tāya kilesa saṃkilesaḥ
translated: But the words “Then it is like a gourd” are said to show that it is hard to purify because it is far to go and because it is hard to clean. Herein,🔽the gourd is full of brine because it has been long immersed in it, and the cloth is soaked in oil and grease because it is weak.🔽They are said to be hard to clean because they are smeared with ointment.

original: eva pana dubbisodhanīyataro anādikālikattā, anusayitattā ca. Tenāha “atisaṃkiliṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: eva pana dubbisodhanīyataraḥ anādi kālika ttā ca tena āha ati saṃkiliṭṭhā iti
translated: But defilement and stains are even harder to purify than these, because they are beginningless, and because they lie latent. That is why he said “extremely soiled.”

original: Yathā ca dubbisodhanīyatāya evaṃ gambhīraduddasaduranubodhānampi vuttaupamā hīnūpamāva.
analyzed: yathā ca dubbisodhanīya tāyai evam vuttā aupamā hīnūpamā ava
translated: And just as it is because of the difficulty of cleansing it, so too it is because of the difficulty of penetrating it, of seeing it, of understanding it, that the simile is an inappropriate one.

original: Gambhīropi dhammo paṭipakkhavidhamanena supākaṭo bhaveyya, paṭipakkhavidhamanaṃ pana
analyzed: gambhīraḥ api dhammaḥ paṭipakkha vidhamanena su pākaṭaḥ bhaveyya paṭipakkha vidhamanam pana
translated: For even though the Dhamma is profound, it can be made quite clear by the removal of its opposite, and the removal of the opposite

original: sammāpaṭipattipaṭibaddhaṃ, sā saddhammasavanādhīnā, taṃ satthari, dhamme ca pasādāyattaṃ.
analyzed: sammā paṭipatti paṭibaddham sā saddhamma savana adhīnā tam satthari dhamme ca pasāda āyattam
translated: is bound up with right practice, which in turn depends on hearing the true Dhamma, and that depends on confidence in the Teacher and the Dhamma.

original: So visesato loke sambhāvanīyassa garukātabbassa abhipatthanāhetukoti panāḷikāya sattānaṃ
analyzed: so visesataḥ loke sambhāvanīyassa garu kātabbassa abhipatthanā hetukaḥ ti panāḷikāya sattānam
translated: And that confidence is due to the fact that beings have a natural tendency to honour and respect those who are worthy of such feelings.

original: dhammasampaṭipattiyā brahmayācanādinimittanti taṃ dassento “apicā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: dhamma sampaṭipattiyā brahma yācanā ādi nimittanti tam dassentaḥ apica atiādim āha
translated: So, showing that the practice of the Dhamma by beings is due to the request of Brahmā, etc., he said “Besides, Brahmā” ,

original: 66. “Aññataro”ti appaññāto viya kiñcāpi vuttaṃ, atha kho pākaṭo paññātoti dassetuṃ
analyzed: aññataro ti appaññātaḥ viya kiñcā api vuttam atha kho pākaṭaḥ paññāto ti dassetuṃ
translated: “A certain one” : although this is said as if he were unknown, still it is said in order to show that he was well known and famous.

original: “imasmiṃ cakkavāḷe jeṭṭhakamahābrahmā”ti vuttaṃ. Mahābrahmabhavane jeṭṭhakamahābrahmā.
analyzed: imasmin cakkavāḷe jeṭṭhaka mahābrahmā ati vuttam mahābrahma bhavane jeṭṭhaka mahābrahmā
translated: “The Great Brahmā, the most senior deity in this universe” : in the Brahmā-world.

original: So hi sakko viya kāmadevaloke, brahmaloke ca pākaṭo paññāto. Upakkilesabhūtaṃ appaṃ
analyzed: so hi sakkaḥ viya kāmadeva loke brahma loke ca pākaṭaḥ paññātaḥ upakkilesa bhūtam appam
translated: For he is as well known and famous in the Brahmā-world as Sakka is in the world of the gods of the sense sphere.

original: rāgādirajaṃ etassāti apparajaṃ, apparajaṃ akkhi paññācakkhu yesaṃ te taṃsabhāvāti
analyzed: rāga ādi rajam etassa ati appa rajam appa rajam akkhi paññācakkhu yesam te
translated: and the dust of lust, etc., is little in them, thus they are of little dust; they are of the kind that has little dust in the eye of understanding.

original: katvā apparajakkhajātikāti imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ “paññāmaye”tiādimāha. Appaṃ rāgādirajaṃ
analyzed: katvā apparajakkha jātikā ti imam attham dassetum paññā maya iti ādim āha appam rāga ādi rajam
translated: In order to point out this meaning he says “in the eye of understanding” and so on.

original: yesaṃ te taṃsabhāvā apparajakkhajātikāti evamettha attho veditabbo. Assavanatāti
analyzed: yesam te taṃsa bhāvāḥ appara jakkha jātikā ti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbo a savana tā ti
translated: Those in whom there is little dust of lust, etc., are of the kind that has little dust in the eye. This is how the meaning should be understood here.

original: “sayaṃ abhiññā”tiādīsu viya karaṇe paccattavacananti āha “assavanatāyā”ti. Dasapuññakiriyavatthuvasenāti
analyzed: sayam abhiññā ti ādīsu viya karaṇe paccatta vacananti āha assavana tāya āti dasa puñña kiriya vatthu vasena ati
translated: As to the hearing of the sound: the reflexive pronoun “his” is in the instrumental case as to the hearing of the sound, according to the construction “by the hearing of the sound.”

original: dānādidasavidhavimuttiparipācanīyapuññakiriyavatthūnaṃ vasena. Tenāha “katādhikārā”tiādi.🔽Papañcasūdaniyaṃ pana “dvādasapuññakiriyavasenā”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ dānādīsu saraṇagamanaparahitapariṇāmanadvaya
analyzed: dāna ādi dasavidha vimutti paripācanīya puñña kiriya vatthūnam vasena tena āha kata adhikāra ati ādi  papañcasūdaniyam pana dvādasa puñña kiriya vasena ati vuttam tam dāna ādīsu saraṇa gamana para hita pariṇāmana dvaya
translated: As to the ten bases of meritorious activity: according to the ten bases of meritorious activity consisting in giving, etc., which ripen in the deliverance of full absorption.🔽Hence he says “who have fulfilled their duties” and so on.

original: pakkhipanavasena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pakkhipana vasena vuttam
translated: But in the Papañcasūdanī it is said that it is according to the twelve bases of meritorious activity. That is said according to the inclusion of the two kinds of dedication of merit for the welfare of others among the bases of meritorious activity beginning with giving.

original: 69. Garuṭṭhāniyesu gāravavasena garukarapatthanā ajjhesanā, sāpi atthato patthanā
analyzed: garu ṭhāniyesu gārava vasena garu kara patthanā ajjhesanā sā api atthato patthanā
translated: The earnest wish for the revered state, the request for the revered state, is the earnest wish for the revered state as to those who are worthy of reverence. That too is an earnest wish in meaning.

original: evāti vuttaṃ “yācana”nti. Padesavisayañāṇadassanaṃ hutvā buddhānaṃyeva āveṇikabhāvato
analyzed: eva ati vuttam yācanam ti padesa visaya ñāṇa dassanam hutvā buddhānam yeva āveṇika bhāvato
translated: “ Requesting” is what is said.🔽Because it is the unique property of Buddhas, this pair of kinds of knowledge is called “the Buddha’s eye” .

original: idaṃ ñāṇadvayaṃ “buddhacakkhū”ti vuccatīti āha “imesañhi dvinnaṃ ñāṇānaṃ buddhacakkhūti🔽nāma”nti. Tiṇṇaṃ maggañāṇānanti heṭṭhimānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ maggañāṇānaṃ “dhammacakkhū”ti
analyzed: idam ñāṇa dvayam buddha cakkhu iti vuccati iti āha imesam hi dvinnam ñāṇānam buddha cakkhu iti  nāman ti tiṇṇam magga ñāṇānam ti heṭṭhimānam tiṇṇam magga ñāṇānam dhamma cakkhu iti
translated: “ For these two kinds of knowledge are called the Buddha’s eye” .🔽“ The three kinds of path knowledge” : the three lower kinds of path knowledge are called “the eye of Dhamma” because they are mere seeing, in the sense of seeing the four noble truths.

original: nāmaṃ, catusaccadhammadassananti katvā dassanamattabhāvato. Yato tāni ñāṇāni vijjūpamābhāvena
analyzed: nāmam catu sacca dhamma dassananti katvā dassana matta bhāvataḥ yatas tāni ñāṇāni vijju upamā bhāvena
translated: Since these kinds of knowledge are said to be like lightning flashes,

original: vuttāni, aggamaggañāṇaṃ pana ñāṇakiccassa sikhāppattiyā dassanamattaṃ na hotīti “dhammacakkhū”ti🔽na vuccatīti. Yato taṃ vajirūpamābhāvena vuttaṃ. Vuttanayenevāti “apparajakkhajātikā”ti
analyzed: vuttāni aggamagga ñāṇam pana ñāṇa kiccassa sikhā appattiyā dassana mattam na hoti iti dhammacakkhu iti  na vuccati iti yatas tam vaji rūpam abhāvena vuttam vutta nayena iva ati appara jakkha jātikā ati
translated: the knowledge of the path of the highest fruit is not mere seeing because it has reached the culmination of the function of knowledge. Therefore it is not called “the eye of Dhamma” .🔽Since it is said to be like a diamond.🔽“ In the way stated” : in the way stated in the passage beginning, “Those of little dust on the eyes” .

original: ettha vuttanayeneva. Yasmā mandakilesā “apparajakkhā”ti vuttā, tasmā bahalakilesā
analyzed: ettha vutta nayena iva yasmā manda kilesā apparajakkhā ti vuttā tasmā bahala kilesā
translated: Since those of weak defilements are called “of little dust on the eyes,” those of strong defilements are called “of much dust on the eyes” .

original: “mahārajakkhā”ti veditabbā. Paṭipakkhavidhamanasamatthatāya tikkhāni sūrāni visadāni,🔽vuttavipariyāyena mudūni. Saddhādayo ākārāti saddahanādippakāre vadati. Sundarāti🔽kalyāṇā. Sammohavinodaniyaṃ pana “yesaṃ āsayādayo koṭṭhāsā sundarā, te svākārā”ti
analyzed: mahārajakkhā ati veditabbā paṭipakkha vidhamana samattha tāya tikkhāni sūrāni visadāni  vutta vipariyāyena mudūni saddhā ādayaḥ ākārā ati sat dahana ādi ppakāre vadati sundarā ati  kalyāṇā sammoha vinodaniyam pana yesam āsaya ādayo koṭṭhāsā sundarā te su ākārā ati
translated: They should be understood as “great royal seers.” They are keen, brave, and clear, in the sense of being able to discern the opposite side.🔽They are mild in the opposite sense. He says that faith, etc., are the aspects of the state of being a seer in the sense of the act of seeing.

original: vuttaṃ, taṃ imāya atthavaṇṇanāya aññadatthu saṃsandati sametīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yato
analyzed: vuttam tam imāya attha vaṇṇanāya añña datthu saṃsandati sameti iti daṭṭhabbam yatas
translated: They are beautiful in the sense of being good. But in the Paramattha-vinodani it is said: “Those whose parts, such as the abode, are beautiful are of good aspect” . That should be regarded as agreeing with this commentary.

original: saddhāsampadādivasena ajjhāsayassa sundaratāti, tabbipariyāyato asundaratāti. Kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: saddhā sampad ādi vasena ajjhāsayassa sundara tā ati tad bipariyāyataḥ asundara tā ati kāraṇam
translated: For the abode is beautiful by reason of the perfection of faith, etc., and ugly in the opposite sense.

original: nāma paccayākāro, saccāni vā. Paralokanti samparāyaṃ. Taṃ dukkhāvahaṃ vajjaṃ viya🔽bhayato passitabbanti vuttaṃ “paralokañceva vajjañca bhayato passantī”ti. Sampattibhavato
analyzed: nāma paccaya ākāraḥ saccāni vā para lokanti samparāyam tam dukkha āvaham vajjam viya  bhayataḥ passitabbanti vuttam para lokañca iva vajjañca bhayataḥ passanti iti sampatti bhavato
translated: The reason is the mode of conditionality or the four truths. The world beyond is the next world. It is said that the blameworthy should be seen as fearful in the sense of bringing suffering.🔽“Seeing the world beyond and the blameworthy as fearful” means seeing the world beyond and the blameworthy as fearful.

original: vā aññattā vipattibhavo “paraloko”ti vuttaṃ “para…pe… passantī”ti.
analyzed: vā aññattā vipatti bhavo para loko ti vuttam para pe passanti iti
translated: Or alternatively, the world beyond is called “the world beyond” because it is different from the world of success. It is said: “Seeing the world beyond and the blameworthy as fearful” .

original: Ayaṃ panettha pāḷīti ettha “apparajakkhā”dipadānaṃ atthavibhāvane ayaṃ tassa tathābhāvasādhakapāḷi.
analyzed: ayam pana ittha pāḷi iti ettha appara jakkha ādi padānam attha vibhāvane ayam tassa tathābhāva sādhaka pāḷi
translated: This is the text here: this is the text that proves that the matter is as stated, in the explanation of the meaning of the terms “with little corruption” and so on.🔽For the strength of the factors that ripen in deliverance, namely, faith, etc.,

original: Saddhādīnañhi vimuttiparipācakadhammānaṃ balavabhāvo tappaṭipakkhānaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ🔽dubbalabhāveneva hoti, tesañca balavabhāvo saddhādīnaṃ dubbalabhāvenāti vimuttiparipācakadhammānaṃ
analyzed: saddhā ādīnam hi vimutti paripācaka dhammānam balava bhāvaḥ tad paṭipakkhānam pāpa dhammānam  dubbala bhāvena iva hoti tesam ca balava bhāvaḥ saddhā ādīnam dubbala bhāvena ati vimutti paripācaka dhammānam
translated: is due only to the weakness of the opposing states, the evil roots,

original: savisesaṃ atthitānatthitāvasena “apparajakkhā mahārajakkhā”ti ādayo pāḷiyaṃ vibhajitvā
analyzed: sa visesam atthita anatthitā vasena apparajakkhā mahārajakkhā ati ādayaḥ pāḷiyam vibhajitvā
translated: and the strength of the latter is due to the weakness of the former. So the factors that ripen in deliverance are shown in the text by the terms “with little corruption” and “with much corruption” according to whether they are respectively present in a weak or strong form.

original: dassitā. Iti saddhādīnaṃ vasena pañca apparajakkhā, asaddhiyādīnaṃ vasena pañca mahārajakkhā.
analyzed: dassitāḥ iti saddhā ādīnam vasena pañca apparajakkhāḥ asaddhiya ādīnam vasena pañca mahārajakkhāḥ
translated: Thus there are five kinds of persons with little corruption according to the five faculties of faith, etc., and five kinds with much corruption according to the five faculties of faith, etc.,

original: Evaṃ tikkhindriyamudindriyādayoti vibhāvitā paññāsa puggalā. Saddhādīnaṃ pana antarabhedena
analyzed: evam vibhāvitā paññāsa puggalā saddhā ādīnam pana antara bhedena
translated: So the fifty persons are distinguished according to the keen and blunt faculties. But they should be understood as of many kinds according to the different kinds of faith, etc.,

original: anekabhedā veditabbā. Khandhādayo eva lujjanapalujjanaṭṭhena loko, sampattibhavabhūto
analyzed: aneka bhedā veditabbā khandha ādayaḥ eva lujjana palujjana ṭṭhena loko sampatti bhava bhūto
translated: The world is the aggregates, etc., in the sense of being subject to crumbling, and it is the becoming that is the basis for distinction.

original: loko sampattibhavaloko, sugatisaṅkhāto upapattibhavo, sampatti sambhavati etenāti🔽sampattisambhavaloko sugatisaṃvattaniyo kammabhavo. Duggatisaṅkhātaupapattibhavaduggatisaṃvattaniyakammabhavā
analyzed: lokaḥ sampatti bhava lokaḥ sugati saṅkhātaḥ upapatti bhavaḥ sampatti sambhavati etena ati  sampatti sambhava lokaḥ sugati saṃvattaniyaḥ kamma bhavaḥ duggati saṅkhāta aupapatti bhava duggati saṃvattaniya kamma bhavā
translated: The world of success is the world of becoming consisting in the happy destinies, that is, rebirth-process becoming. It is the “world of success” because success comes about in it.🔽The world of failure is the world of becoming consisting in the unhappy destinies, that is, rebirth-process becoming. It is the “world of failure” because it is the coming about of failure.🔽

original: vipattibhavalokavipattisambhavalokā.
analyzed: vipatti bhava loka vipatti sambhava lokā
translated: The world of the occurrence of success is the occurrence of becoming consisting in the happy destinies, that is, rebirth-linking in the happy destinies. The world of the occurrence of the origin of success is kamma-process becoming that leads to the happy destinies. The world of the occurrence of the origin of failure is kamma-process becoming that leads to the unhappy destinies.🔽The world of failure is the occurrence of becoming consisting in the unhappy destinies, that is, rebirth-linking in the unhappy destinies.

original: Puna ekakadukādivasena lokaṃ vibhajitvā dassetuṃ “eko loko”tiādi vuttaṃ. Āhārādayo
analyzed: punar ekaka duka ādi vasena lokam vibhajitvā dassetum ekaḥ loka iti ādi vuttam āhāra ādayo
translated: Again, in order to show the world by dividing it into single, double, etc., sets, he said “One world” and so on. For nutriment, etc., are the world in the sense of decaying and disintegrating .

original: hi lujjanapalujjanaṭṭhena lokoti. Tattha “eko loko sabbe sattā āhāraṭṭhitikā”ti yāyaṃ🔽puggalādhiṭṭhānāya kathāya sabbasaṅkhārānaṃ paccayāyattavuttitā vuttā, tāya sabbo🔽saṅkhāraloko eko ekavidho pakārantarassābhāvato. “Dve lokā”tiādīsupi iminā nayena
analyzed: hi lujjana palujjana ṭṭhena loko ti tattha ekaḥ loko sabbe sattā āhāra ṭṭhitikā ati yā ayam  puggala adhiṭṭhānāya kathāya sabba saṅkhārānam paccaya āyatta vutti tā vuttā tāya sabbo  saṅkhāra lokaḥ ekaḥ ekavidhaḥ dve iminā nayena
translated: Herein, “One world: all beings subsist by nutriment” is a statement about a person that shows the dependence for existence of all formations. By that🔽the whole world of formations is one, is of one kind, because there is no other kind apart from that.

original: attho veditabbo. Nāmaggahaṇena cettha nibbānassa aggahaṇaṃ tassa alokasabhāvattā.
analyzed: atthaḥ veditabbaḥ nāma ggahaṇena ca ittha nibbānassa a gahaṇam tassa a loka sabhāva ttā
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way in the case of “Two worlds” and so on. But the non-mention of Nibbāna in the expression “One world” is because it is not a world.

original: Nanu ca “āhāraṭṭhitikā”ti ettha paccayāyattavuttitāya maggaphalānampi lokatā āpajjatīti?
analyzed: nanu ca āhāra ṭṭhitikā ati ettha paccaya āyatta vutti tāya magga phalānam pi loka tā āpajjati iti
translated: But is not the path and fruit also mundane because of the dependence of their occurrence on conditions, since it is said, “The life-continuum is by way of nutriment” ?

original: Nāpajjati pariññeyyānaṃ dukkhasaccadhammānaṃ “idha loko”ti adhippetattā. Atha vā🔽na lujjati na palujjatīti yo gahito, tathā na hoti, so lokoti taṃgahaṇarahitānaṃ
analyzed: na āpajjati pariññeyyānam dukkha sacca dhammānam idha loko ti adhippeta ttā atha vā  na lujjati na palujjati iti yaḥ gahitaḥ tathā na hoti saḥ
translated: It is not so because it is the states of the truth of suffering that are intended here as “the world” in the sense of what is to be fully understood. Or alternatively,🔽it is not so because it is the supramundane states that are free from the act of conceiving that are intended here as “the world” in the sense of what is not to be despised, not to be rejected.

original: lokuttarānaṃ natthi lokatā. Upādānānaṃ ārammaṇabhūtā khandhā upādānakkhandhā. Anurodhādivatthubhūtā
analyzed: lokuttarānam natthi lokatā upādānānam ārammaṇa bhūtā khandhāḥ upādāna khandhāḥ anurodha ādi vatthu bhūtā
translated: The aggregates that are objects of clinging are called “the aggregates as objects of clinging” .🔽The eight worldly ideas, namely, gain, fame, censure, pleasure, and their opposites, are the “eight worldly ideas” .

original: lābhādayo aṭṭha lokadhammā. Dasāyatanānīti dasa rūpāyatanāni vivaṭṭajjhāsayassa adhippetattā.
analyzed: lābha ādayaḥ aṭṭha loka dhammā dasa āyatanāni iti dasa rūpāyatanāni
translated: The ten bases are the ten physical-basis bases, which are intended here as the “ten bases” because they are the door of the round’s occurrence.

original: Tassa ca sabbaṃ tebhūmakakammaṃ garahitabbaṃ, vajjitabbañca hutvā upaṭṭhātīti vuttaṃ
analyzed: tassa ca sabbam tebhūmaka kammam garahitabbam vajjitabbam ca hutvā upaṭṭhāti iti vuttam
translated: And all kamma in the three planes of becoming appears to him as blameworthy and censurable, thus it is said:🔽“All determinations are blameworthy, All kamma that leads to becoming is blameworthy” .

original: “sabbe abhisaṅkhārā vajjaṃ, sabbe bhavagāmikammā vajja”nti. Yesaṃ puggalānaṃ saddhādayo
analyzed: sabbe abhisaṅkhārāḥ vajjam sabbe bhava gāmi kammāḥ vajjanti yesam puggalānam saddhā ādayo
translated: The faith, etc., of those persons

original: mandā, te idha “assaddhā”tiādinā vuttā. Na pana sabbena sabbaṃ saddhādīnaṃ abhāvatoti🔽apparajakkhadukādīsu pañcasu dukesu ekekasmiṃ dasa dasa katvā “paññāsāya ākārehi
analyzed: mandā te idha assaddhā ti ādinā vuttā na pana sabbena sabbam saddhā ādīnam abhāvato  appara jakkha duka ādīsu pañcasu dukesu ekekasmin dasa dasa katvā ākārehi
translated: They are called “faithless” and so on. But it is not because they are completely devoid of faith, etc.🔽In the five pairs beginning with “little dust” there are ten kinds in each pair. Thus it is said that he knows these five faculties

original: imāni pañcindriyāni jānātī”ti vuttaṃ. Atha vā anvayato, byatirekato ca saddhādīnaṃ
analyzed: imāni pañca indriyāni jānāti iti vuttam atha vā anvayataḥ ca saddhā ādīnam
translated: in fifty aspects. Or alternatively, he knows the relative superiority of the faculties of faith, etc.,

original: indriyānaṃ paropariyattaṃ jānātīti katvā tathā vuttaṃ. Ettha ca apparajakkhādivasena
analyzed: jānāti iti katvā tathā vuttam ettha ca appara jakkha ādi vasena
translated: by way of their succession and their non-succession. Here, when he adverts to them by way of “little dust,” etc.,

original: āvajjantassa bhagavato te sattā puñjapuñjāva hutvā upaṭṭhahanti, na ekekā.
analyzed: āvajjantassa bhagavataḥ te sattā puñja puñjā ava hutvā upaṭṭhahanti na ekekā
translated: those beings appear to him as heaps of dust, not as individuals.

original: Uppalāni ettha santīti uppalinī, gacchopi jalāsayopi, idha pana jalāsayo adhippetoti
analyzed: uppalāni ettha santi iti uppalinī gacchaḥ upi jalāsayaḥ pi idha pana jalāsayaḥ adhippeto ti
translated: A place where there are lotuses is “lotusy” . It can be a path or a body of water. Here it is a body of water that is meant.

original: āha “uppalavane”ti. Yāni udakassa anto nimuggāneva hutvā pusanti vaḍḍhanti, tāni
analyzed: āha uppala vana iti yāni udakassa antar nimuggāna iva hutvā pusanti vaḍḍhanti tāni
translated: Therefore it is said, “in a lotus-pond.” Those that bloom and grow submerged in the water are called “submerged bloomers.”

original: antonimuggaposīnī. Dīpitānīti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pakāsitāni, idheva vā “aññānipī”tiādinā
analyzed: dīpitāni iti aṭṭhakathā ayam pakāsitāni idha iva vā aññāni pi iti ādinā
translated: “Are shown” is explained in the commentary. Or else, “other” is referred to by the words “and so on.”

original: dīpitāni. Ugghaṭitaññūti ugghaṭanaṃ nāma ñāṇugghaṭanaṃ, ñāṇe ugghaṭitamatte eva jānātīti
analyzed: dīpitāni ugghaṭita ññūti ugghaṭanam nāma ñāṇa ugghaṭanam ñāṇe ugghaṭita matte eva jānāti iti
translated: and the four foundations of mindfulness are shown. The type who understands after being shown: the meaning of “shown” is the showing of knowledge. The meaning is that he understands as soon as the knowledge is shown.

original: attho. Vipañcitaṃ vitthāramevamatthaṃ jānātīti vipañcitaññū. Uddesādīhi netabboti🔽neyyo. Saha udāhaṭavelāyāti udāhāre dhammassa uddese udāhaṭamatte eva. Dhammābhisamayoti🔽catusaccadhammassa ñāṇena saddhiṃ abhisamayo. Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ “cattāro satipaṭṭhānā”tiādinā🔽nayena saṅkhittena mātikāya dīpiyamānāya desanānusārena ñāṇaṃ pesetvā arahattaṃ gaṇhituṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ vipañcitam vitthāram evam attham jānāti iti vipañcitaññū uddesa ādīhi netabbaḥ ti  saha udāhaṭa velāya ati udāhāre dhammassa uddese udāhaṭa matte eva dhamma abhisamayo ti  catu sacca dhammassa ñāṇena saddhim abhisamayaḥ ayam vuccati iti ayam cattāro sati paṭṭhāna ati ādinā  nayena saṅkhittena mātikāya dīpiyamānāya desanā anusārena ñāṇam pesetvā arahattam gaṇhitum
translated: The type who understands after being told in detail: he understands the meaning in detail, in an extended form. The type who is led: he is led by the teaching in accordance with the method of exposition.

original: samattho “puggalo ugghaṭitaññū”ti vuccati. Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ saṅkhittena mātikaṃ🔽ṭhapetvā vitthārena atthe vibhajiyamāne arahattaṃ pāpuṇituṃ samattho “puggalo vipañcitaññū”ti
analyzed: samatthaḥ puggalaḥ ugghaṭita ññū ti vuccati ayam vuccati iti ayam saṅkhittena mātikam 🔽ṭhapetvā vitthārena atthe vibhajiyamāne arahattam pāpuṇitum samatthaḥ puggalaḥ
translated: As soon as the teaching is begun: as soon as the teaching of the Dhamma is begun by the utterance of the teaching. Penetration of the Dhamma: penetration together with the knowledge of the Four Noble Truths. This type of person: this person who is able to attain arahatship by directing his knowledge in accordance with the teaching as soon as the teaching is shown by the brief summary beginning with the words “Four foundations of mindfulness” is called the type who understands after being shown. This type of person: this person who is able to reach arahatship as soon as the meaning is analyzed in an extended form, after the brief summary has been set forth, is called the type who understands after being told in detail.

original: vuccati. Uddesatoti uddesahetu, uddisantassa, uddisāpentassa vāti attho. Paripucchatoti
analyzed: vuccati uddesato ti uddesa hetu uddisantassa uddisāpentassa vā attho paripucchato ti
translated: is said. By recitation: for the sake of recitation, for one who recites, for one who causes to recite. By questioning:

original: atthaṃ paripucchantassa. Anupubbena dhammābhisamayo hotīti anukkamena arahattappatto🔽hoti. Na tāya jātiyā dhammābhisamayo hotīti tena attabhāvena maggaṃ vā phalaṃ vā
analyzed: attham paripucchantassa anupubbena dhamma abhisamayaḥ hoti iti anukkamena arahatta ppatto  hoti na tāya jātiyā dhamma abhisamayaḥ hoti iti tena atta bhāvena maggam vā phalam vā
translated: for one who questions about the meaning. There is gradual penetration of the Dhamma: he reaches Arahantship in due course.

original: antamaso jhānaṃ vā vipassanaṃ vā nibbattetuṃ na sakkoti. Ayaṃ vuccati puggalo padaparamoti
analyzed: antamasaḥ jhānam vā vipassanam vā nibbattetum na sakkoti ayam vuccati puggalo pada paramaḥ ti
translated: There is no penetration of the Dhamma in that birth: he is unable to produce the path, the fruition, or at least jhana or insight in that existence. This is called a person of the letter:

original: ayaṃ puggalo byañjanapadameva paramaṃ assāti “padaparamo”ti vuccati.
analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ byañjana padam eva paramam assa ati pada paramaḥ ti vuccati
translated: this person is called “of the letter” because the letter is his highest.

original: Yeti ye duvidhe puggale sandhāya vuttaṃ vibhaṅge kammāvaraṇenāti pañcavidhena ānantariyakammena.
analyzed: ye iti ye duvidhe puggale sandhāya vuttam vibhaṅge kamma āvaraṇena ati pañcavidhena ānantariya kammena
translated: Those: those two kinds of persons, in reference to whom it is said in the Vibhanga: “By the hindrance of kamma” means by the five kinds of heinous kamma.

original: Vipākāvaraṇenāti ahetukapaṭisandhiyā. Yasmā duhetukānampi ariyamaggapaṭivedho natthi,
analyzed: vipāka āvaraṇena ati ahetuka paṭisandhiyā yasmā du hetukānam pi ariya magga paṭivedhaḥ natthi
translated: By the hindrance of result: by the rebirth-linking of the rootless. Since there is no penetration of the noble path in those of double and rootless ,

original: tasmā duhetukapaṭisandhipi “vipākāvaraṇamevā”ti veditabbā. Kilesāvaraṇenāti niyatamicchādiṭṭhiyā.
analyzed: tasmā vipāka āvaraṇam eva ati veditabbā kilesa āvaraṇena ati niyatam icchādiṭṭhiyā
translated: therefore the rebirth-linking of the double and rootless should be understood as “the hindrance of result.” By the hindrance of defilement: by fixed wrong view.

original: Assaddhāti buddhādīsu saddhā rahitā. Acchandikāti kattukamyatākusalacchandarahitā,
analyzed: assaddhā iti buddha ādīsu saddhā rahitā acchandikā ati kattu kamyatā akusala chanda rahitā
translated: “Without faith” means devoid of faith in the Buddha, etc. “Without keenness” means devoid of the unwholesome keenness of desire to act.🔽The people of Uttarakuru are without keenness in the sense that they have not entered the state of keenness.

original: uttarakurukā manussā acchandikaṭṭhānaṃ paviṭṭhā. Duppaññāti bhavaṅgapaññāya parihīnā,
analyzed: uttarakurukāḥ manussāḥ acchandika ṭṭhānam paviṭṭhāḥ duppaññā ati bhavaṅga paññāya parihīnā
translated: “Without understanding” means devoid of the understanding of the life-continuum.

original: bhavaṅgapaññāya pana paripuṇṇāyapi yassa bhavaṅgaṃ lokuttarassa paccayo na hoti,🔽sopi duppañño eva nāma. Abhabbā niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattanti kusalesu
analyzed: bhavaṅga paññāya pana yassa bhavaṅgam lokuttarassa paccayaḥ na hoti  so api duppaññaḥ eva nāma abhabbāḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu kusalesu
translated: But even one who is complete in the understanding of the life-continuum is called “without understanding” if his life-continuum does not serve as a condition for the supramundane state.🔽“Incapable of entering into the certainty of rightness in profitable states” means incapable of entering into and attaining the noble path, which is called “the certainty of rightness in profitable states.”

original: dhammesu sammattaniyāmasaṅkhātaṃ ariyamaggaṃ okkamituṃ adhigantuṃ abhabbā. “Na kammāvaraṇenā”tiādīni🔽vuttavipariyāyena veditabbāni.
analyzed: dhammesu sammatta niyāma saṅkhātam ariya maggaṃ okkamitum adhigantum abhabbāḥ na kamma āvaraṇena ati ādīni  vutta vipariyāyena veditabbāni
translated: “Not by the hindrance of kamma” should be understood in the opposite sense to the above.🔽As to “characterized by greed,” etc., what should be said has been said in the Paṭisambhidā, in the Visuddhimagga, and in the Paramatthamañjūsā .

original: “Rāgacaritā”tiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ paramatthadīpaniyaṃ [paramatthamañjūsāyaṃ visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanāyanti bhavitabbaṃ –
analyzed: rāga caritā ti ādīsu yam vattabbam tam paramatthadīpaniyam paramatthamañjūsāyam visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanāyanti bhavitabbam
translated: Herein, the following should be said:

original: “Sā esā paramatthānaṃ, tattha tattha yathārahaṃ;
analyzed: sā esā parama atthānam tattha tattha yathāraham
translated: In each case, as appropriate,

original: Nidhānato paramattha-mañjūsā nāma nāmato”ti. (visuddhimaggamahāṭīkāya nigamane sayameva vuttattā)] visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayena veditabbaṃ;🔽70. Ārabbhāti attano adhippetassa atthassa bhagavato jānāpanaṃ uddissāti attho. Selo🔽pabbato ucco hoti thiro ca, na paṃsupabbato, missakapabbato vāti āha “sele yathā🔽pabbatamuddhanī”ti. Dhammamayaṃ pāsādanti lokuttaradhammamāha. So hi pabbatasadiso🔽ca hoti sabbadhamme atikkamma abbhuggataṭṭhena pāsādasadiso ca, paññāpariyāyo vā
analyzed: nidhānato param atthamañjūsā nāma nāmato ti visuddhi magga mahā ṭīkāya nigamane sayam eva vutta ttā visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanā ayam vutta nayena veditabbam  ārabbha ati attanaḥ adhippetassa atthassa bhagavataḥ jānāpanam uddissa atthaḥ selaḥ  pabbataḥ uccaḥ hoti thiraḥ ca na paṃsu pabbataḥ missaka pabbataḥ vā ati āha sele yathā  pabbata muddhani iti dhamma mayam pāsādam ti lokuttara dhammam āha saḥ hi pabbata sadisaḥ  ca hoti sabba dhamme atikkamma abbhuggata ṭṭhena pāsāda sadisaḥ ca paññā pariyāyaḥ vā
translated: This is to be understood in the way stated in the commentary on the Visuddhimagga.

original: idha dhamma-saddo. Sā hi abbhuggataṭṭhena pāsādoti abhidhamme niddiṭṭhā. Tathā cāha –
analyzed: idha dhamma saddo sā hi abbhuggata ṭṭhena pāsādaḥ ti abhidhamme niddiṭṭhā tathā ca āha
translated: The meaning of “having recourse to” is the making known to the Blessed One of the matter intended by oneself. A rock mountain is high and firm, not a sand mountain or a mountain of earth. Therefore it is said: “As to the top of a rock mountain.” The palace of Dhamma is the supramundane Dhamma. For that is like a mountain because it is arisen above all things, and it is like a palace because it is arisen above all things. Or else the word “Dhamma” here refers to the method of wisdom. For that is called a palace because it is arisen above all things, as is stated in the Abhidhamma:

original: “Paññāpāsādamāruyha, asoko sokiniṃ pajaṃ;
analyzed: paññāpāsādam āruyha asokaḥ sokinim pajam
translated: “Having ascended the palace of wisdom, the sorrowless one beholds the sorrowing people,

original: Pabbataṭṭhova bhūmaṭṭhe, dhīro bāle avekkhatī”ti. ;
analyzed: pabbata aṭṭhaḥ uva bhūma aṭṭhe dhīraḥ bāle avekkhati iti
translated: As one on a mountain top beholds those on the ground, the wise one the fools.”

original: “Yathā hī”tiādīsu yathā pabbate ṭhatvā rattandhakāre heṭṭhā olokentassa purisassa
analyzed: yathā hi iti ādīsu yathā pabbate ṭhatvā ratta ndhakāre heṭṭhā olokentassa purisassa
translated: In the passage beginning “Just as, when a man stands on a mountain top” ,

original: khette kedārapāḷikuṭiyo, tattha sayitamanussā ca na paññāyanti anujjalabhāvato. Kuṭikāsu
analyzed: khette kedāra pāḷi kuṭiyaḥ tattha sayita manussā ca na paññāyanti anujjala bhāvato kuṭikāsu
translated: the fields, the huts of the poor, and the people lying in them are not seen by a man looking down from a mountain in the dark of the night because they are not illuminated by moonlight or starlight.

original: pana aggijālā paññāyati ujjalabhāvato evaṃ dhammapāsādamāruyha sattalokaṃ olokayato
analyzed: pana aggi jālā paññāyati ujjala bhāvataḥ evam dhammapāsādam āruyha satta lokam olokayato
translated: But the flames of the fires burning in the huts are seen because they are illuminated by the fires. So too, when the Exalted One looks down on the world of beings from the palace of Dhamma,

original: bhagavato ñāṇassa āpāthaṃ nāgacchanti akatakalyāṇā sattā ñāṇagginā anujjalabhāvato,🔽anuḷārabhāvato ca rattiṃ khittā sarā viya honti. Katakalyāṇā pana bhabbapuggalā dūre
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ñāṇassa āpātham na āgacchanti a kata kalyāṇā sattā ñāṇa agginā anujjala bhāvataḥ  anuḷāra bhāvataḥ ca rattim khittā sarāḥ viya honti kata kalyāṇāḥ pana bhabba puggalāḥ dūre
translated: beings who have not done good are not within the range of his knowledge because they are not illuminated by the fire of his knowledge.

original: ṭhitāpi bhagavato ñāṇassa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti paripakkañāṇaggitāya samujjalabhāvato,
analyzed: ṭhitā api bhagavataḥ ñāṇassa āpātham āgacchanti paripakka ñāṇaggitāya samujjala bhāvataḥ
translated: They are like the water in the wells at night. But those who have done good, who are fit vessels, are within the range of his knowledge even when they are far away because they are illuminated by the fire of his knowledge,

original: uḷārasantānatāya himavantapabbato viya cāti evaṃ yojanā veditabbā.
analyzed: uḷāra santāna tāya himavanta pabbataḥ viya ca ati evam yojanā veditabbā
translated: which is fully matured. They are like the Himalaya mountain because of the greatness of its range. This is how the passage should be understood.

original: Uṭṭhehīti tvaṃ dhammadesanāya appossukkatāsaṅkhātasaṅkocāpattito kilāsubhāvato uṭṭhaha.
analyzed: uṭṭhehi iti tvam dhamma desanāya appossukka tā saṅkhāta saṅkoca āpattitaḥ kilāsu bhāvataḥ uṭṭhaha
translated: “Rise up” : rise up from the contraction called lack of interest in teaching the Dhamma, as if from a sickbed.

original: Vīriyavantatāyāti sātisaya catubbidhasammappadhānavīriyavantatāya. Vīrassa hi bhāvo,🔽kammaṃ vā vīriyaṃ. Kilesamārassa viya maccumārassapi āyatiṃ asambhavato “maccukilesamārāna”nti
analyzed: vīriyavanta tāya ati sa atisaya catubbidha sammappadhāna vīriyavanta tāya vīrassa hi bhāvo  kammam vā vīriyam kilesa mārassa viya maccu mārassa api āyatim asambhavataḥ
translated: “Energy” is the state of being of a hero,🔽or it is the action of a hero.🔽“The death-māra and the defilement-māra” are mentioned because, like the active-māra, they too are incapable of arising again.

original: vuttaṃ. Abhisaṅkhāramāravijayassa aggahaṇaṃ kilesamāravijayeneva tabbijayassa jotitabhāvato.
analyzed: vuttam abhisaṅkhāra māra vijayassa aggahaṇam kilesa māra vijayena iva tad vijayassa jotita bhāvato
translated: The victory over the kamma-māra is implied by the victory over the defilement-māra.

original: Vāhanasamatthatāyāti saṃsāramahākantārato nibbānasaṅkhātaṃ khemappadesaṃ sampāpanasamatthatāya.
analyzed: vāhana samattha tāya ati saṃsāra mahā kantārataḥ nibbāna saṅkhātam khema ppadesam sampāpana samattha tāya
translated: “The ability to carry”: the ability to reach the place of safety called Nibbāna from the great wilderness of saṃsāra.

original: 71. “Apārutaṃ tesaṃ amatassa dvāra”nti keci paṭhanti. Nibbānassa dvāraṃ pavisanamaggo🔽vivaritvā ṭhapito mahākaruṇūpanissayena sayambhuñāṇena adhigatattā. Saddhaṃ pamuñcantūti
analyzed: apārutam tesam amatassa dvāran ti keci paṭhanti nibbānassa dvāram pavisana maggo  vivaritvā ṭhapitaḥ mahā karuṇūpanissayena sayambhuñāṇena adhigata ttā saddham pamuñcantu uti
translated: Some read “apārutaṃ tesaṃ amatassa dvāraṃ” . The door to the deathless is the path to the entrance of Nibbāna.🔽It is “opened” because it has been discovered by the self-awakened knowledge that is the support for the great compassion.🔽“Let them release their faith”: let them show their faith, let them manifest their faith.

original: saddhaṃ pavedentu, attano saddahanākāraṃ upaṭṭhāpentūti attho. Sukhena akicchena
analyzed: saddham pavedentu attanaḥ saddahana ākāram upaṭṭhāpentu uti attho sukhena akicchena
translated: “Easily entered”: easily penetrated.

original: pavattanīyatāya suppavattitaṃ. Na bhāsiṃ na bhāsissāmīti cintesi.
analyzed: pavattanīya tāya suppavattitam na bhāsim na bhāsissāmi iti cintesi
translated: “I will not speak, I will not speak” he thought.

original: Aggasāvakayugavaṇṇanā
analyzed: agga sāvaka yuga vaṇṇanā
translated: Description of the chief pair of disciples

original: 73. Sallapitvāti “vippasannāni kho te āvuso indriyānī”tiādinā ālāpasallāpaṃ katvā. Tañhissa aparabhāge satthu santikaṃ upasaṅkamanassa paccayo ahosi.
analyzed: sallapitvā iti vippasannāni kho te āvuso indriyāni iti ādinā ālāpa sallāpam katvā tat hi issa aparabhāge satthu santikam upasaṅkamanassa paccayaḥ ahosi
translated: “Having conversed”: having had a conversation beginning thus, “Friend, your faculties are clear.” This was a condition for his later approach to the Teacher.

original: 75-6. Anupubbiṃ kathanti anupubbiyā anupubbaṃ kathetabbaṃ kathaṃ. Kā pana sāti? Dānādikathā.🔽Tattha dānakathā tāva pacurajanesu pavattiyā sabbasādhāraṇattā, sukarattā, sīle patiṭṭhānassa
analyzed: anupubbim kathanti anupubbiyā anupubbam kathetabbam katham kā pana sā ati dāna ādi kathā  tattha dāna kathā tāva pacura janesu pavattiyā sabba sādhāraṇa ttā sukara ttā sīle patiṭṭhānassa
translated: “A talk in due order”: a talk that should be given in due order, in sequence. But what is it? The talk on giving, etc.🔽Herein, the talk on giving is mentioned first among the talks because it is common to all, because it is easy, and because it is the means for establishing virtue.

original: upāyabhāvato ca ādito kathitā. Pariccāgasīlo hi puggalo pariggahavatthūsu nissaṅgabhāvato
analyzed: upāya bhāvataḥ ca āditas kathitā pariccāga sīlaḥ hi puggalo pariggaha vatthūsu nissaṅga bhāvato
translated: For a person whose nature is generous, because of his lack of attachment to the things he has given up,

original: sukheneva sīlāni samādiyati, tattha ca suppatiṭṭhito hoti. Sīlena dāyakapaṭiggāhakavisuddhito
analyzed: sukhena iva sīlāni samādiyati tattha ca su patiṭṭhitaḥ hoti sīlena dāyaka paṭiggāhaka visuddhito
translated: he undertakes the precepts easily and becomes well established in them. Because of the purity of the giver and receiver through virtue,

original: parānuggahaṃ vatvā parapīḷānivattivacanato, kiriyadhammaṃ vatvā akiriyadhammavacanato,
analyzed: para anuggaham vatvā para pīḷā nivatti vacanataḥ kiriya dhammam vatvā akiriya dhamma vacanataḥ
translated: after the talk on helping others, the talk on refraining from harming others is given; after the talk on doing what should be done, the talk on refraining from doing what should not be done is given;

original: bhogasampattihetuṃ vatvā bhavasampattihetuvacanato ca dānakathānantaraṃ sīlakathā
analyzed: bhoga sampatti hetum vatvā bhava sampatti hetu vacanataḥ ca dāna kathā anantaram sīla kathā
translated: After the discussion of the excellence of wealth, the discussion of the excellence of becoming is given.

original: kathitā, tañce dānasīlaṃ vaṭṭanissitaṃ, ayaṃ bhavasampatti tassa phalanti dassanatthaṃ,🔽imehi ca dānasīlamayehi paṇītapaṇītatarādibhedabhinnehi puññakiriyavatthūhi etā cātumahārājikādīsu
analyzed: kathitā tat ce dāna sīlam vaṭṭa nissitam ayam bhava sampatti tassa phalanti dassana attham  imehi ca dāna sīla mayehi paṇīta paṇītatara ādi bheda bhinnehi puñña kiriya vatthūhi etā cātumahārājika ādīsu
translated: The discussion of virtue is given next to the discussion of giving in order to show that the excellence of becoming is the fruit of giving and virtue.

original: paṇītapaṇītatarādibhedabhinnā aparimeyyā dibbabhogabhavasampattiyo hontīti dassanatthaṃ
analyzed: paṇīta paṇītatara ādi bheda bhinnāḥ aparimeyyāḥ dibba bhoga bhava sampattiyaḥ honti iti dassana ttham
translated: And in order to show that by means of these bases for making merit consisting in giving and virtue, which are distinguished as inferior, medium, and superior, there are immeasurable kinds of excellence of heavenly becoming distinguished as inferior, medium, and superior in the heavenly worlds of the gods of the Four Great Kings, etc.,🔽and in order to show that after the discussion of the excellence of becoming, the discussion of heaven should be given.

original: tadanantaraṃ saggakathaṃ. Vatvā ayaṃ saggo rāgādīhi upakkiliṭṭho, sabbadā anupakkiliṭṭho
analyzed: tad anantaram sagga katham vatvā ayam saggaḥ rāga ādīhi upakkiliṭṭhaḥ sabbadā an upakkiliṭṭhaḥ
translated: After showing that heaven is defiled by lust, etc., and that the noble path is undefiled,🔽the discussion of the path should be given next to the discussion of heaven.

original: ariyamaggoti dassanatthaṃ saggānantaraṃ maggakathā kathetabbā. Maggañca kathentena
analyzed: ariya maggo ti dassana attham sagga anantaram magga kathā kathetabbā maggam ca kathentena
translated: And when the path is being discussed, it should be shown that the path is the means to the realization of the goal.

original: tadadhigamupāyadassanatthaṃ saggapariyāpannāpi, pageva itare sabbepi kāmā nāma bahvādīnavā,
analyzed: tad adhigama upāya dassana attham sagga pariyāpannā api pagā iva itare sabbe pi kāmāḥ nāma bahu ādīnavā
translated: Therefore, after the discussion of heaven, the discussion of the drawbacks of sense pleasures should be given in order to show that sense pleasures, which are included in heaven as well as in the other worlds, are full of drawbacks,

original: aniccā adhuvā, vipariṇāmadhammāti kāmānaṃ ādīnavo, hīnā, gammā, pothujjanikā, anariyā,
analyzed: aniccāḥ a dhuvāḥ vipariṇāma dhammā ati kāmānam ādīnavaḥ hīnāḥ gammā pothujjanikāḥ an ariyāḥ
translated: The danger in sensual desires is that they are impermanent, unstable, and subject to change.

original: anatthasañhitāti tesaṃ okāro lāmakabhāvo, sabbepi bhavā kilesānaṃ vatthubhūtāti tattha
analyzed: anattha sañhitā ti tesam okāraḥ lāmaka bhāvo sabbe pi bhavā kilesānam vatthu bhūtā tattha
translated: Their disadvantage is that they are low, vulgar, common, ignoble, and not conducive to welfare.🔽Their drawback is that they are the basis for the defilements.

original: saṃkileso, sabbaso kilesavippamuttaṃ nibbānanti nekkhamme ānisaṃso ca kathetabboti
analyzed: saṃkilesaḥ sabbasas kilesa vippamuttam nibbānanti nekkhamme ānisaṃsaḥ ca kathetabbaḥ ti
translated: The benefit in renunciation is that it is the escape from all the defilements.

original: ayamattho maggantīti ettha iti-saddena ādiatthajotakena bodhitoti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ayam atthaḥ magganti iti ettha iti saddena ādi attha jotakena bodhitaḥ iti veditabbam
translated: The meaning of this is indicated by the word “thus” in the phrase “thus renunciation is the escape.”

original: Sukhānaṃ nidānanti diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ, samparāyikānaṃ, nibbānapaṭisaṃyuttānañcāti
analyzed: sukhānam nidānam ti diṭṭhadhammikānam samparāyikānam nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttānam ca ati
translated: The source of happiness is the happiness of the present life, the happiness of the life to come, and the happiness of the state of Nibbāna.

original: sabbesampi sukhānaṃ kāraṇaṃ. Yañhi kiñci loke bhogasukhaṃ nāma, taṃ sabbaṃ dānanidānanti🔽pākaṭo yamattho. Yaṃ pana taṃ jhānavipassanāmaggaphalanibbānapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ sukhaṃ,
analyzed: sabbesam pi sukhānam kāraṇam yat hi kiñci loke bhoga sukham nāma tat sabbam dāna nidānam ti  pākaṭaḥ yam atthaḥ yam pana tam jhāna vipassanā magga phala nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttam sukham
translated: It is the cause of all these kinds of happiness. Whatever happiness there is in the world is rooted in giving.

original: tassāpi dānaṃ upanissayapaccayo hotiyeva. Sampattīnaṃ mūlanti yā imā loke padesarajjaṃ
analyzed: tassa api dānam upanissaya paccayaḥ hotiyā iva sampattīnam mūlanti yāḥ imāḥ loke padesa rajjam
translated: This is the obvious meaning. But giving is also a decisive support condition for the happiness of jhāna, insight, the supramundane paths, and Nibbāna.🔽The root of prosperity is the prosperity of a district, a country, and a king.

original: sirissariyaṃ sattaratanasamujjalacakkavattisampadāti evaṃpabhedā mānusikā sampattiyo,🔽yā ca cātumahārājikacātumahārājādibhedā dibbasampattiyo, yā vā panaññāpi sampattiyo,

original: tāsaṃ sabbāsaṃ idaṃ dānaṃ nāma mūlaṃ kāraṇaṃ. Bhogānanti bhuñjitabbaṭṭhena “bhogo”ti🔽laddhanāmānaṃ manāpiyarūpādīnaṃ, tannissayānañca upabhogasukhānaṃ. Avassayaṭṭhena🔽patiṭṭhā. Visamagatassāti byasanappattassa. Tāṇanti rakkhā tato paripālanato. Leṇanti🔽byasanehi paripāciyamānassa olīyanapadeso. Gatīti gantabbaṭṭhānaṃ. Parāyaṇanti paṭisaraṇaṃ.🔽Avassayoti vinipatituṃ adento nissayo. Ārammaṇanti olubbhārammaṇaṃ.
analyzed: tāsam sabbāsam idam dānam nāma mūlam kāraṇam bhoga ananti bhuñjitabba ṭṭhena  laddha nāmānam manā piya rūpa ādīnam tad nissayānam ca upabhoga sukhānam avassaya ṭṭhena  patiṭṭhā visama gatassa ati byasana ppattassa tāṇanti rakkhā tatas paripālanato leṇanti  byasanehi paripāciyamānassa olīyana padesaḥ gatī iti gantabba ṭṭhānam parāyaṇam ti paṭisaraṇam  avassayo ti vinipatitum a dentaḥ nissayaḥ ārammaṇam ti olubbha ārammaṇam
translated: The human kinds of distinction are the distinction of freedom from debt, the distinction of being unmolested, the distinction of being unblamed, the distinction of being a human being, the distinction of being a man, the distinction of being a youth, the distinction of being healthy, the distinction of being well born on both sides, the distinction of being rich, the distinction of being powerful, the distinction of being a warrior, the distinction of being a brahmin, the distinction of being a merchant, the distinction of being a worker, the distinction of being a deva on reaching a happy destination, the distinction of being a wheel-turning monarch, the distinction of being endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man, the distinction of being endowed with the thirty-two portents of a universal monarch, the distinction of being endowed with the seven treasures and the four properties of a wheel-turning monarch, the distinction of being a universal monarch with his wheel- treasure, etc., and the distinction of being a universal monarch with his full one thousand sons.

original: Ratanamayasīhāsanasadisanti sabbaratanamayasattaṅgamahāsīhāsanasadisaṃ mahagghaṃ
analyzed: ratana maya sīhāsana sadisanti sabba ratana maya sattaṅga mahā sīhāsana sadisam mahaggham
translated: The kinds of distinction of the deities are the distinction of the deities of the realm of the Four Great Kings, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the Thirty-three, the distinction of the deities of the Yāma realm, the distinction of the deities of the Tavatimsa realm, the distinction of the deities of the Tusita realm, the distinction of the deities of the Brahma-world, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Limited Radiance, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Streaming Radiance, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Glory, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Limited Glory, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Immeasurable Glory, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Great Glory, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Constant Mindfulness, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Limited Virtue, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Immeasurable Virtue, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Abundant Virtue, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Great Fruit, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Streaming Radiance, the distinction of the deities of the realm of the gods of Limited

original: hutvā sabbaso vinipatituṃ appadānato. Mahāpathavisadisaṃ gatagataṭṭhāne patiṭṭhāya
analyzed: hutvā sabbasas vinipatitum appadānataḥ mahā pathavi sadisam gata gata ṭṭhāne patiṭṭhāya
translated: because it does not give up its position when it has been given. It is like a great road, because it is the means of access to all kinds of success.

original: labhāpanato. Ālambanarajjusadisanti yathā dubbalassa purisassa ālambanarajju uttiṭṭhato,🔽tiṭṭhato ca upatthambho, evaṃ dānaṃ sattānaṃ sampattibhave uppattiyā, ṭhitiyā ca🔽paccayabhāvato. Dukkhanittharaṇaṭṭhenāti duggatidukkhanittharaṇaṭṭhena. Samassāsanaṭṭhenāti🔽lobhamacchariyādipaṭisattupaddavato sammadeva assāsanaṭṭhena. Bhayaparittāṇaṭṭhenāti
analyzed: labhāpanataḥ ālambana rajju sadisanti yathā dubbalassa purisassa ālambana rajju uttiṭṭhato  tiṭṭhataḥ ca upatthambhaḥ evam dānam sattānam sampatti bhave uppattiyā ṭhitiyā ca  paccaya bhāvataḥ dukkha nittharaṇa ṭhena ati duggati dukkha nittharaṇa ṭhena samassāsana ṭṭhena ati  lobha macchariya ādi paṭisattu paddavato sammat eva assāsana ṭhena bhaya parittāṇa ṭṭhena ati
translated: It is like a rope for support, because it is the support for beings who are weak from lack of merit, just as a rope for support is for a weak man who is climbing.🔽It is the condition for the arising of the various kinds of success and for the continuity of the continuity of success once it has arisen.🔽It is the means of crossing over suffering, because it is the means of crossing over the suffering of the unhappy destiny. It is the means of consolation, because it is the means of consoling those who are frightened by the dangers of stinginess, avarice, and so on.🔽It is the means of protection from fear, because it protects from the fear of poverty.

original: dāliddiyabhayato paripālanaṭṭhena. Maccheramalādīhīti maccheralobhadosaissāvicikicchādiṭṭhi🔽ādicittamalehi. Anupalittaṭṭhenāti anupakkiliṭṭhatāya. Tesanti maccheramalādikacavarānaṃ.
analyzed: paripālana ṭṭhena macchera mala ādīhi iti  ādi citta malehi an upalitta ṭṭhena ati
translated: It is unsoiled, because it is unstained by the stains of stinginess, avarice, and so on, such as greed, delusion, hatred, envy, doubt, and views.🔽It is not soiled by those stains of stinginess, avarice, and so on.

original: Etehi eva durāsadaṭṭhena. Asantāsanaṭṭhenāti anabhibhavanīyatāya santāsābhāvena.
analyzed: etehi eva durāsada ṭṭhena asantāsana ṭṭhena ati an abhibhavanīya tāya santāsa abhāvena
translated: It is hard to overcome, because it is hard to overcome. It is the means of comforting, because it is the means of comforting those who are frightened by the dangers of stinginess, avarice, and so on.

original: Yo hi dāyako dānapati, so sampatipi kutoci na bhāyati, pageva āyatiṃ. Dhammasīsena
analyzed: yaḥ hi dāyakaḥ dānapati saḥ kutocid na bhāyati pagā iva āyatim dhamma sīsena
translated: The person is spoken of as “the one who has the nature of the Dhamma.”

original: puggalo vutto. Balavantaṭṭhenāti mahābalavatāya. Dāyako hi dānapati sampati pakkhabalena
analyzed: puggalaḥ vuttaḥ balavat aṭṭhena ati mahā balavatāya dāyakaḥ hi dānapati pakkha balena
translated: “By reason of his strength” means by reason of his great strength. For the giver, the donor, is strong in this world by the strength of his retinue,🔽but in the next world he is strong by the strength of his body, etc.

original: balavā hoti, āyatiṃ pana kāyabalādīhipi. Abhimaṅgalasammataṭṭhenāti “vaḍḍhikāraṇa”nti🔽abhisammatabhāvena. Vipattibhavato sampattibhavūpanayanaṃ khemantabhūmisampāpanaṃ,
analyzed: balavā hoti āyatim pana abhimaṅgala sammata ṭṭhena ati  abhisammata bhāvena vipatti bhavato sampatti bhava upanayanam khemanta bhūmi sampāpanam
translated: “By reason of his being recognized as a great blessing” means by reason of his being recognized as the cause of increase.

original: bhavasaṅgāmato yogakkhemasampāpanañca khemantabhūmisampāpanaṭṭho.🔽Idāni dānaṃ vaṭṭagatā ukkaṃsappattā sampattiyo viya vivaṭṭagatāpi tā sampādetīti
analyzed: bhava saṅgāmataḥ yogakkhema sampāpanañca khemanta bhūmi sampāpanaṭṭhaḥ  idāni dānam vaṭṭa gatāḥ ukkaṃsa pattā sampattiyaḥ viya vivaṭṭa gatā api tā sampādeti iti
translated: The meaning of “reaching the state of security” is the attainment of the state of security by leading from the state of loss to the state of gain, and by leading from the battlefield of existence to the security of final Nibbāna.

original: bodhicariyabhāvenapi dānaguṇe dassetuṃ “dānañhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha sakkamārabrahmasampattiyo
analyzed: bodhi cariya bhāvena api dāna guṇe dassetum dānam hi itiādi vuttam tattha sakka māra brahma sampattiyaḥ
translated: Now, in order to point out the virtue of giving even by way of the practice of the perfections, it is said: “For giving, indeed,” etc. Herein, the perfections of Sakka, Māra, and Brahmā

original: attahitāya eva, cakkavattisampatti pana attahitāya, parahitāya cāti dassetuṃ sā tāsaṃ
analyzed: atta hitāya eva cakkavatti sampatti pana atta hitāya para hitāya ca ati dassetum sā tāsam
translated: are for one’s own benefit only, but the perfection of a wheel-turning monarch is for one’s own benefit and for the benefit of others. In order to point out this,

original: parato vuttā, etā lokiyā, imā pana lokuttarāti dassetuṃ tato paraṃ “sāvakapāramīñāṇa”ntiādi
analyzed: paratas vuttā etā lokiyāḥ imā pana lokuttarā ti dassetum tatas param sāvaka pāramī ñāṇa ntiādi
translated: In order to show that these are mundane, but the following are supramundane, it is said next: “Knowledge of the perfection of discipleship, etc.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tatthāpi ukkaṭṭhukkaṭṭhatarukkaṭṭhatamāti dassetuṃ kamena ñāṇattayaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam tattha api ukkaṭṭha ukkaṭṭha tarukkaṭṭhatamā ti dassetum kamena ñāṇa ttayam vuttam
translated: Here too, in order to show the highest, higher, and highest of the high, the three kinds of knowledge are mentioned in order.

original: Tesaṃ pana dānassa paccayabhāvo heṭṭhā vutto eva. Etenevassa brahmasampattiyāpi paccayabhāvo dīpitoti veditabbo.🔽Dānañca nāma dakkhiṇeyyesu hitajjhāsayena vā pūjanajjhāsayena vā attano santakassa🔽paresaṃ pariccajanaṃ, tasmā dāyako sattesu ekantahitajjhāsayo purisapuggalo, so “paresaṃ
analyzed: tesam pana dānassa paccaya bhāvaḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ eva etena ivassa brahma sampattiyā api paccaya bhāvaḥ dīpito ti veditabbo  dānam ca nāma dakkhiṇeyyesu hita ajjhāsayena vā pūjana ajjhāsayena vā attano santakassa  paresam pariccajanam tasmā dāyako sattesu ekanta hita jjhāsayo purisa puggalo so paresam
translated: The conditionality of generosity in relation to these is stated below. By this it should be understood that it is also a condition for the attainment of Brahma.

original: hiṃsati, paresaṃ vā santakaṃ haratī”ti aṭṭhānametanti āha “dānaṃ dadanto sīlaṃ samādātuṃ
analyzed: hiṃsati paresam vā santakam harati iti aṭṭhānam etat ti āha dānam dadantaḥ sīlam samādātum
translated: Generosity is the giving of one’s own property to others out of a desire to benefit or to worship those worthy of gifts. Therefore, a person who is a giver is one who is exclusively desirous of the welfare of beings. It is impossible for him to harm others or to take the property of others. Thus it is said: “One who gives can undertake virtue.”

original: sakkotī”ti. Sīlasadiso alaṅkāro natthīti akittimaṃ hutvā sabbakālaṃ sobhāvisesāvahattā.
analyzed: sakkoti iti sīla sadisaḥ alaṅkāraḥ na atthi iti akittimam hutvā sabbakālam sobhā visesa āvaha ttā
translated: There is no ornament equal to generosity, because it is the only one that shines at all times, having become a special cause for beauty.

original: Sīlapupphasadisaṃ pupphaṃ natthīti etthāpi eseva nayo. Sīlagandhasadiso gandho natthīti🔽ettha “candanaṃ tagaraṃ vāpī”tiādikā gāthā, “gandho isīnaṃ ciradikkhitānaṃ, kāyā🔽cuto gacchati mālutenā”tiādikā ca vattabbā. Sīlañhi sattānaṃ ābharaṇañceva alaṅkāro
analyzed: sīla puppha sadisam puppham natthi iti ettha api esa iva nayaḥ sīla gandha sadisaḥ gandhaḥ natthi iti  ettha candanam tagaram vāpī iti ādikā gāthā gandhaḥ isīnam cira dikkhitānam kāyā  cutaḥ gacchati mālutena ati ādikā ca vattabbā sīlam hi sattānam ābharaṇam ca iva alaṅkāraḥ
translated: There is no flower like the flower of virtue. The same method applies here. There is no scent like the scent of virtue.🔽Herein, the verse beginning “Sandalwood, tagara, and water-lily” and the verse beginning “The scent of the seers who have long gone forth” should be quoted.

original: ca gandhavilepanañca parassa dassanīyabhāvāvahañca. Tenāha “sīlālaṅkārena hī”tiādi.
analyzed: ca gandha vilepanam ca parassa dassanīya bhāva āvahañca tena āha sīla alaṅkārena hi itiādi
translated: For virtue is the adornment and ornament of beings, and it is the scent and unguent that causes others to look on with love. Therefore it is said: “Adorned with the ornament of virtue” .

original: “Ayaṃ saggo labbhatī”ti idaṃ majjhimehi chandādīhi āraddhaṃ sīlaṃ sandhāyāha. Tenāha sakko devarājā –
analyzed: ayam saggaḥ labbhati iti idam majjhimehi chanda ādīhi āraddham sīlam sandhāya āha tena āha sakkaḥ devarājā
translated: “This heaven is obtained” : this is said with reference to virtue that is fulfilled by medium zeal, etc. Therefore Sakka, king of the gods, said:

original: “Hīnena brahmacariyena, khattiye upapajjati;
analyzed: hīnena brahmacariyena khattiye upapajjati
translated: “By the inferior life of celibacy, one is reborn among the warrior-nobles;🔽By the medium life of celibacy, one becomes a god;

original: Majjhimena ca devattaṃ, uttamena visujjhatī”ti. ;🔽Iṭṭhoti sukho, kantoti kamanīyo, manāpoti manavaḍḍhanako, taṃ panassa iṭṭhādibhāvaṃ
analyzed: majjhimena ca devattam uttamena visujjhati iti  iṭṭhaḥ ti sukhaḥ kanto ti kamanīyaḥ manāpo ti tam panassa iṭṭha ādi bhāvam
translated: By the superior life of celibacy, one is purified.”

original: dassetuṃ “niccamettha kīḷā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Niccanti sabbakālaṃ kīḷāti kāmūpasaṃhitā
analyzed: dassetum niccam ettha kīḷā tiādi vuttam niccam ti sabbakālam kīḷā ati kāma upasaṃhitā
translated: Pleasant : delightful. Lovely : lovable. Charming : gladdening. In order to show that it is pleasant, etc., it is said: “One always plays there.” One always plays there with the pleasures of the five senses.

original: sukhavihārā. Sampattiyoti bhogasampattiyo. Dibbanti dibbabhavaṃ devalokapariyāpannaṃ.
analyzed: sukha vihārāḥ sampattiyaḥ ti bhoga sampattiyaḥ dibbanti dibba bhavam deva loka pariyāpannam
translated: “Happy states” : the states of happiness. “Prosperity” : the prosperities of wealth. “Divine” : divine existence, included in the deva-world.

original: Sukhanti kāyikaṃ, cetasikañca sukhaṃ. Dibbasampattinti dibbabhavaṃ āyusampattiṃ,🔽vaṇṇayasaissariyasampattiṃ, rūpādisampattiñca. Evamādīti ādi-saddena yāmādīhi anubhavitabbaṃ
analyzed: sukham ti kāyikam cetasikam ca sukham dibba sampattim ti dibba bhavam āyu sampattim  vaṇṇa ya saissariya sampattim rūpa ādi sampattim ca evamādi iti ādi saddena yāma ādīhi anubhavitabbam
translated: “Bliss” : bodily and mental bliss. “Divine prosperity” : divine existence, the prosperity of life,

original: dibbasampattiṃ vadati.
analyzed: dibba sampattim vadati
translated: the prosperity of beauty, glory, and so on, and the prosperity of visible forms, and so on. “And so on” : by the word “and so on” he includes divine prosperity to be experienced by means of the Yāma and other heavens.

original: Appassādāti nirassādā paṇḍitehi yathābhūtaṃ passantehi tattha assādetabbatābhāvato.
analyzed: appassādā ati nirassādā paṇḍitehi yathābhūtam passantehi tattha assādetabba tā abhāvato
translated: “Unsatisfactory” : unsatisfactory, devoid of satisfaction, because of the absence of anything to be satisfied with there by the wise who see things as they really are.

original: Bahudukkhāti mahādukkhā sampati, āyatiñca vipuladukkhānubandhattā. Bahupāyāsāti anekavidhaparissayā.
analyzed: bahu dukkhā ati mahā dukkhā sampati āyatiñca vipula dukkha anubandha ttā bahu pāyāsā ati anekavidha parissayā
translated: “Full of suffering” : full of great suffering, because of the great suffering that follows in the future. “Full of despair” : full of many kinds of misfortune.

original: Etthāti kāmesu. Bhiyyoti bahuṃ. Dosoti aniccatādinā, appassādatādinā ca dūsitabhāvo,
analyzed: ettha ati kāmesu bhiyyas iti bahum doso ti anicca tā ādinā appassāda tā ādinā ca dūsita bhāvaḥ
translated: “Here” : in sensual pleasures. “More” : much more. “Danger” : the state of being defiled by impermanence, and so on, and by the unsatisfactory nature, and so on,

original: yato te viññūnaṃ cittaṃ nārādhenti. Atha vā ādīnaṃ vāti pavattatīti ādīnavo, paramakapaṇatā,
analyzed: yatas te viññūnam cittam na ārādhenti atha vā ādīnam vāti pavattati iti ādīnavaḥ parama kapaṇa tā
translated: because of which they do not satisfy the minds of the wise. Or alternatively, the danger is that which occurs , thus it is a danger ; it is the state of being extremely contemptible,

original: tathā ca kāmā yathābhūtaṃ paccavekkhantānaṃ paccupatiṭṭhanti. Lāmakabhāvoti nihīnabhāvo
analyzed: tathā ca kāmāḥ yathābhūtam paccavekkhantānam paccupatiṭṭhanti lāmaka bhāvo ti nihīna bhāvo
translated: The state of being low-class: the state of being inferior,🔽because it is frequented by the low-class and not by the high-class.

original: aseṭṭhehi sevitabbattā, seṭṭhehi na sevitabbattā ca. Saṃkilissananti vibādhetabbatā
analyzed: aseṭṭhehi sevitabba ttā seṭṭhehi na sevitabba ttā ca saṃkilissanam ti vibādhetabba tā
translated: The state of being defiled: the state of being disturbed,🔽the state of being heated up.

original: upatāpetabbatā. Nekkhamme ānisaṃsanti ettha yattakā kāmesu ādīnavā, tappaṭipakkhato🔽tattakā nekkhamme ānisaṃsā. Api ca “nekkhammaṃ nāmetaṃ asambādhaṃ asaṃkiliṭṭhaṃ,🔽nikkhantaṃ kāmehi, nikkhantaṃ kāmasaññāya, nikkhantaṃ kāmavitakkehi, nikkhantaṃ kāmapariḷāhehi,🔽nikkhantaṃ byāpādato”tiādinā nayena nekkhamme ānisaṃse pakāsesi, pabbajjāya, jhānādīsu
analyzed: upatāpetabba tā nekkhamme ānisaṃsanti ettha yattakā kāmesu ādīnavā tad paṭipakkhato  tattakāḥ nekkhamme ānisaṃsāḥ api ca nekkhammam nāma etam asambādham asaṃkiliṭṭham  nikkhantam kāmehi nikkhantam kāma saññāya nikkhantam kāma vitakkehi nikkhantam kāma pariḷāhehi  nikkhantam byāpādato ti ādinā nayena nekkhamme ānisaṃse pakāsesi pabbajjāya jhāna ādīsu
translated: The benefits of renunciation: here, the benefits of renunciation are the opposites of the dangers in sensual desires.

original: ca guṇe vibhāvesi vaṇṇesi.
analyzed: ca guṇe vibhāvesi vaṇṇesi
translated: Moreover, he has proclaimed the benefits of renunciation in the way beginning, “Renunciation is uncrowded, unconfined, unencumbered, free from materiality, free from earth, free from hatred” , and so on. He has analyzed and expounded the special qualities of going forth and of the jhānas, etc.,🔽in the way beginning, “The going forth into homelessness is the best in the world” .🔽In the way stated: here, the way not stated is that beginning with “Kallacitta” . There,

original: Vuttanayanti ettha yaṃ avuttanayaṃ “kallacitte”tiādi, tattha kallacitteti kammaniyacitte,
analyzed: ettha yam a vutta nayam kalla citta itiādi tattha kalla citta iti kammaniya citte
translated: kammaniya = kammaniya .

original: heṭṭhā pavattitadesanāya assaddhiyādīnaṃ cittadosānaṃ vigatattā uparidesanāya bhājanabhāvūpagamanena
