analyzed: ekanta gambhīrā uva tattha kasmā gambhīra avabhāsa tā jotitā ati saccam etam ekanta gambhīra tā dassana ttham eva
translated: It is true that it is very deep, but the mention of the appearance of its depth is made in order to show its very deepness.

original: panassa gambhīrāvabhāsaggahaṇaṃ. Tasmā aññattha labbhamānaṃ catukoṭikaṃ byatirekamukhena
analyzed: panassa gambhīra avabhāsa ggahaṇam tasmai aññattha labbhamānam catu koṭikam byatireka mukhena
translated: Therefore, after showing by a method of excess the four-cornered logical problem that occurs elsewhere,🔽he said “one-sided” , etc., in order to demonstrate its very deepness.

original: nidassetvā taṃ evassa ekantagambhīrataṃ vibhāvetuṃ “ekañhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Etaṃ natthīti
analyzed: nidassetvā tam evassa ekanta gambhīra tam vibhāvetum ekañhi itiādi vuttaṃ etam na atthi iti
translated: “This does not exist” .

original: agambhīro, agambhīrāvabhāso cāti etaṃ dvayaṃ natthi, tena yathādassite catukoṭike🔽pacchimā eka koṭi labbhatīti dasseti. Tenāha “ayañhī”tiādi.
analyzed: agambhīro agambhīra avabhāso ca ati etam dvayam na atthi tena yathā dassite catu koṭike  pacchimā eka koṭi labbhati iti dasseti tena āha ayam hi itiādi
translated: Thus he shows that the last one of the four corners is possible in the way stated.

original: Yehi gambhīrabhāvehi paṭiccasamuppādo “gambhīro”ti vuccati, te catūhi upamāhi ulliṅgento
analyzed: yehi gambhīra bhāvehi paṭiccasamuppādaḥ gambhīraḥ ti vuccati te catūhi upamāhi ulliṅgentaḥ
translated: He says “because of the profundity of the dependent origination” in order to show that the dependent origination is called “profound” because of the profundity of the following four things:🔽“Because of the profundity of the condition, of the arising, of the state, and of the penetration.”🔽The meaning of “condition” is the meaning of the conditionality of formations, etc., by ignorance, etc.🔽This cannot be grasped by ordinary knowledge,

original: “bhavaggaggahaṇāyā”tiādimāha. Yathā bhavaggaṃ hatthaṃ pasāretvā gahetuṃ na sakkā
analyzed: bha vagga ggahaṇāya iti ādim āha yathā bha vaggam hattham pasāretvā gahetum na sakkā
translated: just as the top of the world-sphere cannot be grasped by stretching out the hand.🔽The meaning of “arising” is the meaning of the arising of formations, etc., by ignorance, etc.

original: dūrabhāvato, evaṃ saṅkhārādīnaṃ avijjādipaccayasambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho pākatikañāṇena
analyzed: dūra bhāvataḥ evam saṅkhāra ādīnam avijjā ādi paccaya sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭhaḥ pākatika ñāṇena
translated: This cannot be grasped by ordinary knowledge,

original: gahetuṃ na sakkā. Yathā sineruṃ bhinditvā miñjaṃ pabbatarasaṃ pākatikapurisena nīharituṃ
analyzed: gahetum na sakkā yathā sinerum bhinditvā miñjam pabbata rasam pākatika purisena nīharitum
translated: just as the core of Sineru cannot be brought out by an ordinary man by splitting Sineru.

original: na sakkā, evaṃ paṭiccasamuppādagate dhammatthādike pākatikañāṇena bhinditvā vibhajja
analyzed: na sakkā evam paṭiccasamuppāda gate dhamma attha ādike pākatika ñāṇena bhinditvā vibhajja
translated: The meaning of “state” is the meaning of the state of the dhammas of the dependent origination, etc.🔽This cannot be penetrated by ordinary knowledge,

original: paṭivijjhanavasena jānituṃ na sakkā. Yathā mahāsamuddaṃ pākatikapurisassa bāhudvayena
analyzed: paṭivijjhana vasena jānitum na sakkā yathā mahā samuddam pākatika purisassa bāhu dvayena
translated: just as the great ocean cannot be drunk dry by an ordinary man with a pair of bellows.

original: padhārituṃ na sakkā, evaṃ vepullaṭṭhena mahāsamuddasadisaṃ paṭiccasamuppādaṃ pākatikañāṇena
analyzed: padhāritum na sakkā evam vepulla ṭṭhena mahā samudda sadisam paṭiccasamuppādam pākatika ñāṇena
translated: It cannot be borne by the knowledge of the ordinary man.🔽So the dependent origination is like the ocean in the sense of vastness.

original: desanāvasena padhārituṃ na sakkā. Yathā mahāpathaviṃ parivattetvā pākatikapurisassa
analyzed: desanā vasena padhāritum na sakkā yathā mahā pathavim parivattetvā pākatika purisassa
translated: Just as the ordinary man cannot take the earth and turn it over in his hands,

original: pathavojaṃ gahetuṃ na sakkā, evaṃ “itthaṃ avijjādayo saṅkhārādīnaṃ paccayā hontī”ti🔽tesaṃ paccayabhāvo pākatikañāṇena nīharitvā gahetuṃ na sakkāti. Evaṃ catubbidhagambhīratāvasena
analyzed: gahetum na sakkā evam ittham avijjā ādayo saṅkhāra ādīnam paccayāḥ honti iti  tesam paccaya bhāvaḥ pākatika ñāṇena nīharitvā gahetum na sakkāti evam catubbidha gambhīra tā vasena
translated: so he cannot take the dependent origination and turn it over in his knowledge, thinking, “Thus ignorance is a condition for formations, etc.”

original: catasso upamā yojetabbā. Pākatikañāṇavasena cāyamatthayojanā katā diṭṭhasaccānaṃ🔽tattha paṭivedhasabhāvato, tathāpi yasmā sāvakānaṃ, paccekabuddhānañca tattha sappadesameva
analyzed: catasso upamā yojetabbā pākatika ñāṇa vasena ca ayam attha yojanā katā diṭṭha saccānam  tattha paṭivedha sabhāvato tathā api yasmā sāvakānam paccekabuddhānam ca tattha sa ppadesam eva
translated: So the four similes should be construed in accordance with the fourfold profundity.🔽And this interpretation of the meaning has been given in terms of the knowledge of the ordinary man.🔽But although that is so, the knowledge of disciples and paccekabuddhas extends only as far as the principle in the case of the dependent origination,

original: ñāṇaṃ, buddhānaṃyeva nippadesaṃ, tasmā vuttaṃ “buddhavisayaṃ pañha”ntiādi.
analyzed: ñāṇam buddhānam yeva nippadesam tasmā vuttam buddha visayam pañha nti ādi
translated: but that of the Buddhas extends to the principle and its exemplifications. That is why it is said, “The question is one that is in the province of Buddhas” , and so on.

original: Ussādentoti paññāya ukkaṃsento, uggaṇhantoti attho. Apasādentoti nibbhacchanto, niggaṇhantoti attho.
analyzed: ussādento ti paññāya ukkaṃsento uggaṇhanto iti attho apasādento ti nibbhacchantaḥ niggaṇhanto iti attho
translated: “Extolling” means extolling with understanding; the meaning is, “taking up.” “Disparaging” means disparaging; the meaning is, “rejecting.”

original: Ussādanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: ussādanā vaṇṇanā
translated: Extolling and disparaging

original: Tenāti mahāpaññābhāvena. Tatthāti therassa satipi uttānabhāve, paṭiccasamuppādassaaññesaṃ🔽gambhīrabhāve. Subhojanarasapuṭṭhassāti sundarena bhojanarasena positassa. Katayogassāti
analyzed: tena ati mahā paññā bhāvena tattha ati therassa sati pi uttāna bhāve  gambhīra bhāve su bhojana rasa puṭṭhassa ati sundarena bhojana rasena positassa kata yogassa ati
translated: “Ten”: because of his great understanding. “There”: although the elder was straightforward, the dependent origination was profound

original: nibaddhapayogena kataparicayassa. Mallapāsāṇanti mallehi mahabbaleheva ukkhipitabbapāsāṇaṃ.
analyzed: nibaddha payogena kata paricayassa malla pāsāṇam ti mallehi mahabbalehi iva ukkhipitabba pāsāṇam
translated: for others. “Having eaten a fine meal”: having eaten a meal with a fine flavour. “Having done the work”: having done the work with a fixed purpose; the meaning is, “having done the work with a fixed purpose.” “A stone for wrestling”: a stone that has to be lifted by strong men.

original: Kuhiṃ imassa bhāriyaṭṭhānanti kasmiṃ passe imassa pāsāṇassa garutarappadesoti tassa
analyzed: kuhim imassa bhāriya ṭṭhānan ti kasmin passe imassa pāsāṇassa garutara ppadesaḥ ti tassa
translated: “Where is the heavy place of this?” In which part of this stone is the heavy place?

original: sallahukabhāvaṃ dīpento vadati.🔽Timirapiṅgaleneva dīpenti tassa mahāvipphārabhāvato. Tenāha “tassa kirā”tiādi. Pakkuthatīti
analyzed: sat lahuka bhāvam dīpentaḥ vadati  timira piṅgalena iva dīpenti tassa mahā vipphāra bhāvataḥ tena āha tassa kirāti ādi pakkuthati iti
translated: He says this, showing its lightness.

original: pakkuthantaṃ viya parivattati parito vivattati. Lakkhaṇavacanañhetaṃ. Piṭṭhiyaṃ sakalinapadakāpiṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: pakkuthantam viya parivattati paritas vivattati lakkhaṇa vacanam ha etam piṭṭhiyam
translated: They shine like the sun and moon because of their great extension. Therefore he says “Tassa kira” , etc. “It turns over”: it turns over as if it were turning over, it turns around. This is a statement of a characteristic. “On his back, the stone for wrestling”: on his back, the stone for wrestling.

original: Kāyūpapannassāti mahatā kāyena upetassa, mahākāyassāti attho.
analyzed: kāya upapannassa ati mahatā kāyena upetassa mahākāyassa ati attho
translated: ‘One who has come to have a great body’ means one who has come to have a great mass of a body, one who has a great body, is the meaning.

original: Piñchavaṭṭīti piñchakalāpo. Supaṇṇavātanti nāgaggahaṇādīsu pakkhapapphoṭanavasena uppajjanakavātaṃ.
analyzed: piñchavaṭṭī iti piñcha kalāpaḥ supaṇṇa vātam ti nāga ggahaṇa ādīsu pakkha papphoṭana vasena uppajjanaka vātam
translated: ‘A mass of hair’ is a mass of feathers. ‘The Supaṇṇa wind’ is the wind that arises by the flapping of the wings when a Supaṇṇa seizes an elephant, and so on.

original: Pubbūpanissayasampattikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pubba upanissaya sampatti kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the possession of the necessary prerequisites in the past

original: “Pubbūpanissayasampattiyā”tiādinā uddiṭṭhakāraṇāni vitthārato vivarituṃ “ito kirā”tiādi
analyzed: pubba upanissaya sampattiyā iti ādinā uddiṭṭha kāraṇāni vitthārataḥ vivaritum itas kira ati ādi
translated: In order to expound in detail the reasons stated in the above terms beginning with ‘the possession of the necessary prerequisites in the past,’

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha itoti ito kappato. Satasahassimeti satasahassame. Haṃsāvatī nāma nagaraṃ
analyzed: vuttam tattha itas ti itas kappataḥ sata sahassimā iti sata sahassame haṃsāvatī nāma nagaram
translated: it is said: ‘It is said that in the past, etc.’ Herein, ‘in the past’ means in the past world-cycle. ‘A hundred thousand’ means a hundred times a thousand. The city called Haṃsavatī

original: ahosi jātanagaraṃ. Dhurapattānīti bāhirapattāni, yāni dīghatamāni.
analyzed: ahosi jāta nagaram dhura pattāni iti bāhira pattāni yāni dīghatamāni
translated: was a city that had come into existence. ‘The longest streets’ are the streets that were longest outside.

original: Kaniṭṭhabhātāti vemātikabhātā kaniṭṭho yathā amhākaṃ bhagavato nandatthero. Buddhānañhi
analyzed: kaniṭṭha bhātā ati vemātika bhātā kaniṭṭhaḥ yathā amhākam bhagavataḥ nanda ttheraḥ buddhānam hi
translated: ‘The younger brother’ is the younger brother of the same mother, just as the Elder Nandaka was to our Blessed One. For the brothers of the Buddhas

original: sahodarā bhātaro nāma na honti. Kathaṃ jeṭṭhā tāva na uppajjanti, kaniṭṭhānaṃ pana
analyzed: sahodarāḥ bhātaraḥ nāma na honti katham jeṭṭhā tāva na uppajjanti kaniṭṭhānam pana
translated: are not uterine brothers. How is it that the elder brothers do not arise? But the younger brothers

original: asambhavo eva. Bhoganti vibhavaṃ. Upasantoti corajanitasaṅkhobhavūpasamena upasanto janapado.
analyzed: eva vibhavam upasanto iti cora janita saṅkhobha vūpasamena upasantaḥ janapadaḥ
translated: It is impossible. ‘Bho’ is wealth. ‘Tranquil’ means the country was tranquil because of the cessation of the disturbance caused by thieves.

original: Dve sāṭake nivāsetvāti sāṭakadvayameva attano kāyaparihārikaṃ katvā itaraṃ sabbasambhāraṃ attato mocetvā.🔽Pattaggahaṇatthanti antopakkhittauṇhabhojanattā aparāparaṃ hatthe parivattentassa
analyzed: dve sāṭake nivāsetvā ati sāṭaka dvayam eva attano kāya parihārikam katvā itaram sabba sambhāram attataḥ mocetvā  patta ggahaṇa attham ti anta upakkhitta oṇha bhojana ttā apara aparam hatthe parivattentassa
translated: Having put on two pieces of cloth: having made just two pieces of cloth his own personal clothing, and having given up all the rest of his possessions.🔽For the sake of taking a leaf: because of eating hot food put inside, when he was turning it over and over in his hands,

original: pattaggahaṇatthaṃ. Uttarisāṭakanti attano uttarisāṭakaṃ. Etāni pākaṭaṭṭhānānīti etāni
analyzed: patta gahaṇa attham uttari sāṭakan ti attanaḥ uttari sāṭakam etāni pākaṭa ṭṭhānāni iti etāni
translated: it was for the sake of taking a leaf. ‘Upper robe’: his own upper robe. ‘These are the obvious places’: these,

original: yathāvuttāni bhagavato desanāya pākaṭāni therassa puññakaraṇaṭṭhānāni.
analyzed: yathā vuttāni bhagavataḥ desanāya pākaṭāni therassa puñña karaṇa ṭṭhānāni
translated: as stated, are the obvious places for the Elder’s making merit in the Blessed One’s teaching.

original: Paṭisandhiṃ gahetvāti amhākaṃ mahābodhisattassa paṭisandhiggahaṇadivase eva paṭisandhiṃ gahetvā.
analyzed: paṭisandhim gahetvā ti amhākam mahā bodhisattassa paṭisandhi ggahaṇa divase eva paṭisandhim gahetvā
translated: Having taken rebirth: having taken rebirth on the very day of our Great Being’s taking rebirth.

original: Titthavāsādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: tittha vāsa ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Dwellers in the Hells

original: Uggahaṇaṃ pāḷiyā uggaṇhanaṃ. Savanaṃ atthasavanaṃ. Paripucchanaṃ gaṇṭhiṭṭhānesu atthaparipucchanaṃ.
analyzed: uggahaṇam pāḷiyā uggaṇhanam savanam attha savanam paripucchanam gaṇṭhi ṭṭhānesu attha paripucchanam
translated: Learning: learning by heart the texts. Hearing: hearing the meaning. Asking: asking about the meaning at difficult points.

original: Dhāraṇaṃ pāḷiyāpi pāḷiatthassapi citte ṭhapanaṃ. Sabbañcetaṃ idha paṭiccasamuppādavasena veditabbaṃ.🔽Sotāpannānañca…pe... upaṭṭhātitattha sammohaviddhaṃsanena “yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ,🔽sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhamma”nti attapaccakkhavasena upaṭṭhānato. Nāmarūpaparicchedoti
analyzed: dhāraṇam pāḷiyā api citte ṭhapanam sabbam ca etam idha paṭiccasamuppāda vasena veditabbam  sotāpannā nañcape upaṭṭhāti tattha sammoha viddhaṃsanena yam kiñci samudaya dhammam  sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti atta paccakkha vasena upaṭṭhānataḥ nāma rūpa paricchedaḥ ti
translated: Retention is the keeping in mind of the text and the meaning of the text. And all this should be understood here in accordance with dependent origination.🔽And for stream-enterers … and so on. It is the establishment of the fact of the cessation of confusion about the dependent origination by the establishment of the fact of the cessation of confusion about the dependent origination.

original: saha paccayena nāmarūpassa paricchijja avabodho.
analyzed: saha paccayena nāma rūpassa paricchijja avabodho
translated: The delimitation of mentality-materiality is the understanding that comes about through the delimitation of mentality-materiality together with its conditions.

original: Paṭiccasamuppādagambhīratāvaṇṇanā
translated: The profundity of dependent origination

original: “Atthagambhīratāyā”tiādinā saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vivarituṃ “tatthā”tiādi āraddhaṃ.🔽Jātipaccayasambhūtasamudāgataṭṭhoti jātipaccayato sambhūtaṃ hutvā sahitassa attano
analyzed: attha gambhīra tāya ati ādinā saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vivaritum tattha ati ādi āraddham  jāti paccaya sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭhāḥ ti jāti paccayataḥ sambhūtam hutvā sahitassa attano
translated: The meaning of the words “The profundity of the meaning” and so on is now to be made clear.🔽The meaning of “arisen through the condition of birth” is the meaning of “arisen through the condition of birth” as the coming about of the individual existence that has arisen through the condition of birth.

original: paccayānurūpassa jarāmaraṇassa uddhaṃ uddhaṃ āgatabhāvo, anupavattatthoti attho.
analyzed: paccaya anurūpassa jarā maraṇassa uddham uddham āgata bhāvaḥ anupavatta tthaḥ ti attho
translated: The meaning of “come about” is the meaning of “arisen through the condition of birth.”

original: Atha vā sambhūtaṭṭho ca samudāgataṭṭho ca sambhūtasamudāgataṭṭho. “Na jātito jarāmaraṇaṃ
analyzed: atha vā sambhūta ṭṭhaḥ ca samudāgata ṭṭhaḥ ca sambhūta samudāgata ṭṭhaḥ na jātitaḥ jarā maraṇaṃ
translated: Or the meaning of “arisen through the condition of birth” is the meaning of “arisen” and the meaning of “come about.” “Aging-and-death is not due to birth,

original: na hoti,” na ca jātiṃ vinā “aññato hotī”ti hi jātipaccayasambhūtaṭṭho vutto, itthañca
analyzed: na hoti na ca jātim vinā aññatas hoti iti hi jāti paccaya sambhūta ṭṭhaḥ vuttaḥ ittham ca
translated: “It is not without birth,” and “It is not from anything else than birth” are said to show the meaning of being originated by birth through a condition consisting in birth.

original: jātito samudāgacchatīti jātipaccayasamudāgataṭṭho, yā yā jāti yathā yathā paccayo
analyzed: jātitaḥ samudāgacchati iti jāti paccaya samudāgata ṭṭhaḥ yā yā jāti yathā yathā paccayo
translated: And “It comes to be through birth” is said to show the meaning of being originated by birth through a condition consisting in birth. The meaning is that whatever kind of birth there is, it comes to be in accordance with the kind of condition that is present.

original: hoti, tadanurūpapātubhāvoti attho. So anupacitakusalasambhārānaṃ ñāṇassa tattha appatiṭṭhatāya
analyzed: hoti tad anurūpa pātubhāvaḥ ti attho so an upacita kusala sambhārānam ñāṇassa tattha a patiṭṭha tāya
translated: And that is “profound” in the sense of “unfathomable” because of the difficulty of knowing it, since it is not the province of those who have not stored up the equipment of the wholesome roots.

original: agādhaṭṭhena gambhīro. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo.🔽Avijjāya saṅkhārānaṃ paccayaṭṭhoti yenākārena yadavatthā avijjā saṅkhārānaṃ paccayo
analyzed: agādha aṭṭhena gambhīraḥ sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ  avijjāya saṅkhārānam paccaya ṭṭho ti yena ākārena yad avatthā avijjā saṅkhārānam paccayaḥ
translated: The same method of explanation applies in the case of the other terms.🔽The meaning of conditionality in the case of ignorance as condition for formations: in whatever way and in whatever instance ignorance is a condition for formations,

original: hoti. Yena hi pavattiākārena, yāya ca avatthāya avatthitā avijjā tesaṃ tesaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ🔽paccayo hoti, tadubhayassapi duravabodhanīyato avijjā saṅkhārānaṃ navahi ākārehi
analyzed: hoti yena hi pavatti ākārena yāya ca avatthāya avatthitā avijjā tesam tesam saṅkhārānam  paccayaḥ hoti tad ubhayassa api duravabodhanīyataḥ avijjā saṅkhārānam navahi ākārehi
translated: in that same way and in that same instance ignorance is a condition for formations.

original: paccayaṭṭho anupacitakusalasambhārānaṃ ñāṇassa tattha appatiṭṭhatāya agādhaṭṭhena
analyzed: paccaya ṭṭhaḥ an upacita kusala sambhārānam ñāṇassa tattha a patiṭṭha tāya agādha ṭṭhena
translated: And since that is hard to understand, the meaning of conditionality in the case of ignorance as condition for formations is “profound” in the sense of “unfathomable” because of the difficulty of knowing it, since it is not the province of those who have not stored up the equipment of the wholesome roots.

original: gambhīro. Esa nayo sesapadesupi.
analyzed: gambhīraḥ e sa nayaḥ sesa padesupi
translated: The same method of explanation applies in the case of the other terms.

original: Katthaci anulomato desīyati, katthaci paṭilomatoti idha pana paccayuppādā paccayuppannuppādasaṅkhāto🔽anulomo, paccayanirodhā paccayuppannanirodhasaṅkhāto ca paṭilomo adhippeto. Ādito
analyzed: katthaci anulomataḥ desīyati katthaci paṭilomataḥ ti idha pana paccayuppādā paccayuppannuppāda saṅkhāto  anulomaḥ paccaya nirodhā paccaya uppanna nirodha saṅkhāto ca paṭilomaḥ adhippetaḥ āditas
translated: Sometimes it is taught in forward order, sometimes in reverse order. But here what is intended is the forward order as the arising of the arisen conditions and the reverse order as the cessation of the arisen conditions.🔽🔽

translated: The meaning of bending towards the object is the meaning of “bending” . The meaning of causing the arising of a different state in the presence of conditions that are incompatible with materiality is the meaning of “materializing” . The meaning of “world-going,” “world-door,” and “world-field” should be applied to the five beginning with the eye. original: vedayitaṭṭho lakkhaṇavasena. Sukhadukkhama ajjhattabhāvo yathākkamaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ

translated: The meaning of “feeling” is the characteristic. The meaning of “pleasant and painful” is the individual essence of the three kinds of feeling respectively.

original: sabhāvavasena vutto. “Attā vedayatī”ti abhinivesassa balavabhāvato nijjīvaṭṭho vedanāya

original: Sappītikataṇhāya abhinanditaṭṭho. Balavatarataṇhāya gilitvā pariniṭṭhāpanaṃ ajjhosānaṭṭho.

original: viya jāyanaṃ okkantiattho. So jātito nibbattanaṃ nibbattiattho. Kevalaṃ pātubhavanaṃ pātubhāvaṭṭho.
analyzed: viya jāyanam okkanti attho so jātitaḥ nibbattanam nibbatti attho kevalam pātubhavanam pātubhāvaṭṭho
translated: For thus the compound is made up of the words “yonī” and “abhisamkharaṇā.” The meaning of “birth” is “to be born.” But the meaning of “rebirth” is “to be born again” by the meeting of the three. The meaning of “descent” is “to be born” as if descending into the mother’s womb. The meaning of “appearance” is “to be born” from the womb. The meaning of “manifestation” is mere appearance.

original: Jarāmaraṇaṅgaṃ maraṇappadhānanti tassa maraṇaṭṭhā eva khayādayo gambhīrāti dassitā.
analyzed: jarā maraṇaṅgam maraṇa ppadhānanti tassa maraṇa ṭṭhāḥ eva khaya ādayaḥ gambhīrā ati dassitā
translated: The meaning of “death” is the most prominent in the death factor. Thus it is shown that its profundity is due to the other three meanings, “destruction,” etc.

original: Uppannauppannānañhi navanavānaṃ khayena kamena khaṇḍiccādiparipakkapavattiyaṃ loke🔽jarāvohāroti. Khayaṭṭho vā jarāya vuttoti daṭṭhabbo. Navabhāvāpagamo hi “khayo”ti
analyzed: uppanna auppannānam hi nava navānam khayena kamena loke  jarā avohāro ti khaya ṭṭho vā jarāya vutto ti daṭṭhabbaḥ nava bhāva apagamaḥ hi khayaḥ ti
translated: For in the world, the process of aging and death is called “aging” and “death” because of the destruction, etc., of the new and new aggregates that arise.

original: vattuṃ yuttoti vipariṇāmaṭṭho dvinnampi vasena yojetabbo, santativasena vā jarāya
analyzed: vattum yuttaḥ iti vipariṇāma ṭṭhaḥ dvinnam pi vasena yojetabbo santati vasena vā jarāya
translated: Or the meaning of “destruction” should be regarded as stated by way of aging. For “destruction” is suitable to be stated as “the passing away of the new.” The meaning of “change” should be construed by way of both . Or the meaning of “destruction” should be construed by way of aging as the passing away of the continuity.

original: khayavayabhāvā, sammutikhaṇikavasena maraṇassa bhedavipariṇāmaṭṭhā yojetabbā. Avijjādīnaṃ🔽sabhāvo paṭivijjhīyatīti paṭivedho. Vuttañhetaṃ nidānakathāyaṃ “tesaṃ tesaṃ vā tattha
analyzed: khaya vaya bhāvā sammuti khaṇika vasena maraṇassa bheda vipariṇāma ṭṭhā yojetabbā avijjā ādīnam  sabhāvaḥ paṭivijjhīyati iti paṭivedhaḥ vuttam ha etam nidāna kathāyam tesam tesam vā tattha
translated: and the state of dissolution and change should be construed as death in the sense of the conventional and momentary.

original: tattha vuttadhammānaṃ paṭivijjhitabbo salakkhaṇasaṅkhāto aviparītasabhāvo paṭivedho”ti.🔽so hi avijjādīnaṃ sabhāvo maggañāṇeneva asammohapaṭivedhavasena paṭivijjhitabbato
analyzed: tattha vutta dhammānam paṭivijjhitabbaḥ sa lakkhaṇa saṅkhātaḥ aviparīta sabhāvaḥ paṭivedhaḥ ti  saḥ hi avijjā ādīnam sabhāvaḥ magga ñāṇena iva asammoha paṭivedha vasena paṭivijjhitabbato
translated: Penetrating the individual essences of ignorance, etc., is penetration. For this is said in the Nidāna-kathā: “The penetration is the non-erroneous individual essence called the specific characteristic that should be penetrated of the states described here and there” .🔽For that individual essence of ignorance, etc., should be penetrated by means of the knowledge of the path in the sense of non-delusion.

original: aññāṇassa alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhatāya agādhaṭṭhena gambhīro. Sā sabbāpīti sā yathāvuttā🔽saṅkhepato catubbidhā vitthārato anekappabhedā sabbāpi paṭiccasamuppādassa gambhīratā
analyzed: aññāṇassa a labbhaneyya patiṭṭha tāya agādha ṭṭhena gambhīraḥ sā sabbā api iti sā yathā vuttā  saṅkhepataḥ catubbidhā vitthārataḥ aneka ppabhedā sabbā api paṭiccasamuppādassa gambhīra tā
translated: It is deep in the sense of unfathomable because ignorance is not to be found as a self or a being.🔽All that is called “the depth of dependent origination” is what was said.🔽It is all fourfold in brief and manifold in detail.🔽It appeared to the elder as clear as the palm of his hand because he possessed four factors.

original: therassa uttānakā viya upaṭṭhāsi catūhi aṅgehi samannāgatattā. Udāhu aññesampīti
analyzed: therassa uttānakā viya upaṭṭhāsi catūhi aṅgehi samannāgata ttā udāhu aññesam pi iti
translated: Or did it appear to others too?

original: “mayhaṃ tāva esa paṭiccasamuppādo uttānako hutvā upaṭṭhāti, kiṃ nu kho aññesampi
analyzed: mayham tāva esa paṭiccasamuppādaḥ uttānakaḥ hutvā upaṭṭhāti kim nu kho aññesam pi
translated: “This dependent origination appears to me as clear as the palm of my hand. But did it appear to others too?

original: evaṃ uttānako hutvā upaṭṭhātī”ti mā evaṃ avaca mayāva dinnanaye catusaccakammaṭṭhānavidhimhi ṭhatvā.
analyzed: evam uttānakaḥ hutvā upaṭṭhāti iti mā evam avaca mayā ava dinna naye catu sacca kammaṭṭhāna vidhimhi ṭhatvā
translated: “Do not say so.

original: Apasādanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: apasādanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the disparagement

original: Oḷārikanti vatthuvītikkamasamatthatāvasena thūlaṃ. Kāmaṃ kāmarāgapaṭighāyeva atthato
analyzed: oḷārikam ti vatthu vītikkama samattha tā vasena thūlam kāmam kāma rāga paṭighāya iva atthataḥ
translated: “Gross” is gross in the sense of being able to transgress the physical basis.

original: kāmarāgapaṭighasaṃyojanāni, kāmarāgapaṭighānusayā ca, tathāpi aññoyeva saṃyojanaṭṭho
analyzed: kāma rāga paṭigha saṃyojanāni kāma rāga paṭigha anusayā ca tathā api saṃyojana ṭṭhaḥ
translated: Although lust and hate are in fact the lust and hate underlying the fetters, the lust and hate underlying the ties, and the lust and hate underlying the inherent tendencies,🔽nevertheless the meaning of fetter is different from the meaning of inherent tendency,

original: bandhanabhāvato, añño anusayanaṭṭho appahīnabhāvena santāne thāmagamananti katvā,
analyzed: bandhana bhāvataḥ aññaḥ anusayana ṭṭho appahīna bhāvena santāne thāma gamanan ti katvā
translated: since the former is bondage and the latter is the state of lying hidden in the continuity by not being abandoned.

original: iti kiccavisesavisiṭṭhabhede gahetvā “cattāro kilese”ti ca vuttaṃ. Eseva nayo itaresupi.
analyzed: iti kicca visesa visiṭṭha bhede gahetvā cattāro kilese iti ca vuttam esa iva nayaḥ itaresu pi
translated: Thus, taking them as distinguished by the difference in their functions, it is said: “four defilements.” The same method applies to the others.

original: Aṇusahagateti aṇusabhāvaṃ upagate. Tabbhāvattho hi ayaṃ sahagata-saddo “nandirāgasahagatā”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: aṇu sahagata iti aṇu sabhāvam upagate tad bhāva atthaḥ hi ayam sahagata saddaḥ nandi rāga sahagata ati ādīsu viya
translated: “Subtle” : they have become subtle in the sense of having become of the nature of the subtle. For this word “become” has the meaning of “state of being,” just as in such passages as “associated with joy and happiness” .

original: Yathā uparimaggādhigamanavasena saccasampaṭivedho paccayākārapaṭivedhavasena, evaṃ
analyzed: yathā upari magga adhigamana vasena sacca sampaṭivedhaḥ paccaya ākāra paṭivedha vasena evam
translated: Just as the penetration of the four truths is by the attainment of the higher paths, so too

original: sāvakabodhipaccekabodhisammāsambodhiadhigamanavasenapi saccasampaṭivedho paccayākārapaṭivedhavasenevāti
analyzed: sāvaka bodhi pacceka bodhi sammāsambodhi adhigamana vasena api sacca sampaṭivedhaḥ paccaya ākāra paṭivedha vasena iva ati
translated: And the penetration of the truths is the penetration of the way of conditionality.🔽To show this, the following is said: “And why? ”

original: dassetuṃ “kasmā cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sabbathāvāti sabbappakāreneva kiñcipi pakāraṃ asesetvāti🔽attho. Ye katābhinīhārānaṃ mahābodhisattānaṃ vīriyassa ukkaṭṭhamajjhimamudutāvasena🔽bodhisambhārasambharaṇe kālabhedā icchitā, te dassento “cattāri, aṭṭha, soḷasa vā
analyzed: dassetum kasmā ca atiādi vuttam sabbathāvā ti sabba ppakārena iva kiñci pi pakāram a sesetvā iti  atthaḥ ye kata abhinīhārānam mahā bodhisattānam vīriyassa ukkaṭṭha majjhima mudu tā vasena  bodhi sambhāra sambharaṇe kāla bhedāḥ icchitā te dassento cattāri aṭṭha soḷasa vā
translated: “In every way” means in every mode, without leaving out any mode whatsoever.🔽The meaning is that.🔽The four, eight, or sixteen incalculables are mentioned by him who wishes to show the difference in time for the accumulation of the requisites for enlightenment according to the intensity, medium, or mildness of the energy of the great Bodhisattvas who have made their aspiration.

original: asaṅkhyeyyānī”ti āha, svāyamattho cariyāpiṭakavaṇṇanāya gahetabbo. Sāvako padesañāṇe
analyzed: asaṅkhyeyyāni iti āha cariyā piṭaka vaṇṇanāya gahetabbo sāvako padesa ñāṇe
translated: The meaning of this is to be understood from the Cariyāpiṭaka Commentary.🔽The disciple who has stood in the knowledge of parts

original: ṭhitoti sāvako hutvā sekkhabhāvato tatthāpi padesañāṇe ṭhito. Buddhānaṃ kathāya “taṃ🔽tathāgato abhisametī”tiādikāya paccanīkaṃ hoti. Anaññasādhāraṇassa hi vasena buddhānaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ ti sāvakaḥ hutvā sekkha bhāvato tattha api padesa ñāṇe ṭhitaḥ buddhānam kathāya tam  tathāgataḥ abhisameti iti ādikāya paccanīkam hoti anañña sādhāraṇassa hi vasena buddhānam
translated: means the disciple who has stood in the knowledge of parts even there, i.e. in the state of being a learner.🔽The Buddha’s speech is opposed to the statement: “The Tathāgata understands thus.”

original: sīhanādo, na aññasādhāraṇassa.
analyzed: sīha nādaḥ na añña sādhāraṇassa
translated: For the lion’s roar of the Buddhas is in terms of what is not shared by others, not in terms of what is shared by others.

original: “Vāyamantassevā”ti iminā visesato ñāṇasambhārasambharaṇaṃ paññāpāramitāpūraṇaṃ vadati. Tassa ca sabbampi puññaṃ upanissayo.
analyzed: vā ayam antassa iva āti iminā visesataḥ ñāṇa sambhāra sambharaṇam paññāpāramitā pūraṇam vadati tassa ca sabbam pi puññam upanissayaḥ
translated: “By striving” : by this he shows that the accumulation of the requisites of knowledge is the fulfilment of the perfection of wisdom. And all that merit is a condition for the arising of the knowledge of the way.🔽“This treasure, which grants all wishes,

original: “Esa devamanussānaṃ, sabbakāmadado nidhi;
analyzed: esa deva manussānam sabba kāma dadaḥ nidhi
translated: Of gods and men,

original: Yaṃ yadevābhipatthenti, sabbametena labbhatī”ti. –
analyzed: yam yat eva abhipatthenti sabbam etena labbhati iti
translated: By which whatever is desired is obtained.”🔽This is said.🔽Therefore, the accumulation of merit of all the great Bodhisattvas is only for the purpose of the accumulation of knowledge.

original: Hi vuttaṃ. Tasmā mahābodhisattānaṃ sabbesampi puññasambhāro yāvadeva ñāṇasambhārattho🔽sammāsambodhisamadhigamasamatthattāti āha “paccayākāraṃ …pe… natthī”ti. Idāni paccayākārapaṭivedhasseva
analyzed: hi vuttam tasmā mahā bodhisattānam sabbesam pi puñña sambhāraḥ yāvat eva ñāṇa sambhāra atthaḥ  sammāsambodhi samadhigama samattha ttā ti āha paccaya ākāram pe natthi iti idāni paccaya ākāra paṭivedhassa iva
translated: The conditionality of the dependent origination is the condition for the arising of the knowledge of the way.

original: vā mahānubhāvatādassanamukhena paṭiccasamuppādasseva paramagambhīrataṃ dassetuṃ “avijjā”tiādi
analyzed: vā mahā anubhāva tā dassana mukhena paṭiccasamuppādassa iva parama gambhīra tam dassetum avijjā ti ādi
translated: Now, in order to show the supreme profundity of the dependent origination itself by way of showing the great power of the penetration of the conditionality of the dependent origination, “ignorance” and so forth are stated.

original: vuttaṃ. Navahi ākārehīti uppādādīhi navahi ākārehi. Avijjā hi saṅkhārānaṃ uppādo
analyzed: vuttam navahi ākārehi iti uppāda ādīhi navahi ākārehi avijjā hi saṅkhārānam uppādaḥ
translated: By nine aspects means by the nine aspects of arising and so forth. For ignorance is the arising of the formations,

original: hutvā paccayo hoti, pavattaṃ hutvā nimittaṃ, āyūhanaṃ, saṃyogo, palibodho, samudayo,
analyzed: hutvā paccayaḥ hoti pavattam hutvā nimittam āyūhanam saṃyogo palibodho samudayo
translated: and it is a condition by way of being a preceding state. It is the cause by way of being the root cause. It is the foundation by way of being the proximate cause. It is the support by way of being the support. It is the establishment by way of being the establishment. It is the condition by way of being the decisive support. It is the condition by way of being the absence of a counteragent. It is the condition by way of being the absence of a hindrance. It is the condition by way of being the non-relinquishment. It is the condition by way of being the non-abandonment. It is the condition by way of being the non-destruction. It is the condition by way of being the non-interruption. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance. It is the condition by way of being the non-transformation. It is the condition by way of being the non-separation. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance of the non-separation. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance of the non-transformation. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance of the non-destruction. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance of the non-interruption. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance of the non-abandonment. It is the condition by way of being the non-disappearance of the non-relinquishment. It is

original: hetu, paccayo hutvā paccayo hoti. Evaṃ saṅkhārādayo viññāṇādīnaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ paṭisambhidāmagge🔽“kathaṃ paccayapariggahe paññā dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ? Avijjā saṅkhārānaṃ uppādaṭṭhiti
analyzed: hetu paccayaḥ hutvā paccayaḥ hoti evam saṅkhāra ādayaḥ viññāṇa ādīnam vuttam ha etam paṭisambhidā magge  katham paccaya pariggahe paññā dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam avijjā saṅkhārānam uppāda ṭṭhiti
translated: and it is a condition as a condition. So too with formations and the rest in regard to consciousness and the rest. For this is said in the Paṭisambhidā:

original: ca pavattaṭṭhiti ca nimittaṭṭhiti ca āyūhanaṭṭhiti ca saññogaṭṭhiti ca palibodhaṭṭhiti🔽ca samudayaṭṭhiti ca hetuṭṭhiti ca paccayaṭṭhiti ca imehi navahākārehi avijjāpaccayā
analyzed: ca pavatta ṭṭhiti ca nimitta ṭṭhiti ca āyūhana ṭṭhiti ca saññoga ṭṭhiti ca palibodha ṭṭhiti  ca samudaya ṭṭhiti ca hetu ṭṭhiti ca paccaya ṭṭhiti ca imehi navahā ākārehi avijjā paccayā
translated: “How is it that knowledge of the causal relationship of states is understanding of discernment of conditions? Ignorance is a condition for formations as arising condition, presence condition, occurrence condition, disappearance condition, sign condition, inducement condition, support condition, obstruction condition,🔽accumulation condition, root condition, and conditionness condition.

original: saṅkhārā paccayasamuppannā”tiādi.
analyzed: saṅkhārāḥ paccaya samuppannā itiādi
translated: By these nine modes ignorance is a condition for formations that have arisen from conditions” and so on.

original: Tattha navahākārehīti navahi paccayabhāvūpagamanākārehi. Uppajjati etasmā phalanti🔽uppādo, phaluppattiyā kāraṇabhāvo. Sati ca avijjāya saṅkhārā uppajjanti, nāsati,
analyzed: tattha navahā ākārehi iti navahi paccaya bhāva upagamana ākārehi uppajjati etasmai phalanti  uppādaḥ phala uppattiyā kāraṇa bhāvaḥ sati ca avijjāya saṅkhārāḥ uppajjanti na asati
translated: Herein, by these nine modes means by the nine modes of assuming the nature of a condition. Arising is the cause of the occurrence of the fruit.🔽When there is ignorance, formations arise; when there is not, they do not.

original: tasmā avijjā saṅkhārānaṃ uppādo hutvā paccayo hoti. Tathā avijjāya sati saṅkhārā
analyzed: tasmai avijjā saṅkhārānaṃ uppādaḥ hutvā paccayaḥ hoti tathā avijjāya sati saṅkhārā
translated: Therefore ignorance is a condition for formations as arising condition. So too, when there is ignorance, formations occur; when there is not, they do not.

original: pavattanti, nīyanti ca. Yathā ca bhavādīsu khipanti, evaṃ tesaṃ avijjā paccayo hoti.
analyzed: pavattanti nīyanti ca yathā ca bhava ādīsu khipanti evam tesam avijjā paccayaḥ hoti
translated: and they are led on. And as they fling them into becoming, etc., so ignorance is a condition for them.

original: Tathā āyūhanti phaluppattiyā ghaṭenti, saṃyujjanti attano phalena. Yasmiṃ santāne🔽sayaṃ uppannā, taṃ palibundhanti. Paccayantarasamavāye udayanti uppajjanti. Hinoti
analyzed: tathā āyūhanti phaluppattiyā ghaṭenti saṃyujjanti attanaḥ phalena yasmin santāne  sayam uppannā tam palibundhanti paccaya antara samavāye udayanti uppajjanti hinoti
translated: And as they gather them together, they bring about the fruit’s appearance, they are united with their own fruit. In the continuity🔽in which they themselves have arisen, they bind it. They arise, they come to be, when there is a concurrence of other conditions. They go,

original: ca saṅkhārānaṃ kāraṇabhāvaṃ gacchati. Paṭicca avijjaṃ saṅkhārā ayanti pavattantīti
analyzed: ca saṅkhārānam kāraṇa bhāvam gacchati paṭicca avijjam saṅkhārāḥ ayanti pavattanti iti
translated: they become the cause of formations. With ignorance as condition, formations come to be, they are led on.

original: evaṃ avijjāya saṅkhārānaṃ kāraṇabhāvūpagamanavisesā uppādādayo veditabbā. Tattha🔽tathā saṅkhārādīnaṃ viññāṇādīsu uppādaṭṭhitiādīsupi. Tiṭṭhati etenāti ṭhiti, kāraṇaṃ.🔽Uppādo eva ṭhiti uppādaṭṭhiti. Eseva nayo sesesupi. “Paccayo hotī”ti idaṃ idha lokanāthena
analyzed: evam avijjāya saṅkhārānam kāraṇa bhāva upagamana visesāḥ uppāda ādayaḥ veditabbā tattha  tathā saṅkhāra ādīnam viññāṇa ādīsu uppāda ṭṭhiti ādīsu pi tiṭṭhati etena ati ṭhiti kāraṇam  uppādaḥ eva ṭhiti uppāda ṭṭhiti esa iva nayo sesesu pi paccayo hoti iti idam idha lokanāthena
translated: Thus the distinction in the way ignorance is a condition for formations should be understood as the arising, etc.;🔽and so too in the way the formations, etc., are the arising, the presence, etc., of consciousness, etc. Herein,

original: tadā paccayapariggahassa āraddhabhāvadassanaṃ. So ca ārambho ñāyāruḷho “yathā ca
analyzed: tadā paccaya pariggahassa āraddha bhāva dassanam saḥ ca ārambhaḥ ñāya āruḷhaḥ yathā ca
translated: “Presence” is a cause in the sense of “it stands for this” . Arising itself is presence; thus arising and presence are one thing. The same method applies in the case of the rest. “Is a condition” : this shows that the Lord of the World has begun the exposition of the condition clause. And that beginning is well grounded in the knowledge of how it is.

original: purimehi mahābodhisattehi bodhimūle pavattito, tatheva ca pavattito”ti. Acchariyavegābhihatā
analyzed: purimehi mahā bodhisattehi bodhi mūle pavattitaḥ tathā iva ca pavattitaḥ ti acchariya vega abhihatā
translated: and it was just as they had done.

original: dasasahassilokadhātu saṅkampi sampakampīti dassento “diṭṭhamattevā”tiādimāha.🔽Etassa dhammassāti etassa paṭiccasamuppādasaññitassa dhammassa. So pana yasmā atthato
analyzed: dasa sahassi lokadhātu saṅkampi sampakampi iti dassentaḥ diṭṭhamattā iva iti ādim āha  etassa dhammassa ati etassa paṭiccasamuppāda saññitassa dhammassa saḥ pana yasmai atthato
translated: Showing that the ten-thousandfold world system shook and quaked and trembled, struck with the wonder of the knowledge, he said, “At the very sight of it.”🔽“This Dhamma”: this Dhamma called dependent origination. But in meaning

original: hetupabhavānaṃ hetu. Tenāha “etassa paccayadhammassā”ti, jātiādīnaṃ jarāmaraṇādipaccayatāyāti
analyzed: hetu pabhavānam hetu tena āha etassa paccaya dhammassa ati jāti ādīnam jarā maraṇa ādi paccaya tāya ati
translated: it is the cause of the causes of becoming. Therefore he said, “of this condition-dhamma.” The meaning is: the conditionality of birth, etc., by aging-and-death, etc.

original: attho. Nāmarūpaparicchedo, tassa ca paccayapariggaho na paṭhamābhinivesamattena hoti,🔽atha kho tattha aparāparaṃ ñāṇuppattisaññitena anu anu bujjhanena, tadubhayābhāvaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ nāma rūpa paricchedaḥ tassa ca paccaya pariggaho na paṭhama abhinivesa mattena hoti  atha kho tattha apara aparam ñāṇa uppatti saññitena anu anu bujjhanena tad ubhaya abhāvam
translated: The delimitation of mentality-materiality and the discernment of its conditions do not occur merely through the first insight.🔽But rather through repeated insight, called the arising of knowledge again and again, and through the absence of both.

original: pana dassento “ñātapariññāvasena ananubujjhanā”ti āha. Niccasaññādīnaṃ pajahanavasena
analyzed: pana dassentaḥ ñāta pariññā vasena āha nicca saññā ādīnam pajahana vasena
translated: Showing the absence of both, he said, “because of the non-penetration of the full understanding of the known.”🔽Insight occurring through the abandoning of the perception of permanence, etc.,

original: vattamānā vipassanā dhamme ca paṭivijjhantī eva nāma hoti paṭipakkhavikkhambhanena
analyzed: vattamānā vipassanā dhamme ca paṭivijjhantī eva nāma hoti paṭipakkha vikkhambhanena
translated: penetrates the dhammas, so to speak, by suppressing their opposites.

original: tikkhavisadabhāvāpattito, tadadhiṭṭhānabhūtā ca tīraṇapariññā, ariyamaggo ca pariññāpahānābhisamayavasena
analyzed: tikkha visada bhāva āpattito tad adhiṭṭhāna bhūtā ca tīraṇa pariññā ariya maggo ca pariññā apahāna abhisamaya vasena
translated: and because it has become sharp and clear, and also the penetration of the investigation of that, and the noble path, are included in the investigation and the abandoning by the abandoning-comprehension,

original: pavattiyā tīraṇapahānapariññāsaṅgaho cāti tadubhayapaṭivedhābhāvaṃ dassento “tīraṇa…pe…🔽appaṭivijjhanā”ti āha. Tantaṃ vuccati vatthavīnanatthaṃ tantavāyehi daṇḍake āsañjitvā🔽pasāritasuttapaṭṭī tanīyatīti katvā. Taṃ pana suttasantānākulatāya nidassanabhāvena
analyzed: pavattiyā tīraṇa pahāna pariññā saṅgahaḥ ca ati tad ubhaya paṭivedha abhāvam dassento tīraṇa pe  āha tantam vuccati tantavāyehi daṇḍake āsañjitvā  pasārita sutta paṭṭī tanīyati iti katvā tam pana sutta santāna ākula tāya nidassana bhāvena
translated: and the penetration of both of them is shown by “not penetrating the investigation …🔽not penetrating the abandoning.” The warp is called “tanta” because it is stretched out by the weavers on a frame for the purpose of weaving the cloth.🔽But because the warp is confused by the confusion of the threads, it is taken as “ākula” in the sense of being shown.

original: ākulameva gahitanti āha “tantaṃ viya ākulakajātā”ti. Saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vitthārato
analyzed: ākulam eva gahitanti āha tantam viya ākulaka jātā iti saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vitthārato
translated: He said “like the warp, born confused” in order to show the meaning stated in brief.

original: dassetuṃ “yathā nāmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Samānetunti pubbena paraṃ samaṃ katvā ānetuṃ,
analyzed: dassetum yathā nāma atiādi vuttam samānetum ti pubbena param samam katvā ānetum
translated: “To make even”: to make even by making the next one equal to the former,🔽the meaning is: to make uneven even. Or the warp itself, being confused, is “tanta-ākula.”

original: avisamaṃ ujuṃ kātunti attho. Tantameva vā ākulaṃ tantākulaṃ, tantākulaṃ viya jātā
analyzed: avisamam ujum kātunti tantam eva vai ākulam tanta ākulam tanta ākulam viya jātā
translated: They are born like the warp, being confused, thus they are “tanta-ākula-jāta.”

original: bhūtāti tantākulajātā. Majjhimaṃ paṭipadaṃ anupagantvā antadvayapatanena paccayākāre
analyzed: bhūtā ati tantā kula jātā majjhimam paṭipadam an upagantvā anta dvaya patanena paccaya ākāre
translated: Without following the middle way, they fall into the two extremes, and they are confused by the confusion of the conditions.

original: khalitā ākulā byākulā honti. Teneva antadvayapatanena taṃtaṃdiṭṭhigāhavasena paribbhamantā
analyzed: khalitāḥ ākulāḥ byākulāḥ honti tena iva anta dvaya patanena taṃ taṃ diṭṭhi gāha vasena paribbhamantā
translated: They are confused, agitated, and disturbed. Wandering about by reason of that falling into the two extremes and by reason of the grasping of various views,

original: ujukaṃ dhammaṭṭhiti kathaṃ paṭipajjituṃ na jānanti. Tenāha “na sakkonti taṃ paccayākāraṃ
analyzed: ujukam dhamma ṭṭhiti katham paṭipajjitum na jānanti tena āha na sakkonti tam paccaya ākāram
translated: they do not know how to practice the straight way of the stability of the Dhamma. Therefore it is said: “They are not able to make the method of conditions straight.”

original: ujuṃ kātu”nti. Dve bodhisatteti paccekabodhisattamahābodhisatte. Attano dhammatāyāti🔽attano sabhāvena, paropadesena vināti attho. Tattha tattha guḷakajātanti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ
analyzed: ujum kātum ti dve bodhisatte iti paccekabodhisatta mahābodhisatte attanaḥ dhamma tāya ati  sabhāvena para upadesena vinā ati tattha tattha guḷaka jātanti tasmin tasmin
translated: Two kinds of Bodhisattas: Paccekabodhisattas and Mahabodhisattas. By their own nature:

original: ṭhāne jātaguḷakampi gaṇṭhīti suttagaṇṭhi. Tato eva gaṇṭhibaddhaṃ baddhagaṇṭhikaṃ.🔽Paccayesu pakkhalitvāti aniccadukkhānattādisabhāvesu paccayadhammesu niccādiggāhavasena
analyzed: ṭhāne jāta guḷakam pi gaṇṭhī iti sutta gaṇṭhi tatas eva gaṇṭhi baddham baddha gaṇṭhikam  paccayesu pakkhalitvā ti anicca dukkha anatta ādi sabhāvesu paccaya dhammesu nicca ādi gāha vasena
translated: by their own nature, by their own character. The meaning is: they do not wander by the instruction of others. There, here and there, lumps of sugar: lumps of sugar that have arisen in this and that place. A knot: a knot in a thread. Because of that, bound by a knot, bound with a knot.🔽Having fallen into conditions: having fallen into conditions, into conditioned things, by grasping permanence, etc., in regard to impermanence, suffering, non-self, etc.

original: pakkhalitvā. Paccaye ujuṃ kātuṃ asakkontāti tasseva niccādiggāhassa avissajjanato
analyzed: pakkhalitvā paccaye ujum kātum asakkontā ati tassa iva nicca ādiggāhassa a vissajjanato
translated: Not able to make the conditions straight: because of not relinquishing that grasping of permanence, etc.,

original: paccayadhammanimittaṃ attano dassanaṃ ujuṃ kātuṃ asakkontā idaṃsaccābhinivesakāyaganthavasena
analyzed: paccaya dhamma nimittam attanaḥ dassanam ujum kātum asakkontāḥ idaṃsacca abhinivesa kāyagantha vasena
translated: not able to make their own vision of the sign of the conditioned things straight. Because of the bond of the body that consists in insistence upon the true nature of this or that view,

original: gaṇṭhikajātā hontīti āha “dvāsaṭṭhi…pe… gaṇṭhibaddhā”ti. Ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā
analyzed: gaṇṭhika jātāḥ honti iti āha gaṇṭhi baddhā ati ye hi keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: Whatever ascetics and brahmins are bound by the sixty-two views, such as the view of eternalism, etc.,

original: vā sassatadiṭṭhiādidiṭṭhiyo nissitā allīnā.🔽Vinanato “kulā”ti itthiliṅgavasena laddhanāmassa tantavāyassa gaṇṭhikaṃ nāma ākulabhāvena
analyzed: vā sassata diṭṭhi ādi diṭṭhiyaḥ nissitāḥ allīnā  vinanataḥ itthi liṅga vasena laddha nāmassa tantavāyassa gaṇṭhikam nāma ākula bhāvena
translated: they are bound by the knots of views.🔽“The knots of a mat” is the name of a knot of a weaver, which is difficult to untie at the beginning or at the end.

original: aggato vā mūlato vā duviññeyyāyeva khalitatantasuttanti āha “kulāgaṇṭhikaṃ vuccati
analyzed: aggataḥ vā mūlataḥ vā duviññeyyāya iva āha kulāgaṇṭhikam vuccati
translated: Therefore it is said: “The knots of a mat are called the mat-weaver’s knot.”

original: pesakārakañjiyasutta”nti. Sakuṇikāti kulāvakasakuṇikā. Sā hi rukkhasākhāsu olambanakulāvakā
analyzed: sakuṇikā ati kulāvakasakuṇikā sā hi rukkha sākhāsu olambana kulāvakā
translated: “The knots of a bird’s nest” are the knots of a weaver bird. For this bird has a nest hanging from a tree branch,

original: hoti. Tañhi sā kulāvakaṃ tato tato tiṇahīrādike ānetvā tathā vinandhati, yathā tesaṃ🔽pesakārakañjiyasuttaṃ viya aggena vā aggaṃ mūlena vā mūlaṃ samānetuṃ vivecetuṃ vā
analyzed: hoti tat hi sā kulāvakam ānetvā tathā vinandhati yathā  pesakārakañjiya suttam viya aggena vā aggam mūlena vā mūlam samānetum vivecetum vā
translated: and it brings grass, sticks, etc., from here and there and arranges them in such a way that

original: na sakkā. Tenāha “yathā hī”tiādi. Tadubhayampīti “kulāgaṇṭhika”nti vuttaṃ kañjiyasuttaṃ,
analyzed: na sakkā tena āha yathā hi itiādi tat ubhayam pi iti kulāgaṇṭhikam ti vuttam kañjiya suttam
translated: the top and bottom cannot be distinguished, like the mat-weaver’s knot. Therefore it is said: “Just as … ”🔽“Both of these” are the mat-weaver’s knot and the bird’s nest.

original: kulāvakañca. Purimanayenevāti “evameva sattā”tiādinā pubbe vuttanayeneva.
analyzed: kulāvakam ca purima nayena iva āti evam eva satta ati ādinā pubbe vutta nayena iva
translated: and the reed-grass. As before means in the way already stated above with the words “So too, beings” .

original: Kāmaṃ muñjapabbajatiṇāni yathājātānipi dīghabhāvena patitvā araññaṭṭhāne aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: kāmam muñja pabbaja tiṇāni yathā jātāni api dīgha bhāvena patitvā arañña ṭṭhāne aññamaññam
translated: Although the muñja grass, etc., lie in the forest in the same way in which they grew, that is, long, short, etc.,

original: vinandhitvā ākulabyākulāni hutvā tiṭṭhanti, tāni pana na tathā dubbiveciyāni, yathā
analyzed: vinandhitvā ākula byākulāni hutvā tiṭṭhanti tāni pana na tathā dubbiveciyāni yathā
translated: they are not so difficult to sort as the creepers.

original: rajjubhūtānīti dassetuṃ “yathā tānī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sesamettha heṭṭhā vuttanayameva.🔽Apāyāti avaḍḍhitā, sukhena, sukhahetunā vā virahitāti attho. Dukkhassa gatibhāvatoti
analyzed: rajju bhūtāni iti dassetum yathā tāni itiādi vuttam sesam ettha heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva  apāyāti a vaḍḍhitā sukhena sukha hetunā vā virahitā ati atthaḥ dukkhassa gati bhāvato ti
translated: In order to show that, it is said, “As though they were” , etc. The rest here is as already stated above.🔽Depravities: non-development. The meaning is: devoid of pleasure, or of a cause for pleasure.🔽Because they are the destiny for suffering: because they are the place of occurrence of the suffering of the depravities.

original: āpāyikassa dukkhassa pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato. Sukhasamussayatoti abbhudayato. Vinipatitattāti
analyzed: āpāyikassa dukkhassa pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ sukha samussayataḥ ti abbhudayataḥ vinipatita ttā ati
translated: Because they are the opposite of pleasure: because they are the opposite of prosperity.

original: virūpaṃ nipatitattā yathā tenattabhāvena sukhasamussayo na hoti, evaṃ nipatitattā.
analyzed: virūpam nipatita ttā yathā tenatta bhāvena sukha samussayaḥ na hoti evam nipatita ttā
translated: Because they have fallen away: because they have fallen away in such a way that they are the opposite of the kind of prosperity that is pleasure.🔽The other: the round of rebirths.

original: Itaroti saṃsāro. Nanu “apāya”ntiādinā vuttopi saṃsāro evāti? Saccametaṃ, nirayādīnaṃ
analyzed: itaraḥ iti saṃsāraḥ nanu apāyanti ādinā vuttaḥ api saṃsāraḥ eva ati saccam etam niraya ādīnam
translated: But is not the round of rebirths itself what is referred to by the words “depravities,” etc.?🔽That is true, but the round of rebirths is mentioned here in order to show that the round of rebirths is the opposite of the kind of prosperity that is pleasure.

original: pana adhimattadukkhabhāvadassanatthaṃ apāyādiggahaṇaṃ. Gobalībaddañāyenāyamattho
analyzed: pana adhimatta dukkha bhāva dassana attham apāya ādi ggahaṇam
translated: But the mention of the states of loss, etc., is for the purpose of showing the excess of suffering. This meaning should be understood by the method of extension.

original: veditabbo. Khandhānañca paṭipāṭīti pañcannaṃ khandhānaṃ hetuphalabhāvena aparāparaṃ
analyzed: veditabbaḥ khandhānam ca paṭipāṭī iti pañcannam khandhānam hetu phala bhāvena apara aparam
translated: The succession of aggregates: the occurrence of the five aggregates in succession by way of cause and fruit.

original: pavatti. Abbocchinnaṃ vattamānāti avicchedena pavattamānā. Taṃ sabbampīti taṃ “apāya”ntiādinā
analyzed: pavatti abba ucchinnam vattamānā ati avicchedena pavattamānā tam sabbam pi iti tam apāyanti ādinā
translated: Occurring uninterruptedly: occurring without interruption.

original: vuttaṃ sabbaṃ apāyadukkhañceva vaṭṭadukkhañca. “Mahāsamudde vātukkhittanāvā viyā”ti
analyzed: vuttam sabbam apāya dukkham ca iva vaṭṭa dukkham ca mahā samudde vātukkhitta nāvā viyāti
translated: All that: all that suffering in the states of loss, etc., and the suffering of the round of rebirths, mentioned in the passage beginning “in the states of loss” .

original: idaṃ paribbhamaṭṭhānassa mahantadassanatthañceva paribbhamanassa anavaṭṭhitatādassanatthañca
analyzed: idam paribbhama ṭṭhānassa mahanta dassana ttham ca iva paribbhamanassa anavaṭṭhita tā dassana ttham ca
translated: Like a ship driven by the wind on the ocean: this is said in order to show the greatness of the place of wandering and in order to show the non-stopping of the wandering.

original: “upamāya. Yantesu yuttagoṇo viyā”ti idaṃ pana avasabhāvadassanatthañceva duppamokkhabhāvadassanatthañcāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: upamāya yantesu yutta goṇaḥ viyāti idam pana avasa bhāva dassana attham ca iva duppamokkha bhāva dassana attham ca ati veditabbam
translated: Like a bull with a goad in his neck: this should be understood as said in order to show the nature of the beast of prey and in order to show the difficulty of escape.

original: Paṭiccasamuppādavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭiccasamuppāda vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of Dependent Origination

original: Iminā tāvāti ettha tāva-saddo kamattho, tena “tantākulakajātā”ti padassa anusandhi
analyzed: iminā tāvā ti ettha tāva saddo kamattho tena tantā kulaka jātā ti padassa anusandhi
translated: Herein, the word “tāva” has the meaning of “at first.” By it there is a connection with the passage “entangled in a tangle.”

original: parato āvibhavissatīti dīpeti. Atthi idappaccayāti ettha ayaṃ paccayoti idappaccayo,🔽tasmā idappaccayā, imasmā paccayāti attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “imasmā nāma paccayā
analyzed: paratas āvibhavissati iti dīpeti atthi idappaccayā ati ettha ayam paccayo ti idappaccayo  tasmai idappaccayā imasmā paccayā ati atthaḥ idam vuttam hoti imasmā nāma paccayā
translated: He shows that it will be revealed from the other side. As to “Is there a demonstrable condition for this? ” , here this is a condition, thus it is a demonstrable condition ;

original: jarāmaraṇa”nti evaṃ vattabbo atthi nu kho jarāmaraṇassa paccayoti. Tenāha “atthi
analyzed: jarā maraṇanti evam vattabbaḥ atthi nu kho jarā maraṇassa paccayaḥ ti tena āha atthi
translated: therefore it is a demonstrable condition in this way, the meaning is. This is what is said: “Is there anything that can be said thus ‘From this condition there is aging and death’? ”🔽Hence he said “Is there …

original: nu kho…pe… bhaveyyā”ti. Ettha hi “kiṃ paccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ? Jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇa”nti
analyzed: nu khope bhaveyya ati ettha hi kim paccayā jarā maraṇam jāti paccayā jarā maraṇan ti
translated: aging and death? ” Herein, “What is the condition for aging and death? With birth as condition there is aging and death” ,

original: upari jātisaddapaccayasaddasamānādhikaraṇena kiṃ-saddena idaṃ-saddassa samānādhikaraṇatādassanato🔽kammadhārayasamāsatā idappaccayasaddassa yujjati. Na hettha “imassa paccayā idappaccayā”ti
analyzed: upari jāti sadda paccaya sadda samāna adhikaraṇena kiṃsaddena idaṃsaddassa samāna adhikaraṇa tā dassanato  kammadhāraya samāsa tā idappaccaya saddassa yujjati na ha ittha imassa paccayāḥ idappaccayā ti
translated: the word “what” in the compound “what is the condition” is in apposition to the word “condition” in the compound “with birth as condition” ,

original: jarāmaraṇassa, aññassa vā paccayato jarāmaraṇasambhavapucchā sambhavati viññātabhāvato,
analyzed: jarā maraṇassa aññassa vā paccayataḥ jarā maraṇa sambhava pucchā sambhavati viññāta bhāvato
translated: so the compound “demonstrable condition” is a copulative compound. Herein, the question “Is there aging and death that can originate from a condition, or from another condition? ” is not possible, because it is known that

original: asambhavato ca, jarāmaraṇassa pana paccayapucchā sambhavati. Paccayasaddasamānādhikaraṇatāyañca
analyzed: asambhavato ca jarā maraṇassa pana paccaya pucchā sambhavati paccaya sadda samāna adhikaraṇa tā idam ca
translated: and because of the impossibility of aging-and-death, the question of its condition is possible. And because of the co-referentiality of the word “this”

original: idaṃ-saddassa “imasmā paccayā”ti paccayapucchā yujjati.🔽Sā pana samānādhikaraṇatā yadipi aññapadatthasamāsepi labbhati, aññapadatthavacanicchābhāvato
analyzed: idaṃsaddassa imasmā paccayā ati paccaya pucchā yujjati  sā pana samāna adhikaraṇa tā yadi pi añña padattha samāse pi labbhati añña padattha vacanicchā bhāvato
translated: with the word “condition,” the question of the condition of this is appropriate.🔽But although this co-referentiality is found in a compound with a different meaning of the word,

original: panettha kammadhārayasamāso veditabbo. Sāmivacanasamāsapakkhe pana nattheva samānādhikaraṇatāsambhavoti.🔽Nanu ca “idappaccayatā paṭiccasamuppādo”ti ettha idappaccaya-saddo sāmivacanasamāso
analyzed: pana ittha kammadhāraya samāsaḥ veditabbo sāmivacana samāsa pakkhe pana nattha iva samāna adhikaraṇa tā sambhavaḥ ti  nanu ca idappaccaya tā paṭiccasamuppādaḥ ti ettha idappaccaya saddo sāmivacana samāso
translated: here it should be understood as a determinative compound because of the absence of the desire to express a different meaning of the word. But in the case of a compound with a possessive meaning, there is no possibility of co-referentiality.🔽But isn’t the word “this condition” in the passage “This is the conditioned arising, namely: with this as condition that” a compound with a possessive meaning?

original: icchitoti? Saccaṃ icchito ujukameva tattha paṭiccasamuppādavacanicchāti katvā, idha
analyzed: icchito ti saccam icchitaḥ ujukam eva tattha paṭiccasamuppāda vacana icchā ati katvā idha
translated: It is true that it is desired, but there the desire is only for the expression “conditioned arising,” not for

original: pana kevalaṃ jarāmaraṇassa paccayaparipucchā adhippetā, tasmā yathā tattha idaṃ-saddassa
analyzed: pana kevalam jarā maraṇassa paccaya paripucchā adhippetā tasmā yathā tattha idaṃsaddassa
translated: here, only the question of the condition of aging-and-death is intended. Therefore, just as there🔽the word “this” specifies “conditioned arising,” and here

original: paṭiccasamuppādavisesanatā, idha ca “pucchitabbapaccayatthatā sambhavati, tathā tattha,
analyzed: paṭicca samuppāda visesana tā idha ca pucchitabba paccaya ttha tā sambhavati tathā tattha
translated: the meaning of “condition to be asked about” is possible, so too there,

original: idha ca samāsakappanā veditabbā. Kasmā pana tattha kammadhārayasamāso na icchitoti?🔽Hetuppabhavānaṃ hetu paṭiccasamuppādoti imassa atthassa kammadhārayasamāse asambhavatoti
analyzed: idha ca samāsa kappanā veditabbā kasmā pana tattha kammadhāraya samāsaḥ na icchito ti  hetu pabhavānam hetu paṭiccasamuppādaḥ ti imassa atthassa kammadhāraya samāse asambhavato ti
translated: But why is a genitive-locative compound not accepted there?🔽Because the meaning of the compound would be impossible in the sense of “the cause of the cause of the origination of what is subject to the cause of origination.”

original: imassa, attano paccayānurūpassa anurūpo paccayo idappaccayoti etassa ca atthassa
analyzed: imassa attanaḥ paccaya anurūpassa anurūpaḥ paccayaḥ idappaccayaḥ ti etassa ca atthassa
translated: But the meaning of the compound is accepted in the sense of🔽“the condition that is appropriate to its own condition.”

original: icchitattā. Yo panettha idaṃ-saddena gahito attho, so “atthi idappaccayā jarāmaraṇa”nti
analyzed: icchita ttā yaḥ pana ittha idam saddena gahitaḥ attho saḥ atthi idappaccayā jarā maraṇanti
translated: And the meaning of the word idam here is included by the word jarāmaraṇa in the phrase “jarāmaraṇassa paccayā” .🔽So the word idam is used to exclude the Dependent Origination and to refer to the conditions.

original: jarāmaraṇaggahaṇeneva gahitoti idaṃ-saddo paṭiccasamuppādato pariccajanato aññassa🔽asambhavato paccaye avatiṭṭhati, tenettha kammadhārayasamāso. Tattha pana idaṃ-saddassa
analyzed: jarā maraṇa ggahaṇena iva gahito ti idam saddaḥ paṭiccasamuppādataḥ pariccajanataḥ aññassa  asambhavataḥ paccaye avatiṭṭhati tena ittha kammadhāraya samāsaḥ tattha pana idam saddassa
translated: Therefore a genitive-locative compound is used there. But in the passage “atthi idappaccayā jarāmaraṇa” ,🔽there is no reason to exclude anything else.

original: tato pariccajanakāraṇaṃ natthīti sāmivacanasamāso eva icchito. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃpana
analyzed: tatas pariccajana kāraṇam na atthi iti sāmi vacana samāsaḥ eva icchitaḥ
translated: Therefore only a co-ordinate compound is accepted.🔽But in the commentary,

original: yasmā jarāmaraṇādīnaṃ paccayapucchāmukhenāyaṃ paṭiccasamuppādadesanā āraddhā, paṭiccasamuppādo
analyzed: yasmai jarā maraṇa ādīnam paccaya pucchā mukhena ayam paṭiccasamuppāda desanā āraddhā paṭiccasamuppādaḥ
translated: the teaching of the Dependent Origination is begun with the question about the conditions of aging and death, etc.

original: ca nāma atthato hetuppabhavānaṃ hetūti vutto vāyamattho, tasmā “imassa jarāmaraṇassa
analyzed: ca nāma atthataḥ hetu ppabhavānam hetu uti vuttaḥ vā ayam atthaḥ tasmai imassa jarā maraṇassa
translated: and the meaning of “cause” is stated in the sense of “cause of origination” .

original: paccayo”ti evamatthavaṇṇanā katā.
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti evam attha vaṇṇanā katā
translated: So the meaning of the words “condition for this aging-and-death” is stated thus.

original: Paṇḍitenāti ekaṃsabyākaraṇīyādipañhāvisesajānanasamatthāya paññāya samannāgatena.
analyzed: paṇḍitena ati ekaṃsa byākaraṇīya ādi pañha avisesa jānana samatthāya paññāya samannāgatena
translated: Possessed of wisdom: possessed of the wisdom that is able to distinguish the kinds of questions that are to be answered categorically and so on.

original: Tameva hissa paṇḍiccaṃ dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yādisassa jīvassa diṭṭhigatiko
analyzed: tam eva hi ssa paṇḍiccam dassetum yathā itiādi vuttam yādisassa jīvassa diṭṭhi gatikaḥ
translated: For the purpose of showing just that wisdom, the following is said: “As to the question,” etc.🔽The questioner, who is a theorist, asks whether the living being is the same as the body,

original: sarīrato anaññattaṃ pucchati “taṃ jīvaṃ taṃ sarīra”nti, so evaṃ paramatthato nupalabbhati,
analyzed: sarīrataḥ an aññattam pucchati tam jīvam tam sarīran ti saḥ evam paramatthataḥ na upalabbhati
translated: and that is not found in the ultimate sense.

original: kathaṃ tassa vañjhātanayassa viya dīgharassatā sarīrato aññatā vā anaññatā vā byākātabbā
analyzed: katham tassa vañjhā tanayassa viya dīgha rassa tā sarīrataḥ añña tā vā anañña tā vā byākātabbā
translated: How can the length of time of that which is barren of result be stated, or can it be stated whether it is the same as or different from the body?🔽Therefore the question should be set aside.

original: siyā, tasmāssa pañhassa ṭhapanīyatā veditabbā. Tuṇhībhāvo nāmesa pucchato anādaro
analyzed: siyā tasmā assa pañhassa ṭhapanīya tā veditabbā tuṇhībhāvaḥ nāma isa pucchataḥ anādaraḥ
translated: But the questioner’s silence is a lack of respect,🔽as if he were being contemptuous, so the Blessed One says, “This is not to be explained,” in order to show another alternative.

original: vihesā viya hotīti “abyākatameta”nti pakārantaramāha. Evaṃ abyākaraṇakāraṇaṃ ñātukāmassa
analyzed: vihesā viya hoti iti abyākatam etat ti pakāra antaram āha evam abyākaraṇa kāraṇam ñātu kāmassa
translated: Thus,

original: kathetabbaṃ hoti, kathite ca jānantassa pamādopi evaṃ siyā, kathanavidhi pana “yādisassā”tiādinā
analyzed: kathetabbam hoti kathite ca jānantassa pamādaḥ api evam siyā kathana vidhi pana yādisassa ati ādinā
translated: and if he answers, he may be careless in knowing how to answer. But the way of answering is shown by the verse beginning, “As to the kind of question.”

original: dassito eva. Evaṃ appaṭipajjitvāti evaṃ ṭhapanīyapañhe viya tuṇhībhāvādiṃ anāpajjitvā
analyzed: dassitaḥ eva evam appaṭipajjitvā ati evam ṭhapanīya pañhe viya tuṇhībhāva ādim an āpajjitvā
translated: “Without answering as he should”: without answering by remaining silent, etc., as in the case of the questions to be set aside.

original: eva. “Appaṭipajjitvā”ti vacanaṃ nidassanamattametaṃ. “Kiṃ sabbaṃ anicca”nti vutte
analyzed: eva a paṭipajjitvā iti vacanam nidassana mattam etam kim sabbam aniccanti vutte
translated: The words “without answering as he should” are merely an illustration. If he is asked, “Is all impermanent?”

original: “kiṃ saṅkhataṃ sandhāya pucchasi, udāhu asaṅkhata”nti paṭipucchitvā byākātabbaṃ hoti
analyzed: kim saṅkhatam sandhāya pucchasi udāhu a saṅkhatanti paṭipucchitvā byākātabbam hoti
translated: he should counter-question thus, “Are you asking about what is formed or about what is unformed?”🔽and then answer accordingly. If he is asked, “Are the five aggregates of aggregates of what is to be fully understood?”

original: “kiṃ khandhapañcakaṃ pariññeyya”nti puṭṭhe “atthi tattha pariññeyyaṃ, atthi na pariññeyya”nti
analyzed: kim khandha pañcakam pariññeyyanti puṭṭhe atthi tattha pariññeyyam atthi na pariññeyyanti
translated: he should analyze the question thus, “There is what is to be fully understood and what is not to be fully understood”🔽and then answer accordingly. This is the meaning intended here by “without answering as he should.”

original: vibhajja byākātabbaṃ hoti, evaṃ appaṭipajjitvāti ca ayamettha attho icchitoti. Pubbe
analyzed: vibhajja byākātabbam hoti evam a paṭipajjitvā ati ca ayam ettha atthaḥ icchito ti pubbe
translated: The mere presence of the condition was admitted by the answer, “It is.”

original: yassa paccayassa atthitāmattaṃ coditanti atthitāmattaṃ vissajjitaṃ. Pucchāsabhāgena
analyzed: yassa paccayassa atthi tā mattam coditanti atthi tā mattam vissajjitam pucchā sabhāgena
translated: For the answer is by way of question.🔽Now a question in the form of the answer is given: “Again, why?”

original: hi vissajjananti. Idāni tasseva sarūpapucchā karīyatīti “puna ki”nti vuttaṃ. Idhāpi
analyzed: hi idāni tassa iva sarūpa pucchā karīyati iti puna kinti vuttam idha api
translated: Here too,

original: “yathā”tiādi sabbaṃ ānetvā vattabbaṃ.🔽“Esa nayo sabbapadesū”ti atidesavasena ussukkaṃ katvā “nāmarūpapaccayā”tiādinā tattha
analyzed: yathā itiādi sabbam ānetvā vattabbam  esa nayo sabba padesu iti atidesa vasena ussukkam katvā nāma rūpa paccaya āti ādinā tattha
translated: “As” and all the rest should be brought in.🔽“This method applies in all instances” is the over-pervasion. The exception is begun with the words “Name-and-form is a condition for the sixfold base” .

original: apavādo āraddho. Yasmā dassetukāmo, tasmā idaṃ vuttanti yojanā. Channaṃ vipākasamphassānaṃyeva
analyzed: apavādaḥ āraddhaḥ yasmai dassetu kāmo tasmai idam vuttan ti yojanā channam vipāka samphassānam yeva
translated: The reason why he wishes to show this is that in many passages in the suttas and in the Abhidhamma

original: gahaṇaṃ hoti viññāṇādi vedanāpariyosānā vipākavidhīti katvā anekesu suttapadesu,
analyzed: gahaṇam hoti viññāṇa ādi vedanā pariyosānā vipāka vidhi iti katvā anekesu sutta padesu
translated: the six kinds of resultant consciousness beginning with eye-consciousness and ending with mind-consciousness are usually included in the six kinds of resultant contact.

original: abhidhamme ca yebhuyyena tesaṃyeva gahaṇassa niruḷhattā. Idhāti imasmiṃ sutte. Ca-saddo
analyzed: abhidhamme ca yebhuyyena tesaṃ yeva gahaṇassa niruḷha ttā idha ati imasmim sutte ca saddaḥ
translated: Here in this sutta the word “and”

original: byatirekattho, tenettha “gahitampī”tiādinā vuccamānaṃyeva visesaṃ joteti. Paccayabhāvo
analyzed: byatireka atthaḥ tena ittha gahitam pi iti ādinā vuccamānam yeva visesam paccaya bhāvaḥ
translated: signifies inclusion. The distinction is stated with the words “though included” .

original: nāma paccayuppannāpekkho tena vinā tassa asambhavato. Tasmā saḷāyatanappaccayāti
analyzed: nāma paccaya uppanna apekkhaḥ tena vinā tassa asambhavato tasmā
translated: The state of being a condition is dependent on the occurrence of the conditioned, since the latter cannot occur without the former. Therefore the meaning of the expression “with the sixfold base as condition”

original: “saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso”ti iminā padenāti yojanā. Avayavena vā samudāyopalakkhaṇametaṃ
analyzed: saḷāyatana paccayā phasso ti iminā padena ati yojanā avayavena vā samudāya upalakkhaṇam etam
translated: is “with the sixfold base as condition there is contact.” This is the construction. Or else this is a case of characterizing the whole by means of a part.

original: “saḷāyatanapaccayā”ti, tasmā “saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso”ti iminā padenāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: saṅghāyatana paccayā ti tasmā saṅghāyatana paccayā phasso ti iminā padena ati vuttam hoti
translated: “With the sixfold base as condition”: thus it is said with the words “With the sixfold base as condition, contact.”

original: Gahitampīti chabbidhaṃ vipākaphassampi. Aggahitampīti avipākaphassampi kusalākusalakiriyāphassampi.
analyzed: gahitam pi iti chabbidham vipāka phassam pi aggahitam pi iti avipāka phassam pi kusala akusala kiriyā phassam pi
translated: “Also what is included”: also the six kinds of resultant contact. “Also what is not included”: also the functional contact that is neither resultant nor functional.

original: Paccayuppannavisesaṃ dassetukāmoti yojanā. Na cettha paccayuppannova upādinno icchito,🔽atha kho paccayopi upādinno icchitoti ajjhattikāyatanasseva saḷāyatanaggahaṇena gahaṇanti
analyzed: paccaya uppanna visesam dassetu kāmaḥ iti yojanā na ca ittha paccaya uppannaḥ va upādinnaḥ icchito  atha kho paccayaḥ api upādinnaḥ icchito ti ajjhattika āyatanassa iva saḷāyatana ggahaṇena gahaṇanti
translated: The construction is: “Desiring to show the distinction between what is a condition and what is not a condition.” But here what is a condition is not intended as “included,”🔽but rather what is a condition is intended as “not included.”🔽Thus it is said: “Desiring to show the distinction between what is a condition and what is not a condition, he included only the internal bases by mentioning the sixfold base, not the external bases.”

original: katvā vuttaṃ “saḷāyatanato…pe… dassetukāmo”ti. Na hi phassassa cakkhādisaḷāyatanameva🔽paccayo, atha kho “cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati
analyzed: katvā vuttam dassetu kāmaḥ ti na hi phassassa cakkha ādi saḷāyatanam eva  paccayaḥ atha kho cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇam tiṇṇam saṅgati
translated: For the eye, etc., are not the only condition for contact,🔽but visible data, etc., are also conditions for contact, according to the texts: “Dependent on the eye and visible data eye-consciousness arises” , and “The meeting of the three is contact” .

original: phasso”tiādi vacanato rūpāyatanādirūpañca cakkhuviññāṇādināmañca paccayo, tasmā imaṃ
analyzed: phassaḥ tiādi vacanataḥ rūpa āyatana ādi rūpam ca cakkhu viññāṇa ādi nāmam ca paccayaḥ tasmai imaṃ
translated: Therefore, since the visible-data base, etc., are also conditions for contact,

original: cakkhādisaḷāyatanato atirittaṃ āvajjanādi viya sādhāraṇaṃ ahutvā, tassa tassa phassassa
analyzed: cakkha ādi saḷāyatanato atirittam āvajjana ādi viya sādhāraṇam a hutvā tassa tassa phassassa
translated: and that it is not a general condition like adverting, etc., which are over and above the six bases beginning with the eye,

original: sādhāraṇatāya aññaṃ visesapaccayaṃ pi-saddena avisiṭṭhaṃ sādhāraṇapaccayaṃ pidassetukāmo🔽bhagavā, “nāmarūpapaccayā phasso”ti idaṃ vuttanti yojanā. Abhidhammabhājanīyepi imameva
analyzed: sādhāraṇa tāya aññam visesa paccayam pi saddena avisiṭṭham sādhāraṇa paccayam pidassetu kāmo  bhagavā nāma rūpa paccayā phasso ti idam vuttanti yojanā abhidhammabhājanīye pi imam eva
translated: but that it is a general condition in the sense of being a condition for each of the several kinds of contact.🔽The Blessed One, it seems, wanted to show that the general condition is not included by the word “and” in the expression “and contact has name-and-form as its condition,” and so he said, “Contact has name-and-form as its condition.”

original: paccayaṃ sandhāya “nāmarūpapaccayā phasso”ti vuttanti tadaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “paccayavisesadassanatthañceva
analyzed: paccayam sandhāya nāma rūpa paccayā phasso ti vuttanti tad aṭṭhakathā ayam paccaya visesa dassana ttham ca iva
translated: In the Abhidhamma too, this same condition is referred to when it is said, “Contact has name-and-form as its condition” .

original: mahānidānadesanāsaṅgahatthañcā”ti atthavaṇṇanā katā. Paccayānanti jātiādīnaṃ paccayadhammānaṃ.
analyzed: mahā nidāna desanā saṅgaha ttham ca ati attha vaṇṇanā katā paccayānam ti jāti ādīnam paccaya dhammānam
translated: And the commentary to that passage explains the meaning thus: “In order to show the specific condition and in order to include the teaching of the Great Thread” .🔽As to the conditions: as to the states that are conditions for the kinds of states beginning with birth.

original: Nidānaṃ kathitanti jarāmaraṇādikassa nidānattaṃ kathitaṃ ekaṃsiko paccayabhāvo kathito.
analyzed: nidānam kathitanti jarā maraṇa ādikassa nidāna ttam kathitam ekaṃsikaḥ paccaya bhāvaḥ kathito
translated: The source is stated: the specific conditionality of ageing-and-death, etc., is stated, the invariable conditionality is stated.

original: Tañhi tesaṃ paccayabhāve abyabhicārīti dassetuṃ “iti kho paneta”ntiādinā upari desanā
analyzed: tat hi tesam paccaya bhāve abyabhicāri iti dassetum iti kho pana itara ti ādinā upari desanā
translated: For that is invariable in the conditionality for those states. In order to show this, the teaching given above is repeated with the words “Now this is the dependent origination” , etc.

original: pavattā. Nijjaṭeti nijjālake. Niggumbeti nikkhepe. Padadvayenāpi ākulābhāvameva dasseti,
analyzed: pavattā nijjaṭā iti nijjālake niggumbā iti nikkhepe pada dvayena api ākula abhāvam eva dasseti
translated: and so on. “In its own net” : in its own snare. “Cast out” : thrown out. By the two phrases he shows the absence of confusion.

original: tasmā anākulaṃ abyākulaṃ mahantaṃ paccayanidānamettha kathitanti mahānidānaṃ suttaṃ
analyzed: tasmai an ākulam a byākulam mahantam paccaya nidānam ettha kathitam ti mahā nidānam suttam
translated: Therefore the sutta is called the Great Discourse on Causation because a great exposition of conditions is given here, without confusion, without muddle.

original: aññathābhāvassa abhāvato.
analyzed: aññathābhāvassa abhāvato
translated: because there is no otherness.🔽“Of these and those conditions” : of the conditions of these and those states.

original: 98. Tesaṃ tesaṃ paccayānanti tesaṃ tesaṃ jātiādīnaṃ paccayānaṃ. Yasmā paccayabhāvo
analyzed: tesam tesam paccayānam ti tesam tesam jāti ādīnam paccayānam yasmā paccaya bhāvaḥ
translated: Because the state of being a condition is🔽just so, just thus,

original: nāma tehi tehi paccayehi anūnādhikeheva tassa tassa phalassa sambhavato tatho taccho,🔽tappakāro vā sāmaggiupagatesu paccayesu muhuttampi tatho nibbattanadhammānaṃ asambhavābhāvato.
analyzed: nāma tehi tehi paccayehi anūna adhikehi iva tassa tassa phalassa sambhavato  tad pakāraḥ vā sāmaggi upagatesu paccayesu muhuttam pi nibbattana dhammānam asambhava abhāvato
translated: because of the arising of the respective results only through the respective conditions, neither less nor more.

original: Avitatho avisaṃvādanako visaṃvādanākāravirahito aññadhammapaccayehi aññadhammānuppattito.
analyzed: avitathaḥ a visaṃvādanakaḥ visaṃvādana ākāra virahitaḥ añña dhamma paccayehi añña dhamma anuppattito
translated: It is not otherwise, not deceptive, not of a deceptive nature, because one state does not arise from the conditions of another.

original: “Anaññathā”ti vuccati aññathābhāvassa abhāvato. Tasmā “tathaṃ avitathaṃ anaññathaṃ
analyzed: anaññathā ti vuccati aññathābhāvassa abhāvato tasmā tatham avitatham anaññatham
translated: It is said to be “not otherwise” because there is no otherness. Therefore it is “just so, just thus, not otherwise”

original: paccayabhāvaṃ dassetu”nti vuttaṃ. Pariyāyati attano phalaṃ pariggahetvā vattatīti
analyzed: paccaya bhāvam dassetunti vuttam pariyāyati attanaḥ phalam pariggahetvā vattati iti
translated: A condition is what occurs having appropriated its own fruit.🔽“By means of a condition” means by means of a cause.

original: pariyāyo, hetūti āha “pariyāyenāti kāraṇenā”ti. Sabbena sabbanti devattādinā sabbabhāvena🔽sabbā jāti. Sabbathā sabbanti tatthāpi cātumahārājikādisabbākārena sabbā, nipātadvayametaṃ,🔽nipātañca abyayaṃ, tañca sabbaliṅgavibhattivacanesu ekākārameva hotīti pāḷiyaṃ “sabbena
analyzed: pariyāyaḥ hetu iti āha pariyāyena ati kāraṇena ati sabbena sabbanti devattā ādinā sabba bhāvena  sabbā jāti sabbathā sabbanti tattha api cātumahārājika ādi sabba ākārena sabbā nipāta dvayam etam  nipātam ca abyayam tam ca sabba liṅga vibhatti vacanesu eka ākāram eva hoti iti pāḷiyam sabbena
translated: “In every way” means by all the modes of being, such as being a god, etc.🔽“In every respect” means by all the modes of being such as being a Cātumahārājika god, etc. These are two indeclinables.

original: sabbaṃ sabbathā sabba”nti vuttaṃ. Atthavacane pana tassa tassa jātisaddāpekkhāya
analyzed: sabbam sabbathā sabbanti vuttam attha vacane pana tassa tassa jāti sadda apekkhāya
translated: And an indeclinable is invariable in gender and case when it occurs with a noun, an adjective, a verbal noun, or a verb. Therefore in the text it is said: “in every way, in every respect.”

original: itthiatthavuttitaṃ dassetuṃ “sabbākārena sabbā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Imināva nayenāti iminā
analyzed: itthi attha vutti tam dassetum sabba ākārena sabba atiādi vuttam iminā ava nayena ati iminā
translated: But in the sense of meaning, in order to show the feminine gender, it is said: “in every way, in every respect.”🔽“In this way” means in the way stated in the section on the gerund.

original: jātivāre vutteneva nayena. Devādīsūti ādi-saddena gandhabbayakkhādike pāḷiyaṃ āgate,
analyzed: jāti vāre vuttena iva nayena deva ādīsu iti ādi saddena gandha bba yakkha ādike pāḷiyam āgate
translated: “Gods, etc.”: the word “etc.” includes those mentioned in the text such as gandhabbas and yakkhas,

original: tadantarabhede ca saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: tad antara bhede ca saṅgaṇhāti
translated: and those included in their subdivisions.

original: Idha nikkhittaatthavibhajanattheti imasmiṃ “kassaci kimhicī”ti aniyamato uddesavasena
analyzed: idha nikkhitta attha vibhajana atthā iti imasmin kassaci kimhici iti aniyamataḥ uddesa vasena
translated: Here the particle is to be taken as indicating the meaning of the words “kassaci kimhicī” which are stated in the uddesa without any specification.

original: vuttatthassa niddisanatthe jotetabbe nipāto, tadatthajotanaṃ nipātapadanti attho.
analyzed: vutta tthassa niddisana tthe jotetabbe nipātaḥ tad attha jotanam nipāta padanti atthaḥ
