translated: The meaning of the particle is the indication of the meaning stated in the uddesa. The meaning of the words of the particle is the indication of that meaning.

original: Tassāti tassa padassa. Teti dhammadesanāya sampadānabhūtaṃ theraṃ vadati. Seyyathidanti
analyzed: tassa ati tassa padassa te ti dhamma desanāya sampadāna bhūtam theram vadati
translated: “Tassā” means of that word. “Tā” means the elder who is the condition for the teaching of the Dhamma. “Seyyathīdaṃ” means🔽“what are they?”

original: vā te katameti ceti attho. Ye hi “kassacī”ti, “kimhicī”ti ca aniyamato vutto attho,
analyzed: vā te katame iti ca iti atthaḥ ye hi kassaci iti kimhici iti ca aniyamataḥ vuttaḥ atthaḥ
translated: The meaning of “kassaci kimhicī” is stated without any specification.

original: te katameti. Kathetukamyatāpucchā hesā. Devabhāvāyāti devabhāvatthaṃ. Khandhajātīti
analyzed: te katamā iti kathā itu kamyatā pucchā ha esā deva bhāvāya ati deva bhāvattham khandha jātī iti
translated: What are they? This is a question asked with the desire to tell. “For the sake of the divine state” means for the sake of the divine state. “The appearance of the aggregates” means

original: khandhapātubhāvo, yathā khandhesu uppannesu “devā”ti samaññā hoti, tathā tesaṃ uppādoti
analyzed: khandha pātubhāvaḥ yathā khandhesu uppannesu devā ti samaññā hoti tathā tesam uppādo ti
translated: the manifestation of the aggregates. Just as when the aggregates appear, the designation “gods” occurs, so the meaning is the arising of those.

original: attho. Tenāha “yāyā”ti āha. Sabbapadesūti “gandhabbānaṃ gandhabbatthāyā”tiādīsu sabbesu
analyzed: atthaḥ tena āha yāya iti āha sabba padesu iti gandhabbānam gandhabba tthāya ati ādīsu sabbesu
translated: Therefore it is said “yāyā.” “In all the passages” means in all the passages indicating the species, such as “for the sake of the gandhabbas,” and in the passages such as “existence.”

original: jātiniddesapadesu, bhavādipadesu ca. Yena hi nayena sace hi jātīti ayamatthayojanā
analyzed: jāti niddesa padesu bhava ādi padesu ca yena hi nayena sace hi jāti iti ayam attha yojanā
translated: If this is the interpretation of the meaning of “jāti,”

original: katā, jātiniddesapadesova “bhavo”tiādinā bhavādipadesupi so kātabboti. Devāti upapattidevā🔽cātumahārājikato paṭṭhāya yāva bhavaggā dibbanti kāmaguṇādīhi kīḷanti laḷanti viharanti
analyzed: katā bhava uti ādinā bhava ādi padesu pi saḥ kātabbā iti devā ati upapatti devā  cātumahārājikataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva bhavaggāḥ dibbanti kāmaguṇa ādīhi kīḷanti laḷanti viharanti
translated: Gods are those who are reborn in the divine world.🔽They are called “gods” because they shine and play and enjoy themselves and sport and revel with the divine sensual pleasures, etc., from the Cātumahārājika world up to the highest world of all.

original: jotantīti katvā. Gandhaṃ abbanti paribhuñjantīti gandhabbā, dhataraṭṭhassa mahārājassa🔽parivārabhūtā. Yajanti vessavaṇasakkādike pūjentīti yakkhā, tena tena vā paṇidhikammādinā
analyzed: jotanti iti katvā gandham abbanti paribhuñjanti iti gandhabbāḥ dhataraṭṭhassa mahā rājassa  parivāra bhūtāḥ yajanti vessavaṇa sakka ādike pūjenti iti yakkhā tena tena vā paṇidhi kamma ādinā
translated: Gandhabbas are those who enjoy scents. They are the retinue of the great king Dhātarattha.

original: yajitabbā pūjetabbāti yakkhā, vessavaṇassa mahārājassa parivārabhūtā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: yajitabbā pūjetabbā ati yakkhāḥ vessavaṇassa mahā rājassa parivāra bhūtāḥ aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: Yakkhas are those who worship. They worship and honour Vessavaṇa, Sakka, etc., or they are to be worshipped and honoured by such worship and honour as sacrifices, etc., and they are the retinue of the great king Vessavaṇa.🔽But in the commentary they are said without distinction to be non-human beings.

original: pana “amanussā”ti avisesena vuttaṃ. Bhūtāti kumbhaṇḍā, virūḷhakassa mahārājassa parivārabhūtā.
analyzed: pana amanussā ti avisesena vuttam bhūtā ati kumbhaṇḍā virūḷhakassa mahā rājassa parivāra bhūtā
translated: Bhūtas are kumbhaṇḍas, and they are the retinue of the great king Virūḷhaka.🔽But in the commentary they are said without distinction to be any kind of being that has been born.

original: Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “ye keci nibbattasattā”ti avisesena vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhipakkhā bhamaratuppaḷādayo.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam pana ye keci nibbatta sattā ti avisesena vuttam aṭṭhi pakkhāḥ bhamara tuppaḷa ādayo
translated: Aṭṭhas are those with eight legs, such as bees, spiders, etc.

original: Cammapakkhā jatusiṅgālādayo. Lomapakkhā haṃsamorādayo. Sarīsapā ahivicchikasatapadiādayo.
analyzed: cammapakkhāḥ jatu siṅgāla ādayaḥ lomapakkhāḥ haṃsa mora ādayaḥ sarīsapāḥ ahivicchika satapadi ādayo
translated: The skin-born are the jackal, the hyena, etc.; the egg-born are the goose, the peacock, etc.; the womb-born are the snake, the lizard, the centipede, etc.; the spontaneously born are the gods, the denizens of hell, and the intermediate existence.

original: “Tesaṃ tesa”nti idaṃ na yevāpanakaniddeso viya avuttasaṅgahatthaṃ vacanaṃ, atha kho
analyzed: tesam tesam ti idam na viya avutta saṅgaha attham vacanam atha kho
translated: “Of these and those” is not a statement for the purpose of including what is not already included, as in the case of the exposition of the “not-so-classifications.”🔽Rather, it is a statement for the purpose of including what is already included, as in the case of the exposition of the “so-classifications.”

original: ayevāpanakaniddeso viya vuttasaṅgahatthanti. Ādi-saddeneva ca āmeḍitattho saṅgayhatīti🔽āha “tesaṃ tesaṃ devagandhabbādīna”nti. Tadattāyāti taṃbhāvāya, yathārūpesu khandhesu
analyzed: viya vutta saṅgaha tthanti ādi saddena iva ca āmeḍita atthaḥ saṅgayhati iti  āha tesam tesam deva gandhabba ādīn anti tad attāya ati taṃbhāvāya yathārūpesu khandhesu
translated: And the word “and” includes the meaning of “even.”🔽“For the sake of their being” means for the sake of their nature. The meaning is: for the sake of their being of such a nature that when the aggregates occur in such and such a way, the conventional designation “gods,” “gandhabbas,” etc., is used in the world.

original: pavattamānesu “devā gandhabbā”ti lokasamaññā hoti, tathārūpatāyāti attho. Tenāha🔽“devagandhabbādibhāvāyā”ti. “Nirodho, vigamo”ti ca paṭiladdhattālābhassa bhāvo vuccati,
analyzed: pavattamānesu devāḥ gandhabbāḥ ti loka samaññā hoti tathārūpa tāya ati attho tena āha  deva gandhabba ādi bhāvāya ati nirodhaḥ vigamaḥ ti ca paṭiladdha ttā lābhassa bhāvaḥ vuccati
translated: Therefore he says, “for the sake of their being gods, gandhabbas, etc.”🔽“Cessation, separation” is said to be the state of one who has attained the deathless.

original: idha pana accantābhāvo adhippeto “sabbaso jātiyā asatī”ti avatvā “jātinirodhā”ti
analyzed: idha pana accanta abhāvaḥ adhippetaḥ sabbasas jātiyāḥ asati iti avatvā jāti nirodhā ti
translated: But here the intended meaning is absolute non-existence. For if the state of non-existence were intended, the text would have said “with the destruction of birth there is no” and not “with the cessation of birth there is the destruction of …”

original: vuttattāti āha “abhāvāti attho”ti.
analyzed: vutta ttā iti āha abhāvā ti attho ti
translated: Therefore he says, “the meaning is non-existence.”

original: Phalatthāya hinotīti yathā phalaṃ tato nibbattati, evaṃ hinoti pavattati, tassa hetubhāvaṃ
analyzed: phala atthāya hinoti iti yathā phalam tatas nibbattati evam hinoti pavattati tassa hetu bhāvam
translated: He inclines for the sake of fruit: he inclines in such a way that the fruit arises from it; the meaning is that he becomes its cause.

original: upagacchatīti attho. Idaṃ gaṇhatha nanti “idaṃ me phalaṃ, gaṇhatha na”nti evaṃ appeti
analyzed: upagacchati iti attho idam gaṇhatha idam me phalam gaṇhatha nanti evam appeti
translated: He hands over: he hands over as if saying “Take this fruit from me.”

original: viya niyyāteti viya. “Esa nayo”ti avisesaṃ atidisitvā visesamattassa atthaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: viya niyyātā iti viya esa nayo ti avisesam atidisitvā visesa mattassa attham dassetuṃ
translated: The same method applies: after pointing out the non-difference, this is said in order to show the difference in meaning.

original: “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nanu cāyaṃ jāti parinipphannā, saṅkhatabhāvā ca na hoti vikārabhāvato,
analyzed: apica atiādi vuttam nanu ca ayam jāti parinipphannā saṅkhata bhāvā ca na hoti vikāra bhāvato
translated: But is not this birth already accomplished? And is it not a formed state? For it is not a state of change.

original: tathā jarāmaraṇaṃ, tassa kathaṃ sā hetu hotīti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “jarāmaraṇassa
analyzed: tathā jarā maraṇam tassa katham sā hetu hoti iti codanam sandhāya āha jarā maraṇassa
translated: And so too aging-and-death. So how can it be a condition for that? The answer is:

original: hī”tiādi. Tabbhāve bhāvo, tadabhāve ca abhāvo jarāmaraṇassa jātiyā upanissayatā.
analyzed: hi itiādi tad bhāve bhāvaḥ tad abhāve ca abhāvaḥ jarā maraṇassa jātiyāḥ upanissaya tā
translated: The presence and absence of aging-and-death are respectively due to the presence and absence of birth.

original: 99. Okāsapariggahoti pavattiṭṭhānapariggaho. Upapattibhave yujjati upapattikkhandhānaṃ
analyzed: okāsa pariggaho ti pavatti ṭṭhāna pariggahaḥ upapatti bhave yujjati upapatti kkhandhānam
translated: The delimitation of the location: the delimitation of the place of occurrence. It is appropriate in the rebirth-process becoming because the aggregates of the rebirth-process

original: yathāvuttaṭṭhānato aññattha anuppajjanato. Idha panāti imasmiṃ sutte “kāmabhavo”tiādinā
analyzed: yathā vutta ṭṭhānataḥ aññattha anuppajjanataḥ idha pana ati imasmin sutte kāma bhava iti ādinā
translated: do not occur elsewhere than in the place stated. But here in this sutta,

original: āgate imasmiṃ ṭhāne. Kammabhave yujjati kāmabhavādijotanā visesato tassa jātiyā paccayabhāvatoti.
analyzed: āgate imasmim ṭhāne kamma bhave yujjati kāma bhava ādi jotanā visesato tassa jātiyā paccaya bhāvato ti
translated: and it is in this place that it is found. It is in the kamma-process becoming that the illumination of sense-desire becoming, etc., is appropriate, because it is a condition for that birth in particular.

original: Tenāha “so hi jātiyā upanissayakoṭiyāva paccayo”ti. Nanu ca upapattibhavopi jātiyā
analyzed: tena āha so hi jātiyā upanissaya koṭiyā ava paccayaḥ ti nanu ca upapatti bhavaḥ api jātiyā
translated: That is why it is said, “For that is a condition for birth as decisive-support” .🔽But is not rebirth-process becoming also a condition for birth as decisive-support?

original: upanissayavasena paccayo hotīti? Saccaṃ hoti, so pana na tathā padhānabhūto, kammabhavo
analyzed: upanissaya vasena paccayaḥ hoti iti saccam hoti so pana na tathā padhāna bhūto kamma bhavo
translated: It is, but it is not so prominent, for kamma-process becoming is a condition as a generator.

original: pana padhānabhūto paccayo janakabhāvatoti. “So hi jātiyā”tiādi vuttaṃ kāmabhavūpagaṃ
analyzed: pana padhāna bhūtaḥ paccayaḥ janaka bhāvato ti so hi jātiyā itiādi vuttam kāma bhava upagam
translated: That is why it is said, “For that is a condition for birth” , etc.

original: kammaṃ kāmabhavo. Esa nayo rūpārūpabhavesupi. Okāsapariggahova kato“kimhicī”ti iminā
analyzed: kammam kāma bhavaḥ iti iminā
translated: Kamma that has gone to sense-desire becoming is sense-desire becoming. So too with fine-material and immaterial becoming.

original: sattapariggahassa katattā.🔽100. Tiṇṇampi kammabhavānanti kāmakammabhavādīnaṃ tiṇṇampi kammabhavānaṃ. Tiṇṇañca
analyzed: satta pariggahassa kata ttā  tiṇṇam pi kamma bhavānan ti kāma kamma bhava ādīnam tiṇṇam pi kamma bhavānam tiṇṇam ca
translated: The words “and so on” include the seven constituents.🔽Three kinds of kamma-process becoming: the three kinds of kamma-process becoming consisting of sense-desire kamma-process becoming, etc.

original: upapattibhavānanti kāmupapattibhavādīnaṃ tiṇṇañca upapattibhavānaṃ. Tathā sesānipīti
analyzed: upapatti bhavānam ti kāma upapatti bhava ādīnam tiṇṇam ca upapatti bhavānam tathā sesāni api iti
translated: And three kinds of rebirth-process becoming: the three kinds of rebirth-process becoming consisting of sense-desire rebirth-process becoming, etc. So too with the rest.

original: diṭṭhupādānādīni sesupādānānipi tiṇṇampi kammabhavānaṃ, tiṇṇañca upapattibhavānaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhupādāna ādīni tiṇṇam pi kamma bhavānam tiṇṇam ca upapatti bhavānam
translated: The other kinds of clinging, such as the clinging of views, are conditions for the three kinds of kamma-process becoming and for the three kinds of rebirth-process becoming.

original: paccayoti attho. Itīti evaṃ vuttanayena. Dvādasa kammabhavā dvādasa upapattibhavāti
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti attho iti iti evam vutta nayena dvādasa kamma bhavāḥ dvādasa upapatti bhavā ti
translated: This is the meaning. In this way: twelve kinds of kamma-process becoming and twelve kinds of rebirth-process becoming

original: catuvīsatibhavā veditabbā. Yasmā kammabhavassa paccayabhāvamukheneva upādānaṃ upapattibhavassa
analyzed: catuvīsati bhavāḥ veditabbāḥ yasmā kamma bhavassa paccaya bhāva mukhena iva upādānam upapatti bhavassa
translated: should be understood as the twenty-four kinds of becoming. Since clinging is a condition for kamma-process becoming only as a condition for the kamma-process becoming,

original: paccayo nāma hoti, na aññathā, tasmā upādānaṃ kammabhavassa ujukameva paccayabhāvoti
analyzed: paccayaḥ nāma hoti na aññathā tasmai upādānam kamma bhavassa ujukam eva paccaya bhāvaḥ ti
translated: and not otherwise, it is only as a condition for kamma-process becoming that the actual state of being a condition is evident in clinging.

original: āha “nippariyāyenettha dvādasa kammabhavā labbhantī”ti. Tesanti kammabhavānaṃ. Sahajātakoṭiyāti🔽akusalassa kammabhavassa sahajātaṃ upādānaṃ sahajātakoṭiyā, itaraṃ anantarūpanissayādivasena
analyzed: āha nippariyāyena ittha dvādasa kamma bhavāḥ labbhanti iti kamma bhavānam sahajāta koṭiyā ti  akusalassa kamma bhavassa sahajātam upādānam sahajāta koṭiyāḥ itaram ananta rūpa nissaya ādi vasena
translated: Therefore it is said: “Here, literally, there are twelve kinds of kamma-process becoming.”🔽The words “in the case of these” refer to the kamma-process becoming. The words “in the case of the co-nascent” refer to the co-nascent clinging that is a condition for unwholesome kamma-process becoming, and the other kinds of clinging that are conditions for it by way of decisive support, prenascence, postnascence, etc.

original: upanissayakoṭiyā, kusalassa kammabhavassa pana upanissayakoṭiyāva paccayo. Ettha
analyzed: upanissaya koṭiyā kusalassa kamma bhavassa pana upanissaya koṭiyā ava paccayaḥ ettha
translated: are conditions for wholesome kamma-process becoming only by way of decisive support.

original: ca yathā aññamaññanissayasampayuttaatthiavigatādipaccayānaṃ sahajātapaccayena ekasaṅgahataṃ
analyzed: ca yathā aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata ādi paccayānam sahajāta paccayena eka saṅgahatam
translated: and how the other conditions, such as the condition being due to decisive support, being due to association, being due to presence, and being due to non-disappearance, are included in the condition being due to arising together,

original: dassetuṃ “sahajātakoṭiyā”ti vuttaṃ, evaṃ ārammaṇūpanissayaanantarūpanissayapakatūpanissayānaṃ🔽ekajjhaṃ gahaṇavasena “upanissayakoṭiyā”ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽101. Upādānassāti ettha kāmupādānassa taṇhā upanissayakoṭiyāva paccayo, sesupādānānaṃ sahajātakoṭiyāpi upanissayakoṭiyāpi viññāṇādi ca vedanāpariyosānā vipākavidhīti katvā.
analyzed: dassetum sahajāta koṭiyā iti vuttam evam ārammaṇa upanissaya anantara upanissaya pakata upanissayānam  ekajjham gahaṇa vasena upanissaya koṭiyā ti vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ  upādānassa ati ettha kāma upādānassa taṇhā upanissaya koṭiyā āva paccayaḥ sesa upādānānam sahajāta koṭiyā api upanissaya koṭiyā api viññāṇa ādi ca vedanā pariyosānā vipāka vidhi iti katvā
translated: and just as the conditions of mutuality, conascence, association, presence, non-disappearance, etc., are included in the one condition of conascence in order to show them, so too the object condition, the prenascence condition, the prenascence support condition, and the postnascence support condition are included in the one condition of support in order to show them.🔽. As to ‘with the condition of clinging’: here craving is a condition for sense-desire clinging only by way of the support condition, but for the other kinds of clinging it is a condition by way of the conascence condition as well as by way of the support condition. And consciousness, etc., down to feeling are a state of result,

original: 102. Yadidaṃ vedanāti ettha vipākavedanāti tameva tāva upanissayakoṭiyā paccayo itarakoṭiyā asambhavato. Aññāti kusalākusalakiriyavedanā. Aññathāpīti sahajātakoṭiyāpi.
analyzed: yat idam vedanā ati ettha vipāka vedanā ati tam eva tāva upanissaya koṭiyā paccayaḥ itara koṭiyā asambhavataḥ aññā ati kusala akusala kiriya vedanā aññathā api iti sahajāta koṭiyā api
translated: . As to ‘with the condition of feeling’: here feeling as a state of result is a condition only by way of the support condition for the other kinds of clinging, not by way of the other condition, since it is a state of result. The other kinds of feeling, namely, profitable, unprofitable, and functional, are a condition by way of the support condition and also by way of the conascence condition.

original: 103. Ettāvatāti jarāmaraṇādīnaṃ paccayaparamparādassanavasena pavattāya ettakāya
analyzed: ettāvatā iti jarā maraṇa ādīnam paccaya paramparā dassana vasena pavattāya ettakāya
translated: . As to ‘so far’: in the exposition of the succession of conditions beginning with ageing-and-death.

original: desanāya. Purimataṇhanti purimabhavasiddhaṃ taṇhaṃ. “Esa paccayo taṇhāya, yadidaṃ
analyzed: desanāya purima taṇhanti purima bhava siddham taṇham esa paccayaḥ taṇhāya yat idam
translated: in the teaching. Craving in the past: craving that has been accomplished in a previous existence. “This is a condition for craving, namely,

original: vedanā”ti vatvā tadanantaraṃ “phassapaccayā vedanāti iti kho panetaṃ vutta”ntiādinā
analyzed: vedanā iti vatvā tad anantaram phassa paccayā vedanā ti iti kho pana itam vutta nti ādinā
translated: In the exposition. Craving in the past : craving that has arisen in a previous existence. “Craving has feeling as its condition” .

original: vedanāya paccayabhūtassa phassassa uddharaṇaṃ aññesu suttesu āgatanayena paṭiccasamuppādassa🔽desanāmaggo, taṃ pana anotaritvā samudācārataṇhādassanamukheneva taṇhāmūlakadhamme
analyzed: vedanāya paccaya bhūtassa phassassa uddharaṇam aññesu suttesu āgata nayena paṭiccasamuppādassa  desanā maggo tam pana an otaritvā samudācāra taṇhā dassana mukhena iva taṇhā mūlaka dhamme
translated: After that, the picking out of contact, which is the condition for feeling, is the way of exposition of dependent origination as it occurs in other suttas.

original: desento āciṇṇadesanāmaggato okkamanto viya, tañca desanaṃ passato appavattanti pasayha🔽balakkārena desento viya ca hotīti āha “idānī”tiādi. Dve taṇhāti idhādhippetataṇhā🔽eva dvidhā bhindanto āha. Esanataṇhāti bhogānaṃ pariyesanavasena pavattataṇhā. Esitataṇhāti
analyzed: desento āciṇṇa desanā maggataḥ okkamantaḥ viya tat ca desanam passataḥ appavattanti pasayha  balakkārena desentaḥ viya ca hoti iti āha idāni itiādi dve taṇhā ati idha adhippeta taṇhā  eva dvidhā bhindantaḥ āha esana taṇhā ati bhogānam pariyesana vasena pavatta taṇhā esita taṇhā ti
translated: But the Blessed One, instead of following that way of exposition, as if he were going out of the way, teaches the states rooted in craving by showing the craving that occurs in the mode of assuming.🔽And he does so as if he were teaching by the method of a “direct challenge” , as if he were saying: “I will teach the Dhamma to one who has no faith in the Dhamma as it is taught by me.”🔽Craving is twofold : he divides the craving intended here into two kinds. Craving for search : craving that occurs in the mode of searching for enjoyments. Craving for what is searched : craving that arises in regard to the enjoyments that have been searched for.

original: pariyiṭṭhesu bhogesu uppajjamānataṇhā. Samudācārataṇhāyāti pariyuṭṭhānavasena pavattataṇhāya.
analyzed: pariyiṭṭhesu bhogesu uppajjamāna taṇhā samudācāra taṇhāya ati pariyuṭṭhāna vasena pavatta taṇhāya
translated: Craving that occurs in the mode of assuming : craving that occurs in the mode of assuming.

original: Duvidhāpesā vedanaṃ paṭicca taṇhā nāma vedanāpaccayā ca appaṭiladdhānaṃ bhogānaṃ🔽paṭilābhāya pariyesanā, laddhesu ca tesupātabyatāpattiādi hotīti.
analyzed: duvidhā apesā vedanam paṭicca taṇhā nāma vedanā paccayā ca appaṭiladdhānam bhogānam  paṭilābhāya pariyesanā laddhesu ca tesupātabya tā āpatti ādi hoti iti
translated: Craving is twofold as craving for sense desires and craving for fine-material and immaterial states. It is called craving because it is a state of seeking in the sense of seeking for the sense desires that have not been obtained, and because it is a state of seeking in the sense of seeking for the enjoyment of those that have been obtained.🔽It is a state of seeking in the sense of seeking for the enjoyment of those that have been obtained.

original: Paritassanavasena pariyesati etāyāti pariyesanā. Āsayato, payogato ca pariyesanā🔽tathāpavatto cittuppādo. Tenāha “taṇhāya sati hotī”ti. Rūpādiārammaṇapaṭilābhoti
analyzed: paritassana vasena pariyesati etāyāti pariyesanā āsayataḥ payogataḥ ca pariyesanā  tathā pavatto cittuppādo tena āha taṇhāya sati hoti iti rūpa ādi ārammaṇa paṭilābhaḥ ti
translated: The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽It is a state of seeking in the sense of seeking for the enjoyment of those that have been obtained.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.

original: savatthukānaṃ rūpādiārammaṇānaṃ gavesanavasena, pavattiyaṃ pana apariyiṭṭhaṃyeva🔽labbhati, tampi atthato pariyesanāya laddhameva nāma tathārūpassa kammassa pubbekatattā
analyzed: sa vatthukānam rūpa ādi ārammaṇānam gavesana vasena pavattiyam pana a pariyiṭṭham yeva  labbhati tat pi atthataḥ pariyesanāya laddham eva nāma tathārūpassa kammassa pubbekata ttā
translated: The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.

original: eva labbhanato. Tenāha “so hi pariyesanāya sati hotī”ti. Sukhavinicchayanti sukhaṃ
analyzed: eva tena āha saḥ hi pariyesanāya sati hoti iti sukha vinicchayanti
translated: The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.🔽The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.

original: visesato nicchinotīti sukhavinicchayo, sukhaṃ sabhāvato, samudayato, atthaṅgamanato,
analyzed: visesataḥ nicchinoti iti sukha vinicchayaḥ sukham sabhāvataḥ samudayataḥ atthaṅgamanato
translated: The state of seeking is a state of seeking by way of inclination and by way of activity.

original: nissaraṇato ca yāthāvato jānitvā pavattañāṇaṃ, taṃ sukhavinicchayaṃ. Jaññāti jāneyya.
analyzed: nissaraṇataḥ ca yāthāvataḥ jānitvā pavatta ñāṇam tam sukha vinicchayam jaññāti jāneyya
translated: And the knowledge that occurs when one has known the escape from them as it actually is is the “happy discovery” . “One should know” : one should know.

original: “Subhasukha”ntiādikaṃ ārammaṇe abhūtākāraṃ vividhaṃ ninnabhāvena nicchinoti āropetīti
analyzed: ārammaṇe abhūta ākāram vividham ninna bhāvena nicchinoti āropeti iti
translated: “The pleasant and the agreeable” , etc., is the various ways of misrepresenting an object. He “measures it down” by the act of lowering it.

original: vinicchayo. Assādānupassanataṇhādiṭṭhiyāpi evameva vinicchayabhāvo veditabbo. Imasmiṃ
analyzed: vinicchayaḥ assāda anupassana taṇhā diṭṭhiyā api evam eva vinicchaya bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ imasmin
translated: “Discovery” : the act of discovering should be understood in the same way as “discovery of pleasure in pain” , “discovery of pleasure in sensual desires” , and “discovery of pleasure in views” .🔽But in this sutta only the discovery of pleasure in thinking is mentioned.

original: pana sutte vitakkoyeva āgatoti yojanā. Imasmiṃ pana sutteti sakkapañhasutte. tattha
analyzed: pana sutte vitakko yā iva āgato ti yojanā imasmin pana sutta iti sakka pañha sutte tattha
translated: In this sutta : in the Sakkapañhasutta .

original: hi “chando kho, devānaṃ inda, vitakkanidāno”ti āgataṃ. Idhāti imasmiṃ mahānidānasutte.🔽“Vitakkeneva vinicchinātī”ti etena “vinicchīyati etenāti vinicchayo”ti vinicchaya-saddassa
analyzed: hi chandaḥ khalu devānam inda vitakka nidānaḥ ti āgatam idha ati imasmim mahānidāna sutte  vitakkena iva vinicchināti iti etena vinicchīyati etena ati vinicchayaḥ ti vinicchaya saddassa
translated: For there it is said: “Desire, ruler of the gods, has thinking as its source” . Here : in the Mahānidānasutta .🔽“By thinking it is discovered” : by this phrase he shows that the word “discovery” is a gerundive formed from the verbal root nicch with the prefix vi .

original: karaṇasādhanamāha. “Ettaka”ntiādi vinicchayanākāradassanaṃ.
analyzed: karaṇa sādhanam āha ettakantiādi vinicchayana ākāra dassanam
translated: “So much” , etc., shows the mode of discovery.

original: Chandanaṭṭhena chando, evaṃ rañjanaṭṭhena rāgo, svāyaṃ anāsevanatāya mando hutvā
analyzed: chandana ṭṭhena chandaḥ evam rañjana ṭṭhena rāgaḥ an āsevana tāya mandaḥ hutvā
translated: Desire is so called in the sense of wishing . Craving is so called in the sense of relishing . This is weak because it is not cultivated.

original: pavatto idhādhippetoti āha “dubbalarāgassādhivacana”nti. Ajjhosānanti taṇhādiṭṭhivasena🔽abhinivisanaṃ. “Mayhaṃ ida”nti hi taṇhāgāho yebhuyyena attaggāhasannissayova hoti.🔽Tenāha “ahaṃ mama”nti, “balavasanniṭṭhāna”nti ca tesaṃ gāhānaṃ thirabhāvappattimāha.
analyzed: pavattaḥ idha adhippetaḥ ti āha dubbala rāgassa adhivacanam ti ajjhosānam ti taṇhā diṭṭhi vasena  abhinivisanam mayham idam ti hi taṇhā gāhaḥ yebhuyyena attaggāha sannissayaḥ uva hoti  tena āha aham mamanti ca tesam gāhānam thira bhāva ppattim āha
translated: Clinging is the act of adhering through craving and views.🔽For the grasping of craving is for the most part dependent on the grasping of the self.🔽Hence it is said: “I am,” “mine.” “Strong determination” refers to the stability of the grasping.

original: Taṇhādiṭṭhivasena pariggahakaraṇanti “ahaṃ mama”nti balavasanniṭṭhānavasena abhiniviṭṭhassa🔽attattaniyaggāhavatthuno aññāsādhāraṇaṃ viya katvā pariggahetvā ṭhānaṃ, tathāpavatto🔽lobhasahagatacittuppādo. Attanā pariggahitassa vatthuno yassa vasena parehi sādhāraṇabhāvassa
analyzed: taṇhā diṭṭhi vasena pariggaha karaṇam ti aham mama nti balava sanniṭṭhāna vasena abhiniviṭṭhassa  atta tta niyaggāha vatthuno añña a sādhāraṇam viya katvā pariggahetvā ṭhānam tathāpavatto  lobha sahagata cittuppādaḥ attanā pariggahitassa vatthunaḥ yassa vasena parehi sādhāraṇa bhāvassa
translated: The act of appropriation through craving and views is the act of appropriating by way of the strong determination “I am,” “mine,” as if it were not shared by others, of the object of the grasping of the self and what belongs to the self.🔽The arising of consciousness accompanied by greed is the act of appropriation.

original: asahamāno hoti puggalo, so dhammo asahanatā. Evaṃ vacanatthaṃ vadanti niruttinayena.
analyzed: asahamānaḥ hoti puggalaḥ saḥ dhammaḥ asahana tā evam vacana attham vadanti nirutti nayena
translated: The state of being intolerant is the state of being unable to bear the fact that the object appropriated by oneself is shared with others. This is the meaning of the term according to the method of explanation in the commentaries.

original: Saddalakkhaṇe pana yassa dhammassa vasena macchariyayogato puggalo maccharo, tassa
analyzed: sadda lakkhaṇe pana yassa dhammassa vasena macchariya yogataḥ puggalo maccharaḥ tassa
translated: But according to the method of explanation in the Suttas, the state of being a miser is the state of being a miser due to the connection with miserliness by way of a certain state.

original: bhāvo, kammaṃ vā macchariyaṃ, macchero dhammo. Macchariyassa balavabhāvato ādarena
analyzed: bhāvaḥ kammam vā macchariyam maccheraḥ dhammo macchariyassa balava bhāvataḥ ādarena
translated: and the state of being miserly, the action of miserliness, the miserly person, the thing miserly. Because of the strength of miserliness, the guarding is done with effort.🔽Therefore it is said: “The guarding of the doors of the sense faculties, etc., is the guarding of what is his own.”

original: rakkhaṇaṃ ārakkhoti āha “dvāra…pe… suṭṭhu rakkhaṇa”nti. Attano phalaṃ karotīti karaṇaṃ,
analyzed: rakkhaṇam ārakkho ti āha dvārape suṭṭhu rakkhaṇanti attanaḥ phalam karoti iti karaṇam
translated: The cause is that which brings about its own fruit.

original: yaṃ kiñci kāraṇaṃ, adhikaṃ karaṇanti adhikaraṇaṃ, visesakāraṇaṃ. Visesakāraṇañca
analyzed: yam kiñci kāraṇam adhikam adhikaraṇanti adhikaraṇam visesa kāraṇam visesa kāraṇam ca
translated: Any cause is a reason. An additional reason is a special reason.

original: bhogānaṃ ārakkhadaṇḍādānādianatthasambhavassāti vuttaṃ “ārakkhādhikaraṇa”ntiādi.🔽Paranisedhanatthanti māraṇādinā paresaṃ vibādhanatthaṃ. Ādīyati etenāti ādānaṃ, daṇḍassa
analyzed: bhogānam ārakkha daṇḍa ādāna ādi anattha sambhavassa ati vuttam ārakkha adhikaraṇa ntiādi  para nisedhana tham ti māraṇa ādinā paresam vibādhana tham ādīyati etena ati ādānam daṇḍassa
translated: And because of the possibility of the arising of harm through the guarding of wealth, the taking of the stick, etc., it is said: “The taking of the stick, etc., is the reason for the guarding of what is his own.”🔽The purpose of the stick is for the purpose of restraining others, for the purpose of killing, etc., for the purpose of afflicting others.

original: ādānaṃ daṇḍādānaṃ, abhibhavitvā paraviheṭhanacittuppādo. Satthādānepi eseva nayo.🔽Hatthaparāmāsādivasena kāyena kātabbakalaho kāyakalaho. Mammaghaṭṭanādivasena vācāya
analyzed: ādānam daṇḍa ādānam abhibhavitvā para viheṭhana cittuppādo sattha ādāne pi esa iva nayo  hattha parāmāsa ādi vasena kāyena kātabba kalahaḥ kāya kalahaḥ mamma ghaṭṭana ādi vasena vācāya
translated: That by which one takes up the stick is the taking of the stick, the arising of the thought of afflicting others after overpowering them. The same method applies to the taking of the sword.🔽A quarrel that is to be done by body, by means of the seizing of sticks, etc., is a quarrel by body.🔽A quarrel that is to be done by speech, by means of the striking of the chest, etc., is a quarrel by speech.

original: kātabbakalaho vācākalaho. Virujjhanavasena virūpaṃ gaṇhāti etenāti viggaho. Viruddhaṃ
analyzed: kātabba kalahaḥ vācā kalahaḥ virujjhana vasena virūpam gaṇhāti etena ati viggahaḥ viruddham
translated: By means of the taking of what is contrary, one seizes what is contrary. A quarrel is a dispute.

original: vadati etenāti vivādo. Tuvaṃ tuvanti agāravavacanasahacaraṇato tuvaṃ tuvaṃ, sabbete🔽tathāpavattā dosasahagatacittuppādā veditabbā. Tenāha bhagavā “aneke pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: vadati etena ati vivādaḥ tuvam tuvanti agārava vacana sahacaraṇato tuvam tuvam sabba ete  tathā pavattā dosa sahagata cittuppādā veditabbā tena āha bhagavā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalā
translated: Vivāda is that by which one speaks, i.e. the dispute. Tuvaṃ tuvaṃ is tuvaṃ tuvaṃ because of the association with the word of disrespect. All these should be understood as the arising of the thought-conception associated with hate. Therefore the Blessed One said: “Many are the evil unwholesome states

original: dhammā sambhavantī”ti.🔽112. Desanaṃ nivattesīti “taṇhaṃ paṭicca pariyesanā”tiādinā anulomanayena pavattitaṃ
analyzed: dhammāḥ sambhavanti iti  desanam nivattesi iti taṇham paṭicca pariyesanā ati ādinā anuloma nayena pavattitam
translated: ‘Dispute’ is what is said by ‘dispute’ . ‘You, you’ is ‘you, you’ in the sense of ‘you, you’ as a term of disrespect. All these are to be understood as the occurrence of the unprofitable consciousness accompanied by hate. Hence the Exalted One said: ‘Many bad unwholesome states come into being’ .

original: desanaṃ paṭilomanayena puna “ārakkhādhikaraṇa”nti ārabhanto nivattesi. Pañcakāmaguṇikarāgavasenāti🔽ārammaṇabhūtā pañca kāmaguṇā etassa atthīti pañcakāmaguṇiko, tattha rañjanavasena🔽abhiramaṇavasena pavattarāgo, tassa vasena uppannā rañjanavasena taṇhāyanavasena
analyzed: desanam paṭiloma nayena puna ārakkha adhikaraṇam ti ārabhantaḥ nivattesi pañca kāmaguṇika rāga vasena ati  ārammaṇa bhūtā pañca kāmaguṇā etassa atthi iti pañcakāmaguṇikaḥ tattha rañjana vasena  abhiramaṇa vasena pavatta rāgaḥ tassa vasena uppannā rañjana vasena taṇhāyana vasena
translated: ‘He turned the teaching round’: having set the teaching going by the forward order in the way beginning, ‘With craving as decisive support, seeking comes to be,’ he turned it round by setting it going again in the reverse order, beginning, ‘With guarding as decisive support, seeking comes to be.’🔽‘By means of the lust for the five strands of sensual desire’: the five strands of sensual desire that are objects are what is meant. The lust that occurs by way of delighting in and enjoying that is ‘lust for the five strands of sensual desire.’ The craving that occurs by way of delighting in and enjoying that same lust for the five strands of sensual desire is ‘lust for sensual desires.’

original: pavattā rūpāditaṇhāva kāmesu taṇhāti kāmataṇhā. Bhavati atthi sabbakālaṃ tiṭṭhatīti
analyzed: pavattā rūpa ādi taṇhā ava kāmesu taṇhā ati kāma taṇhā bhavati atthi sabbakālam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: ‘It exists, it is, it occurs, it happens’ .

original: pavattā bhavadiṭṭhi uttarapadalopena bhavo, taṃsahagatā taṇhā bhavataṇhā. Vibhavati
analyzed: pavattā bhava diṭṭhi uttara pada lopena bhavaḥ tad sahagatā taṇhā bhava taṇhā vibhavati
translated: The view that occurs as “existence” is “existence” with the elision of the middle term. Craving associated with that is “craving for existence.”

original: vinassati ucchijjatīti pavattā vibhavadiṭṭhi vibhavo uttarapadalopena, taṃsahagatā
analyzed: vinassati ucchijjati iti pavattā vibhava diṭṭhi vibhavaḥ uttara pada lopena tad sahagatā
translated: The view that occurs as “non-existence” is “non-existence” with the elision of the middle term. Craving associated with that is “craving for non-existence.”

original: taṇhā vibhavataṇhāti āha “sassatadiṭṭhī”tiādi. Ime dve dhammāti “esa paccayo upādānassa,
analyzed: taṇhā vibhava taṇhā ti āha sassata diṭṭhi itiādi ime dve dhammā ti esa paccayaḥ upādānassa
translated: The two ideas are the craving at the root of the round and the craving in actual existence, which are stated thus: “This is a condition for clinging, namely, craving” ,

original: yadidaṃ taṇhā”ti evaṃ vuttā vaṭṭamūlataṇhā ca “taṇhaṃ paṭicca pariyesanā”ti evaṃ🔽vuttā samudācārataṇhā cāti ime dve dhammā. Vaṭṭamūlasamudācāravasenāti vaṭṭamūlavasena
analyzed: yat idam taṇhā iti evam vuttā vaṭṭa mūla taṇhā ca taṇham paṭicca pariyesanā ati evam  vuttā samudācāra taṇhā ca ati ime dve dhammā vaṭṭa mūla samudācāra vasena ati vaṭṭa mūla vasena
translated: and thus: “With craving as condition, search” .🔽By the two sections: by the two parts.🔽By the two factors: by the two components.

original: ceva samudācāravasena ca. Dvīhi koṭṭhāsehīti dvīhi bhāgehi. Dvīhi avayavehi samosaranti
analyzed: ca iva samudācāra vasena ca dvīhi koṭṭhāsehi iti dvīhi bhāgehi dvīhi avayavehi samosaranti
translated: They converge here by the two factors: they occur equally by the two factors.

original: nibbattanavasena samaṃ vattanti itoti samosaraṇaṃ, paccayo, ekaṃ samosaraṇaṃ etāsanti
analyzed: nibbattana vasena samam vattanti itas ti samosaraṇam paccayaḥ ekam samosaraṇam etāsanti
translated: Convergence is a condition. They have one convergence, thus they are of one convergence.

original: ekasamosaraṇā. Kena pana ekasamosaraṇāti āha “vedanāyā”ti. Dvepi hi taṇhā vedanāpaccayā
analyzed: eka samosaraṇā kena pana eka samosaraṇā ti āha vedanāya ati dve api hi taṇhāḥ vedanā paccayā
translated: But by what are they of one convergence? He said “by feeling.” For both kinds of craving have feeling as their condition.

original: evāti. Tenāha “vedanāpaccayena ekapaccayā”ti. Tato tato osaritvā āgantvā samavasanaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: eva iti tena āha vedanā paccayena eka paccayā ti tatas tatas osaritvā āgantvā samavasana ṭṭhānam
translated: From here and there, having come down, the place of meeting🔽is the “coming down and meeting together” .

original: osaraṇa samosaraṇaṃ. Vedanāya samaṃ saha ekasmiṃ ārammaṇe osaraṇakapavattanakā vedanā
analyzed: osaraṇa samosaraṇam vedanāya samam saha ekasmin ārammaṇe osaraṇaka pavattanakā vedanā
translated: With feeling, together, in one object, the coming down and the occurrence are feeling.

original: samosaraṇāti āha “idaṃ sahajātasamosaraṇaṃ nāmā”ti.
analyzed: āha idam sahajāta samosaraṇam nāma ati
translated: The meeting together is said to be the “conascence meeting together” .

original: 113. Sabbeti uppattidvāravasena bhinditvā vuttā savipākaphassā eva viññāṇādi vedanāpariyosānā
analyzed: sabbā iti uppatti dvāra vasena bhinditvā vuttā sa vipāka phassā eva viññāṇa ādi vedanā pariyosānā
translated: “All” : the resultant consciousnesses, etc., ending with feeling, which are spoken of by dividing them up according to the doors of origination,🔽are called the “resultant process” because they are the “resultant course” .

original: vipākavithīti katvā. Paṭiccasamuppādakathā nāma vaṭṭakathāti āha “ṭhapetvā cattāro🔽lokuttaravipākaphasse”ti. Bahudhāti bahuppakārena. Ayañhi pañcadvāre cakkhupasādādivatthukānaṃ
analyzed: vipāka vithī iti katvā paṭiccasamuppāda kathā nāma vaṭṭa kathā ti āha ṭhapetvā cattāro  lokuttara vipāka phassa iti bahudhā ti bahuppakārena ayam hi pañca dvāre cakkhu pasāda ādi vatthukānam
translated: The “exposition of dependent origination” is called the “exposition of the round” . Therefore he said “excepting the four supramundane resultant processes” .🔽“Many” : of many kinds. For this resultant process, in the five doors, is the contact of eye-contact, etc., of the five kinds of feeling with eye-sensitivity, etc., as their basis,

original: pañcannaṃ vedanānaṃ cakkhusamphassādiko phasso sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākaāhārasampayuttaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: pañcannam vedanānam cakkhu samphassa ādiko phasso sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra sampayutta atthi avigata vasena
translated: by way of conascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, association, presence, and non-disappearance.

original: aṭṭhadhā paccayo hoti. Sesānaṃ pana ekekasmiṃ dvāre sampaṭicchanasantīraṇatadārammaṇavasena
analyzed: aṭṭhadhā paccayaḥ hoti sesānam pana ekekasmim dvāre sampaṭicchana santīraṇa tad ārammaṇa vasena
translated: It is a condition in eight ways. But the contact of eye-contact, etc., is a condition in one way, as decisive-support condition,

original: pavattānaṃ kāmāvacaravipākavedanānaṃ cakkhusamphassādiko phasso upanissayavasena🔽ekadhāva paccayo hoti. Manodvārepi tadārammaṇavasena pavattānaṃ kāmāvacaravipākavedanānaṃ🔽sahajātamanosamphasso tatheva aṭṭhadhā paccayo hoti, tathā paṭisandhibhavaṅgacutivasena
analyzed: pavattānam kāmāvacara vipāka vedanānam cakkhu samphassa ādikaḥ phassaḥ upanissaya vasena  ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti manaḥ dvāre pi tad ārammaṇa vasena pavattānam kāmāvacara vipāka vedanānam  sahajāta manaḥ samphasso tathā iva aṭṭhadhā paccayaḥ hoti tathā paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti vasena
translated: for the resultant feeling in the sense sphere that occurs in the eye door, etc., in the way already stated.🔽And in the mind door too, the conascent contact of mind-contact is a condition in the same way for the resultant feeling in the sense sphere that occurs in the way already stated.🔽So too, the conascent contact of mind-contact is a condition in the same way for the resultant feeling in the three planes that occurs in the way already stated.

original: pavattānaṃ tebhūmakavipākavedanānaṃ. Yā pana tā manodvāre tadārammaṇavasena pavattā🔽kāmāvacaravedanā, tāsaṃ manodvārāvajjanasampayutto manosamphasso upanissayavasena
analyzed: pavattānam tebhūmaka vipāka vedanānam yā pana tā manaḥ dvāre tad ārammaṇa vasena pavattā  kāmāvacara vedanā tāsam manaḥ dvāra āvajjana sampayuttaḥ manaḥ samphassaḥ upanissaya vasena
translated: But the contact of mind-contact that is conascent with the registration in the mind door is a condition in one way, as decisive-support condition,

original: ekadhāva paccayo hotīti evaṃ phasso bahudhā vedanāya paccayo hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti iti evam phassaḥ bahudhā vedanāya paccayaḥ hoti iti veditabbam
translated: for the resultant feeling in the sense sphere that occurs in the way already stated. This is how it should be understood that contact is a condition for feeling in many ways.

original: 114. Vedanādīnanti vedanāsaññāsaṅkhāraviññāṇānaṃ. Asadisabhāvāti anubhavanasañjānanābhisaṅkharaṇavijānanabhāvā.🔽Te hi aññamaññavidhurena vedayitādirūpena ākiriyanti paññāyantīti ākārāti vuccanti.🔽Teyevāti vedanādīnaṃ te eva vedayitādiākārā. Sādhukaṃ dassiyamānāti sakkaccaṃ paccakkhato
analyzed: vedanā ādīnam ti vedanā saññā saṅkhāra viññāṇānam asadisa bhāvā ati anubhavana sañjānana abhisaṅkharaṇa vijānana bhāvā  te hi aññamañña vidhurena vedayita ādi rūpena ākiriyanti paññāyanti iti ākārā ati vuccanti  teyeva iva ati vedanā ādīnam te eva vedayita ādi ākārā sādhukam dassiyamānā iti sakkaccam paccakkhataḥ
translated: 114. The words “feeling, etc.” include feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness. “Their individual essences”: the essences of experiencing, perceiving, forming, and cognizing.🔽For these are called “aspects” because they are known as the functions of experiencing, etc., which are distinct from each other.

original: viya pakāsiyamānā. Taṃ taṃ līnamatthaṃ gamentīti “arūpaṭṭho ārammaṇābhimukhanamanaṭṭho”ti
analyzed: tam tam līnam attham gamenti iti arūpa ṭṭhaḥ ārammaṇa abhimukha namana ṭṭho ti
translated: “Those very”: those very aspects of experiencing, etc., of feeling, etc. “Are well shown”: are well revealed as if directly perceived. “They go to the various meanings”: they go to, they reach, the various meanings, which are not explicit, such as “the meaning of the formless,” “the meaning of directing the mind to the object.”

original: evamādikaṃ taṃ taṃ līnaṃ apākaṭamatthaṃ gamenti ñāpentīti liṅgāni. Tassa tassa sañjānanahetutoti
analyzed: evamādikam tam tam līnam apākaṭam attham gamenti ñāpenti iti liṅgāni tassa tassa sañjānana hetuto ti
translated: “The signs”: they are signs because they are inferred from the various meanings.🔽“The causes of the various perceptions”: because they are the causes of the various kinds of perception, such as the perception of the formless, etc.

original: tassa tassa arūpaṭṭhādikassa sallakkhaṇassa kāraṇattā. Nimīyanti anumīyanti etehīti
analyzed: tassa tassa arūpa ṭṭhā ādikassa sat lakkhaṇassa kāraṇa ttā nimīyanti anumīyanti etehi iti
translated: “The indications”: they are indications because they are inferred from these .

original: nimittāni. Tathā tathā arūpabhāvādippakārena, vedayitādippakārena ca uddisitabbato
analyzed: nimittāni tathā tathā arūpa bhāva ādi ppakārena vedayita ādi ppakārena ca uddisitabbato
translated: “In such and such a way”: in the way of the formless, etc., and in the way of experiencing, etc.

original: kathetabbato uddesā. Tasmāti “asadisabhāvā”tiādinā vuttamevatthaṃ kāraṇabhāvena paccāmasati.
analyzed: kathetabbataḥ uddesā tasmā iti asadisa bhāvā ti ādinā vuttam evattham kāraṇa bhāvena
translated: and the headings are for the purpose of teaching. So the words “because of the state of being dissimilar” are repeated here as the reason for the meaning stated in the words “because of the state of being dissimilar.”

original: Yasmā vedanādīnaṃ aññamaññaasadisabhāvā yathāvuttenatthena ākārādayo, tasmā ayaṃ
analyzed: yasmai vedanā ādīnam aññamañña asadisa bhāvāḥ yathā vuttena atthena ākāra ādayaḥ tasmai ayam
translated: Since feeling, etc., are dissimilar to each other, they are the aspects, etc., in the way already stated. Therefore this

original: idāni vuccamāno ettha pāḷipade attho.🔽Nāmasamūhassāti ārammaṇābhimukhaṃ namanaṭṭhena “nāma”nti laddhasamaññassa vedanādicatukkhandhasaṅkhātassa🔽arūpadhammapuñjassa. Paññattīti “nāmakāyo arūpakalāpo arūpino khandhā”tiādikā paññāpanā
analyzed: idāni vuccamānaḥ ettha pāḷi pade atthaḥ  nāma samūhassa ati ārammaṇa abhimukham namana ṭṭhena nāmanti laddha samaññassa vedanā ādi catu khandha saṅkhātassa  arūpa dhamma puñjassa paññatti iti nāma kāyaḥ arūpa kalāpaḥ arūpino khandhā ati ādikā paññāpanā
translated: is the meaning of the terms in the text that is now being commented on.🔽Of the aggregate of mentality: of the mass of immaterial states called the four mental aggregates, feeling, etc., which have the common characteristic of cognizing, and which are called “mentality” in the sense of bending towards the object.🔽Designation: the designation “aggregate of mentality,” “mass of immaterial states,” “immaterial aggregates,” and so on.

original: hoti. Cetanāpadhānattā saṅkhārakkhandhadhammānaṃ “saṅkhārānaṃ cetanākāre”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: hoti cetanā apadhāna ttā saṅkhāra kkhandha dhammānam saṅkhārānam cetanā ākāra itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: Since the states of the formations aggregate are dominated by volition, it is said: “The formations are in the aspect of volition.”

original: Tathā hi suttantabhājanīye saṅkhārakkhandhavibhajane “yā cetanā sañcetanā sañcetayitatta”nti
analyzed: tathā hi suttanta bhājanīye saṅkhāra kkhandha vibhajane yā cetanā sañcetanā
translated: For in the exposition of the formations aggregate in the Suttantabhājanīya, volition alone is specified thus: “Volition, will, mental volition, acting of consciousness” .

original: cetanāva niddiṭṭhā. Asatīti asantesu. Vacanavipallāsena hi evaṃ vuttaṃ. Cattāro khandhe
analyzed: cetanā ava niddiṭṭhā asatī iti asantesu vacana vipallāsena hi evam vuttam cattāro khandhe
translated: Non-existent: the meaning is, in the non-existent four aggregates. For this is said by a reversal of the statement.

original: vatthuṃ katvāti vedanā saññā cittaṃ cetanādayoti ime catukkhandhasaññite nissayapaccayabhūte
analyzed: vatthum katvā ati vedanā saññā cittam cetanā ādayo ti ime catu khandha saññite nissaya paccaya bhūte
translated: “Having a physical basis” means having as a basis the four aggregates called feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, which are the conditions by state.

original: dhamme vatthuṃ katvā. Ayañca nayo pañcadvārepi sambhavatīti “manodvāre”ti visesitaṃ.
analyzed: dhamme vatthum katvā ayam ca nayo pañca dvāre api sambhavati iti manaḥ dvāra iti visesitam
translated: And this method applies also to the five doors, so “in the mind door” is specified.

original: Adhivacanasamphassavevacanoti adhivacanamukhena paññattimukhena gahetabbattā “adhivacanasamphasso”ti
analyzed: adhivacana samphassa vevacano ti adhivacana mukhena paññatti mukhena gahetabba ttā adhivacana samphassaḥ ti
translated: “Conveying terms” is a name given to contact because it can be apprehended by means of terms, that is, by means of concepts.

original: laddhanāmo. Soti manosamphasso. Pañcavokāre ca hadayavatthuṃ nissāya labbhanato rūpakāye
analyzed: laddha nāmo so ti mano samphasso pañcavokāre ca hadaya vatthum nissāya labbhanato rūpa kāye
translated: “So” refers to mind-contact. And because it occurs in the five doors having a physical basis in the heart-basis in the material body,

original: paññāyateva, ayaṃ pana nayo idha na icchito vedanādipaṭikkhepavasena asambhavapariyāyassa🔽jotitattāti “pañcapasāde vatthuṃ katvā uppajjeyyā”ti attho vutto. Na hi vedanāsannissayena
analyzed: paññāyate iva ayam pana nayaḥ idha na icchitaḥ vedanā ādi paṭikkhepa vasena asambhava pariyāyassa  jotita ttā ti pañcapasāde vatthum katvā uppajjeyya ati atthaḥ vuttaḥ na hi vedanā sannissayena
translated: it is known in the material body. But this method is not accepted here, because it is shown by the negative way that it is impossible without the aggregates beginning with feeling.

original: vinā pañcapasāde vatthuṃ katvā manosamphassassa sambhavo atthi. Uppattiṭṭhāne asati
analyzed: vinā pañca pasāde vatthum katvā mano samphassassa sambhavaḥ atthi uppatti ṭhāne asati
translated: So the meaning is stated as “having a physical basis in the five strands of sense pleasure.” For there is no possibility of mind-contact having a physical basis in the five strands of sense pleasure without a physical basis consisting of the aggregates beginning with feeling.🔽If there is no place of origin,

original: anuppattiṭṭhānato phalassa uppatti nāma kadācipi natthīti imamatthaṃ yathādhigatassa
analyzed: anuppatti ṭṭhānato phalassa uppatti nāma kadācipi natthi iti imam attham yathā adhigatassa
translated: There is never any arising of a fruit from a non-arisen state. The meaning of this is shown by the words “In a sky-flower tree” in order to point out the meaning as it has been understood.

original: atthassa nidassanavasena dassento “ambarukkhe”tiādimāha. Rūpakāyatoti kevalaṃ rūpakāyato.
analyzed: atthassa nidassana vasena dassentaḥ amba rukkha iti ādim āha rūpa kāyataḥ iti kevalam rūpa kāyataḥ
translated: “From the material body”: only from the material body.

original: Tassāti manosamphassassa.🔽Virodhipaccayasannipāte vibhūtatarā visadisuppatti, tasmiṃ vā sati attano santāne
analyzed: tassa ati manaḥ samphassassa  virodhi paccaya sannipāte vibhūtatarā tasmin vā sati attano santāne
translated: “Its”: of the mind-contact.

original: vijjamānasseva visadisuppattihetubhāvo ruppanākāro. So eva ruppanākāro vatthusappaṭighādikaṃ🔽taṃ taṃ līnamatthaṃ gametīti liṅgaṃ. Tassa tassa sañjānanahetuto nimittaṃ. Tathā
analyzed: vijjamānassa iva visadisa uppatti hetu bhāvaḥ ruppana ākāro saḥ eva ruppana ākāraḥ vatthu sa paṭigha ādikam  tam tam līnam attham gameti iti liṅgam tassa tassa sañjānana hetutaḥ nimittam tathā
translated: When there is a concurrence of incompatible conditions, there is a more evident and different arising. Or, when there is that, there is the state of being a cause for the arising of only what exists in one’s own continuum.🔽The mode of appearance is the mode of appearance as a cause for the arising of that different thing. That mode of appearance itself is the sign because it goes to that and that thing that is obscure.

original: tathā uddisitabbato uddesoti evamettha ākārādayo atthato veditabbā. Vatthārammaṇānaṃ
analyzed: tathā uddisitabbataḥ uddeso ti evam ettha ākāra ādayaḥ atthataḥ veditabbāḥ vattha ārammaṇānam
translated: The reason is because of the cause for the perception of that and that. The indication is because of the state of being indicated thus and thus. Thus the modes, etc., should be understood here in this way by meaning.

original: aññamaññapaṭihananaṃ paṭigho, tato paṭighato jāto paṭighasamphasso. Tenāha “sappaṭigha”ntiādi.
analyzed: aññamañña paṭihananam paṭighaḥ tatas paṭighataḥ jāto paṭigha samphasso tena āha sa paṭigha ntiādi
translated: The resistance is the mutual obstruction of the physical support and the object. The contact that arises from that resistance is contact with resistance. Therefore it is said “with resistance” and so on.

original: Nāmakāyatoti kevalaṃ nāmakāyato. Tassāti paṭighasamphassassa. Sesaṃ paṭhamapañhe vuttanayameva.
analyzed: nāmakāyato ti kevalam nāmakāyato tassa ti paṭigha samphassassa sesam paṭhama pañhe vutta nayam eva
translated: “From the name-group”: only from the name-group. “That”: of the impact-contact. The rest is in the way stated in the first question.

original: Ubhayavasenāti nāmakāyo rūpakāyoti ubhayasannissayassa adhivacanasamphasso paṭighasamphassoti ubhayasamphassassa vasena.
analyzed: ubhaya vasena ati nāma kāyaḥ rūpa kāyaḥ ti ubhaya sannissayassa adhivacana samphasso paṭigha samphasso ti ubhaya samphassassa vasena
translated: “In both ways”: the expression-contact is the expression for the support of both, namely, the name-group and the form-group. The impact-contact is the expression for the contact of both.

original: Visuṃ visuṃ paccayaṃ dassetvāti byatirekamukhena paccekaṃ nāmakāyarūpakāyasaññitaṃ
analyzed: visum visum paccayam dassetvā ati byatireka mukhena paccekam nāmakāya rūpa kāya saññitam
translated: “Having shown the conditions separately”: having shown the conditions called the name-group and the form-group separately, by way of the method of excess.

original: paccayaṃ dassetvā. Tesanti phassānaṃ. Avisesatoti visesaṃ akatvā sāmaññato. Dassetunti🔽byatirekamukheneva dassetuṃ. Eseva hetūti esa chasupi dvāresu pavatto nāmarūpasaṅkhāto
analyzed: paccayam dassetvā tesan ti phassānam avisesato ti visesam a katvā sāmaññataḥ dassetunti  byatireka mukhena iva dassetum esa iva hetu iti esa chasu pi dvāresu pavattaḥ nāma rūpa saṅkhāto
translated: “Those”: the contacts. “Without distinction”: without making a distinction, in a general way. “Having shown”:

original: hetu yathārahaṃ dvinnampi phassānaṃ. Idāni taṃ yathārahaṃ pavattiṃ vibhajitvā dassetuṃ
analyzed: hetu yathāraham dvinnam pi phassānam idāni tam yathāraham pavattim vibhajitvā dassetum
translated: in order to show by the method of excess. “This is the reason”: this reason consisting of mentality-materiality occurring in the six doors is, as appropriate, for the two kinds of contact. Now, in order to show that occurrence as appropriate,

original: “cakkhudvārādīsu hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: cakkhu dvāra ādīsu hi itiādi vuttam
translated: “In the eye door, etc.” is said.

original: Sampayuttakā khandhāti phassena sampayuttā vedanādayo khandhā. Āvajjanassāpi sampayuttakkhandhaggahaṇenevettha
analyzed: sampayuttakā khandhā ti phassena sampayuttāḥ vedanā ādayaḥ khandhāḥ āvajjanassa api sampayutta khandha ggahaṇena iva ittha
translated: The aggregates associated with it are the aggregates of feeling, etc., associated with contact.🔽The apprehension of the adverting should be understood to be included here by the words “the aggregates associated with it” because it is invariably associated with contact.

original: gahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ tadavinābhāvato. Parato manosamphassepi eseva nayo. Pañcavidhopīti
analyzed: gahaṇam daṭṭhabbam tad avinābhāvato paratas manaḥ samphasse pi esa iva nayaḥ pañcavidhaḥ api iti
translated: The same method applies to the other kinds of contact beginning with that of the mind.🔽The fivefold contact is the fivefold contact classed as eye-contact, etc.🔽That contact is resistance contact.

original: cakkhusamphassādivasena pañcavidhopi. So phassoti paṭighasamphasso. Bahudhāti bahuppakārena.
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa ādi vasena pañcavidhaḥ api so phassaḥ ti paṭigha samphassaḥ bahudhā ati bahu pakārena
translated: It is manifold in its modes.

original: Tathā hi vipākanāmaṃ vipākassa anekabhedassa manosamphassassa sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākasampayuttaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: tathā hi vipāka nāmam vipākassa aneka bhedassa manaḥ samphassassa sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthi avigata vasena
translated: For the name-contact that is result is a condition in seven ways, as conascence, mutuality, support, result, nutriment, faculty, and presence, for the manifold resultant mind-contact classed as contact of the mind.

original: sattadhā paccayo hoti. Yaṃ panettha āhārakiccaṃ, taṃ āhārapaccayavasena. Yaṃ indriyakiccaṃ,🔽taṃ indriyapaccayavasena paccayo hoti. Avipākaṃ pana nāmaṃ avipākassa manosamphassassa
analyzed: sattadhā paccayaḥ hoti yam pana ittha āhāra kiccam tam āhāra paccaya vasena yam indriya kiccam  tam indriya paccaya vasena paccayaḥ hoti avipākam pana nāmam avipākassa manaḥ samphassassa
translated: But the function of nutriment is a condition by way of nutriment condition. The function of faculty is a condition by way of faculty condition.🔽But the name-contact that is not result is a condition by way of all these conditions except for the result condition for the contact of the mind that is not result.

original: ṭhapetvā vipākapaccayaṃ itaresaṃ vasena paccayo hoti. Rūpaṃ pana cakkhāyatanādibhedaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapetvā vipāka paccayam itaresam vasena paccayaḥ hoti rūpam pana cakkha āyatana ādi bhedam
translated: The visible-data base, etc., classed as eye-base, etc.,

original: cakkhusamphassādikassa pañcavidhassa phassassa nissayapurejātaindriyavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena🔽chadhā paccayo hoti. Rūpāyatanādibhedaṃ tassa pañcavidhassa ārammaṇapurejātaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: cakkhu samphassa ādikassa pañcavidhassa phassassa nissaya purejāta aindriya vippayutta atthi avigata vasena  chadhā paccayaḥ hoti rūpa āyatana ādi bhedam tassa pañcavidhassa ārammaṇa purejāta atthi avigata vasena
translated: Contact of eye-contact, etc., has four kinds of conditionality, that is to say, as support, prenascence, dissociation, presence, and absence conditions.

original: catudhā paccayo hoti. Manosamphassassa pana tāni rūpāyatanādīni, dhammārammaṇañca
analyzed: catudhā paccayaḥ hoti manaḥ samphassassa pana tāni rūpa āyatana ādīni dhamma ārammaṇam ca
translated: The five kinds of object, that is to say, visible data, etc., have four kinds of conditionality, that is to say, as object, prenascence, absence, and presence conditions.

original: tathā ca ārammaṇapaccayamatteneva paccayo hoti. Vatthurūpaṃ pana manosamphassassa
analyzed: tathā ca ārammaṇa paccaya mattena iva paccayaḥ hoti vatthu rūpam pana manaḥ samphassassa
translated: But the mental-data object has only one kind of conditionality, that is to say, as object condition.

original: nissayapurejātavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena pañcadhā paccayo hoti. Evaṃ nāmarūpaṃ
analyzed: nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigata vasena pañcadhā paccayaḥ hoti evam nāma rūpam
translated: The materiality of the physical heart- basis has five kinds of conditionality, that is to say, as support, prenascence, dissociation, presence, and absence conditions.

original: assa phassassa bahudhā paccayo hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: assa phassassa bahudhā paccayaḥ hoti iti veditabbam
translated: So it should be understood that mentality-materiality is a condition for contact in many ways.

original: 115. Paṭhamuppattiyaṃ viññāṇaṃ nāmarūpassa visesapaccayoti imamatthaṃ byatirekamukhena
analyzed: paṭhama uppattiyam viññāṇam nāma rūpassa visesa paccayo ti imam attham byatireka mukhena
translated: The meaning of the words “If, when the consciousness of the rebirth-linking, etc.,

original: dassetuṃ pāḷiyaṃ “mātukucchimhi na okkamissathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Gabbhaseyyakapaṭisandhi
analyzed: dassetum pāḷiyam mātukucchimhi na okkamissatha atiādi vuttam gabbhaseyyaka paṭisandhi
translated: is occurring, the materiality due to kamma performed is a condition for the rebirth-linking, etc., consciousness, then the rebirth-linking, etc., consciousness is a condition for the materiality due to kamma performed in the way already stated” is stated in the text by the words “If you say that the rebirth-linking consciousness would not descend into the mother’s womb” and so on.

original: hi bāhirato mātukucchiṃ okkamantassa viya hontīpi atthato yathāpaccayaṃ khandhānaṃ🔽tattha paṭhamuppattiyeva. Tenāha “pavisitvā…pe… na vattissathā”ti. Suddhanti kevalaṃ
analyzed: hi bāhiratas mātukucchim okkamantassa viya honti ipi atthataḥ yathāpaccayam khandhānam  tattha paṭhama uppattiyā iva tena āha pavisitvā āpe na vattissatha ati suddham ti kevalam
translated: And though they are like those entering the womb from outside, still, in the sense of the arising of the aggregates in dependence on the conditions,

original: viññāṇena amissitaṃ virahitaṃ. “Avasesa”nti idaṃ nāmāpekkhaṃ, tasmā avasesaṃ nāmarūpanti
analyzed: viññāṇena a missitam virahitam avasesanti idam nāma apekkham tasmai avasesam nāma rūpanti
translated: it is only the first arising there that is meant. Hence he said, “having entered … would not continue.” Pure: not mixed, not associated, with consciousness. “The rest”: this is dependent on the name, so the meaning is that the rest of the mentality-materiality,

original: imaṃ viññāṇaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ nāmarūpaṃ vāti attho. Paṭisandhivasena okkantanti
analyzed: imam viññāṇam ṭhapetvā avasesam nāma rūpam vā ti attho paṭisandhi vasena okkantanti
translated: excepting this consciousness, would not descend into the womb.

original: paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena, mātukucchiṃ okkamantassa vā paṭhamāvayavabhāvena otiṇṇaṃ.
analyzed: paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena mātu kucchim okkamantassa vā paṭhama avayava bhāvena otiṇṇam
translated: Having entered by way of rebirth-linking: by way of the taking up of rebirth-linking. Or it is that which has entered by way of the first stage of descent into the womb.

original: Vokkamissathāti santativicchedaṃ vināsaṃ upagamissatha, taṃ pana maraṇaṃ nāma hotīti
analyzed: vokkamissatha ati santati vicchedam vināsam upagamissatha tam pana maraṇam nāma hoti iti
translated: Would emerge: would come to destruction by way of the severance of the continuity. But that is called death.

original: āha “cutivasenā”ti. Assāti viññāṇassa, tañca kho viññāṇasāmaññavasena vuttaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: āha cuti vasena ati assa āti viññāṇassa tat ca kho viññāṇa sāmañña vasena vuttam tena āha
translated: Hence he said “by way of the life-continuum.” The “it” refers to consciousness, and that is said in terms of the similarity of consciousness. Hence he said,

original: “tasseva cittassa nirodhenā”ti, paṭisandhicittasseva nirodhenāti attho. Tatoti paṭisandhicittato.
analyzed: tassa iva cittassa nirodhena ati paṭisandhi cittassa iva nirodhena ati attho tatas ti paṭisandhi cittato
translated: “by the cessation of that same consciousness.” The meaning is: by the cessation of the rebirth-linking consciousness. From that: from the rebirth-linking consciousness.

original: Paṭisandhicittassa, tato dutiyatatiyacittānaṃ vā nirodhena cuti na hotīti vuttamatthaṃ
analyzed: paṭisandhi cittassa tatas dutiya tatiya cittānam vā nirodhena cuti na hoti iti vuttam attham
translated: Death does not occur with the cessation of the rebirth-linking consciousness or of the second and third consciousnesses that follow it.🔽The meaning of this statement is analyzed in the following passage, which begins, “For the rebirth-linking consciousness. ..”

original: yuttito vibhāvetuṃ “paṭisandhicittena hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Etasmiṃ antareti etasmiṃ soḷasacittakkhaṇe🔽kāle. Antarāyo natthīti ettha dārakassa tāva maraṇantarāyo mā hotu tadā cuticittassa
analyzed: yuttitaḥ vibhāvetum paṭisandhi cittena hi itiādi vuttam etasmin antare ti etasmin soḷasa cittakkhaṇe  kāle antarāyaḥ natthi iti ettha dārakassa tāva maraṇa antarāyaḥ mā hotu tadā cuti cittassa
translated: In the interval: in the sixteen moments of consciousness.🔽At that time: at that moment.

original: asambhavato, mātu pana kathaṃ tadā maraṇantarāyābhāvoti? Taṃ taṃ kālaṃ anatikkamitvā🔽tadantareyeva cavanadhammāya gabbhaggahaṇasseva asambhavato. Tenāha “ayañhi anokāso
analyzed: asambhavataḥ pana katham tadā maraṇa antarāya abhāvaḥ iti tam tam kālam an atikkamitvā  tat antareya iva cavana dhammāya gabbha ggahaṇassa iva asambhavataḥ tena āha ayan hi an okāsaḥ
translated: There is no obstacle: let there be no obstacle to the death of the child, since the death consciousness cannot arise at that time. But how can there be no obstacle to the death of the mother at that time? Because it is impossible for her to die in the interval between the time of conception and the time of delivery.

original: nāmā”ti, cutiyāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: nāma ati cutiyā ati adhippāyo
translated: Therefore it is said, “This is called an inopportune time. ..” The meaning is: it is impossible for her to die.

original: Paṭisandhicittena saddhiṃ samuṭṭhitarūpānīti okkantikkhaṇe uppannakammajarūpāni vadati.
analyzed: paṭisandhi cittena saddhim samuṭṭhita rūpāni iti okkanti khaṇe uppanna kamma ja rūpāni vadati
translated: The material phenomena that arise together with the rebirth-linking consciousness: the kamma-born material phenomena that arise at the moment of descent into the womb.

original: Tāni hi nippariyāyato paṭisandhicittena saddhiṃ samuṭṭhitarūpāni nāma, na utusamuṭṭhānāni
analyzed: tāni hi nippariyāyataḥ paṭisandhi cittena saddhim samuṭṭhita rūpāni nāma na utu samuṭṭhānāni
translated: For these are called material phenomena that arise together with the rebirth-linking consciousness in the primary sense, not material phenomena arisen by temperature, etc.

original: paṭisandhicittassa uppādato pacchā samuṭṭhitattā. Cittajāhārajānaṃ pana tadā asambhavo
analyzed: paṭisandhi cittassa uppādato pacchā samuṭṭhita ttā citta ja āhāra jānam pana tadā asambhavo
translated: because they arise after the arising of the rebirth-linking consciousness. But the materiality originated by kamma does not exist then.

original: eva. Yāni paṭisandhicittena saddhiṃ samuṭṭhitarūpāni, tāni tividhāni tassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: eva yāni paṭisandhi cittena saddhim samuṭṭhita rūpāni tāni tividhāni tassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: The material instances that arise together with the rebirth-linking consciousness are of three kinds: those that arose at the moment of its arising,

original: samuṭṭhitāni, ṭhitikkhaṇe samuṭṭhitāni, bhaṅgakkhaṇe samuṭṭhitānīti. Tesu uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: samuṭṭhitāni ṭhiti kkhaṇe samuṭṭhitāni bhaṅga kkhaṇe samuṭṭhitāni iti tesu uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: those that arose at the moment of its presence, and those that arose at the moment of its dissolution.

original: samuṭṭhitāni sattarasamassa bhavaṅgassa uppādakkhaṇe nirujjhanti, ṭhitikkhaṇe samuṭṭhitāni
analyzed: samuṭṭhitāni sattarasamassa bhavaṅgassa uppāda khaṇe nirujjhanti ṭhiti khaṇe samuṭṭhitāni
translated: Of these, those that arose at the moment of its arising cease at the moment of the arising of the seventeenth thought-unit of the life-continuum;🔽those that arose at the moment of its presence cease at the moment of the presence of that thought-unit;

original: ṭhitikkhaṇe nirujjhanti, bhaṅgakkhaṇe samuṭṭhitāni bhaṅgakkhaṇe nirujjhanti. Tattha🔽“bhañjamāno dhammo bhañjamānassa dhammassa paccayo hotī”ti na sakkā vattuṃ, uppāde,🔽pana ṭhitiyañca na na sakkāti “sattarasamassa bhavaṅgassa uppādakkhaṇe, ṭhitikkhaṇe
analyzed: ṭhiti kkhaṇe nirujjhanti bhaṅga kkhaṇe samuṭṭhitāni bhaṅga kkhaṇe nirujjhanti tattha  bhañjamānaḥ dhammaḥ bhañjamānassa dhammassa paccayaḥ hoti iti na sakkā vattum uppāde  pana ṭhitiyam ca na na sakkāti sattarasamassa bhavaṅgassa uppāda khaṇe ṭhiti kkhaṇe
translated: those that arose at the moment of its dissolution cease at the moment of the dissolution of that thought-unit. Herein,🔽it cannot be said that “a materiality that is dissolving is a condition for a materiality that is dissolving,” but it can be said of the arising and the presence that

original: ca dharantānaṃ vasena tassa paccayampi dātuṃ na sakkontī”ti vuttaṃ. Rūpakāyūpatthambhitasseva
analyzed: ca dharantānam vasena tassa paccayam pi dātum na sakkonti iti vuttam rūpa kāya upatthambhitassa iva
translated: “it cannot be said that it cannot be done.” So it is said that “it cannot give a condition for that by way of maintaining it at the moment of its arising and at the moment of its presence, and it cannot give a condition for that at the moment of its dissolution.”

original: hi nāmakāyassa pañcavokāre pavattīti. Tehi rūpadhammehi tassa cittassa balavataraṃ
analyzed: hi nāmakāyassa pañcavokāre tehi rūpa dhammehi tassa cittassa balavataram
translated: for it occurs in the five-constituent kind of becoming. He said ‘of the seventeenth … occurs … occurs’ referring to the material instances that are stronger than the consciousness.

original: sandhāyāha “sattarasamassa…pe… pavatti pavattatī”ti. Paveṇī ghaṭiyatīti aṭṭhacattālīsakammajassa🔽rūpapaveṇī sambandhā hutvā pavattati. Paṭhamañhi paṭisandhicittaṃ, tato yāva soḷasamaṃ🔽bhavaṅgacittaṃ, tesu ekekassa uppādaṭhitibhaṅgavasena tayo tayo khaṇā. Tattha ekekassa🔽cittassa tīsu tīsu khaṇesu samatiṃsa samatiṃsa kammajarūpāni uppajjanti. Iti soḷasatikā
analyzed: sandhāya āha satta rasa massape pavatti pavattati iti paveṇī ghaṭiyati iti aṭṭhacattālīsa kamma jassa  rūpa paveṇī sambandhā hutvā pavattati paṭhamam hi paṭisandhi cittam tatas yāva soḷasamam  bhavaṅga cittam tesu ekekassa uppāda ṭhiti bhaṅga vasena tayo tayo khaṇā tattha ekekassa  cittassa tīsu tīsu khaṇesu samatiṃsa samatiṃsa kamma ja rūpāni uppajjanti iti soḷasatikā
translated: The stream is linked up: the stream of material instances produced by kamma occurs linked up with the stream of the forty-eight instances of materiality due to kamma.

original: aṭṭhacattālīsaṃ honti. Esa nayo tato paresupi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “aṭṭhacattālīsakammajassa🔽rūpapaveṇī sambandhā hutvā pavattatī”ti. Sace pana na sakkontīti paṭisandhicittena
analyzed: aṭṭhacattālīsam honti esa nayo tatas paresu pi tam sandhāya vuttam aṭṭha cattālīsa kamma jassa 🔽rūpa paveṇī sambandhā hutvā pavattati iti sace pana na sakkonti iti paṭisandhi cittena
translated: For the first rebirth-linking consciousness, and then the life-continuum consciousness up to the sixteenth, each have three moments as arising, presence, and dissolution. Herein, thirty material instances produced by kamma arise in each of the three moments of each consciousness. So the sixteen sets of thirty make eighty, and with the forty-eight instances of materiality due to kamma that makes one hundred and twenty-eight. The same method applies in the case of the rest. It is with reference to this that it is said, ‘The stream of material instances produced by kamma occurs linked up with the stream of the forty-eight instances of materiality due to kamma.’🔽If it cannot:

original: saddhiṃ samuṭṭhitarūpāni sattarasamassa bhavaṅgassa paccayaṃ dātuṃ sace na sakkonti.🔽Yadi hi paṭisandhicittato sattarasamaṃ cuticittaṃ siyā, paṭisandhicittassa ṭhitibhaṅgakkhaṇesupi
analyzed: saddhim samuṭṭhita rūpāni sattarasamassa bhavaṅgassa paccayam dātum sace na sakkonti  yadi hi paṭisandhi cittato sattarasamam cuti cittam siyā paṭisandhi cittassa ṭhiti bhaṅga kkhaṇesu pi
translated: and the materiality originated together with it cannot give support to the seventeenth life-continuum consciousness if it is unable to do so.

original: kammajarūpaṃ na uppajjeyya, pageva bhavaṅgacittakkhaṇesu. Tathā sati nattheva tassa
analyzed: kamma ja rūpam na uppajjeyya pagā iva bhavaṅga cittakkhaṇesu tathā sati nattha iva tassa
translated: For if the death consciousness were the seventeenth from the rebirth-linking consciousness, then materiality due to kamma would not arise at the time of the arising, presence, and dissolution of the rebirth-linking consciousness,

original: cittassa paccayalābhoti pavatti nappavattati, paveṇī na ghaṭiyateva, aññadatthu vicchijjati.
analyzed: cittassa paccaya lābho ti pavatti na pavattati paveṇī na ghaṭiyate iva añña datthu vicchijjati
translated: let alone at the time of the life-continuum consciousness. And in that case there would be no acquisition of support for that consciousness, and so it would not occur; the stream would not be maintained, it would be broken off, in fact.

original: Tenāha “vokkamatiti nāma hotī”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha nāma hoti itiādi
translated: Hence it is said, “It is called ‘it breaks off’” , and so on.

original: Itthattāyāti itthaṃpakāratāya. Yādiso gabbhaseyyakassa attabhāvo, taṃ sandhāyetaṃ
analyzed: itthattāya ati itthaṃpakāra tāya yādisaḥ gabbhaseyyakassa atta bhāvo tam sandhāya itam
translated: In this way: in this manner, in this way. This is said with reference to the individual essence of one lying in the womb.

original: vuttaṃ. Tassa ca pañcakkhandhā anūnā eva hontīti āha “evaṃ paripuṇṇapañcakkhandhabhāvāyā”ti.
analyzed: vuttam tassa ca pañca kkhandhāḥ anūnāḥ eva honti iti āha evam paripuṇṇa pañca kkhandha bhāvāya ati
translated: And the five aggregates in his case are not incomplete; that is why it is said, “in one who has the complete five aggregates. ”

original: Upacchijjissathāti santānavicchedena vicchindeyya. Suddhaṃ nāmarūpamevāti viññāṇavirahitaṃ
analyzed: upacchijjissatha ati santāna vicchedena vicchindeyya suddham nāma rūpam eva ati viññāṇa virahitam
translated: It would be cut off: it would be broken off by the severance of the continuity. Pure mentality-materiality: consciousness-free

original: kevalaṃ nāmarūpameva. Avayavānaṃ pāripūri vuḍḍhi. Thirabhāvappatti virūḷhi. Mahallakabhāvappatti
analyzed: kevalam nāma rūpam eva avayavānam pāripūri vuḍḍhi thira bhāva ppatti virūḍhi mahallaka bhāva ppatti
translated: The fulfilment of the parts is growth. The attainment of firmness is increase. The attainment of bulk is

original: vepullaṃ. Tāni ca yathākkamaṃ paṭhamādivayavasena hontīti vuttaṃ “paṭhamavayavasenā”tiādi.
analyzed: vepullam tāni ca yathākkamam paṭhama ādi vaya vasena honti iti vuttam paṭhama vaya vasena atiādi
translated: expansion. And these are the first part, etc., respectively.

original: Vā-saddo aniyamattho, tena vassasahassadvayādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vā saddaḥ aniyama atthaḥ tena vassa sahassa dvaya ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: The word “or” has the meaning of non-restriction; thus it should be seen as including two thousand years, etc.

original: Viññāṇamevāti niyamavacanaṃ, ito bāhirakappitassa attano, issarādīnañca paṭikkhepapadaṃ,
analyzed: viññāṇam eva ati niyama vacanam itas bāhira kappitassa attanaḥ issara ādīnam ca paṭikkhepa padam
translated: The word “only” is a restrictive term; it is a term that excludes a self postulated outside this , and also a Ruler, etc.

original: na avijjādiphassādipaṭikkhepapadaṃ paṭiyogīnivattanapadattā avadhāraṇassa. Tenāha🔽“eseva hetū”tiādi. Ayañca nayo heṭṭhāpi sabbapadesu yathārahaṃ vattabbo. Idāni viññāṇameva🔽nāmarūpassa padhānakāraṇanti imamatthaṃ opammavasena vibhāvetuṃ “yathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: na avijjā ādi phassa ādi paṭikkhepa padam paṭiyogī nivattana pada tā avadhāraṇassa tena āha  esa iva hetu utiādi ayam ca nayaḥ heṭṭhā api sabba padesu yathāraham vattabbaḥ idāni viññāṇam eva  nāma rūpassa padhāna kāraṇanti imam attham opamma vasena vibhāvetum yathā hi itiādi vuttam
translated: It is not a term that excludes ignorance, etc., or contact, etc.; for the restriction is a term that excludes the opposite. Therefore he said:🔽“This is the only cause” , etc. And this method should be applied in each instance as appropriate. Now, in order to demonstrate by means of a simile the meaning of the statement that consciousness is the principal cause of name-and-form, it is said:

original: Paccekaṃ viya samuditassāpi nāmarūpassa viññāṇena vinā attakiccāsamatthataṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: paccekam viya samuditassa api nāma rūpassa viññāṇena vinā atta kicca asamattha tam dassetum
translated: “Just as,” etc. In order to show that even when combined, name-and-form cannot perform its own function without consciousness, as if each were separate,🔽it is said:

original: “tvaṃ nāmarūpaṃ nāmā”ti ekajjhaṃ gahaṇaṃ. Purecāriketi pubbaṅgameva. Viññāṇañhi sahajātadhammānaṃ
analyzed: tvam nāma rūpam nāma ati ekajjham gahaṇam purecārikā iti pubbaṅgam eva viññāṇam hi sahajāta dhammānam
translated: “You are mentality-materiality” is a single apprehension. “Preceding” is preceding it. For consciousness is the forerunner of the states that are conascent with it,

original: pubbaṅgamaṃ. Tenāha bhagavā “manopubbaṅgamā dhammā”ti. bahudhāti anekappakārena paccayo hoti.
analyzed: pubbaṅgamam tena āha bhagavā manaḥ pubbaṅgamāḥ dhammā ati bahudhā ati aneka ppakārena paccayaḥ hoti
translated: and that is why the Blessed One said, “Mind precedes thoughts” . It is a condition in many ways.

original: Kathaṃ? Vipākanāmassa hi paṭisandhiyaṃ aññaṃ vā viññāṇaṃ sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākaāhāraindriyasampayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi🔽navadhā paccayo hoti. Vatthurūpassa paṭisandhiyaṃ sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākaāhāraindriyavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi🔽navadhā paccayo hoti. Ṭhapetvā pana vatthurūpaṃ sesarūpassa imesu navasu aññamaññapaccayaṃ
analyzed: katham vipāka nāmassa hi paṭisandhiyam aññam vā viññāṇam sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra aindriya sampayutta atthi avigata paccayehi  navadhā paccayaḥ hoti vatthu rūpassa paṭisandhiyam sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra aindriya vippayutta atthi avigata paccayehi  navadhā paccayaḥ hoti ṭhapetvā pana vatthu rūpam sesa rūpassa imesu navasu aññamañña paccayam
translated: How? For the resultant kind of mentality is a condition in nine ways, as postnascence, prenascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, dissociation, and presence conditions, for the resultant kind of materiality at the rebirth-linking moment or at any other time.🔽And the materiality of the physical heart- basis is a condition in nine ways, as postnascence, prenascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, association, and presence conditions, for the mentality that is conascent with it at the rebirth-linking moment or at any other time. But, leaving aside the materiality of the physical heart-basis, the remaining kinds of materiality are a condition in eight ways, as postnascence, prenascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, dissociation, and presence conditions, for the remaining kinds of mentality that are conascent with them.

original: apanetvā sesehi aṭṭhahi paccayehi paccayo hoti. Abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ pana asaññasattarūpassa,
analyzed: apanetvā sesehi aṭṭhahi paccayehi paccayaḥ hoti abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇam pana asañña satta rūpassa
translated: And the consciousness that is kamma-result is a condition in nine ways, as postnascence, prenascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, dissociation, and presence conditions, for the materiality of the non-percipient beings.

original: pañcavokāre vā kammajassa suttantikapariyāyato upanissayavasena ekadhāva paccayo
analyzed: pañcavokāre vā kamma jassa suttantika pariyāyato upanissaya vasena ekadhā va paccayo
translated: Or it is a condition in one way, as decisive-support condition, for the kamma-born in the five aggregates, according to the Suttanta method.

original: hoti. Avasesañhi paṭhamabhavaṅgato pabhuti sabbampi viññāṇaṃ tassa nāmarūpassa yathārahaṃ
analyzed: hoti avasesam hi paṭhama bhavaṅgataḥ pabhuti sabbam pi viññāṇam tassa nāma rūpassa yathāraham
translated: For all consciousness beginning with the first life-continuum is a condition for that mentality-materiality as appropriate.

original: paccayo hotīti veditabbaṃ. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthārato pana paccayanaye dassiyamāne
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti iti veditabbam ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthārataḥ pana paccaya naye dassiyamāne
