translated: By mentioning the Ābhassaras, all those of the Limited Radiance and the Measureless Radiance are included.

original: subhoti pariyāyavacananti “subhena okiṇṇā vikiṇṇā”ti attho vutto, etthāpi antima-ṇa-kārassa
analyzed: subhaḥ ti pariyāya vacanam ti subhena okiṇṇā vikiṇṇā ti atthaḥ vuttaḥ ettha api antima ṇakārassa
translated: “Subha” is beautiful radiance. “Subhakiṇha” should be said of those who are covered with beauty, but the -a- of “subha” is elided and the -ṇa- of “kiṇha” is elided and the -a- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided, and the -a- of “ki” is elided and the -ṇa- of “ki” is elided

original: ha-kārakaraṇaṃ icchitabbameva. Na chijjitvā chijjitvā pabhā gacchati ekagghanattā.
analyzed: hakāra karaṇam icchitabbam eva na chijjitvā chijjitvā pabhā gacchati ekaggha nattā
translated: and the ha-kārakaṇa is to be desired. It does not go on being broken up, because it is of one price.

original: Catutthaviññāṇaṭṭhitimeva bhajanti kāyassa, saññāya ca ekarūpattā. Vipulasantasukhāyuvaṇṇādiphalattā
analyzed: catuttha viññāṇa ṭṭhitim eva bhajanti kāyassa saññāya ca eka rūpa ttā vipula santa sukha āyu vaṇṇa ādi phala ttā
translated: They are called “pertaining to the fourth consciousness” because they are included in the fourth kind of consciousness, and because they are of the same form as perception.🔽They are called “fruit of the vast” because they are the fruit of the vast, extensive, pleasant, long-lived, beautiful, etc.,

original: vehapphalā. Etthāti viññāṇaṭṭhitiyaṃ.🔽Vivaṭṭapakkhe ṭhitā napunarāvattanato. “Na sabbakālikā”ti vatvā tameva asabbakālikattaṃ
analyzed: vehapphalāḥ ettha āti viññāṇa ṭṭhitiyam  vivaṭṭa pakkhe ṭhitā na punarāvattanataḥ na sabbakālikā iti vatvā tam eva a sabbakālika ttam
translated: Here means in the station of consciousness.🔽They are called “not subject to reversal” because they do not reverse, i.e. return, to the side of the reversal.

original: vibhāvetuṃ “kappasatasahassampī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Soḷasakappasahassaccayena uppannānaṃ
analyzed: vibhāvetum kappa sata sahassam pi itiādi vuttam soḷasa kappa sahassa ccayena uppannānam
translated: After saying “not subject to all time” he said “even for a hundred thousand eons” in order to explain that very non-subjectness to all time.🔽Because the Suddhāvāsa Brahmās who arose sixteen thousand eons ago are now attaining Nibbāna,

original: suddhāvāsabrahmānaṃ parinibbāyanato, aññesañca tattha anuppajjanato buddhasuññe loke
analyzed: suddhāvāsa brahmānam parinibbāyanataḥ aññesañca tattha anuppajjanataḥ buddha suññe loke
translated: and because others are not being reborn there, the world is empty of Buddhas,

original: suññaṃ taṃ ṭhānaṃ hoti, tasmā suddhāvāsā na sabbakālikā, khandhāvāraṭṭhānasadisā
analyzed: suññam tam ṭhānam hoti tasmā suddhāvāsā na sabba kālikā khandhāvāra ṭṭhāna sadisā
translated: and that station is empty. Therefore the Suddhāvāsa planes are not subject to all time.🔽They are like the station of the aggregates.

original: honti suddhāvāsabhūmiyo. Iminā suttena suddhāvāsānaṃ sattāvāsabhāvadīpaneneva viññāṇaṭṭhitibhāvo
analyzed: honti suddhāvāsa bhūmiyaḥ iminā suttena suddhāvāsānam sattā vāsa bhāva dīpanena iva viññāṇa ṭṭhiti bhāvaḥ
translated: By this sutta, which shows that the Suddhāvāsa planes are stations of beings, it is also shown that they are stations of consciousness.

original: dīpito, tasmā suddhāvāsāpi sattasu viññāṇaṭṭhitīsu catutthaviññāṇaṭṭhitiṃ navasu
analyzed: tasmā suddhāvāsā api sattasu viññāṇa ṭṭhitīsu catuttha viññāṇa ṭṭhitim navasu
translated: and so the Suddhāvāsa gods are included in the fourth kind of consciousness-station among the seven kinds of consciousness-stations, and in the ninth among the nine kinds of abodes of beings .🔽

original: sattāvāsesu catutthasattāvāsaṃyeva bhajanti.
analyzed: sattāvāsesu catuttha sattāvāsaṃya iva bhajanti
translated: and so they are called “pure abodes.” So the gods of the Suddhāvāsa class belong to the fourth kind of station for consciousness and to the fourth kind of abode of beings among the seven kinds of stations for consciousness and the nine kinds of abodes of beings.

original: Sukhumattāti saṅkhārāvasesasukhumabhāvappattattā. Paribyattaviññāṇakiccābhāvato neva
analyzed: sukhuma ttā ati saṅkhāra avasesa sukhuma bhāva ppatta ttā paribyatta viññāṇa kicca abhāvataḥ na iva
translated: They are called “subtle” because they have reached the state of subtlety due to the mere remainder of formations. They are called “neither-perception-nor-non-perception” because their consciousness has reached the limit of what can be done with consciousness and is not, therefore,

original: viññāṇaṃ, sabbaso aviññāṇaṃ na hotīti nāviññāṇaṃ, tasmā paripphuṭaviññāṇakiccavantīsu
analyzed: viññāṇam sabbasas aviññāṇam na hoti iti na aviññāṇam tasmā paripphuṭa viññāṇa kiccavantīsu
translated: “perception” and because it is not, therefore, “non-perception.” So they are called “neither-perception-nor-non-perception” because they are not “perception” and are not “non-perception.”

original: viññāṇaṭṭhitīsu avatvā.🔽128. Tañca viññāṇaṭṭhitinti paṭhamaṃ viññāṇaṭṭhitiṃ. Heṭṭhā vuttanayena sarūpato,🔽manussādivibhāgato, saṅkhepato, “nāmañca rūpañcā”ti bhedato ca pajānāti. Tassā samudayañcāti🔽tassā paṭhamāya viññāṇaṭṭhitiyā pañcavīsatividhaṃ samudayañca pajānāti. Atthaṅgamepi
analyzed: viññāṇa ṭṭhitīsu a vatvā  tat ca viññāṇa ṭhitim ti paṭhamam viññāṇa ṭṭhitim heṭṭhā vutta nayena sarūpataḥ  manussa ādi vibhāgato saṅkhepataḥ nāmañca rūpañca ati bhedato ca pajānāti tassā samudayañca ati  tassā paṭhamāya viññāṇa ṭṭhitiyā pañcavīsatividham samudayam ca pajānāti atthaṅgame pi
translated: They are called “the station for consciousness” because they are the station for the consciousness that has reached the limit of what can be done with consciousness.

original: eseva nayo. Assādetabbato, assādato ca assādaṃ. Ayaṃ aniccādibhāvo ādīnavo. Chandarāgo
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ assādetabbataḥ assādataḥ ca assādam ayam anicca ādi bhāvaḥ ādīnavaḥ chanda rāgaḥ
translated: And he understands the first station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the first station for consciousness.’ He understands the second station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the second station for consciousness.’ He understands the third station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the third station for consciousness.’ He understands the fourth station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the fourth station for consciousness.’ He understands the fifth station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the fifth station for consciousness.’ He understands the sixth station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the sixth station for consciousness.’ He understands the seventh station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the seventh station for consciousness.’ He understands the eighth station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the eighth station for consciousness.’ He understands the ninth station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the ninth station for consciousness.’ He understands the tenth station for consciousness as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This is the tenth station for consciousness.’🔽He understands the origin of the first station for consciousness and he understands its cessation and he understands its gratification, its danger, and the escape from it.🔽He understands the origin of the second station for consciousness …🔽He understands the origin of the third station for consciousness …🔽He understands the origin of the fourth station for consciousness …

original: vinīyati etena, ettha vāti chandarāgavinayo, saha maggena nibbānaṃ. Chandarāgappahānanti
analyzed: vinīyati etena ettha vāti chanda rāga vinayaḥ saha maggena nibbānam chanda rāga ppahānan ti
translated: It is by this that one is disciplined, thus it is discipline . The destruction of lust and hate together with the path is Nibbāna. The abandoning of lust and hate is

original: etthāpi eseva nayo. Mānadiṭṭhīnaṃ vasenāhanti vā, taṇhāvasena mamanti vā abhinandanāpi
analyzed: ettha api esā iva nayaḥ māna diṭṭhīnam vasena ahanti vā taṇhā vasena vā
translated: the same in meaning. The delighting in is to be regarded as the conceit of “I am” in the case of the conceit of “I am,” or as the delighting in the craving in the case of the craving.

original: mānassa paritassanā viya daṭṭhabbā. Sabbatthāti sabbesu sesesu aṭṭhasupi vāresu.
analyzed: mānassa paritassanā viya daṭṭhabbā sabbattha ati sabbesu sesesu aṭṭhasu pi vāresu
translated: In all the rest: in the remaining eight sections.

original: Tatthāti upari tīsu viññāṇaṭṭhitīsu dutiyāyatanesu. Tattha hi rūpaṃ natthi. Puna
analyzed: tattha ati upari tīsu viññāṇa ṭṭhitīsu dutiya āyatanesu tattha hi rūpam natthi puna
translated: There: in the last three stations for consciousness and the second bases. For there is no materiality there. Again,

original: tatthāti paṭhamāyatane. Tattha hi eko rūpakkhandhova. Etthāti ca tameva sandhāya
analyzed: tattha ati paṭhama āyatane tattha hi ekaḥ rūpa kkhandhaḥ uva ettha ati ca tam eva sandhāya
translated: there: in the first base. For there is only one materiality aggregate there. Here: this is said with reference to the same. For there,

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha hi rūpassa kammasamuṭṭhānattā āhāravasena yojanā na sambhavati.🔽Yato khoti ettha to-saddo dā-saddo viya kālavacano “yato kho, sāriputta, bhikkhusaṅgho”tiādīsu
analyzed: vuttam tattha hi rūpassa kamma samuṭṭhāna ttā āhāra vasena yojanā na sambhavati  yatas kho ti ettha to saddaḥ dā saddaḥ viya kāla vacanaḥ yatas kho sāriputta bhikkhu saṅghaḥ ti ādīsu
translated: since materiality is originated by kamma, the application by way of nutriment is not possible.🔽Since the word to in the phrase “When, bhikkhus, the bhikkhu saṅgha” is a temporal word like the word da in the phrase “When the rice is cooked,”

original: viyāti vuttaṃ “yadā kho”ti. Aggahetvāti kañcipi saṅkhāraṃ “etaṃ mamā”tiādinā aggahetvā.
analyzed: viya iti vuttam yadā kho ti aggahetvā ti kañcipi saṅkhāram etam mama ati ādinā aggahetvā
translated: it is said “when the bhikkhu saṅgha.” Without grasping: without grasping any formation as “this is mine,” etc.

original: Paññāvimuttoti aṭṭhannaṃ vimokkhānaṃ anadhigatattā sātisayassa samādhibalassa abhāvato
analyzed: paññā vimutto ti aṭṭhannam vimokkhānam anadhigata ttā sa atisayassa samādhi balassa abhāvato
translated: “Liberated in wisdom” : he is liberated by the power of wisdom alone, because he has not attained the eight emancipations and because he lacks the power of concentration to a high degree.

original: paññābaleneva vimutto. Tenāha “aṭṭha vimokkhe asacchikatvā paññābalenevā”tiādi. Appavattinti🔽āyatiṃ appavattiṃ katvā. Pajānanto vimuttoti vā paññāvimutto, paṭhamajjhānaphassena
analyzed: paññā balena iva vimuttaḥ tena āha aṭṭha vimokkhe a sacchikatvā paññā balena iva ātiādi appavattin ti  āyatim appavattim katvā pajānantaḥ vimutto ti vā paññā vimutto paṭhamajjhāna phassena
translated: Thus it is said: “Without realizing the eight emancipations, he is liberated by the power of wisdom alone” .🔽“Having made it non-existent in the future” : having made it non-existent in the future.

original: vinā parijānanādippakārehi cattāri saccāni jānanto paṭivijjhanto tesaṃ kiccānaṃ matthakappattiyā
analyzed: vinā parijānana ādi ppakārehi cattāri saccāni jānantaḥ paṭivijjhantaḥ tesam kiccānam matthaka ppattiyā
translated: “Liberated by understanding and by seeing” : he is liberated by understanding, by the wisdom that penetrates the four truths through the process of full understanding, etc., by the experience of the first jhana.🔽He is liberated by the pre-eminence of his function, by the completion of his task.

original: niṭṭhitakiccatāya visesena muttoti vimutto. So paññāvimutto. Sukkhavipassakoti samathabhāvanāsinehābhāvena
analyzed: niṭṭhita kicca tāya visesena mutto ti vimuttaḥ so paññā vimutto sukkha vipassako ti samatha bhāvanā sineha abhāvena
translated: “Liberated in wisdom” : he is liberated in wisdom.

original: sukkhā lūkhā, asiniddhā vā vipassanā etassāti sukkhavipassako. Ṭhatvāti pādakakaraṇavasena
analyzed: sukkhā lūkhā asi niddhā vā vipassanā etassa ati sukkha vipassakaḥ ṭhatvā ati pādaka karaṇa vasena
translated: “Dry insight worker” : his insight is dry, rough, and unsoothed, because he lacks the affection of the development of serenity.🔽“Having stood” : having stood by way of the preparatory task.🔽“In any one” : in this or that, in each one.

original: ṭhatvā. Aññatarasminti ca aññataraaññatarasmiṃ, ekekasminti attho. Evañhissa pañcavidhatā
analyzed: aññatarasmin ti ca aññatara aññatarasmin eka ekasmin ti attho evam hi sa pañcavidha tā
translated: Thus his fivefoldness is stated.

original: siyā. “Na heva kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharatī”ti iminā sātisayassa samādhibalassa🔽abhāvo dīpito. “Paññāya cassa disvā”tiādinā sātisayassa paññābalassa bhāvo. Paññāya
analyzed: siyā na ha iva kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati iti iminā sa atisayassa samādhi balassa  abhāvaḥ dīpito paññāya cassa disvā ati ādinā sa atisayassa paññā balassa bhāvo paññāya
translated: It may be. By the words “He does not abide in the attainment of the eight emancipations” the absence of the strength of concentration beyond that is shown. By the words “Having seen with wisdom” the presence of the strength of wisdom beyond that is shown.

original: cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā hontīti na āsavā paññāya passanti, dassanakāraṇā pana
analyzed: cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti iti na āsavā paññāya passanti dassana kāraṇā pana
translated: The taints are not seen by wisdom. But they are said to be “seen” when they are destroyed because of seeing.

original: parikkhīṇā “disvā parikkhīṇā”ti vuttā. Dassanāyattaparikkhayattā eva hi dassanaṃ🔽āsavānaṃ khayassa purimakiriyā hoti.
analyzed: parikkhīṇā disvā parikkhīṇā ati vuttā dassana āyatta parikkhaya ttā eva hi dassanam  āsavānam khayassa purima kiriyā hoti
translated: For seeing is the prior action for the destruction of the taints because the destruction is dependent on seeing.

original: Aṭṭhavimokkhavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭha vimokkha vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the eight emancipations.

original: 129. Ekassa bhikkhunoti sattasu ariyapuggalesu ekassa bhikkhuno. Viññāṇaṭṭhitiādinā
analyzed: ekassa bhikkhuno ti sattasu ariya puggalesu ekassa bhikkhuno viññāṇa ṭṭhiti ādinā
translated: Of one bhikkhu: of one bhikkhu among the seven kinds of noble persons. By the words “having fully understood with wisdom” the name “one liberated by wisdom” is given to the mode of life consisting in full understanding, etc.,

original: parijānanādivasappa vattaniggamanañca paññāvimuttanāmañca. Itarassāti ubhatobhāgavimuttassa.
analyzed: parijānanā divasa ppa vatta niggamanañca paññā vimutta nāmañca itarassa ati ubhatobhāga vimuttassa
translated: of the stations of consciousness, etc. Of the other: of the one liberated in both ways.🔽For it is with reference to these two that the words “of two bhikkhus” were said above.

original: Ime sandhāya hi pubbe “dvinnaṃ bhikkhūna”nti vuttaṃ. Kenaṭṭhenāti kena sabhāvena.
analyzed: ime sandhāya hi pubbe dvinnam bhikkhūnam ti vuttam kenaṭṭhena ati kena sabhāvena
translated: By what essential characteristic?

original: Sabhāvo hi ñāṇena yāthāvato araṇīyato ñātabbato “attho”ti vuccati, so eva ttha-kārassa
analyzed: sabhāvaḥ hi ñāṇena yāthāvataḥ araṇīyataḥ ñātabbataḥ atthaḥ ti vuccati saḥ eva tthakārassa
translated: For the individual essence is called “meaning” because it is to be known by knowledge as it actually is. That same individual essence is called “meaning” by making the tth of attha into ṭṭ.

original: ṭṭha-kāraṃ katvā “aṭṭho”ti vutto. Adhimuccanaṭṭhenāti adhikaṃ savisesaṃ muccanaṭṭhena,
analyzed: ṭṭhakāram katvā aṭṭhaḥ ti vuttaḥ adhimuccana ṭhena ati adhikam sa visesam muccana ṭṭhena
translated: By the meaning of “adherence” : by the meaning of “adherence” in the sense of “adherence in excess,” in the sense of “adherence with distinction.”

original: etena satipi sabbassāpi rūpāvacarajjhānassa vikkhambhanavasena paṭipakkhato vimuttabhāve🔽yena bhāvanāvisesena taṃ jhānaṃ sātisayaṃ paṭipakkhato vimuccitvā pavattati, so bhāvanāviseso🔽dīpito. Bhavati hi samānajātiyuttopi bhāvanāvisesena pavattiākāraviseso, yathā taṃ
analyzed: etena sati api sabbassa api rūpāvacara jhānassa vikkhambhana vasena paṭipakkhataḥ vimutta bhāve  yena bhāvanā visesena tam jhānam sa atisayam paṭipakkhataḥ vimuccitvā pavattati saḥ bhāvanā visesaḥ  dīpitaḥ bhavati hi samāna jāti yuttaḥ api bhāvanā visesena pavatti ākāra visesaḥ yathā tam
translated: Although all jhāna of the fine-material sphere is liberated from opposition by suppression,🔽the distinction in the development of that jhāna is shown by the distinction in the way in which it occurs liberated from opposition in excess by that particular development.

original: saddhāvimuttatā diṭṭhippattassa. Tathā paccanīkadhammehi suṭṭhu vimuttatāya, evaṃ
analyzed: saddhā vimutta tā diṭṭhi ppattassa tathā paccanīka dhammehi suṭṭhu vimutta tāya evam
translated: For even though it is associated with the same kind of consciousness, there is a distinction in the way in which it occurs owing to the distinction in the development, just as there is in the case of the “liberation of will” and the “liberation by wisdom” .

original: aniggahitabhāvena nirāsaṅkatāya abhirativasena suṭṭhu adhimuccanaṭṭhenapi vimokkho.
analyzed: a niggahita bhāvena nirāsaṅka tāya abhirati vasena suṭṭhu adhimuccana ṭṭhena api vimokkhaḥ
translated: And it is liberated in the sense of “adherence” too, because of the extreme adherence by way of extreme confidence due to the extreme liberation from opposing states.🔽Hence he said “and in the object” .

original: Tenāha “ārammaṇe cā”tiādi. Ayaṃ panatthoti ayaṃ adhimuccanaṭṭho pacchime vimokkhe
analyzed: tena āha ārammaṇe ca atiādi ayam pana atthaḥ ti ayam adhimuccana ṭṭho pacchime vimokkhe
translated: This is the meaning, etc. This is the meaning of “adherence” in the last two liberations.

original: nirodhe natthi, kevalo vimuttaṭṭho eva tattha labbhati, taṃ sayameva parato vakkhati.
analyzed: nirodhe na atthi kevalaḥ vimutta ṭṭhaḥ eva tattha labbhati tam sayam eva paratas vakkhati
translated: In the case of cessation, there is none of this, only the meaning of deliverance is applicable there. He will deal with that in the next section.

original: Rūpīti yenāyaṃ sasantatipariyāpannena rūpena samannāgato, taṃ yassa jhānassa hetubhāvena
analyzed: rūpī iti yena ayam sa santati pariyāpannena rūpena samannāgataḥ tam yassa jhānassa hetu bhāvena
translated: “Possessed of form”: he is possessed of the kind of materiality that is included in his own continuity, and that is the materiality that is distinguished by being the cause of the jhāna.

original: visiṭṭhaṃ rūpaṃ hoti, yena visiṭṭhena rūpena “rūpī”ti vucceyya rūpī-saddassa atisayatthadīpanato,
analyzed: visiṭṭham rūpam hoti yena visiṭṭhena rūpena rūpī iti vucceyya rūpī saddassa atisaya ttha dīpanato
translated: The word “possessed of form” is stated in the sense of predominance, since it is by reason of the distinguished materiality that one is called “possessed of form.”

original: tadeva sasantatipariyāpannarūpavasena paṭiladdhaṃ jhānaṃ idha paramatthato rūpībhāvasādhakanti
analyzed: tat eva sa santati pariyāpanna rūpa vasena paṭiladdham jhānam idha paramatthataḥ rūpībhāva sādhakanti
translated: The jhāna itself, which is obtained by means of the materiality included in one’s own continuity, should be regarded as the fulfiller of the “possessed of form” condition here in the ultimate sense.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenāha “ajjhatta”ntiādi. Rūpajjhānaṃ rūpaṃ uttarapadalopena. Rūpānīti
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tena āha ajjhatta ntiādi rūpa jjhānam rūpam uttara pada lopena rūpāni iti
translated: Hence he said “internally” and so on. The jhāna that has materiality is “material” in the sense of omitting the prefix vi .🔽But here the omission of the prefix should be regarded as taking place in the word “material” .

original: panettha purimapadalopo daṭṭhabbo. Tena vuttaṃ “nīlakasiṇādirūpānī”ti. Rūpe kasiṇarūpe
analyzed: pana ittha purima pada lopo daṭṭhabbo tena vuttam nīla kasiṇa ādi rūpāni iti rūpe kasiṇa rūpe
translated: That is why he said “materiality as the kasiṇa of blue, and so on” .🔽“Perception of materiality” is perception of the kasiṇa materiality.

original: saññā rūpasaññā, sā etassa atthīti rūpasaññī, saññāsīsena jhānaṃ vadati. Tappaṭikkhepena
analyzed: saññā rūpa saññā sā etassa atthi iti rūpa saññī saññā sīsena jhānam vadati tad paṭikkhepena
translated: He has that, thus he is “percipient of materiality.” He states the jhāna by the perception that is the principal factor in it.🔽“Non-percipient of materiality” is in the sense of absence of that perception.

original: arūpasaññī. Tenāha “ajjhattaṃ na rūpasaññī”tiādi.
analyzed: arūpa saññī tena āha ajjhattam na rūpa saññī itiādi
translated: That is why he said “internally non-percipient of materiality” and so on.

original: “Anto appanāyaṃ subhanti ābhogo natthī”ti iminā pubbābhogavasena tathā adhimutti🔽siyāti dasseti. Evañhettha tathāvattabbatāpatticodanā samatthitā hoti. Yasmā suvisuddhesu🔽nīlādīsu vaṇṇakasiṇesu tattha katādhikārānaṃ abhirativasena suṭṭhu adhimuccanaṭṭho
analyzed: antar appanā ayam subhanti ābhogo natthi iti iminā pubba ābhoga vasena tathā  siyā ti dasseti evañhi ittha tathāvattabba tā āpatti codanā samatthitā hoti yasmā su visuddhesu  nīla ādīsu vaṇṇa kasiṇesu tattha kata adhikārānam abhirati vasena suṭṭhu adhimuccana ṭṭho
translated: “There is no conceiving of it as beautiful in the attainment itself” shows that the resolve is of the same kind as the previous conceiving.🔽So the question and answer here are complete.

original: sambhavati, tasmā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ tathā tatiyo vimokkho saṃvaṇṇito, yasmā pana mettāvasena
analyzed: sambhavati tasmai aṭṭhakathā ayam tathā tatiyaḥ vimokkho saṃvaṇṇito yasmai pana mettā vasena
translated: Since the kasiṇas of blue, etc., are quite pure, it is possible to resolve upon them by over-mastering them with the will, and that is why the third liberation is commended in the commentary in this way.

original: pavattamānā bhāvanā satte appaṭikūlato dahanti tesu tato adhimuccitvāva pavattati,🔽tasmā paṭisambhidāmagge “brahmavihārabhāvanā subhavimokkho”ti vuttā, tayidaṃ ubhayampi
analyzed: pavattamānā bhāvanā satte a paṭikūlataḥ dahanti tesu tatas adhimuccitvā ava pavattati  tasmā paṭisambhidā magge brahmavihāra bhāvanā subha vimokkhā ti vuttā tayā idam ubhayam pi
translated: But since the development of the divine abidings occurs by way of loving-kindness, etc., it is only by over-mastering beings with the will that it occurs, not by over-mastering them as beautiful.

original: tena tena pariyāyena vuttattā na virujjhatīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: tena tena pariyāyena vutta ttā na virujjhati iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: That is why it is said in the Paṭisambhidā: “The development of the divine abidings is the beautiful liberation” . So this should be regarded as not contradictory, since it is stated in different ways.

original: Sabbasoti anavasesato. Na hi catunnaṃ arūpakkhandhānaṃ ekadesopi tattha avassissati.
analyzed: sabbaso ti anavasesataḥ na hi catunnam arūpa kkhandhānam eka desaḥ api tattha avassissati
translated: All: without exception. For not even a fraction of the four immaterial aggregates remains there.

original: Visuddhattāti yathāparicchinnakāle nirodhitattā. Uttamo vimokkho nāma ariyeheva samāpajjitabbato,
analyzed: visuddha ttā ati yathā paricchinna kāle nirodhita ttā uttamaḥ vimokkhaḥ nāma ariyeha iva samāpajjitabbato
translated: ‘By purity’: by cessation at the time delimited. ‘The supreme liberation’ is so called because it can be entered only by Noble Ones,

original: ariyaphalapariyosānattā diṭṭheva dhamme nibbānappattibhāvato ca.
analyzed: ariya phala pariyosāna ttā diṭṭhe iva dhamme nibbāna ppatti bhāvato ca
translated: because it ends in the Noble Fruit, and because it leads to the attainment of Nibbāna here and now.

original: 130. Ādito paṭṭhāyāti paṭhamasamāpattito paṭṭhāya. Yāva pariyosānā samāpatti, tāva.
analyzed: āditas paṭṭhāya ati paṭhama samāpattitaḥ paṭṭhāya yāva pariyosānā samāpatti tāva
translated: ‘From the beginning’: from the first jhāna. As long as there is attainment, so long.

original: Aṭṭhatvāti katthaci samāpattiyaṃ aṭṭhito eva, nirantarameva paṭipāṭiyā, uppaṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: a ṭhatvā ti katthaci samāpattiyam aṭṭhitaḥ eva nirantaram eva paṭipāṭiyā uppaṭipāṭiyā
translated: ‘Without wavering’: without standing still in any jhāna, but entering only in unbroken and reverse order.

original: ca samāpajjatevāti attho. Tenāha “ito cito ca sañcaraṇavasena vutta”nti. Icchati🔽samāpajjituṃ. Tattha “samāpajjati pavisatī”ti samāpattisamaṅgīpuggalo taṃ taṃ paviṭṭho
analyzed: ca samāpajjatā iva iti attho tena āha itas ca itas ca sañcaraṇa vasena vuttanti icchati  samāpajjitum tattha samāpajjati pavisati iti samāpatti samaṅgī puggalaḥ tam tam paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: This is the meaning. Hence it is said, ‘It is said of him that he enters and emerges by skipping over in this way and that way.’🔽He wishes to enter.

original: viya hotīti katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: viya hoti iti katvā vuttam
translated: ‘He enters and emerges’ is said of the person who possesses attainment, because he is as if entered and emerged.

original: Dvīhi bhāgehi vimuttoti arūpajjhānena vikkhambhanavimokkhena, maggena samucchedavimokkhenāti
analyzed: dvīhi bhāgehi vimuttaḥ ti arūpa jhānena vikkhambhana vimokkhena maggena samuccheda vimokkhena ati
translated: ‘Liberated in both ways’: by the jhāna of the immaterial sphere, which is liberation by substitution of opposites, and by the path, which is liberation by eradication.

original: dvīhi vimuccanabhāgehi, arūpasamāpattiyā rūpakāyato, maggena nāmakāyatoti dvīhi vimuccitabbabhāgehi
analyzed: dvīhi vimuccana bhāgehi arūpa samāpattiyāḥ rūpa kāyataḥ maggena nāma kāyataḥ ti dvīhi vimuccitabba bhāgehi
translated: He is liberated by two liberations that are to be liberated from.

original: ca vimutto. Tenāha “arūpasamāpattiyā”tiādi. Vimuttoti hi kilesehi vimutto, vimuccanto
analyzed: ca vimuttaḥ tena āha arūpa samāpattiyā atiādi vimuttaḥ iti hi kilesehi vimuttaḥ vimuccantaḥ
translated: He is liberated, thus he is liberated from defilements. He is liberated, thus he is liberating from defilements.

original: ca kilesānaṃ vikkhambhanasamucchindanehi kāyadvayato vimuttoti ayamettha attho. Gāthāya
analyzed: ca kilesānam vikkhambhana samucchindanehi kāya dvayataḥ vimuttaḥ ti ayam ettha atthaḥ gāthāya
translated: He is liberated by the two bodies that are the suppression and the severing of defilements. This is the meaning here.

original: ca ākiñcaññāyatanalābhino upasivabrāhmaṇassa bhagavatā “nāmakāyā vimutto”ti ubhatobhāgavimutto🔽muni akkhāto. Tattha atthaṃ paletīti atthaṃ gacchati. Na upeti saṅkhanti “asukaṃ
analyzed: ca ākiñcaññāyatana lābhinaḥ upasiva brāhmaṇassa bhagavatā nāma kāyā vimutto ti ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ  muni akkhāto tattha attham paleti iti attham gacchati na upeti asukam
translated: And in the verse the Blessed One declared the sage who has attained the base consisting of nothingness to be “liberated from the mental body” and “liberated in both ways.”

original: nāma disaṃ gato”ti vohāraṃ na gacchati. Evaṃ muni nāmakāyā vimuttoti evaṃ arūpaṃ
analyzed: nāma disam gataḥ iti vohāram na gacchati evam muni nāma kāyāḥ vimuttaḥ ti evam arūpam
translated: Herein, he goes to the meaning, thus he goes to the end. He does not come to the reckoning, thus he does not come to the expression “He has gone to such and such a direction.”

original: upapanno sekkhamuni pakatiyā pubbeva rūpakāyā vimutto, tattha ca catutthamaggaṃ nibbattetvā
analyzed: upapanno sekkha muni pakatiyā pubbā iva rūpa kāyā vimutto tattha ca catuttha maggam nibbattetvā
translated: Thus the sage liberated from the mental body, thus the learner sage who has reappeared in the immaterial world is already liberated from the material body. And after he has generated the fourth path there,

original: nāmakāyassa pariññātattā puna nāmakāyāpi vimutto. Ubhatobhāgavimutto khīṇāsavo hutvā🔽anupādāya parinibbānasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ, “khattiyo brāhmaṇo”ti
analyzed: nāmakāyassa pariññāta ttā puna nāmakāya api vimuttaḥ ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ khīṇāsavaḥ hutvā  an upādāya parinibbāna saṅkhātam attham paleti na upeti saṅkham khattiyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ti
translated: He is liberated from both sides. Having become one whose cankers are destroyed,🔽he passes away without clinging. He does not come within the scope of the terms “noble one” or “ordinary man,” etc.,

original: evaṃ ādikaṃ samaññaṃ na gacchatīti attho.
analyzed: evam ādikam samaññam na gacchati iti attho
translated: and he does not come within the scope of the terms “warrior,” “brahmin,” etc. This is the meaning.

original: “Aññatarato vuṭṭhāyā”ti idaṃ kiṃ ākāsānañcāyatanādīsu aññataralābhīvasena vuttaṃ,
analyzed: aññataratas vuṭṭhāya ati idam kim ākāsa anañcāyatana ādīsu aññatara lābhī vasena vuttam
translated: As regards the words “having emerged from anywhere,” it may be asked: does this refer to one who has attained to any one of the immaterial states,

original: udāhu sabbāruppalābhīvasenāti yathicchasi, tathā hotu, yadi sabbāruppalābhīvasena
analyzed: udāhu sabbāruppala abhīvasena ati yathā icchasi tathā ha utu yadi sabbāruppala abhīvasena
translated: or to one who has attained to all of them? Let it be as you wish. If it refers to one who has attained to all of them,

original: vuttaṃ, na koci virodho. Atha tattha aññataralābhīvasena vuttaṃ, “yato kho, ānanda,
analyzed: vuttam na koci virodhaḥ atha tattha aññatara lābhī vasena vuttam yatas kho ānanda
translated: there is no contradiction. But if it refers to one who has attained to any one of them, does it not contradict the passage:🔽“When a bhikkhu enters upon the eight emancipations in forward order … in reverse order … in forward and reverse order … having seen with his body’s sensitivity” ,

original: bhikkhu ime aṭṭha vimokkhe anulomampi samāpajjatī”tiādivacanena virujjheyyāti? Yasmā
analyzed: bhikkhu ime aṭṭha vimokkhe anulomam pi samāpajjati iti ādi vacanena virujjheyyāti yasmā
translated: and so on?

original: arūpāvacarajjhānesu ekassāpi lābhī “aṭṭhavimokkhalābhī” tveva vuccati aṭṭhavimokkhe
analyzed: arūpāvacara jhānesu ekassa api lābhī aṭṭha vimokkha lābhī tu eva vuccati aṭṭha vimokkhe
translated: Because it is said that one who has attained to any one of the immaterial jhānas is “one who has attained to the eight emancipations.”

original: ekadesassāpi taṃnāmadānasamatthatāsambhavato. Ayañhi aṭṭhavimokkhasamaññā samudāye
analyzed: eka desassa api tad nāma dāna samattha tā sambhavataḥ ayam hi aṭṭha vimokkha samaññā samudāye
translated: because it is possible to give it the name of any one of them. For this name of the eight emancipations is established in each of them,🔽like the name of a village established in a part of it.

original: viya tadekadesepi niruḷhāpattisamaññā viyāti. Tena vuttaṃ “ākāsānañcāyatanādīsu aññatarato
analyzed: viya tad eka dese pi niruḷha āpatti samaññā viya ati tena vuttam ākāsa anañcāyatana ādīsu aññataratas
translated: So it is said, “having emerged from any one of the four immaterial states” .

original: vuṭṭhāyā”ti. “Pañcavidho hotī”ti vatvā chabbidhataṃpissa keci parikappenti, taṃ tesaṃ
analyzed: vuṭṭhāya ati pañcavidhaḥ hoti iti vatvā chabbidha taṃpissa keci parikappenti tam tesam
translated: Some people, after saying that it is of five kinds, imagine that it is of six kinds. That is their own idea.

original: matimattaṃ, nicchitovāyaṃ pañho pubbācariyehīti dassetuṃ “keci panā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: matimattam nicchitaḥ uva ayam pañhaḥ pubba ācariyehi iti dassetum keci pana atiādi vuttam
translated: The question is settled as being of five kinds by the former teachers. To show this it is said, “But some say” .

original: Tattha kecīti uttaravihāravāsino, sārasamāsācariyā ca. Te hi “ubhatobhāgavimuttoti
analyzed: tattha keci iti uttara vihāra vāsino ca te hi ubhatobhāga vimutto ti
translated: Herein, some is the residents of the Northern Monastery and the teachers of the Sārasangaha.

original: ubhayabhāgavimutto samādhivipassanāto”ti vatvā rūpāvacarasamādhināpi samādhiparipanthato
analyzed: ubhaya bhāga vimuttaḥ samādhi vipassanāto ti vatvā rūpāvacara samādhinā api samādhi paripanthato
translated: For they say that the “liberated in both ways” is liberated by both concentration and insight.🔽And they imagine that he is liberated from the obstruction by concentration by means of the concentration of the fine-material sphere.🔽So he is liberated by the fine-material jhāna factor and by the immaterial jhāna factor.

original: vimuttiṃ maññanti. Evaṃ rūpajjhānabhāgena, arūpajjhānabhāgena ca ubhato vimuttoti🔽pāyasamāno. “Tādisamevā”ti iminā yādisaṃ arūpāvacarajjhānaṃ kilesavikkhambhane, tādisaṃ
analyzed: vimuttim maññanti evam rūpa jhāna bhāgena arūpa jhāna bhāgena ca ubhatas vimuttaḥ ti 🔽tādisam eva ati iminā yādisam arūpāvacara jhānam kilesa vikkhambhane tādisam
translated: He is the same as the “liberated in both ways” .

original: rūpāvacaracatutthajjhānaṃ pīti imamatthaṃ ullaṅgeti. Tenāha “tasmā”tiādi.
analyzed: rūpāvacara catuttha jhānam pi iti imam attham ullaṅga iti tena āha tasmā itiādi
translated: The fourth jhāna of the fine-material sphere is the “joy” that “overflows” this meaning. Hence he said “Therefore … ”

original: Ubhatobhāgavimuttapañhoti ubhatobhāgavimuttassa chabbidhataṃ nissāya uppannapañho.🔽Vaṇṇanaṃ nissāyāti tassa padassa atthavacanaṃ nissāya. Cirenāti therassa aparabhāge🔽cirena kālena. Vinicchayanti saṃsayachedakaṃ sanniṭṭhānaṃ patto. Taṃ pañhanti tamatthaṃ.
analyzed: ubhatobhāga vimutta pañhaḥ ti ubhatobhāga vimuttassa chabbidha tam nissāya uppanna pañho  vaṇṇanam nissāya ati tassa padassa attha vacanam nissāya cirena ati therassa aparabhāge  cirena kālena vinicchayanti saṃsaya chedakam sanniṭṭhānam tam pañhanti tam attham
translated: The question about one “liberated in both ways” : the question that arose in dependence on the sixfold method of one “liberated in both ways” .🔽In dependence on the commentary : in dependence on the statement of the meaning of that term. After a long time : after a long time, after the elder’s death.🔽He reached a conclusion : he reached a decision that removed his doubt. That question : that matter.

original: Ñātuṃ icchito hi attho pañho. Na kenaci sutapubbanti kenaci kiñci na sutapubbaṃ,🔽idaṃ atthajātanti adhippāyo. Kiñcāpi upekkhāsahagataṃ, kiñcāpi kilese vikkhambhetīti🔽paccekaṃ kiñcāpi-saddo yojetabbo. Samudācaratīti pavattati. Tattha kāraṇamāha “ime
analyzed: ñātum icchitaḥ hi atthaḥ pañhaḥ na kenaci suta pubbanti kenaci kiñci na suta pubbam  idam attha jātanti adhippāyaḥ kiñca api upekkhā sahagatam kiñca api kilese vikkhambheti iti  paccekam kiñcā api saddaḥ yojetabbaḥ samudācarati iti pavattati tattha kāraṇam āha ime
translated: For a question is a matter that one wishes to know. Never heard before by anyone : the intention is that no one has ever heard anything like this.🔽Although it is associated with equanimity, and although it suppresses defilements,

original: hī”tiādinā, tena rūpāvacarabhāvanato āruppabhāvanā savisesaṃ kilese vikkhambheti
analyzed: hi iti ādinā tena rūpāvacara bhāvanataḥ āruppa bhāvanā sa visesam kilese vikkhambheti
translated: the word “although” should be construed with each clause. It occurs : it comes about. Here he gives a reason: “because” , etc. Thus the development of the immaterial states surpasses the development of the fine-material sphere in the suppression of defilements.

original: rūpavirāgabhāvanābhāvato, uparibhāvanābhāvato cāti dassetīti. Evañca katvā aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: rūpa virāga bhāvanā bhāvato upari bhāvanā bhāvato ca ati dasseti iti evam ca katvā aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: And when it is so taken, then the passage in the commentary on the meaning of “development” in the case of the immaterial states, namely:

original: āruppabhāvanāniddese yaṃ vuttaṃ “tassevaṃ tasmiṃ nimitte punappunaṃ cittaṃ cārentassa
analyzed: āruppa bhāvanā niddese yam vuttam tassa ivam tasmim nimitte punappunam cittam cārentassa
translated: “As he brings his mind again and again on to that sign in this way,🔽the hindrances are suppressed, and his mind becomes concentrated in access concentration,”

original: nīvaraṇāni vikkhambhanti sati santiṭṭhatī”tiādi, taṃ samatthataṃ hotīti. Idaṃ suttanti
analyzed: nīvaraṇāni vikkhambhanti sati santiṭṭhati itiādi tam samatthatam hoti iti idam suttanti
translated: is appropriate.🔽This sutta,

original: puggalapaññattipāṭhamāha. Sabbañhi buddhavacanaṃ atthasūcanādiatthena suttanti vutto
analyzed: puggala paññatti pāṭham āha sabbam hi buddha vacanam attha sūcana ādi atthena suttam ti vuttaḥ
translated: he said, is the text for the description of the person. For all the Buddha’s utterance is called “sutta” in the sense of “that which is uttered” .

original: vāyamattho. Yaṃ pana tattha vattabbaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vuttameva. Aṭṭhannaṃ vimokkhānaṃ🔽anulomādito samāpajjanena sātisayaṃ santānassa abhisaṅkhatattā, aṭṭhamañca uttamaṃ
analyzed: vā ayam atthaḥ yat pana tattha vattabbam tat heṭṭhā vuttam eva aṭṭhannam vimokkhānam  anuloma āditas samāpajjanena sa atisayam santānassa abhisaṅkhata ttā aṭṭhamañca uttamam
translated: And the meaning of that is the same as that of the word “suttanta” . But what should be said about that has already been said above.🔽Because of the special kind of formation of the continuity by attaining the eight liberations in forward order, etc.,

original: vimokkhaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ katvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā aggamaggādhigamena ubhatobhāgavimuccanato
analyzed: vimokkham padaṭṭhānam katvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā agga magga adhigamena ubhatobhāga vimuccanato
translated: and because of the attainment of the supreme path by developing insight with the eighth, the supreme liberation, as its proximate cause, and by being “liberated in both ways” ,

original: ca imāya ubhatobhāgavimuttiyā sabbaseṭṭhatā veditāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: ca imāya ubhatobhāga vimuttiyā sabba seṭṭha tā veditā ati daṭṭhabbā
translated: the “liberation of both kinds” should be regarded as the best of all.

original: Mahānidānasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.🔽3. Mahāparinibbānasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mahāparinibbāna sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the word “great” in the Mahānidāna Sutta is finished.🔽The Great Passing

original: 131. Pūjanīyabhāvato, buddhasampadañca pahāya pavattatā mahantañca taṃ parinibbānañcāti🔽mahāparinibbānaṃ; savāsanappahānato mahantaṃ kilesakkhayaṃ nissāya pavattaṃ parinibbānantipi🔽mahāparinibbānaṃ; mahatā kālena mahatā vā guṇarāsinā sādhitaṃ parinibbānantipi mahāparinibbānaṃ;
analyzed: pūjanīya bhāvataḥ buddha sampadam ca pahāya pavattatā mahantam ca tam parinibbānam ca ati  mahāparinibbānam sa vāsanā pahānataḥ mahantam kilesa kkhayam nissāya pavattam parinibbānam ti pi  mahāparinibbānam mahatā kālena mahatā vā guṇa rāsinā sādhitam parinibbānam ti pi mahāparinibbānam
translated: The great passing away is so called because it is great and because it is a passing away. It is great because it is the passing away of the Blessed One, who is worthy of great offerings, and because it is a great passing away, being a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.

original: mahantabhāvāya, dhātūnaṃ bahubhāvāya parinibbānantipi mahāparinibbānaṃ; mahato lokato🔽nissaṭaṃ parinibbānantipi mahāparinibbānaṃ; sabbalokāsādhāraṇattā buddhānaṃ sīlādiguṇehi
analyzed: mahanta bhāvāya dhātūnam bahu bhāvāya parinibbānam tipi mahāparinibbānam mahataḥ lokataḥ  nissaṭam parinibbānam ti pi mahāparinibbānam sabba loka asādhāraṇa ttā buddhānam sīla ādi guṇehi
translated: Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.🔽Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken to maintain.

original: mahato buddhassa bhagavato parinibbānantipi mahāparinibbānaṃ; mahati sāsane patiṭṭhite
analyzed: mahataḥ buddhassa bhagavataḥ parinibbānam tipi mahāparinibbānam mahati sāsane patiṭṭhite
translated: Or alternatively, it is a great passing away because it is a passing away that occurs by the Blessed One’s abandoning of the perfection of the Buddha-qualities that he had previously undertaken

original: parinibbānantipi mahāparinibbānanti buddhassa bhagavato parinibbānaṃ vuccati, tappaṭisaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: parinibbānan ti pi mahā parinibbānan ti buddhassa bhagavataḥ parinibbānam vuccati tad paṭisaṃyuttam
translated: “The Great Passing” : the passing of the Blessed One, the Buddha, is called the “Great Passing” .🔽The discourse connected with that is the Great Passing Discourse .

original: suttaṃ mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ. Gijjhā ettha vasantīti gijjhaṃ, gijjhaṃ kūṭaṃ etassāti
analyzed: suttam mahāparinibbāna suttam gijjhāḥ ettha vasanti iti gijjham gijjham kūṭam etassa ati
translated: “The Vultures’ Peak” : vultures live here, thus it is “the Vultures’ Peak” .🔽Or alternatively, it is “the Vultures’ Peak” because it is like a vulture’s head, or because it is a peak for vultures.

original: gijjhakūṭo, gijjhaṃ viya vā gijjhaṃ, kūṭaṃ, taṃ etassāti gijjhakūṭo, pabbato, tasmiṃ
analyzed: gijjhakūṭaḥ gijjham viya vā gijjham kūṭam tam etassa ati gijjhakūṭaḥ pabbato tasmin
translated: It is a mountain.🔽“There” means “on that Vultures’ Peak.”

original: gijjhakūṭe. Tenāha “gijjhā”tiādi. Abhiyātukāmoti ettha abhi-saddo abhibhavanattho,🔽“abhivijānātū”tiādīsu viyāti āha “abhibhavanatthāya yātukāmo”ti. Vajjirājānoti “vajjetabbā
analyzed: gijjhakūṭe tena āha gijjha atiādi abhiyātu kāmaḥ ti ettha abhi saddaḥ abhibhavana atthaḥ  abhivijānātu uti ādīsu viyāti āha abhibhavana thāya yātu kāmaḥ iti vajji rājānā ti vajjetabbā
translated: “Desiring to go”: the prefix abhi here has the meaning of “overpowering” .🔽Thus he says: “desiring to go for the purpose of overpowering.”

original: ime”tiādito pavattaṃ vacanaṃ upādāya “vajjī”ti laddhanāmā rājāno, vajjīraṭṭhassa
analyzed: ime iti āditaḥ pavattam vacanam upādāya vajjī iti laddha nāmā rājānaḥ vajjī raṭṭhassa
translated: “The Vajjian kings”: the kings who have received the name “Vajjians” from the expression “these are to be conquered” .

original: vā rājāno vajjirājāno. Vajjiraṭṭhassa pana vajjisamaññā tannivāsirājakumāravasena
analyzed: vā rājānaḥ vajji rājānaḥ vajji raṭṭhassa pana vajji samaññā tad nivāsi rāja kumāra vasena

translated: and by serving their husbands. They honour them: they honour them by showing them respect. But that respect is preceded by their own satisfaction, which is why it is said, “They love them with a mind free from hate.” They serve them: they serve them by attending to their washing, rubbing, and massaging. They support them: they support them by keeping the connection unbroken.

original: Pasayhākārassāti balakkārassa. Kāmaṃ vuddhiyā pūjanīyatāya “vuddhihāniyo”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: pasayhākārassa ati balakkārassa kāmam vuddhiyā pūjanīya tāya vuddhi hāniyā iti vuttam
translated: and by attending on their husbands. They honour them: they respect them. But that respect is preceded by their being pleased with them. Hence he said: “They love them with a mind of love” . They serve them: they serve them with a curtsy. They show them respect: they show them the respect of a mind that is humble, thinking “These are our grandfathers and grandmothers, great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers, etc.” . They support them: they support them by keeping the relationship unbroken. They do not despise them: they do not despise them by the contempt of power. Although it is growth that is to be praised, still it is said “growth and decline” .

original: attho pana vuttānukkameneva yojetabbo, pāḷiyaṃ vā yasmā “vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no🔽parihānī”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā tadanukkamena “vuddhihāniyo”ti vuttaṃ.

translated: But the meaning should be construed in the same order as the words, namely, “growth only is to be expected, not decline” .

analyzed: vipaccitum a laddha ukāse pāpa kamme tassa kammassa vipāke vā anavasaraḥ uva devatā upasaggo
translated: and there is no escape from the result of that kamma, which has no opportunity to ripen in a place of growth, by going to the gods.

translated: But there is a chance that the gods may come to the place where he has gone for refuge, so he says, “When it has not arisen … and makes it grow.”

analyzed: an icchitanti an iṭṭham āvaraṇato ti nisedhanataḥ yassa dhammataḥ an apetā dhammiyā ti

analyzed: idha dhammikā ati vuttā miga sūkara ādi ghātāya su nakha ādīnam kaḍḍhitvā vana caraṇam vājaḥ

original: migavā, tattha niyuttā, te vā vājenti nentīti vājikā, migavadhacārino. Cittappavattiṃ
analyzed: migavā tattha niyuttā te vā vājenti nenti iti vājikāḥ miga vadha cārino citta ppavattim
translated: “Hunters” are those who are engaged in that. Or alternatively, they “hunt” , they pursue, deer, thus they are “hunters” , those who pursue deer for the purpose of killing them.🔽he asks about the occurrence of consciousness.

analyzed: pucchati kāyika vācasika payogena hi sā loke pākaṭā pakāsa bhūtā ati

original: 135. Devāyatanabhāvena citattā, lokassa cittīkāraṭṭhānattā ca cetiyaṃ ahosi.
analyzed: devāyatana bhāvena citattā lokassa cittīkāra ṭṭhāna ttā ca cetiyam ahosi
translated: It was a shrine because it was the object of the minds of the people and because it was the object of the people’s veneration.

original: Kāmaṃkāravasena kiñcipi na karaṇīyāti akaraṇīyā. Kāmaṃkāro pana hatthagatakaraṇavasenāti
analyzed: kāmaṃkāra vasena kiñcipi na karaṇīyā ati akaraṇīyā kāmaṃkāraḥ pana hattha gata karaṇa vasena ati

original: āha “aggahetabbāti attho”ti. Abhimukhayuddhenāti abhimukhaṃ ujukameva saṅgāmakaraṇena.
analyzed: āha aggahetabbā ati atthaḥ ti abhimukha yuddhena ati abhimukham ujukam eva saṅgāma karaṇena
translated: ‘By open warfare’ means by waging battle face to face, straightforwardly.🔽‘By conciliation and by gifts’ are mentioned in order to show that these are also means.

analyzed: upalāpanam sāmam dānam ca ati dassetum alam ti ādi vuttam bhedaḥ api idha upāyaḥ evā ti
translated: But since intrigue is also a means here,🔽it is said: ‘except by intrigue and by sowing dissension among their friends.’

analyzed: vuttam aññatra mithu bhedāya ati yuddhassa pana anupāya tā pagā iva pakāsitā idam ti  aññatra upalāpanāya aññatra mithu bhedā ati ca idam vacanam kathāya nayam labhitvā ati
translated: But the uselessness of warfare is already evident.🔽‘Here’ means🔽in the statement: ‘except by conciliation and by sowing dissension among their friends.’

original: “yāvakīvañca…pe… no parihānī”ti imāya bhagavato kathāya nayaṃ upāyaṃ labhitvā.
analyzed: yāvakīvañcape no iti imāya bhagavataḥ kathāya nayam upāyam labhitvā
translated: ‘Having obtained a means by discussion’ means having obtained a means by way of the Blessed One’s discussion in the passage beginning:🔽‘As long as the Vajjians do not dig the earth for a distance of four fingerbreadths around their city, etc., their growth will not wane.’🔽‘Out of compassion’ means out of sympathy for the Vajjians.

original: Anukampāyāti vajjirājesu anuggahena. Assāti bhagavato.
analyzed: anukampāya ati vajji rājesu anuggahena assa ati bhagavataḥ
translated: ‘I’ means the Blessed One.🔽‘Discussion’ means discussion about the war to be waged with the Vajjians.

original: Kathanti vajjīhi saddhiṃ kātabbayuddhakathaṃ. Ujuṃ karissāmīti paṭirājāno ānetvā pākāraparikhānaṃ aññathābhāvāpādanena ujubhāvaṃ karissāmi.
analyzed: katham ti vajjīhi saddhim kātabba yuddha katham ujum karissāmi iti paṭirājānaḥ ānetvā pākāra parikhānam aññathābhāva āpādanena uju bhāvam karissāmi
translated: ‘I will make it straight’ means I will make it straight by bringing the rival kings and making them remove the ramparts and moats.

original: Patiṭṭhitaguṇoti patiṭṭhitācariyaguṇo. Issarā sannipatantu, mayaṃ anissarā, tattha
analyzed: patiṭṭhita guṇo ti patiṭṭhita ācariya guṇo issarā sannipatantu mayam anissarā tattha
translated: “The qualities of the established teacher” means the qualities of the established teacher. Let those who are free come together, we are not free.

original: gantvā kiṃ karissāmāti licchavino na sannipatiṃsūti yojanā. Sūrā sannipatantūti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: gantvā kim karissāma ati licchavinaḥ na sannipatiṃsu iti yojanā sūrā sannipatantu iti ettha api esā iva nayo
translated: “The qualities of the established teachers” means the qualities of the established teachers. The Licchavīs did not assemble, thinking: “Let the powerful assemble; we are powerless. What can we do there, having gone?” The same method applies here also to “the brave assemble.”

original: Balabherinti yuddhāya balakāyassa uṭṭhānabheriṃ.
analyzed: bala bherim ti yuddhāya balakāyassa uṭṭhāna bherim
translated: “The war-drum” is the drum for the army’s rising.

original: Bhikkhuaparihāniyadhammavaṇṇanā🔽136. Aparihānāya hitāti aparihāniyā, na parihāyanti etehīti vā aparihāniyā, te pana
analyzed: bhikkhu aparihāniya dhamma vaṇṇanā  a parihānāya hitā ati aparihāniyā na parihāyanti vā aparihāniyā te pana
translated: The explanation of the factors that prevent the decline of the bhikkhus

original: yasmā aparihāniyā kārakā nāma honti, tasmā vuttaṃ “aparihānikare”ti. Yasmā pana te
analyzed: yasmai aparihāniyā kārakāḥ nāma honti tasmai vuttam aparihāni karā iti yasmai pana te
translated: “For the non-decline” means for the non-decline, or they do not decline through these, thus for the non-decline. But since they are the makers of the non-decline, therefore it is said: “for the non-decline.”

original: parihānikarānaṃ ujupaṭipakkhabhūtā, tasmā āha “vuddhihetubhūte”ti. Yasmā bhagavato🔽desanā uparūpari ñāṇālokaṃ pasādentī sattānaṃ hadayandhakāraṃ vidhamati, pakāsetabbe
analyzed: uju paṭipakkha bhūtā tasmai āha vuddhi hetu bhūtā iti yasmai bhagavato  desanā upari upari ñāṇa ālokam pasādentī sattānam hadaya andhakāram vidhamati pakāsetabbe
translated: But since they are the direct opposites of the causes of decline, therefore it is said: “for the increase.”

original: ca atthe hatthatale āmalakaṃ viya suṭṭhutaraṃ pākaṭe katvā dasseti, tasmā vuttaṃ

original: “candasahassaṃ…pe… kathayissāmī”ti.
analyzed: canda sahassaṃpe kathayissāmi iti
translated: “I will speak of a thousand moons. ”

original: Yasmā bhagavā “tassa brāhmaṇassa sammukhā vajjīnaṃ abhiṇhasannipātādipaṭipattiṃ kathentoyeva
analyzed: yasmai bhagavā tassa brāhmaṇassa sammukhā abhiṇha sannipāta ādi paṭipattim

analyzed: ayam aparihāniya kathā aniyyānikā vaṭṭa nissitā mayham pana sāsane tathārūpī kathā
translated: this is a talk that does not lead out , that is bound up with the round of births. But in my dispensation a talk of this kind

original: kathetabbā, sā hoti niyyānikā vivaṭṭanissitā, yāya sāsanaṃ mayhaṃ parinibbānato parampi
analyzed: kathetabbā sā hoti niyyānikā vivaṭṭa nissitā yāya sāsanam mayham parinibbānataḥ param pi
translated: should be given, which does lead out , which is not bound up with the round of births, and by which my dispensation will last long after my parinibbāna,

original: addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitika”nti cintesi, tasmā bhikkhū sannipātāpetvā tesaṃ aparihāniye
analyzed: addhaniyam assa cira ṭṭhitikan ti cintesi tasmā bhikkhū sannipātāpetvā tesam a parihāniye
translated: and will not be destroyed.” Therefore he assembled the bhikkhus and taught them the Dhamma of non-decline

original: dhamme desento teneva niyāmena desesi. Tena vuttaṃ “idaṃ vajjisattake vuttasadisamevā”ti.
analyzed: dhamme desento tena iva niyāmena desesi tena vuttam idam vajji sattake vutta sadisam evā ti
translated: in the same way as he had taught it. That is why it is said, “It is the same as that given in the Vajjisattakavagga. ”

original: Evaṃ saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vitthārato dassento “idhāpi cā”tiādimāha. Tattha “tato”tiādi
analyzed: evam saṅkhepataḥ vutta mattham vitthārataḥ dassentaḥ idha api ca atiādim āha tattha tatas itiādi

original: disāsu āgatasāsane vuttaṃ taṃ kathanaṃ. Vihārasīmā ākulā yasmā, tasmā uposathapavāraṇā ṭhitā.
analyzed: disāsu āgata sāsane vuttam tam kathanam vihāra sīmā ākulā yasmai tasmai uposatha pavāraṇā ṭhitā
translated: is the talk given in the dispensation that has come down from the directions. Since the monastery zone is crowded, therefore the observance-day ceremony and the invitation ceremony are suspended.

original: Olīyamānakoti pāḷito, atthato ca vinassamāno. Ukkhipāpentāti paguṇabhāvakaraṇena, atthasaṃvaṇṇanena ca paggaṇhantā.
analyzed: olīyamānakaḥ ti pāḷitaḥ atthataḥ ca vinassamānaḥ ukkhipāpentā ati paguṇa bhāva karaṇena attha saṃvaṇṇanena ca paggaṇhantā
translated: “They should be lifted up” means that they should be lifted up by making them well known and by explaining their meaning.

original: Sāvatthiyaṃ bhikkhū viya pācittiyaṃ desāpetabboti. Vajjiputtakā viya dasavatthudīpanena.
analyzed: sāvatthiyam bhikkhū viya pācittiyam desāpetabbaḥ ti vajji puttakāḥ viya dasa vatthu dīpanena
translated: “He should make them confess an offence” means as the monks at Sāvatthī did.

original: “Gihigatānīti gihipaṭisaṃyuttānī”ti vadanti. Gihīsu gatāni, tehi ñātāni gihigatāni.
analyzed: gihi gatāni iti gihi paṭisaṃyuttāni iti vadanti gihīsu gatāni tehi ñātāni gihi gatāni
translated: “They are connected with householders” means they are connected with householders. They have gone to householders, they are known by householders.

original: Dhūmakālo etassāti dhūmakālikaṃ citakadhūmavūpasamato paraṃ appavattanato.
analyzed: dhūma kālaḥ etassa ati dhūmakālikam citaka dhūma vūpasamataḥ param appavattanato
translated: “The time of the smoke” means the time after the smoke from the funeral pyre has disappeared.

original: Thirabhāvappattāti sāsane thirabhāvaṃ anivattitabhāvaṃ upagatā. Therakārakehīti therabhāvasādhakehi
analyzed: thira bhāva pattā ati sāsane thira bhāvam a nivattita bhāvam upagatā thera kārakehi iti thera bhāva sādhakehi
translated: “They have reached stability” means they have reached stability in the Dispensation, they have reached the state of non-decline.🔽“By those who are leaders of the elders” means by those who have fulfilled the state of an elder.🔽“By the qualities of virtue, etc.” means by the qualities of virtue, etc., which are the qualities of those beyond training.

original: sīlādiguṇehi asekkhadhammehi. Bahū rattiyoti pabbajitā hutvā bahū rattiyo jānanti.
analyzed: sīla ādi guṇehi asekkha dhammehi bahū rattiyaḥ ti pabbajitāḥ hutvā bahū rattiyaḥ jānanti
translated: “For many a night” means for many a night after they have gone forth.

original: Sīlādiguṇesu patiṭṭhāpanameva sāsane pariṇāyakatāti āha “tīsu sikkhāsu pavattentī”ti.
analyzed: sīla ādi guṇesu patiṭṭhāpanam eva sāsane pariṇāyaka tā ti āha tīsu sikkhāsu pavattenti iti
translated: “They should be made to continue in the three trainings” means that they should be made to continue in the three trainings. This is the way in which they are leaders in the Dispensation.

original: Ovādaṃ na denti abhājanabhāvato. Paveṇīkathanti ācariyaparamparābhataṃ sammāpaṭipattidīpanaṃ🔽dhammakathaṃ. Sārabhūtaṃ dhammapariyāyanti samathavipassanāmaggaphalasampāpanena
analyzed: ovādam na denti a bhājana bhāvataḥ ācariya paramparā bhatam sammā paṭipatti dīpanam  dhamma katham sāra bhūtam dhamma pariyāyanti samatha vipassanā magga phala sampāpanena
translated: The talk that is the means of access is a talk on the Dhamma that illuminates right practice and is handed down by a succession of teachers.

original: sārabhūtaṃ bojjhaṅgakosallaanuttarasītībhāvaadhicittasuttādidhammatantiṃ.
analyzed: sāra bhūtam bojjhaṅga kosalla anuttara sītībhāva adhicitta sutta ādi dhamma tantim
translated: The essence of the Dhamma is the Dhamma talk that is the essence of the Dhamma, which brings about the attainment of serenity, insight, the path, and the fruits, and which consists of the discourses on the factors of enlightenment, skillfulness, the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, the four foundations of mindfulness, etc.

original: Punabbhavadānaṃ punabbhavo uttarapadalopena. Itareti ye na paccayavasikā na āmisacakkhukā, te na gacchanti taṇhāya vasaṃ.
analyzed: punabbhava dānam punabbhavaḥ uttara pada lopena itare iti ye na paccayavasikāḥ na āmisa cakkhukāḥ te na gacchanti taṇhāya vasam
translated: The word punabbhava is a bahubbīhi compound, the meaning being “the giving of rebirth.” The others, who are not dependent on conditions and are not eye-lovers, do not come under the sway of craving.

original: Āraññakesūti araññabhāgesu araññapariyāpannesu. Nanu yattha katthacipi taṇhā sāvajjā🔽evāti codanaṃ sandhāyāha “gāmantasenāsanesu hī”tiādi, tena “anuttaresu vimokkhesu🔽pihaṃ upaṭṭhāpayato”ti ettha vuttasinehādayo viya āraññakesu senāsanesu sālayatā
analyzed: āraññakesu iti arañña bhāgesu arañña pariyāpannesu nanu yattha katthacipi taṇhā sāvajjā  eva iti codanam sandhāya āha gāmanta senāsanesu hi itiādi tena anuttaresu vimokkhesu  piham upaṭṭhāpayato ti ettha vutta sineha ādayaḥ viya āraññakesu senāsanesu sālaya tā
translated: In the forest-dwellers’ quarters: in the forest-dwellers’ quarters, which are a part of the forest and included in the forest.🔽But is not craving blameworthy wherever it occurs?

original: sevitabbapakkhiyā evāti dasseti.

translated: With reference to this objection he says, “In the forest-dwellers’ quarters, too,” etc. Thus he shows that the fondness, etc., mentioned in the passage, “One who delights in and enjoys this kind of forest-dwelling,” are to be abandoned, just as the fondness, etc., mentioned in the passage, “One who delights in and enjoys the unsurpassed liberations,” are to be abandoned.

original: Attanāvāti sayameva, tena parehi anussāhitānaṃ saraseneva anāgatānaṃ pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ🔽āgamanaṃ, āgatānañca phāsuvihāraṃ paccāsisantīti dasseti. Iminā nīhārenāti imāya
analyzed: attanā avāti sayam eva tena parehi anussāhitānam sarasena iva anāgatānam pesalānam bhikkhūnam  āgamanam āgatānam ca phāsu vihāram dasseti iminā nīhārena ati imāya
translated: “By himself” means by himself alone, without being asked by others. He is “announcing” the coming of and the comfortable abiding of the well-behaved monks who have not yet come and who will come of their own accord. “By this means” means by this method.

original: paṭipattiyā. Aggahitadhammaggahaṇanti aggahitassa pariyattidhammassa uggahaṇaṃ. Gahitasajjhāyakaraṇanti🔽uggahitassa suṭṭhu atthacintanaṃ. Cintanattho hi sajjhāyasaddo.
analyzed: paṭipattiyāḥ aggahita dhamma ggahaṇanti aggahitassa pariyatti dhammassa uggahaṇam gahita sajjhāya karaṇanti  uggahitassa suṭṭhu attha cintanam cintana atthaḥ hi sajjhāya saddaḥ
translated: “By himself” : he shows that he is inviting the good monks who have not yet come and who have not been invited by others, and that he is welcoming the ones who have come, by himself, of his own accord. “By this means” : by this practice. “To take up the Dhamma that has not been taken up” : to learn the texts that have not been learned. “To review the Dhamma that has been taken up” : to reflect well on the meaning of what has been learned. For the word “review” is synonymous with “reflection.”

original: Entīti upagacchanti. Nisīdanti āsanapaññāpanādinā.

translated: “They come” : they approach. “They sit down” : they sit down after the seats have been prepared.
