translated: and it is called “acceptance” because of the acceptance that comes with the going forth and the descent .

original: okappanasaddhāpi. Tattha pasādasaddhā aparaneyyarūpā hoti savanamattena pasīdanato.🔽Okappanasaddhā saddheyyavatthuṃ ogāhetvā anupavisitvā “evameta”nti paccakkhaṃ karontī
analyzed: okappana saddhā api tattha pasāda saddhā apara neyya rūpā hoti savana mattena pasīdanato  okappana saddhā saddheyya vatthum ogāhetvā an upavisitvā evam etat ti paccakkham karontī
translated: “Two kinds of faith” are the faith of confidence and the faith of acceptance.🔽Herein, the faith of confidence is not to be relied on, since one is confident merely through hearing.🔽The faith of acceptance is to be relied on, since it occurs as if it were making a declaration of truth by entering into and investigating a trustworthy .

original: viya pavattati. Tenāha “saddhādhimutto vakkalittherasadiso hotī”ti. Tassa hīti okappanasaddhāya
analyzed: viya pavattati tena āha saddhā adhimuttaḥ vakkalitthera sadisaḥ hoti iti tassa hi iti okappana saddhāya
translated: That is why it is said, “One who is resolute in faith is like the Elder Vakkali” .🔽“One who has a sense of moral shame” : he has shame , thus he is one who has a sense of moral shame ;

original: samannāgatassa. Hirī etassa atthīti hiri, hiri mano etesanti hirimanāti āha “pāpa…pe…
analyzed: samannāgatassa hirī etassa atthi iti hiri hiri manaḥ etesanti hirimanā ti āha pāpape
translated: he is ashamed of evil, etc., thus he is ashamed of evil, etc.

original: cittā”ti. Pāpato ottappenti ubbijjanti bhāyantīti ottappī.
analyzed: pāpataḥ ottappenti ubbijjanti bhāyanti iti ottappī
translated: “One who is scrupulous” : he is scrupulous about evil, thus he is scrupulous.

original: Bahu sutaṃ suttageyyādi etenāti bahussuto, sutaggahaṇaṃ cettha nidassanamattaṃ dhāraṇaparicayaparipucchānupekkhanadiṭṭhinijjhānānaṃ
analyzed: bahu sutam sutta geyya ādi etena ati bahussutaḥ suta gahaṇam ca ittha nidassana mattam dhāraṇa paricaya paripucchā an upekkhana diṭṭhi nijjhānānam
translated: “One who is learned” : he is learned through this, namely, the scriptures, stories, etc., that are heard.

original: pettha icchitabbattā. Savanamūlakattā vā tesampi taggahaṇeneva gahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Atthakāmena pariyāpuṇitabbato, diṭṭhadhammikādipurisatthasiddhiyā pariyattabhāvato
analyzed: pa ittha icchitabba ttā savana mūlaka ttā vā tesam pi tad gahaṇena iva gahaṇam daṭṭhabbam  attha kāmena pariyāpuṇitabbataḥ diṭṭhadhammika ādi purisattha siddhiyā pariyatta bhāvataḥ
translated: because it is desired here. Or else, their inclusion should be regarded as included by the inclusion of that.🔽The “tradition” is the three Piṭakas, because it is to be learned by one who desires welfare, and because it is the means of accomplishing the welfare of man in this life, etc., since it is the means of knowing.

original: ca pariyatti, tīṇi piṭakāni. Saccappaṭivedho saccānaṃ paṭivijjhanaṃ. Tadapi bāhusaccaṃ🔽yathāvuttabāhusaccakiccanipphattito. Pariyatti adhippetā saccapaṭivedhāvahena bāhusaccena
analyzed: ca tīṇi piṭakāni sacca ppaṭivedhaḥ saccānam paṭivijjhanam tat api bāhusaccam  yathā vutta bāhusacca kicca nipphattitaḥ pariyatti adhippetā sacca paṭivedha āvahena bāhusaccena
translated: The “penetration of the truths” is the penetration of the truths by means of great learning. That also is great learning,🔽because it is the fulfilment of the function of great learning as already described. The “tradition” is intended here as great learning, since the state of being learned is desired here as the means of penetrating the truths. “He” is the one who has the tradition and great learning. He is of four kinds,

original: bahussutabhāvassa idha icchitattā. Soti pariyattibahussuto. Catubbidho hoti pañcamassa🔽pakārassa abhāvato. Sabbatthakabahussutoti nissayamuccanakabahussutādayo viya padesiko🔽ahutvā piṭakattaye sabbatthakameva bāhusaccasabbhāvato sabbassa atthassa kāyanato
analyzed: bahussuta bhāvassa idha icchita ttā saḥ ti pariyatti bahussutaḥ catubbidhaḥ hoti pañcamassa  pakārassa abhāvataḥ sabbatthaka bahussuto ti nissayamuccanaka bahussuta ādayaḥ viya padesiko  a hutvā piṭaka ttaye sabbatthakam eva bāhu sacca sabbhāvataḥ sabbassa atthassa kāyanato
translated: because there is no fifth kind. He is “learned in all ways” because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, not like the “learned in a portion” who is learned in a portion of the three Piṭakas, such as the “learned in the recitation of the Nissaya” .🔽He is “learned in all ways” because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, not like the “learned in a portion” who is learned in a portion of the three Piṭakas, such as the “learned in the recitation of the Nissaya” .

original: kathanato sabbatthakabahussuto. Te idha adhippetā paṭipattipaṭivedhasaddhammānaṃ
analyzed: kathanataḥ sabbatthaka bahussuto te idha adhippetā paṭipatti paṭivedha saddhammānam
translated: He is “learned in all ways” because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, not like the “learned in a portion” who is learned in a portion of the three Piṭakas, such as the “learned in the recitation of the Nissaya” .🔽He is “learned in all ways” because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, not like the “learned in a portion” who is learned in a portion of the three Piṭakas, such as the “learned in the recitation of the Nissaya” .🔽He is “learned in all ways” because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, because he is learned in all the meaning of the three Piṭakas, not like the “learned in a portion” who is learned in a

original: mūlabhūte pariyattisaddhamme suppatiṭṭhitabhāvato.
analyzed: mūla bhūte pariyatti saddhamme suppatiṭṭhita bhāvataḥ
translated: and by the words “in the true Teaching” the fact that he is well established in the fundamental True Idea of the scriptures is shown.

original: Āraddhanti paggahitaṃ. Taṃ pana duvidhampi vīriyārambhavibhāgena dassetuṃ “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha ekakāti ekākino, vūpakaṭṭhavihārinoti attho.
analyzed: āraddham ti paggahitam tam pana duvidham pi vīriya ārambha vibhāgena dassetum tattha atiādi vuttam tattha ekakā iti ekākinaḥ vūpakaṭṭha vihārinaḥ ti attho
translated: “He has begun” : he has undertaken. But in order to show both these kinds of beginning by a classification of the kinds of effort, the words “Herein, bhikkhus” are said. Herein, alone: by himself; the meaning is, living in a secluded place.

original: Pucchitvāti parato pucchitvā. Sampaṭicchāpetunti “tvaṃ asukanāmo”ti vatvā tehi “āmā”ti🔽paṭijānāpetunti attho. Evaṃ cirakatādianussaraṇasamatthasatinepakkānaṃ appakasireneva
analyzed: pucchitvā iti paratas pucchitvā tvam asuka nāmā iti vatvā tehi  paṭijānāpetunti atthaḥ evam cirakata ādi anussaraṇa samattha sati nepakkānam appaka sirena iva
translated: Having asked: having asked another. Having satisfied: having made them say “Yes” by saying “You are so-and-so” .

original: satisambojjhaṅgabhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchatīti dassanatthaṃ “evarūpe bhikkhū sandhāyā”ti
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅga bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchati iti dassana ttham evarūpe bhikkhū sandhāya ati
translated: The meaning is: having made them acknowledge it. In order to show that the fulfilment of the development of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness comes about with little difficulty in those who are able to recollect what was done long ago, the words “Bhikkhus, I shall expound” are said.

original: vuttaṃ. Tenevāha “apicā”tiādi.
analyzed: vuttam tena iva āha apica itiādi
translated: Therefore he said “Moreover, bhikkhus” .

original: 139. Bujjhati etāyāti “bodhī”ti laddhanāmāya sammādiṭṭhiādidhammasāmaggiyā aṅgoti
analyzed: bujjhati etāya ati bodhī iti laddha nāmāya sammādiṭṭhi ādi dhamma sāmaggiyā
translated: It is called “enlightenment” because it illuminates . The combination of states beginning with right view is a factor of enlightenment because it is a cause for enlightenment.

original: bojjhaṅgo, pasattho, sundaro vā bojjhaṅgo sambojjhaṅgo. Upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇoti kāyavedanācittadhammānaṃ
analyzed: bojjhaṅgo pasattho sundaraḥ vā bojjhaṅgo sambojjhaṅgo upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇo ti kāya vedanā citta dhammānam
translated: Or the enlightenment factor is either a cause for enlightenment or a beautiful factor of enlightenment. Its characteristic is appearance. Its function is to illuminate. It is manifested as non-delusion.

original: asubhadukkhāniccānattabhāvasallakkhaṇasaṅkhātaṃ ārammaṇe upaṭṭhānaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ etassāti
analyzed: asubha dukkha anicca anatta bhāva sat lakkhaṇa saṅkhātam ārammaṇe upaṭṭhānam lakkhaṇam etassa ati
translated: Its characteristic is that of having that sign as its object.🔽The characteristic of investigation is the investigation of the four noble truths as to their being a burden, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that investigation as its characteristic.

original: upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇo. Catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ pīḷanādippakārato vicayo upaparikkhā lakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇo catunnam ariya saccānam pīḷana ādi ppakārataḥ vicayaḥ upaparikkhā lakkhaṇam
translated: The characteristic of exertion is the exertion of the mind in giving attention to the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that exertion as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of absorption is the absorption of the mind in the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that absorption as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of equanimity is the equanimity of the mind in the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that equanimity as its characteristic.

original: etassāti pavicayalakkhaṇo. Anuppannā kusalānuppādanādivasena cittassa paggaho paggaṇhanaṃ
analyzed: etassa ti pavicaya lakkhaṇaḥ anuppannā kusala anuppādana ādi vasena cittassa paggahaḥ paggaṇhanaṃ
translated: The characteristic of adverting is the adverting of the mind to the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that adverting as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of maintaining is the maintaining of the mind on the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that maintaining as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of reviewing is the reviewing of the sign of the beautiful, and so on.

original: lakkhaṇaṃ etassāti paggahalakkhaṇo. Pharaṇaṃ vipphārikatā lakkhaṇaṃ etassāti pharaṇalakkhaṇo.
analyzed: lakkhaṇam etassa ati paggaha lakkhaṇaḥ pharaṇam vipphārika tā lakkhaṇam etassa ati pharaṇa lakkhaṇaḥ
translated: Its characteristic is that of having that reviewing as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of absorption is the absorption of the mind in the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that absorption as its characteristic.

original: Upasamo kāyacittapariḷāhānaṃ vūpasamanaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ etassāti upasamalakkhaṇo. Avikkhepo
analyzed: upasamaḥ kāya citta pariḷāhānam vūpasamanam lakkhaṇam etassa ati upasama lakkhaṇaḥ avikkhepaḥ
translated: The characteristic of equanimity is the equanimity of the mind in the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that equanimity as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of adverting is the adverting of the mind to the sign of the beautiful, and so on.

original: vikkhepaviddhaṃsanaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ etassāti avikkhepalakkhaṇo. Līnuddhaccarahite adhicitte
analyzed: vikkhepa viddhaṃsanam lakkhaṇam etassa ati avikkhepa lakkhaṇaḥ līn uddhacca rahite adhi citte
translated: Its characteristic is that of having that adverting as its characteristic.

original: pavattamāne paggahaniggahasampahaṃsanesu abyāvaṭattā ajjhupekkhanaṃ paṭisaṅkhānaṃ
analyzed: pavattamāne paggaha niggaha sampahaṃsanesu a byāvaṭa tā ajjhupekkhanam paṭisaṅkhānam
translated: The characteristic of maintaining is the maintaining of the mind on the sign of the beautiful, and so on.🔽Its characteristic is that of having that maintaining as its characteristic.🔽The characteristic of reviewing is the reviewing of the sign of the beautiful, and so on.

original: lakkhaṇaṃ etassāti paṭisaṅkhānalakkhaṇo.
analyzed: lakkhaṇam etassa ati paṭisaṅkhāna lakkhaṇaḥ
translated: Its characteristic is that of having that reviewing as its characteristic.

original: Catūhi kāraṇehīti satisampajaññaṃ, muṭṭhassatipuggalaparivajjanā, upaṭṭhitassatipuggalasevanā,
analyzed: catūhi kāraṇehi iti sati sampajaññam muṭṭha ssati puggala parivajjanā upaṭṭhita ssati puggala sevanā
translated: By four reasons: by mindfulness and awareness, by avoiding the person who is forgetful, by associating with the person who is mindful,

original: tadadhimuttatāti imehi catūhi kāraṇehi. Chahi kāraṇehīti paripucchakatā, vatthuvisadakiriyā,
analyzed: tad adhimutta tā ati imehi catūhi kāraṇehi chahi kāraṇehi iti paripucchaka tā vatthu visada kiriyā
translated: and by being resolved upon that. By six reasons: by questioning, by making the basis clean,

original: indriyasamattapaṭipādanā, duppaññapuggalaparivajjanā, paññavantapuggalasevanā, tadadhimuttatāti
analyzed: indriya samatta paṭipādanā duppañña puggala parivajjanā paññavanta puggala sevanā tad adhimutta tā ati
translated: by balancing the faculties, by avoiding the person who is witless, by associating with the person who is wise,

original: imehi chahi kāraṇehi. Mahāsatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ pana “sattahi kāraṇehī” vakkhati,
analyzed: imehi chahi kāraṇehi mahāsati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanā ayam pana sattahi kāraṇehi vakkhati
translated: and by being resolved upon that. But in the exposition of the Great Forty-Line Pericope it is said, “By seven reasons” .

original: taṃ gambhīrañāṇacariyāpaccavekkhaṇāti imaṃ kāraṇaṃ pakkhipitvā veditabbaṃ. Navahi
analyzed: tam gambhīra ñāṇa cariyā paccavekkhaṇā ti imam kāraṇam pakkhipitvā veditabbam navahi
translated: That should be understood as including the reason “by reviewing the conduct of profound knowledge.” By nine reasons:

original: kāraṇehīti apāyabhayapaccavekkhaṇā, gamanavīthipaccavekkhaṇā, piṇḍapātassa apacāyanatā,
analyzed: kāraṇehi iti apāya bhaya paccavekkhaṇā gamana vīthi paccavekkhaṇā piṇḍapātassa apacāyana tā
translated: by reviewing the fear of states of woe, by reviewing the way of going, by not being a nuisance in the alms-resort,

original: dāyajjamahattapaccavekkhaṇā, satthumahattapaccavekkhaṇā, sabrahmacārīmahattapaccavekkhaṇā,
analyzed: dāyajja mahatta paccavekkhaṇā satthu mahatta paccavekkhaṇā sabrahmacārī mahatta paccavekkhaṇā
translated: by reviewing the great value of the heritage, by reviewing the greatness of the Master, by reviewing the greatness of the fellow-practitioners,🔽and by being resolved upon that.

original: kusītapuggalaparivajjanā, āraddhavīriyapuggalasevanā, tadadhimuttatāti imehi navahi🔽kāraṇehi. Mahāsatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ pana ānisaṃsadassāvitā, jātimahattapaccavekkhaṇāti
analyzed: kusīta puggala parivajjanā āraddha vīriya puggala sevanā tad adhimutta tā ti imehi navahi  kāraṇehi mahāsati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanā ayam pana ānisaṃsa dassāvitā jāti mahatta paccavekkhaṇā ti
translated: and avoiding the lazy type of person and associating with the energetic type of person and being devoted to that.🔽But in the description of the development of the foundations of mindfulness it is said to be “elevenfold” with the addition of “seeing the benefits” and “reviewing the greatness of the opportunity.”

original: imehi saddhiṃ “ekādasā”ti vakkhati. Dasahi kāraṇehīti buddhānussati, dhammānussati,
analyzed: imehi saddhim ekādasā ati vakkhati dasahi kāraṇehi iti buddha anussati dhamma anussati
translated: With the ten reasons given thus: the recollection of the Buddha, the recollection of the Dhamma,

original: saṅghasīlacāgadevatāupasamānussati, lūkhapuggalaparivajjanā, siniddhapuggalasevanā,🔽tadadhimuttatāti imehi dasahi. Mahāsatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ pana pasādaniyasuttantapaccavekkhaṇāya
analyzed: saṅgha sīla cāga devatā upasama anussati lūkha puggala parivajjanā siniddha puggala sevanā  tad adhimutta tā ti imehi dasahi mahāsati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanāyam pana pasādaniya suttanta paccavekkhaṇāya
translated: the recollection of the Sangha, the recollection of virtue, the recollection of generosity, the recollection of the devas, avoiding bad people, associating with good people,🔽being devoted to that. But in the description of the development of the foundations of mindfulness it is said to be “elevenfold” with the addition of “reviewing the discourses that inspire confidence.”

original: saddhiṃ “ekādasā”ti vakkhati. Sattahi kāraṇehīti paṇītabhojanasevanatā, utusukhasevanatā,
analyzed: saddhim ekādasā iti vakkhati sattahi kāraṇehi iti paṇīta bhojana sevana tā utu sukha sevana tā
translated: With the seven reasons given thus: using superior food, using superior medicine,

original: iriyāpathasukhasevanatā, majjhattapayogatā, sāraddhakāyapuggalaparivajjanatā, passaddhakāyapuggalasevanatā,
analyzed: iriyāpatha sukha sevana tā majjhatta payoga tā sāraddha kāya puggala parivajjana tā passaddha kāya puggala sevana tā
translated: using superior resting places, using what is neither too far nor too near, avoiding people who are difficult to live with, associating with people who are easy to live with,

original: tadadhimuttatāti imehi sattahi. Dasahi kāraṇehīti vatthuvisadakiriyā, indriyasamattapaṭipādanā,
analyzed: tad adhimutta tā ti imehi sattahi dasahi kāraṇehi iti vatthu visada kiriyā indriya samatta paṭipādanā
translated: With ten reasons: the purification of the physical basis, the balancing of the faculties,

original: nimittakusalatā, samaye cittassa paggahaṇaṃ, samaye cittassa niggahaṇaṃ, samaye cittassa
analyzed: nimitta kusala tā samaye cittassa paggahaṇam samaye cittassa niggahaṇam samaye cittassa
translated: skill in the sign, the exertion of the mind at the proper time, the restraining of the mind at the proper time,

original: sampahaṃsanaṃ, samaye cittassa ajjhupekkhanaṃ, asamāhitapuggalaparivajjanaṃ, samāhitapuggalasevanaṃ,
analyzed: sampahaṃsanam samaye cittassa ajjhupekkhanam asamāhita puggala parivajjanam samāhita puggala sevanam
translated: the encouraging of the mind at the proper time, the looking on at the mind at the proper time, the avoiding of people who are not in jhāna, the cultivation of people who are in jhāna,

original: tadadhimuttatāti imehi dasahi kāraṇehi. Mahāsatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ pana “jhānavimokkhapaccavekkhaṇā”ti
analyzed: tad adhimutta tā ti imehi dasahi kāraṇehi mahāsati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanā ayam pana jhāna vimokkha paccavekkhaṇā ti
translated: and the state of being intent upon that. But in the commentary to the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta it is said that the “recollection of peace” should be added to make eleven reasons.

original: iminā saddhiṃ “ekādasahī”ti vakkhati. Pañcahi kāraṇehīti sattamajjhattatā, saṅkhāramajjhattatā,
analyzed: iminā saddhim ekādasahi iti vakkhati pañcahi kāraṇehi iti satta majjhatta tā saṅkhāra majjhatta tā
translated: With five reasons: the state of neutrality towards beings, the state of neutrality towards formations,

original: sattasaṅkhārakelāyanapuggalaparivajjanā, sattasaṅkhāramajjhattapuggalasevanā, tadadhimuttatāti
analyzed: satta saṅkhāra kelāyana puggala parivajjanā satta saṅkhāra majjhatta puggala sevanā tad adhimutta tā ati
translated: the avoiding of people who are indulgent in the five kinds of pleasure, the cultivation of people who are neutral towards formations,

original: imehi pañcahi kāraṇehi. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ mahāsatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ āgamissati.
analyzed: imehi pañcahi kāraṇehi yat pana ittha vattabbam tat mahāsati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanāyam āgamissati
translated: and the state of being intent upon that. But what should be said about this has been said in the commentary to the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta.

original: Kāmaṃ bodhipakkhiyadhammā nāma nippariyāyato ariyamaggasampayuttā eva niyyānikabhāvato.
analyzed: kāmam bodhi pakkhiya dhammāḥ nāma nippariyāyataḥ ariya magga sampayuttāḥ eva niyyānika bhāvato
translated: The factors of enlightenment are in the ultimate sense only those associated with the noble path, since it is that which leads out of the world.

original: Suttantadesanā nāma pariyāyakathāti “iminā vipassanā…pe… kathesī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: suttanta desanā nāma pariyāya kathā ti iminā vipassanāpe kathesi iti vuttam
translated: The teaching of the suttas is the teaching of the conventional.

original: 140. Tebhūmake saṅkhāre “aniccā”ti anupassati etāyāti aniccānupassanā, tathā pavattā🔽vipassanā, sā pana yasmā attanā sahagatasaññāya bhāvitāya vibhāvitā eva hotīti vuttaṃ
analyzed: tebhūmake saṅkhāre aniccā ati anupassati etāya ati anicca anupassanā tathā pavattā  vipassanā sā pana yasmai attanā sahagata saññāya bhāvitāya vibhāvitā eva hoti iti vuttam
translated: He contemplates formations in the three planes as impermanent: the contemplation of impermanence is the insight that occurs in this way.🔽But since that insight is developed by the perception associated with it, it is said that it is only when perception has been developed that insight is developed.

original: “aniccānupassanāya saddhiṃ uppannasaññā”ti. Saññāsīsena vāyaṃ vipassanāya eva niddeso.🔽Anattasaññādīsupi eseva nayo. Lokiyavipassanāpi honti, yasmā “anicca”ntiādinā tā
analyzed: anicca anupassanāya saddhim uppanna saññā ti saññā sīsena vā ayam vipassanāya eva niddesaḥ  anatta saññā ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ lokiya vipassanā api honti yasmai aniccanti ādinā tā
translated: Or this is a description of insight by way of its perception.🔽The same method of explanation applies to the perception of non-self, etc.🔽They are also mundane insight, because they occur with the words “impermanent,” etc.

original: pavattantīti. Lokiyavipassanāpīti pi-saddena missakāpettha santīti atthato āpannanti
analyzed: pavattanti iti lokiya vipassanā api iti pi saddena missakā api ittha santi iti atthataḥ āpannanti
translated: The word “also” implies that there is a mixture of supramundane and mundane insight here.🔽The meaning is stated in the words “the meaning is established.”

original: atthāpattisiddhamatthaṃ niddhāretvā sarūpato dassetuṃ “virāgo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: atthāpatti siddham attham niddhāretvā sarūpataḥ dassetum virāga uti ādi vuttam tattha
translated: In order to show the meaning by its characteristics, the text says “dispassion,” etc.

original: āgatavasenāti tathā āgatapāḷivasena “virāgo nirodho”ti hi tattha nibbānaṃ vuttanti🔽idha “virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā”ti vuttasaññā nibbānārammaṇāpi siyuṃ. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: āgata vasena āti tathā āgata pāḷi vasena virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ ti hi tattha nibbānam vuttanti  idha virāga saññā nirodha saññā ti vutta saññā nibbāna ārammaṇā api siyum tena vuttam
translated: “By way of what has come down” means by way of the text that has come down thus: “Fading away is cessation” . For in that text Nibbāna is stated.

original: “dve lokuttarāpi hontī”ti.
analyzed: dve lokuttarā api honti iti
translated: Herein, the perception stated as “perception of fading away, perception of cessation” may have Nibbāna as its object. Hence it was said above “They are also two of the supramundane kinds.”

original: 141. Mettā etassa atthīti mettaṃ, cittaṃ. Taṃsamuṭṭhānaṃ kāyakammaṃ mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ.🔽Esa nayo sesadvayepi. Imānipi mettākāyakammādīni bhikkhūnaṃ vasena āgatāni tesaṃ
analyzed: mettā etassa atthi iti mettam cittam tad samuṭṭhānam kāya kammam mettam kāya kammam  esa nayo sesa dvaye pi imāni pi mettā kāya kamma ādīni bhikkhūnam vasena āgatāni tesam
translated: It has loving-kindness, thus it is loving-kindness ; the mind is loving-kindness ; the bodily work of one possessed of loving-kindness is loving-kindness ;🔽so too is the verbal work.🔽These kinds of bodily work, etc., are stated as belonging to bhikkhus because the bhikkhus are the best of assemblies.

original: seṭṭhaparisabhāvato. Yathā pana bhikkhūsupi labbhanti, evaṃ gihīsupi labbhanti catuparisasādhāraṇattāti🔽taṃ dassento “bhikkhūnañhī”tiādimāha. Kāmaṃ ādibrahmacariyakadhammassavanenapi mettākāyakammāni
analyzed: seṭṭha parisa bhāvataḥ yathā pana bhikkhū supi labbhanti evam gihī supi labbhanti catu parisa sādhāraṇa ttā ati  tam dassentaḥ bhikkhūnaṃ hi iti ādim āha kāmam mettā kāya kammāni
translated: But they are also found in the laity, since they are common to the four assemblies.🔽In order to show this he said “In the case of bhikkhus” , etc.

original: labbhanti, nippariyāyato pana cārittadhammassavanena ayamattho icchitoti dassento
analyzed: labbhanti nippariyāyataḥ pana cāritta dhamma ssavanena ayam attho icchito ti dassento
translated: Of course, the bodily work of loving-kindness, etc., is also found in those who listen to the Dhamma of the beginningless beginning, but it is found in the sense intended here only in those who listen to the Dhamma of conduct.

original: “ābhisamācārikadhammapūraṇa”nti āha. Tepiṭakampi buddhavacanaṃ paripucchanaatthakathanavasena
analyzed: ābhisamācārika dhamma pūraṇanti āha tepiṭakam pi buddha vacanam paripucchana attha kathana vasena
translated: The Buddha’s word in the three Piṭakas, when it is being taught for the purpose of answering questions and explaining the meaning,

original: pavattiyamānaṃ hitajjhāsayena pavattitabbato.
analyzed: pavattiyamānam hita jjhā sayena
translated: should be taught with a benevolent intention.

original: Āvīti pakāsaṃ, pakāsabhāvo cettha yaṃ uddissa taṃ kāyakammaṃ karīyati, tassa sammukhabhāvatoti
analyzed: āvi iti pakāsam pakāsa bhāvaḥ ca ittha yam uddissa tam kāya kammam karīyati tassa sammukha bhāvato ti
translated: “In public” means in a place that is open. The meaning is that the bodily action is done in the presence of the one to whom it is done.

original: āha “sammukhā”ti. Rahoti appakāsaṃ, appakāsatā ca yaṃ uddissa taṃ kāyakammaṃ karīyati,
analyzed: āha sammukhā ati raho ti appakāsam appakāsa tā ca yam uddissa tam kāya kammam karīyati
translated: “In private” means in a place that is not open. The meaning is that the bodily action is done in the absence of the one to whom it is done.

original: tassa paccakkhābhāvatoti āha “parammukhā”ti. Sahāyabhāvagamanaṃ tesaṃ purato. Ubhayehīti🔽navakehi, therehi ca.
analyzed: tassa paccakkha bhāvato ti āha parammukhā iti sahāya bhāva gamanam tesam puratas ubhayehi iti  navakehi therehi ca
translated: “In the presence of both” means in front of the other.

original: Paggayhāti paggaṇhitvā uccaṃ katvā.🔽Kāmaṃ mettāsinehasiniddhānaṃ nayanānaṃ ummīlanā, pasannena mukhena olokanañca mettaṃ🔽kāyakammameva, yassa pana cittassa vasena nayanānaṃ mettāsinehasiniddhatā, mukhassa
analyzed: paggayha ati paggaṇhitvā uccam katvā  kāmam ummīlanā pasannena mukhena olokanam ca mettam  kāya kammam eva yassa pana cittassa vasena nayanānam mettā sineha siniddha tā mukhassa
translated: “The new bhikkhus and the senior bhikkhus” means the junior and the senior bhikkhus.🔽“With uplifted mind” means with a mind that is raised up, that is, with a mind that is elevated.🔽The opening of the eyes with loving-kindness, the looking with a serene face, are indeed loving-kindness as bodily action.

original: ca pasannatā, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “mettaṃ manokammaṃ nāmā”ti.
analyzed: ca pasanna tā tam sandhāya vuttam mettam manokammam nāma ati
translated: But the loving-kindness of the mind is the serenity of the eyes and the serenity of the face that occur by the influence of a certain consciousness.

original: Lābhasaddo kammasādhano “lābhāvata, lābho laddho”tiādīsu viya, so cettha “dhammaladdhā”ti
analyzed: lābha saddo kamma sādhanaḥ lābhaḥ laddhaḥ ti ādīsu viya saḥ ca ittha dhamma laddhā ti
translated: The word “gain” is a synonym for “accomplishment” in such passages as “accomplishment of gain” . Here it is a past participle, according to the statement “gained in accordance with the Dhamma” .🔽Therefore the commentator says: “The requisites of robes, etc., that have been gained” .

original: vacanato atītakālikoti āha “cīvarādayo laddhapaccayā”ti. Dhammato āgatāti dhammikā.
analyzed: vacanataḥ atīta kālikaḥ iti āha cīvara ādayaḥ laddha paccayā ati dhammataḥ āgatā ati dhammikā
translated: “Dhammika” means “in accordance with the Dhamma” .🔽Hence the commentator says: “gained in accordance with the Dhamma” .

original: Tenāha “dhammaladdhā”ti. Imameva hi atthaṃ dassetuṃ “kuhanādī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Cittena
analyzed: tena āha dhamma laddhā iti imam eva hi attham dassetum kuhanā ādi itiādi vuttam cittena
translated: In order to show this very meaning, the words “through hypocrisy, etc.” are stated.

original: vibhajanapubbakaṃ kāyena vibhajananti mūlameva dassetuṃ “evaṃ cittena vibhajana”nti
analyzed: vibhajana pubbakam kāyena vibhajananti mūlam eva dassetum evam cittena vibhajananti
translated: In order to show the root, namely, the distribution by body preceded by distribution by mind, it is said: “Thus the distribution by mind” .

original: vuttaṃ, tena cittuppādamattenapi paṭivibhāgo na kātabboti dasseti. Appaṭivibhattanti
analyzed: vuttam tena cittuppāda mattena api paṭivibhāgaḥ na kātabbaḥ ti dasseti appaṭivibhattam ti
translated: Thereby he shows that distribution should not be made by mere mental resolve.🔽The word “unshared” is a substantive formed from the gerundive

original: bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso, appaṭivibhattaṃ vā lābhaṃ bhuñjatīti kammaniddeso eva.
analyzed: bhāva napuṃsaka niddeso appaṭivibhattam vā lābham bhuñjati iti kamma niddesaḥ eva
translated: . Or it is a gerundive formed from the verb “to eat” .

original: Taṃ taṃ neva gihīnaṃ deti attano ājīvasodhanatthaṃ. Na attanā bhuñjatīti attanāva
analyzed: tam tam na iva deti attanā ājīva sodhana attham na attanā bhuñjati iti attanā ava
translated: He does not give it to householders in order to purify his own livelihood.🔽He does not eat it himself, thinking: “Let me not be one who eats alone, apart from the community of bhikkhus.”

original: na paribhuñjati “mayhaṃ asādhāraṇabhogitā mā hotū”ti. “Paṭiggaṇhanto ca…pe… passatī”ti
analyzed: na paribhuñjati mayham asādhāraṇa bhogi tā mā hotu uti paṭiggaṇhanto cape passati iti
translated: “When he receives it, etc., he sees” .

original: iminā tassa lābhassa tīsupi kālesu sādhāraṇato ṭhapanaṃ dassitaṃ. “Paṭiggaṇhanto🔽ca saṅghena sādhāraṇaṃ hotū”ti iminā paṭiggahaṇakālo dassito, “gahetvā…pe… passatī”ti🔽iminā paṭiggahitakālo, tadubhayaṃ pana tādisena pubbābhogena vinā na hotīti atthasiddho
analyzed: iminā tassa lābhassa tīsu pi kālesu sādhāraṇataḥ ṭhapanam dassitam paṭiggaṇhanto  ca saṅghena sādhāraṇam hotu iti iminā paṭiggahaṇa kālaḥ dassitaḥ gahetvā ape passati iti  iminā paṭiggahita kālaḥ tat ubhayam pana tādisena pubbābhogena vinā na hoti iti attha siddho
translated: This shows the placing of it in common for the three times. By “May it be in common with the Community” he shows the time of receiving; by “having taken it … sees” he shows the time of having received it. But since neither of these two is possible without a previous use of the kind, the meaning is established.

original: purimakālo. Tayidaṃ paṭiggahaṇato pubbe vassa hoti “saṅghena sādhāraṇaṃ hotūti paṭiggahessāmī”ti.
analyzed: purima kālaḥ paṭiggahaṇataḥ pubbe hoti saṅghena sādhāraṇam hotu uti paṭiggahessāmi iti
translated: This shows how the establishment is shared in the three times. “May it be shared by the Community” shows the time of receiving. “Having received … sees” shows the time of having received. But the meaning is established as the previous time since that is not possible without a previous use of the same kind. This is the time before the receiving, thinking, “I will receive, saying, ‘May it be shared by the Community.’“

original: Paṭiggaṇhantassa hoti “saṅghena sādhāraṇaṃ hotūti paṭiggaṇhāmī”ti. Paṭiggahetvā hoti
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhantassa hoti saṅghena sādhāraṇam hotu uti paṭiggaṇhāmi iti paṭiggahetvā hoti
translated: At the time of receiving, he thinks, “I receive, saying, ‘May it be shared by the Community.’“ After receiving, he thinks,

original: “saṅghena sādhāraṇaṃ hotūti paṭiggahitaṃ mayā”ti evaṃ tilakkhaṇasampannaṃ katvā laddhalābhaṃ
analyzed: saṅghena sādhāraṇam hotu uti paṭiggahitam mayā ati evam ti lakkhaṇa sampannam katvā laddha lābham
translated: “I have received, saying, ‘May it be shared by the Community.’“ Having obtained the gain endowed with the three characteristics in this way,

original: osānalakkhaṇaṃ avikopetvā paribhuñjanto sādhāraṇabhogī, appaṭivibhattabhogī ca hoti.
analyzed: osāna lakkhaṇam a vikopetvā paribhuñjanto sādhāraṇa bhogī appaṭivibhatta bhogī ca hoti
translated: he is one who shares and one who does not distribute by using it without disturbing its characteristic of being stored.

original: Imaṃ pana sāraṇīyadhammanti imaṃ catutthaṃ saritabbayuttadhammaṃ. Na hi…pe… gaṇhanti,
analyzed: imam pana sāraṇīya dhamman ti imam catuttham saritabba yutta dhammam na hipe gaṇhanti
translated: “This is the quality of being easy to admonish”: this is the fourth quality that is to be spoken of.🔽“He does not accept”: the unvirtuous person does not accept the admonishment.

original: tasmā sādhāraṇabhogitā eva dussīlassa natthīti ārambhopi tāva na sambhavati, kuto🔽pūraṇanti adhippāyo. “Parisuddhasīlo”ti iminā lābhassa dhammikabhāvaṃ dasseti. “Vattaṃ
analyzed: tasmā sādhāraṇa bhogi tā eva dussīlassa natthi iti ārambhaḥ pi tāva na sambhavati kutas  pūraṇam ti adhippāyo parisuddha sīlo ti iminā lābhassa dhammika bhāvam dasseti vattam
translated: The meaning is that he does not even begin to do so, much less

original: akhaṇḍento”ti iminā appaṭivibhattabhogitaṃ, sādhāraṇabhogitañca dasseti. Sati pana
analyzed: akhaṇḍento ti iminā appaṭivibhatta bhogitam sādhāraṇa bhogitam ca dasseti sati pana
translated: fulfill it. “He is of pure virtue”: this shows that the gain is in accordance with the Dhamma. “He does not break the rules of the community”: this shows that he does not keep the requisites to himself and that he shares them. But when he does both,

original: tadubhaye sāraṇīyadhammo pūrito eva hotīti āha “pūretī”ti. “Odissakaṃ katvā”ti etena🔽anodissakaṃ katvā pituno, ācariyupajjhāyādīnaṃ vā therāsanato paṭṭhāya dentassa sāraṇīyadhammoyeva
analyzed: tad ubhaye sāraṇīya dhammo pūritaḥ eva hoti iti āha pūreti iti odissakam katvā iti etena  anodissakam katvā pituno ācariya upajjhāya ādīnam vā thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya dentassa
translated: he fulfills the quality of being easy to admonish. Therefore it is said: “he fulfills it.” “Having made a reservation”:🔽the quality of being easy to admonish is not fulfilled by one who makes a reservation and gives to his father, teacher, preceptor, etc., beginning with the seat of the elders.

original: hotīti. Sāraṇīyadhammo panassa na hotīti paṭijagganaṭṭhāne odissakaṃ katvā dinnattā.
analyzed: hoti iti sāraṇīya dhammo pana assa na hoti iti paṭijaggana ṭṭhāne odissakam katvā dinnattā
translated: But it is fulfilled by one who does not make a reservation.

original: Tenāha “palibodhajagganaṃ nāma hotī”tiādi. Yadi evaṃ sabbena sabbaṃ sāraṇīyadhammapūrakassa
analyzed: tena āha palibodha jagganam nāma hoti itiādi yadi evam sabbena sabbam sāraṇīya dhamma pūrakassa
translated: Therefore it is said: “there is a reservation and a keeping back.” If it is so, then for one who fulfills the quality of being easy to admonish in every way,

original: odissakadānaṃ na vaṭṭatīti? No na vaṭṭati yuttaṭṭhāneti dassento “tena panā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: odissaka dānam na vaṭṭati iti no na vaṭṭati yutta ṭṭhāne iti dassento tena pana atiādim āha
translated: Is it not allowable to give a gift with reservation? It is allowable, he shows, in the case of a suitable recipient, with the words “But if he gives … ”

original: Gilānādīnaṃ odissakaṃ katvā dānaṃ appaṭivibhāgapakkhikaṃ “asukassa na dassāmī”ti
analyzed: gilāna ādīnam odissakam katvā dānam appaṭivibhāga pakkhikam asukassa na dassāmi iti
translated: Giving a gift with reservation to the sick, etc., is not a kind of sharing out, because there is no rejection in the form “I will not give to so and so.”

original: paṭikkhepassa abhāvato. Byatirekappadhāno hi paṭivibhāgo. Tenāha “avasesa”ntiādi.
analyzed: paṭikkhepassa abhāvataḥ byatireka ppadhānaḥ hi paṭivibhāgaḥ tena āha avasesa ntiādi
translated: For sharing out is a kind of distribution. That is why he said, “The rest … ”

original: Adātumpīti pi-saddena dātumpi vaṭṭatīti dasseti, tañca kho karuṇāyanavasena, na vattapūraṇavasena.
analyzed: a dātum pi iti pi saddena dātum pi vaṭṭati iti dasseti tat ca kho karuṇāyana vasena na vatta pūraṇa vasena
translated: The word “also” in the words “he may give it also” shows that it is allowable to give it out of compassion, not out of a desire to fulfil a duty.

original: Susikkhitāyāti sāraṇīyadhammapūraṇavidhimhi suṭṭhu sikkhitāya, sukusalāyāti attho.
analyzed: su sikkhitāya ati sāraṇīya dhamma pūraṇa vidhimhi suṭṭhu sikkhitāya su kusalāya ati attho
translated: “Well trained”: well instructed in the method of fulfilling the duty of being helpful. The meaning is, very skilled.🔽In order to show her skill he said, “For a well-trained woman … ”

original: Idāni tassā kosallaṃ dassetuṃ “susikkhitāya hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Dvādasahi vassehi pūrati,🔽na tato ora”nti iminā tassa duppūraṇaṃ dasseti. Tathā hi so mahapphalo mahānisaṃso,
analyzed: idāni tassā kosallam dassetum su sikkhitāya hi itiādi vuttam dvādasahi vassehi pūrati  na iminā tassa duppūraṇam dasseti tathā hi saḥ mahapphalaḥ mahā nisaṃso
translated: By the words “It is fulfilled in twelve years” he shows that it is difficult to fulfil,🔽for it is fruitful and beneficial,

original: diṭṭhadhammikehipi tāva garutarehi phalānisaṃsehi ca anugato. Taṃsamaṅgī ca puggalo
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikehi pi tāva garutarehi phala anisaṃsehi ca anugataḥ tad samaṅgī ca puggalo
translated: and it is accompanied by fruits and benefits even in this present existence. And the person who possesses it

original: visesalābhī ariyapuggalo viya loke acchariyabbhutadhammasamannāgato hoti. Tathā hi
analyzed: visesa lābhī ariya puggalaḥ viya loke acchariya bbhuta dhamma samannāgataḥ hoti tathā hi
translated: He becomes endowed with the wonderful and marvellous qualities of the world, like a noble person who has attained distinction. For

original: so duppajahaṃ dānamayassa, sīlamayassa ca puññassa paṭipakkhadhammaṃ sudūre vikkhambhitaṃ
analyzed: so duppajaham dāna mayassa sīla mayassa ca puññassa paṭipakkha dhammam sudūre vikkhambhitam
translated: he has far removed and suppressed the quality that is the opposite of the merit consisting in giving and virtue, which is hard to abandon.

original: katvā suvisuddhena cetasā loke pākaṭo paññāto hutvā viharati, tassimamatthaṃ byatirekato,
analyzed: katvā su visuddhena cetasā loke pākaṭaḥ paññātaḥ hutvā viharati tassa imam attham byatirekato
translated: Having lived in the world with a well-purified mind, he has become well known and famous. In order to demonstrate the meaning of this,

original: anvayato ca vibhāvetuṃ “sace hī”tiādi vuttaṃ, taṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: anvayato ca vibhāvetum sace hi itiādi vuttam tam su viññeyyam eva
translated: he says, “If he is a bhikkhu,” etc. This is easy to understand.

original: Idāni ye samparāyike, diṭṭhadhammike ca ānisaṃse dassetuṃ “eva”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Neva
analyzed: idāni ye samparāyike diṭṭhadhammike ca ānisaṃse dassetum eva nti ādi vuttam na eva
translated: Now, in order to point out the benefits both in the life to come and in the present life, he says, “If he is a bhikkhu,” etc.

original: issā, na macchariyaṃ hoti cirakālabhāvanāya vidhutabhāvato. Manussānaṃ piyo hoti🔽pariccāgasīlatāya visuddhattā. Tenāha “dadaṃ piyo hoti bhajanti naṃ bahū”tiādi. Sulabhapaccayo
analyzed: issā na macchariyam hoti cira kāla bhāvanāya vidhuta bhāvataḥ manussānam piyaḥ hoti  pariccāga sīla tāya visuddha ttā tena āha piyaḥ hoti bhajanti nam bahu uti ādi sulabha paccayo
translated: He has no envy or avarice because of the absence of the latent tendency to these states, which has been removed by long practice. He is dear to human beings🔽because of his purity due to the habit of giving. Therefore it is said: “He is dear and beloved, and many people love him” . He is easy to support

original: hoti dānavasena uḷārajjhāsayānaṃ paccayalābhassa idhānisaṃsabhāvato dānassa. Pattagataṃ
analyzed: hoti dāna vasena uḷāra jhāsayānam paccaya lābhassa idha a nisaṃsa bhāvataḥ dānassa patta gatam
translated: because of the benefit of giving, which is a condition for the acquisition of requisites by those who have a lofty disposition. He is not dependent

original: assa diyyamānaṃ na khīyati pattagatavasena dvādasavassikassa mahāpattassa avicchedena
analyzed: assa diyyamānam na khīyati patta gata vasena dvādasa vassikassa mahāpattassa a vicchedena
translated: He gets the best of the alms because he does not get tired of being given alms, as he has filled a large bowl for twelve years without a break.🔽He gets the best of the stores because he has given the gift beginning with the best of those worthy of offerings every day.

original: pūritattā. Aggabhaṇḍaṃ labhati devasikaṃ dakkhiṇeyyānaṃ aggato paṭṭhāya dānassa dinnattā.🔽Bhayevā…pe… āpajjanti deyyapaṭiggāhakavikappaṃ akatvā attani nirapekkhacittena cirakālaṃ
analyzed: pūrita ttā agga bhaṇḍam labhati devasikam dakkhiṇeyyānam aggataḥ paṭṭhāya dānassa dinna ttā  bhaya ivāpe āpajjanti deyya paṭiggāhaka vikappam a katvā attani nirapekkha cittena cira kālam
translated: He gets the best of the dwellings because he has given dwellings for the Community.🔽He gets the best of the requisites because he has given the requisites for the Community.

original: dānapūratāya pasāditacittattā.
analyzed: dāna pūra tāya pasādita citta ttā
translated: He gets the best of the offerings because he has given offerings for the Community.🔽He gets the best of the rains because he has given the rains for the Community.🔽He gets the best of the gifts because he has given gifts to the Community without regard for himself for a long time without making any distinction between the giver and the receiver.🔽He gets the best of the offerings because he has given offerings to the Community with a mind pleased by the fulfilment of his giving.

original: Tatrāti tesu ānisaṃsesu vibhāvetabbesu. Imāni taṃ dīpanāni vatthūni kāraṇāni. Alabhantāpīti
analyzed: tatra ati tesu ānisaṃsesu vibhāvetabbesu imāni tam dīpanāni vatthūni kāraṇāni alabhanta api iti
translated: There: among those benefits to be demonstrated. These are the illustrations, the reasons.🔽Not getting: not getting, not being a recipient, because of not having great merit.

original: amahāpuññatāya na lābhino samānāpi. Bhikkhācāramaggasabhāganti sabhāgaṃ tabbhāgiyaṃ
analyzed: a mahā puñña tāya na lābhinaḥ samānā api bhikkhā cāra magga sabhāgam ti sabhāgam tabbhāgiyam
translated: The alms round: the alms round is the same as the path.

original: bhikkhācāramaggaṃ jānanti.
analyzed: bhikkhācāra maggam jānanti
translated: They know the alms round.

original: Anuttarimanussadhammattā, therānaṃ saṃsayavinodanatthañca “sāraṇīyadhammo me bhante
analyzed: anuttari manussa dhamma ttā therānam saṃsaya vinodana attham ca sāraṇīya dhammaḥ me bhante
translated: Because of being the unsurpassed human state, and in order to remove the Elder’s doubt, he said: “The state of being delightful to me, venerable sir,🔽has been fulfilled.” For in the second case too the Elder revealed himself.

original: pūrito”ti āha. Tathā hi dutiyavatthusmimpi therena attā pakāsito. Manussānaṃ piyatāya,
analyzed: pūritaḥ iti āha tathā hi dutiya vatthusmim pi therena attā pakāsitaḥ manussānam piya tāya
translated: Because of being dear to people,

original: sulabhapaccayatāyapi idaṃ vatthumeva. Pattagatākhīyanassa pana visesaṃ vibhāvanato
analyzed: idam vatthum eva patta gata ākhīyanassa pana visesam vibhāvanato
translated: This is the very same subject-matter as that of the previous story, which was told to show the ease with which the conditions of the Path can be obtained. But the story of the man who was despised for his leaf-bowl is told to show a special point.

original: “idaṃ tāva…pe… ettha vatthu”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam tāvape ettha vatthun ti vuttam
translated: “This is the subject-matter of the story of the man who was despised for his leaf-bowl.”

original: Giribhaṇḍamahāpūjāyāti cetiyagirimhi sakalalaṅkādīpe, yojanappamāṇe samudde ca nāvāsaṅghāṭādike🔽ṭhapetvā dīpapupphagandhādīhi kariyamānamahāpūjāyaṃ. Pariyāyenapīti lesenapi. Anucchavikanti
analyzed: giribhaṇḍa mahāpūjāyāti cetiya girimhi sakala laṅkā dīpe yojana ppamāṇe samudde ca nāvā saṅghāṭa ādike  ṭhapetvā dīpa puppha gandha ādīhi pariyāyena api iti lesena api
translated: “The great worship at the mountain shrine” was the great worship performed with all the flowers and perfumes of the whole island of Laṅkā and with ships a league in length anchored in the ocean.

original: sāraṇīyadhammapūraṇatopi idaṃ yathābhūtappavedanaṃ tumhākaṃ anucchavikanti attho.
analyzed: sāraṇīya dhamma pūraṇataḥ pi idam yathā bhūta ppavedanam tumhākam anucchavikam ti attho
translated: “By the method” means by the method of the story. “Is suitable” means that this declaration of the truth is suitable for you because it fulfills the quality of being edifying.

original: Anārocetvāva palāyiṃsu corabhayena. “Attano dujjīvikāyā”ti ca vadanti.
analyzed: an ārocetvā ava palāyiṃsu cora bhayena ca vadanti
translated: and fled without informing anyone, out of fear of robbers. “Because of their own difficulty in making a living,” they say.

original: Vaṭṭissatīti kappissati. Therī sāraṇīyadhammapūrikā ahosi, therassa pana sīlatejeneva devatā ussukkaṃ āpajji.
analyzed: vaṭṭissati iti kappissati therī sāraṇīya dhamma pūrikā ahosi therassa pana sīla tejena iva devatā ussukkam āpajji
translated: “Will be all right” means will be successful. The Elder Nun was one who fulfilled the quality of being edifying, but it was only through the Elder’s virtue that the deities became zealous.

original: Natthi etesaṃ khaṇḍanti akhaṇḍāni. Taṃ pana nesaṃ khaṇḍaṃ dassetuṃ “yassā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: natthi etesam khaṇḍanti akhaṇḍāni tam pana nesam khaṇḍam dassetum yassa atiādi vuttam
translated: “They have no gaps” means they are not broken. But in order to show their gaps, the following is said: “Whose virtue is not broken.”

original: Tattha upasampannasīlānaṃ uddesakkamena ādi antā veditabbā. Tenāha “sattasū”tiādi.
analyzed: tattha upasampanna sīlānam uddesa kkamena ādi antā veditabbā tena āha satta sūti ādi
translated: Herein, the beginning and end of the precepts for those who have been admitted to the Order should be understood according to the order in which they are announced. Hence he said “seven” and so on.🔽But the beginning and end of the precepts for those who have not been admitted to the Order can be found according to the order in which they are undertaken.

original: Anupasampannasīlānaṃ pana samādānakkamenapi ādi antā labbhanti. Pariyante chinnasāṭako
analyzed: anupasampanna sīlānam pana samādāna kkamena api ādi antāḥ labbhanti pariyante chinna sāṭako
translated: Like a cloth that is cut at the edge,🔽like a cloth that is cut at the edge or at the warp, this is an example of a dissimilar kind.🔽Because of the existence of the unbroken,🔽and so on. The broken and torn state is a break.

original: viyāti vatthante, dasante vā chinnavatthaṃ viya, visadisūdāharaṇaṃ cetaṃ “akhaṇḍānī”ti
analyzed: viyāti vatthante dasante vā chinna vattham viya akhaṇḍāni iti
translated: It has that,🔽thus it is a precept with a break. The same method of explanation applies in the case of the torn and the holed.🔽The torn and the split are split.🔽The torn and the rent are rent.

original: imassa adhigatattā. Evaṃ sesānipi udāharaṇāni. Khaṇḍitabhinnatā khaṇḍaṃ, taṃ etassa
analyzed: imassa adhigata ttā evam sesāni api udāharaṇāni khaṇḍita bhinna tā khaṇḍam tam etassa
translated: The torn and the tattered are tattered.🔽The torn and the spoiled are spoiled.🔽The torn and the stained are stained.🔽The torn and the blotched are blotched.🔽The torn and the patched are patched.🔽The torn and the darned are darned.🔽The torn and the darned here and there are darned here and there.🔽The torn and the darned all over are darned all over.🔽The torn and the darned in the middle are darned in the middle.🔽The torn and the darned in the middle like a cow’s ear are darned in the middle like a cow’s ear.

original: atthīti khaṇḍaṃ, sīlaṃ. “Chidda”ntiādīsupi eseva nayo. Vemajjhe bhinnaṃ vinivijjhanavasena
analyzed: atthi iti khaṇḍam sīlam chiddanti ādīsu pi esā iva nayaḥ vemajjhe bhinnam vinivijjhana vasena
translated: The torn and the darned like a patchwork are darned like a patchwork.🔽The torn and the darned like a sugar-bag are darned like a sugar-bag.🔽The torn and the darned like a winnowing basket are darned like a winnowing basket.🔽The torn and the darned like a purse are darned like a purse.🔽The torn and the darned like a purse in the middle are darned like a purse in the middle.🔽The torn and the darned like a purse all over are darned like a purse all over.

original: visabhāgavaṇṇena gāvī viyāti sambandho. Sabalarahitāni asabalāni. Tathā akammāsāni.
analyzed: visa bhāga vaṇṇena gāvī viyāti sambandhaḥ sabala rahitāni asabalāni tathā akammāsāni
translated: The torn and the darned like a bird’s wing are darned like a bird’s wing.🔽The torn and the darned like a saw are darned like a saw.🔽The torn and the darned like a snake’s hood are darned like a snake’s hood.

original: Sīlassa taṇhādāsabyato mocanaṃ vivaṭṭūpanissayabhāvāpādanaṃ. Yasmā ca taṃsamaṅgīpuggalo🔽serī sayaṃvasī bhujisso nāma hoti, tasmāpi bhujissāni. Tenevāha “bhujissabhāvakāraṇato
analyzed: sīlassa mocanam vivaṭṭu upanissaya bhāva āpādanam yasmā ca tad samaṅgī puggalaḥ 🔽serī sayaṃvasī bhujissaḥ nāma hoti tasmā api bhujissāni tena iva āha bhujissa bhāva kāraṇataḥ
translated: The torn and the darned like a

original: bhujissānī”ti. Suparisuddhabhāvena pāsaṃsattā viññupasatthāni. Imināhaṃ sīlena devo🔽vā bhaveyyaṃ, devaññataro vā, tattha “nicco dhuvo sassato”ti, “sīlena suddhī”ti ca🔽evaṃ ādinā taṇhādiṭṭhīhi aparāmaṭṭhattā. “Ayaṃ te sīlesu doso”ti catūsupi vipattīsu
analyzed: bhujissāni iti su parisuddha bhāvena pāsaṃsattā viññu pasatthāni iminā aham sīlena devaḥ  vā bhaveyyam devaññataraḥ vā tattha niccaḥ dhuvaḥ sassatoti sīlena suddhī iti ca  evam ādinā taṇhā diṭṭhīhi a parāmaṭṭha ttā ayam te sīlesu dosaḥ ti catūsu pi vipattīsu
translated: “They are respected and revered” because of their purity. “By this virtue may I become” means “a god or one of the gods,” and so on. “By virtue there is purification” means “permanent, stable, and eternal.” “This is a defect in your virtue” means “in the four kinds of failure.”

original: yāya kāyaci vipattiyā dassanena parāmaṭṭhuṃ anuddhaṃsetuṃ. Samādhisaṃvattanappayojanāni🔽samādhisaṃvattanikāni.
analyzed: yāya kāyaci vipattiyā dassanena parāmaṭṭhum an uddhaṃsetum samādhi saṃvattana payojanāni  samādhi saṃvattanikāni
translated: “They are respected and revered” because of their extreme purity. “By means of this virtue I shall become a god or one of the gods” : he does not misapprehend it as permanent, etc., and he does not misapprehend it as purification, etc. “This is a defect in your virtue” : he does not misapprehend it as a defect in virtue by seeing it as a defect in any of the four fallings away. “They lead to concentration” : they lead to the concentration of the fine-material sphere.

original: Samānabhāvūpagatasīlāti sīlasampattiyā samānabhāvaṃ upagatasīlā sabhāgavuttikā. Kāmaṃ
analyzed: samāna bhāva upagata sīlā ati sīla sampattiyā samāna bhāvam upagata sīlā sa bhāga vuttikā kāmam
translated: “They are virtue that has attained a state of similarity” : virtue that has attained a state of similarity with the perfection of virtue, virtue that is of the same mode of progress.

original: puthujjanānañca catupārisuddhisīle nānattaṃ na siyā, taṃ pana na ekantikaṃ, idaṃ
analyzed: puthujjanānam ca catu pārisuddhi sīle nānattam na siyā tam pana na ekantikam idam
translated: Although there may be no difference in the virtue of purification by the four paths of the ordinary man, that is not certain, but this is certain.🔽Therefore it is said: “There is no difference in the virtue of the path.”

original: ekantikaṃ niyatabhāvatoti āha “natthi maggasīle nānatta”nti. Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttanti🔽maggasīlaṃ sandhāya etaṃ “yāni tāni sīlānī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ekantikam niyata bhāvato ti āha natthi magga sīle nānattam ti tam sandhāya itam vuttan ti 🔽magga sīlam sandhāya etam yāni tāni sīlāni itiādi vuttam
translated: This was said with reference to the path.

original: Yāyanti yā ayaṃ mayhañceva tumhākañca paccakkhabhūtā. Diṭṭhīti maggasammādiṭṭhi.🔽Niddosāti nidhutadosā, samucchinnarāgādipāpadhammāti attho. Niyyātīti vaṭṭadukkhato
analyzed: yā ayanti yā ayam mayham ca iva tumhākam ca paccakkha bhūtā diṭṭhī iti magga sammādiṭṭhi  niddosā ati nidhuta dosā samucchinna rāga ādi pāpa dhammā ati atthaḥ niyyāti iti vaṭṭa dukkhato
translated: ‘Which’: which is evident to me and to you. ‘View’: right view of the path.🔽‘Free from poison’: free from the poison of defilements, the meaning is, with greed, etc., cut off. ‘Escapes’: escapes from, goes out from,

original: nissarati nigacchati. Sayaṃ niyyantasseva hi “taṃsamaṅgīpuggalaṃ vaṭṭadukkhato niyyāpetī”ti🔽vuccati. Yā satthu anusiṭṭhi, taṃ karotīti takkaro, tassa, yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjanakassāti
analyzed: nissarati nigacchati sayam niyyantassa iva hi taṃ samaṅgī puggalam vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ niyyāpeti iti  vuccati yā satthu anusiṭṭhi tam karoti iti takkaro tassa yathānusiṭṭham paṭipad janakassa ati
translated: the suffering of the round of rebirths. For it is said that ‘he causes that person to escape from the suffering of the round of rebirths’

original: attho. Samānadiṭṭhibhāvanti sadisadiṭṭhibhāvaṃ saccasampaṭivedhena abhinnadiṭṭhibhāvaṃ.
analyzed: attho samāna diṭṭhi bhāvanti sadisa diṭṭhi bhāvam sacca sampaṭivedhena abhinna diṭṭhi bhāvam
translated: who is himself escaping from it. ‘Does what he says’: he does what the Master says; the meaning is, he practices in accordance with the advice. ‘The same view’: the same state of view, the state of view that is undivided through the penetration of the truths.

original: Vuddhiyevāti ariyavinaye guṇehi vuḍḍhiyeva, no parihānīti ayaṃ aparihāniyadhammadesanā
analyzed: vuddhiyā iva ati ariya vinaye guṇehi vuḍḍhiyā iva no ayam a parihāniya dhamma desanā
translated: ‘Only growth’: only growth in special qualities in the Dispensation of the Noble Ones, not diminution. This is the teaching of the state of non-diminution

original: attanopi sāsanassa addhaniyataṃ ākaṅkhantena bhagavatā idha desitā.
analyzed: attanaḥ api sāsanassa addha niyatam ākaṅkhantena bhagavatā idha desitā
translated: taught here by the Blessed One who desires the security of the Dispensation and of himself.

original: 142. Āsannaparinibbānattāti katipayamāsādhikena saṃvaccharamattena parinibbānaṃ bhavissatīti
analyzed: āsanna parinibbāna ttā ati katipaya māsa adhikena saṃvacchara mattena parinibbānam bhavissati iti
translated: Because his final Nibbāna was near: his final Nibbāna would be in a few months, in a year at most.

original: katvā vuttaṃ. Etaṃyevāti “iti sīla”ntiādikaṃyeva iti sīlanti ettha iti-saddo pakārattho,
analyzed: katvā vuttam etaṃ yeva ati iti iti iti sīlanti ādikam yeva iti sīlanti ettha iti saddo pakāra attho
translated: and so on. ‘This itself’: the ‘thus’ is the ‘thus of virtue’ and so on. The word ‘thus’ has the meaning of ‘in this way’ and the meaning of ‘to this extent’;

original: parimāṇattho ca ekajjhaṃ katvā gahitoti āha “evaṃ sīlaṃ ettakaṃ sīla”nti. Evaṃ sīlanti🔽evaṃ pabhedaṃ sīlaṃ. Ettakanti etaṃ paramaṃ, na ito bhiyyo. Catupārisuddhisīlanti
analyzed: parimāṇa atthaḥ ca ekajjham katvā gahitaḥ iti āha evam sīlam ettakam sīlanti evam sīlanti  evam pabhedam sīlam ettakanti etam paramam naḥ itas bhiyyas catu pārisuddhi sīlanti
translated: and it is taken as having both meanings combined, according to the commentarial method. So he said ‘thus virtue, virtue to this extent.’ ‘Thus virtue’:

original: maggassa sambhārabhūtaṃ lokiyacatupārisuddhisīlaṃ. Cittekaggatā samādhīti etthāpi🔽eseva nayo. Yasmiṃ sīle ṭhatvāti yasmiṃ lokuttarakusalassa padaṭṭhānabhūte “pubbeva
analyzed: maggassa sambhāra bhūtam lokiya catu pārisuddhi sīlam citta ekagga tā samādhi iti ettha api  esa iva nayaḥ yasmim sīle ṭhatvā ati yasmin lokuttara kusalassa padaṭṭhāna bhūte pubbā eva
translated: virtue of this classification. ‘To this extent’: to this limit, no more than this. ‘The virtue of the fourfold purity’: the mundane virtue of the fourfold purity, which is a prerequisite for the path. ‘One-pointedness of mind is concentration’:

original: kho panassa kāyakammaṃ vacīkammaṃ ājīvo suparisuddho hotī”ti evaṃ vuttasīle patiṭṭhāya.🔽Esoti maggaphalasamādhi. Paribhāvitoti tena sīlena sabbaso bhāvito sambhāvito. Mahapphalo
analyzed: kho panassa kāya kammam vacī kammam ājīvaḥ su parisuddhaḥ hoti iti evam vutta sīle patiṭṭhāya  eso ti magga phala samādhi paribhāvito ti tena sīlena sabbasas bhāvitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ mahapphalo
translated: the same method applies here. ‘In virtue that is kept’: in virtue that is the proximate cause for supramundane profitable states, and which is described thus: ‘His bodily action, speech, and livelihood are already well purified’ .

original: hoti mahānisaṃsoti maggasamādhi tāva sāmaññaphalehi mahapphalo, vaṭṭadukkhavūpasamena
analyzed: hoti mahā nisaṃso ti magga samādhi tāva sāmañña phalehi mahapphalaḥ vaṭṭa dukkha vūpasamena
translated: ‘This’: the concentration of the path and the fruition. ‘Is developed’: is fully developed, perfected, by that virtue. ‘Has great fruit and great benefit’: the concentration of the path has great fruit in the fruits of asceticism,🔽and it has great benefit in the cessation of the suffering of the round of rebirths.

original: mahānisaṃso. Itaro paṭippassaddhippahānena mahapphalo, nibbutisukhuppattiyā mahānisaṃso.🔽Yamhi samādhimhi ṭhatvāti yasmiṃ lokuttarakusalassa padaṭṭhānabhūte pādakajjhānasamādhimhi
analyzed: mahā nisaṃsaḥ itaro paṭippassaddhi ppahānena mahapphalaḥ nibbuti sukha uppattiyā mahā nisaṃsaḥ  yamhi samādhimhi yasmin lokuttara kusalassa padaṭṭhāna bhūte pādaka jhāna samādhimhi
translated: The other is of great fruit because of the abandoning of the hindrance of agitation, and of great profit because of the production of the bliss of peace.

original: ceva vuṭṭhānagāminisamādhimhi ca ṭhatvā. Sāti maggaphalapaññā. Tena paribhāvitāti🔽tena yathāvuttasamādhinā sabbaso bhāvitā paribhāvitā. Mahapphalamahānisaṃsatā samādhimhi
analyzed: ca iva vuṭṭhāna gāmini samādhimhi ca sā ati magga phala paññā tena paribhāvitā ati  tena yathā vutta samādhinā sabbasas bhāvitā paribhāvitā mahat phala mahā nisaṃsa tā samādhimhi
translated: In whatever concentration: in whatever concentration of jhāna, which is the footing for the supramundane profitable, and in the concentration of the path and the fruition that is the outcome of that jhāna.🔽And is purified: is quite developed, quite perfected, by that concentration stated thus. Its being of great fruit and of great profit should be understood in the way already stated.

original: vuttanayena veditabbā. Api ca te bojjhaṅgamaggaṅgajhānaṅgappabhedahetutāya mahapphalā
analyzed: vutta nayena veditabbāḥ api ca te bojjhaṅga maggaṅga jhānaṅga ppabheda hetutāya mahapphalā
translated: Besides, it is of great fruit because it is the cause for the kinds of enlightenment factor, path factor, and jhāna factor,

original: sattadakkhiṇeyyapuggalavibhāgahetutāya mahānisaṃsāti veditabbā. Yāya paññāya ṭhatvāti
analyzed: satta dakkhiṇeyya puggala vibhāga hetu tāya mahā nisaṃsā ati veditabbā yāya paññāya ṭhatvā ati
translated: and it is of great profit because it is the cause for the classification of the seven kinds of person worthy of offerings.🔽By means of which understanding: by means of which understanding of insight or of concentration-and-insight.

original: yāyaṃ vipassanāpaññāyaṃ, samādhivipassanāpaññāyaṃ vā ṭhatvā. Samathayānikassa hi
analyzed: yāyam vipassanā paññāyam samādhi vipassanā paññāyam vā ṭhatvā samatha yānikassa hi
translated: For the one whose vehicle is serenity,🔽understanding accompanied by concentration is itself a special condition for the attainment of the path.

original: samādhisahagatāpi paññā maggādhigamāya visesapaccayo hotiyeva. Sammadevāti suṭṭhuyeva
analyzed: samādhi sahagatā api paññā magga adhigamāya visesa paccayaḥ hotiyā iva sammad eva ati suṭṭhuyeva
translated: Rightly gone: gone well,

original: yathā āsavānaṃ lesopi nāvasissati, evaṃ sabbaso āsavehi vimuccati. Aggamaggakkhaṇañhi sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ.🔽143. Lokiyatthasaddānaṃ viya abhiranta-saddassa siddhi daṭṭhabbā. Abhirantaṃ abhirataṃ
analyzed: yathā āsavānam lesaḥ api na avasissati evam sabbaso āsavehi vimuccati agga magga kkhaṇam hi sandhāya itam vuttam  lokiya attha saddānam viya abhiranta saddassa siddhi daṭṭhabbā abhirantam abhiratam
translated: The word abhirati should be understood to be established in the same way as the words lokiya and attha.🔽For abhirati, abhirata, and abhiramati are one in meaning.

original: abhiratīti hi atthato ekaṃ. Abhiranta-saddo cāyaṃ abhirucipariyāyo, na assādapariyāyo.
analyzed: abhirati iti hi atthataḥ ekam abhiranta saddo ca ayam abhiruci pariyāyaḥ na assāda pariyāyaḥ
translated: And this word abhirati is used in the sense of delighting in, not in the sense of relishing.

original: Assādavasena hi katthaci vasantassa assādavatthuvigamena siyā tassa tattha anabhirati,🔽yadidaṃ khīṇāsavānaṃ natthi, pageva buddhānanti āha “buddhānaṃ…pe… natthī”ti. Abhirativasena
analyzed: assāda vasena hi katthaci vasantassa assāda vatthu vigamena siyā tassa tattha an abhirati  yat idam khīṇāsavānam natthi pageva buddhānam ti āha buddhānam pe natthi iti abhirati vasena
translated: For one who dwells somewhere relishingly might become disinclined to it if the object of relishing disappears.🔽But this is not so in the case of the Buddhas, let alone those whose cankers are exhausted.🔽The word abhirati is used in the sense of delighting in, not in the sense of relishing.

original: katthaci vasitvā tadabhāvato aññattha gamanaṃ nāma buddhānaṃ natthi. Veneyyavinayanatthaṃ
analyzed: katthaci vasitvā tad abhāvataḥ aññattha gamanam nāma buddhānam na atthi veneyya vinayana attham
translated: The Buddhas do not go elsewhere after dwelling somewhere out of a desire to do so.🔽But after dwelling somewhere for the purpose of training their disciples,

original: pana katthaci vasitvā tasmiṃ siddhe veneyyavinayanatthameva tato aññattha gacchanti,
analyzed: pana katthaci vasitvā tasmin siddhe veneyya vinayana attham eva tatas aññattha gacchanti
translated: when that purpose has been served, they go elsewhere for the purpose of training other disciples.

original: ayamettha yathāruci. Āyāmāti ettha ā-saddo “āgacchā”ti iminā samānatthoti āha “ehi
analyzed: ayam ettha yathāruci āyāma ati ettha āsaddaḥ āgaccha āti iminā samāna atthaḥ ti āha ehi
translated: This is according to preference. The word āyām is synonymous with āgacchā. Therefore he says, “Come, let us go.”

original: yāmā”ti. Ayāmāti pana pāṭhe a-kāro nipātamattaṃ. Santikāvacarattā theraṃ ālapati,
analyzed: yāmā ati ayāmā ati pana pāṭhe akāraḥ nipāta mattam theram ālapati
translated: But in the reading āyām, the letter a is merely a particle. He addresses the elder because the latter was living near him,

original: na pana tadā satthu santike vasantānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhāvato. Aparicchinnagaṇano hi
analyzed: na pana tadā satthu santike vasantānam bhikkhūnam abhāvataḥ aparicchinna gaṇanaḥ hi
translated: not because there were no bhikkhus living with the Master at that time. For the bhikkhu-saṅgha was then unlimited in number

original: tadā bhagavato santike bhikkhusaṅgho. Tenāha “mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhi”nti.
analyzed: tadā bhagavato santike bhikkhu saṅgho tena āha mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhinti
translated: in the presence of the Blessed One. Therefore he says, “together with a great bhikkhu-saṅgha.”

original: Ambalaṭṭhikāgamananti ambalaṭṭhikāgamanapaṭisaṃyuttapāṭhamāha. Pāṭaligamaneti etthāpi
analyzed: ambala ṭṭhikā gamanam ti ambala ṭṭhikā gamana paṭisaṃyutta pāṭham āha pāṭali gamana iti ettha api
translated: Ambalaṭṭhikāgamana means the recitation connected with the going to Ambalaṭṭhikā. Pāṭaligāma means

original: eseva nayo. Uttānameva anantaraṃ, heṭṭhā ca saṃvaṇṇitarūpattā.
analyzed: esā iva nayaḥ uttānam eva anantaram heṭṭhā ca saṃvaṇṇita rūpa ttā
translated: the same method. The next is the same as the one below, because it has already been explained.

original: Sāriputtasīhanādavaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Lion’s Roar of Sāriputta

original: 145. “Āyasmā sāriputto”tiādi pāṭhajātaṃ. Sampasādanīyeti sampasādanīyasutte vitthāritaṃ porāṇaṭṭhakathāyaṃ, tasmā mayampi tattheva naṃ atthato vitthārayissāmāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: āyasmā sāriputto tiādi pāṭha jātam sampasādanīya iti sampasādanīya sutte vitthāritam porāṇa aṭṭhakathā ayam tasmā mayam pi tattha iva nam atthataḥ vitthārayissāma ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The passage beginning “The venerable Sāriputta” is the text. Sampasādanīya means the Sutta on Conversion, which is explained in detail in the old commentary. Therefore the intention is that we too will explain it there in the meaning.

original: Dussīlaādīnavavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dussīla ādīnava vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Evils of Immorality, etc.

original: 148. Āgantvā vasanti ettha āgantukāti āvasatho, tadeva agāranti āha “āvasathāgāranti
analyzed: āgantvā vasanti ettha āgantukā ati āvasatho tat eva agāranti āha āvasatha āgāranti
translated: “A dwelling-place is a place where visitors stay. That same place is a house , thus it is said ‘a dwelling-place house’ .

original: āgantukānaṃ āvasathageha”nti. Dvinnaṃ rājūnanti licchavirājamagadharājūnaṃ. Sahāyakāti🔽sevakā. Kulānīti kuṭumbike. Santhatanti santhari, sabbaṃ santhari sabbasanthari,
analyzed: āgantukānam dvinnam rājūnanti licchavi rāja magadha rājūnam sahāyaka ati  sevakā kulāni iti kuṭumbike santhatanti santhari sabbam santhari sabba santhari
translated: A dwelling is a place where visitors stay, where they come and stay, thus it is a dwelling-place . That itself is a house , thus it is said: “A dwelling-place is a house for visitors to stay in.” Of the two kings : of the Licchavi king and the Magadha king. Companions :

original: taṃ sabbasanthariṃ. Bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso cāyaṃ. Tenāha “yathā sabbaṃ santhataṃ hoti, eva”nti.🔽149. Dussīloti ettha du-saddo abhāvattho “duppañño”tiādīsu viya, na garahatthoti🔽āha “asīlo nissīlo”ti. Bhinnasaṃvaroti ettha yo samādinnasīlo kenaci kāraṇena sīlabhedaṃ🔽patto, so tāva bhinnasaṃvaro hoti. Yo pana sabbena sabbaṃ asamādinnasīlo ācārahīno,
analyzed: tam sabbasantharim bhāva napuṃsaka niddeso ca ayam tena āha yathā sabbam santhatam hoti evam ti  dussīlaḥ ti ettha du saddo abhāva atthaḥ duppañño ti ādīsu viya na garaha tthaḥ ti  āha asīlaḥ nissīlaḥ iti bhinna saṃvaraḥ ti ettha yaḥ samādinna sīlaḥ kenaci kāraṇena sīla bhedam  patto so tāva bhinna saṃvaraḥ hoti yaḥ pana sabbena sabbam a samādinna sīlaḥ ācāra hīnaḥ
translated: servants. Families : heads of families. Spread out : he spread out , he spread out everything , he spread out all , thus he is a “he-who-spreads-out-all” . And this is a description of a male person by a derivative of the verb bhū . Therefore it is said: “as if all were spread out” .

original: so kathaṃ bhinnasaṃvaro nāma hotīti? Sopi sādhusamācārassa parihāniyassa bheditattā
analyzed: saḥ katham bhinna saṃvaraḥ nāma hoti iti saḥ api sādhu samācārassa bhedita ttā
translated: Immoral : here the prefix du- has the meaning of non- , as in duppañña , etc., not the meaning of blame, thus it is said: “without virtue, devoid of virtue” . One whose virtue is broken : here one who has undertaken virtue and who has fallen into an offence of Expiation or an offence of Forfeiture is one whose virtue is broken. But how can one who has never undertaken virtue at all, who is lacking in conduct, be called one whose virtue is broken? He too is called one whose virtue is broken because he has broken away from the state of one of good conduct, which is the opposite of that of one whose virtue is broken.

original: bhinnasaṃvaro eva nāma. Vissaṭṭhasaṃvaro saṃvararahitoti hi vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: bhinna saṃvaraḥ eva nāma vissaṭṭha saṃvaraḥ saṃvara rahitaḥ ti hi vuttam hoti
translated: he is called “one whose restraint has been broken.” “Restraint-breaker” means one who is devoid of restraint.

original: Taṃ taṃ sippaṭṭhānaṃ. Māghātakāleti “mā ghātetha pāṇino”ti evaṃ māghātāti ghosanaṃ ghositadivase.
analyzed: tam tam sippa ṭṭhānam mā āghāta kāla iti mā ghātetha pāṇinā iti evam mā āghāta ati ghosanam ghosita divase
translated: “Any craft or occupation” means any kind of work. “On the day of proclamation” means on the day of the proclamation: “Do not kill living beings.”

original: Abbhuggacchati pāpako kittisaddo.
analyzed: abbhuggacchati pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ
translated: “Evil reputation spreads”

original: Ajjhāsayena maṅku hotiyeva vippaṭisāribhāvato.
analyzed: ajjhāsayena maṅku hotiyā iva vippaṭisāri bhāvato
translated: “He is ashamed” because he is remorseful.

original: Tassāti dussīlassa. Samādāya pavattiṭṭhānanti uṭṭhāya samuṭṭhāya katakāraṇaṃ. Āpāthaṃ
analyzed: tassa ati dussīlassa samādāya pavatti ṭṭhānam ti uṭṭhāya samuṭṭhāya kata kāraṇam āpātham
translated: “That” means the unvirtuous one’s. “The occasion for his undertaking” means the reason he has undertaken to do. “Comes to him”

original: āgacchatīti taṃ manaso upaṭṭhāti. Ummīletvā idhalokanti ummīlanakāle attano puttadārādidassanavasena
analyzed: āgacchati iti tam manasaḥ upaṭṭhāti ummīletvā idha lokam ti ummīlana kāle attano putta dāra ādi dassana vasena
translated: means it occurs to his mind. “When he opens his eyes and looks at this world” means that when he opens his eyes he sees this world in terms of his wife, children, etc.

original: idha lokaṃ passati. Nimīletvā paralokanti nimīlanakāle gatinimittupaṭṭhānavasena🔽paralokaṃ passati. Tenāha “cattāro apāyā”tiādi. Pañcamapadanti “kāyassa bhedā”tiādinā
analyzed: idha lokam passati nimīletvā para lokam ti nimīlana kāle gati nimitta upaṭṭhāna vasena  para lokam passati tena āha cattāro apāya atiādi kāyassa bheda atiādinā
translated: “When he closes his eyes and looks at the other world” means that when he closes his eyes he sees the other world in terms of the sign of his destiny.

original: vutto pañcamo ādīnavakoṭṭhāso.
analyzed: vuttaḥ pañcamaḥ ādīnava koṭṭhāso
translated: Therefore it is said: “the four lower worlds” and so on. “The fifth section” is the fifth section on danger, stated with the words “With the breakup of the body, after death” and so on.

original: Sīlavantaānisaṃsavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the benefits of virtue

original: 150. Vuttavipariyāyenāti vuttāya ādīnavakathāya vipariyāyena. “Appamatto taṃ taṃ🔽kasivāṇijjādiṃ yathākālaṃ sampādetuṃ sakkotī”tiādinā “pāsaṃsaṃ sīlamassa atthīti
analyzed: vutta vipariyāyena ati vuttāya ādīnava kathāya vipariyāyena appamattaḥ tam tam  kasi vāṇijja ādim yathākālam sampādetum sakkoti iti ādinā pāsaṃsam sīlam assa atthi iti
translated: The opposite of the way in which the dangers have been stated is the way in which the benefits should be stated. “The heedful one is able to accomplish this and that field-work, trading, and so on, in good time” . “He is praiseworthy, he has virtue” .

original: sīlavā. Sīlasampannoti sīlena samannāgato. Sampannasīlo”ti evamādikaṃ pana atthavacanaṃ🔽sukaranti anāmaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: sīlavā sīla sampanno ti sīlena samannāgato sampanna sīlo ti evamādikam pana attha vacanam  sukaranti anāmaṭṭham
translated: The opposite of the way in which the dangers have been stated: “The heedful one is able to accomplish this and that field-work, trading, etc., in good time” and so on. “He has praiseworthy virtue” and so on. But the meaning of the words “virtuous” , etc., is easy to understand, so I shall not comment on it.

original: 151. Pāḷimuttakāyāti saṅgītianāruḷhāya dhammikathāya. Tatthevāti āvasathāgāre eva.
analyzed: pāḷimuttakāya ati saṅgīti an āruḷhāya dhammi kathāya tattha iva ati āvasatha āgāre eva
translated: “In the texts” : in the Dhamma talks not included in the Canon. “There itself” : in the rest house itself.

original: Pāṭaliputtanagaramāpanavaṇṇanā🔽152. Issariyamattāyāti issariyappamāṇena, issariyena ceva vittūpakaraṇena cāti evaṃ🔽vā attho daṭṭhabbo. Upabhogūpakaraṇānipi hi loke “mattā”ti vuccanti. Pāṭaligāmaṃ
analyzed: pāṭaliputta nagara māpana vaṇṇanā  issariya mattāya ati issariya ppamāṇena issariyena ca iva vittu upakaraṇena ca ati evam  vā atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo upabhogu upakaraṇāni pi hi loke mattā ati vuccanti pāṭaligāmam
translated: The description of the city of Pāṭaliputta

original: nagaraṃ katvāti pubbe “pāṭaligāmo”ti laddhanāmaṃ ṭhānaṃ idāni nagaraṃ katvā. Māpentīti
analyzed: nagaram katvā ti pubbe pāṭaligāmaḥ ti laddha nāmam ṭhānam idāni nagaram katvā māpenti iti

original: patiṭṭhāpenti. Āyamukhapacchindanatthanti āyadvārānaṃ upacchedanāya. “Sahassasevā”ti🔽vā pāṭho, sahassaso eva. Tenāha “ekekavaggavasena sahassaṃ sahassaṃ hutvā”ti. Nāgaggāhoti nāgānaṃ nivāsappariggaho.🔽Sesadvayesupi eseva nayo. Pāsāṇoti appalakkhaṇapāsāṇo. Khāṇukoti yo koci khāṇuko.
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpenti āya mukha pacchindana thanti āya dvārānaṃ upacchedanāya  vā eva tena āha eka eka vagga vasena sahassam sahassam hutvā ati ghara vatthūni iti  ghara patiṭṭhāpana ṭṭhānāni cittāni namanti iti taṃ taṃ devatā anubhāvena tattha tattha iva  cittāni namanti vatthu vijjā pāṭhakānam yattha yattha vatthūni pariggahitāni  sippa anubhāvena ati sippa anugata vijjā anubhāvena nāga ggāhaḥ iti nāgānam nivāsa pariggaho  sesa dvayesu pi esā iva nayo pāsāṇo ti appalakkhaṇa pāsāṇo khāṇuko ti yaḥ koci khāṇuko
translated: They are established. For the purpose of cutting off the approach: for the purpose of cutting off the approaches. The reading “sahassasevā” is the same as “sahassaso”. Therefore it is said: “a thousand each by way of each section”. House sites: the places for establishing a house. Minds are bent: by the power of the various deities minds are bent there and there,🔽the reciters of the lore of sites, where and where the sites are selected.🔽By the power of the arts: by the power of the arts and the lore connected with them. The capture of the dragon: the selection of the dragon’s abode.🔽The same method applies in the case of the other two. Stone: a small stone with good characteristics. Tree-trunk: any tree-trunk.

original: vatthuvijjāpāṭhakānaṃ, sabbāsaṃ devatānaṃ. Maṅgalaṃ vaḍḍhāpessantīti maṅgalaṃ brūhessanti.
analyzed: vatthu vijjā pāṭhakānam sabbāsam devatānam maṅgalam vaḍḍhāpessanti iti maṅgalam brūhessanti
translated: Will proclaim good fortune: will proclaim good fortune.

original: Paṇḍitadassanādīni hi uttamamaṅgalāni. Tenāha “atha maya”ntiādi.
analyzed: paṇḍita dassana ādīni hi uttama maṅgalāni tena āha atha mayanti ādi
translated: For the seeing of the wise and so on are the supreme good fortune. Therefore it is said: “Then I” and so on.

original: Saddo abbhuggacchati avayavadhammena samudāyassa apadisitabbato yathā “alaṅkato devadatto”ti.
analyzed: saddaḥ abbhut gacchati avayava dhammena samudāyassa apadisitabbataḥ yathā alaṅkataḥ devadattaḥ iti
translated: The sound occurs by way of the analysis of the parts, because the whole is to be indicated, as in “Devadatta is adorned.”🔽The noble people: the people living in the noble country.

original: Ariyakamanussānanti ariyadesavāsimanussānaṃ. Rāsivasenevāti “sahassaṃ satasahassa”ntiādinā
analyzed: ariyaka manussānam ti ariya desavāsi manussānam rāsi vasena iva ati sahassam sata sahassa nti ādinā
translated: By the method of the market: by the method of the market, “a thousand, a hundred thousand” and so on.

original: rāsivaseneva, appakassa pana bhaṇḍassa kayavikkayo aññatthāpi labbhatevāti “rāsivasenevā”ti
analyzed: rāsi vasena iva appakassa pana bhaṇḍassa kaya vikkayo aññattha api labbhate iva ati rāsi vasena iva ati
translated: But the buying and selling of a small amount of goods is available elsewhere as well, therefore it is said: “by the method of the market.”

original: vuttaṃ. Vāṇijāya patho pavattiṭṭhānanti vaṇippathoti purimavikappe attho dutiyavikappe🔽pana vāṇijānaṃ patho pavattiṭṭhānanti, vaṇippathoti imamatthaṃ dassento “vāṇijānaṃ
analyzed: vuttam vāṇijāya patho pavatti ṭṭhānan ti vaṇippatho ti purima vikappe atthaḥ dutiya vikappe  pana vāṇijānam pathaḥ pavatti ṭṭhānan ti vaṇippatho ti imam attham dassento vāṇijānam
translated: The path of trade is the place of occurrence: the path of trade. In the first analysis the meaning is this. In the second analysis,🔽however, the path of the traders is the place of occurrence, the path of trade. Showing this meaning, “the dwelling place of the traders” is said.

original: vasanaṭṭhāna”nti āha. Bhaṇḍapuṭe bhindanti mocenti etthāti puṭabhedananti ayamettha
analyzed: vasana ṭṭhānanti āha bhaṇḍapuṭe bhindanti mocenti ettha ati puṭabhedananti ayam ettha
translated: They break open the bundles here, they release them here, therefore it is the bundle-breaking.

original: atthoti āha “bhaṇḍapuṭe…pe… vuttaṃ hotī”ti.
analyzed: atthaḥ ti āha vuttam hoti iti
translated: “The meaning of ‘wealth’ is stated in the passage beginning ‘In the case of a bundle of goods’ …

original: Ca-kārattho samuccayattho vā-saddo.🔽153. Kāḷakaṇṇī sattāti attanā kaṇhadhammabahulatāya paresañca kaṇhavipākānatthanibbattinimittatāya
analyzed: cakāra atthaḥ samuccaya tthaḥ vā saddaḥ  kāḷakaṇṇī sattā ati attanā kaṇha dhamma bahula tāya paresam ca kaṇha vipāka anattha nibbatti nimitta tāya
translated: The word vā is in the sense of samuccaya .🔽The creatures called ‘black-eared’ are creatures of little importance that cause harm to others, because they themselves are full of dark states and because they are the cause for others to produce dark kamma-results.

original: “kāḷakaṇṇī”ti laddhanāmā parūpaddavakarā appesakkhasattā. Tanti bhagavantaṃ. Pubbaṇhasamayanti
analyzed: kāḷakaṇṇī iti laddha nāmā parūpaddava karā appesakkha sattā bhagavantam pubbaṇhasamayanti
translated: Tanti bhagavantaṃ . Pubbaṇhasamayanti

original: pubbaṇhe ekaṃ samayaṃ. Gāmappavisananīhārenāti gāmappavesana nivasanākārena. Kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ
analyzed: pubbaṇhe ekam samayam gāma pavisana nīhārena ati gāma ppavesana nivasana ākārena kāya paṭibaddham
translated: at one time in the morning. Gāmappavisananīhārenāti gāmappavesana nivasanākārena. Kāyapaṭibaddhaṃ

original: katvāti cīvaraṃ pārupitvā, pattaṃ hatthena gahetvāti attho.
analyzed: katvā iti cīvaram pārupitvā pattam hatthena gahetvā iti attho
translated: katvāti cīvaraṃ pārupitvā, pattaṃ hatthena gahetvāti attho.

original: Etthāti etasmiṃ vā sakappitappadese. Saññateti sammadeva saññate susaṃvutakāyavācācitte.
analyzed: ettha ati etasmin vā sa kappita ppadese saññatā iti sammad eva saññate su saṃvuta kāya vācā citte
