analyzed: ñāti manussāḥ ñāti petānam patti dāna ādinā pūjana mānana ādīni karonti ime pana aññātakā api
translated: Kinsmen honour and respect their dead kinsmen by giving gifts in their names, and so on. But these do not wait for that.

original: samānā tathā karonti, tasmā nesaṃ sakkaccaṃ ārakkhā saṃvidhātabbā”ti aññamaññaṃ sampavāretvā🔽devatā tattha ussukkaṃ āpajjantīti dassento “ime”tiādimāha. Balikammakaraṇaṃ mānanaṃ,
analyzed: samānā tathā karonti tasmā na esam sakkaccam ārakkhā saṃvidhātabbā ati aññam aññam sampavāretvā  devatā tattha ussukkam āpajjanti iti dassentaḥ imā iti ādim āha bali kamma karaṇam mānanam
translated: They do it themselves. Therefore they should be carefully guarded.”🔽Showing that the deities make an effort there, he said, “These” , etc. The making of offerings is honouring;

original: sampati uppannaparissayaharaṇaṃ paṭimānanti dassetuṃ “ete”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sampati uppanna parissaya haraṇam paṭimānanti dassetum eta itiādi vuttam
translated: the removal of any misfortune that has arisen is respect.

original: Sundarāni passatīti sundarāni iṭṭhāni eva passati, na aniṭṭhāni.🔽154. Āṇiyo koṭṭetvāti lahuke dārudaṇḍe gahetvā kavāṭaphalake viya aññamaññaṃ sambandhe🔽kātuṃ āṇiyo koṭṭetvā. Nāvāsaṅkhepena kataṃ uḷumpaṃ, veḷunaḷādike saṅgharitvā valliādīhi
analyzed: sundarāni passati iti sundarāni iṭṭhāni eva passati na aniṭṭhāni  āṇiyaḥ koṭṭetvā ati lahuke dāru daṇḍe gahetvā kavāṭa phalake viya aññamaññam sambandhe  koṭṭetvā nāvā saṅkhepena katam uḷumpam veḷu naḷa ādike saṅgharitvā
translated: He sees only what is beautiful: he sees only what is agreeable, not what is disagreeable.🔽He pushes the rudder: he takes two light wooden sticks and pushes them together like the two halves of a door leaf.

original: kalāpavasena bandhitvā kattabbaṃ kullaṃ.
analyzed: kalāpa vasena bandhitvā kattabbam kullam
translated: A raft is a floating structure made with logs, bamboo, etc., bound together with creepers, etc., in the form of bundles.

original: Udakaṭṭhānassetaṃ adhivacananti yathāvuttassa yassa kassaci udakaṭṭhānassa etaṃ “aṇṇava”nti🔽adhivacanaṃ, samuddassevāti adhippāyo. Saranti idha nadī adhippetā sarati sandatīti
analyzed: udaka ṭṭhānassa etam adhivacanam ti yathā vuttassa yassa kassaci udaka ṭṭhānassa etam  adhivacanam samuddassa iva ati adhippāyaḥ saranti idha nadī adhippetā sarati sandati iti
translated: This is a designation for a place where water collects: the meaning intended is that this is a designation for any place where water collects, just as the ocean is.

original: katvā. Gambhīravitthatanti agādhaṭṭhena gambhīraṃ, sakalalokattayabyāpitāya vitthataṃ.🔽Visajjāti anāsajja appatvā. Pallalāni tesaṃ ataraṇato. Vināyeva kullenāti īdisaṃ🔽udakaṃ kullena īdisena vinā eva tiṇṇā medhāvino janā, taṇhāsaraṃ pana ariyamaggasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: katvā gambhīra vitthatanti agādha ṭṭhena gambhīram sakala loka ttaya byāpitāya vitthatam  visajja ati an āsajja appatvā pallalāni tesam a taraṇataḥ kullena ati īdisam  udakam kullena īdisena vinā eva tiṇṇā medhāvinaḥ janā taṇhāsaram pana ariya magga saṅkhātam
translated: This is a designation for a place of water: the meaning intended is that this is a designation for any such place of water as has been described, just as the ocean is. Rivers are intended here by the word “rivers,” taking the word in the sense of “they flow” (saranti). “Deep and wide”: deep in the sense of unfathomable, wide in the sense of extending over the whole of the three worlds.

original: setuṃ katvā nittiṇṇāti yojanā.
analyzed: setum katvā nittiṇṇā ati yojanā
translated: “Without touching”: without reaching, without crossing the banks. “Without a boat”: the wise ones have crossed such water as that without such a boat as a bank. But they have crossed the river of craving by making the noble path their boat.

original: Paṭhamabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: paṭhama bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The first recitation section is finished.

original: Ariyasaccakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Discussion of the Noble Truths”

original: 155. Mahāpanādassa rañño. Pāsādakoṭiyaṃ katagāmoti pāsādassa patitathupikāya patiṭṭhitaṭṭhāne
analyzed: mahāpanādassa rañño pāsāda koṭiyam kata gāmo ti pāsādassa patita thupikāya patiṭṭhita ṭṭhāne
translated: The village built on the slope of the palace: the village built on the place where the palace’s foundation had been laid.

original: niviṭṭhagāmo. Ariyabhāvakarānanti ye paṭivijjhanti, tesaṃ ariyabhāvakarānaṃ nimittassa
analyzed: niviṭṭha gāmaḥ ariya bhāva karānam ti ye paṭivijjhanti tesam ariya bhāva karānam nimittassa
translated: The cause of the noble state: the cause of the noble state of those who penetrate it.

original: kattubhāvūpacāravaseneva vuttaṃ. Tacchāvipallāsabhūtabhāvena saccānaṃ. Anubodho pubbabhāgiyaṃ🔽ñāṇaṃ, paṭivedho maggañāṇena abhisamayo, tattha yasmā anubodhapubbako paṭivedho anubodhena🔽vinā na hoti, anubodhopi ekacco paṭivedhena sambandho, tadubhayābhāvahetukañca vaṭṭeva🔽saṃsaraṇaṃ, tasmā vuttaṃ pāḷiyaṃ “ananubodhā…pe… tumhākañcā”ti. Paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena
analyzed: kattu bhāva upacāra vasena iva vuttam tad chāvi pallāsa bhūta bhāvena saccānam anubodhaḥ pubbabhāgiyam  ñāṇam paṭivedhaḥ magga ñāṇena abhisamayaḥ tattha yasmai anubodha pubbako paṭivedhaḥ anubodhena  vinā na hoti anubodhaḥ api ekacco paṭivedhena sambandho tad ubhaya abhāva hetukam ca  saṃsaraṇam tasmā vuttam pāḷiyam tumhākam ca ati paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena
translated: and it is said in terms of the mere semblance of writing.🔽The understanding is the knowledge in the prior stage.🔽The penetration is the penetration by means of the path-knowledge. The realization is the realization by means of the path. And since the penetration is preceded by the understanding,🔽it does not occur without the understanding. And some of the understanding is connected with the penetration. And because of the absence of both, there is only the wandering on in the round of rebirths.🔽Therefore it is said in the text: “Because of non-understanding … and so on up to … yours.”🔽The grasping of rebirth-linking

original: bhavato bhavantarūpagamanaṃ sandhāvanaṃ, aparāparaṃ cavanupapajjanavasena sañcaraṇaṃ🔽saṃsaraṇanti āha “bhavato”tiādi. Sandhāvitasaṃsaritapadānaṃ kammasādhanataṃ sandhāyāha🔽“mayā ca tumhehi cā”ti paṭhamavikappe. Dutiyavikappe pana bhāvasādhanataṃ hadaye
analyzed: bhavataḥ bhavantar upagamanam sandhāvanam apara aparam sañcaraṇam 🔽āha bhavatā itiādi sandhāvita saṃsarita padānam kamma sādhanatam sandhāya āha 🔽mayā ca tumhehi ca ati paṭhama vikappe dutiya vikappe pana bhāva sādhana tam hadaye
translated: and it is said in terms of the mere semblance of authorship. The knowledge of the four noble truths is the penetration of the four noble truths in the sense of their being the non-delusion of what is true. Understanding is the knowledge in the prior stage. Penetration is the penetration by means of the knowledge of the path. Herein, since penetration is preceded by understanding, it does not occur without understanding. And some understanding is related to penetration. And the wandering on in the round of rebirths, which is due to the absence of both, is the wandering on in the round of rebirths. That is why it is said in the text: “Through failure to understand … you and I have wandered and circled thus far in this long course” . The running hither and thither is the running hither and thither in the sense of the taking up of rebirths. The wandering on is the wandering on in the round of rebirths by dying here and being reborn there. That is why it is said: “From realm to realm we have wandered thus far” . Taking the words “wandering and circling” as referring to kamma, he said: “by you and me” in the first analysis. But in the second analysis, taking them as referring to becoming, he said: “by me” in the sense of the heartwood, and “by you” in the sense of the outer bark.

original: katvā “mamañceva tumhākañcā”ti yathārutavaseneva vuttaṃ. Nayanasamatthāti pāpanasamatthā,🔽dīgharajjunā baddhasakuṇaṃ viya rajjuhattho puriso desantaraṃ taṇhārajjunā baddhaṃ🔽sattasantānaṃ abhisaṅkhāro bhavantaraṃ neti etāyāti bhavanetti, taṇhā, sā ariyamaggasatthena🔽suṭṭhu hatā chinnāti bhavanettisamūhatā.
analyzed: katvā mamañca iva tumhākañca ati yathā ruta vasena iva vuttam nayana samatthā ati pāpana samatthā  dīgha rajjunā baddha sakuṇam viya rajju hatthaḥ purisaḥ desantaram taṇhā rajjunā baddham  satta santānam abhisaṅkhāraḥ bhavantaram na iti taṇhā sā ariya magga satthena  suṭṭhu hatā chinnā ati bhava netti samūha tā
translated: and he said accordingly, “Both for me and for you.”

original: āvasathe”ti. Tulādaṇḍakavāṭaphalakāni pana dārumayāneva.
analyzed: āvasatha iti tulā daṇḍaka vāṭa phalakāni dāru mayāni iva
translated: In a monastery. But the scales and the beam and the board are only of wood.

original: 157. Oraṃ vuccati kāmadhātu, paccayabhāvena taṃ oraṃ bhajantīti orambhāgiyāni, orambhāgassa
analyzed: oram vuccati kāmadhātu paccaya bhāvena tam oram bhajanti iti orambhāgiyāni orambhāgassa
translated: The word “under” means the sense-desire element. They belong to the under-side by way of condition.

original: vā hitāni orambhāgiyāni. Tenāha “heṭṭhābhāgiyāna”ntiādi. Tīhi maggehīti heṭṭhimehi
analyzed: vā hitāni orambhāgiyāni tena āha tīhi maggehi iti heṭṭhimehi
translated: Or they are beneficial to the under-side, and thus they are under-side-belongings. Therefore it is said: “under-side-belongings” and so on.🔽By the three paths: by the three lower paths.

original: tīhi maggehi. Tehi pahātabbatāya hi nesaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ orambhāgiyatā. Orambhañjiyāni🔽vā orambhāgiyāni vuttāni niruttinayena. Idāni byatirekamukhena nesaṃ orambhāgiyabhāvaṃ
analyzed: tīhi maggehi tehi pahātabba tāya hi nesam saṃyojanānam orambhāgiya tā orambhañjiyāni  vā orambhāgiyāni vuttāni nirutti nayena idāni byatireka mukhena orambhāgiya bhāvam
translated: For it is because they are to be abandoned by these that the fetters are under-side-belongings.🔽Or they are called under-side-belongings because they are under-side-cuttings.🔽Now, in order to show their under-side-belonging by way of excess, it is said: “Therein” and so on.

original: vibhāvetuṃ “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vikkhambhitāni samatthatāvighātena puthujjanānaṃ,
analyzed: vibhāvetum tattha atiādi vuttam vikkhambhitāni samattha tā vighātena puthujjanānam
translated: They are not cut off by the worldlings by way of the destruction of the state of being able to stand alone,

original: samucchinnāni sabbaso abhāvena ariyānaṃ rūpārūpabhavūpapattiyā vibandhāya na hontīti
analyzed: samucchinnāni sabbasas abhāvena ariyānam rūpa arūpa bhava upapattiyā vibandhāya na honti iti
translated: but they are cut off by the Noble Ones by way of non-existence. They are not for the obstruction of rebirth in the fine-material and immaterial existences.🔽Therefore it is said: “They are not cut off, not destroyed.”

original: vuttaṃ “avikkhambhitāni asamucchinnānī”ti. Nibbattavasenāti paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena.
analyzed: vuttam a vikkhambhitāni a samucchinnāni iti nibbatta vasena ati paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena
translated: By way of rebirth: by way of the taking of rebirth-linking.

original: Gantuṃ na denti mahaggatagāmikammāyūhanassa vinibandhanato. Sakkāyadiṭṭhiādīni tīṇi
analyzed: gantum na denti mahaggata gāmi kamma āyūhanassa vinibandhanato sakkāya diṭṭhi ādīni tīṇi
translated: Because they are a hindrance to the accumulation of kamma that would lead to rebirth in a high-stationed realm. The three fetters of personality view, etc.,

original: saṃyojanāni kāmacchandabyāpādā viya mahaggatūpapattiyā avinibandhabhūtānipi kāmabhavūpapattiyā🔽visesapaccayattā tattha mahaggatabhave nibbattampi tannibbattihetukammaparikkhaye
analyzed: saṃyojanāni kāma chanda byāpādāḥ viya mahaggata upapattiyā avinibandha bhūtāni api kāma bhava upapattiyā  visesa paccaya ttā tattha mahaggata bhave nibbattam pi tad nibbatti hetu kamma parikkhaye
translated: are not a hindrance to rebirth in a high-stationed realm as are sensual desire and ill will. But they are🔽a special condition for rebirth in the sensual realm. Therefore, even though one is reborn in a high-stationed realm, when the kamma that caused that rebirth is exhausted,

original: kāmabhavūpapattipaccayatāya mahaggatabhavato ānetvā puna idheva kāmabhave eva nibbattāpenti,🔽tasmā sabbānipi pañcapi saṃyojanāni orambhāgiyāni eva. Paṭisandhivasena anāgamanasabhāvāti
analyzed: kāma bhava upapatti paccaya tāya mahaggata bhavataḥ ānetvā punar idha iva kāma bhave eva nibbattāpenti  tasmā sabbāni api pañca api saṃyojanāni orambhāgiyāni eva paṭisandhi vasena
translated: they act as a condition for rebirth in the sensual realm. Thus they bring one down from the high-stationed realm and cause one to be reborn here in the sensual realm.🔽Therefore all five fetters are called lower fetters.🔽They are called lower fetters because they do not lead to rebirth in that realm by way of rebirth-linking. But this does not preclude the possibility of their leading to rebirth in that realm by way of aspiration.

original: paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena tasmā lokā idha na āgamanasabhāvā. Buddhadassanatheradassanadhammassavanānaṃ
analyzed: paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena tasmā lokāḥ idha na āgamana sabhāvāḥ buddha dassana thera dassana dhammassavanānam
translated: For the purpose of seeing the Buddha, a disciple, or a Dhamma talk, one may go there.

original: panatthāyassa āgamanaṃ anivāritaṃ.🔽Kadāci karahaci uppattiyā saviraḷākāratā pariyuṭṭhānamandatāya abahalatāti dvedhāpi
analyzed: panatthāyassa āgamanam a nivāritam 🔽kadāci karahaci uppattiyā sa viraḷa ākāra tā pariyuṭṭhāna manda tāya a bahala tā ati dvedhā api
translated: They are called lower fetters because they are not prominent,🔽because they are weak, and because they are not numerous.

original: tanubhāvo. Abhiṇhanti bahuso. Bahalabahalāti tibbatibbā. Yattha uppajjanti, taṃ santānaṃ
analyzed: tanu bhāvaḥ abhiṇhanti bahusas bahala bahalāḥ ati tibba tibbāḥ yattha uppajjanti tam santānam
translated: and the state of being weak. They are “repeatedly” because of being many times. “Very much” is very strong. They arise in the continuity where they arise

original: maddantā, pharantā, sādhentā, andhakāraṃ karontā uppajjanti, dvīhi pana maggehi pahīnattā
analyzed: maddantā pharantā sādhentā andhakāram karontā uppajjanti dvīhi pana maggehi pahīna ttā
translated: and they arise making it dark, destroying, breaking, and crushing. But because they are abandoned by the two paths,

original: tanukatanukā mandamandā uppajjanti. “Puttadhītaro hontī”ti idaṃ akāraṇaṃ. Tathā hi
analyzed: tanuka tanukāḥ manda mandāḥ uppajjanti putta dhītaraḥ honti iti idam akāraṇam tathā hi
translated: they arise weak and weak, slight and slight. “They are like sons and daughters” is not a reason. For

original: aṅgapaccaṅgaparāmasanamattenapi te honti. Idanti “rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā”ti idaṃ
analyzed: te honti idam ti rāga dosa mohānam idam
translated: they are so even by the mere clinging to the limbs and secondary limbs. “Here” is this statement: “Because of the weakening of greed, hatred, and delusion.”

original: vacanaṃ. Bhavatanukavasenāti appakabhavavasena. Tanti mahāsivattherassa vacanaṃ paṭikkhittanti
analyzed: vacanam bhava tanuka vasena ati appaka bhava vasena mahāsiva ttherassa vacanam
translated: “By the weakening of becoming” is by the state of little becoming. “Tanti” is the statement of the Elder Maha-Siva. The connection is: “is rejected.”

original: sambandho. Ye bhavā ariyānaṃ labbhanti, te paripuṇṇalakkhaṇabhavā eva. Ye na labbhanti,
analyzed: sambandhaḥ ye bhavāḥ ariyānam labbhanti te paripuṇṇa lakkhaṇa bhavāḥ eva ye na labbhanti
translated: Those kinds of becoming that are available to Noble Ones are only those kinds of becoming that have the complete characteristics. Those that are not available to them,

original: tattha kīdisaṃ taṃ bhavatanukaṃ, tasmā ubhayathāpi bhavatanukassa asambhavo evāti
analyzed: tattha kīdisam tam bhava tanukam tasmai ubhayathā api bhava tanukassa asambhavaḥ eva ati
translated: what kind of weakening of becoming is that? Therefore, in both ways, the impossibility of the weakening of becoming is shown🔽by the words “of a stream-enterer” and so on. In the eighth becoming there is no weakening of becoming. There is only the eighth

original: dassetuṃ “sotāpannassā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhame bhave bhavatanukaṃ natthi aṭṭhamasseva
analyzed: dassetum sotāpannassa ātiādi vuttam aṭṭhame bhave bhava tanukam natthi aṭṭhamassa eva
translated: becoming.

original: bhavassa sabbasseva abhāvato. Sesesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: bhavassa sabbassa iva abhāvataḥ sesesu pi esa iva nayo
translated: because of the non-existence of all becoming. The same method applies in the other cases.

original: Kāmāvacaralokaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ itarassa lokassa vasena tathā vattuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā.
analyzed: kāmāvacara lokam sandhāya vuttam itarassa lokassa vasena tathā vattum a sakkuṇeyya ttā
translated: The words “having come to this world” are said with reference to the sense-desire world, because it is impossible to say so with reference to the other worlds.

original: Yo hi sakadāgāmī devamanussalokesu vomissakavasena nibbattati, sopi kāmabhavavaseneva
analyzed: yaḥ hi sakadāgāmī deva manussa lokesu vomissaka vasena nibbattati saḥ api kāma bhava vasena iva
translated: For the once-returner who is reborn in the divine and human worlds in succession is also to be defined by means of the sense-desire becoming.

original: paricchinditabbo. Bhagavatā ca kāmaloke ṭhatvā “sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: paricchinditabbaḥ bhagavatā ca kāma loke ṭhatvā sakidevaḥ imam lokam āgantvā iti vuttam
translated: And the Exalted One, remaining in the sense-desire world, said: “Having come to this world once only” .

original: “imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā”ti ca iminā pañcasu sakadāgāmīsu cattāro vajjetvā ekova gahito.🔽Ekacco hi idha sakadāgāmiphalaṃ patvā idheva parinibbāyati, ekacco idha patvā devaloke🔽parinibbāyati, ekacco devaloke patvā tattheva parinibbāyati, ekacco devaloke patvā
analyzed: imam lokam āgantvā ati ca iminā pañcasu sakadāgāmīsu cattāraḥ vajjetvā ekaḥ iva gahitaḥ  ekaccaḥ hi idha sakadāgāmi phalam patvā idha iva parinibbāyati ekaccaḥ idha patvā deva loke  parinibbāyati ekaccaḥ deva loke patvā tattha iva parinibbāyati ekaccaḥ deva loke patvā
translated: And by the words “having come to this world” the Exalted One, excluding the four among the five once-returners, included only one.

original: idhūpapajjitvā parinibbāyati, ime cattāro idha na labbhanti. Yo pana idha patvā devaloke
analyzed: idha upapajjitvā parinibbāyati ime cattāraḥ idha na labbhanti yaḥ pana idha patvā deva loke
translated: For one, having attained the fruit of once-returner here, attains Nibbāna here itself; another, having attained it here, attains Nibbāna in the divine world; another, having attained it there, attains Nibbāna there itself; and another, having attained it there, is reborn here and attains Nibbāna here. These four are not included here. But the one who, having attained it here, attains Nibbāna in the divine world,

original: yāvatāyukaṃ vasitvā puna idhūpapajjitvā parinibbāyati, ayaṃ idha adhippeto. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: yāvatāyukam vasitvā punar idhu upapajjitvā parinibbāyati ayam idha adhippetaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: and after living on for the rest of his life, he attains final Nibbāna here. This is what is intended here.

original: pana imaṃ lokanti kāmabhavo adhippetoti imamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “sace hī”tiādinā aññaṃyeva catukkaṃ dassitaṃ.
analyzed: pana imam lokam ti kāma bhavaḥ adhippeto ti imam attham vibhāvetum sace hi iti ādinā aññam yeva catukkam dassitam
translated: But in the commentary, in order to elucidate the meaning of “this world” as referring to the sense-desire world, another tetrad is given, beginning with “If he is a stream-enterer.”

original: Catūsu …pe… sabhāvoti attho apāyagamanīyānaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ sabbaso pahīnattā. Dhammaniyāmenāti
analyzed: catūsu pe sabhāvaḥ ti atthaḥ apāya gamanīyānam pāpa dhammānam sabbaso pahīna ttā dhamma niyāmena ati
translated: In the four paths … his nature is that of one who has completely abandoned the states of vice that lead to the states of deprivation.

original: maggadhammaniyāmena. Niyato uparimaggādhigamassa avassaṃbhāvibhāvato. Tenāha “sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
analyzed: magga dhamma niyāmena niyataḥ upari magga adhigamassa tena āha sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti
translated: By the regularity of dhammas: by the regularity of the path dhammas. He is fixed in the attainment of the higher paths. Therefore it is said, “he is bound for enlightenment.”

original: Dhammādāsadhammapariyāyavaṇṇanā🔽158. Tesaṃ tesaṃ ñāṇagatinti tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ “asuko sotāpanno, asuko sakadāgāmī”tiādinā
analyzed: tesam tesam ñāṇa gatī ti tesam tesam sattānam asukaḥ sotāpannaḥ asukaḥ sakadāgāmī iti ādinā
translated: The exposition of the discourse on the Dhamma for the faithful layman Dhammadinna.🔽The knowledge of the destination of beings: the knowledge of the attainment of this or that of those beings, “This one is a stream-enterer, this one is a once-returner,” etc.

original: taṃtaṃñāṇādhigamanaṃ. Ñāṇūpapattiṃ ñāṇābhisamparāyanti tato parampi “niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo,
analyzed: taṃ taṃ ñāṇa adhigamanam ñāṇūpapattim ñāṇa abhisamparāyanti tatas niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ
translated: The knowledge of rebirth: the knowledge of the future attainment of this or that, “He is fixed in the attainment of enlightenment,

original: sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karissatī”tiādinā ca ñāṇasahitaṃ uppattipaccayabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: sakidevaḥ imam lokam āgantvā dukkhassantam karissati iti ādinā ca ñāṇa sahitam uppatti paccaya bhāvam
translated: and with the knowledge: “He will come into this world only once more and will make an end of suffering” he has the state of being a condition for the arising of the knowledge.

original: Olokentassa ñāṇacakkhunā pekkhantassa kāyakilamathova, na tena kāci veneyyānaṃ atthasiddhīti
analyzed: olokentassa ñāṇa cakkhunā pekkhantassa kāya kilamathā uva na tena kāci veneyyānam attha siddhi iti
translated: When he looks with the eye of knowledge, he has only bodily fatigue, and by that no benefit is accomplished for those who need training.

original: adhippāyo. Cittavihesāti cittakhedo, sā kilesūpasaṃhitattā buddhānaṃ natthi. Ādīyati
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ citta vihesā ati citta khedaḥ sā kilesu upasaṃhita ttā buddhānam na atthi ādīyati
translated: This is the purport. “Mental fatigue”: mental exhaustion. That does not exist in Buddhas because it is associated with defilements.

original: ālokīyati attā etenāti ādāsaṃ, dhammabhūtaṃ ādāsaṃ dhammādāsaṃ, ariyamaggañāṇassetaṃ
analyzed: ālokīyati attā etena ati ādāsam dhamma bhūtam ādāsam dhamma ādāsam ariya magga ñāṇassa etam
translated: “Mirror”: that by which the self is looked at, is seen. The mirror of the Dhamma is the mirror of the Dhamma-element, which is a designation for the knowledge of the noble path.

original: adhivacanaṃ, tena ariyasāvakā catūsu ariyasaccesu viddhastasammohattā attānampi yāthāvato🔽ñatvā yāthāvato byākareyya, tappakāsanato pana dhammapariyāyassa suttassa dhammādāsatā
analyzed: adhivacanam tena ariya sāvakā catūsu ariya saccesu vid hasta sammoha ttā attānam pi yāthāvato  ñatvā yāthāvataḥ byākareyya tad pakāsanataḥ pana dhammapariyāyassa suttassa dhamma adāsa tā
translated: By that the noble disciples, having pierced through the delusion in the four noble truths, having known the self as it really is,🔽would declare the self as it really is. But the mirror of the Dhamma of the discourse is to be understood by the exposition of the self.

original: veditabbā. Yena dhammādāsenāti idha pana maggadhammameva vadati.
analyzed: veditabbā yena dhamma ādāsena ati idha pana magga dhammam eva vadati
translated: “By the mirror of the Dhamma”: here he speaks only of the path-truth.

original: Avecca yāthāvato jānitvā tannimittauppannapasādo aveccapasādo, maggādhigamena uppannapasādo,
analyzed: avecca yāthāvataḥ jānitvā tad nimitta uppanna pasādaḥ avecca pasādaḥ magga adhigamena uppanna pasādaḥ
translated: “Confidence born of seeing”: confidence arisen in regard to that sign, which is born of seeing, of knowing as it really is. The confidence arisen by the attainment of the path,

original: so pana yasmā pāsāṇapabbato viya niccalo, na ca kenaci kāraṇena vigacchati, tasmā
analyzed: saḥ pana yasmā pāsāṇa pabbataḥ viya niccalaḥ na ca kenacid kāraṇena vigacchati tasmā
translated: But it is immovable in the sense that it is as unmoving as a rock and does not depart through any cause.

original: vuttaṃ “acalena accutenā”ti.
analyzed: vuttam acalena accutena ati
translated: Hence it is said: “It is immovable, firm.”

original: “Pañcasīlānī”ti gahaṭṭhavasenetaṃ vuttaṃ tehi ekantapariharaṇīyato. Ariyānaṃ pana sabbāni sīlāni kantāneva. Tenāha “sabbopi panettha saṃvaro labbhatiyevā”ti.
analyzed: pañca sīlāni iti gahaṭṭha vasena itam vuttam tehi ekanta pariharaṇīyataḥ ariyānam pana sabbāni sīlāni kantāni eva tena āha sabbaḥ api pana ittha saṃvaraḥ labbhatiyā eva iti
translated: “The five training precepts”: this is said according to the lay followers, since they are to be observed without exception by them. But all the precepts of the ariyans are dear. Hence it is said: “But here restraint is possible for all.”

original: Sabbesanti sabbesaṃ ariyānaṃ. Sikkhāpadāvirodhenāti yathā bhūtarocanāpatti na hoti, evaṃ. Yuttaṭṭhāneti kātuṃ yuttaṭṭhāne.
analyzed: sabbesam ti sabbesam ariyānam sikkhāpada avirodhena ati yathā bhūtarocanā patti na hoti evam yutta ṭṭhāne iti kātum yutta ṭṭhāne
translated: “All”: for all ariyans. “Not in conflict with the training precepts”: so that there is no offense in the perception of what is true. “In a suitable place”: in a place suitable for practice.

original: Ambapālīgaṇikāvatthuvaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the courtesan Ambapali

original: 161. Tadā kira vesālī iddhā phītā sabbaṅgasampannā ahosi vepullappattā, taṃ sandhāyāha🔽“khandhake vuttanayena vesāliyā sampannabhāvo veditabbo”ti. Tasmiṃ kira bhikkhusaṅghe
analyzed: tadā kira vesālī iddhā phītā sabbaṅga sampannā ahosi vepulla ppattā tam sandhāya āha  khandhake vutta nayena vesāliyā sampanna bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ ti tasmin kira bhikkhu saṅghe
translated: At that time, it seems, Vesali was powerful, prosperous, and successful, having reached the peak of development. Referring to this, the commentator said:

original: pañcasatamattā bhikkhū navā acirapabbajitā ahesuṃ osannavīriyā ca. Tathā hi vakkhati
analyzed: pañca sata mattāḥ bhikkhū navāḥ acirapabbajitāḥ ahesuṃ osanna vīriyā ca tathā hi vakkhati
translated: “The prosperity of Vesali should be understood in the way stated in the Khandhaka.” In that bhikkhu community, it seems, there were five hundred bhikkhus who were newly ordained, and their energy had declined. For it is said:

original: “tattha kira ekacce bhikkhū osannavīriyā”tiādi. Satipaccupaṭṭhānatthanti tesaṃ satipaccupaṭṭhāpanatthaṃ.
analyzed: tattha kira ekacce bhikkhū osanna vīriya ātiādi sati paccupaṭṭhāna attham ti tesam sati paccupaṭṭhāpana attham
translated: “For the establishment of mindfulness”: for the purpose of establishing their mindfulness.

original: Saratīti kāyādike yathāsabhāvato ñāṇasampayuttāya satiyā anussarati upadhāreti. Sampajānātīti
analyzed: sarati iti kāya ādike yathā sabhāvataḥ ñāṇa sampayuttāya satiyā anussarati upadhāreti sampajānāti iti
translated: He remembers: he recollects and bears in mind by means of the mindfulness associated with knowledge in the way in which each of the things, the body, etc., exists. He is fully aware:

original: samaṃ pakārehi jānāti avabujjhati. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthāro pana parato satipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanāyaṃ āgamissati.
analyzed: samam pakārehi jānāti avabujjhati ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ pana paratas sati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanāyam āgamissati
translated: he knows, he penetrates, by means of the full understanding of exhaustion. This is the brief treatment here. The detailed treatment will come later in the description of the foundations of mindfulness .

original: Sabbasaṅgāhakanti sarīragatassa ceva vatthālaṅkāragatassa cāti sabbassa nīlabhāvassa
analyzed: sabba saṅgāhakam ti sarīra gatassa ca iva vattha alaṅkāra gatassa ca ati sabbassa nīla bhāvassa
translated: The term “blue” is the inclusive term for all the blue colour in the blue things belonging to the body and in the blue things belonging to external objects.

original: saṅgāhakaṃ vacanaṃ. Tassevāti nīlāti sabbasaṅgāhakavasena vuttaatthasseva. Vibhāgadassananti🔽pabhedadassanaṃ. Yathā te licchavirājāno apītādivaṇṇā eva keci vilepanavasena pītādivaṇṇā
analyzed: saṅgāhakam vacanam tassa iva āti nīlā ati sabba saṅgāhaka vasena vutta atthassa iva vibhāga dassanam ti  pabheda dassanam yathā te licchavi rājānaḥ a pīta ādi vaṇṇāḥ eva vilepana vasena pīta ādi vaṇṇā
translated: The meaning of the term “blue” is the meaning of the inclusive term. The demonstration of the analysis:🔽the showing of the analysis. Just as some of those Licchavi princes, though not yellow in colour, became yellow by smearing themselves with dye,

original: khāyiṃsu, evaṃ anīlādivaṇṇā eva keci vilepanavasena nīlādivaṇṇā khāyiṃsūti vuttaṃ
analyzed: evam anīla ādi vaṇṇāḥ eva keci vilepana vasena nīla ādi vaṇṇāḥ khāyiṃsu iti vuttam
translated: so some, though not blue in colour, etc., became blue by smearing themselves with dye.

original: “na tesaṃ pakativaṇṇo nīlo”tiādi. Nīlo maṇi etesūti nīlamaṇi, indanīlamahānīlādinīlaratanavinaddhā🔽alaṅkārā. Te kira suvaṇṇaviracite hi maṇiobhāsehi ekanīlā viya khāyanti. Nīlamaṇikhacitāti🔽nīlaratanaparikkhittā. Nīlavatthaparikkhittāti nīlavatthanīlakampalaparikkhepā. Nīlavammikehīti🔽nīlakaghaṭaparikkhittehi. Sabbapadesūti “pītā hontī”tiādisabbapadesu. Parivaṭṭesīti
analyzed: na tesam pakati vaṇṇaḥ nīlaḥ iti ādi nīlaḥ maṇi etesu iti nīla maṇi indanīla mahānīla ādi nīla ratana vinaddhā  alaṅkārā te kira suvaṇṇa viracite hi eka nīlāḥ viya khāyanti nīla maṇi khacita ati  nīla ratana parikkhittā nīlavattha parikkhittā ati nīlavattha nīla kampala parikkhepā nīla vammikehi iti  nīlaka ghaṭa parikkhittehi sabba padesu iti pītāḥ honti iti ādi sabba padesu parivaṭṭesi iti
translated: “Their natural colour is not blue” and so on. They are adorned with ornaments set with blue gems, such as sapphires, lapis lazuli, and so on. They are said to appear as if they were all blue because of the reflections of the gems in the gold. Adorned with blue gems means🔽surrounded by sapphires. Surrounded by blue cloth means surrounded by blue cloth and blue lotuses. In blue mounds means🔽surrounded by blue jars. In all the passages means in all the passages beginning with “They are yellow” . He turned them means🔽🔽

original: paṭighaṭṭesi. Āharanti imasmā rājapurisā balinti āhāro, tappattajanapadoti āha “sāhāranti🔽sajanapada”nti. Aṅguliphoṭopi aṅguliyā cālanavaseneva hotīti vuttaṃ “aṅguliṃ cālesu”nti.🔽Ambakāyāti mātugāmena. Upacāravacanaṃ hetaṃ itthīsu, yadidaṃ “ambakā mātugāmo jananikā”ti.
analyzed: paṭighaṭṭesi āharanti imasmai rāja purisāḥ balinti āhāro tad patta janapado ti āha sa āhāranti 🔽sa janapadam ti aṅguli phoṭaḥ api aṅguliyā cālana vasena iva hoti iti vuttam aṅgulim 🔽ambakāyā iti mātugāmena upacāra vacanam itthīsu yat idam ambakā mātugāmaḥ jananikā ati
translated: “Their natural colour is not blue” and so on. They are adorned with ornaments set with blue gems, such as sapphires, lapis lazuli, and so on. They are said to be “blue” because they appear as if they were all blue with the reflections of the gems set in the golden ground. They are “adorned with blue cloth” because they are surrounded by blue cloth and blue lotuses. They are “surrounded by blue mounds” because they are surrounded by blue heaps. In all the passages beginning “They are yellow” he “turned them” by striking them. “They brought” means that the king’s men brought them. The word “brought” is a past passive participle formed with the verbal root hri . “They brought them” means that they brought the people who had attained . “They snapped their fingers” means that they moved their fingers. “The women” means the womenfolk. This is a term of address used for women, like “womenfolk,” “mothers,” and “nurses.”

original: Avalokethāti apavattitvā olokanaṃ oloketha. Taṃ pana apavattitvā olokanaṃ anu anu🔽dassanaṃ hotīti āha “punappunaṃ passathā”ti. Upanethāti “yathāyaṃ licchavirājaparisā
analyzed: avaloketha ati apavattitvā olokanam oloketha tam pana apavattitvā olokanam anu anu  dassanam hoti iti āha punappunam passatha ati upanetha ati yathā ayam licchavi rāja parisā
translated: “Look” means look without turning away. But that looking without turning away is seeing again and again. Therefore it is said: “See again and again.” “Bring” means: “As this Licchavi assembly

original: sobhātisayena yuttā, evaṃ tāvatiṃsaparisā”ti upanayaṃ karotha. Tenāha “tāvatiṃsehi🔽samake katvā passathā”ti.🔽“Upasaṃharatha bhikkhave licchaviparisaṃ tāvatiṃsasadisa”nti nayidaṃ nimittaggāhe
analyzed: sobha atisayena yuttāḥ evam upanayam karotha tena āha tāvatiṃsehi  samake katvā passatha ati  upasaṃharatha bhikkhave liccha viparisam tāvatiṃsa sadisanti na yidam nimitta ggāhe
translated: “Look” means look without turning away. But that looking without turning away is seeing again and again. Therefore it is said: “Look again and again.” “Compare” means make a comparison thus: “As this assembly of Licchavis is endowed with the excellence of beauty, so is the assembly of the Thirty-three.” Therefore it is said: “Look at them as being equal to the Thirty-three.”

original: niyojanaṃ, kevalaṃ pana dibbasampattisadisā etesaṃ rājūnaṃ issariyasampattīti anupubbikathāya🔽saggasampattikathanaṃ viya daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tesu pana bhikkhūsu ekaccānaṃ tattha nimittaggāhopi
analyzed: niyojanam kevalam pana dibba sampatti sadisā etesam rājūnam issariya sampatti iti anupubbi kathāya  sagga sampatti kathanam viya daṭṭhabbam tesu pana bhikkhūsu ekaccānam tattha nimitta ggāhaḥ api
translated: “Bhikkhus, compare the assembly of Licchavis with the Thirty-three” is not an instruction to grasp a sign. Rather, it should be seen as a gradual discourse, like the description of the excellence of the heavens, in which it is said: “The excellence of sovereignty of these kings is similar to the excellence of the divine life.”🔽But among those bhikkhus, some may have grasped a sign. With reference to them it is said: “He instructs in the grasping of a sign.”

original: siyā, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “nimittaggāhe uyyojetī”ti. Hitakāmatāya tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: siyā tam sandhāya vuttam nimitta ggāhe uyyojeti iti hita kāmatāya tesam bhikkhūnam
translated: With the desire for their welfare,

original: yathā āyasmato nandassa hitakāmatāya saggasampattidassanaṃ. Tenāha “tatra kirā”tiādi.🔽Osannavīriyāti sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ avasannavīriyā, ossaṭṭhavīriyā vāti attho. Aniccalakkhaṇavibhāvanatthanti
analyzed: yathā ā yasmataḥ nandassa hita kāma tāya sagga sampatti dassanam tena āha tatra kirāti ādi  osanna vīriyā ti sammāpaṭipattiyam avasanna vīriyā ossaṭṭha vīriyā vā ti attho anicca lakkhaṇa vibhāvana tham ti
translated: As in the case of the Elder Nanda, who was shown the excellence of the heavenly worlds out of compassion. That is why he said “there” and so on.🔽“Their energy had declined”: their energy had declined in the right way, their energy had been removed, is the meaning.

original: tesaṃ rājūnaṃ vasena bhikkhūnaṃ aniccalakkhaṇavibhūtabhāvatthaṃ.
analyzed: tesam rājūnam vasena bhikkhūnam anicca lakkhaṇa vibhūta bhāvattham
translated: “For the purpose of demonstrating the characteristic of impermanence”: for the purpose of demonstrating to the bhikkhus the characteristic of impermanence by means of those kings.

original: Veḷuvagāmavassūpagamanavaṇṇanā
analyzed: veḷuva gāma vassūpagamana vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Rains Retreat at Veḷuvagāma

original: 163. Samīpe veḷuvagāmoti pubbaṇhaṃ vā sāyanhaṃ vā gantvā nivattanayogye āsannaṭṭhāne niviṭṭhā parivāragāmo. Saṅgammāti sammā gantvā. Assāti bhagavato.
analyzed: samīpe veḷuva gāmo ti pubbaṇham vā sāyanham vā gantvā nivattana yogye āsanna ṭhāne niviṭṭhā parivāra gāmo saṅgamma ati sammā gantvā assa ati bhagavataḥ
translated: “Veḷuvagāma is near”: a surrounding village situated in a place that is suitable for returning to in the morning or in the evening after going there. “Having gone together”: having gone properly. “The Blessed One”: the Blessed One.

original: 164. Pharusoti kakkhaḷo, garutaroti attho. Visabhāgarogoti dhātuvisabhāgatāya samuṭṭhito
analyzed: pharusaḥ ti kakkhaḷaḥ garutaraḥ ti attho visa bhāga rogaḥ ti dhātu visa bhāga tāya samuṭṭhito
translated: “Harsh”: rough, is the meaning. “An illness that was not common”: an illness that arose from an imbalance of the elements,

original: bahalatararogo, na ābādhamattaṃ. Ñāṇena paricchinditvāti vedanānaṃ khaṇikataṃ, dukkhataṃ,
analyzed: bahalatara rogaḥ naḥ ābādha mattam ñāṇena paricchinditvā ati vedanānam khaṇika tam dukkha tam
translated: a very serious illness, not just a slight indisposition. “Having discerned it with his knowledge”: having discerned and investigated the momentary nature of the feelings, their painful nature,

original: attasuññatañca yāthāvato ñāṇena paricchijja parituletvā. Adhivāsesīti tā abhibhavanto
analyzed: atta suñña tat ca yāthāvataḥ ñāṇena paricchijja parituletvā adhivāsesi iti tāḥ abhibhavantaḥ
translated: and their emptiness of self, in accordance with actuality. “Endured it”: having overcome those feelings,

original: yathāparimadditākārasallakkhaṇena attani āropetvā vāsesi, na tāhi abhibhuyyamāno.🔽Tenāha “avihaññamāno”tiādi. Adukkhiyamānoti cetodukkhavasena adukkhiyamāno, kāyadukkhaṃ🔽pana “natthī”ti na sakkā vattuṃ. Asati hi tasmiṃ adhivāsanāya eva asambhavoti. Anāmantetvāti
analyzed: yathā parimaddita ākāra sat lakkhaṇena attani āropetvā vāsesi na tāhi abhibhuyyamānaḥ  tena āha a vihaññamānaḥ tiādi a dukkhiyamānaḥ ti cetaḥ dukkha vasena a dukkhiyamānaḥ kāya dukkham  pana natthi iti na sakkā vattum asati hi tasmin adhivāsanāya eva an āmantetvā ati
translated: and he endured them by superimposing them on himself in the aspect of being rubbed in, not being overwhelmed by them.

original: anālapitvā. Anapaloketvāti avissajjitvā. Tenāha “ovādānusāsaniṃ adatvāti vuttaṃ hotī”ti.🔽Pubbabhāgavīriyenāti phalasamāpattiyā parikammavīriyena. Phalasamāpattivīriyenāti🔽phalasamāpattisampayuttavīriyena. Vikkhambhetvāti vinodetvā. Yathā nāma pupphanasamaye🔽campakādirukkhe vekhe dinne yāva so vekho nāpanīyati, tāvassa pupphanasamatthatā
analyzed: an ālapitvā an apaloketvā ati a vissajjitvā tena āha ovāda anusāsanim a datvā ati vuttam hoti iti  pubbabhāga vīriyena ati phala samāpattiyā parikamma vīriyena phala samāpatti vīriyena ati  phala samāpatti sampayutta vīriyena vikkhambhetvā ati vinodetvā yathā nāma pupphana samaye  campaka ādi rukkhe vekhe dinne yāva saḥ vekhaḥ na apanīyati tāva assa pupphana samattha tā
translated: Hence he said: “without being hurt” , etc. He was not suffering means that he was not suffering in the way that mental pain is suffering. But it cannot be said that he was not suffering in the way that bodily pain is suffering. For if that had been absent, endurance would have been impossible. Without taking leave means without saying goodbye. Without taking leave means without giving up. Hence he said: “without giving up the advice and instruction” .

original: vikkhambhitā vinoditā hoti, evameva yathāvuttavīriyavekhadānena tā vedanā satthu
analyzed: vikkhambhitā vinoditā hoti evam eva yathā vutta vīriya vekhadānena tāḥ vedanāḥ satthu
translated: By the energy of the prior stage means by the energy of the preliminary work for the attainment of fruition. By the energy of the fruition attainment means by the energy associated with the attainment of fruition. He suppressed means he removed. Just as when a creeper is cut down and the stumps are dug up, and then the place is burned with fire, the creeper cannot grow again in that place, so too, the Blessed One, by giving the gift of the energy-creeper in this way, suppressed those feelings, removed them, and by the energy of the prior stage he made them incapable of arising again in the future.

original: sarīre yathāparicchinnaṃ kālaṃ vikkhambhitā vinoditā ahesuṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “vikkhambhetvāti
analyzed: sarīre yathā paricchinnam kālam vikkhambhitāḥ vinoditāḥ ahesum tena vuttam vikkhambhetvā ati
translated: and in the body they were suppressed and removed for as long as was delimited. Hence ‘having suppressed’ is said.

original: vinodetvā”ti. Jīvitampi jīvitasaṅkhāro kammunā saṅkharīyatīti katvā. Chijjamānaṃ🔽virodhipaccayasamāyogena payogasampattiyā ghaṭetvā ṭhapīyati. Adhiṭṭhāyāti adhiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: jīvitam pi jīvita saṅkhāro kammunā saṅkharīyati iti katvā chijjamānam  virodhi paccaya samāyogena payoga sampattiyā ghaṭetvā ṭhapīyati adhiṭṭhāyāti adhiṭṭhānam
translated: Life is called a ‘life formation’ because it is formed by kamma. When it is about to cease

original: katvā. Tenāha “dasamāse mā uppajjitthāti samāpattiṃ samāpajjī”ti. Taṃ pana “adhiṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: katvā tena āha dasa māse mā uppajjittha iti samāpattim samāpajji iti tam pana adhiṭṭhānam
translated: it is kept going by making it coincide with the presence of the conditions that are incompatible with it, by the success of the effort. ‘Having resolved’: having made a resolve. Hence it is said: ‘he attained the attainment of cessation, thinking: “Let it not arise for ten months” ’. But that is called ‘resolution’

original: pavattana”nti ca vattabbataṃ arahatīti vuttaṃ “adhiṭṭhahitvā pavattetvā”ti.
analyzed: pavattananti ca vattabba tam arahati iti vuttam adhiṭṭhahitvā pavattetvā iti
translated: and ‘reversal’ . Hence it is said: ‘having resolved and reversed it’.

original: Khaṇikasamāpattīti tādisaṃ pubbābhisaṅkhāraṃ akatvā ṭhānaso samāpajjitabbasamāpatti.
analyzed: khaṇika samāpatti iti tādisam pubba abhisaṅkhāram a katvā ṭhānasaḥ samāpajjitabba samāpatti
translated: ‘Momentary attainment’: attainment to be attained immediately, without such prior formation as is described.

original: Puna sarīraṃ vedanā ajjhottharati savisesapubbābhisaṅkhārassa akatattā. Rūpasattakaarūpasattakāni
analyzed: puna sarīram vedanā ajjhottharati sa visesa pubba abhisaṅkhārassa a kata ttā rūpa sattaka arūpa sattakāni
translated: Again, feeling invades the body because the prior formation was not made special.

original: visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanāsu vitthāritanayena veditabbāni. Suṭṭhu vikkhambheti pubbābhisaṅkhārassa
analyzed: visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanāsu vitthāri tanayena veditabbāni suṭṭhu vikkhambheti pubba abhisaṅkhārassa
translated: They should be understood in detail in the commentaries on the path of purification.🔽“He suppressed it well” means that he suppressed it with a very powerful prior volition.🔽Now, in order to illustrate that meaning by means of a simile, the following is said:

original: sātisayattā. Idāni tamatthaṃ upamāya vibhāvetuṃ “yathā nāmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Apabyūḷhoti🔽apanīto. Cuddasahākārehi sannetvāti tesaṃyeva rūpasattakaarūpasattakānaṃ vasena cuddasahi
analyzed: idāni tam attham upamāya vibhāvetum yathā nāma atiādi vuttam apabyūḷhaḥ ti  apanītaḥ cuddasahā ākārehi tesam yeva rūpa sattaka arūpa sattakānam vasena
translated: “As though he had pulled out” means that he had pulled out.🔽“Having combined it in fourteen ways” means that the insight consciousness, or the whole of the individual existence, was combined in fourteen ways by means of the seven kinds of materiality and the seven kinds of mentality.

original: pakārehi vipassanācittaṃ, sakalameva vā attabhāvaṃ visabhāgarogasañjanitalūkhabhāvanirogakaraṇāya
analyzed: pakārehi vipassanā cittam sakalam eva vā atta bhāvam visa bhāga roga sañjanita lūkha bhāva niroga karaṇāya
translated: In order to cure the sickness of the body, which was produced by a disease of a different nature,

original: sinehetvā na uppajjiyeva sammāsambuddhena sātisayasamāpattivegena suvikkhambhitattā.🔽Gilāno hutvā puna vuṭṭhitoti pubbe gilāno hutvā puna tato gilānabhāvato vuṭṭhito.
analyzed: sinehetvā na uppajjiya iva sammāsambuddhena sa atisaya samāpatti vegena su vikkhambhita ttā  gilānaḥ hutvā puna vuṭṭhitaḥ ti pubbe gilānaḥ hutvā puna tatas gilāna bhāvataḥ vuṭṭhitaḥ
translated: it did not arise again because it had been well suppressed by the force of the very powerful attainment of the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽“Having been sick, he recovered” means that he had been sick before, and then he recovered from that sick state.

original: Madhurakabhāvo nāma sarīrassa thambhitattaṃ, taṃ pana garubhāvapubbakanti āha “sañjātagarubhāvo
analyzed: madhuraka bhāvaḥ nāma sarīrassa thambhi tattam tam pana garu bhāva pubbakan ti āha sañjāta garu bhāvaḥ
translated: The state of stiffness is the rigidity of the body. But that is preceded by heaviness. Therefore it is said: “Having produced a state of heaviness”

original: sañjātathaddhabhāvo”ti. “Nānākārato na upaṭṭhahantī”ti iminā disāsammohopi me ahosi
analyzed: sañjāta thaddha bhāvaḥ ti nānā ākārataḥ na upaṭṭhahanti iti iminā disā sammohaḥ api me ahosi
translated: “They do not appear in their various aspects” shows that he had also lost his bearings.🔽“By the force of sorrow” shows that he was overwhelmed by sorrow.

original: sokabalenāti dasseti. Satipaṭṭhānādidhammāti kāyānupassanādayo anupassanādhammā pubbe
analyzed: soka balena ati dasseti sati paṭṭhāna ādi dhammā ti kāya anupassanā ādayaḥ anupassanā dhammā pubbe
translated: “The ideas of the Arousings of Mindfulness, etc.”: the ideas of contemplation, namely, contemplation of the body, etc.,

original: vibhūtā hutvā upaṭṭhahantāpi idāni mayhaṃ pākaṭā na honti.
analyzed: vibhūtāḥ hutvā upaṭṭhahantā api idāni mayham pākaṭāḥ na honti
translated: which had appeared to him before when they were developed, do not now appear to him.

original: 165. Abbhantaraṃ karoti nāma attaniyeva ṭhapanato. Puggalaṃ abbhantaraṃ karoti nāma🔽samānattatāvasena dhammena pubbe tassa saṅgaṇhato. Daharakāleti attano daharakāle.🔽Kassaci akathetvāti kassaci attano antevāsikassa upanigūhabhūtaṃ ganthaṃ akathetvā.
analyzed: abbhantaram karoti nāma attaniyā iva ṭhapanataḥ puggalam abbhantaram karoti nāma  samānatta tā vasena dhammena pubbe tassa saṅgaṇhataḥ dahara kāle iti attanaḥ dahara kāle  kassaci a kathetvā ati kassaci attanaḥ antevāsikassa upanigūha bhūtam gantham a kathetvā
translated: “He makes it his own” : he establishes it in himself. “He makes the person his own” : he makes the person his own by inclusion in the idea of his own identity.🔽“In his youth” : in his own youth.🔽“Without having taught it to anyone” : without having taught the text that was his own secret to any pupil of his.

original: Muṭṭhiṃ katvāti muṭṭhigataṃ viya rahasibhūtaṃ katvā. Yasmiṃ vā naṭṭhe sabbo taṃmūlako
analyzed: muṭṭhim katvā iti muṭṭhi gatam viya rahasi bhūtam katvā yasmin vā naṭṭhe sabbaḥ taṃmūlako
translated: “He makes a fist of it” : he makes it his own secret as if it were in his fist.🔽Or alternatively, the idea that is the root of all the rest is the fist, since the whole of the Dhamma is lost when that is lost.

original: dhammo vinassati, so ādito mūlabhūto dhammo, mussati vinassati dhammo etena naṭṭhenāti
analyzed: dhammo vinassati saḥ āditas mūla bhūtaḥ dhammaḥ mussati vinassati dhammaḥ etena naṭṭhena ati
translated: The Dhamma is lost, is destroyed, when that is lost.

original: muṭṭhi, taṃ tathārūpaṃ muṭṭhiṃ katvā pariharitvā ṭhapitaṃ kiñci natthīti dasseti.🔽Ahamevāti avadhāraṇaṃ bhikkhusaṅghapariharaṇassa aññasādhāraṇicchādassanatthaṃ, avadhāraṇena
analyzed: tam tathārūpam muṭṭhim katvā pariharitvā ṭhapitam kiñci natthi iti dasseti  aham eva ati avadhāraṇam bhikkhu saṅgha pariharaṇassa añña sādhāraṇa icchā dassana ttham avadhāraṇena
translated: He shows that there is nothing of that kind, a fist, made and kept.🔽“I alone” is a restrictive term. It shows that the keeping of the Community of Bhikkhus is not shared with others.

original: pana vinā “ahaṃ bhikkhusaṅgha”ntiādi bhikkhusaṅghapariharaṇe ahaṃkāramamaṃkārābhāvadassananti
analyzed: pana vinā aham bhikkhu saṅgha nti ādi bhikkhu saṅgha pariharaṇe ahaṃkāra mamaṃkāra abhāva dassananti
translated: But without the restrictive term, “I the Community of Bhikkhus” and so on, it shows that there is no I-making and Mine-making in the keeping of the Community of Bhikkhus.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Uddisitabbaṭṭhenāti “satthā”ti uddisitabbaṭṭhena. Mā vā ahesuṃ bhikkhūti🔽adhippāyo. “Mā vā ahosī”ti vā pāṭho. Evaṃ na hotīti “ahaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pariharissāmī”tiādi
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam uddisitabba ṭṭhena ati satthā ati uddisitabba ṭṭhena mā vā ahesum bhikkhū ti  adhippāyaḥ mā vā ahosi iti vā pāṭhaḥ evam na hoti iti aham bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi itiādi
translated: “To be called” : in the sense of being called “Master.” “There were no bhikkhus” : this is the intention.

original: ākārena cittappavatti na hoti. “Pacchimavayaanuppattabhāvadīpanatthaṃ vutta”nti iminā
analyzed: ākārena citta ppavatti na hoti pacchima vaya anuppatta bhāva dīpana tham vuttan ti iminā
translated: Or the reading is “mā vā ahosī” . “It is not so” : the occurrence of consciousness in the mode “I shall keep the Community of Bhikkhus” and so on is not.

original: vayo viya buddhakiccampi pariyositakammanti dīpeti. Sakaṭassa bāhappadese daḷhībhāvāya
analyzed: vayaḥ viya buddha kiccam pi pariyosita kammanti dīpeti sakaṭassa bāha ppadese daḷhībhāvāya
translated: By this he shows that the Buddha’s task is finished, like the life .

original: veṭhadānaṃ bāhabandho. Cakkanemisandhīnaṃ daḷhībhāvāya veṭhadānaṃ cakkabandho.
analyzed: veṭha dānam bāha bandho cakka nemi sandhīnam daḷhībhāvāya veṭha dānam cakka bandho
translated: The binding of the axle is the binding of the axle to the pole in order to make it firm. The binding of the wheel is the binding of the axle to the spokes in order to make it firm.

original: Tamatthanti veṭhamissakena maññeti vuttamatthaṃ. Rūpādayo eva dhammā saviggaho viya
analyzed: tam attham ti veṭha missakena maññā iti vuttam attham rūpa ādayaḥ eva dhammā sa viggahaḥ viya
translated: The meaning of what was said is this: “He conceives the meaning of the words ‘with the sign of materiality’ as ‘with the sign of materiality mixed with the sign of the immaterial,’ and so on.

original: upaṭṭhānato rūpanimittādayo, tesaṃ rūpanimittādīnaṃ. Lokiyānaṃ vedanānanti yāsaṃ
analyzed: upaṭṭhānataḥ rūpa nimitta ādayo tesam rūpa nimitta ādīnam lokiyānam
translated: The materiality, etc., themselves are dhammas. The sign of materiality, etc., are dhammas.

original: nirodhanena phalasamāpatti samāpajjitabbā, tāsaṃ nirodhā phāsu hoti, tathā bāḷhavedanābhitunnasarīrassāpi.
analyzed: nirodhanena phala samāpatti samāpajjitabbā tāsam nirodhā phāsu hoti tathā bāḷha vedanā abhitunna sarīrassa api
translated: The mundane feelings are those that are to be entered upon and dwelt in by the attainment of cessation. The cessation of those feelings is comfortable, as is also the cessation of the feelings of one whose body is being racked by a violent illness.

original: Tadatthāyāti phalasamāpattivihāratthāya. Dvīhi bhāgehi āpo gato etthāti dīpo, oghena🔽parigato hutvā anajjhotthaṭo bhūmibhāgo, idha pana catūhipi oghehi, saṃsāramahogheneva
analyzed: tad atthāya ati phala samāpatti vihāra atthāya dvīhi bhāgehi āpaḥ gataḥ ettha ati dīpaḥ oghena  parigataḥ hutvā an ajjhotthaṭaḥ bhūmi bhāgaḥ idha pana oghehi saṃsāra mahā oghena iva
translated: For the sake of that: for the sake of the abiding in the attainment of fruition.🔽An island: an area of land surrounded by water on all sides, not subject to inundation by rivers.🔽Here, however, the self is intended as “an island” in the sense that it is not subject to inundation by the four floods or by the great flood of the round of rebirths.

original: vā anajjhotthaṭo attā “dīpo”ti adhippeto. Tenāha “mahāsamuddagatā”tiādi. Attassaraṇāti
analyzed: vā an ajjhotthaṭaḥ attā dīpo ti adhippeto tena āha mahā samudda gata ati ādi
translated: Thus it is said: “Like an island in the ocean” , and so on.🔽A refuge for oneself: a protection for oneself.

original: attappaṭisaraṇā. Attagatikā vāti attaparāyaṇāva. Mā aññagatikāti aññaṃ kiñci gatiṃ
analyzed: atta paṭisaraṇā atta gatikā vā ati atta parāyaṇā ava mā añña gatikā ati aññam kiñci gatim
translated: Having one’s own self as its support: having only one’s own self as its support.

original: paṭisaraṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ mā cintayittha. Kasmā? Attā nāmettha paramatthato dhammo abbhantaraṭṭhena,
analyzed: paṭisaraṇam parāyaṇam mā cintayittha kasmai attā nāma ittha paramatthataḥ dhammaḥ abbhantaraṭṭhena
translated: and refuge and resort. Why? Because the self here in the ultimate sense is a state of one’s own inner being.

original: so evaṃ sampādito tumhākaṃ dīpaṃ tāṇaṃ gati parāyaṇanti. Tena vuttaṃ “dhammadīpā”tiādi.
analyzed: saḥ evam sampāditaḥ tumhākam dīpam tāṇam gati parāyaṇam ti tena vuttam dhamma dīpa ati ādi
translated: When it is developed in this way, it is an island, a refuge, a resort, and a support for you. Hence ‘with the self as an island’ and so on.

original: Tathā cāha “attā hi attano nātho, ko hi nātho paro siyā”ti upadesamattameva hi parasmiṃ
analyzed: tathā ca āha attā hi attanaḥ kaḥ hi nātho paraḥ siyāt iti upadesam attam eva hi parasmin
translated: And he said: ‘The self is the refuge of the self; who else could the refuge be? ’ For the teaching is dependent on another,

original: paṭibaddhaṃ, aññā sabbā sampatti purisassa attādhīnā eva. Tenāha bhagavā “tumhehi
analyzed: paṭibaddham aññā sabbā sampatti purisassa atta adhīnā eva tena āha bhagavā tumhehi
translated: but all success is dependent on oneself. Hence the Blessed One said: ‘The task is yours, bhikkhus, the Teacher has only pointed it out. The Exhorters are only those who remind you. ’

original: kiccaṃ ātappaṃ, akkhātāro tathāgatā”ti. Tamaggeti tamayogassa agge tassa atikkantābhāvato.
analyzed: kiccam ātappam akkhātāro tathāgatā ti tam agge iti tam ayogassa agge tassa atikkanta abhāvato
translated: ‘The foremost of those who have overcome the darkness’ : he is foremost of those who have overcome the darkness because he has gone beyond darkness.

original: Tenevāha “ime aggatamā”tiādi. Mamāti mama sāsane. Sabbepi te catusatipaṭṭhānagocarā
analyzed: tena iva āha ime mama ati mama sāsane sabbe pi te catusati paṭṭhāna gocarā
translated: Hence it is said: ‘The foremost of those who have gone to the foremost state’ and so on. ‘In my Dispensation’ : in my Dispensation.🔽All of them have the four foundations of mindfulness as their domain.

original: vāti catubbidhaṃ satipaṭṭhānaṃ bhāvetvā brūhetvā tadeva gocaraṃ attano pavattiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: vāti catubbidham sati paṭṭhānam bhāvetvā brūhetvā tat eva gocaram attano pavatti ṭṭhānam
translated: Having developed and made much of the fourfold foundation of mindfulness,

original: katvā ṭhitā eva bhikkhū agge bhavissanti.🔽Dutiyabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: katvā ṭhitāḥ eva bhikkhū agge bhavissanti 🔽dutiya bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: having made that their domain, their ground for being, the bhikkhus will be foremost.

original: Nimittobhāsakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nimitta ubhāsa kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the section on the appearance of the sign

original: 166. Anekavāraṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati, tasmā imaṃ vesālippavesanaṃ niyametvā
analyzed: aneka vāram bhagavā vesāliyam viharati tasmai imam vesāli ppa vesanam niyametvā
translated: . The Blessed One stayed at Vesālī on many occasions, so in order to specify this particular visit to Vesālī

original: dassetuṃ “kadā pāvisī”ti pucchitvā āgamanato paṭṭhāya taṃ dassento “bhagavā kirā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: dassetum kadā pāvisi iti pucchitvā āgamanataḥ paṭṭhāya tam dassentaḥ bhagavā kirāti ādim āha
translated: and to show it, he said, “It is said that the Blessed One” and so on.🔽By the way he came by: by the same way he had come earlier as far as the Veḷuvana.

original: Āgatamaggenevāti pubbe yāva veḷuvagāmakā āgatamaggeneva paṭinivattento. Yathāparicchedenāti
analyzed: āgata maggena iva ati pubbe yāva veḷuva gāmakāḥ āgata maggena iva paṭinivattento yathā paricchedena ati
translated: By the time he had determined: by the time he had decided.🔽From that: from the attainment of fruition.🔽The way he came by: the way he is now going to be described.

original: yathāparicchinnakālena. Tatoti phalasamāpattito. Ayanti idāni vuccamānākāro. Divāṭṭhānolokanādi
analyzed: yathā a paricchinna kālena tatas iti phala samāpattitaḥ ayanti idāni vuccamāna ākāraḥ divāṭṭhāna ālokana ādi
translated: The looking out over the world in the daytime, etc.,🔽is shown in order to demonstrate the certainty of his final Nibbāna.

original: parinibbānassa ekantikabhāvadassanaṃ. Ossaṭṭhoti vissaṭṭho āyusaṅkhāro “sattāhameva mayā jīvitabba”nti.
analyzed: parinibbānassa ekantika bhāva dassanam ossaṭṭhaḥ ti vissaṭṭhaḥ āyu saṅkhāro satta aham eva mayā jīvitabbanti
translated: His life span was extended: his life-formation was extended. “I must live for seven days” means that he extended his life span for seven days.

original: Jeṭṭhakaniṭṭhabhātikānanti sabbeva sabrahmacārino sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: jeṭṭha kaniṭṭha bhātikānam ti sabbe eva sabrahmacārino sandhāya vadati
translated: His brothers and sisters: he says this referring to all his fellow monks.🔽I will guide: I will instruct in the practice of the path.

original: Paṭipādessāmīti maggapaṭipattiyā niyojessāmi. Maṇiphalaketi maṇikhacite pamukhe atthataphalake.
analyzed: paṭipādessāmi iti magga paṭipattiyā niyojessāmi maṇi phalake iti maṇi khacite pamukhe atthata phalake
translated: On a slab of stone: on a slab of stone that was polished and set up.

original: Taṃ paṭhamaṃ dassananti yaṃ veḷuvane paribbājakarūpena āgatassa siddhaṃ dassanaṃ,
analyzed: tam paṭhamam dassanam ti yam veḷuvane paribbājaka rūpena āgatassa siddham dassanam
translated: The first seeing: the seeing that was accomplished for him when he came in the guise of an ascetic in the Veḷuvana,

original: taṃ paṭhamadassanaṃ. Yaṃ vā anomadassissa bhagavato vacanaṃ saddahantena tadā abhinīhārakāle🔽paccakkhato viya tumhākaṃ dassanaṃ siddhaṃ, taṃ paṭhamadassanaṃ. Paccāgamanacārikanti
analyzed: tam paṭhama dassanam yam vā anomadassissa bhagavataḥ vacanam saddahantena tadā abhinīhāra kāle  paccakkhataḥ viya tumhākam dassanam siddham tam paṭhama dassanam paccāgamana cārikam ti
translated: or the seeing that was accomplished for him at the time of his aspiration when he had faith in the Blessed One’s words,

original: paccāgamanatthaṃ cārikaṃ.
analyzed: paccāgamana attham cārikam
translated: as if he had seen it with his own eyes. The journey back: the journey back for the purpose of seeing the Buddha.

original: Sattāhanti accantasaṃyoge upayogavacanaṃ. Therassa jātovarakagehaṃ kira itaragehato🔽vivekaṭṭhaṃ, vivaṭaṅgaṇañca, tasmā devabrahmānaṃ upasaṅkamanayogyanti “jātovarakaṃ
analyzed: sattāhan ti accanta saṃyoge upayoga vacanam therassa jāta uvaraka geham kira itara gehataḥ  tasmai devabrahmānam jāta uvarakam
translated: Seven days: the word “day” is used in the sense of a period of time. It seems that the elder’s hut was separate from the other huts,

original: paṭijaggathā”ti vuttaṃ. Soti uparevato. Taṃ pavattinti tattha vasitukāmatāya vuttaṃ taṃ.
analyzed: paṭijaggatha iti vuttam saḥ ti uparevataḥ tam pavattinti tattha vasitu kāma tāya vuttam tam
translated: and had an open courtyard, so it was suitable for the gods and brahmas to approach. Therefore it was said: “Take care of the hut.” He: the elder. That: the statement made there out of a desire to live there.

original: “Jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchantī”ti iminā nīhārena thero “ke tumhe”ti pucchi. “Tvaṃ
analyzed: jānantā api tathāgatā pucchanti iti iminā nīhārena thero ke tumhe iti pucchi tvam
translated: “Even though they know, the Tathāgatas ask,” by this method the elder asked: “Who are you?” “We are gods.”

original: catūhi mahārājehi mahantataro”ti puṭṭho attano mahattaṃ satthu upari pakkhipanto
analyzed: catūhi mahārājehi mahantataraḥ ti puṭṭhaḥ attanaḥ mahattam satthu upari pakkhipanto
translated: and the four great kings are greater than the four great kings.”

original: “ārāmikasadisā ete upāsike amhākaṃ satthuno”ti āha. Sāvakasampattikittanampi hi atthato
analyzed: ārāmika sadisāḥ ete upāsike amhākam satthunā iti āha sāvaka sampatti kittanam pi hi atthataḥ
translated: And he said, “These lay followers are like the monastery attendants of our Teacher.” For the praise of the excellence of the disciple

original: satthu sampattiṃyeva vibhāveti.
analyzed: satthu sampattiṃyā iva vibhāveti
translated: in fact reveals the excellence of the Teacher.

original: Sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhāyāti therassa desanānubhāvena, attano ca upanissayasampattiyā ñāṇassa paripakkattā sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhahitvā.
analyzed: sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhāya ati therassa desanā anubhāvena attano ca upanissaya sampattiyā ñāṇassa paripakka ttā sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhahitvā
translated: “Was established in the fruit of stream-entry”: by the power of the elder’s teaching and by the maturity of his own faculties, he was established in the fruit of stream-entry.

original: Ayanti yathāvuttā. Etthāti “vesāliṃ piṇḍāya pāvisī”ti etasmiṃ vesālīpavese. Anupubbīkathāti anupubbadīpanī kathā.
analyzed: ayanti yathā vuttāḥ ettha ati vesālim piṇḍāya pāvisi iti etasmin vesālī pavese anupubbīkathā ati anupubba dīpanī kathā
translated: “This”: as described above. “Here”: in the entry into Vesālī, in the words “entered Vesālī for alms.” “A gradual talk”: a talk that teaches gradually.

original: 167. Udenayakkhassa cetiyaṭṭhāneti udenassa nāma yakkhassa āyatanabhāvena iṭṭhakāhi
analyzed: udena yakkhassa cetiya ṭṭhāne ti udenassa nāma yakkhassa āyatana bhāvena
translated: “The shrine of the yakkha Udena”: a shrine built of bricks, which was a place of worship for a yakkha named Udena.

original: cite mahājanassa cittīkataṭṭhāne. Katavihāroti bhagavantaṃ uddissa katavihāro. Vuccatīti
analyzed: cite mahājanassa cittīkata ṭṭhāne kata vihāraḥ ti bhagavantam uddissa kata vihāraḥ vuccati iti
translated: “A monastery”: a monastery built for the Blessed One. “Is called”:

original: purimavohārena “udenacetiya”nti vuccati. Gotamakādīsupīti “gotamakacetiya”nti evaṃ
analyzed: purima vohārena udenacetiyanti vuccati gotamaka ādīsu pi iti gotamaka cetiyanti evam
translated: It is called “the Udena Shrine” by the former name. “Gotamaka, etc.”: in the same way, “the Gotamaka Shrine,” etc.

original: ādīsupi. Eseva nayoti cetiyaṭṭhāne katavihārabhāvaṃ atidisati. Vaḍḍhitāti bhāvanāpāripūrivasena
analyzed: ādīsupi esā iva cetiya ṭṭhāne kata vihāra bhāvam atidisati vaḍḍhitā ati bhāvanā pāripūri vasena
translated: The same method: he shows that the monastery is made in the shrine’s place.🔽Developed: perfected by development.

original: paribrūhitā. Punappunaṃ katāti bhāvanāya bahulīkaraṇena aparāparaṃ pavattitā. Yuttayānaṃ
analyzed: paribrūhitā punappunam katā ati bhāvanāya bahulīkaraṇena apara aparam yutta yānam
translated: Repeatedly made: made again and again by the repetition of development.

original: viya katāti yathā yuttaṃ ājaññayānaṃ chekena sārathinā adhiṭṭhitaṃ yathāruci pavattati,
analyzed: viya katā ati yathā yuttam ājaññayānam chekena sārathinā adhiṭṭhitam yathāruci pavattati
translated: Made like a well-yoked vehicle: just as a well-yoked thoroughbred vehicle is directed by the charioteer and proceeds as he wishes,🔽so it is made to proceed as he wishes.

original: evaṃ yathārucipavattirahataṃ gamitā. Patiṭṭhānaṭṭhenāti adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhena. Vatthu🔽viya katāti sabbaso upakkilesavisodhanena iddhivisayatāya pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato suvisodhitaparissayavatthu
analyzed: evam yathāruci pavatti rahatam gamitā patiṭṭhāna ṭhena ati adhiṭṭhāna ṭhena vatthu  viya katā ati sabbaso upakkilesa visodhanena iddhi visaya tāya pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvato su visodhita parissaya vatthu
translated: By the meaning of establishment: by the meaning of determination.🔽Made like a basis: made like a basis for the occurrence of the supernormal powers by the complete purification of the defilements.

original: viya katā. Adhiṭṭhitāti paṭipakkhadūrībhāvato subhāvitabhāvena taṃtaṃadhiṭṭhānayogyatāya
analyzed: viya katā adhiṭṭhitā ati paṭipakkha dūrībhāvato su bhāvita bhāvena taṃ taṃ adhiṭṭhāna yogyatāya
translated: Determined: by the state of being fit for the various determinations through the state of being well developed by the removal of the opposite qualities.

original: ṭhapitā. Samantato citāti sabbabhāgena bhāvanupacayaṃ gamitā. Tenāha “suvaḍḍhitā”ti.
analyzed: ṭhapitā samantataḥ citā ati sabba bhāgena bhāva anupacayam gamitā tena āha su vaḍḍhitā iti
translated: “Established” means “made to last.” “Well developed” means “made to grow in all ways.”

original: Suṭṭhu samāraddhāti iddhibhāvanāya sikhāppattiyā sammadeva saṃsevitā.
analyzed: suṭṭhu samāraddhā ati iddhi bhāvanāya sikhā appattiyā sammad eva saṃsevitā
translated: “Well undertaken” means “well practiced for the attainment of the jhānas and the supernormal powers.”

original: Aniyamenāti “yassa kassacī”ti aniyamavacanena. Niyametvāti “tathāgatassā”ti sarūpadassanena🔽niyametvā. Āyuppamāṇanti paramāyuppamāṇaṃ vadati, tasseva gahaṇe kāraṇaṃ brahmajālasuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ🔽vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Mahāsivatthero pana “mahābodhisattānaṃ carimabhave paṭisandhidāyino
analyzed: aniyamena ati yassa kassaci iti aniyama vacanena niyametvā ati tathāgatassa ati sarūpa dassanena  niyametvā āyu pamāṇam ti parama āyu pamāṇam vadati tassa iva gahaṇe kāraṇam brahmajāla sutta vaṇṇanāyam  vutta nayena iva veditabbam mahāsiva theraḥ pana mahā bodhisattānam carima bhave paṭisandhi dāyinaḥ
translated: “Without distinction” means “without making any distinction” by the words “of anyone at all.”🔽“Having made a distinction” means “having made a distinction” by the words “of the Tathāgata.”🔽“The measure of life” means the measure of the highest life span. The reason for mentioning it should be understood in the way stated in the commentary on the Brahmajāla Sutta.

original: kammassa asaṅkhyeyyāyukatāsaṃvattanasamatthataṃ hadaye ṭhapetvā buddhānaṃ āyusaṅkhārassa
analyzed: kammassa asaṅkhyeyya āyuka tā saṃvattana samattha tam hadaye ṭhapetvā buddhānam āyu saṅkhārassa
translated: But the Elder Maha Siva said: “The highest life span of the great Bodhisattas in their last existence, who are destined to be reborn in the Tusita heaven, is immeasurable.

original: parissayavikkhambhanasamatthatā pāḷiyaṃ āgatā evāti imaṃ bhaddakappameva tiṭṭheyyā”ti
analyzed: parissaya vikkhambhana samattha tā pāḷiyam āgatā eva ati imam bhadda kappam eva tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: But the ability of the Buddhas to extend the life span is mentioned in the texts. Therefore this good statement should be accepted.”

original: avoca. “Khaṇḍiccādīhi abhibhuyyatī”ti etena yathā iddhibalena jarāya na paṭighāto,
analyzed: avoca khaṇḍicca ādīhi abhibhuyyati iti etena yathā iddhi balena jarāya na paṭighātaḥ
translated: “It is overcome by the breaking up of the components, etc.” shows that the Buddha is not subject to old age by the power of the supernormal powers.

original: evaṃ tena maraṇassapi na paṭighātoti atthato āpannamevāti. “Kva saro khitto, kva
analyzed: evam tena maraṇassa api na paṭighāto ti atthataḥ āpannam evā ati kva saraḥ khitto kva
translated: The Elder’s reply, “Where was the arrow shot? Where did it fall?” is not correct.

original: ca nipatito”ti aññathā vuṭṭhitenāpi theravādena aṭṭhakathāvacanameva samatthitanti
analyzed: ca nipatito ti aññathā vuṭṭhitena api thera vādena aṭṭhakathā vacanam eva samatthitan ti
translated: The statement in the commentary should be taken as correct.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenāha “so na ruccati…pe… niyamita”nti.
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tena āha saḥ na ruccatipe niyamitanti
translated: That is why it is said, “That does not satisfy me … I will confine myself to the suttas.”

original: Pariyuṭṭhitacittoti yathā kiñci atthānatthaṃ sallakkhetuṃ na sakkā, evaṃ abhibhūtacitto.
analyzed: pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ ti yathā kiñci attha anattham sallakkhetum na sakkā evam abhibhūta cittaḥ
translated: His mind was obsessed: his mind was so overwhelmed that he was unable to consider what was good or bad.

original: So pana abhibhavo mahatā udakoghena appakassa udakassa ajjhottharaṇaṃ viya ahosīti
analyzed: saḥ pana abhibhavaḥ mahatā udaka oghena appakassa udakassa ajjhottharaṇam viya ahosi iti
translated: But this obsession was like the submergence of a little water by a great mass of water.🔽That is why it is said, “His mind was submerged.”

original: vuttaṃ “ajjhotthaṭacitto”ti. Aññopīti therato, ariyehi vā aññopi yo koci puthujjano.
analyzed: vuttam ajjhotthaṭa citto ti aññaḥ api iti therataḥ ariyehi vā aññaḥ api yaḥ koci puthujjano
translated: Another: anyone else, whether a senior or junior bhikkhu or a worldling other than the elder.

original: Puthujjanaggahaṇañcettha yathā sabbena sabbaṃ appahīnavipallāso mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto
analyzed: puthujjana ggahaṇam ca ittha yathā sabbena sabbam appahīna vipallāsaḥ mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ
translated: The inclusion of the worldling is stated in order to show that one whose mind is obsessed by Mara, who has not abandoned the perversions in all aspects, is unable to consider what is good or bad.

original: kiñci atthaṃ sallakkhetuṃ na sakkoti, evaṃ thero bhagavatā kataṃ nimittobhāsaṃ sabbaso
analyzed: kiñci attham sallakkhetum na sakkoti evam theraḥ bhagavatā katam nimitta ubhāsam sabbaso
translated: The elder, however, had been made by the Blessed One to see the sign in all aspects.

original: na sallakkhesīti dassanatthaṃ. Tenāha “māro hī”tiādi. Cattāro vipallāsāti asubhe
analyzed: na sallakkhesi iti dassana attham tena āha māraḥ hi itiādi cattāraḥ asubhe
translated: ‘He did not look at it’ means ‘for the purpose of seeing it.’ Therefore he says: ‘Because Mara …’ ‘The four perversions’ means: in the unpleasant

original: “subha”nti saññāvipallāso, cittavipallāso, dukkhe “sukha”nti saññāvipallāso, cittavipallāsoti
analyzed: subhanti saññā vipallāsaḥ citta vipallāsaḥ dukkhe sukhanti saññā vipallāsaḥ citta vipallāso ti
translated: ‘He did not take cognizance of him’: for the purpose of seeing him. Hence he said, ‘For Mara, you know’ , and so on. ‘The four perversions’: the perversion of perception and the perversion of cognizance in the sense of ‘beautiful’ in regard to the ugly, and the perversion of perception and the perversion of cognizance in the sense of ‘pleasant’ in regard to what is painful.

original: ime cattāro vipallāsā. Tenāti yadipi itare aṭṭha vipallāsā pahīnā, tathāpi yathāvuttānaṃ
analyzed: ime cattāraḥ vipallāsā tena ati yadi pi itare aṭṭha vipallāsā pahīnā tathā api yathāvuttānam
translated: These are the four perversions. ‘For that reason’: although the other eight perversions are abandoned, still,🔽because of the unabandonedness of the four perversions stated thus,

original: catunnaṃ vipallāsānaṃ appahīnabhāvena. Assāti therassa. Maddatīti phusanamattena
analyzed: catunnam vipallāsānam appahīna bhāvena assa ati therassa maddati iti phusana mattena
translated: ‘For that reason’. ‘Assa’: of the Elder. ‘He maddened’: he was as if maddened by mere contact;

original: maddanto viya hoti, aññathā tena maddite sattānaṃ maraṇameva siyā. Kiṃ sakkhissati,
analyzed: mad dantaḥ viya hoti aññathā tena maddite sattānam maraṇam eva siyā kim sakkhissati
translated: otherwise death would have been the only outcome for beings maddened by him. ‘What can he do? ‘,

original: na sakkhissatīti adhippāyo. Kasmā na sakkhissati, nanu esa aggasāvakassa kucchiṃ
analyzed: na sakkhissati iti adhippāyaḥ kasmā na sakkhissati nanu esa aggasāvakassa kucchiṃ
translated: is the intention. Why can he not do anything? Has he not entered into the belly of the foremost disciple?

original: paviṭṭhoti? Saccaṃ paviṭṭho, tañca kho attano ānubhāvadassanatthaṃ, na vibādhanādhippāyena.
analyzed: paviṭṭhaḥ ti saccam paviṭṭhaḥ tat ca kho attanaḥ ānubhāva dassana attham na vibādhana adhippāyena
translated: Though he has entered, it was for the purpose of showing his own power, not with the intention of causing affliction.

original: Vibādhanādhippāyena pana idha “kiṃ sakkhissatī”ti vuttaṃ hadayamaddanassa adhigatattā.
analyzed: vibādhana adhippāyena pana idha kim sakkhissati iti vuttam hadaya maddanassa adhigata ttā
translated: But here ‘What can he do? ‘ is said with the intention of causing affliction because of the Elder’s having attained heart-maddening.

original: Nimittobhāsanti ettha “tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappa”nti sakalakappaṃ avaṭṭhānayācanāya
analyzed: ettha tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappanti sakala kappam avaṭṭhāna yācanāya
translated: “Sign-appearance” is the begging of the whole aeon by the request “Let the Blessed One remain, O Blessed One, let the Happy One remain for an aeon, for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the sake of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and men” .🔽

original: “yassa kassaci ānanda cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā”tiādinā aññāpadesena attano caturiddhipādabhāvanānubhāvena
analyzed: yassa kassaci ānanda cattāro iddhipādāḥ bhāvitā ati ādinā añña apadesena attano catur iddhipāda bhāvanā anubhāvena
translated: “Sign and illumination”: the sign is the arousing of the perception of the ability to remain for an eon by the Blessed One through the power of his own development of the four bases of success, as indicated by the words, “If anyone has developed the four bases of success in higher consciousness, he can remain for an eon or until the end of an eon” .

original: kappaṃ avaṭṭhānasamatthatāvasena saññuppādanaṃ nimittaṃ, tathā pana pariyāyaṃ muñcitvā🔽ujukaṃyeva attano adhippāyavibhāvanaṃ obhāso. Jānantoyeva vāti mārena pariyuṭṭhitabhāvaṃ
analyzed: kappam avaṭṭhāna samattha tā vasena saññā uppādanam nimittam tathā pana pariyāyam muñcitvā  ujukam yā iva attanaḥ adhippāya vibhāvanam obhāsaḥ jānantaḥ yā iva vāti mārena pariyuṭṭhita bhāvam
translated: The illumination is the clear expression of his own intention after he has relinquished the indirect way of speaking.🔽“Though he knew”: though he knew that his mind was seized by Māra.

original: jānanto eva. Attano aparādhahetuto sattānaṃ soko tanuko hoti, na balavāti āha “dosāropanena🔽sokatanukaraṇattha”nti. Kiṃ pana thero mārena pariyuṭṭhitacittakāle pavattiṃ pacchā
analyzed: jānantaḥ eva attanaḥ aparādha hetutaḥ sattānam sokaḥ tanukaḥ hoti na balavā ati āha dosa āropanena  soka tanu karaṇa ttham ti kim pana theraḥ mārena pariyuṭṭhita citta kāle pavattim pacchā
translated: “In order to lessen the grief of beings through his own fault”: the grief of beings would be great if the Elder were to die through the seizure of his mind by Māra. But if he were to die through his own fault, their grief would be slight.

original: jānātīti? Na jānāti sabhāvena, buddhānubhāvena pana anujānāti.🔽Mārayācanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: jānāti iti na jānāti sabhāvena buddha anubhāvena pana anujānāti 🔽māra yācana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: “But how did the Elder know what was happening after his mind was seized by Māra?” He did not know it by his own power. But he knew it through the Buddha’s power, for the Buddha allowed him to know it.

original: 168. Anatthe niyojento guṇamāraṇena māreti, virāgavibandhanena vā jātinimittatāya
analyzed: anatthe niyojentaḥ guṇa māraṇena māreti virāga vibandhanena vā jāti nimitta tāya
translated: He kills by killing off the special qualities of those who are engaged in what is unprofitable, or by obstructing their dispassion.

original: tattha tattha jātaṃ jātaṃ mārento viya hotīti “māretīti māro”ti vuttaṃ. Ativiya pāpatāya
analyzed: tattha tattha jātam jātam mārentaḥ viya hoti iti māreti iti māroti vuttam ati viya pāpa tāya
translated: And he is as if he were killing what is born here and there, since what is born here and there is killed off. Thus it is said that he kills, thus he is Māra.🔽He is wicked by reason of his extreme wickedness.

original: pāpimā. Kaṇhadhammehi samannāgato kaṇho. Virāgādiguṇānaṃ antakaraṇato antako. Sattānaṃ
analyzed: pāpimā kaṇha dhammehi samannāgataḥ kaṇhaḥ virāga ādi guṇānaṃ anta karaṇataḥ antakaḥ sattānam
translated: He is black by reason of his black states. He is the Ender by ending the special qualities of dispassion, etc.🔽He is Namuci because he does not let go of the practice that brings beings to no good.

original: anatthāvahapaṭipattiṃ na muccatīti namuci. Attano mārapāsena pamatte bandhati, pamattā🔽vā bandhū etassāti pamattabandhu. Sattamasattāhato paraṃ satta ahāni sandhāyāha “aṭṭhame
analyzed: anattha āvaha paṭipattim na muccati iti namuci attanaḥ māra pāsena pamatte bandhati pamattā  vā bandhū etassa ati pamatta bandhu sattama sattāhato param satta ahāni sandhāya āha aṭṭhame
translated: He is the Friend of the Careless because he binds the careless with his own snares of sensual desires, or because the careless are bound to him.

original: sattāhe”ti na pana pallaṅkasattāhādi viya niyatakiccassa aṭṭhamasattāhassa nāma labbhanato.🔽Sattamasattāhassa hi parato ajapālanigrodhamūle mahābrahmuno, sakkassa ca devarañño
analyzed: sattāha iti na pana pallaṅka sattāha ādi viya niyata kiccassa aṭṭhama sattāhassa nāma labbhanato  sattama sattāhassa hi paratas ajapāla nigrodha mūle mahābrahmunaḥ sakkassa ca deva rañño
translated: He is the One of Seven Days because he is so for seven days after the seventh week. He said “in the eighth week” referring to the seven days after the seventh week, not because there is an eighth week of seven days with a definite function like the first week of sitting cross-legged, etc.

original: paṭiññātadhammadesanaṃ bhagavantaṃ ñatvā “idāni satte dhammadesanāya mama visayaṃ
analyzed: paṭiññāta dhamma desanam bhagavantam ñatvā idāni satte dhamma desanāya mama visayam
translated: For after the seventh week, the Blessed One was aware that the teaching of the True Idea had been promised him by Great Brahma and Sakka Ruler of Gods at the foot of the Ajapāla banyan tree, and that it was now time to teach the True Idea.

original: atikkamāpessatī”ti sañjātadomanasso hutvā ṭhito cintesi “handa dānāhaṃ naṃ upāyena
analyzed: atikkamāpessati iti sañjāta domanassaḥ hutvā ṭhitaḥ cintesi handa dāna aham naṃ upāyena
translated: and will pass away beyond the realm of Death.” And he stood there with a sorrowful heart, thinking, “Now I will bring about his passing away by some means or other.

original: parinibbāpessāmi, evamassa manoratho aññathattaṃ gamissati, mama ca manoratho ijjhissatī”ti.🔽Evaṃ pana cintetvā bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃ antaṃ ṭhito “parinibbātu dāni bhante
analyzed: parinibbāpessāmi evam assa manorathaḥ aññathattam gamissati mama ca manorathaḥ ijjhissati iti  evam pana cintetvā bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā ekam antam ṭhitaḥ parinibbātu dāni bhante
translated: Thus his wish will be frustrated and my wish fulfilled.”

original: bhagavā”tiādinā parinibbānaṃ yāci, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “aṭṭhame sattāhe”tiādi. Tattha
analyzed: bhagavā iti ādinā parinibbānam yāci tam sandhāya vuttam aṭṭhame sattāhe itiādi tattha
translated: Having thought thus, he approached the Exalted One, stood at one side, and requested his passing away with the words, “Let the Exalted One now attain final Nibbana, let the Well-Farer now attain final Nibbana.”101 This is referred to in the stanza by the words “In the eighth week.”

original: ajjāti āyusaṅkhārossajjanadivasaṃ sandhāyāha. Bhagavā cassa abhisandhiṃ jānantopi
analyzed: ajjā iti āyu saṅkhāra ussajjana divasam sandhāya āha bhagavā abhisandhim jānantaḥ api
translated: Herein, “today” refers to the day on which the Exalted One relinquished the life-continuum. Although the Exalted One knew his intention,

original: taṃ anāvikatvā parinibbānassa akālabhāvameva pakāsento yācanaṃ paṭikkhipi. Tenāha “na tāvāha”ntiādi.
analyzed: tam anāvikatvā parinibbānassa akāla bhāvam eva pakāsentaḥ yācanam paṭikkhipi tena āha na tau aham itiādi
translated: he did not reveal it but rather declared the untimeliness of his passing away. Thus he refused the request. Therefore it is said, “Not yet.”
