original: Maggavasena viyattāti saccasampaṭivedhaveyyattiyena byattā. Tatheva vinītāti maggavasena
analyzed: magga vasena viyattā ati sacca sampaṭivedha veyyattiyena byattā tathā iva vinītā ati magga vasena
translated: “Ready through the path”: ready through the urgency of the penetration of the truths. “Just so disciplined”: disciplined through the path.

original: kilesānaṃ samucchedavinayanena vinītā. Tathā visāradāti ariyamaggādhigameneva satthusāsane🔽vesārajjappattiyā visāradā, sārajjakarānaṃ diṭṭhivicikicchādipāpadhammānaṃ vigamena
analyzed: kilesānam samuccheda vinayanena vinītā tathā visāra dāti ariya magga adhigamena iva satthu sāsane  vesārajja ppattiyā visāradā sārajja karānam diṭṭhi vicikicchā ādi pāpa dhammānam vigamena
translated: And they are trained in the sense of having destroyed and eliminated defilements.🔽And they are confident in the sense of having attained the noble path and of having become confident in the Teacher’s Dispensation by attaining fearlessness. The meaning is that they have become confident by being rid of evil states such as views and uncertainty that cause fear.

original: visāradabhāvaṃ pattāti attho. Yassa sutassa vasena vaṭṭadukkhato nissaraṇaṃ sambhavati,
analyzed: visārada bhāvam pattā ti attho yassa sutassa vasena vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaraṇam sambhavati
translated: The “learning” intended here is that by means of which escape from the suffering of the round of rebirths becomes possible.

original: taṃ idha ukkaṭṭhaniddesena “suta”nti adhippetanti āha “tepiṭakavasenā”ti. Tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: tam idha ukkaṭṭha niddesena sutanti adhippetanti āha tepiṭaka vasena ati tiṇṇam
translated: He said “by means of the three Piṭakas” because the three Piṭakas are what is intended as “learning” in the sense of what should be heard.

original: piṭakānaṃ samūho tepiṭakaṃ, tīṇi vā piṭakāni tipiṭakaṃ, tipiṭakameva tepiṭakaṃ, tassa
analyzed: piṭakānam samūhaḥ tepiṭakam tīṇi vā piṭakāni ti piṭakam ti piṭakam eva tepiṭakam tassa
translated: The three Piṭakas are a collection of the three Piṭakas, or the three Piṭakas are the three Piṭakas, and it is by means of that that they are confident.

original: vasena. Tamevāti yaṃ taṃ tepiṭakaṃ sotabbabhāvena “suta”nti vuttaṃ, tameva. Dhammanti🔽pariyattidhammaṃ. Dhārentīti suvaṇṇabhājane pakkhittasīhavasaṃ viya avinassantaṃ
analyzed: vasena tam eva āti yam tam tepiṭakam sotabba bhāvena sutan ti vuttam tam eva dhammam ti  pariyatti dhammam dhārenti iti suvaṇṇa bhājane pakkhitta sīha vasam viya a vinassantam
translated: The “Dhamma” is the Dhamma as text.

original: katvā suppaguṇasuppavattibhāvena dhārenti hadaye ṭhapenti. Iti pariyattidhammavasena
analyzed: katvā suppa guṇa suppavatti bhāvena dhārenti hadaye ṭhapenti iti pariyatti dhamma vasena
translated: They bear it in mind: they bear it in mind by keeping it in the heart without letting it be lost, as one does a drop of sesame oil on a leaf of lotus, by making it well learned and well remembered. Thus they are confident by means of the Dhamma as text.

original: bahussutadhammadharabhāvaṃ dassetvā idāni paṭivedhadhammavasenapi taṃ dassetuṃ “atha
analyzed: bahussuta dhammadhara bhāvam dassetvā idāni paṭivedha dhamma vasena api tam dassetum atha
translated: Having shown the state of being learned and a bearer of the Dhamma, he now says “Or else” in order to show it by way of the Dhamma of penetration.

original: vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Ariyadhammassāti maggaphaladhammassa, navavidhassāpi vā lokuttaradhammassa.🔽Anudhammabhūtanti adhigamāya anurūpadhammabhūtaṃ. Anucchavikapaṭipadanti ca tameva🔽vipassanādhammamāha, chabbidhā visuddhiyo vā. Anudhammanti tassā yathāvuttapaṭipadāya
analyzed: vā tiādi vuttam ariya dhammassa āti magga phala dhammassa navavidhassa api vā lokuttara dhammassa  anudhamma bhūtanti adhigamāya anurūpa dhamma bhūtam ca tam eva  vipassanā dhammam āha chabbidhāḥ visuddhiyaḥ vā tassāḥ yathā vutta paṭipadāya
translated: The ariyan Dhamma: the Dhamma of the path and the fruit, or the supramundane Dhamma of the ninefold.🔽The Dhamma that is in conformity with that: the Dhamma that is in conformity with the attainment. The practice that is suitable: he says that very insight Dhamma, or the six kinds of purification.🔽The Dhamma that is in conformity with that: the Dhamma of fewness of wishes, etc., which is well penetrated in conformity with the practice stated in the way just described.

original: anurūpaṃ abhisallekhitaṃ appicchatādidhammaṃ. Caraṇasīlāti samādāya pavattanasīlā.
analyzed: anurūpam abhisallekhitam appiccha tā ādi dhammam caraṇa sīlā ati samādāya pavattana sīlā
translated: The practice of virtue: the virtue that occurs by undertaking.🔽Or else, the Dhamma that is in conformity with the path and the fruit is the practice of virtue.

original: Anu maggaphaladhammo etissāti vā anudhammā, vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā, tassā caraṇasīlā.🔽Attano ācariyavādanti attano ācariyassa sammāsambuddhassa vādaṃ. Sadevakassa lokassa
analyzed: anu magga phala dhammaḥ etissa ati vā anudhammā vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā tassā caraṇa sīlā  attanaḥ ācariya vādanti attanaḥ ācariyassa sammāsambuddhassa vādam sa devakassa lokassa
translated: The practice of virtue is the insight that leads to emergence.🔽The doctrine of his own teacher: the doctrine of his own teacher, the Fully Enlightened One.🔽The Blessed One is a teacher because he teaches the training in good behaviour to the world with its gods.

original: ācārasikkhāpanena ācariyo, bhagavā. Tassa vādo, catusaccadesanā.
analyzed: ācāra sikkhāpanena ācariyaḥ bhagavā tassa vādo catu sacca desanā
translated: His doctrine is the teaching of the Four Noble Truths.

original: Ācikkhissantīti ādito kathessanti, attanā uggahitaniyāmena pare uggaṇhāpessantīti🔽attho. Desessantīti vācessanti, pāḷiṃ sammā pabodhessantīti attho. Paññāpessantīti🔽pajānāpessanti, saṅkāpessantīti attho. Paṭṭhapessantīti pakārehi ṭhapessanti, pakāsessantīti
analyzed: ācikkhissanti iti āditas kathessanti attanā uggahita niyāmena pare uggaṇhāpessanti iti  attho desessanti iti vācessanti pāḷim sammā pabodhessanti iti attho paññāpessanti iti  pajānāpessanti saṅkāpessanti iti attho paṭṭhapessanti iti pakārehi ṭhapessanti pakāsessanti iti
translated: They will expound: they will expound from the beginning, they will cause others to learn by the method of learning they themselves have acquired.🔽The meaning is that they will teach: they will cause to be recited, they will cause the text to be properly learned. The meaning is that they will make known:

original: attho. Vivarissantīti vivaṭaṃ karissanti. Vibhajissantīti vibhattaṃ karissanti. Uttāniṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ vivarissanti iti vivaṭam karissanti vibhajissanti iti vibhattam karissanti uttānim
translated: they will cause to be known, the meaning is that they will make clear. They will expound: they will expound by means of the factors of skill in the aggregates, etc. The meaning is that they will make clear. They will reveal: they will make manifest. They will analyse: they will make the meaning clear by means of the analysis of the aggregates, etc. The meaning is that they will make clear. They will expound: they will expound by means of the factors of skill in the aggregates, etc. The meaning is that they will make clear. They will reveal: they will make manifest. They will analyse: they will make the meaning clear by means of the analysis of the aggregates, etc.

original: karissantīti anuttānaṃ gambhīraṃ uttānaṃ pākaṭaṃ karissanti. Saha dhammenāti ettha
analyzed: karissanti iti anuttānam gambhīram uttānam pākaṭam karissanti saha dhammena ati ettha
translated: They will make plain: they will make the obscure clear.🔽In the phrase “with the Dhamma as it really is” ,

original: dhamma-saddo kāraṇapariyāyo “hetumhi ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā”tiādīsu viyāti āha
analyzed: dhamma saddaḥ kāraṇa pariyāyaḥ hetumhi ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā ti ādīsu viya āha
translated: the word “Dhamma” is a term for a reason, as in the passages: “Knowledge of the reason is the discrimination of the Dhamma” .🔽Therefore the commentator says: “with a statement that has a reason and a cause.”

original: “sahetukena sakāraṇena vacanenā”ti. Sappāṭihāriyanti sanissaraṇaṃ, yathā paravādaṃ
analyzed: sa hetukena sa kāraṇena vacanena ati sa pāṭihāriyanti sa nissaraṇam yathā paravādam
translated: With a demonstration: with an escape, in such a way that after refuting the doctrine of another, one’s own doctrine is established.

original: bhañjitvā sakavādo patiṭṭhahati, evaṃ hetudāharaṇehi yathādhigatamatthaṃ sampādetvā
analyzed: bhañjitvā saka vādaḥ patiṭṭhahati evam hetu udāharaṇehi yathā adhigatam attham sampādetvā
translated: Having established the meaning one has understood by means of reasons and examples,

original: dhammaṃ kathessanti. Tenāha “niyyānikaṃ katvā dhammaṃ desessantī”ti, navavidhaṃ lokuttaradhammaṃ
analyzed: dhammam kathessanti tena āha niyyānikam katvā dhammam desessanti iti navavidham lokuttara dhammaṃ
translated: They will teach the Dhamma leading to Nibbana. The meaning is that they will teach the ninefold supramundane Dhamma.

original: pabodhessantīti attho. Ettha ca “paññāpessantī”tiādīhi chahi padehi cha atthapadāni
analyzed: pabodhessanti iti atthaḥ ettha ca paññāpessanti itiādīhi chahi padehi cha attha padāni
translated: And here the six terms beginning with “they will announce” show the six kinds of meaning,

original: dassitāni, ādito pana dvīhi padehi cha byañjanapadāni. Ettāvatā tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: dassitāni āditaḥ pana dvīhi padehi cha byañjana padāni ettāvatā tepiṭakam buddha vacanam
translated: but the first two terms show the six kinds of phrasing. So far the Buddha’s word consisting of the three Piṭakas

original: saṃvaṇṇanānayena saṅgahetvā dassitaṃ hoti. Vuttañhetaṃ nettiyaṃ “dvādasapadāni suttaṃ,
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanā nayena saṅgahetvā dassitam hoti vuttam ha etam nettiyam dvādasa padāni suttam
translated: has been shown to be collected by way of the method of exposition. For this is said in the Netti: “A sutta has twelve terms,

original: taṃ sabbaṃ byañjanañca attho cā”ti.
analyzed: tam sabbam byañjanam ca atthaḥ ca ati
translated: all of which are phrasing and meaning.”

original: Sikkhattayasaṅgahitanti adhisīlasikkhādisikkhattayasaṅgahaṇaṃ. Sakalaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyanti
analyzed: sikkhattaya saṅgahitanti adhi sīla sikkhā ādi sikkhattaya saṅgahaṇam sakalam sāsana brahmacariyam ti
translated: “Comprehended by the three trainings”: included in the three trainings, namely, in higher virtue, etc.🔽“The whole of the spiritual life in the Dispensation”: the whole of the noble life which is the Master’s Dispensation.

original: anavasesaṃ satthusāsanabhūtaṃ seṭṭhacariyaṃ. Samiddhanti sammadeva vaḍḍhitaṃ. Jhānassādavasenāti
analyzed: anavasesam satthu sāsana bhūtam seṭṭha cariyam samiddhanti sammat eva vaḍḍhitam jhāna ssāda vasena ati
translated: “Flourished”: grew in a manner that was complete.

original: tehi tehi bhikkhūhi samadhigatajhānasukhavasena. Vuddhippattanti uḷārapaṇītabhāvagamanena
analyzed: tehi tehi bhikkhūhi samadhigata jhāna sukha vasena vuddhi ppattanti uḷāra paṇīta bhāva gamanena
translated: “By the taste of jhana”: by the taste of the bliss of jhana attained by this or that bhikkhu.

original: sabbaso parivuddhiṃ upagataṃ. Sabbapāliphullaṃ viya abhiññāsampattivasena abhiññāsampadāhi
analyzed: sabbasas parivuddhim upagatam sabba pāliphullam viya abhiññā sampatti vasena
translated: It is like a tree in full flower with the attainment of direct-knowledge.

original: sāsanābhivuddhiyā matthakappattito. Patiṭṭhitavasenāti patiṭṭhānavasena, patiṭṭhappattiyāti
analyzed: sāsana abhivuddhiyāḥ matthaka ppattito patiṭṭhita vasena ati patiṭṭhāna vasena patiṭṭha ppattiyā ati
translated: The meaning is: by the state of being established.

original: attho. Paṭivedhavasena bahuno janassa hitanti bāhujaññaṃ. Tenāha “bahujanābhisamayavasenā”ti.
analyzed: attho paṭivedha vasena bahunaḥ janassa hitanti bāhujaññam tena āha bahu jana abhisamaya vasena ati
translated: The meaning of “for the welfare of many people” is “for the welfare of many people” .

original: Puthu puthulaṃ bhūtaṃ jātaṃ, puthu vā puthuttaṃ bhūtaṃ pattanti puthubhūtaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: puthu puthulam bhūtam jātam puthu vā puthuttam bhūtam pattanti puthubhūtam tena āha
translated: It has become extensive in the sense of being spread out, or it has attained the state of being extensive.

original: “sabbākāra…pe… patta”nti. Suṭṭhu pakāsitanti suṭṭhu sammadeva ādikalyāṇādibhāvena paveditaṃ.
analyzed: sabba ākāra pe suṭṭhu pakāsitanti suṭṭhu sammadeva ādi kalyāṇa ādi bhāvena paveditam
translated: It has been well revealed in every aspect, etc.,

original: Āyusaṅkhāraossajjanavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āyu saṅkhāra ossajjana vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Renunciation of Life

original: 169. Satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvāti ayaṃ kāyādivibhāgo attabhāvasaññito dukkhabhāro mayā
analyzed: satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā iti ayam kāya ādi vibhāgaḥ atta bhāva saññitaḥ dukkha bhāraḥ mayā
translated: Having established mindfulness well: this analysis of the body, etc., which is called “self”

original: ettakaṃ kālaṃ vahito, idāni pana na vahitabbo, etassa avahanatthaṃ cirataraṃ kālaṃ
analyzed: ettakam kālam vahitaḥ idāni pana na vahitabbaḥ etassa a vahana attham cirataram kālam
translated: has been carried by me for so long as a burden of suffering. Now it is not to be carried any more. For the purpose of not carrying it any more, for a longer time than that

original: ariyamaggasambhāro sambhato, svāyaṃ ariyamaggo paṭividdho, yato ime kāyādayo asubhādito
analyzed: ariya magga sambhāraḥ sambhataḥ svāyam ariya maggaḥ paṭividdhaḥ yatas ime kāya ādayaḥ asubha āditaḥ
translated: The equipment for the Noble Path has been gathered, and now this Noble Path has been penetrated. Since these things beginning with the body have been fully understood in accordance with reality as foul, etc.,

original: sammadeva pariññātā, catubbidhampi sammāsatiṃ yathātathaṃ visaye suṭṭhu upaṭṭhitaṃ
analyzed: sammat eva pariññātā catubbidham pi sammāsatim yathātatham visaye suṭṭhu upaṭṭhitam
translated: and since the fourfold right mindfulness has been well established in the object in accordance with reality,🔽having discerned with knowledge.

original: katvā. Ñāṇena paricchinditvāti yasmā imassa attabhāvasaññitassa dukkhabhārassa vahane
analyzed: katvā ñāṇena paricchinditvā ati yasmai imassa atta bhāva saññitassa dukkha bhārassa vahane
translated: The purpose of bearing this burden called the individual self has been fulfilled,

original: payojanabhūtaṃ attahitaṃ tāva mahābodhimūle eva parisamāpitaṃ, parahitaṃ pana buddhaveneyyavinayanaṃ
analyzed: payojana bhūtam atta hitam tāva mahā bodhi mūle eva parisamāpitam para hitam pana buddha veneyya vinayanam
translated: and the benefit of others, the taming of those disciples of the Buddha who are to be tamed,

original: parisamāpitabbaṃ, taṃ idāni māsattayeneva parisamāpanaṃ pāpuṇissati, tasmā abhāsi
analyzed: parisamāpitabbam tat idāni māsa ttayena iva parisamāpanam pāpuṇissati tasmai abhāsi
translated: will be fulfilled in three months’ time. Therefore he said,🔽“I will attain final Nibbāna on the full-moon day of the month of Visākha.”

original: “visākhapuṇṇamāyaṃ parinibbāyissāmī”ti, evaṃ buddhañāṇena paricchinditvā sabbabhāgena
analyzed: visākhapuṇṇamāyam parinibbāyissāmi iti evam buddha ñāṇena paricchinditvā sabba bhāgena
translated: Having thus discerned with the knowledge of a Buddha, having made his decision with all his heart,

original: nicchayaṃ katvā. Āyusaṅkhāraṃ vissajjīti āyuno jīvitassa abhisaṅkhārakaṃ phalasamāpattidhammaṃ
analyzed: nicchayam katvā āyu saṅkhāram vissajji iti āyunaḥ jīvitassa abhisaṅkhārakam phala samāpatti dhammaṃ
translated: he relinquished the life-process on which his life depended.

original: “na samāpajjissāmī”ti vissajji taṃvissajjaneneva tena abhisaṅkhariyamānaṃ jīvitasaṅkhāraṃ
analyzed: na samāpajjissāmi iti vissajji tad vissajjanena iva tena abhisaṅkhariyamānam jīvita saṅkhāram
translated: “I shall not attain it,” he released it. By that releasing he released the life-formation that was being formed.

original: “nappavattessāmī”ti vissajji. Tenāha “tatthā”tiādi. Ṭhānamahantatāyapi pavattiākāramahantatāyapi🔽mahanto pathavīkampo. Tattha ṭhānamahantatāya bhūmicālassa mahattaṃ dassetuṃ “tadā
analyzed: na ppavattessāmi iti tena āha tattha atiādi ṭhāna mahanta tāya api pavatti ākāra mahanta tāya api  mahantaḥ pathavī kampo tattha ṭhāna mahanta tāya bhūmicālassa mahattam dassetum tadā
translated: “I shall not cause it to occur,” he released it. Hence he said: “Therein, etc. ” The great earthquake was great both in extent and in the mode of its occurrence.

original: kira…pe… kampitthā”ti vuttaṃ. Sā pana jātikkhettabhūtā dasasahassī lokadhātu eva,
analyzed: kirape kampittha iti vuttam sā pana jāti khetta bhūtā dasasahassī lokadhātu eva
translated: In order to show the greatness of the earthquake in extent, it was said: “At that time, etc. ” But the extent was the ten-thousandfold world-element, which is the field of the birth of a Buddha,

original: na yā kāci, yā mahābhinīhāramahājātiādīsupi kampittha. Tadāpi tattikāya eva kampane
analyzed: na yā kāci yā mahā abhinīhāra mahā jāti ādīsu pi tadā api eva kampane
translated: and not any other, which was not shaken even by the great resolve, the great birth, etc.

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ? Jātikkhettabhāvena tasseva ādito pariggahassa katattā. Pariggahakaraṇaṃ
analyzed: kim kāraṇam jāti khetta bhāvena tassa iva āditas pariggahassa kata ttā pariggaha karaṇam
translated: Why was it shaken only to that extent? Because that extent was the first to be taken as the field of birth.🔽And the taking of the field of birth should be understood as a natural attribute of the Buddha.

original: cassa dhammatāvasena veditabbaṃ. Tathā hi purimabuddhānampi tāvatakameva jātikkhettaṃ
analyzed: cassa dhamma tā vasena veditabbam tathā hi purima buddhānam pi tāvatakam eva jāti kkhettam
translated: For the field of birth of the former Buddhas was just that extent.

original: ahosi. Tathā hi vuttaṃ “dasasahassī lokadhātū, nissaddā honti nirākulā…pe… mahāsamuddo
analyzed: ahosi tathā hi vuttam dasa sahassī lokadhātū nissaddāḥ honti nirākulāpe mahā samuddo
translated: For it is said: “The ten-thousandfold world element becomes silent and still … The great ocean,

original: ābhujati, dasasahassī pakampatī”ti ca ādi. Udakapariyantaṃ katvā chappakārapavedhanena
analyzed: ābhujati dasa sahassī pakampati iti ca ādi udaka pariyantam katvā cha pakāra pavedhanena
translated: Having made the water the limit, it shakes the earth with its seven underworlds and its seven golden surfaces and its seven oceans.

original: avītarāge bhiṃsetīti bhiṃsano, so eva bhiṃsanakoti āha “bhayajanako”ti. Devabheriyoti
analyzed: a vīta rāge bhiṃsā iti iti bhiṃsanaḥ saḥ eva āha bhaya janakā uti
translated: It terrifies those who have not yet overcome sense desire: thus it is terrifying. That itself is the frightening, he says, “causing fear.”

original: devadundubhisaddassa pariyāyavacanamattaṃ. Na cettha kāci bherī “devadundubhī”ti
analyzed: deva dundubhi saddassa pariyāya vacana mattam na ca ittha kāci bherī deva dundubhī iti
translated: The divine drum: this is a mere synonym for the sound of the divine drum. But here no drum is intended as the divine drum,

original: adhippetā, atha kho uppātabhāvena labbhamāno ākāsagato nigghosasaddo. Tenāha “devo”tiādi.
analyzed: adhippetāḥ atha kho uppāta bhāvena labbhamānaḥ ākāsa gataḥ nigghosa saddaḥ tena āha deva iti ādi
translated: rather, it is the sound in the sky that occurs by way of the shaking. Therefore he said “the divine” and so on.

original: Devoti megho. Tassa hi acchabhāvena ākāsassa vassābhāvena sukkhagajjitasaññite sadde
analyzed: devo ti megho tassa hi accha bhāvena ākāsassa vassa abhāvena sukkha gajjita saññite sadde
translated: The divine: the cloud. For when the sound occurs by way of the brightness of that cloud and the sky’s lack of rain, which is thought of as a dry rumble,

original: niccharante devadundubhisamaññā. Tenāha “devo sukkhagajjitaṃ gajjī”ti.
analyzed: deva dundubhi samaññā tena āha devaḥ sukkha gajjitam gajjīti
translated: it is called the divine drum. Therefore he said “the divine rumbles dryly.”

original: Pītivegavissaṭṭhanti “evaṃ cirataraṃ kālaṃ vahito ayaṃ attabhāvasaññito dukkhabhāro,
analyzed: pīti vega vissaṭṭhanti evam cirataram kālam vahitaḥ ayam atta bhāva saññitaḥ dukkha bhāro
translated: The rapture-keenness: the Blessed One, having generated the thought “This burden of suffering, known as the self, has been borne for a long time,

original: idāni na cirasseva nikkhipissatī”ti sañjātasomanasso bhagavā sabhāveneva pītivegavissaṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: idāni na cirassa iva nikkhipissati iti sañjāta somanassaḥ bhagavā sabhāvena iva pīti vega vissaṭṭham
translated: now it will be laid down before long,” was delighted by nature, and so he was keen with rapture.

original: udānaṃ udānesi. Evaṃ pana udānentena ayampi attho sādhito hotīti dassanatthaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: udānam udānesi evam pana udānentena ayam pi atthaḥ sādhitaḥ hoti iti dassana ttham aṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: and he uttered this exalted utterance. But in order to show that the meaning is also accomplished by his uttering it thus, in the commentary

original: “kasmā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kasmā itiādi vuttam
translated: it is said, “Why? ”

original: Tulīyatīti tulanti tula-saddo kammasādhanoti dassetuṃ “tulita”nti vuttaṃ. Appānubhāvatāya
analyzed: tulīyati iti tulanti tula saddo kamma sādhano ti dassetum tulitam ti vuttam appa anubhāva tāya
translated: The word tula is a verbal noun formed from the verb tulati . In order to show that it is a verbal noun formed from the verb tulati , it is said, “tulite” . It is limited because it has little power.

original: paricchinnaṃ. Tathā hi taṃ parito khaṇḍitabhāvena “paritta”nti vuccati. Paṭipakkhavikkhambhanato
analyzed: paricchinnam tathā hi tam paritas khaṇḍita bhāvena parittanti vuccati paṭipakkha vikkhambhanato
translated: For it is called “limited” because it is broken up all round. It is not limited because it is not limited by the opposite quality of being extensive,

original: dīghasantānatāya, vipulaphalatāya ca na tulaṃ na paricchinnaṃ. Yehi kāraṇehi pubbe🔽avisesato mahaggataṃ “atula”nti vuttaṃ, tāni kāraṇāni rūpāvacarato āruppassa sātisayāni
analyzed: dīgha santāna tāya vipula phala tāya ca na tulam na paricchinnam yehi kāraṇehi pubbe  avisesataḥ mahaggatam atulan ti vuttam tāni kāraṇāni rūpa avacarataḥ āruppassa sa atisayāni
translated: because it has a long continuity, and because it has a wide range of results.

original: vijjantīti “arūpāvacaraṃ atula”nti vuttaṃ, itarañca “tula”nti, appavipākaṃ tīsupi
analyzed: vijjanti iti arūpāvacaram atulanti vuttam itaram ca tulanti appa vipākam tīsu pi
translated: The formless-world states are called “not limited” because they have to a higher degree than the fine-material-world states the reasons for which the exalted states were called “not limited” without distinction in the way beginning, “Because they are not overmastered by the world of sense desires” .🔽And the other, namely, the fine-material-world states, is called “limited” because it has a small range of results in the three kinds of kamma.

original: kammesu yaṃ tanuvipākaṃ hīnaṃ, taṃ tulaṃ. Bahuvipākanti yaṃ mahāvipākaṃ paṇītaṃ,
analyzed: kammesu yam tanu vipākam hīnam tam tulam bahu vipākam ti yam mahā vipākam paṇītam
translated: That kamma which has a small result, which is inferior, is “limited.” That which has a great result, which is superior,

original: taṃ atulaṃ. Yaṃ panettha majjhimaṃ, taṃ hīnaṃ, ukkaṭṭhanti dvidhā bhinditvā dvīsu
analyzed: tam atulam yam pana ittha majjhimam tam hīnam ukkaṭṭhanti dvidhā bhinditvā dvīsu
translated: The middle one is inferior, the best is twofold.

original: bhāgesu pakkhipitabbaṃ. Hīnattikavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayeneva appabahuvipākataṃ niddhāretvā
analyzed: bhāgesu pakkhipitabbam hīna ttika vaṇṇanāyam vutta nayena iva appa bahu vipāka tam niddhāretvā
translated: The middle one is inferior, and the best is superior. Having divided it into two, it should be placed in the two parts. Having extracted the small fruit by the method stated in the commentary on the inferior plane,🔽the state of being incomparable should be understood by that.

original: tassa vasena tulātulabhāvo veditabbo. Sambhavati etasmāti sambhavoti āha “sambhavassa
analyzed: tassa vasena tula atula bhāvaḥ veditabbo sambhavati etasmā ati sambhavaḥ ti āha sambhavassa
translated: The cause of the state of being is the cause of the state of being.

original: hetubhūta”nti. Niyakajjhattaratoti sasantānadhammesu vipassanāvasena, gocarāsevanāya
analyzed: hetu bhūtam ti sa santāna dhammesu vipassanā vasena gocara āsevanāya
translated: The one who is detached from his own mind is detached from the things that are in continuity with his mind, by the method of insight and by the method of the development of the object.

original: ca nirato. Savipākaṃ samānaṃ pavattivipākamattadāyikammaṃ savipākaṭṭhena sambhavaṃ.🔽Na ca taṃ kāmādibhavābhisaṅkhārakanti tato visesanatthaṃ “sambhava”nti vatvā “bhavasaṅkhāra”nti
analyzed: ca nirataḥ sa vipākam samānam pavatti vipāka matta dāyi kammam sa vipāka ṭṭhena sambhavam  na ca tam kāma ādi bhava abhisaṅkhārakanti tatas visesana attham sambhavanti vatvā bhava saṅkhāranti
translated: The action that gives only the result of the process of becoming, though it has a result, is the state of being by the state of having a result.🔽But it is not the action that is the formation of the state of being of the sensual-desire realm, etc. Therefore, in order to distinguish it, after saying “state of being,” it is said “formation of the state of being.”

original: vuttaṃ. Ossajjīti ariyamaggena avassajji. Kavacaṃ viya attabhāvaṃ pariyonandhitvā
analyzed: vuttam ossajji iti ariya maggena avassajji kavacam viya atta bhāvam pariyonandhitvā
translated: Having cast off by the noble path, having surrounded the body like a coat of mail,🔽having stood, the one who is detached from the state of being that has arisen in himself, having broken the defilements,

original: ṭhitaṃ attani sambhūtattā attasambhavaṃ kilesañca abhindīti kilesabhedasahabhāvikammossajjanaṃ
analyzed: sambhūta ttā atta sambhavam kilesam ca kilesa bheda saha bhāvi kamma ussajjanam
translated: the casting off that is associated with the breaking of the defilements,

original: dassento tadubhayassa kāraṇaṃ avoca “ajjhattarato samāhito”ti.🔽Tīrentoti “uppādo bhayaṃ, anuppādo khema”ntiādinā vīmaṃsanto. “Tulento tīrento”tiādinā
analyzed: dassentaḥ tat ubhayassa kāraṇam avoca ajjhattarataḥ samāhitaḥ ti  tīrento ti uppādaḥ bhayam anuppādaḥ khemanti ādinā vīmaṃsanto tulento tīrento itiādinā
translated: He said “Delighting in non-arising, being concentrated” in order to show the reason for both.🔽“Measuring, crossing over”: he said “Measuring, crossing over” in order to show in detail the meaning stated in brief by “measuring, crossing over.”

original: saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “pañcakkhandhā”ti ādiṃ vatvā bhavasaṅkhārassa🔽avassajjanākāraṃ sarūpato dassesi. “Eva”ntiādinā pana udānavaṇṇanāyaṃ ādito vuttamatthaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vitthārataḥ dassetum pañca kkhandhā ti ādim vatvā bhava saṅkhārassa  avassajjana ākāram sarūpataḥ dassesi evam ti ādinā pana udāna vaṇṇanāyam āditas vuttam attham
translated: “The five aggregates” and so on he said in order to show the nature of the non-abandoning of the formations of existence.

original: nigamanavasena dassesi.
analyzed: nigamana vasena dassesi
translated: “Thus” and so on he said in order to show by way of conclusion the meaning stated at the beginning in the commentary on the Udana.

original: Mahābhūmicālavaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Great Earth-quake

original: 171. Yanti karaṇe vā adhikaraṇe vā paccattavacananti adhippāyena āha “yena samayena,
analyzed: yanti karaṇe vā adhikaraṇe vā paccatta vacananti adhippāyena āha yena samayena
translated: “Yena samayena, yasmiṃ vā samaye” he said, intending the locative case, either as instrument or as objective.

original: yasmiṃ vā samaye”ti. Ukkhepakavātāti udakasandhārakavātaṃ upacchinditvā ṭhitaṭṭhānato
analyzed: yasmin vā samaye iti ukkhepaka vātā ati udaka sandhāraka vātam upacchinditvā ṭhita ṭṭhānato
translated: “Upheaving winds” are the winds that lift up the water from the place where it stands after cutting off the water-holding winds.

original: khepakavātā. “Saṭṭhi…pe… bahala”nti idaṃ tassa vātassa ubbedhappamāṇameva gahetvā
analyzed: khepaka vātā saṭṭhipe bahalanti idam tassa vātassa ubbedha ppamāṇam eva gahetvā
translated: “Sixty-four hundred thousand leagues” he said, taking the height of the water as the measure of the winds.

original: vuttaṃ, āyāmavitthārato pana dasasahassacakkavāḷappamāṇampi udakasandhārakavātaṃ🔽upacchindatiyeva. Ākāseti pubbe vātena patiṭṭhitokāse. Puna vātoti ukkhepakavāte🔽tathākatvā vigate udakasandhārakavāto puna ābandhitvā gaṇhāti yathā taṃ udakaṃ na
analyzed: vuttam āyāma vitthārato pana dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa ppamāṇam pi udaka sandhāraka vātam  upacchindatiyā iva ākāseti pubbe vātena patiṭṭhita ukāse puna vātoti ukkhepaka vāte  tathā katvā vigate udaka sandhāraka vātaḥ punar ābandhitvā gaṇhāti yathā tam udakam na
translated: But as to what is said, the wind that supports the water extends to the ten-thousand world-system in breadth and length.🔽It breaks up the wind that supports the water. In the sky: in the space that was previously occupied by the wind.🔽Again the wind: after the wind that had been throwing up the water had ceased, the wind that supports the water again took hold of it and held it, so that the water did not overflow.

original: bhassati, evaṃ utthambhentaṃ ābandhanavitānavasena bandhitvā gaṇhāti. Tato udakaṃ
analyzed: bhassati evam utthambhentam ābandhana vitāna vasena bandhitvā gaṇhāti tatas udakam
translated: It took hold of it and held it as if it were a roof-support or a prop. Then the water

original: uggacchatīti tato ābandhitvā gahaṇato tena vātena utthambhitaṃ udakaṃ uggacchati
analyzed: uggacchati iti tatas ābandhitvā tena vātena utthambhitam udakam uggacchati
translated: rose up. Then the water rose up from the place where it had been held.

original: upari gacchati. Hotiyevāti antarantarā hotiyeva. Bahalabhāvenāti mahāpathaviyā mahantabhāvena.
analyzed: upari gacchati hotiyā iva ati antar antarā hotiyā iva bahala bhāvena ati mahā pathaviyā mahanta bhāvena
translated: It happens: it happens now and again. By its great extent: by the great extent of the great earth.

original: Sakalā hi mahāpathavī tadā oggacchati, uggacchati ca, tasmā kampanaṃ na paññāyati.
analyzed: sakalā hi mahā pathavī tadā oggacchati uggacchati ca tasmai kampanam na paññāyati
translated: For then the whole of the great earth rises up, and it rises up, and that is why the quaking is not noticed.

original: Ijjhanassāti icchitatthasijjhanassa. Anubhavitabbassaissariyasampattiādikassa. Parittāti
analyzed: ijjhanassa ati anubhavitabba saissariya sampatti ādikassa parittā ati
translated: Of one who desires: of one who desires the success of his wishes, of the success of his experience of the prosperity of sovereignty, etc. Limited:

original: paṭiladdhamattā nātisubhāvitā. Tathā ca bhāvanā balavatī na hotīti āha “dubbalā”ti.
analyzed: paṭiladdha mattā na ati su bhāvitā tathā ca bhāvanā balavatī na hoti iti āha dubbalā ati
translated: and it is not well developed. And so the development is not strong.🔽For development is spoken of as a head of perception.

original: Saññāsīsena hi bhāvanā vuttā. Appamāṇāti paguṇā subhāvitā. Sā hi thirā daḷhatarā
analyzed: saññā sīsena hi bhāvanā vuttā appamāṇā ati paguṇā su bhāvitā sā hi thirā daḷhatarā
translated: It is extensive, purified, and well developed. For that is firm and very strong.🔽That is why it is said to be strong.

original: hotīti āha “balavā”ti. “Parittā pathavīsaññā, appamāṇā āposaññā”ti desanāmattameva,
analyzed: hoti iti āha balavā ati parittā pathavī saññā appamāṇā āpo saññā ti desanā mattam eva
translated: The teaching is merely that the perception of earth is limited and the perception of water is extensive.

original: āposaññāya pana subhāvitāya pathavīkampo sukheneva ijjhatīti ayamettha adhippāyo
analyzed: āposaññāya pana su bhāvitāya pathavī kampo sukhena iva ijjhati iti ayam ettha adhippāyaḥ
translated: But when the perception of water is well developed, the shaking of the earth is successful without difficulty. This is the intention here.🔽He was exhorting Sakka Ruler of Gods, who was heedless of the divine attainments,

original: veditabbo. Saṃvejento dibbasampattiyā pamattaṃ sakkaṃ devarājānaṃ. Vīmaṃsanto vā
analyzed: veditabbaḥ saṃvejentaḥ dibba sampattiyā pamattam sakkam devarājānam vīmaṃsantaḥ vā
translated: or he was testing🔽the power of his own supernormal power, which he had just attained.

original: tāvadeva samadhigataṃ attano iddhibalaṃ. Mahāmoggallānattherassa pāsādakampanaṃ pākaṭanti🔽taṃ anāmasitvā saṅgharakkhitasāmaṇerassa pāsādakampanaṃ dassetuṃ “so kirāyasmā”tiādi
analyzed: tāvat eva samadhigatam attanaḥ iddhi balam mahāmoggallāna therassa pāsāda kampanam pākaṭanti  tam an āmasitvā saṅgha rakkhita sāmaṇerassa pāsāda kampanam dassetum saḥ
translated: The Elder Mahā Moggallāna’s shaking of the palace was well known,🔽but he did not refer to that. Instead, he said “The venerable one called Saṅgharakkhita” in order to show the shaking of the palace by the novice Saṅgharakkhita.

original: vuttaṃ. Pūtimisso gandho etassāti pūtigandho, tena pūtigandheneva adhigatamātukucchisambhavaṃ
analyzed: vuttam pūti missaḥ gandhaḥ etassa ati pūti gandho tena pūti gandhena iva adhigata mātukucchi sambhavam
translated: He had a foul smell because of the smell of the womb he had just left.

original: viya gandheneva sīsena, ativiya dārako evāti attho.
analyzed: viya gandhena iva sīsena ativiya dārakaḥ eva ati attho
translated: as if with a head by means of a scent, the meaning is, he was a very great child.

original: Ācariyanti ācariyūpadesaṃ. Iddhābhisaṅkhāro nāma iddhividhappaṭipakkhādībhāvena icchitabbo,
analyzed: ācariyanti ācariyu upadesam iddhābhisaṅkhāraḥ nāma iddhividha paṭipakkha ādībhāvena icchitabbaḥ
translated: The teacher: the teacher’s advice. The wish for success is what is wanted by way of the pre-eminence of the success-making,

original: so ca upāye kosallassa attanā na sammā uggahitattā na tāva sikkhitoti āha “asikkhitvāva
analyzed: so ca upāye kosallassa attanā na sammā uggahita ttā na tāva sikkhitoti āha a sikkhitvā āva
translated: and that is not yet trained in because of his own failure to learn it properly, so he said: “Without training

original: yuddhaṃ paviṭṭhosī”ti. “Pilavanta”nti iminā sakalameva pāsādavatthuṃ udakaṃ katvā
analyzed: yuddham paviṭṭhaḥ asi iti iminā sakalam eva pāsāda vatthum udakam katvā
translated: you have gone into battle.” By “flooded” he shows that the whole palace site is to be resolved into water

original: adhiṭṭhātabbapāsādova tattha pilavatīti dasseti. Adhiṭṭhānakkamaṃ pana upamāya dassento
analyzed: adhiṭṭhātabba pāsādaḥ uva tattha pilavati iti dasseti adhiṭṭhāna kkamam pana upamāya dassento
translated: and that the palace resolved into water is the flooded one there. But showing the extent of the resolution by means of a simile,

original: “tāta…pe… jānāhī”ti āha. Tattha kapallakapūvanti āsittakapūvaṃ, taṃ pacantā kapāle
analyzed: tātape jānāhi iti āha tattha kapallaka pūvanti āsittaka pūvam tam pacantā kapāle
translated: he said: “Dear … … know … … ” Herein, a cake on a dish is a cake baked on a dish. When they are baking it they first put a little flour

original: paṭhamaṃ kiñci piṭṭhaṃ ṭhapetvā anukkamena vaḍḍhetvā antantena paricchindanti pūvaṃ
analyzed: paṭhamam kiñci piṭṭham ṭhapetvā anukkamena vaḍḍhetvā anta antena paricchindanti
translated: on the dish and then gradually add more and more until they have enclosed it all round with the dough.🔽When the cake is completely enclosed they put it aside. In the same way, by means of the kasiṇa consisting of water, the place where the palace stands

original: samantato paricchinnaṃ katvā ṭhapenti, evaṃ “āpokasiṇavasena ‘pāsādena patiṭṭhitaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: samantataḥ paricchinnam katvā ṭhapenti evam āpokasiṇa vasena pāsādena patiṭṭhita ṭṭhānam
translated: is resolved into water.

original: udakaṃ hotū’ti adhiṭṭhahanto samantato pāsādassa yāva pariyantā yathā udakaṃ hoti,
analyzed: udakam hotu uti adhiṭṭhahantaḥ samantataḥ pāsādassa yāva pariyantā yathā udakam hoti
translated: and he resolves, ‘Let it be water,’ he should resolve that it is water all round the palace as far as the outer wall.”

original: tathā adhiṭṭhātabba”nti upamāya upadisati.
analyzed: tathā adhiṭṭhātabbanti upamāya upadisati
translated: He teaches by means of a simile.

original: Mahāpadāne vuttamevāti “dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā
analyzed: mahāpadāne vuttam eva ati dhammatā esā bhikkhave yadā bodhisatto cavitvā
translated: What is stated in the Great Birth Stories: “Bhikkhus, it is the rule that when a Bodhisatta passes away from the Tusita heaven and enters his mother’s womb,

original: mātukucchiṃ okkamatī”ti vatvā “ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati
analyzed: mātukucchim okkamati iti vatvā ayam ca dasa sahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati
translated: then this ten-thousandfold world system shakes, quivers, and trembles, and a great immeasurable light becomes manifest in the world” ,

original: sampavedhatī”ti, tathā “dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamatī”ti
analyzed: sampavedhati iti tathā dhamma tā esā bhikkhave yadā bodhisattaḥ mātukucchimhā nikkhamati iti
translated: and similarly “Bhikkhus, it is the rule that when a Bodhisatta comes forth from his mother’s womb,

original: vatvā “ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhatī”ti ca mahābodhisattassa
analyzed: vatvā ayam ca dasa sahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati iti ca mahā bodhisattassa
translated: then this ten-thousandfold world system shakes, quivers, and trembles, and a great immeasurable light becomes manifest in the world” ,

original: gabbhokkantiyaṃ, abhijātiyañca dhammatāvasena mahāpadānepathavīkampassa vuttattā
analyzed: gabbha ukkantiyam abhijātiyam ca dhamma tā vasena mahā padāne pathavī kampassa vuttattā
translated: and in the Great Birth Stories the earth’s trembling is stated to be a rule of nature in the case of the great Bodhisatta’s descent into the womb and his birth,

original: itaresupi catūsu ṭhānesu pathavīkampo dhammatāvasenevāti mahāpadāneatthato vuttaṃ evāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: itaresu pi catūsu ṭhānesu pathavī kampaḥ dhamma tā vasena iva ati mahāpadāne atthataḥ vuttam eva ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: so it is a rule of nature in the other four instances too. This is the meaning.

original: Idāni nesaṃ pathavīkampanaṃ kāraṇato, pavattiākārato ca vibhāgaṃ dassetuṃ “iti imesū”tiādi
analyzed: idāni pathavī kampanam kāraṇato pavatti ākārato ca vibhāgam dassetuṃ iti imesu utiādi
translated: Now, in order to show the analysis of the cause and the mode of occurrence of their quaking of the earth, it is said: “Thus, in these” ,

original: vuttaṃ. Dhātukopenāti ukkhepakadhātusaṅkhātāya vāyodhātuyā pakopena. Iddhānubhāvenāti
analyzed: vuttam dhātu kopena ati ukkhepaka dhātu saṅkhātāya vāyodhātuyā pakopena iddha anubhāvena ati
translated: etc. The disturbance of the elements : by the disturbance of the air element called the “uplifting element” . The power of spiritual achievement :

original: ñāṇiddhiyā vā kammavipākajiddhiyā vā pabhāvena, tejenāti attho. Puññatejenāti puññānubhāvena,
analyzed: ñāṇiddhiyā vā kamma vipāka jiddhiyā vā pabhāvena tejena ati attho puñña tejena ati puñña anubhāvena
translated: by the power of the spiritual achievement of knowledge or the spiritual achievement of kamma-result . The word “power” means “lustre” . The power of merit : by the power of merit ,

original: mahābodhisattassa puññabalenāti attho. Ñāṇatejenāti paṭivedhañāṇānubhāvena. Sādhukāradānavasenāti🔽yathā anaññasādhāraṇena paṭivedhañāṇānubhāvena abhihatā mahāpathavī abhisambodhiyaṃ
analyzed: mahā bodhisattassa puñña balena ati attho ñāṇa tejena ati paṭivedha ñāṇa anubhāvena sādhukāra dāna vasena ati  yathā anañña sādhāraṇena paṭivedha ñāṇa anubhāvena abhihatā mahā pathavī
translated: the power of the great Bodhisatta’s merit, is the meaning. The power of knowledge : by the power of the knowledge of penetration . The giving of applause :🔽just as the great earth was struck by the power of the knowledge of penetration not shared by others and quaked at the time of the Great Awakened One’s full enlightenment,

original: akampittha, evaṃ anaññasādhāraṇena desanāñāṇānubhāvena abhihatā mahāpathavī akampittha,
analyzed: akampittha evam anañña sādhāraṇena desanā ñāṇa anubhāvena abhihatā mahā pathavī akampittha
translated: so the great earth was struck by the power of the knowledge of teaching not shared by others and quaked;

original: taṃ panassā sādhukāradānaṃ viya hotīti “sādhukāradānavasenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam panassā sādhukāra dānam viya hoti iti sādhukāra dāna vasena ati vuttam
translated: that giving of applause by him was as if it were the giving of applause by the great earth. Therefore it is said: “by the giving of applause” .

original: Yena pana bhagavā asītianubyañjanapaṭimaṇḍitadvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇa- vicitrarūpakāyo
analyzed: yena pana bhagavā asi iti anubyañjana paṭimaṇḍita dvattiṃsa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa vicitra rūpa kāyaḥ
translated: The Blessed One’s physical body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man and the eighty minor characteristics,

original: sabbākāraparisuddhasīlakkhandhādiguṇaratanasamiddhidhammakāyo puññamahattathāmamahattayasamahaāiddhimahattapaññāmahattānaṃ
analyzed: sabba ākāra parisuddha sīla kkhandha ādi guṇa ratana samiddhi dhammakāyo
translated: and his Dhamma body was adorned with the jewel of the aggregate of virtue, etc., which are purified in all respects. He was the foremost of all beings endowed with merit, with a great soul, with great majesty, with great psychic power, and with great wisdom.

original: paramukkaṃsagato asamo asamasamo appaṭipuggalo arahaṃ sammāsambuddho attano attabhāvasaññitaṃ
analyzed: param ukkaṃsa gataḥ asamaḥ asamasamaḥ appaṭipuggalaḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ attanaḥ atta bhāva saññitam
translated: He was an Arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One, who had attained the perfection of the incomparable state, who was unequalled, who was the one matchless Lord, who was the Master of the Three Worlds, who was the Master of men and devas, who was the Master of all beings, who was the Teacher of devas and men, who was the Buddha, the Blessed One.🔽He was able to prolong his life span for an eon or for what is left of the eon. Yet, in order to demonstrate the nature of disgust with conditioned things,

original: khandhapañcakaṃ kappaṃ vā kappāvasesaṃ vā ṭhapetuṃ samatthopi saṅkhatadhammaṃ paṭijigucchanākārappavattena🔽ñāṇavisesena tiṇāyapi amaññamāno āyusaṅkhārossajjanavidhinā nirapekkho ossajji. Tadanubhāvābhihatā🔽mahāpathavī āyusaṅkhārossajjane akampittha, taṃ panassā kāruññasabhāvasaṇṭhitā viya
analyzed: khandha pañcakam kappam vā kappa avasesam vā ṭhapetum samatthaḥ api saṅkhata dhammam paṭijigucchana ākāra ppavattena  ñāṇa visesena a maññamānaḥ āyu saṅkhāra ussajjana vidhinā nirapekkhaḥ tad anubhāva abhihatā  mahā pathavī āyu saṅkhāra ussajjane akampittha tam panassā kāruñña sabhāva saṇṭhitā viya
translated: he relinquished his life faculty without concern, as if it were a blade of grass.🔽The great earth trembled because it was struck by the power of his relinquishment of the life faculty. But it is said that the earth was as if filled with his compassion🔽at the time of his relinquishment of the life faculty.

original: hotīti vuttaṃ “kāruññasabhāvenā”ti. Yasmā bhagavā parinibbānasamaye catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhyā
analyzed: hoti iti vuttam kāruñña sabhāvena ati yasmai bhagavā parinibbāna samaye catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhyā
translated: The Blessed One, at the time of his final Nibbāna, relinquished his life faculty in the manner described above, after having completed the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the Noble Eightfold Path, and after having fulfilled the ten perfections.

original: samāpattiyo samāpajji antarantarā phalasamāpattisamāpajjanena, tassa pubbabhāge sātisayaṃ🔽tikkhaṃ sūraṃ vipassanāñāṇañca pavattesi, “yadatthañca mayā evaṃ sucirakālaṃ anaññasādhāraṇo
analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ samāpajji antarantarā phala samāpatti samāpajjanena tassa pubba bhāge sa atisayam  tikkham sūram vipassanā ñāṇañca pavattesi yadattham ca mayā evam su cira kālam anañña sādhāraṇaḥ
translated: and he entered the jhānas and the immaterial attainments, now and again entering the fruition attainment.🔽In the preliminary stage to this he developed insight knowledge, which was more outstanding,🔽sharper and swifter, than before.🔽“Now that I have attained the supreme freedom,

original: paramukkaṃsagato ñāṇasambhāro sambhato, anuttaro ca vimokkho samadhigato, tassa vata
analyzed: param ukkaṃsa gataḥ ñāṇa sambhāraḥ sambhataḥ anuttaraḥ ca vimokkho samadhigato tassa vata
translated: and have accumulated the requisites of knowledge, which for such a long time I have not shared with anyone else,🔽and have attained the supreme deliverance,

original: me sikhāppattaphalabhūtā accantaniṭṭhā anupādisesanibbānadhātu ajja samijjhatī”ti🔽bhiyyo ativiya somanassappattassa bhagavato pītivipphārādiguṇavipulatarānubhāvo parehi
analyzed: me sikhā appatta phala bhūtā accanta niṭṭhā an upādisesa nibbāna dhātu ajja samijjhati iti  bhiyyas somanassa ppattassa bhagavataḥ pīti vipphāra ādi guṇa vipulatara anubhāvo parehi
translated: today the state of Nibbāna, which is the culmination of the fruit of Arahantship, the ultimate goal, the destruction of all suffering, will be realized.”🔽The Blessed One, who had attained even greater joy, had a more abundant and sublime influence, with the increase of the special knowledge that is not shared by others,

original: asādhāraṇañāṇātisayo udapādi, yassa samāpattibalasamupabrūhitassa ñāṇātisayassa ānubhāvaṃ

analyzed: sandhāya idam vuttam dve me piṇḍapātā sama sama phalā sama sama vipākā ati ādi tasmā tassa

original: ānubhāvena samabhihatā mahāpathavī akampittha. Taṃ panassā tassaṃ velāyaṃ ārodanākārappatti
analyzed: ānubhāvena samabhihatā mahā pathavī akampittha tam panassā tassam velāyam ārodana ākāra ppatti

analyzed: viya hoti iti aṭṭhamaḥ ārodanena ati vuttam
translated: So it was said that he was the eighth to be born with weeping.

original: Idāni saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vivaranto “mātukucchiṃ okkamante”tiādimāha. Ayaṃ panatthoti🔽“sādhukāradānavasenā”tiādinā vutto attho. analyzed: idāni saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vivarantaḥ mātukucchim okkamanta iti ādim āha ayam pana atthaḥ iti  sādhukāra dāna vasena ati ādinā vuttaḥ attho pathavī devatāya vasena ati ettha samudda devatā  viya mahāpathaviyāḥ adhidevatā kira nāma atthi tādise kāraṇe sati tassā cittavasena  ayam mahā pathavī saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati yathā
translated: Now, explaining the meaning of what was said in brief, he said “When he entered his mother’s womb,” and so on. But this is the meaning:

analyzed: sā api dāna balā mayham sattakkhattum pakampatha ati
translated: Yet through the power of my charity, It shook seven times for me.”

analyzed: vacana samanantaram mahā pathavī bhijjitvā sa parisam māram parivattesi etat ti sādhukāra dāna ādi
translated: As soon as these words were spoken, the great earth split open and swallowed Mara and his retinue. “Etta” means “well done” and so on.

original: Yadipi natthi acetanattā, dhammatāvasena pana vuttanayena siyāti sakkā vattuṃ. Dhammatā
analyzed: yadi pi natthi acetana ttā dhamma tā vasena pana vutta nayena siyā iti sakkā vattum dhamma tā
translated: Although it is without consciousness, it can be said that it “may be” in the way described, according to the nature of things.

translated: The nature of things is the true nature of dhammas. It is the nature of the true Dhamma of merit or the true Dhamma of knowledge.

translated: All this has been discussed already. Thus:

analyzed: ime dhamme sammasato

analyzed: dhamma tejena vasudhā dasa sahassī pakampatha ati

original: Ādi vacanañca samatthitaṃ hoti.

analyzed: tam attham vīmaṃseyya na ayam bhūmikampaḥ dhātu pakopa hetuko tassa a paññāyamāna rūpa ttā  bāhirakaḥ api isi evam mahā anubhāvaḥ buddha kāle natthi sāsanikaḥ api satthu an ārocetvā evam
translated: would have investigated the matter at that time. “This earthquake is not caused by a disturbance of the elements, because that is not known to be the case.

original: karonto nāma natthi, sesānaṃ pañcannaṃ idāni asambhavo, evaṃ bhūmikampo cāyaṃ mahābhiṃsanako
analyzed: karontaḥ nāma natthi sesānam pañcannam idāni asambhavaḥ evam bhūmikampo ca ayam mahā bhiṃsanako
translated: There is no such powerful seer outside the Dispensation, and there is no such one in the Dispensation who would act in this way without informing the Master. The remaining five are not possible now. And this earthquake is so terrifying

original: Aṭṭhaparisavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭha parisa vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Eight Assemblies

analyzed: okāsam a datvā iti tiṭṭhatu bhante bhagavā naya ppavattāya therassa

analyzed: āyācanāya avasaram a datvā aññāni api aṭṭhakāni sampiṇḍentaḥ hetu aṭṭhakataḥ aññāni parisā abhibhā āyatana vimokkha vasena
