original: Pānīyāharaṇavaṇṇanā🔽191. Pasannabhāvena udakassa acchabhāvo veditabboti āha “acchodakāti pasannodakā”ti.🔽Sādurasattā sātatāti āha “madhurodakā”ti. Tanukameva salilaṃ visesato sītalaṃ, na
analyzed: pānīya āharaṇa vaṇṇanā  pasanna bhāvena udakassa accha bhāvaḥ veditabbo ti āha accha udakā ati pasanna udakā ati  sādura sattā sātatā iti āha madhura udakā ati tanukam eva salilam visesataḥ sītalam na
translated: The Description of the Bringing of the Water🔽The clarity of the water should be understood as its limpidity. That is why he said “limpid water” .🔽The sweetness of the water should be understood as its pleasantness. That is why he said “sweet water” . The thinness of the water should be understood as its coolness, since thin water is especially cool.

original: bahalanti āha “tanusītalasalilā”ti. Nikkaddamāti setabhāvassa kāraṇamāha. Paṅkacikkhallādivasena
analyzed: bahalanti āha tanu sītala salilā ati nikkaddamā ati seta bhāvassa kāraṇam āha paṅka cikkhalla ādi vasena
translated: That is why he said “thin, cool water” . The word “clear” is a reason for the limpidity.

original: hi udakassa vivaṇṇatā, sabhāvato pana taṃ setavaṇṇaṃ evāti.
analyzed: hi udakassa vivaṇṇa tā sabhāvato pana tam seta vaṇṇam eva ati
translated: For water is discoloured by muddiness, scum, and so on, but its natural colour is clear.

original: Pukkusamallaputtavatthuvaṇṇanā🔽192. Dhuravāteti paṭimukhavāte. Dīghapiṅgaloti dīgho hutvā piṅgalacakkhuko. Piṅgalakkhiko
analyzed: dhura vāta iti paṭimukha vāte dīgha piṅgalaḥ ti dīghaḥ hutvā piṅgala cakkhuko piṅga lakkhiko
translated: The Description of the Story of Pukkusāti🔽The word “head-wind” is a wind that blows in the face. “Long-tawny” is one who is long and has tawny eyes.

original: hi so “āḷāro”ti paññāyittha. Evarūpanti dakkhati karissati bhavissatīti īdisaṃ. Īdisesūti
analyzed: hi so āḷāraḥ ti paññāyittha evarūpanti dakkhati karissati bhavissati iti īdisam īdisesu uti
translated: For he was known as “Āḷāra” . “Such as” means “like this” . “Such as these” means

original: yatra yaṃcāti evarūpanipātasaddayuttaṭṭhānesu.🔽193. Vicarantiyo meghagabbhato niccharantiyo viya hontīti vuttaṃ “niccharantīsūti
analyzed: yatra yaṃ ca ati eva rūpa nipāta sadda yutta ṭṭhānesu  vicarantiyaḥ megha gabbhataḥ niccharantiyaḥ viya honti iti vuttam niccharantīsu iti
translated: Where and what: in places where the words are used in this way.🔽They are said to “fall down” as if they were falling from the interior of a cloud.🔽“They fall down” is said for “they move down.”

original: vicarantīsū”ti. Navavidhāyāti navappakārāya. Navasu hi pakāresu ekavidhāpi asani
analyzed: vicarantīsu iti navavidhāya ati nava ppakārāya navasu hi pakāresu ekavidhā api asani
translated: In the ninefold: in the ninefold classification. For although it is of one kind, it is called “ninefold” because it is included in the nine kinds of lightning.

original: tappariyāpannatāya “navavidhā” tveva vuccati. Īdisī hi esā ruḷhi aṭṭhavimokkhapattipi
analyzed: tad pariyāpanna tāya navavidhā tu eva vuccati īdisī hi esā
translated: This is the usage, like the designation of the attainment of the eight liberations.

original: samaññā viya. Asaññaṃ karoti, yo tassā saddena, tejasā ca ajjhotthaṭo. Ekaṃ cakkanti
analyzed: samaññā viya asaññam karoti yaḥ tassā saddena tejasā ca ajjhotthaṭaḥ ekam
translated: He makes it unconscious, he who is struck by its sound and its splendor.🔽One circle: one disk.🔽They show it as if they were separating and throwing out the rubbish.

original: ekaṃ maṇḍalaṃ. Saṅkāraṃ tīrentī paricchijjantī viya dassetīti saterā. Gaggarāyamānāti🔽gaggarātisaddaṃ karontī, anuravadassanañhetaṃ. Kapisīsāti kapisīsākāravatī. Macchavilolikāti
analyzed: ekam maṇḍalam saṅkāram tīrentī paricchijjantī viya dasseti iti saterā gaggarāyamānā ati  gaggara ati saddam karontī kapi sīsā ati kapi sīsa ākāravatī maccha vilolikā ati
translated: They are said to “roar”🔽because they make a roaring sound. This is a description of the reverberation.🔽They are said to “flash”🔽because they flash like a fish wriggling in water.

original: udake paripphandamānamaccho viya viluḷitākārā. Kukkuṭasadisāti pasāritapakkhakukkuṭākārā.
analyzed: udake paripphandamānam acchas viya viluḷita ākārā kukkuṭa sadisā ati pasārita pakkha kukkuṭa ākārā
translated: They are said to be “like a cock’s comb” because they have the shape of a cock’s comb.

original: Naṅgalassa kassanakāle kassakānaṃ hatthena gahetabbaṭṭhāne maṇikā hoti, taṃ upādāya
analyzed: naṅgalassa kassana kāle kassakānam hatthena gahetabba ṭṭhāne maṇikā hoti tam upādāya
translated: The iron of the ploughshare is the part of the plough that is held in the hand when ploughing is being done.

original: naṅgalaṃ “daṇḍamaṇikā”ti vuccati, tasmā daṇḍamaṇikākārā daṇḍamaṇikā. Tenāha “naṅgalasadisā”ti.
analyzed: naṅgalam daṇḍamaṇikā ati vuccati tasmā daṇḍamaṇikā ākārā daṇḍamaṇikā tena āha naṅgala sadisā iti
translated: The plough is called “the handle with the iron” because of that iron.

original: Deve vassantepi sajotibhūtatāya udakena atemetabbato mahāsani “sukkhāsanī”ti vuttā.
analyzed: deve vassante api sajoti bhūta tāya udakena a temetabbataḥ mahā āsani sukkha āsanī iti vuttā
translated: The great lightning flash is called “dry lightning” because it does not get wet even when it rains, being bright with light.

original: Tenāha “patitaṭṭhānaṃ samugghāṭetī”ti.
analyzed: tena āha patita ṭṭhānam samugghāṭeti iti
translated: Therefore it is said, “It digs up the place where it falls.”

original: Bhusāgāraketi bhusamaye agārake. Tattha kira mahantaṃ palālapuñjaṃ abbhantarato palālaṃ
analyzed: bhusa āgāraka iti bhusa maye agārake tattha kira mahantam palāla puñjam abbhantarataḥ palālam
translated: In the bhusāgāra: in the bhusā house. It seems that a great heap of straw was taken out from inside the house

original: nikkaḍḍhitvā sālāsadisaṃ pabbajitānaṃ vasanayoggaṭṭhānaṃ kataṃ, tadā bhagavā tattha
analyzed: nikkaḍḍhitvā sālā sadisam pabbajitānam vasana yoggaṭṭhānam katam tadā bhagavā tattha
translated: and a place for the monks to live in was made like a hall. At that time the Blessed One lived there.

original: vasi, taṃ pana khalamaṇḍalaṃ sālāsadisanti āha “khalasālāya”nti. Etthāti hetumhi
analyzed: tam pana khala maṇḍalam āha ettha ati hetumhi
translated: But that threshing-barn was like a hall. Therefore it is said, “In the threshing-barn.” Here: in the instrumental case.

original: bhummavacananti āha “etasmiṃ kāraṇe”ti, asanipātena channaṃ janānaṃ hatakāraṇeti
analyzed: āha etasmin kāraṇā iti channam hata kāraṇā iti
translated: Therefore it is said, “For this reason.” The meaning is: for the reason of the six people being killed by the lightning flash.

original: attho. So tvaṃ bhanteti ayameva vā pāṭho.
analyzed: attho saḥ tvam bhante iti ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: So you, venerable sir: this is the reading.

original: 194. Siṅgī nāma kira uttamaṃ ativiya pabhassaraṃ buddhānaṃ chavivaṇṇobhāsaṃ devalokato
analyzed: siṅgī nāma kira uttamam pabhassaram buddhānam chavi vaṇṇa ubhāsam deva lokataḥ
translated: The “siṅgī” is said to be the best, the most radiant of the six colours of the light of the Buddhas, which comes from the world of the gods

original: āgatasuvaṇṇaṃ. Tenevāha “siṅgīsuvaṇṇavaṇṇa”nti. “Kiṃ pana thero taṃ gaṇhī”ti sayameva
analyzed: āgata suvaṇṇam tena iva āha siṅgī suvaṇṇa vaṇṇam ti kim pana theraḥ tam gaṇhi iti sayam eva
translated: in the form of gold. Therefore he said “the colour of siṅgī gold.” “But did the Elder take it?” He himself raised the question

original: pucchaṃ samuṭṭhāpetvā tattha kāraṇaṃ dassento “kiñcāpī”tiādimāha. Teneva kāraṇenāti🔽upaṭṭhākaṭṭhānassa matthakappatti, paresaṃ vacanokāsapacchedanaṃ, tena vatthena satthu
analyzed: puccham samuṭṭhāpetvā tattha kāraṇam dassentaḥ kiñcā api iti ādim āha tena iva kāraṇena ati  upaṭṭhāka ṭṭhānassa matthaka ppatti paresam vacana ukāsa pacchedanam tena vatthena satthu
translated: and then showed the reason for it, saying “And yet,” etc. For this reason,

original: pūjanaṃ, satthu ajjhāsayānuvattananti iminā teneva yathāvuttena catubbidhena kāraṇena.🔽195. Thero ca tāvadeva taṃ siṅgīvaṇṇaṃ maṭṭhadussaṃ bhagavato upanāmesi “paṭiggaṇhatu
analyzed: pūjanam satthu ajjhāsayā anuvattanan ti iminā tena iva yathā vuttena catubbidhena kāraṇena  thero ca tāvat eva tam siṅgīvaṇṇam maṭṭhadussam bhagavataḥ upanāmesi paṭiggaṇhatu
translated: that is, for the reason that he reached the peak of the position of attendant, that he interrupted the opportunity of others to speak, that he worshipped the Master with that cloth, and that he conformed to the Master’s wishes—for this reason, for the fourfold reason stated thus.

original: me bhante bhagavā imaṃ maṭṭhadussaṃ, taṃ mamassa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā”ti. Paṭiggahesi
analyzed: me bhante bhagavā imam maṭṭhadussam tam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati paṭiggahesi
translated: And the Elder immediately presented that cloth of siṅgī colour to the Exalted One, saying “May the Exalted One accept this cloth, venerable sir, it will be for my benefit and happiness for a long time.” The Exalted One accepted it,

original: bhagavā, paṭiggahetvāva naṃ paribhuñji. Tena vuttaṃ “bhagavāpi tato ekaṃ nivāsesi,
analyzed: bhagavā paṭiggahetvā ava nam paribhuñji tena vuttam bhagavā api tatas ekam nivāsesi
translated: and having accepted it, he used it. Therefore it was said “The Exalted One put it on”🔽.

original: ekaṃ pārupī”ti. Tāvadeva kira taṃ bhikkhū ovaṭṭikaraṇamattena tunnakammaṃ niṭṭhāpetvā
analyzed: ekam pārupīti tāvat eva kira tam bhikkhū ovaṭṭi karaṇa mattena tunna kammam niṭṭhāpetvā
translated: and put on the other.”🔽The monks immediately finished the sewing and

original: therassa upanesuṃ, thero bhagavato upanāmesi. Hataccikaṃ viyāti paṭihatappabhaṃ,
analyzed: therassa upanesum theraḥ bhagavataḥ upanāmesi hataccikam viyāti paṭihata ppabham
translated: and he put on one of them.” The monks, it seems, had finished the sewing of the robe-cloth, which they had begun only as a formality, and they brought it to the Elder, who in turn brought it to the Blessed One.🔽“Like a flash of lightning”: like a flash of lightning that is broken off.🔽The word “like” is used in the sense of mere comparison.

original: viya-saddo nipātamattaṃ. Bhagavato hi sarīrappabhāhi abhibhuyyamānā tassa vatthayugassa🔽pabhassaratā nāhosi. Antantenevāti anto anto eva, abbhantarato evāti attho. Tenāha
analyzed: viya saddaḥ nipāta mattam bhagavataḥ hi sarīra ppabhāhi tassa vattha yugassa  pabhassaratā na ahosi anta antena iva ati antaḥ antaḥ eva abbhantarataḥ eva ati tena āha
translated: For the radiance of the Blessed One’s body outshone the radiance of the pair of garments.🔽“Within”: inside, within.

original: “bahipanassa pabhā natthī”ti.
analyzed: bahipanassa pabhā natthi iti
translated: “The radiance of the outside is not seen”: the radiance of the outside is not seen.

original: “Pasannarūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpetī”ti etenetassa āhārassa bhuttappaccayā na so rogoti ayamattho
analyzed: pasanna rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti iti etena itassa āhārassa bhutta paccayā na saḥ rogaḥ ti ayam attho
translated: “It produces a pleasing appearance”: by this he shows that the disease is not caused by the food.

original: dīpito. Dvīsu kālesu evaṃ hoti dvinnaṃ nibbānadhātūnaṃ samadhigamasamayabhāvato.
analyzed: dīpitaḥ dvīsu kālesu evam hoti dvinnam nibbāna dhātūnam samadhigama samaya bhāvato
translated: This happens at two times, because of the attainment of the two kinds of Nibbāna.

original: Upavattane antarena yamakasālānanti ettha vattabbaṃ parato āgamissati.
analyzed: upavattane antarena yamaka sālānam ti ettha vattabbam paratas āgamissati
translated: “Between the twin Sāl trees in the Upavattana”: what is to be said about this will come later.

original: 196. Sabbaṃ suvaṇṇavaṇṇameva ahosi ativiya parisuddhāya pabhassarāya ekagghanāya bhagavato sarīrappabhāya nirantaraṃ abhibhūtattā.
analyzed: sabbam suvaṇṇa vaṇṇam eva ahosi ativiya parisuddhāya pabhassarāya ekagghanāya bhagavato sarīra ppabhāya nirantaram abhibhūta ttā
translated: All became the color of gold, because the Blessed One’s radiance, being very pure and bright, outshone the other colors.

original: Dhammeti pariyattidhamme. Pavattāti pāvacanabhāvena desetā. Puratova nisīdi ovādappaṭikaraṇabhāvato.
analyzed: dhamme iti pariyatti dhamme pavattā ati pāvacana bhāvena desetā puratas va nisīdi ovāda paṭikaraṇa bhāvato
translated: “Dhamma” is the Dhamma as text. “He expounded” means he taught by means of recitation. “He sat down in front” because he was going to give advice.

original: 197. Dānānisaṃsasaṅkhātā lābhāti vaṇṇadānabaladānādibhedā dānassa ānisaṃsasaññitā
analyzed: dāna ānisaṃsa saṅkhātā vaṇṇa dāna bala dāna ādi bhedā dānassa ānisaṃsa saññi tā
translated: “The gain called the benefits of giving” is the gain called the benefits of giving, which is of the kind consisting of the gain of beauty, the gain of strength, and so on.

original: diṭṭhadhammikā, samparāyikā ca lābhā icchitabbā. Te alābhāti te sabbe tuyhaṃ alābhā,
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikā samparāyikā ca lābhā icchitabbā te alābhā ati te sabbe tuyham alābhā
translated: “The non-gain of all that” is the non-gain of all that, which is the non-gain of the gain of beauty, the gain of strength, and so on.

original: lābhā eva na honti. Diṭṭheva dhamme paccakkhabhūte imasmiṃyeva attabhāve bhavā diṭṭhadhammikā.
analyzed: lābhāḥ eva na honti diṭṭhe iva dhamme paccakkha bhūte imasmin yeva atta bhāve bhavāḥ diṭṭhadhammikā
translated: “In this very life” means in this very existence, in this very selfhood, in this very continuity of aggregates.

original: Samparetabbato pecca gantabbato “samparāyo”ti laddhanāme paraloke bhavā samparāyikā.
analyzed: samparetabbato pecca gantabbato samparāyo ti laddha nāme para loke bhavā samparāyikā
translated: “In the life to come” means in the next existence, in the next selfhood, in the next continuity of aggregates.

original: Diṭṭhadhammikā ca samparāyikā ca diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikā. Dānānisaṃsasaṅkhātā lābhāti
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikā ca samparāyikā ca diṭṭhadhammika samparāyikā dāna anisaṃsa saṅkhātā
translated: “In this very life and in the life to come” means in this very life and in the life to come. “The gain called the benefits of giving” is the gain called the benefits of giving, which is of the kind consisting of the gain of beauty, the gain of strength, and so on.

original: dānānisaṃsabhūtā lābhā. Sabbathā samameva hutvā samaṃ phalaṃ etesaṃ na ekadesenāti
analyzed: dāna anisaṃsa bhūtā lābhā sabbathā samam eva hutvā samam phalam etesam na eka desena ati
translated: The meaning is that the fruit of both is equal, not partial.

original: samasamaphalā. Piṇḍapātāti tabbisayaṃ dānamayaṃ puññamāha.
analyzed: sama sama phalā piṇḍapātā ati tat visayam dāna mayam puññam āha
translated: The alms food: this refers to the merit consisting in giving that has that as its object.

original: Yadi khettavasena nesaṃ samaphalatā adhippetā, satipi ekasantānabhāve puthujjanaarahantabhāvasiddhaṃ
analyzed: yadi khetta vasena sama phala tā adhippetā eka santāna bhāve puthujjana arahanta bhāva siddham
translated: If the equality of fruit is intended in terms of the field, then, although there is a single continuity, the distinction of ordinary man and Arahant is established.

original: nanu tesaṃ khettaṃ visiṭṭhanti dassetuṃ “nanu cā”tiādimāha. Parinibbānasamatāyāti
analyzed: nanu tesam khettam visiṭṭhanti dassetum nanu ca ati ādim āha parinibbāna samatāya āti
translated: But is not the field of the latter superior? In order to show this, he says: “But is it not so, etc.?”

original: kilesaparinibbānakhandhaparinibbānabhāvena parinibbānasamatāya. “Paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto”ti
analyzed: kilesa parinibbāna khandha parinibbāna bhāvena parinibbāna samatāya paribhuñjitvā parinibbutaḥ ti
translated: Equality of extinction: by the extinction of defilements and by the extinction of the aggregates.

original: etena yathā paṇītapiṇḍapātaparibhogūpatthambhitarūpakāyasannissayo dhammakāyo sukheneva🔽kilese pariccaji, bhojanasappāyasaṃsiddhiyā evaṃ sukheneva khandhe pariccajīti evaṃ
analyzed: etena yathā paṇīta piṇḍapāta paribhoga upatthambhita rūpa kāya sannissayaḥ dhammakāyaḥ sukhena iva  kilese pariccaji bhojana sappāya saṃsiddhiyā evam sukhena iva khandhe pariccaji iti evam
translated: “Having enjoyed, he attained extinction”: by this he shows that the Dhamma body, which is supported by the material body that is strengthened by the enjoyment of excellent alms food,🔽easily abandons defilements. Just as it easily abandons defilements, so it easily abandons the aggregates.🔽Thus, because it is the cause for the easy abandonment of defilements and the easy abandonment of the aggregates,

original: kilesapariccāgassa, khandhapariccāgassa ca sukhasiddhinimittatāya ubhinnaṃ piṇḍapātānaṃ
analyzed: kilesa pariccāgassa khandha pariccāgassa ca sukha siddhi nimittatāya ubhinnam piṇḍapātānam
translated: both kinds of alms food are equal.

original: samaphalatā jotitā. “Piṇḍapātasīsena ca piṇḍapātadānaṃ jotita”nti vutto vāyamattho.🔽Yathā hi sujātāya “imaṃ āhāraṃ nissāya mayhaṃ devatāya vaṇṇasukhabalādiguṇā sammadeva🔽sampajjeyyu”nti uḷāro ajjhāsayo tadā ahosi, evaṃ cundassapi kammāraputtassa “imaṃ
analyzed: sama phala tā jotitā piṇḍapāta sīsena ca piṇḍapāta dānam jotitan ti vuttaḥ vā ayam attho  yathā hi sujātāya imam āhāram nissāya mayham devatāya vaṇṇa sukha bala ādi guṇā sammadā eva  sampajjeyyunti uḷāraḥ ajjhāsayaḥ tadā ahosi evam cundassa api kammāra puttassa imaṃ
translated: and the equality of the fruit is indicated. The meaning stated is that the giving of the alms food and the alms-bowl are indicated.

original: āhāraṃ nissāya bhagavato vaṇṇasukhabalādiguṇā sammadeva sampajjeyyu”nti uḷāro ajjhāsayoti
analyzed: āhāram nissāya bhagavataḥ vaṇṇa sukha bala ādi guṇā sammat eva sampajjeyyunti uḷāraḥ ajjhāsayoti
translated: For just as Sujata’s intention was lofty when she gave the alms food, thinking, “By means of this food may the Blessed One’s beauty, happiness, strength, etc., be perfected,” so too the intention of Cunda the Smith was lofty when he gave the alms food, thinking, “By means of this food may the Blessed One’s beauty, happiness, strength, etc., be perfected.”🔽Thus the equality of the fruit of the two gifts should be understood.

original: evampi nesaṃ ubhinnaṃ samaphalatā veditabbā. Satipi catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasamāpattīnaṃ🔽devasikaṃ vaḷañjanasamāpattibhāve yathā pana abhisambujjhanadivase abhinavavipassanaṃ🔽paṭṭhapento rūpasattakādi vasena cuddasahākārehi sannetvā mahāvipassanāmukhena tā
analyzed: evam pi na īsam ubhinnam sama phala tā veditabbā sati pi catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa samāpattīnam  devasikam vaḷañjana samāpatti bhāve yathā pana abhisambujjhana divase abhinava vipassanam  paṭṭhapentaḥ rūpa sattaka ādi vasena cuddasa hākārehi san netvā mahā vipassanā mukhena tā
translated: And although Cunda had attained the twenty-four hundred and fifty0 jhanas,

original: samāpattiyo samāpajji, evaṃ parinibbānadivasepi sabbā tā samāpajjīti evaṃ samāpattisamatāyapi
analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ samāpajji evam parinibbāna divase pi sabbā tā samāpajji iti evam samāpatti samatāya api
translated: just as on the day of his enlightenment he had attained them by means of the fourteen modes of insight beginning with the contemplation of the material septad, so too on the day of his final Nibbana he attained all those jhanas. Thus the equality of attainment should be understood.

original: tesaṃ samaphalatā. Cundassa tāva anussaraṇaṃ uḷārataraṃ hotu bhagavato dinnabhāvena
analyzed: tesam sama phala tā cundassa tāva anussaraṇam uḷārataram hotu bhagavataḥ dinna bhāvena
translated: Their fruit is the same. Cunda’s recollection is more outstanding because of his having given to the Exalted One.

original: aññathattābhāvato, sujātāya pana kathaṃ devatāya dinnanti? Evaṃsaññibhāvatoti āha
analyzed: aññathattā bhāvataḥ sujātāya pana katham devatāya dinnanti evaṃsaññi bhāvato ti āha
translated: But how is it that Sujata’s recollection is of what was given by a deity? Because she had the perception that it was so.

original: “sujātā cā”tiādi. Aparabhāgeti abhisambodhito aparabhāge. Puna aparabhāgeti parinibbānato🔽parato. Dhammasīsanti dhammānaṃ matthakabhūtaṃ nibbānaṃ. Me gahitanti mama vasena
analyzed: sujātā ca ati ādi aparabhāge iti abhisambodhitaḥ aparabhāge puna aparabhāge iti parinibbānato  paratas dhamma sīsanti dhammānam matthaka bhūtam nibbānam me gahitanti mama vasena
translated: “Sujata” and so on. In the future: in the future time after the enlightenment. In the future again: after the parinibbana.

original: gahitaṃ. Tenāha “mayhaṃ kirā”tiādi.
analyzed: tena āha kirāti ādi
translated: The crest of the Dhamma: nibbana, which is the crest of the dhammas. Taken by me: taken by me as my own. Therefore he said: “It is as if it were mine.”

original: Adhipatibhāvo ādhipateyyanti āha “jeṭṭhabhāvasaṃvattaniyaka”nti.
analyzed: adhipati bhāvaḥ ādhipateyyanti āha jeṭṭha bhāva saṃvattaniyakam ti
translated: The state of being the lord is lordship. He said: “That which leads to the state of being the chief.”

original: Saṃvareti sīlasaṃvare. Veranti pāṇātipātādipañcavidhaṃ veraṃ. Tañhi veridhammabhāvato,🔽verahetutāya ca “vera”nti vuccati. Kosallaṃ vuccati ñāṇaṃ, tena yutto kusaloti āha
analyzed: saṃvara iti sīla saṃvare veranti pāṇa atipāta ādi pañcavidham veram tat hi veri dhamma bhāvato  vera hetu tāya ca veranti vuccati kosallam vuccati ñāṇam tena yuttaḥ kusalaḥ ti āha
translated: In the restraint: in the restraint of virtue. In enmity: in the five kinds of enmity beginning with killing living beings. For that is called “enmity” because it has the nature of enmity and because it is the cause of enmity.

original: “kusalo pana ñāṇasampanno”ti. Ñāṇasampadā nāma ñāṇapāripūrī, sā ca aggamaggavasena
analyzed: kusalaḥ pana ñāṇa sampannaḥ ti ñāṇa sampadā nāma ñāṇa pāripūrī sā ca agga magga vasena
translated: Skill is called knowledge. He who is endowed with it is skilled. Therefore he said: “But the skilled one is endowed with knowledge.” The endowment with knowledge is the fulfilment of knowledge, and that is by way of the supreme path.

original: veditabbā, aggamaggo ca niravasesato kilese pajahatīti āha “ariyamaggena…pe… jahātī”ti.
analyzed: veditabbā agga maggaḥ ca niravasesataḥ kilese pajahati iti āha jahāti iti
translated: and the Noble Path is the way to abandon defilements without remainder.

original: Imaṃ pāpakaṃ jahitvāti dānena tāva lobhamacchariyādipāpakaṃ, sīlena pāṇātipātādipāpakaṃ
analyzed: imam pāpakam jahitvā ati dānena sīlena pāṇātipāta ādi pāpakam
translated: Having abandoned this evil: first, by means of generosity, he abandoned the evil of greed, miserliness, etc.; by means of virtue, the evil of killing living beings, etc.;

original: jahitvā tadaṅgavasena pahāya tato samathavipassanādhammehi vikkhambhanavasena, tato🔽maggapaṭipāṭiyā samucchedavasena anavasesaṃ pāpakaṃ pahāya. Tathā pahīnattā eva rāgādīnaṃ🔽khayā kilesanibbānena sabbaso kilesavūpasamena nibbuto parinibbutoti saupādisesāya
analyzed: jahitvā tad aṅga vasena pahāya tatas samatha vipassanā dhammehi vikkhambhana vasena tatas  magga paṭipāṭiyā samuccheda vasena anavasesam pāpakam pahāya tathā pahīna ttā eva rāga ādīnam  khayā kilesa nibbānena sabbasas kilesa vūpasamena nibbutaḥ parinibbutaḥ iti sa upādisesāya
translated: having abandoned it by means of the special qualities of serenity and insight, by means of suppression;🔽having abandoned it by means of the path, by means of eradication, without remainder. Because he had abandoned it in this way, he was quenched, completely quenched, by means of the destruction of lust, etc., and the complete tranquilization of all defilements, by means of the element of extinction without residue of clinging left.

original: nibbānadhātuyā desanāya kūṭaṃ gaṇhanto “iti cundassa…pe… sampassamāno udānaṃ udānesī”ti.
analyzed: nibbāna dhātuyāḥ desanāya kūṭam gaṇhantaḥ iti cundassape sampassamānaḥ udānam udānesi iti
translated: Thus, grasping the peak of the teaching on the element of extinction with residue of clinging left, he uttered this exalted utterance.

original: Catutthabhāṇavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catuttha bhāṇa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the fourth recitation section is finished.

original: Yamakasālavaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Twin Miracle

original: 198. Evaṃ taṃ kusinārāyaṃ hotīti yathā anurādhapurassa thūpārāmo dakkhiṇapacchimadisāyaṃ,
analyzed: evam tat kusinārāyam hoti iti yathā anurādhapurassa thūpa ārāmaḥ dakkhiṇa pacchima disā ayam
translated: Thus it was at Kusinārā: just as the Thūpārāma at Anurādhapura is in the south-west direction,

original: evaṃ taṃ uyyānaṃ kusinārāya dakkhiṇapacchimadisāyaṃ hoti. Tasmāti yasmā nagaraṃ pavisitukāmā
analyzed: evam tam uyyānam kusinārāya dakkhiṇa pacchima disāyam hoti tasmā ati yasmā nagaram pavisitu kāmā
translated: Thus the park was to the south-west of Kusinārā.

original: uyyānato upecca vattanti gacchanti etenāti “upavattana”nti vuccati, taṃ sālapantibhāvena
analyzed: uyyānataḥ upecca vattanti gacchanti etena ati upavattananti vuccati tam sāla panti bhāvena
translated: Since those who wanted to enter the city went out from the park and turned back by this way, it is called the “turning-back place” .🔽The grove of twin sal trees was situated there.🔽In the middle of it, they say,

original: ṭhitaṃ sālavanaṃ. Antarenāti vemajjhe. Tassa kira mañcakassāti tattha paññapiyamānassa
analyzed: ṭhitam sāla vanam antarena ati vemajjhe tassa kira mañcakassa ati tattha paññapiyamānassa
translated: in the middle of that couch.🔽There too, etc.

original: tassa mañcakassa. Tatrāpi…pe… eko pādabhāgassa, tasmā “antarena yamakasālāna”nti
analyzed: tassa mañcakassa ekaḥ pāda bhāgassa tasmai antarena
translated: One part of the foot, therefore, it is said, “between the twin sal trees.”🔽Entwining, as if entwining each other by means of the branches of the trees that were joined together.

original: vuttaṃ. Saṃsibbitvāti aññamaññaāsattaviṭapasākhatāya saṃsibbitvā viya. “Ṭhitasākhā”tipi
analyzed: vuttam saṃsibbitvā ti saṃsibbitvā viya ṭhita sākhā atipi
translated: “The branches stood up” is also said in the commentary.

original: vuttaṃ aṭṭhakathāyaṃ. Yaṃ pana pāḷiyaṃ “uttarasīsakaṃ mañcakaṃ paññapehī”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: vuttam aṭṭhakathāyam yam pana pāḷiyam uttara sīsakam mañcakam paññapehi iti vuttam
translated: But what is said in the text, “Lay out the couch with the head facing north,”

original: taṃ pacchimadassanaṃ daṭṭhuṃ āgatānaṃ devatānaṃ daṭṭhuṃ yogyatāvasena vuttaṃ. Keci
analyzed: tam pacchima dassanam daṭṭhum āgatānam devatānam daṭṭhum yogyatā vasena vuttam keci
translated: was said in order to make it suitable for the devas who had come to see the final passing away to look on.

original: pana “uttaradisāvilokanamukhaṃ pubbadisāsīsakaṃ katvā mañcakaṃ paññapehīti attho”ti
analyzed: pana uttara disā vilokana mukham pubba disā sīsakam katvā mañcakam paññapehi iti attho ti
translated: But some say that the meaning is: “Lay out the couch with the head to the north and the face to the east.”

original: vadanti, taṃ tesaṃ matimattaṃ.
analyzed: vadanti tam tesam matimattam
translated: They are only their opinion.

original: Ete nāgānamuttamāti ete gottato gocariādināmakā hatthināgesu balena seṭṭhatamā. Majjhimaṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: ete nāgānam uttamā ti ete hatthi nāgesu balena seṭṭhatamā
translated: These are the best of elephants: these elephants named by their clan, their habitat, etc., are the best in strength among the tuskers. But in the Majjhima Commentary

original: pana keci hatthino ito aññathā āgatā, so pana nesaṃ nāmamattakato bhedo daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: pana keci hatthinaḥ itas aññathā āgatā so pana nesam nāma mattakataḥ bhedaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: some elephants are given in a different way. But that is a difference only in the mere names of the elephants.

original: Paribhuttakālato paṭṭhāya…pe… parikkhayaṃ gataṃ, “na pana paribhuttappaccayā”ti heṭṭhā
analyzed: paribhutta kālato paṭṭhāya pe parikkhayam gatam na pana paribhutta paccayā ati heṭṭhā
translated: Since the time of his being dominated … down to … has come to an end. The meaning should be understood in the way stated below with “but not because of being dominated” .🔽In the Caṅgīḷa Sutta: in the Ūmi River.

original: vuttanayeneva attho daṭṭhabbo. Caṅgavāreti ūmiyaṃ. Katokāsassa kammassa vasena yathāsamuṭṭhito
analyzed: vutta nayena iva atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo caṅga vāre iti ūmiyam kata ukāsassa kammassa vasena yathā samuṭṭhito
translated: The disease that arose by the power of the deed that had been done,🔽overwhelmed the health, thus it is said “as if.”

original: rogo ārogyaṃ abhimaddatīti katvā etamatthaṃ dassento “viyā”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmā bhagavā🔽heṭṭhā vuttanayena kappaṃ, kappāvasesaṃ vā ṭhātuṃ samattho eva, tattakaṃ kālaṃ ṭhāne🔽payojanābhāvato āyusaṅkhāre ossajjitvā tādisassa kammassa okāsaṃ adāsi, tasmā etamatthaṃ
analyzed: rogaḥ ārogyam abhimaddati iti katvā etam attham dassentaḥ viyā ti vuttam yasmai bhagavā  heṭṭhā vutta nayena kappam kappa avasesam vā ṭhātum samatthaḥ eva tattakam kālam ṭhāne  payojana abhāvataḥ āyu saṅkhāre ossajjitvā tādisassa kammassa okāsam adāsi tasmai etam attham
translated: Because the Blessed One🔽is able to remain for an aeon or for the remainder of an aeon in the way stated above, he gave an opportunity for such a deed by relinquishing the life formation for that period,

original: dassento “viyā”tipi vattuṃ yujjatiyeva.
analyzed: dassentaḥ viyā atipi vattum
translated: since there was no purpose in remaining any longer. Therefore it is fitting to say “as if” in order to show this meaning.

original: Kusalaṃ kātabbaṃ maññissanti “evaṃ mahapphalaṃ, evaṃ mahānisaṃsaṃ, mahānubhāvañca taṃ kusala”nti.
analyzed: kusalam kātabbam maññissanti evam mahapphalam evam mahā nisaṃsam mahā anubhāvañca tat kusalanti
translated: They will think that what is wholesome should be done, thinking: “Thus it is fruitful, thus it has great fruit, thus it has great advantage, thus it has great influence, that wholesome state.”

original: Ekassāpi sattassa vaṭṭadukkhavūpasamo buddhānaṃ garutaro hutvā upaṭṭhāti atidullabhabhāvato, tasmā “aparampi passatī”tiādi vuttaṃ, svāyamattho māgaṇḍiyasuttena dīpetabbo.
analyzed: ekassa api sattassa vaṭṭa dukkha vūpasamaḥ buddhānam garutaraḥ hutvā upaṭṭhāti ati dullabha bhāvato tasmai aparam pi passati itiādi vuttam su ayam atthaḥ māgaṇḍiya suttena dīpetabbaḥ
translated: The stilling of the suffering and stress of a single being occurs to Buddhas as more weighty than the whole world of beings, because it is so very hard to find, and that is why it is said that “he sees another” and so on. And this meaning should be illustrated by the Magandiya Sutta .

original: Tatiyaṃ pana kāraṇaṃ sattānaṃ uppajjanakaanatthapariharaṇanti taṃ dassento puna “aparampi passatī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: tatiyam pana kāraṇam sattānam uppajjanaka anattha pariharaṇanti tam dassentaḥ puna aparam pi passati itiādim āha
translated: But the third reason is the warding off of the non-utility of beings’ appearance, and so, showing that, he said “He sees another” and so on.

original: Sīhaseyyanti. Ettha sayanaṃ seyyā, sīhassa viya seyyā sīhaseyyā, taṃ sīhaseyyaṃ. Atha vā sīhaseyyanti seṭṭhaseyyaṃ, yadidaṃ atthadvayaṃ parato āgamissati.
analyzed: sīhaseyyanti ettha sayanam seyyā sīhassa viya seyyā sīha seyyā tam sīhaseyyam atha vā sīhaseyyanti seṭṭha seyyam yat idam attha dvayam paratas āgamissati
translated: Lion-like posture: here lying is lying down, and the lying down of a lion is a lion’s lying down, that is, a lion’s posture. Or alternatively, lion-like posture is best lying down, and that is what will come later as the two meanings of “lion’s lying down.”

original: “Vāmena passena sentī”ti evaṃ vuttā kāmabhogiseyyā, dakkhiṇapassena sayāno nāma natthi dakkhiṇahatthassa sarīraggahaṇādiyogakkhamato, purisavasena cetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vāmena passena senti iti evam vuttā kāmabhogi seyyā dakkhiṇa passena sayānaḥ nāma na atthi dakkhiṇa hatthassa sarīra ggahaṇa ādi yogakkhamato purisa vasena ca itam vuttam
translated: The lying down of one who enjoys sensual pleasures is that described thus “They lie on their left side” . There is no lying down on the right side because the right hand is needed for supporting the body and so on. And this is said with reference to a man.

original: Ekena passena sayituṃ na sakkonti dukkhuppattito.
analyzed: ekena passena sayitum na sakkonti dukkha uppattito
translated: They cannot lie on one side because of the pain that would arise.

original: Ayaṃ sīhaseyyāti ayaṃ evaṃ vuttā sīhaseyyā. “Tejussadattā”ti iminā sīhassa abhīrubhāvaṃ
analyzed: ayam sīha seyyā ati ayam evam vuttā sīha seyyā tejussa dattā ati iminā sīhassa abhīru bhāvam
translated: This is the lion’s posture. “Because of his great majesty” shows that the lion is fearless.

original: dasseti. Bhīrukā hi sesamigā attano āsayaṃ pavisitvā santāsapubbakaṃ yathā tathā
analyzed: dasseti bhīrukāḥ hi sesa migāḥ attanaḥ āsayam pavisitvā santāsa pubbakam yathā tathā
translated: For other deer, being timid, enter their lairs and lie down in a heap,

original: sayanti, sīho pana abhīrubhāvato satokārī bhikkhu viya satiṃ upaṭṭhāpetvāva sayati.
analyzed: sayanti sīhaḥ pana abhīru bhāvato satokārī bhikkhu viya satim upaṭṭhāpetvā ava sayati
translated: but the lion, being fearless, lies down like a bhikkhu who is mindful.

original: Tenāha “purimapāde”tiādi. Dakkhiṇe purimapāde vāmassa purimapādassa ṭhapanavasena🔽dve purimapāde ekasmiṃ ṭhāne ṭhapetvā. Pacchimapādeti dve pacchimapāde. Vuttanayeneva
analyzed: tena āha purima pāda itiādi dakkhiṇe purima pāde vāmassa purima pādassa ṭhapana vasena  dve purima pāde ekasmim ṭhāne ṭhapetvā pacchima pāda iti dve pacchima pāde vutta nayena iva
translated: Therefore it is said: “He lies down after placing the right paw on the left flank, and the left paw on the right flank, and the tail between the thighs.”🔽He places the two front paws in one place by placing the right paw on the left flank and the left paw on the right flank.

original: idhāpi ekasmiṃ ṭhāne pādaṭṭhapanaṃ veditabbaṃ, ṭhitokāsasallakkhaṇaṃ abhīrubhāveneva.
analyzed: idha api ekasmim ṭhāne pādaṭṭhapanam veditabbam ṭhita ukāsa sat lakkhaṇam abhīru bhāvena iva
translated: The hind paws are the two hind legs. The placing of the paws should be understood in one place in the same way as the placing of the front paws.

original: “Sīsaṃ pana ukkhipitvā”tiādinā vuttā sīhakiriyā anutrāsapabujjhanaṃ viya abhīrubhāvasiddhā
analyzed: sīsam pana ukkhipitvā iti ādinā vuttā sīha kiriyā anutrāsa pabujjhanam viya abhīru bhāva siddhā
translated: The lion’s action mentioned in the passage beginning with “he raises his head” is established by his fearlessness, like the waking up without fear.

original: dhammatāvasenevāti veditabbā. Sīhavijambhitavijambhanaṃ ativelaṃ ekākārena ṭhapitānaṃ
analyzed: dhamma tā vasena iva ati veditabbā sīha vijambhita vijambhanam ativelam eka ākārena ṭhapitānam
translated: it should be understood as being in the sense of the natural state. The lion’s yawn is the stretching of the limbs after sleeping.

original: sarīrāvayavānaṃ gamanādikiriyāsu yogyabhāvāpādanatthaṃ. Tikkhattuṃ sīhanādanadanaṃ
analyzed: sarīra avayavānam gamana ādi kiriyāsu yogya bhāva āpādana tham tikkhattum sīha nāda nadanam
translated: it should be understood as being in the normal way. The lion’s yawn is for the purpose of making the limbs, which have been stretched out in one way for a long time, fit for the activities of going, etc.,

original: appesakkhamigajātapariharaṇatthaṃ.
analyzed: appesakkha miga jāta pariharaṇa attham
translated: The lion’s roar is for the purpose of keeping away from the neighbourhood of his lair animals of small account.

original: Seti abyāvaṭabhāvena pavattati etthāti seyyā, catutthajjhānameva seyyā catutthajjhānaseyyā.🔽Kiṃ pana taṃ catutthajjhānanti? Ānāpānacatutthajjhānaṃ, tato hi vuṭṭhahitvā vipassanaṃ
analyzed: sā iti abyāvaṭa bhāvena pavattati ettha ati seyyā catuttha jhānam eva seyyā catuttha jhāna seyyā  kim pana tam catuttha jhānan ti āna apāna catuttha jhānam tatas hi vuṭṭhahitvā vipassanam
translated: The bed is that in which he lies down without turning away; the bed of the fourth jhāna is the fourth jhāna itself.

original: vaḍḍhetvā bhagavā anukkamena aggamaggaṃ adhigantvā tathāgato jātoti. “Tayidaṃ padaṭṭhānaṃ🔽nāma, na seyyā, tathāpi yasmā ‘catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantarā bhagavā parinibbāyī’ti
analyzed: vaḍḍhetvā bhagavā anukkamena agga maggam adhigantvā tathāgataḥ jātaḥ iti tayā idam padaṭṭhānaṃ  nāma na seyyā tathā api yasmā catuttha jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantarā bhagavā parinibbāyi iti
translated: But what is that fourth jhāna? It is the fourth jhāna of in-breaths and out-breaths, for it is after emerging from that that he reached the supramundane jhāna, and after developing insight and reaching the supramundane path, he became a Perfect One.🔽This is the footing for the bed,🔽but it is not the bed. Nevertheless, since it is said, “The Blessed One attained final Nibbāna after emerging from the fourth jhāna” ,🔽some say that the bed of the Tathāgata is the attainment of the fourth jhāna of the sense sphere.

original: vakkhati, tasmā lokiyacatutthajjhānasamāpatti eva tathāgataseyyā”ti keci, evaṃ sati
analyzed: tasmā lokiya catuttha jhāna samāpatti eva tathāgata seyyā ti keci evam sati
translated: But if that is so,

original: parinibbānakālikāva tathāgataseyyāti āpajjati, na ca bhagavā lokiyacatutthajjhānasamāpajjanabahulo🔽vihāsi. Aggaphalavasena pavattaṃ panettha catutthajjhānaṃ veditabbaṃ. Tattha yathā
analyzed: parinibbāna kālikā ava tathāgata seyyā ti āpajjati na ca bhagavā lokiya catuttha jjhāna samāpajjana bahulaḥ  vihāsi agga phala vasena pavattam pana ittha catuttha jhānam veditabbam tattha yathā
translated: and that the Blessed One’s posture at the time of attaining Nibbāna was the Tathāgata’s posture. But the Blessed One did not live much in the attainment of the fourth jhāna of the worlds.

original: sattānaṃ niddupagamanalakkhaṇā seyyā bhavaṅgacittavasena hoti, sā ca nesaṃ paṭhamajātisamanvayā
analyzed: sattānam niddupagamana lakkhaṇā seyyā bhavaṅga citta vasena hoti sā ca na īsam paṭhama jāti samanvayā
translated: But the fourth jhāna that occurs as the highest fruit should be understood as intended here. Herein, just as the posture of lying down has the characteristic of the lying down of beings, and that is common to all kinds of rebirth and is due to the life-continuum consciousness,

original: yebhuyyavuttikā, evaṃ bhagavato ariyajātisamanvayaṃ yebhuyyavuttikaṃ aggaphalabhūtaṃ
analyzed: yebhuyya vuttikāḥ evam bhagavataḥ ariya jāti samanvayam yebhuyya vuttikam agga phala bhūtam
translated: so the Blessed One’s posture of lying down, which is common to all kinds of noble rebirth and is due to the highest fruit, should be understood as the Tathāgata’s posture.

original: catutthajjhānaṃ “tathāgataseyyā”ti veditabbaṃ. Sīhaseyyā nāma seṭṭhaseyyāti āha “uttamaseyyā”ti.
analyzed: catuttha jhānam tathāgata seyyā ti veditabbam sīhaseyyā nāma seṭṭha seyyā iti āha uttama seyyā iti
translated: The lion’s posture is the best posture, so it is called “the supreme posture.”

original: Natthi etissā uṭṭhānanti anuṭṭhānā, seyyā, taṃ anuṭṭhānaseyyaṃ. “Ito uṭṭhahissāmī”ti
analyzed: natthi etissāḥ uṭṭhānanti anuṭṭhānā seyyā tam anuṭṭhāna seyyam itas uṭṭhahissāmi iti
translated: It has no rising, thus it is “without rising”; the posture is without rising, thus it is “the posture without rising.” Because there is no thinking, “I shall rise from here,”

original: manasikārassa abhāvato “uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā”ti na vuttaṃ. Etthāti etasmiṃ
analyzed: manasikārassa abhāvato uṭṭhāna saññam manasi karitvā iti na vuttam ettha ati etasmin
translated: it is not said that “having directed thought to the perception of rising” . Herein,

original: anuṭṭhānaseyyupagamane. Kāyavasena anuṭṭhānaṃ, na cittavasena, cittavasena ca anuṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: anuṭṭhānaseyyupagamane kāya vasena anuṭṭhānam na citta vasena citta vasena ca anuṭṭhānam
translated: and the going to sleep. The going to sleep is by means of the body, not by means of cognizance; and the going to sleep is by means of cognizance,

original: nāma niddupagamananti tadabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “niddāvasenā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bhavaṅgassāti
analyzed: nāma niddupagamanam ti tad abhāvam dassetum niddā vasena atiādi vuttam bhavaṅgassa ati
translated: not by means of the body. The words ‘ by means of sleep ’ are said to show the absence of that .

original: niddupagamanalakkhaṇassa bhavaṅgassa.
analyzed: niddupagamana lakkhaṇassa bhavaṅgassa
translated: The ‘ life-continuum ’ is the life-continuum characterized by the going to sleep.

original: Sabbapāliphullāti sabbatthakameva vikasanavasena phullā, na ekadesavikasanavasena.
analyzed: sabba pāli phullā ti sabbatthakam eva vikasana vasena phullā na eka desa vikasana vasena
translated: ‘ All in full flower ’ : they are in full flower by blossoming everywhere, not by blossoming in one place.

original: Tenāha “sabbe samantato pupphitā”ti. Ekacchannāti samphullapupphehi ekākārena sabbattheva🔽chāditā. Ullokapadumānīti heṭṭhā olokentāni viya tiṭṭhanapadumāni. Morapiñchakalāpo
analyzed: tena āha sabbe samantataḥ pupphitā ati eka channā ati samphulla pupphehi eka ākārena sabbattha eva  chāditāḥ ulloka padumāni iti heṭṭhā olokentāni tiṭṭhana padumāni
translated: Hence it is said ‘ all in full flower, all in bloom ’ . ‘ All in shade ’ : all the places are covered over as one with the flowers in full bloom.

original: viya pañcavaṇṇapupphasañchāditattā.
analyzed: viya pañca vaṇṇa puppha sañchādita ttā
translated: ‘ Like a peacock’s tail ’ : they are like a peacock’s tail because they are covered with flowers of five colours.

original: Nandapokkharaṇīsambhavānīti nandapokkharaṇītīrasambhavāni. Mahātumbamattanti āḷhakamattaṃ. Paviṭṭhānīti khittāni. Sarīrameva okirantīti sarīrameva ajjhokiranti.
analyzed: nanda pokkharaṇī sambhavāni iti nanda pokkharaṇī tīra sambhavāni mahātumba mattanti āḷhaka mattam paviṭṭhāni iti khittāni sarīram eva okiranti iti sarīram eva ajjhokiranti
translated: ‘ Originating in the Lake of Nanda ’ : originating on the bank of the Lake of Nanda. ‘ As big as a water-chestnut ’ : as big as a water-chestnut fruit. ‘ Scattered ’ : thrown. ‘ They cover the body ’ : they cover the body all over.

original: Devatānaṃ upakappanacandanacuṇṇānīti saṭṭhipi paññāsampi yojanāni vāyanakasetavaṇṇacandanacuṇṇāni.🔽Dibbagandhajālacuṇṇānīti dibbagandhadibbacuṇṇāni. Haritālaañjanacuṇṇādīnipi dibbāni
analyzed: devatānam upakappana candana cuṇṇāni iti yojanāni vāyanaka setavaṇṇa candana cuṇṇāni  dibba gandha jāla cuṇṇāni iti dibba gandha dibba cuṇṇāni haritāla añjana cuṇṇa ādīni pi dibbāni
translated: “Perfumes and sandal-wood powders for the deities”: sandal-wood powders of the colour of the autumn star, which are wafted about for fifty or sixty leagues.

original: paramasugandhāni evāti veditabbāni. Tenevāha “sabbadibbagandhavāsavikatiyo”ti.
analyzed: parama sugandhāni eva ati veditabbāni tena iva āha
translated: “Divine perfumes and powders”: divine perfumes and divine powders. It should be understood that the divine perfumes and powders are the finest perfumes and powders. Hence it is said, “all divine perfumes and garlands” .

original: Ekacakkavāḷe sannipatitvā antalikkhe vajjanti mahābhinikkhamanakāle viya.
analyzed: eka cakkavāḷe sannipatitvā antalikkhe vajjanti mahā abhinikkhamana kāle viya
translated: They gather in the sky in the same way as they do at the time of the Great Renunciation.

original: Tāti devatā. Ganthamānā vāti mālaṃ racantiyo eva. Apariniṭṭhitā vāti yathādhippāyaṃ🔽pariyositā eva. Hatthena hatthanti attano hatthena parassa hatthaṃ. Gīvāya gīvanti
analyzed: devatā ganthamānā vāti mālam racantiyaḥ eva apariniṭṭhitā vāti yathā adhippāyam  pariyositāḥ eva hatthena hatthanti attanaḥ hatthena parassa hattham gīvāya gīvanti
translated: “They”: the deities. “Weaving garlands”: arranging garlands. “Unfinished”: not completed, not finished according to the wish.

original: kaṇṭhagāhavasena attano gīvāya parassa gīvaṃ. Gahetvāti āmasitvā. Mahāyaso mahāyasoti
analyzed: kaṇṭhagāha vasena attanaḥ gīvāya parassa gīvam gahetvā ati āmasitvā mahā yasaḥ mahā yasaḥ iti
translated: “Hand to hand”: with their own hands. “Neck to neck”: by seizing each other’s necks. “Having seized”: having touched. “Great fame, great fame”:

original: āmeḍitavasena aññamaññaṃ ālāpavacanaṃ.
analyzed: āmeḍita vasena aññamaññam ālāpa vacanam
translated: having called out to each other in a loud voice.

original: 199. Mahantaṃ ussāhanti tathāgatassa pūjāsakkāravasena pavattiyamānaṃ mahantaṃ ussāhaṃ disvā.
analyzed: mahantam ussāhanti tathāgatassa pūjā sakkāra vasena pavattiyamānam mahantam ussāham disvā
translated: On seeing the great effort that is made in the honouring and reverencing of the Perfect One,🔽The same practice: the practice of the prior stage.

original: Sāyeva pana paṭipadāti pubbabhāgapaṭipadā eva. Anucchavikattāti adhigantabbassa navavidhalokuttaradhammassa anurūpattā.
analyzed: sāya iva pana paṭipadā āti pubbabhāga paṭipadā eva anucchavika ttā ati adhigantabbassa navavidha lokuttara dhammassa anurūpa ttā
translated: The right way: because it is in conformity with the supramundane Dhamma of the ninefold supramundane states to be attained.🔽Virtue: here it is virtue as refraining that is meant.

original: Sīlanti cārittasīlamāha. Ācārapaññattīti cārittasīlaṃ. Yāva gotrabhutoti yāva gotrabhuñāṇaṃ,🔽tāva pavattetabbā samathavipassanā sammāpaṭipadā. Idāni taṃ sammāpaṭipadaṃ byatirekato,
analyzed: sīlanti cāritta sīlam āha ācāra paññatti iti cāritta sīlam yāva gotra bhuto ti yāva gotra bhuñāṇam  tāva pavattetabbā samatha vipassanā sammā paṭipadā idāni tam sammā paṭipadam byatirekato
translated: The right way: the right way is the development of serenity and insight that should be undertaken as long as the knowledge of the state of a clansman’s son lasts.🔽Now, in order to show that right way by way of its distinction and its conformity, the following is stated: “Therefore,” etc.

original: anvayato ca vibhāvetuṃ “tasmā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Jinakāḷasuttanti jinamahāvaḍḍhakinā ṭhapitaṃ
analyzed: anvayataḥ ca vibhāvetum tasmā itiādi vuttam jinakāḷa suttam ti jina mahāvaḍḍhakinā ṭhapitam
translated: The “Jina-kala-sutta” is the sutta that was placed by the Great Promoter of the Jina,

original: vajjetabbagahetabbadhammasandassanakāḷasuttaṃ sikkhāpadamariyādaṃ, upāsakopāsikāvāresu
analyzed: vajjetabba gahetabba dhamma sandassana kāḷa suttam sikkhāpada mariyādam upāsaka upāsikā vāresu
translated: which shows the dhammas to be avoided and to be undertaken, the sutta-limit of the training precepts, the limit of the laity,🔽in the sections on the male and female lay followers,

original: “gandhapūjaṃ mālāpūjaṃ karotī”ti vacanaṃ cārittasīlapakkhe ṭhapetvā karaṇaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: gandha pūjam mālā pūjam karoti iti vacanam cāritta sīla pakkhe ṭhapetvā karaṇam sandhāya
translated: where it is said: “He makes offerings of perfumes and garlands.” Having placed it in the section on virtue as refraining,

original: vuttaṃ, tena bhikkhubhikkhunīnampi tathākaraṇaṃ anuññātamevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam tena bhikkhu bhikkhunīnam pi tathākaraṇam anuññātam eva iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: So it should be regarded as allowed for nuns as well as for monks.

original: Ayañhīti dhammānudhammapaṭipadaṃ sandhāya vadati.
analyzed: ayam hi iti dhamma anudhamma paṭipadam sandhāya vadati
translated: “This” : he is referring to the practice of the Dhamma in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: Upavāṇattheravaṇṇanā
analyzed: upavāṇatthera vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the Elder Upavana

original: 200. Apanesīti ṭhitappadesato yathā apagacchati, evamakāsi, na pana nibbhacchi. Tenāha
analyzed: apanesi iti ṭhita ppadesataḥ yathā apagacchati evam akāsi na pana nibbhacchi tena āha
translated: “He removed”: he did so in such a way that they went away from the place where they were standing, but he did not banish them. Therefore he said

original: “ānando”tiādi. Vuttasadisā vāti samacittapariyāyadesanāyaṃ vuttasadisā eva. Āvārentoti chādento.
analyzed: ānandaḥ tiādi vutta sadisā vā ti vutta sadisā eva āvārento ti chādento
translated: “Ananda” and so on. “Like the one already stated” : like the one stated in the teaching of the Discourse on Equanimity of Mind.🔽“He covered them”: he concealed them.

original: Yasmā kassapassabuddhassa cetiye ārakkhadevatā ahosi, tasmā therova tejussado, na aññe arahantoti ānetvā yojanā.
analyzed: yasmā kassapassabuddhassa cetiye ārakkha devatā ahosi tasmā theraḥ uva tejussadaḥ na aññe arahanto ti ānetvā yojanā
translated: Since he was a guardian deity of the shrine of the Buddha Kassapa, the Elder himself was a mass of fire, not the other arahants.

original: Idāni āgamanato paṭṭhāya tamatthaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “vipassimhi kira sammāsambuddhe”tiādi
analyzed: idāni āgamanataḥ paṭṭhāya tam attham vitthārataḥ dassetum vipassimhi kira sammāsambuddha itiādi
translated: Now, in order to show in detail the meaning beginning with the coming, he said, “It is said that in the time of the Supreme Buddha Vipassi” and so on.🔽“The deities of the realm of the Four Great Kings” should be taken in the sense of the “cow-pen” simile,

original: āraddhaṃ. “Cātumahārājikā devatā”ti idaṃ gobalībaddañāyena gahetabbaṃ bhummadevatādīnampi
analyzed: āraddham cātumahārājikāḥ devatā iti idam gobalībaddañāyena gahetabbam bhummadevatā ādīnam pi
translated: because the deities of the earth, etc., are included in them.

original: tappariyāpannattā. Tesaṃ manussānaṃ.
analyzed: tad pariyāpanna ttā tesam manussānam
translated: “Of those people” .

original: Tatthāti kassapassa bhagavato cetiye.
analyzed: tattha ati kassapassa bhagavataḥ cetiye
translated: “There” : at the shrine of the Blessed One Kassapa.

original: 201. Adhivāsentīti rocenti.
analyzed: adhivāsenti iti rocenti
translated: Adhivāsentīti rocentīti.

original: Chinnapāto viya chinnapāto, taṃ chinnapātaṃ, bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso yaṃ. Āvaṭṭantīti
analyzed: chinna pātaḥ viya tam chinna pātam bhāva napuṃsaka niddesaḥ yam āvaṭṭanti iti
translated: Chinnapāto viya chinnapāto, taṃ chinnapātaṃ, bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso yaṃ. Āvaṭṭantīti

original: abhimukhabhāvena vaṭṭanti. Yattha patitā, tato katipayaratanaṭṭhānaṃ vaṭṭanavaseneva
analyzed: abhimukha bhāvena vaṭṭanti yattha patitā katipaya ratana ṭṭhānam vaṭṭana vasena iva
translated: abhimukhabhāvena vaṭṭanti. Yattha patitā, tato katipayaratanaṭṭhānaṃ vaṭṭanavaseneva

original: gantvā puna yathāpatitameva ṭhānaṃ vaṭṭanavasena āgacchanti. Tenāha “āvaṭṭantiyo
analyzed: gantvā puna yathā patitam eva ṭhānam vaṭṭana vasena āgacchanti tena āha
translated: gantvā puna yathāpatitameva ṭhānaṃ vaṭṭanavasena āgacchanti. Tenāha “āvaṭṭantiyo

original: patitaṭṭhānameva āgacchantī”ti. Vivaṭṭantīti yattha patitā, tato vinivaṭṭanti. Tenāha
analyzed: patita ṭṭhānam eva āgacchanti iti vivaṭṭanti iti yattha patitā tatas vinivaṭṭanti tena āha
translated: patitaṭṭhānameva āgacchantī”ti. Vivaṭṭantīti yattha patitā, tato vinivaṭṭanti. Tenāha

original: “patitaṭṭhānato parabhāgaṃ vaṭṭamānā gacchantī”ti. Purato vaṭṭanaṃ āvaṭṭanaṃ, itaraṃ
analyzed: patita ṭṭhānataḥ para bhāgam vaṭṭamānāḥ gacchanti iti puratas vaṭṭanam āvaṭṭanam itaram
translated: “patitaṭṭhānato parabhāgaṃ vaṭṭamānā gacchantī”ti. Purato vaṭṭanaṃ āvaṭṭanaṃ, itaraṃ

original: tividhampi vivaṭṭananti dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Devatā dhāretuṃ na sakkoti
analyzed: tividham pi vivaṭṭanam ti dassetum api ca itiādi vuttam devatāḥ dhāretum na sakkoti
translated: tividhampi vivaṭṭananti dassetuṃ “apicā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Devatā dhāretuṃ na sakkoti

original: udakaṃ viya osīdanato. Tenāha “tatthā”tiādi. Tatthāti pakatipathaviyaṃ. Devatā osīdanti
analyzed: udakam viya osīdanataḥ tena āha tattha atiādi tattha ati pakati pathaviyam devatāḥ osīdanti
translated: udakaṃ viya osīdanato. Tenāha “tatthā”tiādi. Tatthāti pakatipathaviyaṃ. Devatā osīdanti

original: dhātūnaṃ saṇhasukhumālabhāvato. Pathaviyaṃ pathaviṃ māpesunti pakatipathaviyaṃ attano
analyzed: dhātūnam saṇha sukhu māla bhāvataḥ pathaviyam pathavim māpesunti pakati pathaviyam attanaḥ
translated: and the elements are of a soft and delicate nature.

original: sarīraṃ dhāretuṃ samatthaṃ iddhānubhāvena pathaviṃ māpesuṃ.
analyzed: sarīram dhāretum samattham iddha anubhāvena pathavim
translated: In the earth, they created earth by their psychic power, capable of supporting their bodies.

original: Kāmaṃ domanasse asatipi ekacco rāgo hotiyeva, rāge pana asati domanassassa asambhavo
analyzed: kāmam domanasse asati pi ekaccaḥ rāgaḥ hotiyā iva rāge pana asati domanassassa asambhavo
translated: Although there may be no grief, there may be lust, but when there is no lust, grief cannot arise.

original: evāti tadekaṭṭhabhāvatoti āha “vītarāgāti pahīnadomanassā”ti. Silāthambhasadisā iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu nibbikāratāya.
analyzed: eva iti tad ekaṭṭha bhāvato ti āha vīta rāgā iti pahīna domanassā iti silā thambha sadisā iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu nibbikāra tāya
translated: Therefore, because they are of the same nature, it is said that they are free from grief, that is, free from lust. They are like stone pillars, because they are indifferent to what is agreeable and disagreeable.

original: Catusaṃvejanīyaṭṭhānavaṇṇanā
analyzed: catu saṃvejanīya ṭhāna vaṇṇanā
translated: The Four Places of Spiritual Composure

original: 202. Apāragaṅgāyāti gaṅgāya orambhāge. “Saṅkārachaḍḍakasammajjaniyo gahetvā”tiādi
analyzed: apāragaṅgāya ati gaṅgāya orambhāge saṅkāra chaḍḍaka sammajjaniyaḥ gahetvā atiādi
translated: Downstream from the Ganges: below the Ganges. Taking the sweepings and the dustheap:

original: attano attano vasanaṭṭhāne vattakaraṇākāradassanaṃ. “Evaṃ dvīsu kālesū”tiādi nidassanatthaṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ attanaḥ vasana ṭṭhāne vatta karaṇa ākāra dassanam evam dvīsu kālesu utiādi nidassana attham
translated: showing the way of living in their respective dwellings. Thus, in the two periods: this is said for the purpose of illustration.

original: paccāmasanaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā adhigataṃ.
analyzed: paccāmasanam tam heṭṭhā adhigatam
translated: The return of the alms food is explained below.

original: Kammasādhano sambhāvanattho bhāvanīya-saddoti āha “manasā bhāvite sambhāvite”ti. Dutiyavikappe pana bhāvanaṃ, vaḍḍhanañca paṭipakkhapahānatoti āha “ye vā”tiādi.
analyzed: kamma sādhanaḥ sambhāvanā atthaḥ bhāvanīya saddaḥ iti āha manasā bhāvite sambhāvitā iti dutiya vikappe pana bhāvanam vaḍḍhanam ca paṭipakkha pahānato ti āha ye vā itiādi
translated: and so he said “or else, the abandoning of opposition is development” .

original: Buddhādīsu tīsu vatthūsu pasannacittassa, na kammaphalasaddhāmattena. Sā cassa saddhāsampadā
analyzed: buddha ādīsu tīsu vatthūsu pasanna cittassa na kamma phala saddhā mattena sā ca ssa saddhā sampadā
translated: The mind of one who has confidence in the three things beginning with the Enlightened One is confident, not merely through faith in kamma-result,🔽and that is how it should be understood.

original: evaṃ veditabbāti phalena hetuṃ dassento “vattasampannassā”ti āha. Saṃvego nāma sahottappañāṇaṃ,
analyzed: evam veditabbā iti phalena hetum dassentaḥ vatta sampannassa iti āha saṃvegaḥ nāma sahottappa ñāṇam
translated: And showing the cause by means of the fruit he said “of one who has virtue” . Arousal is knowledge accompanied by urgency ;

original: abhijātiṭṭhānādīnipi tassa uppattihetūni bhavantīti āha “saṃvegajanakānī”ti.
analyzed: abhijāti ṭṭhāna ādīni pi tassa uppatti hetūni bhavanti iti āha saṃvega janakāni iti
translated: and the places of birth, etc., are also causes for its arising, which is why he said “arousing” .

original: Cetiyapūjanatthaṃ cārikā cetiyacārikā. Sagge patiṭṭhahissantiyeva buddhaguṇārammaṇāya kusalacetanāya saggasaṃvattaniyabhāvato.🔽Ānandapucchākathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: cetiya pūjana attham cārikā cetiya cārikā sagge patiṭṭhahissantiyā iva buddha guṇa ārammaṇāya kusala cetanāya sagga saṃvattaniya bhāvato  ānanda pucchā kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The “cetiya-visit” is the going on a visit to a shrine for the purpose of worshipping a shrine.🔽The “women” are the female sex.

original: 203. Etthāti mātugāme. Ayaṃ uttamā paṭipatti, yadidaṃ adassanaṃ, dassanamūlakattā
analyzed: ettha ati mātugāme ayam uttamā paṭipatti yat idam adassanam dassana mūla kattā
translated: This is the highest practice, namely, non-seeing,🔽because seeing is the root of the defilements.

original: tappaccayānaṃ sabbānatthānaṃ. Lobhoti kāmarāgo. Cittacalanā paṭipattiantarāyakaro
analyzed: tad paccayānam sabbānatthānam lobho ti kāma rāgo citta calanā paṭipatti antarāya karo
translated: and all the harm that has its source in that. Greed is sensual lust. Agitation is a disturbance of mind that is an obstacle to progress.

original: cittakkhobho. Murumurāpetvāti saaṭṭhikaṃ katvā khādane anuravadassanaṃ. Aparimitaṃ
analyzed: citta kkhobhaḥ murumurāpetvā ti sa aṭṭhikam katvā khādane anurava dassanam aparimitam
translated: Chewing with a smacking noise is chewing with a loud smacking sound. Eating with a full mouth is eating with a mouth already full.

original: kālaṃ dukkhānubhavanaṃ aparicchinnadukkhānubhavanaṃ. Vissāsoti visaṅgo ghaṭṭanābhāvo.🔽Otāroti tattha cittassa anuppaveso. Asihatthena verīpurisena, pisācenāpi khāditukāmena.🔽Āsīdeti akkamanādivasena bādheyya. Assāti mātugāmassa. Pabbajitehi kattabbakammanti
analyzed: kālam dukkha anubhavanam aparicchinna dukkha anubhavanam vissāsaḥ ati visaṅgaḥ ghaṭṭana abhāvaḥ  otāro ti tattha cittassa anuppavesaḥ asi hatthena verī purisena pisācena api khāditu kāmena  āsīda iti akkamana ādi vasena bādheyya assa āti mātu gāmassa pabbajitehi kattabba kammanti
translated: Experiencing suffering for an unlimited time is experiencing suffering for an indefinite time. Confidence is the absence of doubt, the absence of misgiving.🔽To be thrown in is to be thrown into the water. By a man with a sword in his hand, by an enemy, by a demon, by one who wants to eat him.

original: āmisapaṭiggahaṇādi pabbajitehi kātabbaṃ kammaṃ. Satīti vā kāyagatāsati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.🔽204. Atantibaddhāti abhāravahā. Pesitacittāti nibbānaṃ pati pesitacittā.
analyzed: āmisa paṭiggahaṇa ādi pabbajitehi kātabbam kammam satī iti vā kāya gatā asati upaṭṭhāpetabbā  a tanti baddhā ati abhāra vahā pesita cittā ati nibbānam pati pesita cittā
translated: To be attacked is to be attacked by being struck, etc. A mare is a female horse. The duty to be done by those gone forth is the duty to be done by those gone forth, such as receiving requisites, etc.🔽Mindfulness is mindfulness occupied with the body that should be established.🔽A debt is a debt that has to be paid. Sent forth is sent forth with a mind bent on Nibbāna.

original: 205. Vihatenāti kappāsavihananadhanunā pabbajaṭānaṃ vijaṭanavasena hatena. Tenāha
analyzed: vihatena ati kappāsa vihanana dhanunā pabbajaṭānam vijaṭana vasena hatena tena āha
translated: Cut off is cut off by a bow saw. Therefore it is said:

original: “supothitenā”ti, asaṅkaraṇavasena suṭṭhu pothitenāti attho, dassanīyasaṃvejanīyaṭṭhānakittanena
analyzed: su pothitena ati asaṅkaraṇa vasena suṭṭhu pothitena ati atthaḥ dassanīya saṃvejanīya ṭṭhāna kittanena
translated: “Well-wrapped up”: the meaning is, well wrapped up without mixing up. And by praising the place to be seen and inspiring awe,

original: ca vasanaṭṭhānaṃ kathitaṃ.
analyzed: ca vasanaṭṭhānam kathitam
translated: he has also described the place where he lived.

original: Ānandaacchariyadhammavaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Wonderful Qualities of Ānanda

original: 207. Theraṃ adisvā āmantesīti tattha adisvā āvajjanto therassa ṭhitaṭṭhānaṃ, pavattiñca ñatvā āmantesi.
analyzed: theram a disvā āmantesi iti tattha a disvā āvajjantaḥ therassa ṭhita ṭṭhānam pavattim ca ñatvā āmantesi
translated: “Not seeing the elder”: there, not seeing him, he was aware of the elder’s whereabouts and activities and then addressed him.

original: Kāyakammassa hitabhāvo hitajjhāsayena pavattitattāti āha “hitavuddhiyā katenā”ti.
analyzed: kāya kammassa hita bhāvaḥ hita ajjhāsayena pavatti tattā ti āha hita vuddhiyā katena ati
translated: The benefit of bodily action is its occurrence with a beneficial intention. Thus it is said: “done with the wish for welfare and growth.”

original: Sukhabhāvo kāyikadukkhābhāvo, cetasikasukhabhāvo cetasikasukhasamuṭṭhitattā cāti
analyzed: sukha bhāvo kāyika dukkha abhāvo cetasika sukha bhāvo cetasika sukha samuṭṭhita ttā ca ati
translated: The happiness is the absence of bodily pain and the presence of mental happiness, because it arises from mental happiness.

original: vuttaṃ “sukhasomanasseneva katenā”ti. Āvirahovibhāgato advayabhāvato advayenāti imamatthaṃ
analyzed: vuttam sukha somanassena iva katena ati ā viraha uvibhāgataḥ advaya bhāvataḥ advayena ati imam attham
translated: Thus it is said: “done with happiness and gladness.” In order to show the meaning of “without distinction” and “without duality” because of the absence of distinction and duality,

original: dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Satthu khettabhāvasampattiyā, therassa ajjhāsayasampattiyā
analyzed: dassetum yathā itiādi vuttam satthu khetta bhāva sampattiyā therassa ajjhāsaya sampattiyā
translated: it is said: “As if” and so on. Because of the excellence of the Teacher’s field and the excellence of the elder’s intention,

original: ca “ettakamida”nti pamāṇaṃ gahetuṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya pamāṇavirahitattā tassa kammassāti
analyzed: ca ettakam idam ti pamāṇam gahetum a sakkuṇeyya tāya pamāṇa virahita ttā tassa kammassa ati
translated: it is impossible to grasp the extent of that action, saying: “It is this much.” Thus it is said: “That action of his was immeasurable.”

original: āha “cakkavāḷampī”tiādi.
analyzed: āha cakka vāḷampi itiādi
translated: He said, “The world-sphere too,” and so on.

original: Evaṃ pavattitenāti evaṃ odissakamettābhāvanāya vasena pavattitena. Vivaṭṭūpanissayabhūtaṃ
analyzed: evam pavattitena ati evam odissaka mettā bhāvanāya vasena pavattitena vivaṭṭu upanissaya bhūtam
translated: “Thus developed”: thus by way of the development of loving-kindness with a directional object.

original: kataṃ upacitaṃ puññaṃ etenāti katapuñño, arahattādhigamāya katādhikāroti attho. Tenāha
analyzed: katam upacitam puññam etena ati kata puññaḥ arahattā adhigamāya kata adhikāraḥ ti attho tena āha
translated: “The merit that has been made, that has been accumulated, by him”: the merit that has been made, that has been accumulated, by him who has thus developed loving-kindness with a directional object. The meaning is: by him who has done what should be done for the attainment of arahatship. Therefore it was said:

original: “abhinīhārasampannosīti dassetī”ti.
analyzed: abhinīhāra sampanno asi iti dasseti iti
translated: “He shows that you have fulfilled the aspiration.”

original: 208. Katthaci saṅkucitaṃ hutvā ṭhitaṃ mahāpathaviṃ pattharanto viya, paṭisaṃhaṭaṃ🔽hutvā ṭhitaṃ ākāsaṃ vitthārento viya, catusaṭṭhādhikayojanasatasahassubbedhaṃ cakkavāḷagiriṃ
analyzed: katthaci saṅkucitam hutvā ṭhitam mahā pathavim pattharantaḥ viya paṭisaṃhaṭam  hutvā ṭhitam ākāsam vitthārentaḥ viya catu saṭṭha adhika yojana sata sahassa ubbedham cakkavāḷa girim
translated: In some places it is contracted and stands, as if it were stretching out the great earth;🔽it is as if it were expanding the space, which is contracted and stands;🔽it is as if it were lowering the world-sphere mountain, which is 3,200,000 leagues high;

original: adho osārento viya, aṭṭhasaṭṭhādhikasahassayojanasatasahassubbedhaṃ sineruṃ ukkhipento
analyzed: adhas osārentaḥ viya aṭṭha saṭṭha adhika sahassa yojana sata sahassa ubbedham sinerum ukkhipentaḥ
translated: it is as if it were lifting up Sineru, which is 1,600,000 leagues high;🔽it is as if it were shaking the great rose-apple tree, which is ten leagues in length and breadth, by seizing it at the trunk.

original: viya, satayojanāyāmavitthāraṃ mahājambuṃ khandhe gahetvā cālento viyāti pañca hi
analyzed: mahā jambum khandhe gahetvā cālentaḥ viyāti pañca hi
translated: For there are five

original: upamā hi therassa guṇakathā mahantabhāvadassanatthañceva aññesaṃ dukkaṭabhāvadassanatthañca
analyzed: upamā hi therassa guṇa kathā mahanta bhāva dassana attham ca iva aññesam dukkaṭa bhāva dassana attham ca
translated: The similes are for the purpose of showing the greatness of the Elder’s virtue and for the purpose of showing the faultiness of others.

original: āgatāva. Eteneva cāti ca-saddena “ahaṃ etarahi arahaṃ sammāsambuddho”, “sadevakasmiṃ
analyzed: āgatāva etena iva ca ati ca saddena aham etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ sa devakasmin
translated: and so on. By this word “and” the following are included: “I am now a Worthy One, a Perfect Sambuddha,” “In the world with its gods

original: lokasmiṃ natthi me paṭipuggalo”ti ca evaṃ ādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Byattoti khandhakosallādisaṅkhātena
analyzed: lokasmim natthi me paṭipuggalo ti ca evam ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo byattaḥ ti khandha kosalla ādi saṅkhātena
translated: and men there is no one who is my equal,” and so on. “Accomplished”: he is endowed with the extent of knowledge called “skill in the aggregates” and so on.

original: veyyattiyena samannāgato. Medhāvīti medhāsaṅkhātāya sammābhāvitāya paññāya samannāgato.
analyzed: veyyattiyena samannāgataḥ medhāvī iti medhā saṅkhātāya sammābhāvitāya paññāya samannāgataḥ
translated: “Wise”: he is endowed with the wisdom called “right development.”

original: 209. Paṭisanthāradhammanti pakaticārittavasena vuttaṃ, upagatānaṃ pana bhikkhūnaṃ🔽bhikkhunīnañca pucchāvissajjanavasena ceva cittarucivasena ca yathākālaṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: paṭisanthāra dhamman ti pakati cāritta vasena vuttam upagatānam pana bhikkhūnam  bhikkhunīnam ca pucchā vissajjana vasena ca iva citta ruci vasena ca yathākālam dhammaṃ
translated: “Conversant with the right method of reception”: this is said with reference to his ordinary behavior. But when monks and

original: desetiyeva, upāsakopāsikānaṃ pana upanisinnakathāvasena.
analyzed: upāsaka upāsikānam pana upanisinna kathā vasena
translated: nuns come to him, he teaches them the Dhamma with questions and answers and according to their inclinations. He also teaches the Dhamma to laymen at the appropriate time, in the course of a conversation.

original: Mahāsudassanasuttadesanāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Mahāsudassana Sutta

original: 210. Khuddaka-saddo patirūpavācī, ka-saddo appatthoti āha “khuddakanagaraketi nagarapatirūpake
analyzed: khuddaka saddaḥ patirūpa vācī ka saddaḥ appatthaḥ ti āha khuddaka nagaraka iti nagara patirūpake
translated: The word khuddaka is a synonym for “small.” The word ka is a synonym for “not.” Therefore the commentary says: “In small towns, which are like towns.”

original: sambādhe khuddakanagarake”ti. Dhuparavisālasaṇṭhānatāya taṃ “ujjaṅgalanagaraka”nti
analyzed: sambādhe khuddaka nagaraka iti dhupara visāla saṇṭhāna tāya tam ujjaṅgala nagarakam iti
translated: Because of its shape, which is like a dhūpa-visa tree, it is called “a town in a jungle.”

original: vuttanti āha “visamanagarake”ti. Aññesaṃ mahānagarānaṃ ekadesappamāṇatāya sākhāsadise.🔽Ettha ca “khuddakanagarake”ti iminā tassa nagarassa appakabhāvo vutto, “ujjaṅgalanagarake”ti
analyzed: vuttanti āha visama nagaraka iti aññesam mahā nagarānam eka desa ppamāṇa tāya sākhā sadise  ettha ca khuddaka nagaraka iti iminā tassa nagarassa appaka bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ujjaṅgala nagarakā iti
translated: Because of its size, which is only a part of other great towns, it is called “a branch town.”🔽And here, by the words “a little town” the smallness of that town is stated; by the words “a town in a cleft”🔽its inferiority due to the defect of the ground; and by the words “a branch town” its lack of importance.

original: iminā bhūmivipattiyā nihīnabhāvo, “sākhānagarake”ti iminā appadhānabhāvo. Sārappattāti
analyzed: iminā bhūmi vipattiyā nihīna bhāvaḥ sākhānagaraka iti iminā appadhāna bhāvaḥ sāra ppattā ati
translated: They had attained the essence,

original: vibhavasārādinā sāramahattaṃ pattā.
analyzed: vibhava sāra ādinā
translated: had attained the greatness of the essence by means of wealth, etc.

original: Kahāpaṇasakaṭanti ettha “dvikumbhaṃ sakaṭaṃ. Kumbho pana dasambaṇo”ti vadanti. Dve pavisantīti dve kahāpaṇasakaṭāni dve āyavasena pavisanti.
analyzed: ettha dvi kumbham sakaṭam kumbhaḥ pana vadanti dve pavisanti iti dve kahāpaṇa sakaṭāni dve āyavasena pavisanti
translated: Two cart-loads of kahāpaṇas: here they say that a cart-load is two kumbhas, and a kumbha is ten ambas. Two entered by way of two means: two cart-loads of kahāpaṇas entered by way of two means.

original: Subhikkhāti sulabhāhārā, sundarāhārā ca. Tenāha “khajjabhojjasampannā”ti. Saddaṃ
analyzed: subhikkhā ati sulabha āhārā sundara āhārā ca tena āha khajja bhojja sampannā iti saddam
translated: There was an abundance of food: there was an abundance of food that was easy to obtain and good. Therefore it is said: “Rich in food and drink.”🔽Making a sound: making a sound like the cry of a peacock through the joy of being satisfied.

original: karonteti ravasārinā tuṭṭhabhāvena koñcanādaṃ karonte. Avivittāti asuññā, kadāci
analyzed: karontā iti ravasārinā tuṭṭha bhāvena koñca nādam karonte avivittā ati asuññā kadāci
translated: Not deserted: not empty, not at any time.

original: ratho paṭhamaṃ gacchati, taṃ añño anubandhanto gacchati, kadāci dutiyaṃ vuttaratho
analyzed: ratho paṭhamam gacchati tam aññaḥ anubandhantaḥ gacchati kadāci dutiyam vutta ratho
translated: The first chariot goes, the other follows after it, sometimes the second chariot goes first,

original: paṭhamaṃ gacchati, itaro taṃ anubandhati evaṃ aññamaññaṃ anubandhamānā. Etthāti kusāvatīnagare.
analyzed: paṭhamam gacchati itaraḥ tam anubandhati evam aññam aññam anubandhamānāḥ ettha iti kusāvatī nagare
translated: The first chariot goes, and another follows it, sometimes the second chariot goes first, and the other follows it. Thus they go following each other. Here means in the city of Kusāvatī.

original: Tassa mahantabhāvato ceva iddhādibhāvato ca niccaṃ payojitāneva bheriādīni tūriyāni,
analyzed: tassa mahanta bhāvataḥ ca iva iddha ādi bhāvataḥ ca niccam bheri ādīni tūriyāni
translated: Because of its greatness and because of its magical power, etc., the musical instruments such as the drums are always played.

original: samma sammāti vā aññamaññaṃ piyālāpasaddo samma-saddo. Kaṃsatāḷādisabbatāḷāvacarasaddo
analyzed: samma samma iti vā aññam aññam piya alāpa saddo samma saddo kaṃsa tāḷa ādi sabba tāḷa avacara saddo
translated: The sound of “samma samma” is the sound of mutual friendly talk. The sound of “tāla” is the sound of all the “tāla” drums such as the bronze “tāla” drum, etc.

original: tāḷa-saddo, kūṭabheri-saddo kumbhathūṇasaddo.
analyzed: tāḷa saddo kūṭa bheri saddo kumbha thūṇa saddo
translated: The sound of the “kūṭabheri” is the sound of the “kumbathūṇa.”

original: Evarūpā saddā honti kacavarākiṇṇavīthitāya, araññe kandamūlapaṇṇādiggahaṇāya, tattha🔽dukkhajīvikatāya cāti yathākkamaṃ yojetabbaṃ. Idha na evaṃ ahosi devaloke viya sabbaso
analyzed: evarūpā saddāḥ honti kaca vara ākiṇṇa vīthitāya araññe kanda mūla paṇṇa ādi gahaṇāya tattha  dukkha jīvika tāya ca ati yathākkamam yojetabbam idha na evam ahosi deva loke viya sabbaso
translated: Such sounds are heard in the streets filled with rubbish, in the forest when gathering roots, leaves, etc., and there

original: paripuṇṇasampattikatāya.
analyzed: paripuṇṇa sampattika tāya
translated: because of the difficulty of living. But here it was not so, because of the complete perfection of all the requisites like in the deva world.

original: Mahantaṃ kolāhalanti saddhāsampannānaṃ devatānaṃ, upāsakānañca vasena purato purato
analyzed: mahantam kolāhalanti saddhā sampannānam devatānam upāsakānam ca vasena puratas puratas
translated: Great uproar means because of the devas endowed with faith and the lay followers, in front and in front,

original: mahatī ugghosanā hoti. Tattha bhagavantaṃ uddissa katassa vihārassa abhāvato, bhikkhusaṅghassa🔽ca mahantabhāvato te āgantvā…pe… pesesi. Pesento ca “kathañhi nāma bhagavā pacchime
analyzed: mahatī ugghosanā hoti tattha bhagavantam uddissa katassa vihārassa abhāvataḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa  ca mahanta bhāvato te āgantvā āpe pesesi pesento ca katham hi nāma bhagavā pacchime
translated: There was a great outcry. There, because of the absence of a monastery built for the Blessed One and because of the greatness of the bhikkhu🔽saṅgha, they came and sent a message. And when sending, he sent the message, “How is it that the Blessed One did not inform us of his passing away in the last

original: kāle attano pavattiṃ amhākaṃ nārocesi, nesaṃ domanassaṃ mā ahosī”ti “ajja kho vāseṭṭhā”tiādinā sāsanaṃ pesesi.
analyzed: kāle attanaḥ pavattim amhākam na arocesi na isam domanassam mā ahosi iti ajja kho vāseṭṭha ati ādinā sāsanam pesesi
translated: period? Let there be no sorrow for them.” “Today, Vasetthas,” and so on.

original: Mallānaṃ vandanāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: mallānam vandanā vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the homage of the Mallas

original: 211. Aghaṃ dukkhaṃ āventi pakāsentīti aghāvino, pākaṭībhūtadukkhāti āha “uppannadukkhā”ti.🔽Ñātisālohitabhāvena kulaṃ parivattati etthāti kulaparivattaṃ. Taṃ taṃkulīnabhāgena
analyzed: agham dukkham āventi pakāsenti iti aghāvino pākaṭībhūta dukkhā ati āha uppanna dukkhā iti  ñāti sālohita bhāvena kulam parivattati ettha ati kula parivattam tam taṃkulīna bhāgena
translated: The Mallas are those who send forth suffering, who make suffering manifest. He says, “those who have suffering arisen” .🔽The family circle is that which revolves around the family by reason of the state of being relatives and kinsmen. He says, “the family circle” ,

original: ṭhito sattanikāyo “kulaparivattaso”ti vuttanti āha “kulaparivatta”nti. Te pana taṃtaṃkulaparivattaparicchinnā
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ satta nikāyaḥ kula parivattaso ti vuttanti āha kula parivattanti te pana taṃ taṃ kula parivatta paricchinnā
translated: meaning the body of people who stand by reason of the state of being of such and such a family.

original: mallarājāno tasmiṃ nagare vīthiādisabhāgena vasantīti vuttaṃ “vīthisabhāgena ceva
analyzed: malla rājāno tasmin nagare vīthi ādi sabhāgena vasanti iti vuttam vīthi sabhāgena ca iva
translated: But those kings of the Mallas, who are distinguished by the family circle of such and such a family, dwell in that city by reason of the street, etc.,

original: racchāsabhāgena cā”ti.
analyzed: ca ati
translated: and so on. Therefore it is said, “by reason of the street and by reason of the market place.”

original: Subhaddaparibbājakavatthuvaṇṇanā
analyzed: subhadda paribbājaka vatthu vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the wanderer Subhadda

original: 212. Kaṅkhā eva kaṅkhādhammo. Ekato vāti bhūmiṃ avibhajitvā sādhāraṇatova. Bījato🔽ca aggaṃ gahetvā āhāraṃ sampādetvā dānaṃ bījaggaṃ. Gabbhakāleti gabbhadhāraṇato paraṃ🔽khīraggahaṇakāle. Tenāha “gabbhaṃ phāletvā khīraṃ niharitvā”tiādi. Puthukakāleti
analyzed: kaṅkhā eva kaṅkhā dhammo ekatas vā ati bhūmim a vibhajitvā sādhāraṇataḥ iva bījataḥ  ca aggam gahetvā āhāram sampādetvā dānam bīja aggam gabbha kāla iti gabbha dhāraṇataḥ param  khīra ggahaṇa kāle tena āha gabbham phāletvā khīram niharitvā atiādi puthuka kāla iti
translated: Doubt is a state of doubt. “On one side” means without dividing the ground, but making it common to all. “The first gift of seed” is the gift of seed that he made by gathering the first crop.

original: sassānaṃ nātipakke puthukayogyaphalakāle. Lāyanagganti pakkassa sassassa lavane lavanārambhe🔽dānaṃ adāsi. Lunassa sassassa veṇivasena bandhitvā ṭhapanaṃ veṇikaraṇaṃ. Tassa ārambhe
analyzed: sassānam na ati pakke puthuka yogya phala kāle pakkassa sassassa lavane lavana ārambhe  dānam adāsi lunassa sassassa veṇi vasena bandhitvā ṭhapanam veṇi karaṇam tassa ārambhe
translated: “The first gift of milk” is the gift of milk that he made after he had taken the milk when the calf was first put to the mother’s teat. Hence it is said: “Having burst open the calf’s skull and drawn out the milk” and so on. “The first gift of grain” is the gift of grain that he made when the grain was fit to be picked out one by one, that is, when the grain was not yet ripe enough to be reaped all at once. “The first gift of grass” is the gift of grass that he made when the grass was fit to be cut, that is, when the grass had grown to a sufficient height and was fit to be cut.

original: dānaṃ veṇaggaṃ. Veṇiyo pana ekato katvā rāsikaraṇaṃ kalāpo. Tattha aggadānaṃ kalāpaggaṃ.🔽Kalāpato nīharitvā maddane aggadānaṃ khalaggaṃ. Madditaṃ ophuṇitvā dhaññassa rāsikaraṇe
analyzed: dānam veṇaggam veṇiyaḥ pana ekatas katvā rāsi karaṇam kalāpo tattha agga dānam kalāpaggam 🔽kalāpataḥ nīharitvā maddane agga dānam khalaggam madditam ophuṇitvā dhaññassa rāsikaraṇe
translated: “The first gift of fodder” is the gift of fodder that he made when the grass was fit to be tied into bundles, that is, when the grass had grown to a sufficient height and was fit to be tied into bundles. “The first gift of sheaves” is the gift of sheaves that he made after he had reaped the grain and tied it into sheaves. “The first gift of grain” is the gift of grain that he made after he had threshed the sheaves and taken out the grain.

original: aggadānaṃ khalabhaṇḍaggaṃ. Dhaññassa khalato koṭṭhe pakkhipane aggadānaṃ koṭṭhaggaṃ.
analyzed: aggadānam khalabhaṇḍaggam dhaññassa khalato koṭṭhe pakkhipane aggadānam koṭṭhaggam
translated: The first gift is the gift of the best. The first gift of the grain is the gift of the best of the grain.

original: Uddharitvāti koṭṭhato uddharitvā.
analyzed: uddharitvā iti koṭṭhataḥ uddharitvā
translated: Having taken out: having taken out from the store.

original: “Nava aggadānāni adāsī”ti iminā “kathaṃ nu kho ahaṃ satthu santike aggatova mucceyya”nti
analyzed: nava agga dānāni adāsi iti iminā katham nu kho aham satthu santike aggataḥ uva mucceyyanti
translated: “He gave nine first gifts” . By this he shows that he is a fit vessel for the teaching of the best of the Dhamma, thinking, “How can I be released right in the presence of the Teacher?”

original: aggaggadānavasena vivaṭṭūpanissayassa kusalassa katūpacitattā, ñāṇassa ca tathā paripākaṃ🔽gatattā aggadhammadesanāya tassa bhājanabhāvaṃ dasseti. Tenāha “imaṃ aggadhammaṃ
analyzed: aggagga dāna vasena vivaṭṭu upanissayassa kusalassa kata upacita ttā ñāṇassa ca tathā paripākam  gata ttā agga dhamma desanāya tassa bhājana bhāvam dasseti tena āha imam agga dhammaṃ
translated: because of the wholesome root of the opening up of the support by way of the best of the first gifts, and because of the maturity of the knowledge in that way.

original: tassa desessāmī”tiādi. Ohīyitvā saṅkocaṃ āpajjitvā.
analyzed: tassa desessāmi itiādi ohīyitvā saṅkocam āpajjitvā
translated: Therefore he says, “I will teach him the best of the Dhamma” and so on. Having given up: having fallen into a state of contraction.

original: 213. Aññātukāmova na sandiṭṭhiṃ parāmāsī. Abbhaññiṃsūti sandehajātassa pucchāvacananti

original: katvā jāniṃsūti atthamāha. Tenāha pāḷiyaṃ “sabbeva na abbhaññiṃsū”ti. Nesanti pūraṇādīnaṃ.

original: Sā paṭiññāti “karoto kho mahārāja kārayato”tiādinā paṭiññātā, sabbaññupaṭiññā eva
analyzed: sā paṭiññāti karotaḥ kho mahā rāja kārayataḥ iti ādinā paṭiññātā sabbaññu paṭiññā eva

original: niyyānikāti. Sāsanassa sampattiyā tesaṃ sabbaññutaṃ, tabbipariyāyato ca asabbaññutaṃ
