analyzed: pakati iti yathā nīvaraṇa vikkhambhanam ca paṭhamassa jhānassa adhigamāya upāyaḥ evam  sukha dukkha vikkhambhanam catutthassa jhānassa adhigamāya upāyaḥ ti catutthajjhānam
translated: ‘The natural state’: just as the suppression of the hindrances is the means for attaining the first jhāna, so too🔽the suppression of pain and grief is the means for attaining the fourth jhāna. ‘The fourth jhāna’

original: sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ vikkhambhetvā”ti vuttaṃ. Sesaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva.
analyzed: sukham dukkham vikkhambhetvā iti vuttam sesam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva
translated: “Ordinary”: just as the suppression of the hindrances is the means to the attaining of the first jhāna, so too the suppression of pleasure and pain is the means to the attaining of the fourth jhāna. That is why “having suppressed pleasure and pain” is said of the fourth jhāna. The rest is as already stated.

original: Avijjārāgādīhi saha vajjehīti sāvajjaṃ, akusalaṃ, tadabhāvato anavajjaṃ kusalaṃ.
analyzed: avijjā rāga ādīhi saha vajjehi iti sa avajjam akusalam tad abhāvataḥ anavajjam kusalam
translated: “With reproach” is what is unprofitable since it is accompanied by ignorance, lust, etc.; “without reproach” is what is profitable since it is devoid of those states.

original: Attano hitasukhaṃ ākaṅkhantena sevanīyato sevitabbaṃ, kusalaṃ, tabbipariyāyato na
analyzed: attanaḥ hita sukham ākaṅkhantena sevanīyataḥ sevitabbam kusalam tad vipariyāyataḥ na
translated: “To be cultivated” is what should be cultivated since it should be repeatedly practised by one who desires his own good and happiness; “not to be cultivated” is what should not be cultivated since it should not be repeatedly practised.

original: sevitabbaṃ, akusalaṃ. Lāmakabhāvena hīnaṃ, akusalaṃ, seṭṭhabhāvena paṇītaṃ, kusalanti
analyzed: sevitabbam akusalam lāmaka bhāvena hīnam akusalam seṭṭha bhāvena paṇītam kusalanti
translated: “Inferior” is what is unprofitable since it is inferior owing to coarseness, etc.; “superior” is what is profitable since it is superior owing to subtlety, etc.

original: sāvajjadukādayo tayopi dukā yathārahaṃ etesaṃ kusalākusalakammapathānaṃ vaseneva
analyzed: sāvajja duka ādayo dukāḥ yathāraham etesam kusala akusala kamma pathānam vasena iva
translated: These two dyads beginning with “with reproach” should be understood as applicable respectively to the profitable and unprofitable courses of action in the way already stated.

original: veditabbā. Sabbanti yathāvuttaṃ sabbaṃ catūhi dukehi saṅgahitaṃ dhammajātaṃ. Yathārahaṃ
analyzed: veditabbā sabbam ti yathāvuttam sabbam catūhi dukehi saṅgahitam dhamma jātam yathāraham
translated: “All”: all the kinds of states already mentioned are included by the four dyads.

original: kaṇhañca sukkañca paṭidvandibhāvato, sappaṭibhāgañca appaṭibhāgañca advayabhāvato.
analyzed: kaṇhañca sukkañca paṭidvandi bhāvataḥ sappaṭibhāgañca appaṭibhāgañca advaya bhāvataḥ
translated: and the dark and the bright by way of the state of opposition, and the state with opposition and the state without opposition by way of the state of non-duality.

original: Vaṭṭapaṭicchādikā avijjā pahīyati catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ sammadeva paṭivijjhanato.🔽Tato eva arahattamaggavijjā uppajjati. Sukhanti evaṃ kammapathamukhena tebhūmakadhamme🔽sammasitvā vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā maggapaṭipāṭiyā arahatte patiṭṭhahantassa yaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭa paṭicchādikā avijjā pahīyati catunnam ariya saccānam sammat eva paṭivijjhanataḥ  tatas eva arahatta magga vijjā uppajjati sukhanti evam kammapatha mukhena tebhūmaka dhamme  sammasitvā vipassanam ussukkāpetvā magga paṭipāṭiyā arahatte patiṭṭhahantassa yam
translated: The ignorance which covers the round of rebirths is abandoned by the correct penetration of the Four Noble Truths.

original: arahattamaggasukhañceva arahattaphalasukhañca, taṃ idha “sukha”nti adhippetaṃ. Antogadhā
analyzed: arahatta magga sukham ca iva arahatta phala sukham ca tam idha sukhanti adhippetam antogadhā
translated: And the knowledge of the path of arahatship arises. Happiness: the happiness of the path of arahatship and the happiness of the fruit of arahatship are intended here by the word “happiness.”

original: eva nānantariyabhāvato.🔽Aṭṭhatiṃsārammaṇavasenāti pāḷiyaṃ āgatānaṃ aṭṭhatiṃsāya kammaṭṭhānānaṃ vasena. Vitthāretvā
analyzed: eva na ānantariya bhāvato  aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇa vasena ati pāḷiyam āgatānam aṭṭhatiṃsāya kammaṭṭhānānam vasena vitthāretvā
translated: They are included in the word “happiness” because they are not separated from it.

original: kathetabbā paṭhamajjhānādivasena āgatattāti adhippāyo. “Katha”ntiādinā tameva vitthāretvā
analyzed: kathetabbā paṭhama jhāna ādi vasena āgata ttā ati adhippāyaḥ katham iti ādinā tam eva vitthāretvā
translated: By way of the thirty-eight objects of meditation: by way of the thirty-eight meditation subjects mentioned in the texts. The intention is that they should be explained in detail by way of the first jhāna, etc., because they are mentioned in the texts by way of the first jhāna, etc. “The method” and so on: the method should be explained in detail by way of the first jhāna, etc.,

original: kathanaṃ nayato dasseti. “Catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesū”tiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ mahāparinibbānavaṇṇanāyaṃ🔽vuttameva. “Nirodhasamāpattiṃ pāpetvā”ti iminā arūpajjhānānipi gahitāni honti tehi
analyzed: kathanam nayataḥ dasseti catuvīsatiyā ṭhānesu utiādīsu yat vattabbam tat mahāparinibbāna vaṇṇanāyam  vuttam eva nirodha samāpattim pāpetvā iti iminā arūpa jhānāni api gahitāni honti tehi
translated: and the way in which it is told is shown by the words “In twenty-four places” and so on. What is to be said about this has already been said in the description of the Great🔽Passing Away . By the words “after he had attained the attainment of cessation” the immaterial jhānas are also included.

original: vinā nirodhasamāpattisamāpajjanassa asambhavato, catutthajjhānasabhāvattā ca tesaṃ.
analyzed: vinā nirodha samāpatti samāpajjanassa asambhavataḥ catuttha jhāna sabhāva ttā ca tesam
translated: He shows the way of telling it. As to the twenty-four instances, etc., what is to be said has been said already in the description of the Great Passing. By the words “after bringing him to the attainment of cessation” the immaterial jhānas are included too, because it is impossible to reach the attainment of cessation without them, and because they are of the nature of the fourth jhāna.

original: Dasa upacārajjhānānīti ṭhapetvā kāyagatāsatiṃ ānāpānañca aṭṭha anussatiyo, saññāvavatthānañcāti🔽dasa upacārajjhānāni. Adhisīlaṃ nāma samādhisaṃvattaniyanti tassa heṭṭhimantena paṭhamajjhānaṃ🔽pariyosānanti vuttaṃ “adhisīlasikkhā paṭhamaṃ okāsādhigamaṃ bhajatī”ti. Adhicittaṃ
analyzed: dasa upacāra jhānāni iti ṭhapetvā kāya gata asatim āna apānañca aṭṭha anussatiyo saññā vavatthānañca ati  dasa upacārajjhānāni adhisīlam nāma samādhi saṃvattaniyanti tassa heṭṭhimantena paṭhamajjhānam  pariyosānam ti vuttam adhi sīla sikkhā paṭhamam okāsa adhigamam bhajati iti adhicittam
translated: Ten access jhānas: the eight recollections except mindfulness occupied with the body and mindfulness of breathing, and the defining of the four elements.

original: nāma catutthajjhānaniṭṭhaṃ tadantogadhattā arūpajjhānānaṃ, tappariyosānattā phalajjhānānanti
analyzed: nāma catuttha jhāna niṭṭham tad anta gadha ttā arūpa jhānānam tad pariyosāna ttā phala jjhānānam
translated: Ten access jhānas. The training in the higher virtue is the first to reach the opportunity, since the first jhāna is the first of the jhānas and it is conducive to concentration. The training in the higher consciousness is the second to reach the opportunity, since the fourth jhāna is the last of the jhānas and the immaterial jhānas are included in it, and the fruition attainment is the last of the jhānas.

original: vuttaṃ “adhicittasikkhā dutiya”nti. Matthakappattā adhipaññāsikkhā nāma aggamaggavijjāti
analyzed: vuttam adhicitta sikkhā dutiyanti matthaka ppattā adhipaññāsikkhā nāma agga magga vijjā ti
translated: “The higher mind training is the second” . The higher wisdom training, which is the supreme path knowledge, is called “the attainment of the measure” .🔽Therefore it is said: “The higher wisdom training is the third” .🔽The three trainings are the three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: āha “adhipaññāsikkhā tatiya”nti. Sikkhattayavasena tayo okāsādhigame nīharantena🔽yathārahaṃ taṃtaṃsuttavasenapi nīharitabbanti dassento “sāmaññaphalepī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: āha adhipaññā sikkhā tatiyanti sikkhattaya vasena tayo okāsa adhigame nīharantena  yathāraham tad tad sutta vasena api nīharitabban ti dassentaḥ sāmañña phale iti ādim āha
translated: The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.

original: Yadaggena ca tisso sikkhā yathākkamaṃ tayo okāsādhigame bhajanti, tadaggena tappadhānattā🔽yathākkamaṃ tīṇi piṭakāni te bhajantīti dassetuṃ “tīsu panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tīṇi piṭakāni
analyzed: yad aggena ca tissaḥ sikkhāḥ yathākkamam tayo okāsa adhigame bhajanti tad aggena tad padhāna ttā  yathākkamam tīṇi piṭakāni te bhajanti iti dassetum tīsu pana atiādi vuttam tīṇi piṭakāni
translated: The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.

original: vibhajitvāti tiṇṇaṃ okāsādhigamānaṃ vasena yathānupubbaṃ tīṇi piṭakāni vitthāretvā🔽kathetuṃ labhissāmāti. Samodhānetvāti samāyojetvā tattha vuttamatthaṃ imassa suttassa
analyzed: vibhajitvā tiṇṇam okāsa adhigamānam vasena yathānupubbam tīṇi piṭakāni vitthāretvā  kathetum labhissāma ati samodhānetvā ati samāyojetvā tattha vuttam attham imassa suttassa
translated: The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.🔽The three occasions for the arising of the knowledge of the destruction of the taints are the three trainings.

original: atthabhāvena samānetvā. Dukkathitanti asambandhakathanena, atipapañcakathanena vā
analyzed: attha bhāvena samānetvā asambandha kathanena atipapañca kathanena vā
translated: The

original: duṭṭhu kathitanti na sakkā vattuṃ tathākathanasseva sukathanabhāvatoti āha “tepiṭakaṃ…pe… sukathitaṃ hotī”ti.
analyzed: duṭṭhu kathitanti na sakkā vattum tathā kathanassa iva su kathana bhāvato ti āha tepiṭakaṃpe su kathitam hoti iti
translated: It cannot be said that they are badly spoken, because it is just the speaking of them that is good speaking. Hence he said: “The three Piṭakas are well spoken, etc.”

original: Catusatipaṭṭhānavaṇṇanā
analyzed: catusati paṭṭhāna vaṇṇanā
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness

original: 289. Na kevalaṃ abhidhammapariyāyeneva kusalaṭṭho gahetabbo, atha kho bāhitikapariyāyena
analyzed: na kevalam abhidhamma pariyāyena iva kusala ṭṭhaḥ gahetabbaḥ atha kho bāhitika pariyāyena
translated: The profitable meaning is not to be taken only by way of the Abhidhamma method, but also by way of the Bāhitikā method.

original: pīti āha “phalakusalassa cā”ti. Khemaṭṭhenāti catūhipi yogehi anupaddavabhāvena.
analyzed: pi iti āha phala kusalassa ca ati khema ṭṭhena ati catūhi pi yogehi anupaddava bhāvena
translated: He said “and of the fruit of profitable” with the meaning of security, that is to say, with the meaning of non-affliction by the four yokes.🔽Well composed: well composed by means of serenity and insight.

original: Sammā samāhitoti samathavasena ceva vipassanāvasena ca suṭṭhu samāhito. Ekaggacittoti🔽vikkhepassa dūrasamussāritattā ekaggataṃ avikkhepaṃ pattacitto. Attano kāyatoti ajjhattaṃ
analyzed: sammā samāhito ti samatha vasena ca iva vipassanā vasena ca suṭṭhu samāhitaḥ ekagga citto ti  vikkhepassa dūra samussārita ttā ekagga tam a vikkhepam patta cittaḥ attanaḥ kāyato ti ajjhattam
translated: One-pointed: his cognizance has attained unification, non-distraction, by the faring-well of non-distraction.🔽In his own body: internally,

original: kāye kāyānupassanāvasena sammā samāhitacitto samāno “samāhito yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti
analyzed: kāye kāya anupassanā vasena sammā samāhita citto samānaḥ samāhitaḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: being well composed by means of contemplation of the body in the body.🔽Because of the words “He who is concentrated understands and sees what is in conformity with actuality” ,

original: passatī”ti vacanato. Tattha ñāṇadassanaṃ nibbattento tato bahiddhā parassa kāyepi
analyzed: passati iti vacanato tattha ñāṇa dassanam nibbattento tatas bahiddhā parassa kāye pi
translated: he generates the knowledge and vision there in his own body. Then externally in another’s body too,

original: ñāṇadassanaṃ nibbatteti. Tenāha “parassa kāyābhimukhaṃ ñāṇaṃ pesetī”ti. Sammā vippasīdatīti
analyzed: ñāṇa dassanam nibbatteti tena āha parassa kāya abhimukham ñāṇam peseti iti sammā vippasīdati iti
translated: and he generates knowledge and vision. Hence it is said: “He sends knowledge to the front, to the fore, about another’s bodily volitional formations.”

original: sammā samādhānapaccayena abhippasādena ñāṇūpasañhitena ajjhattaṃ kāyaṃ okappeti.
analyzed: sammā samādhāna paccayena abhippasādena ñāṇa upasañhitena ajjhattam kāyam okappeti
translated: “It becomes well steadied”: by means of the condition of right concentration, he directs his body well with confidence accompanied by knowledge.🔽“Everywhere”: in all places. “The survey is stated”: the interpretation.

original: Sabbatthāti sabbaṭṭhānesu. Sati kathitāti yojanā. Lokiyalokuttaramissakā kathitā
analyzed: sabbattha āti sabba ṭṭhānesu sati kathitā ati yojanā lokiya lokuttara missakā kathitā
translated: The survey is stated as a mixture of mundane and supramundane,

original: anupassanāñāṇadassanānaṃ tadubhayasādhāraṇabhāvato.
analyzed: anupassanā ñāṇa dassanānam tad ubhaya sādhāraṇa bhāvato
translated: because the knowledge and vision of survey and the two kinds of concentration are common to both.

original: Sattasamādhiparikkhāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: satta samādhi parikkhāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the seven requisites of concentration🔽“Here” in this exposition. Virtue is stated

original: 290. Etthāti imissā kathāya. Jhānakkhassa vīriyacakkassa ariyamaggarathassa sīlaṃ
analyzed: ettha ati imissā kathāya jhāna kkhassa vīriya cakkassa ariya magga rathassa sīlam
translated: as the adornment and requisite of the wheel-turning monarch, the supreme human being,

original: vibhūsanabhāvena vuttanti āha “alaṅkāro parikkhāro nāmā”ti. Sattahi nagaraparikkhārehīti

analyzed: palighā imehi sattahi nagara parikkhārehi sambharīyati phalam
translated: the city gates, and the city gatekeeper. The fruit is gathered

original: parijānanādikiccaṃ sādhentiyā kāmavitakkādike samugghāṭento sammāsaṅkappo yathā attano
analyzed: parijānana ādi kiccam sādhentiyā kāma vitakka ādike samugghāṭentaḥ sammāsaṅkappaḥ yathā attanaḥ
translated: Right thought is the abandoning of sense-desire and so on, which prevent the function of the knowing of the four noble truths, etc., from being successful.

original: kiccasādhane pahoti, tathā pavattiṃ panassa dassento āha “sammāsaṅkappo pavattatī”ti.
analyzed: kicca sādhane tathā pavattim panassa dassentaḥ āha sammāsaṅkappo pavattati iti
translated: But it is said: “Right thought occurs” in order to show its occurrence in such wise that it is successful in accomplishing its own function.

original: Esa nayo sabbapadesūti “sammāsaṅkappassa sammāvācā pahotī”tiādīsu sesapadesu yathāvuttamatthaṃ atidisati.
analyzed: esa nayaḥ sabba padesu iti sammāsaṅkappassa sammāvācā pahoti itiādīsu sesa padesu yathāvuttam attham atidisati
translated: The same method applies in all the passages, that is to say, in the rest of the passage beginning with “Right thought is the forerunner in the occurrence of right speech” .

original: Ettha ca yasmā nibbānādhigamāya paṭipannassa yogino bahūpakārā sammādiṭṭhi. Tathā
analyzed: ettha ca yasmai nibbāna adhigamāya paṭipannassa yoginaḥ bahu upakārā sammādiṭṭhi tathā
translated: And here right view is of great service to the meditator who is practising for the realization of Nibbāna.🔽For it is said to be “the light of wisdom, the sword of wisdom” .

original: hi sā “paññāpajjoto, paññāsattha”nti ca vuttā. Tāya hi so avijjandhakāraṃ vidhamitvā🔽kilesacore ghātento khemena nibbānaṃ pāpuṇāti, tasmā ariyamaggakathāyaṃ sammādiṭṭhi
analyzed: hi sā ca vuttā tāya hi saḥ avijja andhakāram vidhamitvā  kilesa core ghātento khemena nibbānam pāpuṇāti tasmai ariya magga kathāyam sammādiṭṭhi
translated: For by means of it he dispels the darkness of ignorance,

original: ādito gayhati, idha pana puggalādhiṭṭhānadesanāya “sammādiṭṭhissā”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmā
analyzed: āditaḥ gayhati idha pana puggala adhiṭṭhāna desanāya sammādiṭṭhissa ati vuttam yasmā
translated: and he reaches Nibbāna in safety, slaying the robbers of the defilements. That is why right view is mentioned first in the exposition of the noble path. But here it is said: “of right view” because the teaching is given with reference to the individual.

original: pana sammādiṭṭhipuggalo nekkhammasaṅkappādivasena sammadeva saṅkappeti, na micchākāmasaṅkappādivasena,
analyzed: pana sammādiṭṭhi puggalaḥ nekkhamma saṅkappa ādi vasena sammat eva saṅkappeti na micchā kāma saṅkappa ādi vasena
translated: But a person of right view resolves rightly by way of renunciation, etc., not by way of sense desires, etc.,

original: tasmā sammādiṭṭhissa sammāsaṅkappo pahoti. Yasmā ca sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācāya upakārako.
analyzed: tasmā sammādiṭṭhissa sammāsaṅkappo pahoti yasmā ca sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācāya upakārako
translated: Therefore right view is able to give right resolve. And since right resolve is helpful to right speech,

original: Yathāha “pubbe kho gahapati vitakketvā vicāretvā pacchā vācaṃ bhindatī”ti, tasmā
analyzed: yathā āha pubbe kho gahapati vitakketvā vicāretvā pacchā vācam bhindati iti tasmā
translated: as it is said, “Householder, after thinking and reflecting, one should then speak” ,

original: sammāsaṅkappassa sammāvācā pahoti. Yasmā pana “idañcidañca karissāmā”ti hi paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: sammāsaṅkappassa sammāvācā pahoti yasmai pana idam ca idam ca karissāma ati hi paṭhamam
translated: therefore right resolve is able to give right speech. And since, after deciding verbally, “We will do this and that,”

original: vācāya saṃvidahitvā yebhuyyena te te kammantā sammā payojīyanti, tasmā vācā kāyakammassa🔽upakārikāti sammāvācassa sammākammanto pahoti. Yasmā pana catubbidhaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ,
analyzed: vācāya saṃvidahitvā yebhuyyena te te kammantā sammā payojīyanti tasmā vācā kāya kammassa  upakārikā ati sammā vācassa sammā kammanto pahoti yasmā pana catubbidham vacī duccaritam
translated: the various kinds of work are usually undertaken by the body, therefore right speech is able to give right action.

original: tividhañca kāyaduccaritaṃ pahāya ubhayaṃ sucaritaṃ pūrentasseva ājīvaṭṭhamakasīlaṃ
analyzed: tividham ca kāya duccaritam pahāya ubhayam su caritam pūrentassa iva ājīva ṭṭhamaka sīlam
translated: And since it is only one who has abandoned the four kinds of verbal misconduct and the three kinds of bodily misconduct and who is fulfilling the two kinds of good conduct that is able to fulfil the eighth branch of the noble undertaking of virtue, namely, right livelihood,

original: pūrati, na itarassa, tasmā sammāvācassa sammākammantassa ca sammāājīvo pahoti. Visuddhidiṭṭhisamudāgatasammāājīvassa
analyzed: pūrati na itarassa tasmai sammā vācassa sammā kammantassa ca sammāājīvo pahoti visuddhi diṭṭhi samudāgata sammāājīvassa
translated: and not of the other. So right livelihood is possible for one with right speech and right action.

original: yoniso padhānassa sambhavato sammāājīvassa sammāvāyāmo pahoti. Yoniso padahantassa
analyzed: yonisaḥ padhānassa sambhavataḥ sammāājīvassa sammāvāyāmaḥ pahoti yonisaḥ padahantassa
translated: Right effort is possible for one with right livelihood, because right effort is the right endeavour of one whose livelihood is purified by right view.

original: kāyādīsu catūsu vatthūsu sati sūpaṭṭhitā hotīti sammāvāyāmassa sammāsati pahoti.🔽Yasmā evaṃ sūpaṭṭhitā sati samādhissa upakārānupakārānaṃ dhammānaṃ gatiyo samannesitvā
analyzed: kāya ādīsu catūsu vatthūsu sati su upaṭṭhitā hoti iti sammāvāyāmassa sammā sati pahoti  yasmai evam su upaṭṭhitā sati samādhissa upakāra anupakārānam dhammānam gatiyaḥ samannesitvā
translated: Right mindfulness is possible for one with right effort, because mindfulness of the four things beginning with body becomes well established in one who makes right endeavour.

original: pahoti ekattārammaṇe cittaṃ samādhātuṃ, tasmā sammāsatissa sammāsamādhi pahotīti.
analyzed: pahoti ekatta ārammaṇe cittam samādhātum tasmā sammā satissa sammā samādhi pahoti iti
translated: And right concentration is possible for one with right mindfulness, because when mindfulness is thus well established, it investigates the conditions and non-conditions of concentration and is able to concentrate the mind on a single object.

original: Ayañca nayo pubbabhāge nānākkhaṇikānaṃ sammādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ vasena vutto, maggakkhaṇe
analyzed: ayam ca nayaḥ pubba bhāge nānākkhaṇikānam sammādiṭṭhi ādīnam vasena vuttaḥ magga kkhaṇe
translated: This method is stated in the case of the various kinds of right view, etc., occurring in different moments in the earlier stage. But in the case of the path moment

original: pana sammādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ tassa tassa sahajātādivasena vutto “sammādiṭṭhissa sammāsaṅkappo
analyzed: pana sammādiṭṭhi ādīnam tassa tassa sahajāta ādi vasena vuttaḥ sammādiṭṭhissa sammāsaṅkappo
translated: right intention is possible for one with right view,

original: pahotī”tiādīnaṃ padānamattho yutto, ayameva ca idhādhippeto. Tenāha “ayaṃ panattho”tiādi.🔽Maggañāṇeti maggapariyāpannañāṇe ṭhitassa taṃsamaṅgino. Maggapaññā hi catunnaṃ saccānaṃ
analyzed: pahoti itiādīnam padānam atthaḥ yuttaḥ ayam eva ca idha adhippetaḥ tena āha ayam pana attha utiādi  magga ñāṇe iti magga pariyāpanna ñāṇe ṭhitassa tad samaṅginaḥ magga paññā hi catunnam saccānam
translated: The meaning of the words “he is called a brahmin” is appropriate, and this is what is intended here. Hence he said: “The meaning is this. ”

original: sammādassanaṭṭhena “maggasammādiṭṭhī”ti vuttā, sā eva nesaṃ yāthāvato jānanato paṭivijjhanato
analyzed: sammādassana ṭṭhena magga sammādiṭṭhī iti vuttā sā eva nesam yāthāvataḥ jānanataḥ paṭivijjhanataḥ
translated: “Path-knowledge”: the path-knowledge of one who is established in the path-knowledge. For the path-understanding is called “right view of the path” in the sense of right seeing of the four truths. That same right view of the path is called “path-knowledge” here in the sense of knowing and penetrating them as they really are.

original: idha “maggañāṇa”ntipi vuttā. Maggavimuttīti maggena kilesānaṃ vimuccanaṃ samucchedappahānameva.
analyzed: idha vuttā magga vimutti iti maggena kilesānam vimuccanam samuccheda pahānam eva
translated: “Liberation of the path”: the liberation of the path is the complete abandonment of defilements by means of the path.

original: Phalasammādiṭṭhi eva “phalasammāñāṇa”nti pariyāyena vuttaṃ, pariyāyavacanañca vuttanayānusārena
analyzed: phala sammādiṭṭhi eva phala sammāñāṇanti pariyāyena vuttam pariyāya vacanam ca vutta naya anusārena
translated: “Right knowledge of the fruit”: right view of the fruit is called “right knowledge of the fruit” by way of a synonym. And the synonym should be understood in accordance with the method stated.

original: veditabbaṃ. Phalavimutti pana paṭippassaddhippahānaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Amatassa dvārāti ariyamaggamāha. So pana vinā ca ācariyamuṭṭhinā anantaraṃ abāhiraṃ
analyzed: veditabbam phala vimutti pana paṭippassaddhi ppahānam daṭṭhabbam  amatassa dvārā ti ariya maggam āha saḥ pana vinā ca ācariya muṭṭhinā anantaram abāhiram
translated: “Liberation of the fruit”: the liberation of the fruit should be regarded as the abandonment by suppression.🔽“The door to the deathless”: the noble path is called “the door to the deathless.” And that is open, not closed off, only to the extent that it is well-proclaimed by the Exalted One to human beings without the intervention of a teacher.

original: karitvā yāvadeva manussehi suppakāsitattā vivaṭo. Dhammavinītāti ariyadhamme vinītā.
analyzed: karitvā yāvat eva manussehi su pakāsita ttā vivaṭaḥ dhamma vinītā ati ariya dhamme vinītā
translated: “Taught by the Dhamma”: trained in the noble Dhamma.

original: So panettha kilesānaṃ samucchedavinayavasena veditabboti āha “sammāniyyānena niyyātā”ti.
analyzed: so pana ittha kilesānam samuccheda vinaya vasena veditabbaḥ iti āha sammā niyyānena niyyātā ati
translated: It should be understood here as the destruction of defilements by the right path.

original: Atthīti puthutthavisayaṃ nipātapadaṃ “atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā”tiādīsu viyāti āha
analyzed: atthi iti nipāta padam atthi imasmin kāye kesāti ādīsu viyā ti āha
translated: The word “is” is a particle referring to the individual things.

original: “anāgāmino ca atthī”ti. Tenevāha “atthi cevettha sakadāgāmino”ti. Bahiddhā saṃyojanapaccayo
analyzed: anāgāmino ca atthi iti tena iva āha atthi ca iva ettha sakadāgāmino ti bahiddhā saṃyojana paccayo
translated: “There are non-returners here” means that there are also once-returners here.

original: nibbattihetubhūto puññabhāgo etissā atthīti puññabhāgā, atisayavisiṭṭho cettha atthiattho
analyzed: nibbatti hetu bhūtaḥ puñña bhāgaḥ etissā atthi iti puñña bhāgā atisaya visiṭṭhaḥ ca ittha atthi attho
translated: “There is merit here” means that there is a portion of merit here that is a condition for the arising of fetters outside .🔽Here the meaning of “is” should be understood as an excellent portion.🔽“He is ashamed” means that he is ashamed and abashed.

original: veditabbo. Ottappamānoti uttasanto bhāyanto. Na pana natthi, atthi evāti dīpeti.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ ottappamānaḥ ti uttasantaḥ bhāyantaḥ na pana natthi atthi eva ati dīpeti
translated: “There is no” means that there is not. “There is” means that there is.🔽“Assa” means Vessavana. But there is no success, because he has penetrated the truths.

original: 291. Assāti vessavaṇassa. Laddhi pana na atthi paṭividdhasaccattā. “Abhisamaye viseso natthī”ti etena sabbepi sabbaññuguṇā sabbabuddhānaṃ sadisā evāti dasseti.
analyzed: assa ati vessavaṇassa laddhi pana na atthi paṭividdha sacca ttā abhisamaye visesaḥ natthi iti etena sabbe pi sabbaññu guṇā sabba buddhānam sadisāḥ eva ati dasseti
translated: “There is no distinction in the realization” shows that all the qualities of omniscience of all Buddhas are the same.

original: 292. Kāraṇassa ekarūpattā imāni pana padānīti na kevalaṃ “tayidaṃ brahmacariya”ntiādīni padāni, atha kho “imamatthaṃ janavasabho yakkho”tiādīni padāni pīti.
analyzed: kāraṇassa eka rūpa ttā imāni pana padāni iti na kevalam tayidam brahmacariyanti ādīni padāni atha kho imam attham jana vasabhaḥ yakkhaḥ iti ādīni padāni pi iti
translated: so these words are not only the words beginning with “This is the life of purity” but also the words beginning with “The yakkha Janavasabha” .

original: Janavasabhasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.
translated: The elucidation of the meaning of the brief statement is ended.

original: 6. Mahāgovindasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The Great Steward🔽He had five curls: he had five curls of hair on his head.

original: 293. Pañcakuṇḍalikoti vissaṭṭhapañcaveṇiko. Catumaggaṭṭhānesūti catunnaṃ maggānaṃ
analyzed: pañca kuṇḍaliko ti vissaṭṭha pañca veṇiko catu magga ṭṭhānesu iti catunnam maggānam
translated: At the four cross-roads: at the places where four roads meet.

original: vinivijjhitvā gataṭṭhānesu. Tattha hi katā sālādayo catūhi disāhi āgatamanussānaṃ🔽upabhogakkhamā honti. “Evarūpānī”ti iminā rukkhamūlasodhanādīni ceva yathāsatti annadānādīni
analyzed: vinivijjhitvā gata ṭṭhānesu tattha hi katā sāla ādayaḥ catūhi disāhi āgata manussānam  upabhoga kkhamā honti evarūpāni iti iminā rukkha mūla sodhana ādīni ca iva yathāsatti anna dāna ādīni
translated: For here the halls, etc., built there are fit for people to enjoy who have come from the four quarters.🔽With such: he includes the kinds of merit consisting in clearing the site for a tree, etc., and in giving food according to one’s means.

original: ca puññāni saṅgaṇhāti. “Suvaṇṇakkhandhasadiso attabhāvo iṭṭho kanto manāpo ahosī”ti
analyzed: ca puññāni saṅgaṇhāti suvaṇṇa kkhandha sadisaḥ atta bhāvaḥ iṭṭhaḥ kantaḥ manāpaḥ ahosi iti
translated: His body was as lovely, etc.: the reading is “His body was as lovely, dear, and agreeable as a mass of gold.”

original: pāṭho. Sakaṭasahassamattanti vāhasahassamattaṃ, vāho pana vīsati khārī, khārī soḷasadoṇamattā,
analyzed: sakaṭa sahassa mattanti vāha sahassa mattam vāho pana vīsati khārī khārī soḷasa doṇa mattā
translated: A thousand cart-loads: a thousand cart-loads of grain. A cart-load is twenty khārīs. A khārī is sixteen doṇas.

original: doṇaṃ soḷasa nāḷiyo veditabbā. Kumbhaṃ dasambaṇāni. “Sahassanāḷiyo”ti keci. Rattasuvaṇṇakaṇṇikanti
analyzed: doṇam soḷasa nāḷiyaḥ veditabbā kumbham dasambaṇāni sahassa nāḷiyaḥ ti keci ratta suvaṇṇa kaṇṇikanti
translated: a doṇa is to be understood as sixteen nāḷis. A kumbha is ten ambaṇas. “A thousand nāḷis” is said by some. A golden earring

original: rattasuvaṇṇamayaṃ vaṭaṃsakaṃ.
analyzed: ratta suvaṇṇa mayam vaṭaṃsakam
translated: means a golden ornament in the shape of a ring.

original: Yasmā majjhimayāme eva devatā satthāraṃ upasaṅkamituṃ avasaraṃ labhanti, tasmā “ekakoṭṭhāsaṃ
analyzed: yasmai majjhima yāme eva devatā satthāram upasaṅkamitum avasaram labhanti tasmai eka koṭṭhāsam
translated: Since it is only in the middle watch that deities can find an opportunity to approach the Teacher, therefore it is said: “in the past watch”

original: atītāyā”ti vuttaṃ. Atikkantavaṇṇoti ativiya kamanīyarūpo, kevalakappanti vā manaṃ🔽ūnaṃ avasesaṃ, īsakaṃ asamattanti attho bhagavato hi samīpaṭṭhānaṃ muñcitvā sabbo
analyzed: atītāya iti vuttam atikkanta vaṇṇo ti vā manaṃ  ūnam avasesam īsakam asamattam ti atthaḥ bhagavataḥ hi samīpa ṭṭhānam muñcitvā sabbo
translated: . Exceeding in beauty means having a beauty that exceeds that of the moon. The mind is not lacking in him,

original: gijjhakūṭavihāro tena obhāsito. Tenāha “candimā viyā”tiādi.
analyzed: gijjhakūṭa vihāraḥ tena obhāsitaḥ tena āha candimā viyāti ādi
translated: means that there is no deficiency in his mind. The meaning is that he is not incomplete. For the entire Gijjhakūṭa Monastery was illuminated by him, after he had given up his position near the Blessed One. Therefore it is said: “like the moon,” etc.

original: Devasabhāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: deva sabhā vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the divine assembly

original: 294. Ratanamattakaṇṇikarukkhanissandenāti ratanappamāṇarukkhamayakūṭadānapuññanissandena,
analyzed: ratana matta kaṇṇika rukkha nissandena ati ratana ppamāṇa rukkha maya kūṭa dāna puñña nissandena
translated: . The result of the merit of giving a peak-shaped shrine made of jewels means the result of the merit of giving a peak-shaped shrine made of jewels,

analyzed: tassa vā puññassa nissanda phala bhāvena nibbatta sabhāyanti samuṭṭhita upaṭṭhāna sālāyam
translated: or it is the result of that merit. In the assembly that was created means in the newly constructed assembly hall.🔽.

original: Maṇimayāti padumarāgādimaṇimayā. Āṇiyoti thambhatulāsaṅghāṭakādīsu vāḷarūpādisaṅghāṭanakaāṇiyo.
analyzed: maṇi mayā ati paduma rāga ādi maṇi mayāḥ thambha tulā saṅghāṭaka ādīsu vāḷa rūpa ādi saṅghāṭanaka āṇiyo
translated: ‘Jewels’ means rubies, sapphires, etc. ‘Atoms’ means the atoms of the various elements such as earth, water, fire, and air, which are the ultimate components of the pillars, scales, etc.

original: Gandhabbarājāti gandhabbakāyikānaṃ devatānaṃ rājā. Ye tāvatiṃsānaṃ āsannavāsino cātumahārājikā🔽devā, te purato karonto “dvīsu devalokesu devatā purato katvā nisinno”ti vutto. Sesesupi
analyzed: gandhabba rājā ati gandhabba kāyikānam devatānam rājā ye tāvatiṃsānam āsanna vāsinaḥ cātumahārājikāḥ  devā te puratas karontaḥ dvīsu deva lokesu devatā puratas katvā nisinnaḥ iti vutto sesesu pi
translated: ‘King of the gandhabbas’ means the king of the devas of the gandhabba class. Those devas of the gandhabba class who are residents of the Tāvatiṇsa heaven are the Cātumahārājika devas.

original: tīsu ṭhānesu eseva nayo.
analyzed: tīsu ṭhānesu esa iva nayo
translated: By making them the foremost, he is said to be ‘seated with the devas of two devalokas in front of him.’ The same method of explanation applies to the other three instances.

analyzed: nāga rājāti nāgānam adhipati na pana sayam nāga jātikaḥ  āsati nisīdati ettha ati āsanam nisajja ṭṭhānanti āha nisīditum okāsaḥ ti ettha ati  padam nipāta mattam ettha iti vā etasmin pāṭhe attha uddhāra nayena vattabbam pubbe vuttam
translated: ‘King of the nāgas’ means the lord of the nāgas, not one born as a nāga himself.

original: āyatiṃ sodhanāya ca pañca sīlāni rakkhanti, te tassa visodhanatthaṃ pavāraṇāsaṅgahaṃ
analyzed: āyatim sodhanāya ca pañca sīlāni rakkhanti te tassa visodhana attham pavāraṇā saṅgaham
translated: and they keep the five precepts for the future purification. They make the Invitation ceremony in order to purify that.

original: karonti. Tena vuttaṃ “mahāpavāraṇāyā”tiādi.
analyzed: karonti tena vuttam mahā pavāraṇāya atiādi
translated: Hence it was said, “at the Great Invitation” and so on.

original: Vassasahassanti manussagaṇanāya vassasahassaṃ.🔽Pannapalāsoti patitapatto. Khārakajātoti jātakhuddakamakuḷo. Ye hi nīlapattakā ativiya
analyzed: vassa sahassanti manussa gaṇanāya vassa sahassam  panna palāsaḥ iti patita pattaḥ khāraka jātaḥ iti jāta khuddaka makuḷaḥ ye hi nīla pattakāḥ
translated: A thousand years: a thousand years according to human reckoning.🔽Its leaves fall: its leaves fall off. It has buds: it has small buds. Those that are very small buds are called “buds.”

original: khuddakā makuḷā, te “khārakā”ti vuccanti. Jālakajātoti tehiyeva khuddakamakuḷehi
analyzed: khuddakā makuḷā te khārakā ati vuccanti jālaka jātaḥ ti tehi yeva khuddaka makuḷehi
translated: It has shoots: it has shoots that have arisen from those small buds.

original: jātajālako sabbaso jālo viya jāto. Keci pana “jālakajātoti ekajālo viya jāto”ti atthaṃ
analyzed: jāta jālakaḥ sabbasas jālaḥ viya jātaḥ keci pana jālaka jātaḥ iti eka jālaḥ viya jātaḥ iti attham
translated: Some, however, say that the meaning is: “it has shoots that have arisen like a net.”

original: vadanti. Pārichattako kira khārakaggahaṇakāle sabbatthakameva pallaviko hoti, te
analyzed: vadanti pārichattakaḥ kira khāraka ggahaṇa kāle sabbatthakam eva pallavikaḥ hoti te
translated: The pāricchattaka tree, it seems, at the time of the appearance of the buds, has shoots everywhere,

original: cassa pallavā pabhassarapavāḷavaṇṇasamujjalā honti, tena so sabbaso samujjalanto
analyzed: cassa pallavā pabhassara pavāḷa vaṇṇa samujjalāḥ honti tena so sabbaso samujjalanto
translated: and its shoots are radiant with the colour of clear water. Therefore it stands shining all over.

original: tiṭṭhati. Kuṭumalakajātoti sañjātamahāmakuḷo. Korakajātoti sañjātasūcibhedo sampati
analyzed: tiṭṭhati kuṭumalaka jātaḥ iti sañjāta mahā makuḷaḥ koraka jātaḥ iti sañjāta sūci bhedo
translated: It has flowers: it has large buds. It has burst buds: it has buds that have split open.

original: vikasamānāvattho. Sabbapāliphulloti sabbaso phullitavikasito.
analyzed: sabba pāli phullo ti sabbasas phullita vikasitaḥ
translated: and the flowers open. “In full bloom” means fully blossomed and opened.

original: Kantanakavātoti devānaṃ puññakammapaccayā pupphānaṃ chindanakavāto. Kantatīti chindati.🔽Sampaṭicchanakavātoti chinnānaṃ chinnānaṃ pupphānaṃ sampaṭiggaṇhanakavāto. Naccantoti
analyzed: kantanaka vāto ti devānam puñña kamma paccayā pupphānam chindanaka vāto kantati iti chindati  sampaṭicchanaka vātaḥ iti chinnānam chinnānam pupphānam sampaṭiggaṇhanaka vātaḥ naccanto ti
translated: “A gentle breeze” is a breeze that, as a result of the gods’ meritorious deeds, plucks the flowers. “Plucks” means it cuts.

original: nānāvidhabhattiṃ sannivesavasena naccanaṃ karonto. Aññataradevatānanti nāmagottavasena appaññātadevatānaṃ.
analyzed: nānāvidha bhattim sannivesa vasena naccanam karontaḥ aññatara devatānam ti nāma gotta vasena appaññāta devatānam
translated: “A breeze that gathers” is a breeze that gathers the plucked flowers. “Dancing” means dancing in the form of a variety of postures. “Of certain gods” refers to gods who are not well known by name and clan.

original: Reṇuvaṭṭīti reṇusaṅghāto. Kaṇṇikaṃ āhaccāti sudhammāya kūṭaṃ āhantvā.
analyzed: reṇu vaṭṭī iti reṇu saṅghātaḥ kaṇṇikam āhacca ati sudhammāya kūṭam āhantvā
translated: “A shower of pollen” is a mass of pollen. “Striking the cymbals” means striking the peak of Sudhamma with the cymbals.

original: Aṭṭha divaseti pañcamiyā saddhiṃ pakkhe cattāro divase sandhāya vuttaṃ. Yathāvuttesu
analyzed: aṭṭha divase ti pañcamiyā saddhim pakkhe cattāraḥ divase sandhāya vuttam yathā vuttesu
translated: “For eight days” refers to the four days together with the full moon day.

original: aṭṭhasu divasesu dhammassavanaṃ nibaddhaṃ tadā pavattatīti tato aññadā kāritaṃ sandhāyāha
analyzed: aṭṭhasu divasesu dhammassavanam nibaddham tadā pavattati iti tatas aññadā kāritam sandhāya āha
translated: In the eight days mentioned above, listening to the Dhamma is regular. Therefore, referring to what is done on other days,

original: “akāladhammassavanaṃ kārita”nti. Cetiye chattassa heṭṭhā kātabbavedikā chattavedikā.
analyzed: akāladhammassavanam kāritanti cetiye chattassa heṭṭhā kātabba vedikā chatta vedikā
translated: he says, “Listening to the Dhamma at the wrong time is done.” The platform that should be made under the parasol of the shrine is the parasol platform.

original: Cetiyaṃ parikkhipitvā padakkhiṇakaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ antokatvā kātabbavedikā puṭavedikā.
analyzed: cetiyam parikkhipitvā padakkhiṇa karaṇa ṭṭhānam antokatvā kātabba vedikā puṭa vedikā
translated: The balustrade that is made enclosing the base of the monument, leaving out the place for circumambulation, is called the base-balustrade.

original: Cetiyassa kucchiṃ parikkhipitvā taṃ sambandhameva katvā kātabbavedikā kucchivedikā.
analyzed: cetiyassa kucchim parikkhipitvā tam sambandham eva katvā kātabba vedikā kucchi vedikā
translated: The balustrade that is made enclosing the monument’s body and connecting it with the base-balustrade is called the body-balustrade.

original: Sīharūpapādakaṃ āsanaṃ sīhāsanaṃ. Ubhosu passesu sīharūpayuttaṃ sopānaṃ sīhasopānaṃ.
analyzed: sīha rūpa pādakam āsanam sīhāsanam ubhosu passesu sīha rūpa yuttam sopānam sīha sopānam
translated: A seat with a lion’s figure on its legs is a lion-seat. A staircase with a lion’s figure on both sides is a lion-staircase.

original: Attamanā honti aniyāmanakabhāvato. Tenevāha “mahāpuññe purakkhatvā”tiādi. Pavāraṇāsaṅgahatthāya
analyzed: attamanāḥ honti a niyāmanaka bhāvataḥ tena iva āha mahā puññe purakkhatvā itiādi pavāraṇā saṅga hatthāya
translated: They were pleased because they were not being ordered to do anything. That is why it is said, “Having placed the one of great merit in the lead.”🔽They had assembled for the purpose of the Invitation ceremony,

original: sannipatitāti veditabbā “tadahuposathe pannarase pavāraṇāya puṇṇāya puṇṇamāya rattiyā”ti vacanato.🔽295. Navahi kāraṇehīti “itipi so bhagavā araha”ntiādinā vuttehi arahattādīhi navahi
analyzed: sannipatitā iti veditabbā tad ahuposathe pannarase pavāraṇāya puṇṇāya puṇṇamāya rattiyā iti vacanato  navahi kāraṇehi iti iti pi so bhagavā arahanti ādinā vuttehi arahatta ādīhi navahi
translated: as is clear from the words, “On the fifteenth day, the Uposatha day, at the Invitation ceremony, on the night of the full moon.”🔽For nine reasons: for the nine reasons stated in the passage beginning, “He is the One of Such Virtue … He is the One of Such Wisdom,” which reveal the Buddha’s power, etc.

original: buddhānubhāvadīpanehi kāraṇehi. Dhammassa cāti ettha ca-saddo avuttasamuccayatthoti
analyzed: buddha anubhāva dīpanehi kāraṇehi dhammassa ca ati ettha casaddaḥ avutta samuccaya tthaḥ ti
translated: The word “and” in the words “the Dhamma and the Saṅgha” has the meaning of a conjunction.

original: tena sampiṇḍitamatthaṃ dassento “ujuppaṭipannatādibhedaṃ saṅghassa ca suppaṭipatti”nti āha.
analyzed: tena sampiṇḍitam attham dassentaḥ uju ppaṭipanna tā ādi bhedam saṅghassa ca suppaṭipattin ti āha
translated: Pointing out the meaning of the compound word, he says: “The good practice of the Community, which is divided into the practice of the straight way, etc.”

original: Aṭṭhayathābhuccavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aṭṭha yathābhucca vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the eight things as they really are

original: 296. Yathā anantameva ānañcaṃ, bhisakkameva bhesajjaṃ, evaṃ yathābhūtā eva yathābhuccāti
analyzed: yathā anantam eva ānañcam bhisakkam eva bhesajjam evam yathābhūtāḥ eva yathābhucca ati
translated: Just as Ānāthapiṇḍika is infinite and medicine is a bhikkhu, so the things as they really are are the things as they really are🔽in the text. Therefore he says: “The things as they really are are the things as they really are.”

original: pāḷiyaṃ vuttanti āha “yathābhucceti yathābhūte”ti. Vaṇṇetabbato kittetabbato vaṇṇā,
analyzed: pāḷiyam vuttanti āha yathābhucca iti yathābhūtā iti vaṇṇetabbataḥ kittetabbataḥ vaṇṇā
translated: The things as they really are are praiseworthy because they are to be praised,🔽and they are virtues because they are to be extolled.

original: guṇā. Kathaṃ paṭipannoti hetuavatthāyaṃ, phalaavatthāyaṃ, sattānaṃ upakārā vatthāyanti
analyzed: guṇā katham paṭipanno ti hetu avatthāyam phala avatthāyam sattānam upakārāḥ vatthāyanti
translated: How does he practice? In the basis of cause, in the basis of fruit, and in the basis of benefit to beings,🔽in all three bases, the desire to speak about the practice for the benefit of the many people of the Lord of the World.

original: tīsupi avatthāsu lokanāthassa bahujanahitāya paṭipattiyā kathetukamyatāpucchā. Tathā
analyzed: tīsu pi avatthāsu lokanāthassa bahu jana hitāya paṭipattiyā tathā
translated: Thus,

original: hi naṃ ādito paṭṭhāya yāva pariyosānā saṅkhepeneva dassento “dīpaṅkarapādamūle”tiādimāha.
analyzed: hi naṃ āditaḥ paṭṭhāya yāva pariyosānā saṅkhepena iva dassentaḥ dīpaṅkara pāda mūla iti ādim āha
translated: from the beginning up to the end, showing it in brief, he says: “At the foot of Dīpaṅkara’s tree.”

original: Tattha abhinīharamānoti abhinīhāraṃ karonto. Yaṃ panettha mahābhinīhāre, pāramīsu
analyzed: tattha abhinīharamānaḥ iti abhinīhāram karontaḥ yam pana ittha mahā abhinīhāre pāramīsu
translated: There, making the aspiration means making the aspiration. But here in the great aspiration, in the perfections,

original: ca vattabbaṃ, taṃ brahmajālaṭīkāyaṃ vuttaṃ evāti tattha vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ca vattabbam tam brahmajāla ṭīkāyam vuttam evā ti tattha vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: and this should be said. But it has been said in the Brahmajāla Commentary, and so it should be understood in the way stated there.

original: “Khantivāditāpasakāle”tiādi hetuavatthāyameva anaññasādhāraṇāya sudukkarāya bahujanahitāya🔽paṭipattiyā vibhāvanaṃ. Yathādhippetaṃ hitasukhaṃ yāya kiriyāya vinā na ijjhati,
analyzed: khanti vādi tāpasa kāla itiādi anañña sādhāraṇāya su dukkarāya bahu jana hitāya  paṭipattiyāḥ vibhāvanam yathā adhippetam hita sukham yāya kiriyāya vinā na ijjhati
translated: “In the time of his patience, his teaching, and his austerities” is a description of the practice that is not shared by others, that is difficult to do, and that is for the welfare of many people, in the section on the reason.

original: sāpi tadatthā evāti dassetuṃ “tusitapure yāvatāyukaṃ tiṭṭhantopī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sā api tad atthā evā ti dassetum tusitapure yāvatāyukam tiṭṭhantaḥ api itiādi vuttam
translated: The practice for which the welfare and happiness intended by it do not succeed without it is also for that purpose. In order to show this, it is said: “Even though he remained in the Tusita heaven for the remainder of his life.”

original: Dhammacakkappavattanādi pana nibbattitā bahujanahitāya paṭipatti. Āyusaṅkhārossajjanampi
analyzed: dhamma cakka ppavattana ādi pana nibbatti tā bahu jana hitāya paṭipatti āyu saṅkhāra ussajjanam pi
translated: The setting in motion of the Wheel of the Dhamma, etc., is a practice for the welfare of many people that is undertaken. The relinquishing of the life-span is

original: “ettakaṃ kālaṃ tiṭṭhāmī”ti pavattiyā bahujanahitāya paṭipatti. Anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā
analyzed: ettakam kālam tiṭṭhāmi iti pavattiyāḥ bahu jana hitāya paṭipatti anupādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyāḥ
translated: a practice for the welfare of many people that is undertaken in the thought, “I will remain for so long.” The final Nibbāna in the element of Nibbāna without residue of conditioning is

original: parinibbānavasena bahujanahitāya paṭipatti. Tenāha “yāvassā”tiādi. Sesapadānīti “bahujanasukhāyā”tiādīni
analyzed: parinibbāna vasena bahu jana hitāya paṭipatti tena āha yāva assa atiādi sesa padāni iti bahu jana sukhāya atiādīni
translated: a practice for the welfare of many people that is undertaken by way of final Nibbāna. Therefore it is said: “As long as he remains” and so on. The remaining terms are “for the happiness of the many” and so on.

original: padāni. Pacchimanti “atthāya hitāya sukhāyā”ti padattayaṃ. Purimassāti tato purimassa
analyzed: padāni pacchimanti atthāya hitāya sukhāya ati padattayam purimassa ati tatas purimassa
translated: The words. The last three words are “for welfare, for happiness, for the benefit” . The first three words are the words of the first three .

original: padattayassa. Atthoti atthaniddeso.🔽Yadipi atītenaṅgena samannāgatā satthāro ahesuṃ, tepi pana buddhā evāti atthato amhākaṃ
analyzed: pada ttayassa atthaḥ ti attha niddesaḥ  yadi api atītena aṅgena samannāgatāḥ satthāraḥ ahesum te pi pana buddhāḥ evā ti atthataḥ amhākam
translated: The meaning is the explanation of the meaning.

original: satthā anaññoti āha “atītepi buddhato aññaṃ na samanupassāmā”ti. Yathā ca atīte,
analyzed: satthā anaññaḥ ti āha atīte pi buddhataḥ aññam na samanupassāma iti yathā ca atīte
translated: Although there were teachers who possessed the quality of the past, they were also Buddhas. Therefore, in meaning, our teacher is not different. Therefore he said, “We do not see anyone else in the past but the Buddha.” And just as in the past,

original: evaṃ anāgate cāti ayamattho nayato labbhatīti katvā vuttaṃ “anāgatepi na samanupassāmā”ti.
analyzed: evam anāgate ca ati ayam atthaḥ nayataḥ labbhati iti katvā vuttam anāgate pi na samanupassāma ati
translated: so also in the future. This meaning is obtained by the method. Therefore it was said, “We do not see anyone else in the future.”

original: Sakko pana devarājā tamatthaṃ atthāpannameva katvā “na panetarahi” iccevāha. Kiṃ
analyzed: sakkaḥ pana devarājā tam attham attha āpannam eva katvā na pana itarahi iccā iva āha kim
translated: But Sakka, king of the gods, having established that meaning, said, “But not at present.” What🔽does Sakka say? Having considered thus,

original: sakko kathetīti vicāretvāti “neva atītaṃse samanupassamā’ti vadanto sakko kiṃ kathetī”ti
analyzed: sakko katheti iti vicāretvā ati na iva atīta aṃse vadanto sakko kim katheti iti
translated: saying, “We do not see anyone else in the past,” what does Sakka say?

original: vicāraṇaṃ samuṭṭhapetvā. Yasmā atīte buddhā ahesuṃ, anāgate bhavissantīti nāyamattho
analyzed: vicāraṇam samuṭṭhapetvā yasmai atīte buddhāḥ ahesum anāgate bhavissanti iti na ayam attho
translated: Having aroused this consideration, since there were Buddhas in the past and there will be in the future, this meaning🔽is not.

original: sakkena devarājena pariññāto, te pana buddhasāmaññena amhākaṃ bhagavatā saddhiṃ gahetvā
analyzed: sakkena devarājena pariññāto te pana buddha sāmaññena amhākam bhagavatā saddhim gahetvā
translated: Sakka, King of the Devas, has fully understood it. But you have taken it together with our Blessed One by virtue of the Buddha’s equality.

original: etarahi aññassa sabbena sabbaṃ abhāvato tathā vuttanti dassetuṃ “etarahī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: etarahi aññassa sabbena sabbam abhāvataḥ tathā vuttanti dassetum etarahi itiādi vuttam
translated: Now, in order to show that it is spoken of thus because of the absence of all of it in anyone else, it is said: “At the present time” and so on.

original: Svākkhātādīnīti svākkhātapadādīni. Kusalādīnīti “idaṃ kusala”ntiādīni padāni.
analyzed: svākkhāta ādīni iti svākkhāta pada ādīni kusala ādīni iti idam padāni
translated: “Well proclaimed” and so on: the words “well proclaimed” and so on. “Wholesome” and so on: the words “this is wholesome” and so on.

original: Gaṅgāyamunānaṃ asamāgamaṭṭhāne udakaṃ bhinnavaṇṇaṃ hontampi samāgamaṭṭhāne abhinnavaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: gaṅgā yamunānaṃ a samāgama ṭhāne udakam bhinna vaṇṇam hontam pi samāgama ṭṭhāne abhinna vaṇṇam
translated: The water in the place where the Ganges and the Yamunā meet has a different colour, but in the place where they meet it has a single colour.

original: evāti āha “vaṇṇenapi saṃsandati sametī”ti. Tattha kira gaṅgodakasadisameva yamunodakaṃ.
analyzed: eva iti āha vaṇṇena api saṃsandati sameti iti tattha kira gaṅgā udaka sadisam eva yamunā udakam
translated: Therefore it is said: “It is mixed in colour, it is combined in colour.” There, it seems, the water of the Yamunā is like the water of the Ganges.

original: Yathā nibbānaṃ kenaci kilesena anupakkiliṭṭhatāya parisuddhaṃ, evaṃ nibbānagāminipaṭipadāpi
analyzed: yathā nibbānam kenaci kilesena an upakkiliṭṭha tāya parisuddham evam nibbāna gāmini paṭipadā api
translated: Just as Nibbāna is purified because it is not defiled by any defilement, so the way leading to Nibbāna should be accepted as purified

original: kenaci kilesena anupakkiliṭṭhatāya parisuddhāva icchitabbā. Tenāha “na hī”tiādi.
analyzed: kenaci kilesena icchitabbā tena āha na hi itiādi
translated: because it is not defiled by any defilement. Hence he said: “For if it were not so,” and so on.

original: Yena parisuddhatthena nibbānassa, nibbānagāminiyā paṭipadāya ca ākāsūpamatā, so kenaci
analyzed: yena parisuddha atthena nibbānassa nibbāna gāminiyā paṭipadāya ca ākāsūpama tā saḥ kenacid
translated: By what meaning of purification the Nibbāna element and the way leading to Nibbāna are like space, by that meaning of purification

original: anupalepo, anupakkileso cāti āha “ākāsampi alaggaṃ parisuddha”nti. Idāni tamatthaṃ
analyzed: an upalepaḥ an upakkilesaḥ ca ati āha ākāsam pi a laggam parisuddham ti idāni tam attham
translated: and it is unsoiled and unallied. That is why he said “the sky is the best, the sky is pure.” Now, in order to show that meaning by pointing it out, he said “The moon and sun” .

original: nidassanena vibhūtaṃ katvā dassetuṃ “candimasūriyāna”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Saṃsandati yujjati
analyzed: nidassanena vibhūtam katvā dassetum candima sūriyānan ti ādi vuttam saṃsandati yujjati
translated: It is in conformity with, it is suitable to,

original: paṭipajjitabbatāpaṭipajjanehi aññamaññānucchavikatāya.
analyzed: paṭipajjitabba tā paṭipajjanehi aññamañña anucchavika tāya
translated: the practice and the one who practices, because of the mutual fitness of the practice and the one who practices.🔽“Standing in the practice”: practicing the path, the practice of the path.

original: Paṭipadāya ṭhitānanti paṭipadaṃ maggapaṭipattiṃ paṭipajjamānānaṃ. Vusitavatanti brahmacariyavāsaṃ
analyzed: paṭipadāya ṭhitānam ti paṭipadam magga paṭipattim paṭipajjamānānam vusitavatanti brahmacariya vāsam
translated: “Who have fulfilled the life of purity”: who have fulfilled the life of spiritual practice.

original: vusitavantānaṃ etesaṃ. Laddhasahāyoti etāsaṃ paṭipadānaṃ vasena laddhasahāyo. Tattha
analyzed: vusitavantānam etesam laddha sahāyaḥ ti etāsam paṭipadānam vasena laddha sahāyaḥ tattha
translated: “Who have gained their heart’s desire”: who have gained their heart’s desire by means of these practices.🔽There, in the duties to be performed by disciples for the Master,

original: tattha sāvakehi satthu kātabbakicce. Idaṃ pana “adutiyo”tiādi suttantare āgatavacanaṃ
analyzed: tattha sāvakehi satthu kātabba kicce idam pana adutiya iti ādi sutta antare āgata vacanam
translated: but this statement, which occurs in another sutta beginning with “without a second,”🔽is said in the sense of uniqueness, not in the sense of having no companion as stated.

original: aññehi asadisaṭṭhena vuttaṃ, na yathāvuttasahāyābhāvato. Apanujjāti apanīya vivajjetvā.
analyzed: aññehi a sadisa ṭṭhena vuttam na yathā vutta sahāya abhāvataḥ apanujjāti apanīya vivajjetvā
translated: “Having dismissed”: having removed, having sent away.

original: “Apanujjā”ti ca antogadhāvadhāraṇaṃ idaṃ vacanaṃ ekantikattā tassa apanodassāti vuttaṃ “apanujjevā”ti.
analyzed: apanujja ati ca antogadha avadhāraṇam idam vacanam ekantika ttā tassa apanodassa ati vuttam apanujja iva iti
translated: “Having dismissed” is a restrictive particle. This statement is said because of the absolute certainty of that dismissal.

original: Labbhatīti lābho, so pana ukkaṃsagativijānanena sātisayo, vipulo eva ca idhādhippetoti
analyzed: labbhati iti lābhaḥ saḥ pana ukkaṃsa gati vijānanena sa atisayaḥ vipulaḥ eva ca idha adhippeto ti
translated: “Gain” is what is obtained. But here what is meant is the gain that is “great” in the sense of being excessive and abundant, since it is known as the “highest gain.”🔽Thus it is said: “Great gain has appeared.”🔽“Arisen from the outpouring of merit” : arisen from the outpouring of merit that is exceedingly abundant and sublime, as described above.

original: āha “mahālābho uppanno”ti. Ussannapuññanissandasamuppannoti yathāvuttakālaṃ sambhatasuvipulauḷāratarapuññābhisandato🔽nibbatto.“Ime nibbattā, ito paraṃ mayhaṃ okāso natthī”ti ussāhajāto viya uparūpari
analyzed: āha mahā lābhaḥ uppannaḥ ti ussanna puñña nissanda samuppannaḥ iti yathā vutta kālam sambhata su vipula oḷāratara puñña abhisandataḥ  nibbattaḥ ime nibbattāḥ itas param mayham okāsaḥ natthi iti ussāha jātaḥ viya upari upari
translated: “Like a flood” : like a flood that arises and overflows its banks, increasing more and more.

original: vaḍḍhamāno udapādi. Sabbadisāsu hi yamakamahāmegho uṭṭhahitvā mahāmeghaṃ viya sabbapāramiyo
analyzed: vaḍḍhamānaḥ udapādi sabba disāsu hi yamaka mahā meghaḥ uṭṭhahitvā mahā megham viya sabba pāramiyaḥ
translated: For just as a double monsoon breaks out in all directions and, like a great cloud, all the pāramīs

original: “ekasmiṃ attabhāve vipākaṃ dassāmā”ti sampiṇḍitā viya bhagavato idaṃ lābhasakkārasilokaṃ
analyzed: ekasmin atta bhāve vipākam dassāma ati sampiṇḍitāḥ viya bhagavataḥ idam lābha sakkāra silokam
translated: “We will show their results in a single existence,” and, as if they had combined, they produced this gain, honor, and fame for the Blessed One.

original: nibbattayiṃsu, tato annapānavatthayānamālāgandhavilepanādihatthā khattiyabrāhmaṇādayo
analyzed: nibbattayiṃsu tatas anna pāna vattha yāna mālā gandha vilepana ādi hatthā khattiya brāhmaṇa ādayaḥ
translated: Then, carrying food and drink, clothing and bedding, garlands, scents, ointments, and so on, the khattiyas, brahmins, and householders

original: upagantvā “kahaṃ buddho, kahaṃ bhagavā, kahaṃ devadevo, kahaṃ narāsabho, kahaṃ purisasīho”ti
analyzed: upagantvā kaham buddhaḥ kaham bhagavā kaham devadevaḥ kaham narāsabhaḥ kaham purisa sīhaḥ iti
translated: came and asked: “Where is the Buddha? Where is the Blessed One? Where is the god of gods? Where is the bull of men? Where is the lion of men?”

original: bhagavantaṃ pariyesanti, sakaṭasatehipi paccaye āharitvā okāsaṃ alabhamānā samantā
analyzed: bhagavantam pariyesanti sakaṭa satehi pi paccaye āharitvā okāsam a labhamānā samantā
translated: They search for the Blessed One, bringing requisites in hundreds of carts. Not getting a chance, they stand all around,

original: gāvutappamāṇampi sakaṭadhurena sakaṭadhuraṃ āhacca tiṭṭhanti ceva anubandhanti ca🔽andhakavindabrāhmaṇādayo viya. Sabbaṃ khandhake, tesu tesu ca suttesu āgatanayena
analyzed: gāvuta ppamāṇam pi sakaṭa dhurena sakaṭa dhuram āhacca tiṭṭhanti ca iva anubandhanti ca  andhaka vinda brāhmaṇa ādayaḥ viya sabbam khandhake tesu tesu ca suttesu āgata nayena
translated: even to the extent of a league, with their carts touching the carts in front and behind, and they follow him.

original: veditabbaṃ. Tenāha “lābhasakkāro mahogho viyā”tiādi.
analyzed: veditabbam tena āha lābha sakkāraḥ mahā oghaḥ viyāti ādi
translated: Like the brahmans Andha and Kavin, and so on. All this should be understood as stated in the various suttas and in the Khandhakas. Hence the verse: “Gain and honour, like a flood . . . ”

original: Paṭipāṭibhattanti bahūsu “dānaṃ dassāmā”ti āhaṭapaṭipāṭikāya uṭṭhitesu anupaṭipāṭiyā dātabba bhattaṃ.🔽Matthakaṃ patto anaññasādhāraṇattā tassa dānassa. Upāyaṃ ācikkhi nāgarānaṃ asakkuṇeyyarūpena🔽dānaṃ dāpetuṃ. Sālakalyāṇirukkhā rājapariggahā aññehi asādhāraṇā, tasmā tesaṃ padarehi
analyzed: paṭipāṭi bhattanti bahūsu dānam dassāma ati āhaṭa paṭipāṭikāya uṭṭhitesu anupaṭipāṭiyā dātabba bhattam  matthakam patto an añña sādhāraṇa ttā tassa dānassa upāyam ācikkhi nāgarānam a sakkuṇeyya rūpena  dānam dāpetum sālakalyāṇi rukkhāḥ rāja pariggahāḥ aññehi a sādhāraṇā tasmā tesam padarehi
translated: “The turn for alms” is the alms given when people have risen to give alms in a regular order, but the alms are given out of turn.🔽The bowl is filled to overflowing because the gift is not shared with anyone else. He taught the means to the nāgas,🔽because they were incapable of giving a gift in the way he had done. The sālaka trees were good trees belonging to the king and not shared with others. Therefore,

original: maṇḍapo kārito, hatthino ca rājabhaṇḍabhūtā nāgarehi na sakkā laddhunti tehi chattaṃ
analyzed: maṇḍapaḥ kāritaḥ hatthino ca rāja bhaṇḍa bhūtāḥ nāgarehi na sakkāḥ laddhunti tehi chattam
translated: a pavilion was made with their branches. The elephants were the king’s property and could not be given away by the nāgas. Therefore,🔽an umbrella was made with their ears.

original: dhārāpitaṃ, tathā khattiyadhītāhi veyyāvaccaṃ kāritaṃ. “Pañca āsanasatānī”ti idaṃ
analyzed: dhārāpitam tathā khattiya dhītāhi veyyāvaccam kāritam pañca āsana satāni iti idam
translated: and the water was drawn by the daughters of the nobles. “Five hundred couches” :

original: sālakalyāṇimaṇḍape paññatte sandhāya vuttaṃ, tato bahi pana bahūni paññattāni ahesuṃ.
analyzed: sālakalyāṇi maṇḍape paññatte sandhāya vuttam tatas bahi pana bahūni paññattāni ahesuṃ
translated: this was said with reference to those set out in the Sāla-tree Pavilion; but outside there were many more set out.

original: Catujjātiyagandhaṃ pisati buddhappamukhassa saṅghassa pūjanatthañceva pattassa ubbaṭanatthañca.
analyzed: catujjātiya gandham pisati buddha ppamukhassa saṅghassa pūjana attham ca iva pattassa ubbaṭana attham ca
translated: He ground the four-ingredient fragrant powder for the worship of the Community headed by the Buddha and for the cleansing of the bowl.

original: Udakanti pattadhovanaudakaṃ. Anagghāni ahesuṃ anaggharatanābhisaṅkhatattā.
analyzed: udakanti patta dhovana odakam anagghāni ahesum anaggha ratana abhisaṅkhata ttā
translated: “Water” : water for washing the bowl. They were priceless because they were reckoned as priceless gems.

original: Sattadhā muddhā phalissati anādarakāraṇādinā. Kāḷaṃ olokessāmīti kāḷaṃ evaṃ anupekkhissāmi, tassa uppajjanakaṃ anatthaṃ pariharissāmīti attho.
analyzed: sattadhā muddhā phalissati anādara kāraṇa ādinā kāḷam olokessāmi iti kāḷam evam anupekkhissāmi tassa uppajjanakam anattham pariharissāmi iti attho
translated: “The head will split into seven parts” : because of lack of respect. “I will look at the black” : I will look at the black thus; the meaning is, I will avoid the misfortune that will arise from it.

original: Kadariyāti thaddhamaccharino puññakammavimukhā. Devalokaṃ na vajanti puññassa akatattā,
analyzed: puñña kamma vimukhāḥ deva lokam na vajanti puññassa a kata ttā
translated: “Misers” : hard-hearted, avaricious, averse to meritorious deeds. They do not go to the heavenly world because they have not done meritorious deeds,

original: maccharibhāvena ca pāpassa pasutattā. Bālāti duccintitacintanādinā bālalakkhaṇayuttā.
analyzed: macchari bhāvena ca pāpassa pasuta ttā bālā ati duccintita cintana ādinā bāla lakkhaṇa yuttā
translated: and because of their miserliness they have done evil. “Fools” : endowed with the characteristics of fools, such as bad thoughts.

original: Nappasaṃsanti dānaṃ pasaṃsitumpi na visahanti. Dhīroti dhītisampanno uḷārapañño parehi
analyzed: na pasaṃsanti dānam pasaṃsitum pi na visahanti dhīraḥ iti dhīti sampannaḥ uḷāra pañño parehi
translated: They do not praise giving, they are not even able to praise it. ‘Wise’ means endowed with wisdom, of lofty understanding.

original: kataṃ dānaṃ anumodamānopi, teneva dānānumodaneneva. Sukhī paratthāti paraloke kāyikacetasikasukhasamaṅgī hoti.
analyzed: katam dānam anumodamānaḥ api tena iva dāna anumodanena iva sukhī parattha ati para loke kāyika cetasika sukha samaṅgī hoti
translated: Even when he is rejoicing in the giving done by others, he is happy in the next world, endowed with bodily and mental happiness, by means of that very rejoicing in giving.

original: Vararojo nāma tasmiṃ kāle eko khattiyo, tassa vararojassa. Anavajja…pe… phaleyya
analyzed: vararojaḥ nāma tasmin kāle ekaḥ khattiyaḥ tassa vararojassa anavajjape phaleyya
translated: ‘Vararoja’s’ is the name of a noble at that time. ‘Vararoja’s’ is the name of a noble at that time. ‘Blameless’ … ‘would ripen’

original: abhūtavādibhāvatoti adhippāyo. Atirekapadasahassena tiṃsādhikena aḍḍhateyyagāthāsatena
analyzed: abhūta vādi bhāvato ti adhippāyaḥ atireka pada sahassena tiṃsa adhikena aḍḍhateyya gāthā satena
translated: The intention is that it would be a statement of what is not so. With more than a thousand words, with thirty-two and a half verses,

original: vaṇṇameva kathesi rūpappasannatāya ca.
analyzed: vaṇṇam eva kathesi rūpa ppasanna tāya ca
translated: he spoke only of his beauty, because he was devoted to form.

original: Yāva maññe khattiyāti ettha yāvāti avadhiparicchedavacanaṃ, aññeti nipātamattaṃ,
analyzed: yāva maññe khattiyā ti ettha yāvā ati avadhi pariccheda vacanam aññā iti nipāta mattam
translated: ‘As far as the nobles’ here, ‘as far as’ is a word for a limit, ‘the nobles’ is a mere particle,

original: yāva khattiyā khattiye avadhiṃ katvā sabbe devamanussāti adhippāyo. Tenāha “khattiyā
analyzed: yāva khattiyā khattiye avadhim katvā sabbe deva manussā iti adhippāyaḥ tena āha khattiyā
translated: the intention is that ‘as far as the nobles, as far as the brahmins, as far as all gods and men, having made a limit with the nobles.’ Therefore he said ‘the nobles,

original: brāhmaṇā”tiādi. Madapamattoti lābhasakkārasilokamadena pamatto ceva tadanvayena pamādena pamatto ca hutvā.
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ati ādi mada pamattaḥ iti lābha sakkāra siloka madena pamattaḥ ca iva tad anvayena pamādena pamattaḥ ca hutvā
translated: the brahmins’ and so on. ‘Drunk with conceit’ means heedless both through the conceit of gain, honour and fame and through heedlessness following that.

original: Tadanvayamevāti tadanugatameva. Vācā…pe… sametīti vacīkammakāyakammāni aññamaññaṃ aviruddhāni, aññadatthu saṃsandanti. Ajā eva migāti ajāmigā, te ajāmige.
analyzed: tad anvayam eva ati tad anugatam eva vācāpe sameti iti vacī kamma kāya kammāni aññam aññam a viruddhāni aññadatthu saṃsandanti ajā eva migā ati ajāmigā te ajāmige
translated: “In conformity with that” means in conformity with that. “Speech … and action” means that verbal action and bodily action are not in conflict with each other, but rather are in harmony. “Deer of the field” means deer of the fields, that is, field-deer.🔽“One who has crossed over doubt” is one who has crossed over all doubt, who has gone beyond all doubt.

original: Tiṇṇavicikiccho sabbaso atikkantavicikicchākantāro. Nanu ca sabbepi sotāpannā tiṇṇavicikicchā,
analyzed: tiṇṇa vicikiccho sabbasas atikkanta vicikicchā kantāraḥ nanu ca sabbe pi sā utāpannā tiṇṇa vicikicchā
translated: But are not all stream-enterers “one who has crossed over doubt” and “one who is free from perplexity”?

original: vigatakathaṃkathā ca? Saccametaṃ, idaṃ pana na tādisaṃ tiṇṇavicikicchataṃ sandhāya
analyzed: vigata kathaṃkathā ca saccam etam idam pana na tādisam tiṇṇa vicikiccha tam sandhāya
translated: This is true, but this is said not with reference to the kind of crossing over doubt that is possessed by them,

original: vuttaṃ, atha kho sabbasmiṃ ñeyyadhamme sabbākārāvabodhasaṅkhātasanniṭṭhānavasena
analyzed: vuttam atha kho sabbasmim ñeyya dhamme sabba ākāra avabodha saṅkhāta sanniṭṭhāna vasena
translated: but with reference to one who has completely crossed over doubt, that is, with reference to one who has reached the state of full understanding of all knowable dhammas in all aspects.

original: sabbaso nirākataṃ sandhāyāti dassento “yathā hī”ti ādimāha. Ussannussannattāti paroparabhāvato,
analyzed: sabbasas nirākatam sandhāya ati dassentaḥ yathā hi iti ādim āha ussanna ussanna ttā iti para upara bhāvato
translated: “As, for example” — he says this in order to show that. “High and low” means in the sense of superior and inferior.

original: ayañca attho bhagavato anekadhātunānādhātuñāṇabalenapi ijjhati. Sabbattha vigatakathaṃkatho
analyzed: ayaṃ ca atthaḥ bhagavataḥ aneka dhātu nānā dhātu ñāṇa balena api ijjhati sabbattha vigata kathaṃkatho
translated: And this meaning is accomplished by the Blessed One’s power of knowing the many elements and the various elements. “Free from perplexity in all things”🔽means free from perplexity in all things because of seeing all things.

original: sabbadassāvibhāvato. Sabbesaṃ paramatthadhammānaṃ saccābhisamayavasena paṭividdhattā
analyzed: sabba dassā vibhāvataḥ sabbesam paramattha dhammānam sacca abhisamaya vasena
translated: “One who has penetrated the real nature of all things” means one who has penetrated the real nature of all ultimate dhammas by means of the realization of the four noble truths.

original: vuttaṃ “vohāravasenā”ti vā nāmagottādivasenāti attho.
analyzed: vuttam vohāra vasena ati vā nāma gotta ādi vasena ati attho
translated: “In terms of usage” means “in terms of names, clans, and so on.”

original: Pariyositasaṅkappoti sabbaso niṭṭhitamanoratho. Nanu ca ariyamaggena pariyositasaṅkappatā🔽nāma soḷasakiccasiddhiyā katakaraṇīyabhāvena, na sabbañeyyadhammāvabodhenāti codanaṃ
analyzed: pariyosita saṅkappaḥ ti sabbasas niṭṭhita manorathaḥ nanu ca ariya maggena pariyosita saṅkappa tā  nāma soḷasa kicca siddhiyā kata karaṇīya bhāvena na sabba ñeyya dhamma avabodhena ati codanam
translated: “One whose intentions are fulfilled”: one who has fulfilled all his intentions. But isn’t it the case that one whose intentions are fulfilled is so because he has done what was to be done by attaining the noble paths,

original: sandhāyāha “pubbe ananussutesū”tiādi. Sāvakānaṃ sāvakapāramiñāṇaṃ viya, hi paccekabuddhānaṃ
analyzed: sandhāya āha pubbe an anussutesu itiādi sāvakānam sāvaka pāramiñāṇam viya hi paccekabuddhānam
translated: and not because he has understood all knowable things? Anticipating this objection, the commentator says, “In regard to things unheard of before,” and so on. For just as the knowledge of the disciple’s perfections is preceded by the discovery of the four noble truths,

original: paccekabodhiñāṇaṃ viya ca sammāsambuddhānaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ catusaccābhisambodhapubbakamevāti.
analyzed: pacceka bodhi ñāṇam viya ca sammāsambuddhānam sabbaññu ta ññāṇam catu sacca abhisambodha pubbakam eva ati
translated: and just as the knowledge of the paccekabuddha’s enlightenment is preceded by the discovery of the four noble truths, so too the knowledge of the omniscience of the perfectly enlightened Buddha is preceded by the discovery of the four noble truths.

original: Ananussutesūti na anussutesu. Sāmanti sayameva. Padadvayenāpi parato ghosena vināti
analyzed: an anussutesu iti na anussutesu sāmanti sayam eva pada dvayena api paratas ghosena vinā ati
translated: “In regard to things unheard of before”: not in regard to things heard before. “By himself”: by his own effort. The two terms “by himself” and “without a teacher”

original: dasseti. Tatthāti nimittatthe bhummaṃ, saccābhisambodhanimittanti attho. Saccābhisambodho
analyzed: dasseti tattha ati nimitta atthe bhummam sacca abhisambodha nimittan ti atthaḥ sacca abhisambodhaḥ
translated: indicate that he discovered the truths by himself, without depending on another. “There”: the locative case is used in the sense of a reason. The meaning is: the discovery of the truths was the reason.

original: ca aggamaggavasenāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Balesu ca vasībhāvanti dasannaṃ balañāṇānaṃ yathāruci
analyzed: ca aggamagga vasena ati daṭṭhabbam balesu ca vasībhāvanti dasannam balañāṇānam yathāruci
translated: And the discovery of the truths should be understood as being by means of the path of arahatship. “In the strengths and in the bases of psychic power”: in the ten kinds of knowledge of the strengths and in the four kinds of knowledge of the bases of psychic power.

original: pavatti. Jātattā jātāti sammāsambuddhe vadati.
analyzed: pavatti jāta ttā jātā ati sammāsambuddhe vadati
translated: “He is born” : he is called the Fully Enlightened One because he has been born.

original: 297. Tattha tattha rājadhāniādike nibaddhavāsaṃ vasanto. Tīsu maṇḍalesu yathākālaṃ cārikaṃ caranto.
analyzed: tattha tattha rājadhāni ādike nibaddha vāsam vasantaḥ tīsu maṇḍalesu yathākālam cārikam carantaḥ
translated: “He dwells” : he dwells in a fixed abode such as a royal capital, etc. “He wanders” : he goes on a pilgrimage in the three continents at the appropriate times.

original: 298. Assāti phalassa. Tanti kāraṇaṃ. Dvinnampi ekato uppattiyā kāraṇaṃ natthi, pageva
analyzed: assa ati phalassa tanti kāraṇam dvinnam pi ekatas uppattiyā kāraṇam natthi pageva
translated: “Horse” : fruit. “He” : the cause. There is no cause for the arising of both together, much less of three or four.

original: tiṇṇaṃ, catunnaṃ vāti. “Ettha cā”tiādi “ekissā lokadhātuyā”ti vuttalokadhātuyā pamāṇaparicchedadassanatthaṃ āraddhaṃ.🔽Yāvatāti yattakena ṭhānena. Pariharantīti sineruṃ parikkhipantā parivattanti. Disāti🔽disāsu, bhummatthe etaṃ paccattavacanaṃ. Bhanti dibbanti. Virocanāti obhāsantā, virocanā
analyzed: tiṇṇam catunnam vā ti ettha ca atiādi ekissā lokadhātuyā ati vutta lokadhātuyā pamāṇa pariccheda dassana tham āraddham  yāvatā iti yattakena ṭhānena pariharanti iti sinerum parikkhipantā parivattanti disā ti  disāsu bhumma tthe etam paccattavacanam bhanti dibbanti virocanā ati obhāsantā virocanā
translated: “Here” is introduced in order to show the extent of the world-sphere referred to in the phrase “in one world-sphere.”

original: vā sobhamānā candimasūriyā bhanti, tato eva disā ca bhanti. Tāva sahassadhāti tattako sahassaloko.
analyzed: vā candima sūriyāḥ bhanti tatas eva disā ca bhanti tāva sahassa dhāti tattako sahassa loko
translated: “As far as” : as far as the extent of the place. “They go around” : they go around surrounding Sineru. “In the directions” : in the cardinal directions. This is a locative of place. “They shine” : they illuminate. “They are radiant” : they are resplendent. The moon and sun shine, and therefore the directions shine. “A world-sphere of a thousand” : a world-sphere of that extent.

original: Ettakanti imaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ majjhe katvā imināva saddhiṃ cakkavāḷaṃ dasasahassaṃ. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ mahāpadānavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttameva. Na paññāyatīti tīsu piṭakesu anāgatattā.
analyzed: ettakam ti imam cakkavāḷam majjhe katvā iminā ava saddhim cakkavāḷam dasa sahassam yat pana ittha vattabbam tat mahāpadāna vaṇṇanāyam vuttam eva na paññāyati iti tīsu piṭakesu anāgata ttā
translated: ‘So much’: the world-system, taking this world-sphere as the middle, together with the world-sphere. But what has to be said about this has already been said in the commentary to the Great Forty Discourse. ‘Is not known’: because it is not mentioned in the three Piṭakas.

original: Sanaṅkumārakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of Sanaṅkumāra

original: 300. Vaṇṇenāti rūpasampattiyā. Suviññeyyattā taṃ anāmasitvā yasasaddasseva atthamāha. Alaṅkāraparivārenāti alaṅkārena ca parivārena ca. Puññasiriyāti puññiddhiyā.
analyzed: vaṇṇena ati rūpa sampattiyā su viññeyya ttā tam a nāmasitvā yasa saddassa iva attham āha alaṅkāra parivārena ati alaṅkārena ca parivārena ca puñña siriyā ati puññiddhiyā
translated: ‘By his beauty’: by his beauty of form. Since it is easy to understand, he does not mention it, but explains the meaning of the word ‘glory’ only. ‘With his adornments and retinue’: with his adornments and his retinue. ‘With his glory of merit’: with his glory of merit.

original: 301. Sampasādaneti sampasādajanane. Saṃpubbo khā-saddo jānanattho “saṅkhāyetaṃ paṭisevatī”tiādīsu viyāti āha “jānitvā modāmā”ti.
analyzed: sampasādane iti sampasāda janane saṃpubbaḥ khā saddaḥ jānana atthaḥ saṅkhāya itam paṭisevati itiādīsu viya iti āha jānitvā modāma iti
translated: ‘In the gladdening’: in the arousing of gladness. The word ‘saṃpu’ is the same as ‘saṃpuṇa’ . ‘We rejoice in knowing’ means ‘we rejoice in knowing’.

original: Govindabrāhmaṇavatthuvaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of the Brahmin Govinda

original: 304. Yāva dīgharattanti yāva parimāṇato, aparimitakālaparidīpanametanti āha “ettakanti…pe…
analyzed: yāva yāva parimāṇataḥ aparimita kāla paridīpanam etat ti āha
translated: ‘For a long time’: for a long period of time. Since it shows an unlimited period of time, he says ‘so much …

original: aticiraratta”nti. Mahāpaññova so bhagavāti tena brahmunā anumatipucchāvasena devānaṃ
analyzed: mahā paññā uva so bhagavā iti tena brahmunā anumati pucchā vasena devānam
translated: for a very long time’. ‘The Blessed One is indeed greatly wise’: by way of asking for Brahmā’s consent, the gods

original: vuttanti dassento “mahāpaññova so bhagavā. Noti kathaṃ tumhe maññathā”ti āha. Sayamevetaṃ
analyzed: vuttanti dassento mahā paññaḥ eva so bhagavā no ti katham tumhe maññatha ati āha sayam eva etam
translated: “Greatly wise is the Blessed One,” said the Exalted One, “and you, too, are wise. How do you think?”

original: pañhaṃ byākātukāmo “bhūtapubbaṃ bho”ti ādiṃ āhāti sambandho. Evaṃ pana byākarontena
analyzed: pañham byākātu kāmaḥ bhūta pubbam bho ti ādim āha ati sambandhaḥ evam pana byākarontena
translated: “Greatly wise is the Blessed One. How do you think of it?” He said this in order to show that the question had been answered. The connection is this: he said “Once upon a time, sirs” in order to answer the question himself.🔽But by answering in this way,

original: atthato ayampi attho vutto nāma hotīti dassento “anacchariyameta”nti ādimāha. Tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: atthataḥ ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ nāma hoti iti dassentaḥ anacchariyam etat ti ādim āha tiṇṇam
translated: he showed that this meaning too had been stated. Therefore he said “It is not surprising” in order to show that the meaning had been stated.🔽“The three kinds of enemies”: the defilement-māra, the formations-māra, and the son-of-deity-māra.

original: mārānanti kilesābhisaṅkhāradevaputtamārānaṃ. “Anacchariyameta”nti vuttamevatthaṃ
analyzed: kilesa abhisaṅkhāra devaputta mārānam anat śariyam etat ti vuttam evattham
translated: “It is not surprising” is the meaning stated.

original: nigamanavasena “kimettha acchariya”nti punapi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: nigamana vasena kim ettha acchariyan ti puna api vuttam
translated: “What is there to wonder at?” is stated again in order to conclude the meaning stated.

original: Rañño diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaatthānaṃ puro dhānato pure pure saṃvidhānato purohitoti
analyzed: raññaḥ diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika atthānam puras dhānataḥ pure pure saṃvidhānataḥ purohito ti
translated: “The royal priest” is so called because he is the one who is in front of the king, who is in front of the city in the arranging of the city’s affairs.🔽“The royal priest who directs all affairs” is said.

original: āha “sabbakiccāni anusāsanapurohito”ti. Govindiyābhisekenāti govindassa ṭhāne ṭhapanābhisekena.
analyzed: āha sabba kiccāni anusāsana purohito ti govindiya abhisekena ati govindassa ṭhāne ṭhapana abhisekena
translated: “By the consecration as governor”: by the consecration in the place of the governor.🔽That, it seems, was the position handed down in the family lineage of that brahmin.

original: Taṃ kira tassa brāhmaṇassa kulaparamparāgataṃ ṭhānantaraṃ. Jotitattāti āvudhānaṃ
analyzed: tam kira tassa brāhmaṇassa kula paramparā gatam ṭhāna antaram
translated: “The light of the family”: the light of the family of brahmins.

original: jotitattā. Pālanasamatthatāyāti rañño, aparimitassa ca sattakāyassa anatthato paripālanasamatthatāya.
analyzed: jotita ttā pālana samattha tāya ati raññaḥ aparimitassa ca satta kāyassa anatthataḥ paripālana samattha tāya
translated: because of the light. ‘Because of his ability to protect’: because of his ability to protect the unlimited multitude of people from harm.

original: Sammā vossajjitvāti suṭṭhu tassevāgāravabhāvena vissajjitvā niyyātetvā. Taṃ tamatthaṃ kiccaṃ passatīti atthadaso.🔽305. Bhavanaṃ vaḍḍhanaṃ bhavo, bhavati etenāti vā bhavo, vaḍḍhikāraṇaṃ sandhivasena🔽ma-kārāgamo, o-kārassa ca a-kārādesaṃ katvā “bhavamatthū”ti vuttaṃ. Bhavantaṃ jotipālanti
analyzed: sammā vossajjitvā ti suṭṭhu tassa iva āgāra va bhāvena vissajjitvā niyyātetvā tam tam attham kiccam passati iti attha daso  bhavanam vaḍḍhanam bhavaḥ bhavati etena ati vā bhavaḥ vaḍḍhi kāraṇam sandhi vasena  makāra āgamaḥ okārassa ca akāra ādesam katvā vuttam bhavantam jotipālanti
