analyzed: pahāna kiccam sādhayamānā ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena nibbānam gacchati catu kicca sādhanena iva 🔽ha ittha bahuvacana niddeso evam ca sati iti evam maggaṭṭhena ekattam upādāya maggo ti
translated: It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.🔽It is a way out because it leads to the state of peace.

original: ekavacanena, ārammaṇabhedena catubbidhataṃ upādāya “cattāro”ti ca vattabbatāya sati
analyzed: eka vacanena ārammaṇa bhedena catubbidha tam upādāya cattāro iti ca vattabba tāya sati
translated: and it is to be called “four” because of the fourfoldness by way of the distinction of object.

original: vijjamānattā. Vacanānusandhinā “ekāyano aya”ntiādikā desanā sānusandhikāva, na ananusandhikāti
analyzed: vijjamānattā desanā sa anusandhikā eva na an anusandhikā ati
translated: The intention is this: the teaching beginning with “This is the only way” is with sequel, not without sequel, because of the existence of the fourfoldness.

original: adhippāyo. Vuttamevatthaṃ nidassanena paṭipādetuṃ “mārasenappamaddana”nti suttapadaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ vuttam eva attham nidassanena paṭipādetum māra sena ppamaddanan ti sutta padam
translated: The sutta passage “the quelling of Mara’s army” is brought in to show the meaning already stated.

original: ānetvā “yathā”tiādinā nidassanaṃ saṃsandati. “Tasmā”tiādi nigamanaṃ.🔽Visesato kāyo, vedanā ca assādassa kāraṇanti tappahānatthaṃ tesu taṇhāvatthūsu oḷārikasukhumesu
analyzed: ānetvā yathā atiādinā nidassanam saṃsandati tasmā atiādi nigamanam  visesataḥ kāyaḥ vedanā ca assādassa kāraṇan ti tad pahāna attham tesu taṇhā vatthūsu oḷārika sukhumesu
translated: The illustration is connected by “as” , etc., the conclusion by “therefore” , etc.

original: asubhadukkhabhāvadassanāni mandatikkhapaññehi taṇhācaritehi sukarānīti tāni tesaṃ🔽“visuddhimaggo”ti vuttāni. Tathā “niccaṃ attā”ti abhinivesavatthutāya diṭṭhiyā visesakāraṇesu
analyzed: asubha dukkha bhāva dassanāni manda tikkha paññehi taṇhā caritehi sukarāni iti tāni tesam  visuddhi maggaḥ ti vuttāni tathā niccam attā ati abhinivesa vatthu tāya diṭṭhiyāḥ visesa kāraṇesu
translated: The body and feeling are the cause of enjoyment in particular, so the seeing of foulness and of pain in the gross and subtle bases of craving is easy for those of dull and keen intellectual faculties who are of craving temperament in order to abandon craving.🔽Those are called “the path of purification” .

original: cittadhammesu aniccānattatādassanāni sarāgādivasena, saññāphassādivasena, nīvaraṇādivasena
analyzed: citta dhammesu anicca anatta tā dassanāni sa rāga ādi vasena saññā phassa ādi vasena nīvaraṇa ādi vasena
translated: And likewise the seeing of impermanence and not-self in the special-cause ideas in the mind is easy for those of lust, etc., temperament, for those of perception and contact temperament, and for those of the hindrances temperament, respectively, because of lust, etc., and because of perception and contact, etc., and because of the hindrances, etc., in order to abandon the wrong view whose basis is the resolve “permanent, a self.”

original: ca nātippabhedātippabhedagatesu tesu tappahānatthaṃ mandatikkhapaññānaṃ diṭṭhicaritānaṃ
analyzed: ca na ati ppabheda ati ppabheda gatesu tesu tad pahāna attham manda tikkha paññānam diṭṭhi caritānam
translated: The path of purification is so called because it is easy for those of dull and keen intellectual faculties who are of the temperament of view to traverse in order to abandon the defilements.

original: sukarānīti tesaṃ tāni “visuddhimaggo”ti vuttāni. Ettha ca yathā cittadhammānampi
analyzed: sukarāni iti tesam tāni visuddhi maggaḥ ti vuttāni ettha ca yathā citta dhammānam pi
translated: And here, just as craving has a basis in the states of consciousness and consciousness-concomitants,

original: taṇhāya vatthubhāvo sambhavati, tathā kāyavedanānampi diṭṭhiyāti satipi nesaṃ catunnampi🔽taṇhādiṭṭhivatthubhāve yo yassā sātisayapaccayo, taṃ dassanatthaṃ visesaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: taṇhāya vatthu bhāvo sambhavati tathā kāya vedanānam pi sati pi catunnam pi  taṇhā diṭṭhi vatthu bhāve yaḥ yassā sa atisaya paccayo tam dassana ttham visesa ggahaṇam
translated: so too does view have a basis in the states of body and feeling. So although all four are a basis for craving and for view,🔽the distinction is made in order to show which is the predominant condition for which.

original: katanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tikkhapaññasamathayāniko oḷārikārammaṇaṃ pariggaṇhanto tattha🔽aṭṭhatvā jhānaṃ samāpajjitvā uṭṭhāya vedanaṃ pariggaṇhātīti vuttaṃ “oḷārikārammaṇe🔽asaṇṭhahanato”ti. Vipassanāyānikassa pana sukhume citte, dhammesu ca cittaṃ pakkhandatīti
analyzed: katam ti daṭṭhabbam tikkha pañña samatha yānikaḥ oḷārika ārammaṇam pariggaṇhantaḥ tattha  a ṭhatvā jhānam samāpajjitvā uṭṭhāya vedanam pariggaṇhāti iti vuttam oḷārika ārammaṇe  a saṇṭhahanato ti vipassanāyānikassa pana sukhume citte dhammesu ca cittam pakkhandati iti
translated: One of keen intellectual faculty who is of the temperament of concentration, apprehends the gross object,🔽does not remain there but enters upon and abides in jhāna. On emerging he apprehends feeling. It is said of him that “he does not remain in the gross object.”

original: cittadhammānupassanānaṃ mandatikkhapaññavipassanāyānikānaṃ visuddhimaggatā vuttā.
analyzed: citta dhamma anupassanānam manda tikkha pañña vipassanā yānikānam visuddhi magga tā vuttā
translated: But one of keen intellectual faculty who is of the temperament of insight, penetrates the consciousness to the subtle state. It is said of him that “his mind penetrates to the states of consciousness and consciousness-concomitants.”🔽The path of purification is stated for those of dull and keen intellectual faculties who are of the temperament of insight and who are engaged in insight.

original: Tesaṃ tatthāti ettha tattha-saddassa “pahānattha”nti etena yojanā. Parato tesaṃ tatthāti🔽etthāpi eseva nayo. Pañca kāmaguṇā savisesā kāye labbhantīti visesena kāyo kāmoghassa
analyzed: tesam tattha ati ettha tattha saddassa pahāna atthanti etena yojanā paratas tesam tattha ati  ettha api esā iva nayo pañca kāmaguṇā sa visesā kāye labbhanti iti visesena kāyo
translated: Herein, the interpretation of the word there in the phrase “therein” is “in the sense of abandoning.”🔽The same method applies in the case of the words “therein” in the following phrases.🔽The five cords of sense desire together with their special qualities are found in the body. Therefore the body is the object of the flood of sense desire.

original: vatthu, bhavesu sukhaggahaṇavasena bhavassādo hotīti bhavoghassa vedanā vatthu, santatighanaggahaṇavasena🔽visesato citte attābhiniveso hotīti diṭṭhoghassa cittaṃ vatthu, dhammesu vinibbhogassa
analyzed: vatthu bhavesu sukha ggahaṇa vasena bhava ssādaḥ hoti iti bhava oghassa vedanā vatthu santati ghana ggahaṇa vasena  visesataḥ citte attā abhinivesaḥ hoti iti diṭṭha oghassa cittam vatthu dhammesu vinibbhogassa
translated: The pleasure in the kinds of becoming is the object of the flood of becoming.🔽The false view of individuality is found in the mind, which is the object of the flood of views.

original: dukkarattā, dhammānaṃ dhammamattatāya duppaṭivijjhattā ca sammoho hotīti avijjoghassa
analyzed: dukkara ttā dhammānam dhamma matta tāya duppaṭivijjha ttā ca sammohaḥ hoti iti avijjoghassa
translated: Delusion is found in the mental data, which are the object of the flood of ignorance.

original: dhammā vatthu, tasmā tesu tesaṃ pahānatthaṃ cattārova vuttā.
analyzed: dhammā vatthu tasmā tesu tesam pahāna attham cattāro va vuttā
translated: Therefore four only are mentioned as the objects of the floods.

original: Evaṃ kāyādīnaṃ kāmoghādivatthubhāvakathaneneva kāmayogakāmāsavādīnampi vatthubhāvo
analyzed: evam kāya ādīnam kāma ogha ādi vatthu bhāva kathanena iva kāma yoga kāma āsava ādīnam pi vatthu bhāvaḥ
translated: Thus by the explanation of the body, etc., as the objects of the floods of sense desire, etc., the objects of the fetters of sense desire, the taint of sense desire, etc.,🔽are also shown, because they are not different in meaning from the floods.

original: dīpito hoti oghehi tesaṃ atthato anaññattā. Yadaggena ca kāyo kāmoghādīnaṃ vatthu,
analyzed: dīpitaḥ hoti oghehi tesam atthataḥ an aññattā yad aggena ca kāyaḥ kāma ogha ādīnam vatthu
translated: And since the body is the object of the flood of sense desire, etc.,

original: tadaggena abhijjhākāyaganthassa vatthu. “Dukkhāya vedanāya paṭighānusayo anusetī”ti
analyzed: tad aggena abhijjhā kāya ganthassa vatthu dukkhāya vedanāya paṭigha anusayaḥ anuseti iti
translated: and the body is the basis for the bodily tie of covetousness. “The underlying tendency to resistance underlies painful feeling” .

original: dukkhadukkhavipariṇāmadukkhasaṅkhāradukkhabhūtā vedanā visesena byāpādakāyaganthassa
analyzed: dukkha dukkha vipariṇāma dukkha saṅkhāra dukkha bhūtā vedanā visesena byāpāda kāya ganthassa
translated: Painful feeling, which is threefold as pain pain, change of what is liked into what is not liked, and formations as suffering, is the basis for the bodily tie of ill will.

original: vatthu. Citte niccaggahaṇavasena sassatassa attano sīlena suddhīti ādi parāmasanaṃ
analyzed: vatthu citte nicca ggahaṇa vasena sassatassa attano sīlena suddhi iti ādi parāmasanam
translated: The mind is the basis for the clinging to rules and observances, since the latter consists in misapprehending purity in virtue, etc., by taking them as permanent and as a self.

original: hotīti sīlabbataparāmāsassa cittaṃ vatthu. Nāmarūpaparicchedena bhūtaṃ bhūtato apassantassa🔽bhavavibhavadiṭṭhisaṅkhāto idaṃsaccābhiniveso hotīti tassa dhammā vatthu. Kāyassa
analyzed: hoti iti sīlabbata parāmāsassa cittam vatthu nāma rūpa paricchedena bhūtam bhūtataḥ a passantassa  bhava vibhava diṭṭhi saṅkhāto idaṃsacca abhinivesaḥ hoti iti tassa dhammā vatthu kāyassa
translated: The mental phenomena are the basis for the view of existence and non-existence, since the latter consists in the misapprehension of what is really existent and non-existent as only existent and only non-existent, respectively, by not discerning the mental phenomena as they really are.🔽The body is the basis for sensual desire and for the clinging to false view, in the way already stated.

original: kāmupādānavatthutā vuttanayāva. Yadaggena hi kāyo kāmoghassa vatthu, tadaggena kāmupādānassapi
analyzed: kāma upādāna vatthu tā yad aggena hi kāyaḥ kāma oghassa vatthu tad aggena kāma upādānassa api
translated: For the body is the basis for the sensual desire for the sense desires, and the basis for the clinging to false view is the same as that for sensual desire, since the latter is not different in meaning from the former.

original: vatthu atthato abhinnattā. Sukhavedanassādavasena paralokanirapekkho “natthi dinna”ntiādikaṃ
analyzed: vatthu atthataḥ abhinna ttā sukha vedanā ssāda vasena para loka nirapekkhaḥ natthi dinna nti ādikam
translated: One who is not concerned with the next world, being addicted to the enjoyment of pleasant feeling, misapprehends “There is nothing given” and so on.

analyzed: parāmāsam uppādeti iti diṭṭhupādānassa vedanā vatthu citta dhammānam itara upādāna vatthu tā

analyzed: eva santati ghana ggahaṇa vasena sa rāga ādi citte
translated: The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.

analyzed: sammohaḥ hoti iti moha āgatiyā cittam vatthu dhamma sabhāva anavabodhe bhayam hoti iti bhaya āgatiyā dhammāḥ vatthu  āhāra samudayā kāyassa samudayā phassa samudayā vedanānam samudayo saṅkhāra paccayā

analyzed: viññāṇam viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpan ti vacanataḥ kāya ādīnam samudaya bhūtā kabaḷīkāra phassa manaḥ sañcetanā viññāṇa āhārā  kāya ādi parijānanena pariññātāḥ honti iti āha pakaraṇa nayo ti
translated: The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.

original: nettipakaraṇavasena suttantasaṃvaṇṇanānayo.
analyzed: na itthi pakaraṇa vasena suttanta saṃvaṇṇanā anayo
translated: The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same as that for the unprofitable consciousnesses.🔽The basis for the unprofitable consciousnesses is the same

original: Saraṇavasenāti kāyādīnaṃ, kusalādidhammānañca upadhāraṇavasena. Saranti gacchanti
analyzed: saraṇa vasena ati kāya ādīnam kusala ādi dhammānam ca upadhāraṇa vasena saranti gacchanti
translated: By way of mindfulness: by way of bearing in mind the body, etc., and wholesome and unwholesome states. They go to Nibbāna,

original: nibbānaṃ etāyāti satīti imasmiṃ atthe ekatte ekasabhāve nibbāne samosaraṇaṃ samāgamo
analyzed: nibbānam sati iti imasmin atthe ekatte eka sabhāve nibbāne samosaraṇam samāgamaḥ
translated: therefore it is mindfulness. In this meaning, the word “mindfulness” is a unity, a single nature, in Nibbāna. The meeting, the coming together,

original: ekattasamosaraṇaṃ. Etadeva hi dassetuṃ “yathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Ekanibbānapavesahetubhūto vā samānatāya eko satipaṭṭhānasabhāvo ekattaṃ, tattha samosaraṇaṃ🔽ekattasamosaraṇaṃ, taṃsabhāgatāva, ekanibbānapavesahetubhāvaṃ pana dassetuṃ “yathā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: ekatta samosaraṇam etat eva hi dassetum yathā hi itiādi vuttam  eka nibbāna pavesa hetu bhūtaḥ vā samāna tāya ekaḥ sati paṭṭhāna sabhāvo ekattam tattha samosaraṇam  ekatta samosaraṇam eka nibbāna pavesa hetu bhāvam pana dassetum yathā iti ādim āha
translated: of the three is the unity of meeting. In order to illustrate this, the simile of the three sticks is given.🔽Or the unity of meeting is the single nature of the establishment of mindfulness, which is the cause for the entry into the single Nibbāna. In order to illustrate this, the simile of the three sticks is given.🔽In this meaning, the three establishments of mindfulness are said to be the cause for the single nature of the establishment of mindfulness by way of the unity of meeting and the unity of the cause for the entry into the single Nibbāna.

original: Etasmiṃ atthe saraṇekattasamosaraṇāni saheva satipaṭṭhānekabhāvassa kāraṇattena vuttānīti🔽daṭṭhabbāni, purimasmiṃ visuṃ. Saraṇavasenāti vā gamanavasenāti atthe sati tadeva
analyzed: etasmin atthe saraṇa ekatta samosaraṇāni saha iva sati paṭṭhāna eka bhāvassa kāraṇa ttena vuttāni iti  daṭṭhabbāni purimasmin visum saraṇa vasena ati vā gamana vasena ati atthe sati tat eva
translated: Therefore they should be regarded as the cause for the single nature of the establishment of mindfulness. In the former case, the unity of meeting is by way of going.🔽In the latter case, the unity of meeting is by way of bearing in mind.🔽In the former case, the unity of meeting is by way of going.🔽In the latter case, the unity of meeting is by way of bearing in mind. In the former case, the unity of meeting is by way of going.

original: gamanaṃ samosaraṇanti, samosaraṇe vā sati-saddatthavasena avuccamāne dhāraṇatāva
analyzed: gamanam samosaraṇanti samosaraṇe vā a vuccamāne
translated: In the latter case, the unity of meeting is by way of bearing in mind.

original: satīti sati-saddatthantarābhāvā purimaṃ satibhāvassa kāraṇaṃ, pacchimaṃ ekabhāvassāti
analyzed: satī iti purimam sati bhāvassa kāraṇam pacchimam eka bhāvassa ati
translated: Since there is no other meaning for the word mindfulness, the former is the cause for the establishment of mindfulness and the latter for the singleness .

original: nibbānasamosaraṇepi sahitāneva tāni satipaṭṭhānekabhāvassa kāraṇāni vuttāni honti.
analyzed: nibbāna samosaraṇe pi tāni sati paṭṭhāna eka bhāvassa kāraṇāni vuttāni honti
translated: So too, in the case of the establishment of mindfulness on Nibbāna, the two are stated as the cause for the singleness of the establishment of mindfulness.

original: “Cuddasavidhena, navavidhena, soḷasavidhena, pañcavidhenā”ti idaṃ upari pāḷiyaṃ āgatānaṃ🔽ānāpānapabbādīnaṃ vasena vuttaṃ, tesaṃ pana anantarabhedavasena, tadanugatabhedavasena🔽ca bhāvanāya anekavidhatā labbhatiyeva, catūsu disāsu uṭṭhānakabhaṇḍasadisatā kāyānupassanāditaṃtaṃsatipaṭṭhānabhāvanānubhāvassa daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: cuddasavidhena navavidhena soḷasavidhena pañcavidhena ati idam upari pāḷiyam āgatānam  āna apāna pabba ādīnam vasena vuttam tesam pana anantara bheda vasena tad anugata bheda vasena  ca bhāvanāya anekavidha tā catūsu disāsu uṭṭhānaka bhaṇḍa sadisa tā kāya anupassanā ādi taṃ taṃ sati paṭṭhāna bhāvanā anubhāvassa daṭṭhabbā
translated: “In fourteen ways, in nine ways, in sixteen ways, in five ways” . This is said with reference to the in-breaths and out-breaths, etc., mentioned above in the text.🔽But there are many other ways of development besides these, which are only the principal ones. For the development of the foundation of mindfulness consisting in contemplation of the body, etc., has many divisions according to the analysis of the actualities in the various ways stated in the Paṭṭhāna.🔽The development of the four foundations of mindfulness should be regarded as like the goods a man takes with him when he leaves one country for another.

original: Kathetukamyatāpucchā itarāsaṃ pucchānaṃ idha asambhavato, niddesādivasena desetukamyatāya
analyzed: itarāsam asambhavataḥ niddesa ādi vasena desetu kamyatāya
translated: The question “What is the purpose, what is the advantage of developing the four foundations of mindfulness?” is asked because of the wish to teach, etc.,

original: ca tathā vuttattā. “Idhā”ti vuccamānapaṭipattisampādakassa bhikkhuno sannissayadassanaṃ,
analyzed: ca tathā vutta ttā idha ati vuccamāna paṭipatti sampādakassa bhikkhuno sannissaya dassanam
translated: The words “Here” show the person who is accomplishing the way of practice stated here.

original: so cassa sannissayo sāsanato añño natthīti vuttaṃ “idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane”ti. Dhamma…pe…
analyzed: so ca ssa sannissayaḥ sāsanataḥ aññaḥ natthi iti vuttam idhā ti imasmim sāsane ti dhammape
translated: and he has no other support than the Dispensation. So it is said: “In this Dispensation” .

original: lapanametaṃ tesaṃ attano sammukhābhimukhabhāvakaraṇatthaṃ, tañca dhammassa sakkaccasavanatthaṃ.
analyzed: lapanam etam tesam attano sammukha abhimukha bhāva karaṇa attham tat ca dhammassa sakkacca savana attham
translated: The purpose of this talk is to make them face to face with him and to make them listen respectfully to the Dhamma.

original: “Gocare bhikkhave caratha sake pettike visaye”tiādi vacanato bhikkhugocarā ete dhammā,
analyzed: gocare bhikkhave caratha sake pettike visaya itiādi vacanataḥ bhikkhu gocarāḥ ete dhammāḥ
translated: These dhammas are the bhikkhus’ domain since it is said: “Wander, bhikkhus, in the domain of the four foundations of mindfulness” , and so on.

original: yadidaṃ kāyānupassanādayo. Tattha yasmā kāyānupassanādipaṭipattiyā bhikkhu hoti,
analyzed: yat idam kāya anupassanā ādayaḥ tattha yasmā kāya anupassanā ādi paṭipattiyā bhikkhu hoti
translated: Herein, since one becomes a bhikkhu by the practice of the foundation of mindfulness on the body, etc.,🔽he shows the bhikkhu by the words “abides contemplating a body in the body” , etc., in the sense of the bhikkhu’s being invariably bound up with that .

original: tasmā “kāyānupassī viharatī”tiādinā bhikkhuṃ dasseti bhikkhumhi taṃniyamatoti āha🔽“paṭipattiyā bhikkhubhāvadassanato”ti. Satthucariyānuvidhāyakattā, sakalasāsanasampaṭiggāhakattā
analyzed: tasmā kāya anupassī viharati itiādinā bhikkhum dasseti bhikkhumhi tad niyamato ti āha  paṭipattiyāḥ bhikkhu bhāva dassanato ti satthu cariyā anuvidhāyaka ttā sakala sāsana sampaṭiggāhaka ttā
translated: So he says: “Because it shows the bhikkhu’s being by practice” .🔽The bhikkhu is a fit vessel for the whole of the Dispensation because he follows the Master’s way of life and because he receives the whole of the Dispensation.

original: ca sabbappakārāya anusāsaniyā bhājanabhāvo. Tasmiṃ gahiteti bhikkhumhi gahite. Bhikkhuparisāya
analyzed: ca sabbappakārāya anusāsaniyā bhājana bhāvaḥ tasmin gahita iti bhikkhumhi gahite bhikkhu parisāya
translated: When he is taken, when the bhikkhu is taken,

original: jeṭṭhabhāvato rājagamanañāyena itarā parisāpi atthato gahitāva hontīti āha “sesā”tiādi.
analyzed: jeṭṭha bhāvataḥ rāja gamana ñāyena itarā parisā api atthataḥ gahitā ava honti iti āha sesa itiādi
translated: The other assemblies are included in the meaning of the word “others” because they are mentioned by way of the going to the capital city, which is the reason for the going.

original: Evaṃ paṭhamaṃ kāraṇaṃ vibhajitvā itarampi vibhajituṃ “yo ca ima”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: evam paṭhamam kāraṇam vibhajitvā itaram pi vibhajitum yaḥ ca iman tiādi vuttam
translated: Having thus analyzed the first reason, he says “and he who” in order to analyze the other reason.🔽“Should live evenly”: having abandoned uneven conduct by body, etc., he should live evenly by body, etc.

original: Samaṃ careyyāti kāyādi visamacariyaṃ pahāya kāyādīhi samaṃ careyya. Rāgādivūpasamena
analyzed: samam careyya ati kāya ādi visama cariyam pahāya kāya ādīhi samam careyya rāga ādi vūpasamena
translated: Pacified by the pacification of greed, etc.,

original: santo, indriyadamena danto, catumagganiyāmena niyato, seṭṭhacaritāya brahmacārī,
analyzed: santaḥ indriya damena danto catu magga niyāmena niyataḥ seṭṭha caritāya brahmacārī
translated: tamed by the taming of the faculties, restrained by the restraint of the fourfold path, a celibate by the highest celibacy,

original: sabbattha kāyadaṇḍādioropanena nidhāya daṇḍaṃ. Ariyabhāve ṭhito so evarūpo bāhitapāpasamitapāpabhinnakilesatāhi
analyzed: sabbattha kāya daṇḍa ādi oropanena nidhāya daṇḍam ariya bhāve ṭhitaḥ saḥ evarūpaḥ
translated: having laid down the rod by the laying down of the rod of bodily, verbal, and mental punishment in all cases,

original: “brāhmaṇo, samaṇo, bhikkhū”ti ca veditabbo.🔽“Ayañceva kāyo, bahiddhā ca nāmarūpa”ntiādīsu khandhapañcakaṃ, tathā “sukhañca kāyena
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ samaṇaḥ bhikkhu iti ca veditabbaḥ  ayam ca iva kāyaḥ bahiddhā ca khandha pañcakam tathā sukham ca kāyena
translated: such a one should be known as a brahmin, a recluse, a bhikkhu, by reason of his having expelled evil, having pacified evil, and having broken the defilements.🔽In such passages as “This body and the external name-and-form” , the five aggregates are referred to. Likewise in such passages as “He experiences pleasure in himself” ,

original: paṭisaṃvedetī”tiādīsu, “yā tasmiṃ samaye kāyassa passaddhi paṭippassaddhī”tiādīsu
analyzed: paṭisaṃvedeti iti ādīsu yā tasmin samaye kāyassa passaddhi paṭippassaddhi iti ādīsu
translated: and in such passages as “At that time there is serenity of body, serenity of mind” ,

original: ca vedanādayo cetasikā khandhā kāyoti vuccantīti tato visesanatthaṃ “kāyeti rūpakāye”ti🔽āha. Kesādīnañca dhammānanti kesādisaññitānaṃ bhūtupādādhammānaṃ. Evaṃ “cayaṭṭho
analyzed: ca vedanā ādayaḥ cetasikā khandhā kāyo ti vuccanti iti tatas visesana attham kāya iti rūpa kāya iti  āha kesa ādīnam ca dhammānan ti kesa ādi saññitānam bhūtupāda adhammānam evam caya ṭṭhaḥ
translated: And the mental aggregates beginning with feeling are called “the body.” In order to distinguish the word “body” from these, he said “the material body.”🔽The dhammas called head hairs, etc., are material dhammas derived from the four primary elements.🔽Having thus shown the word “body” by the method of derivation, he now shows it by the method of definition.🔽The word “body” is used for the collection of the dhammas called head hairs, etc., and for the collection of the primary elements that are the material support of the dhammas called head hairs, etc.

original: sarīraṭṭho kāyaṭṭho”ti saddanayena kāya-saddaṃ dassetvā idāni niruttinayenapi taṃ🔽dassetuṃ “yathā cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Āyantīti uppajjanti.
analyzed: sarīra ṭṭho kāya ṭṭho ti sadda nayena kāya saddam dassetvā idāni nirutti nayena api tam  dassetum yathā ca atiādi vuttam āyanti iti uppajjanti
translated: The word “body” is also used for the collection of the dhammas called head hairs, etc., and for the collection of the primary elements that are the material support of the dhammas called head hairs, etc.

original: Asammissatoti vedanādayopi ettha sitā, ettha paṭibaddhāti kāye vedanādianupassanāpasaṅgepi🔽āpanne tato asammissatoti attho. Samūhavisayatāya cassa kāya-saddassa, samudāyupādānatāya
analyzed: a sammissato ti vedanā ādayaḥ api ettha sitāḥ ettha paṭibaddhā ati kāye vedanā ādi anupassanā apasaṅge pi  āpanne tatas a sammissato ti attho samūha visaya tāya ca ssa kāya saddassa samudāya upādāna tāya
translated: The word “body” is also used for the collection of the dhammas called head hairs, etc., and for the collection of the primary elements that are the material support of the dhammas called head hairs, etc.
