original: pakataññutā “sikkhāya kaṅkhatī”ti vuttāya vicikicchāya pahānaṃ karotīti āha “vinaye
analyzed: pakataññu tā sikkhāya kaṅkhati iti vuttāya vicikicchāya pahānam karoti iti āha vinaye
translated: He says that he abandons doubt called “uncertainty about the training” mentioned in the Vibhanga,

original: ciṇṇavasībhāvassāpī”ti. Okappaniyasaddhāsaṅkhātaadhimokkhabahulassāti saddheyyavatthuno
analyzed: ciṇṇavasībhāvassa api iti okappa niya saddhā saṅkhāta adhimokkha bahulassa ati saddheyya vatthuno
translated: by the attainment of mastery in the Vinaya.

original: anupavisanasaddhāsaṅkhātaadhimokkhena adhimuccanabahulassa, adhimuccanañca adhimokkhuppādanamevāti
analyzed: an upavisana saddhā saṅkhāta adhimokkhena adhimuccana bahulassa adhimuccanam ca adhimokkha uppādanam eva ati
translated: He is one who is rich in the faith called “the act of receiving” : he is one who is rich in the act of receiving by way of the faith called “the act of entering into” the object of confidence.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ, saddhāya vā ninnapoṇatāadhimutti adhimokkho.🔽Samudayavayāti samudayavayadhammā. Subhanimittaasubhanimittādīsūti “subhanimittādīsu
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam saddhāya vā ninna poṇa tā adhimutti adhimokkhaḥ  samudaya vayā ati samudaya vaya dhammā subha nimitta asubha nimitta ādīsu uti subha nimitta ādīsu
translated: Or “faith” is the inclination towards, the leaning towards, the act of receiving is the arousing of the act of receiving.

original: asubhanimittādīsū”ti ādi-saddo paccekaṃ yojetabbo. Tattha paṭhamena ādi-saddena paṭighanimittādīnaṃ
analyzed: asubha nimitta ādīsu iti ādi saddo paccekam yojetabbo tattha paṭhamena ādi saddena paṭigha nimitta ādīnam
translated: Arising and falling away : they have the nature of arising and falling away. In the case of the sign of the beautiful, the sign of the ugly, etc. : the word “etc.” should be construed with each term. Herein, the first “etc.” includes the sign of resistance, etc.,

original: saṅgaho, dutiyenamettācetovimuttiādīnaṃ. Sesamettha yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ saṅgahaḥ sesam ettha yat vattabbam tat vutta nayam eva
translated: the second “etc.” includes the deliverances of the beautiful, etc. What is to be said here about the rest can be understood in the way already given.

original: Nīvaraṇapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the hindrances is ended.

original: Khandhapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khandha pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the aggregates

original: 383. Upādānehi ārammaṇakaraṇādivasena upādātabbā vā khandhā upādānakkhandhā.
translated: The aggregates are clung to by means of the kinds of object, etc., thus they are “aggregates as objects of clinging” .

original: Iti rūpanti ettha iti-saddo idaṃ-saddena samānatthoti adhippāyenāha “idaṃ rūpa”nti.
analyzed: iti rūpam ti ettha iti saddaḥ idam saddena samāna tthaḥ ti adhippāyena āha idam rūpam iti
translated: The word “this” in the phrase “this is material form” has the same meaning as the word “this” in the phrase “this material form” .

original: Tayidaṃ sarūpaggahaṇabhāvato anavasesapariyādānaṃ hotīti āha “ettakaṃ rūpaṃ, na ito🔽paraṃ rūpaṃ atthī”ti. Itīti vā pakāratthe nipāto, tasmā “iti rūpa”nti iminā bhūtupādādivasena
analyzed: tayā idam sarūpa ggahaṇa bhāvataḥ anavasesa pariyādānam hoti iti āha ettakam rūpam na itas  param rūpam atthi iti iti iti vā pakāra atthe nipāto tasmai iti bhūtu pāda ādi vasena
translated: This is how he defines material form by including all material form without remainder.

original: yattako rūpassa pabhedo, tena saddhiṃ rūpaṃ anavasesato pariyādiyitvā dasseti. Sabhāvatoti
analyzed: yattakaḥ rūpassa pabhedaḥ tena saddhim rūpam anavasesataḥ pariyādiyitvā dasseti sabhāvato ti
translated: The word “this” is a demonstrative pronoun. Therefore, by the phrase “this is material form” he shows material form by including it in its entirety together with all its divisions according to the primary elements, the four great entities, etc.

original: ruppanasabhāvato, cakkhādivaṇṇādisabhāvato ca. Vedanādīsupīti ettha “ayaṃ vedanā,
analyzed: ruppana sabhāvato cakkha ādi vaṇṇa ādi sabhāvato ca vedanā ādīsu pi iti ettha ayam vedanā
translated: By its individual essence : by its individual essence as the formed, and by its individual essence as colour, etc., in the eye, etc.🔽By its individual essence :

original: ettakā vedanā, na ito paraṃ vedanā atthīti sabhāvato vedanaṃ pajānātī”tiādinā, sabhāvatoti
analyzed: ettakā vedanā na itas param vedanā atthi iti sabhāvataḥ vedanam pajānāti itiādinā
translated: he understands feeling thus: “This is feeling,” “Feeling is of such a kind,” “There is such a state as this, namely, feeling.”

original: ca “anubhavanasabhāvato, sātādisabhāvato cā”ti evamādinā yojetabbaṃ. Sesaṃ vuttanayattā suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: ca anubhavana sabhāvato sāta ādi sabhāvato ca ati evamādinā yojetabbam sesam vutta naya ttā su viññeyyam eva
translated: and “as to the kind of experiencing they are, as to the kind of feeling they are, and so on.” The rest is easily intelligible since it has been given already.

original: Khandhapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khandha pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the aggregates is ended.

original: Āyatanapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āyatana pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the bases

original: 384. Chasu ajjhattikabāhiresūti “chasu ajjhattikesu chasu bāhiresū”ti “chasū”ti padaṃ
analyzed: chasu ajjhattika bāhiresu iti chasu ajjhattikesu chasu bāhiresu iti chasu iti padam
translated: “In the six internal and six external”: the word “six” should be construed with each of the six internal and six external.

original: paccekaṃ yojetabbaṃ. Kasmā panetāni ubhayāni chaḷeva vuttāni? Chaviññāṇakāyuppattidvārārammaṇavavatthānato.
analyzed: paccekam yojetabbam kasmā pana etāni ubhayāni chaḷ eva vuttāni cha viññāṇa kāya uppatti dvāra ārammaṇa vavatthānato
translated: But why are only six internal and six external mentioned? Because of the delimitation of the six bases for consciousness as the door and object for the arising of the six kinds of consciousness.

original: Cakkhuviññāṇavīthiyā pariyāpannassa hi viññāṇakāyassa cakkhāyatanameva uppattidvāraṃ,
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa vīthiyā pariyāpannassa hi viññāṇa kāyassa cakkha āyatanam eva uppatti dvāraṃ
translated: For the eye base is the door for the arising of the kind of consciousness classed as eye-consciousness ;

original: rūpāyatanameva ca ārammaṇaṃ, tathā itarāni itaresaṃ, chaṭṭhassa pana bhavaṅgamanasaṅkhāto
analyzed: rūpa āyatanam eva ca ārammaṇam tathā itarāni itaresam chaṭṭhassa pana bhavaṅgamana saṅkhāto
translated: and the visible-data base is its object. Likewise the other bases should be understood in this way. But the mind base is the door for the arising of the sixth,🔽and the mental-data base is its object.

original: manāyatanekadeso uppattidvāraṃ, asādhāraṇañca dhammāyatanaṃ ārammaṇaṃ. Cakkhatīti
analyzed: manāyatana eka desaḥ uppatti dvāram asādhāraṇam ca dhamma āyatanam ārammaṇam cakkhati iti
translated: The eye is the door for the arising of eye-consciousness.

original: cakkhu, rūpaṃ assādeti, vibhāveti cāti attho. Suṇātīti sotaṃ. Ghāyatīti ghānaṃ. Jīvitanimittatāya
analyzed: cakkhu rūpam assādeti vibhāveti ca ati attho suṇāti iti sotam ghāyati iti ghānam jīvita nimitta tāya
translated: “Eye” is so called because it delights in visible data and extends them. “Ear” is so called because it hears. “Nose” is so called because it smells.🔽Taste is life because it is the cause of life. It is the tongue because it extends life.

original: raso jīvitaṃ, taṃ jīvitaṃ avhāyatīti jivhā. Kucchitānaṃ sāsavadhammānaṃ āyo uppattidesoti🔽kāyo. Munāti ārammaṇaṃ vijānātīti mano. Rūpayati vaṇṇavikāraṃ āpajjamānaṃ hadayaṅgatabhāvaṃ
analyzed: rasaḥ jīvitam tam jīvitam avhāyati iti jivhā sa āsava dhammānam āyaḥ uppatti deso ti  kāyaḥ munāti ārammaṇam vijānāti iti manaḥ rūpayati vaṇṇa vikāram āpajjamānam hadayaṅgata bhāvam
translated: The body is the source of the bodily heap of defilements.🔽The mind is so called because it measures an object.🔽Visible data are so called because they manifest colour as the state of being in the heart.

original: pakāsetīti rūpaṃ. Sappati attano paccayehi harīyati sotaviññeyyabhāvaṃ gamīyatīti🔽saddo. Gandhayati attano vatthuṃ sūcetīti gandho. Rasanti taṃ sattā assādentīti raso.
analyzed: pakāseti iti rūpam sappati attanaḥ paccayehi harīyati sota viññeyya bhāvam gamīyati iti  saddaḥ gandhayati attanaḥ vatthum sūceti iti gandhaḥ rasanti tam sattāḥ assādenti iti rasaḥ
translated: Sound is so called because it is shaken by its own conditions and becomes what is cognizable by the ear.🔽Odour is so called because it odours its own location. Flavour is so called because creatures delight in it.🔽Tangible data are so called because they are touched. Mental data are so called because they bear their own individual essences.

original: Phusīyatīti phoṭṭhabbaṃ. Attano sabhāvaṃ dhārentīti dhammā. Sabbāni pana āyānaṃ tananādiatthena
analyzed: phusīyati iti phoṭṭhabbam attanaḥ sabhāvam dhārenti iti dhammā sabbāni pana āyānam tanana ādi atthena
translated: But all are bases in the sense of source of the respective kinds of consciousness.

original: āyatanāni. Ayamettha saṅkhepo, vitthāro pana visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: āyatanāni ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ pana visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanāyam vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ
translated: This is the brief account here. The detailed account should be understood in the way given in the description of the Path of Purification .

original: Cakkhuñca pajānātīti ettha cakkhu nāma pasādacakkhu, na sasambhāracakkhu, nāpi dibbacakkhuādikanti
analyzed: cakkhuñca pajānāti iti ettha cakkhu nāma pasāda cakkhu na sa sambhāra cakkhu na api dibba cakkhu ādikan ti
translated: “He understands eye” : the eye here is the sensitive eye, not the physical eye, nor the divine eye, etc.

original: āha cakkhupasādanti. Yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “yaṃ cakkhu catunnaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya
analyzed: āha cakkhu pasādam ti yam sandhāya vuttam yam cakkhu catunnam mahābhūtānam upādāya
translated: He says “the sensitive eye” , which is that referred to in the passage: “The sensitive eye is derived from the four great entities” .🔽The word “and” has the meaning of “or.”

original: pasādo”ti. ca-saddo vakkhamānatthasamuccayattho. Yāthāvasarasalakkhaṇavasenāti aviparītassa🔽attano rasassa ceva lakkhaṇassa ca vasena, rūpesu āviñchanakiccassa ceva rūpābhighātārahabhūtapasādalakkhaṇassa
analyzed: pasādaḥ ti ca saddaḥ vakkhamāna attha samuccaya tthaḥ yāthāvasa rasa lakkhaṇa vasena ati aviparītassa  attanaḥ rasassa ca iva lakkhaṇassa ca vasena rūpesu āviñchana kiccassa ca iva rūpa abhighāta araha bhūta pasāda lakkhaṇassa
translated: “By the method of its individual essence and characteristic” : by the method of its own individual essence and characteristic, which are not inverted,🔽by the method of the sensitive matter that is the basis for the function of seeing visible forms and the characteristic of sensitive matter that is capable of being affected by visible forms,

original: ca daṭṭhukāmatānidānakammasamuṭṭhānabhūtapasādalakkhaṇassa ca vasenāti attho. Atha
analyzed: ca daṭṭhu kāma tā nidāna kamma samuṭṭhāna bhūta pasāda lakkhaṇassa ca vasena ati atthaḥ atha
translated: and by the method of the sensitive matter that is the basis for the function of desiring to see visible forms and the characteristic of sensitive matter that is originated by kamma that is the cause of the desire to see visible forms.

original: vā yāthāvasarasalakkhaṇavasenāti yāthāvasarasavasena ceva lakkhaṇavasena ca, yāthāvasarasoti
analyzed: vā yāthāvasa rasa lakkhaṇa vasena ati yāthāvasa rasa vasena ca iva lakkhaṇa vasena ca yāthāvasa rasaḥ ti
translated: Or alternatively, “by the method of its individual essence and characteristic” means by the method of its individual essence and characteristic as they really are.

original: ca aviparītasabhāvo veditabbo. So hi rasīyati aviraddhapaṭivedhavasena assādīyati
analyzed: ca aviparīta sabhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ saḥ hi rasīyati aviraddha paṭivedha vasena assādīyati
translated: “As it really is” should be understood as “without distortion.” For that which is individual essence is relished by way of unopposed penetration and is enjoyed.

original: ramīyatīti “raso”ti vuccati, tasmā salakkhaṇavasenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Lakkhaṇavasenāti
analyzed: ramīyati iti rasaḥ iti vuccati tasmā sa lakkhaṇa vasena ati vuttam hoti lakkhaṇa vasena ati
translated: It is called “taste” because it is relished. So the meaning is: by way of its specific characteristic.

original: aniccādisāmaññalakkhaṇavasena.🔽“Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇa”ntiādīsu samuditāniyeva rūpāyatanāni
analyzed: anicca ādi sāmañña lakkhaṇa vasena  cakkhum ca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇam ti ādīsu samuditāni yeva rūpa āyatanāni
translated: By way of its general characteristic: by way of the general characteristics of impermanence, etc.

original: cakkhuviññāṇuppattihetu, na visuṃ visunti imassa atthassa jotanatthaṃ “rūpe cā”ti🔽puthuvacanaggahaṇaṃ, tāya eva ca desanāgatiyā kāmaṃ idhāpi “rūpe ca pajānātī”ti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa uppatti hetu na visum visum ti imassa atthassa jotana attham rūpe ca ati  puthuvacana ggahaṇam tāya eva ca desanā gatiyā kāmam idha api rūpe ca pajānāti iti vuttam
translated: In such passages as “With eye as condition there arises in dependence on eye visual consciousness” (M I 10), the eye-sensitivity that has arisen together with visual consciousness is the condition for the arising of visual consciousness, not separately.

original: rūpabhāvasāmaññena pana sabbaṃ ekajjhaṃ gahetvā bahiddhā catusamuṭṭhānikarūpañcāti🔽ekavacanavasena attho. Sarasalakkhaṇa vasenāti cakkhuviññāṇassa visayabhāvakiccassa
analyzed: rūpa bhāva sāmaññena pana sabbam ekajjham gahetvā bahiddhā catu samuṭṭhānika rūpam ca ati  ekavacana vasena attho sa rasa lakkhaṇa vasena ati cakkhu viññāṇassa visaya bhāva kiccassa
translated: In order to illustrate this meaning, the words “and in visible forms” are used in the plural.🔽And it is by this very method of teaching that the words “in visible forms” are used in the plural here too.🔽But by the general characteristic of visible-data-ness all visible data are included together in the singular, thus the meaning is: “in the visible-data base.”🔽By way of the general characteristic of taste: by way of the object and function of visual consciousness,

original: vasena ceva cakkhupaṭihananalakkhaṇassa vasena cāti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vasena ca iva cakkhu paṭihanana lakkhaṇassa vasena ca ati yojetabbam
translated: and by way of the characteristic of impingement on the eye.

original: Ubhayaṃ paṭiccāti cakkhuṃ upanissayapaccayavasena paccayabhūtaṃ, rūpe ārammaṇādhipatiārammaṇūpanissayavasena
analyzed: ubhayam paṭicca ati cakkhum upanissaya paccaya vasena paccaya bhūtam rūpe ārammaṇa adhipati ārammaṇa upanissaya vasena
translated: “With both as condition” means with the eye as condition by way of decisive support condition, and with visible data as condition by way of object condition, predominance condition, object decisive support condition,

original: paccayabhūte ca paṭicca. Kāmaṃ ayaṃ suttantasaṃvaṇṇanā, nippariyāyakathā nāma abhidhammasannissitā
analyzed: paccaya bhūte ca paṭicca kāmam ayam suttanta saṃvaṇṇanā nippariyāyakathā nāma abhidhamma sannissitā
translated: Although this is a commentary on a sutta, nevertheless the exposition of the meaning is called “in the mode of the Abhidhamma”🔽because it is based on the Abhidhamma.

original: evāti abhidhammanayeneva saṃyojanāni dassento “kāmarāga…pe… avijjāsaṃyojana”nti āha.
analyzed: eva iti abhidhamma nayena iva saṃyojanāni dassento kāma rāga pe avijjā saṃyojanan ti āha
translated: “With the fetter of lust for sensual pleasures … with the fetter of ignorance” .

original: Tattha kāmesu rāgo, kāmo ca so rāgo cāti vā kāmarāgo. So eva bandhanaṭṭhena saṃyojanaṃ.
analyzed: tattha kāmesu rāgo kāmo ca so rāgo ca ati vā kāma rāgo so eva bandhana ṭṭhena saṃyojanam
translated: Herein, lust for sensual pleasures is either lust for sensual desires or lust for views, etc., and that is a fetter in the sense of binding.

original: Ayañhi yassa saṃvijjati, taṃ puggalaṃ vaṭṭasmiṃ saṃyojeti bandhati iti dukkhena sattaṃ,🔽bhavādike vā bhavantarādīhi, kammunā vā vipākaṃ saṃyojeti bandhatīti saṃyojanaṃ.
analyzed: ayam hi yassa saṃvijjati tam puggalam vaṭṭasmim saṃyojeti bandhati iti dukkhena sattam  bhava ādike vā bhavantara ādīhi kammunā vā vipākam bandhati iti saṃyojanam
translated: For it binds the person in whom it arises to the round of rebirths, and it binds him to suffering,🔽or it binds existence, etc., to the next existence, etc., or it binds the result to the kamma. So it is a fetter in the sense of binding.

original: Evaṃ paṭighasaṃyojaṃādīnampi yathārahamattho vattabbo. Sarasalakkhaṇavasenāti ettha
analyzed: evam paṭigha saṃyojan ādīnam pi yathāraham atthaḥ vattabbo sarasa lakkhaṇa vasena ati ettha
translated: The meaning should be construed in each instance according to the context. “In the mode of the Abhidhamma” .

original: pana sattassa vaṭṭato anissajjanasaṅkhātassa attano kiccassa ceva yathāvuttabandhanasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: pana sattassa vaṭṭataḥ a nissajjana saṅkhātassa attano kiccassa ca iva yathāvutta bandhana saṅkhātassa
translated: and of his own function, which is called “not letting go of the round of existence,” and of the fetter called “the round of existence” as stated.

original: lakkhaṇassa ca vasenāti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: lakkhaṇassa ca vasena ati yojetabbam
translated: and by the characteristic of the fetter stated thus.

original: Bhavassādadiṭṭhissādanivattanatthaṃ kāmassādaggahaṇaṃ. Assādayatoti abhiramantassa.🔽Abhinandatoti sappītikataṇhāvasena nandantassa. Padadvayenāpi balavato kāmarāgassa
analyzed: bhava ssāda diṭṭhi ssāda nivattana attham kāma ssāda gahaṇam assādayato ti abhiramantassa  abhinandato ti sappītika taṇhā vasena nandantassa pada dvayena api balavataḥ kāma rāgassa
translated: The phrase “the gratification of being” is stated for the purpose of preventing the delight in views. “One who delights” is one who delights in, who enjoys, the gratification of being.

original: paccayabhūtā kāmarāguppatti vuttā. Esa nayo sesesupi. Aniṭṭhārammaṇeti ettha “āpāthagate”ti
analyzed: paccaya bhūtā kāma rāga uppatti vuttā esa nayo sesesu pi aniṭṭha ārammaṇā iti ettha āpātha gatā iti
translated: “One who approves” is one who delights by way of craving accompanied by happiness. By the two phrases the arising of sensual lust, which is a condition for strong sensual lust, is stated. The same method applies in the other cases.

original: vibhattivipariṇāmanavasena “āpāthagata”nti padaṃ ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. Etaṃ ārammaṇanti
analyzed: vibhatti vipariṇāmana vasena āpātha gatan ti padam ānetvā sambandhitabbam etam ārammaṇam ti
translated: As regards the phrase “unpleasant object,” the word “arrived” should be brought in by way of a change in the case-ending, and the compound should be resolved as “arrived at the range of the mind.”

original: etaṃ evaṃsukhumaṃ evaṃdubbibhāgaṃ ārammaṇaṃ. “Niccaṃ dhuva”nti idaṃ nidassanamattaṃ.
analyzed: etam evaṃsu khumam evaṃdubbibhāgam ārammaṇam niccam dhuvanti idam nidassana mattam
translated: “This object” is this object of such and such a subtle and such and such a gross division. “Permanent, eternal” is merely an illustration.

original: “Ucchijjissati vinassissatīti gaṇhato”ti evamādīnampi saṅgaho icchitabbo. Paṭhamāya
analyzed: ucchijjissati vinassissati iti gaṇhataḥ ti evamādīnam pi saṅgahaḥ icchitabbo paṭhamāya
translated: The inclusion of such phrases as “will be annihilated, will be destroyed” should be understood.

original: sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā anurodhavasena “satto nu kho”ti, itarāya anurodhavasena “sattassa
analyzed: sakkāyadiṭṭhiyāḥ anurodha vasena sattaḥ nu kho ti itarāya anurodha vasena sattassa
translated: “Is there a being?” in accordance with the view of individuality; “Is there a being’s” in accordance with the view of annihilation.

original: nu kho”ti vicikicchato. Attattaniyādigāhānugatā hi vicikicchā diṭṭhiyā asati abhāvato.🔽Bhavaṃ patthentassāti “īdise sampattibhave yasmā amhākaṃ idaṃ iṭṭhaṃ rūpārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: nu khalu iti vicikicchataḥ atta ttaniya ādi gāha anugatā hi vicikicchā diṭṭhiyāḥ asati abhāvato  bhavam patthentassa ati īdise sampatti bhave yasmai amhākam idam iṭṭham rūpa ārammaṇam
translated: “Is there a being?” in the sense of conformity to personality view, and “Is there a being’s?” in the sense of conformity to doubt. For doubt is accompanied by the misinterpretations of self and self’s, and when there is no view it does not occur.

original: sulabhaṃ jātaṃ, tasmā āyatimpi ediso, ito vā uttaritaro sampattibhavo bhaveyyā”ti
analyzed: sulabham jātam tasmai edisaḥ itas vai uttaritaraḥ sampatti bhavaḥ bhaveyya iti
translated: “Who desires existence” is one who aspires to existence, thinking, “Since this desirable visible form has come within the range of my vision, let me in the future be such or better than such.”

original: bhavaṃ nikāmentassa. Evarūpanti evarūpaṃ rūpaṃ. Taṃsadise hi tabbohāravasenevaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bhavam nikāmentassa evarūpanti evarūpam rūpam tad sadise hi tad bohāra vasena ivam vuttam
translated: “Such” is such visible form. For it is said in this way by the method of expressing the general by the particular.

original: Bhavati hi taṃsadisesu tabbohāro yathā “sā eva tittirī, tāni eva osadhānī”ti. Usūyatoti🔽usūyaṃ issaṃ uppādayato. Aññassa maccharāyatoti aññena asādhāraṇabhāvakaraṇena macchariyaṃ
analyzed: bhavati hi taṃsadisesu tad bohāraḥ yathā sā eva tittirī tāni eva osadhāni iti  usūyam issam uppādayataḥ aññassa maccharāyataḥ ti aññena asādhāraṇa bhāva karaṇena macchariyam
translated: For the particular is expressed by the general, as in the passage, “That is the partridge, those are the herbs” .

original: karoto. Sabbeheva yathāvuttehi navahi saṃyojanehi.
analyzed: sabbehi iva yathā vuttehi navahi saṃyojanehi
translated: “From envy” is from the arising of envy, i.e. from the arising of the state of mind called envy. “From avarice” is from the arising of avarice, i.e. from the arising of the state of mind called avarice. “From all nine fetters” is from all nine fetters as already explained.

original: Tañca kāraṇanti subhanimittapaṭighanimittādivibhāgaṃ iṭṭhāniṭṭhādirūpārammaṇañceva🔽tajjāyonisomanasikārañcāti tassa tassa saṃyojanassa kāraṇaṃ. Avikkhambhitāsamūhatabhūmiladdhuppannaṃ
analyzed: tat ca subha nimitta paṭigha nimitta ādi vibhāgam iṭṭha aniṭṭha ādi rūpa ārammaṇam ca eva  tajjā yoniso manasikāram ca ati tassa tassa saṃyojanassa kāraṇam a vikkhambhita a samūha ta bhūmi laddha uppannam
translated: And the reason is the classification of the sign of the beautiful, the sign of resistance, etc., and the object consisting of visible data, etc., that are desirable or undesirable,🔽and the appropriate kind of attention. That is the reason for the fetter’s occurrence. The meaning of “arisen” is “not yet abandoned” in the sense of not being suppressed, not being rooted out, not being surmounted, not being discarded.

original: taṃ sandhāya “appahīnaṭṭhena uppannassā”ti vuttaṃ. Vattamānuppannatā samudācāraggahaṇeneva
analyzed: tam sandhāya appahīna ṭṭhena uppannassa iti vuttam vattamāna uppanna tā samudācāra ggahaṇena iva
translated: The meaning of “arisen in the present” is included in the meaning of “manifesting.”🔽As to the reason: as to the reason consisting in the development of insight and the path.

original: gahitā. Yena kāraṇenāti yena vipassanāsamathabhāvanāsaṅkhātena kāraṇena. Tañhi tassa🔽tadaṅgavasena ceva vikkhambhanavasena ca pahānakāraṇaṃ. Issāmacchariyānaṃ apāyagamanīyatāya
analyzed: gahitāḥ yena kāraṇena ati yena vipassanā samatha bhāvanā saṅkhātena kāraṇena tat hi tassa  tad aṅga vasena ca iva vikkhambhana vasena ca pahāna kāraṇam apāya gamanīya tāya
translated: For that is the reason for its abandoning in the sense of suppression and in the sense of its being surmounted by the path.🔽Because of their leading to the unhappy destinies, envy and avarice are said to be abandoned by the first path.

original: paṭhamamaggavajjhatā vuttā. Yadi evaṃ “tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sotāpanno hotī”ti
analyzed: paṭhama magga vajjhatā vuttā yadi evam tiṇṇam saṃyojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannaḥ hoti iti
translated: But if that is so, how should the passage “One is a stream-enterer with the destruction of three fetters and the diminishing of greed, hatred, and delusion” be interpreted?🔽That was said according to a sutta method.

original: suttapadaṃ kathanti? Taṃ suttantapariyāyena vuttaṃ. Yathānulomasāsanā hi suttantadesanā,
analyzed: sutta padam kathanti tam suttanta pariyāyena vuttam yathā anuloma sāsanā hi suttanta desanā
translated: For the teaching of the suttas is in accordance with the method of the gradual teaching.

original: ayaṃ pana abhidhammanayena saṃvaṇṇanāti nāyaṃ dosoti. Oḷārikassāti thūlassa, yato🔽abhiṇhasamuppattipariyuṭṭhānatibbatāva hoti. Aṇusahagatassāti vuttappakārābhāvena
analyzed: ayam pana abhidhamma nayena saṃvaṇṇanā ti na ayam doso ti oḷārikassa ati thūlassa yatas  abhiṇha samuppatti pariyuṭṭhāna tibba tā va hoti aṇu sahagatassa ti vutta ppakāra abhāvena
translated: But this is the commentary according to the method of the Abhidhamma. So there is no fault in it.🔽Gross: gross, that is, gross in the occurrence of the defilements, gross in the occurrence of the states, gross in the occurrence of the object, and gross in the mode of occurrence.🔽Subtle: become subtle, become refined, by the absence of the aforementioned grossness.🔽The non-arising of the fetter of agitation should be understood here as stated,

original: aṇubhāvaṃ sukhumabhāvaṃ gatassa. Uddhaccasaṃyojanassapettha anuppādo vuttoyevāti🔽daṭṭhabbo yathāvuttasaṃyojanehi avinābhāvato. Ekatthatāya sotādīnaṃ sabhāvasarasalakkhaṇavasena
analyzed: aṇu bhāvam sukhuma bhāvam gatassa uddhacca saṃyojanassa pa ittha anuppādaḥ vuttaḥ yā iva ati  daṭṭhabbaḥ yathā vutta saṃyojanehi avinābhāvataḥ ekattha tāya sota ādīnam sabhāva sarasa lakkhaṇa vasena
translated: because it is invariably conjoined with the aforementioned fetters.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.

original: pajānanā, tappaccayānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ uppādādipajānanā ca vuttanayeneva veditabbāti🔽dassento “eseva nayo”ti atidisati.
analyzed: pajānanā tad paccayānam saṃyojanānam uppāda ādi pajānanā ca vutta nayena iva veditabbā ti  dassentaḥ esā iva nayo ti atidisati
translated: The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.

original: Attano vā dhammesūti attano ajjhattikāyatanadhammesu, attano ubhayadhammesu vā. Imasmiṃ
analyzed: attanaḥ vā dhammesu iti attanaḥ ajjhattika āyatana dhammesu attanaḥ ubhaya dhammesu vā imasmin
translated: The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.

original: pakkhe ajjhattikāyatanapariggaṇhanenāti ajjhattikāyatanapariggaṇhanamukhenāti attho.
analyzed: pakkhe ajjhattika āyatana pariggaṇhanena ati ajjhattika āyatana pariggaṇhana mukhena ati attho
translated: The knowledge of the internal and external as mere aggregates, etc., should be understood in the way already stated.🔽The knowledge of the internal

original: Evañca anavasesato saparasantānesu āyatanānaṃ pariggaho siddho hoti. Parassa vā dhammesūti
analyzed: evam ca anavasesataḥ sa para santānesu āyatanānam pariggahaḥ siddhaḥ hoti parassa vā dhammesu ti
translated: And thus the definition of the bases in one’s own and another’s continuity is accomplished without omission.🔽In another’s mental data too: the same method applies.

original: etthāpi eseva nayo. Rūpāyatanassāti aḍḍhekādasappabhedassa rūpasabhāvassa āyatanassa
analyzed: ettha api esa iva nayaḥ rūpa āyatanassa ati aḍḍha ekādasa ppabhedassa rūpa sabhāvassa āyatanassa
translated: In the visible-data base: in the visible-data base consisting of eleven kinds of materiality.

original: rūpakkhandhe “vuttanayena nīharitabbo”ti ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. Sesakkhandhesūti
analyzed: rūpa khandhe vutta nayena nīharitabbaḥ ti ānetvā sambandhitabbam sesa khandhesu iti
translated: It should be brought in with the words “in the visible-data base, which is the materiality aggregate, the method stated should be applied” and then the connection made.

original: vedanāsaññāsaṅkhārakkhandhesu. Vuttanayenāti iminā atidesena rūpakkhandhe “āhārasamudayā”ti
analyzed: vedanā saññā saṅkhāra kkhandhesu vutta nayena ati iminā atidesena rūpa kkhandhe āhāra samudayā ti
translated: In the remaining aggregates: in the feeling, perception, and formations aggregates.🔽By the words “the method stated” the distinction is made that in the materiality aggregate the words “with the arising of nutriment” should be used,

original: viññāṇakkhandhe “nāmarūpasamudayā”ti sesakhandhesu “phassasamudayā”ti imaṃ visesaṃ
analyzed: viññāṇa kkhandhe nāma rūpa samudayā ti sesa khandhesu phassa samudayā ti imam visesam
translated: in the consciousness aggregate the words “with the arising of mentality-materiality” should be used, and in the remaining aggregates the words “with the arising of contact” should be used.

original: vibhāveti, itaraṃ pana sabbattha samānanti khandhapabbe viya āyatanapabbepi lokuttaranivattanaṃ🔽pāḷiyaṃ gahitaṃ natthīti vuttaṃ “lokuttaradhammā na gahetabbā”ti. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.🔽Āyatanapabbavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vibhāveti itaram pana sabbattha samāna nti khandha pabbe viya āyatana pabbe pi lokuttara nivattanam  pāḷiyam gahitam natthi iti vuttam lokuttara dhammā na gahetabbā ti sesam vutta nayam eva  āyatana pabba vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: But the rest is the same in all cases.🔽The exposition of the bases is ended.

original: Bojjhaṅgapabbavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bojjhaṅga pabba vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the enlightenment factors

original: 385. Bujjhanakasattassāti kilesaniddāya paṭibujjhanakasattassa, ariyasaccānaṃ vā
analyzed: bujjhanaka sattassa ti kilesa niddāya paṭibujjhanaka sattassa ariya saccānam vā
translated: “A being who is waking up”: a being who is waking up from the sleep of defilement or who is penetrating the noble truths.

original: paṭivijjhanakasattassa. Aṅgesūti kāraṇesu, avayavesu vā. Udayavayañāṇuppattito paṭṭhāya
analyzed: paṭivijjhanaka sattassa aṅgesu iti kāraṇesu avayavesu vā udaya vaya ñāṇa uppattitaḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: “In the factors”: in the reasons or in the component parts.

original: sambodhipaṭipadāyaṃ ṭhito nāma hotīti āha “āraddhavipassakato paṭṭhāya yogāvacaroti
analyzed: sambodhi paṭipadā ayam ṭhitaḥ nāma hoti iti āha āraddha vipassakataḥ paṭṭhāya yoga avacaroti
translated: From the time of the arising of knowledge of rise and fall he is called “standing on the way to enlightenment” .

original: sambodhī”ti. Suttantadesanā nāma pariyāyakathā, ayañca satipaṭṭhānadesanā lokiyamaggavasena
analyzed: sambodhi iti suttanta desanā nāma pariyāya kathā ayam ca sati paṭṭhāna desanā lokiya magga vasena
translated: “The instruction in the suttas” is a discourse in terms of synonyms. And this instruction in the foundations of mindfulness occurs in the way of the mundane path.

original: pavattāti vuttaṃ “yogāvacaroti sambodhī”ti, aññathā “ariyasāvako”ti vadeyya.
analyzed: pavattā iti vuttam yoga avacaro ti sambodhī iti aññathā ariya sāvako ti vadeyya
translated: That is why it is said, “The meditator is standing on the way to enlightenment” . Otherwise he would say “the noble disciple.”🔽The meaning of the words “conducive to the enlightenment factor of mindfulness” should be understood in the way already stated under “conducive to the overcoming of doubt” .

original: “Satisambojjhaṅgaṭṭhānīyā”ti padassa attho “vicikicchāṭṭhānīyā”ti ettha vuttanayena veditabbo. Tanti yonisomanasikāraṃ. Tatthāti satiyaṃ, nipphādetabbe cetaṃ bhummaṃ.🔽Sati ca sampajaññañca satisampajaññaṃ. Atha vā satippadhānaṃ abhikkantādisātthakabhāvapariggaṇhanañāṇaṃ
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅga ṭṭhānīyā ti padassa atthaḥ vicikicchā ṭṭhānīyā ti ettha vutta nayena veditabbo yoniso manasikāram tattha ati satiyam nipphādetabbe ca itam bhummam 🔽sati ca sampajaññañca satisampajaññam atha vā sati ppadhānam abhikkanta ādi sātthaka bhāva pariggaṇhana ñāṇam
translated: “There”: in the establishment of mindfulness. This is a locative of sphere.

original: satisampajaññaṃ. Taṃ sabbattha satokārībhāvāvahattā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya
analyzed: sati sampajaññam tam sabbattha satokārībhāva āvaha tā sati sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya
translated: because it is the cause of the presence of mindfulness everywhere.

original: hoti. Yathā paccanīkadhammappahānaṃ, anurūpadhammasevanā ca anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ
analyzed: hoti yathā paccanīka dhamma ppahānam anurūpa dhamma sevanā ca anuppannānam kusalānam
translated: Just as the abandoning of opposing states and the arousing of the relevant states are the condition for the arising of unarisen profitable states,

original: dhammānaṃ uppādāya hoti, evaṃ satirahitapuggalavivajjanā, satokārīpuggalasevanā,🔽tattha ca yuttappayuttatā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya hotīti imamatthaṃ dasseti
analyzed: dhammānam uppādāya hoti evam sati rahita puggala vivajjanā  tattha ca yutta ppayutta tā sati sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya hoti iti imam attham dasseti
translated: so the avoiding of people devoid of mindfulness, the keeping of company with people who are mindful,🔽and the proper attention to them are the condition for the arising of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness. This is the meaning he shows by the words “Mindfulness and full awareness.”

original: “satisampajañña”ntiādinā. Tissadattatthero nāma, yo bodhimaṇḍe suvaṇṇasalākaṃ gahetvā
analyzed: sati sampajañña nti ādinā tissadatta theraḥ nāma yaḥ bodhimaṇḍe suvaṇṇa salākam gahetvā
translated: The Elder Tissadatta, who took a golden casket to the Bodhi Tree🔽and announced to the assembly, “In eighteen languages I will preach the Dhamma,”

original: “aṭṭhārasasu bhāsāsu katarabhāsāya dhammaṃ kathemī”ti parisaṃ pavāresi. Abhayattheroti
analyzed: aṭṭhārasasu bhāsāsu katara bhāsāya dhammam kathemi iti parisam pavāresi abhayatthero ti
translated: The Elder Abhaya,

original: dattābhayattheramāha.
analyzed: dattābhayattheram āha
translated: is the Elder Dattiya Abhaya.

original: Dhammānaṃ, dhammesu vā vicayo dhammavicayo, so eva sambojjhaṅgo, tassa dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa.
analyzed: dhammānam dhammesu vā vicayaḥ dhamma vicayo saḥ eva sambojjhaṅgo tassa dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: Investigation of states is the investigation of states that occur either as states or in states. That is an enlightenment factor, thus it is the enlightenment factor of investigation of states.

original: “Kusalākusalā dhammā”tiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva. Tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāroti
analyzed: kusala akusalāḥ dhammā tiādīsu yam vattabbam tat heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva tattha yoniso manasikāra bahulīkāro ti
translated: Herein, abundant use of wise attention:

original: kusalādīnaṃ taṃtaṃsabhāvasarasalakkhaṇaādikassa yāthāvato avabujjhanavasena uppanno
analyzed: kusala ādīnam taṃ taṃ sa bhāva sa rasa lakkhaṇa ādikassa yāthāvataḥ avabujjhana vasena uppannaḥ
translated: this is the occurrence of consciousness associated with knowledge that arises by way of the penetration of the specific nature, the general nature, the characteristic, etc., of the profitable, etc.,

original: ñāṇasampayuttacittuppādo. So hi aviparītamanasikāratāya “yonisomanasikāro”ti vutto,
analyzed: ñāṇa sampayutta cittuppādo so hi aviparīta manasikāra tāya yoniso manasikāraḥ ti vutto
translated: for that is called “wise attention” because it is non-delusion.

original: tadābhogatāya āvajjanāpi taggatikā eva, tassa abhiṇhaṃ pavattanaṃ bahulīkāro. Bhiyyobhāvāyāti
analyzed: tad ābhoga tāya āvajjanā api taggatikā eva tassa abhiṇham pavattanam bahulīkāraḥ bhiyyobhāvāya ati
translated: And since it is the cause of that, adverting is also so called. Its repeated occurrence is “abundant use.”🔽To increase:

original: punappunaṃ bhāvāya. Vepullāyāti vipulabhāvāya. Pāripūriyāti paribrūhanāya.
analyzed: punappunam bhāvāya vepullāya ati vipula bhāvāya pāripūriyā ati paribrūhanāya
translated: to make it happen again and again. To expand: to make it extensive. To fulfil: to make it grow.

original: Paripucchakatāti pariyogāhetvā pucchakabhāvo. Ācariye payirupāsitvā pañcapi nikāye
analyzed: paripucchaka tā ati pariyogāhetvā pucchaka bhāvaḥ ācariye nikāye
translated: To ask questions: the state of one who asks questions by way of thorough investigation. Having attended on a teacher and thoroughly investigated the five Nikayas

original: saha aṭṭhakathāya pariyogāhetvā yaṃ yaṃ tattha gaṇṭhiṭṭhānabhūtaṃ, taṃ taṃ “idaṃ
analyzed: saha aṭṭhakathāya pariyogāhetvā yam yam tattha gaṇṭhi ṭṭhāna bhūtam tam tam idam
translated: together with the commentaries, whatever is a knotty point there, he asks about that, saying “What is the meaning of this? What is the meaning of this?”

original: bhante kathaṃ, imassa ko attho”ti khandhāyatanādiatthaṃ pucchantassa dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo
analyzed: bhante katham imassa kaḥ attho ti khandha āyatana ādi attham pucchantassa dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: “Venerable sir, how is this? What is the meaning of this?”🔽When he asks the meaning of the aggregates, sense bases, etc., the factor of discernment of dhamma.

original: uppajjati. Tenāha “khandhadhātu…pe… bahulatā”ti. Vatthūnaṃ visadabhāvakaraṇanti ettha
analyzed: uppajjati tena āha khandha dhātupe vatthūnam ettha
translated: “Venerable sir, how is this? What is the meaning of this?” Then the discernment of what consists in the heard arises in him. Hence he said “The discernment of what consists in the heard is the footing for the arising of the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states” .🔽The words “in the case of the aggregates, etc.” are a mere expansion of the meaning of the words “in the case of the internal and the external” .

original: cittacetasikānaṃ pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato sarīraṃ, tappaṭibaddhāni cīvarāni ca “vatthūnī”ti
analyzed: citta cetasikānam pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvato sarīram tad paṭibaddhāni cīvarāni ca vatthūni iti
translated: The body is intended here as the “internal” since it is the site of the occurrence of consciousness and its concomitants. The “external” is the robes, etc., that are bound up with the body.

original: adhippetāni, tāni yathā cittassa sukhāvahāni honti, tathā karaṇaṃ tesaṃ visadabhāvakaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: adhippetāni tāni yathā cittassa sukha āvahāni honti tathā karaṇam tesam visada bhāva karaṇam
translated: The “making them bright” is the making of them such that they are conducive to the pleasure of consciousness.🔽Hence he said “the internal and the external” .

original: Tena vuttaṃ “ajjhattikabāhirāna”ntiādi. Ussannadosanti vātādiussannadosaṃ. Sedamalamakkhitanti🔽sedena ceva jallikāsaṅkhātena sarīramalena ca makkhitaṃ. Ca-saddena aññampi sarīrassa,
analyzed: tena vuttam ajjhattika bāhira ananti ādi ussanna dosanti vāta ādi ussanna dosam sa idam alam akkhitanti  sedena ca iva jallikā saṅkhātena sarīra malena ca makkhitam ca saddena aññam pi sarīrassa
translated: “With the taint of wind, etc.”: with the taint of wind, etc., that is to say, with the taint of wind, bile, phlegm, etc.,🔽“Smeared with dirt and grease” : smeared with dirt, that is to say, with excrement, urine, spittle, snot, etc., and smeared with grease, that is to say, with the grease of the body.🔽The word “and” implies that it is also smeared with the grease of food.

original: cittassa ca pīḷāvahaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Senāsanaṃ vāti vā-saddena pattādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: cittassa ca pīḷā āvaham saṅgaṇhāti senāsanam vā ati vā saddena patta ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: “The lodging” : the word “and” implies the bowl, etc., as well.

original: Avisade sati, visayabhūte vā. Kathaṃ bhāvanamanuyuttassa tāni visayo? Antarantarā🔽pavattanakacittuppādavasenevaṃ vuttaṃ. Te hi cittuppādā cittekaggatāya aparisuddhabhāvāya
analyzed: avisade sati visaya bhūte vā katham bhāvanam anuyuttassa tāni visayaḥ antar antarā  pavattanaka cittuppāda vasena ivam vuttam te hi cittuppādāḥ citta ekagga tāya a parisuddha bhāvāya
translated: When there is no clarity, or when there is an object of the kind already mentioned. How are they objects for one devoted to development?🔽It is said in this way because of the occurrence of the kinds of consciousness that are the basis for the kinds of defilement. For these kinds of consciousness lead to the lack of purity of the state of concentration of mind.

original: saṃvattanti. Cittacetasikesu nissayādipaccayabhūtesu. Ñāṇampīti pi-saddo sampiṇḍanattho,
analyzed: saṃvattanti citta cetasikesu nissaya ādi paccaya bhūtesu ñāṇam pi iti pi saddaḥ sampiṇḍana tthaḥ
translated: The word “and” in the words “and the object too” has the meaning of “also.”

original: tena na kevalaṃ taṃ vatthuyeva, atha kho tasmiṃ aparisuddhe ñāṇampi aparisuddhaṃ🔽hotīti nissayāparisuddhiyā taṃnissitāparisuddhi viya visayassa aparisuddhatāya visayino
analyzed: tena na kevalam tam atha kho tasmin aparisuddhe ñāṇam pi aparisuddham  hoti iti nissaya aparisuddhiyā viya visayassa aparisuddha tāya visayino
translated: Therefore it is not only the object that is impure, but also the knowledge of it is impure.

original: aparisuddhiṃ dasseti.🔽Samabhāvakaraṇanti kiccato anūnādhikabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Saddheyyavatthusmiṃ paccayavasena
analyzed: a parisuddhim dasseti  sama bhāva karaṇam ti kiccataḥ anūna adhika bhāva karaṇam saddheyya vatthusmim paccaya vasena
translated: He shows that the lack of purity of the object leads to the lack of purity of the subject, just as the lack of purity of the support leads to the lack of purity of what is supported.🔽“Making even”: making even as to function. In the case of the object of confidence,

original: adhimokkhakiccassa paṭutarabhāvena, paññāya avisadatāya, vīriyādīnañca sithilatādinā
analyzed: adhimokkha kiccassa paṭutara bhāvena paññāya avisada tāya vīriya ādīnam ca sithila tā ādinā
translated: the function of confidence is more evident because of the condition, while the function of understanding is less evident because of the lack of clarity, and the function of energy, etc., is less evident because of slackness, etc.

original: saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ hoti. Tenāha “itarāni mandānī”ti. Tatoti tasmā saddhindriyassa
analyzed: saddhi indriyam balavam ha iti tena āha itarāni mandāni iti tasmā saddhi indriyassa
translated: From that, from the fact that the faith faculty is strong and the others are weak,🔽it does not allow itself to fall into the side of indolence.🔽The act of the faith faculty is the act of supporting, the act of assisting, the act of strengthening the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of indolence.

original: balavabhāvato, itaresañca mandattā. Kosajjapakkhe patituṃ adatvā sampayuttadhammānaṃ🔽paggaṇhanaṃ anubalappadānaṃ paggaho, paggahova kiccaṃ paggahakiccaṃ, “kātuṃ na sakkotī”ti🔽ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. Ārammaṇaṃ upagantvā ṭhānaṃ, anissajjanaṃ vā upaṭṭhānaṃ. Vikkhepapaṭikkhepo,
analyzed: balava bhāvataḥ itaresam ca manda ttā kosajja pakkhe patitum a datvā sampayutta dhammānam  paggaṇhanam anubala ppadānam paggahaḥ paggahaḥ uva kiccam paggaha kiccam kātum na sakkoti iti  ānetvā sambandhitabbam ārammaṇam upagantvā ṭhānam a nissajjanam vā upaṭṭhānam vikkhepa paṭikkhepaḥ
translated: The act of energy is the act of exerting, the act of striving, the act of endeavouring of the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of agitation.🔽The act of mindfulness is the act of establishing, the act of not forsaking the object by not allowing itself to fall into the side of negligence.🔽The act of concentration is the act of not distracting, the act of not scattering the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of distraction.🔽The act of understanding is the act of seeing, the act of penetrating the individual and general characteristics of the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of confusion.

original: yena vā sampayuttā avikkhittā honti, so avikkhepo. Rūpagataṃ viya cakkhunā yena yāthāvato🔽visayasabhāvaṃ passati, taṃ dassanakiccaṃ. Kātuṃ na sakkoti balavatā saddhindriyena
analyzed: yena vā sampayuttāḥ a vikkhittāḥ honti saḥ avikkhepaḥ rūpa gatam viya cakkhunā yena yāthāvato  visaya sabhāvam passati tam dassana kiccam kātum na sakkoti balavatā saddhindriyena
translated: The act of faith is the act of resolving, the act of believing, the act of trusting the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of doubt.🔽The act of energy is the act of exerting, the act of striving, the act of endeavouring of the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of indolence.🔽The act of mindfulness is the act of establishing, the act of not forsaking the object by not allowing itself to fall into the side of agitation.

original: abhibhūtattā. Sahajātadhammesu hi indaṭṭhaṃ kārentānaṃ sahapavattamānānaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: abhibhūta ttā sahajāta dhammesu hi indaṭṭham kārentānam saha pavattamānānam dhammānam
translated: The act of concentration is the act of not distracting, the act of not scattering the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of negligence.🔽The act of understanding is the act of seeing, the act of penetrating the individual and general characteristics of the associated states by not allowing itself to fall into the side of distraction.

original: ekarasatāvaseneva atthasiddhi, na aññathā. Tasmāti vuttamevatthaṃ kāraṇabhāvena paccāmasati.🔽Tanti saddhindriyaṃ. Dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇenāti yassa saddheyyassa vatthuno uḷāratādiguṇe
analyzed: ekarasa tā vasena iva na aññathā tasmā iti vuttam evattham kāraṇa bhāvena  tatti saddhi indriyam dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena ati yassa saddheyyassa vatthuno uḷāra tā ādi guṇe
translated: The meaning is established by the mere fact of its being of one taste, not otherwise. So the reason is stated by the words “Therefore, etc.”🔽“That” is the faith faculty.

original: adhimuccanassa sātisayappavattiyā saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ jātaṃ, tassa paccayapaccayuppannatādivibhāgato🔽yāthāvato vīmaṃsanena. Evañhi evaṃdhammatānayena sabhāvasarasato pariggayhamāne savipphāro🔽adhimokkho na hoti “ayaṃ imesaṃ dhammānaṃ sabhāvo”ti parijānanavasena paññābyāpārassa🔽sātisayattā. Dhuriyadhammesu hi yathā saddhāya balavabhāve paññāya mandabhāvo hoti,
analyzed: adhimuccanassa sa atisaya ppavattiyā saddhi indriyam balavam jātam tassa paccaya paccaya uppanna tā ādi vibhāgato  yāthāvataḥ vīmaṃsanena evam hi evaṃdhammatā nayena sabhāva sarasataḥ pariggayhamāne sa vipphāro  adhimokkhaḥ na hoti ayam imesam dhammānam sabhāvaḥ ti parijānana vasena paññā byāpārassa  sā ati saya ttā dhuriya dhammesu hi yathā saddhāya balava bhāve paññāya manda bhāvaḥ hoti
translated: By reviewing the nature of things: when the faith faculty has become strong through the act of believing in the special qualities of a trustworthy object, then by the act of investigating it as to how it is the condition and how it originates, etc.,🔽by the method of the nature of things, the act of believing is not diffused, since the function of understanding is strong by way of the full comprehension of the nature of things,🔽thinking “This is the nature of these things.” For just as when faith is strong, understanding is weak,

original: evaṃ paññāya balavabhāve saddhāya mandabhāvo hotīti. Tena vuttaṃ “taṃ dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena
