original: dassetuṃ “sā cā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha sāti kuladārikā. Ca-saddo byatirekattho, tena
analyzed: dassetum sā ca iti ādi vuttam tattha sā ati kula dārikā ca saddaḥ byatireka atthaḥ tena
translated: “And she” and so on is said. Herein, “she” is the noble girl. The word “and” has the meaning of addition. Therefore,

original: vuccamānaṃ visesaṃ joteti. Kulagharanti patikulagehaṃ. Gabbhanimittanti gabbhassa
analyzed: vuccamānam visesam joteti kula gharam ti pati kula geham gabbha nimittam ti gabbhassa
translated: He illuminates the distinction that is being spoken of. The house of the clan : the house of the clan of her husband. The sign of pregnancy : the sign of the conception of the embryo.

original: saṇṭhitabhāvanimittaṃ. Satipi visākhāya ca sāvatthivāsikulapariyāpannatte tassā tattha
analyzed: saṇṭhita bhāva nimittam visākhāya ca sāvatthi vāsi kula pariyāpannatte
translated: Although Visākhā was included in the clan of the people of Sāvatthī,

original: padhānabhāvadassanatthaṃ “visākhañcā”ti vuttaṃ yathā “brāhmaṇā āgatā vāsiṭṭhopi āgato”ti.🔽Devatāti idhapi sā eva suddhāvāsadevatā. Pañheti “bhikkhu bhikkhu ayaṃ vammiko”tiādinā
analyzed: padhāna bhāva dassana ttham visākhañca ati vuttam yathā brāhmaṇāḥ āgatāḥ vāsiṭṭhaḥ api āgataḥ ti  devatā ti idha api sā eva suddhāvāsa devatā pañhe ti bhikkhu bhikkhu ayam vammikā iti ādinā
translated: the words “Visākhā and” are said in order to show her pre-eminence there, just as it is said “The brahmins have come and Vāseṭṭha has come.”

original: āgate pannarasapañhe.🔽Setabyāti itthiliṅgavasena tassa nagarassa nāmaṃ. Uttarenāti ena-saddayogena “setabya”nti
analyzed: āgate pannarasa pañhe  itthi liṅga vasena tassa nagarassa nāmam uttarena ati ena sadda yogena
translated: Devatā : here too it is that same Suddhāvāsa deity. The fifteen questions : the fifteen questions that were asked, beginning with “Bhikkhu, bhikkhu, this is a termite-mound.”

original: upayogavacanaṃ pāḷiyaṃ vuttaṃ. Atthavacanena pana uttarasaddaṃ apekkhitvā setabyatoti
analyzed: upayoga vacanam pāḷiyam vuttam attha vacanena pana uttara saddam apekkhitvā setabyato ti
translated: Setabya : this is the name of the city in the feminine gender. From the north : the words “from Setabya” are stated in the text with the enclitic enas affix in order to show the use of the word. But with the meaning of the word, the genitive case is required, and so the construction “from Setabya”

original: nissakkappayogo kato. Anabhisittakarājāti khattiyajātiko abhisekaṃ appatto.
analyzed: nissakka ppayogaḥ kataḥ an abhisittaka rājā āti khattiya jātikaḥ abhisekam appatto
translated: is made by taking the word uttara as referring to the word setabya. A king who has not been anointed : a person of the warrior caste who has not received the anointing.

original: Pāyāsirājaññavatthuvaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of the Chief Disciple Pāyāsi

original: 407. Diṭṭhiyeva diṭṭhigatanti gata-saddena padavaḍḍhanamāha, diṭṭhiyā vā gatamattaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhiyā iva diṭṭhi gatam ti gata saddena pada vaḍḍhanam āha diṭṭhiyā vā gata mattam
translated: “View is the ‘state of being a view’ ”: he shows the extension of the word “state of being” by the word “view” or the mere being gone to by view.

original: diṭṭhigataṃ, ayāthāvaggāhitāya gantabbābhāvato diṭṭhiyā gahaṇamattaṃ, kevalo micchābhinivesoti🔽attho, taṃ pana diṭṭhigataṃ tassa ayonisomanasikārādivasena uppajjitvā paṭipakkhasammukhībhāvābhāvato,
analyzed: diṭṭhi gatam a yāthāvaggāhitāya gantabba abhāvataḥ diṭṭhiyāḥ gahaṇa mattam kevalaḥ micchā abhinivesaḥ ti  atthaḥ tam pana diṭṭhi gatam tassa ayoniso manasikāra ādi vasena uppajjitvā paṭipakkha sammukhībhāva abhāvato
translated: The meaning is: the mere holding of a view, since there is no going to it because of wrong apprehension.

original: anurūpāhāralābhato ca samudācārappattaṃ jātanti pāḷiyaṃ “uppannaṃ hotī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Taṃ taṃ kāraṇaṃ apadisitvāti tato idhāgacchanakassa, ito tattha gacchanakassa ca
analyzed: anurūpa āhāra lābhato ca samudācāra ppattam jātanti pāḷiyam uppannam hoti iti vuttam  tam tam kāraṇam apadisitvā ati tatas idha āgacchanakassa itas tattha gacchanakassa ca
translated: But that “state of being a view” is called “arisen” in the text as “come to presence” because it has arisen by means of such causes as wrong reflection, etc., and because it has come to presence by the absence of the presence of its opposite, and because it has obtained a suitable nutriment.

original: apadisanato “tattha tattheva sattānaṃ ucchijjanato”ti evamādi taṃ taṃ kāraṇaṃ paṭirūpakaṃ apadisitvā.
analyzed: apadisanataḥ tattha tattha iva sattānam ucchijjanato ti evamādi tam tam kāraṇam paṭirūpakam apadisitvā
translated: “Without making any reason known”: without making any reason known that would be a simile for that, such as “because beings are annihilated there and then” , etc., for one who is coming here from there or going there from here.

original: 408. Āpannānadhippetatthavisaye ayaṃ purā-saddapayogoti āha “purā…pe… saññāpetīti yāva na saññāpetī”ti.
analyzed: āpanna anadhippeta attha visaye ayam purā sadda payogo ti āha purā āpe saññā apeti iti yāva na saññā apeti iti
translated: “The word ‘purā’ is used here in the sense of the sphere of meaning intended by the word ‘āpanna’” .

original: Candimasūriyaupamāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Simile of the Moon and the Sun

original: 411. Yathā candimasūriyā uḷāravipulobhāsatāya aññena obhāsena anabhibhavanīyā, evamayampi
analyzed: yathā candima sūriyāḥ uḷāra vipula ubhāsa tāya aññena obhāsena an abhibhavanīyāḥ evam ayam pi
translated: And just as the moon and sun are not outshone by any other radiance, so too

original: paññāobhāsenāti dassento “candima…pe… aññenā”tiādimāha. Ādīhīti ādi-saddena “kittake
analyzed: dassento candimape aññena ati ādim āha ādīhi iti ādi saddena kittake
translated: this wisdom is not outshone by any other wisdom. Showing this, he said, “The moon and sun … by any other.”

original: ṭhāne ete pavattenti, kittakañca ṭhānaṃ nesaṃ ābhā pharatī”ti evamādimpi codanaṃ🔽saṅgaṇhāti. Paliveṭhessatīti ābandhissati, anuyuñjissatīti attho. Nibbeṭhetuṃ taṃ
analyzed: ṭhāne ete pavattenti kittakam ca ṭhānam ābhā pharati iti evamādim pi codanam  saṅgaṇhāti paliveṭhessati iti ābandhissati anuyuñjissati iti atthaḥ nibbeṭhetum tam
translated: By the word “etc.,” he includes such questions as, “How far do they extend? How far does their radiance spread?”

original: vissajjetuṃ. Tasmāti yasmā yathāvuttaṃ codanaṃ nibbeṭhetuṃ na sakkoti, tasmā. Attano
analyzed: vissajjetum tasmā iti yasmai yathā vuttam codanam nibbeṭhetum na sakkoti tasmai attanaḥ
translated: He will entangle himself means he will bind himself, he will pursue the matter. To extricate means to release. Therefore means because he is unable to extricate himself from the questions as asked, therefore.

original: anicchitaṃ saṅghātanaṃ pakkhaṃ paṭijānanto “parasmiṃ loke, na imasmi”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: an icchitam saṅghātanam pakkham paṭijānantaḥ parasmin loke na imasmin ti ādim āha
translated: Acknowledging that he has taken a side that is not acceptable to himself, he says, “In the other world, not in this.”

original: Kathaṃ panāyaṃ natthikadiṭṭhi “devo”ti paṭijānātīti tattha kāraṇaṃ dassetuṃ “bhagavā
analyzed: katham pana ayam natthika diṭṭhi devaḥ ti paṭijānāti iti tattha kāraṇam dassetum bhagavā
translated: But how is it that he, who holds the view of annihilation, acknowledges the existence of a god? In order to show the reason for this, he says, “But the Blessed One …

original: panā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Devāpi devattabhāveneva ucchijjanti, manussāpi manussattabhāveneva
analyzed: pana atiādi vuttam devā api devatta bhāvena iva ucchijjanti manussā api manussatta bhāvena iva
translated: gods are annihilated by the mere fact of being gods, humans by the mere fact of being humans,

original: ucchijjantī”ti evaṃ vā assa diṭṭhi, evañca katvā “devā te, na manussā”ti vacanañca
analyzed: ucchijjanti iti evam vai assa diṭṭhi evam ca katvā devā te na manussā ati vacanañca
translated: Or he might have the view that they are gods, not human beings, and so he would not contradict the statement that they are gods, not human beings.

original: na virujjhati. Evaṃ candeti candavimāne, na ca cande vā kathiyante.
analyzed: na virujjhati evam canda iti canda vimāne na ca cande vā kathiyante
translated: ‘In the moon’s mansion’ means in the moon’s abode, not in the moon.

original: 412. Ābādho etesaṃ atthīti ābādhikā. Dukkhaṃ sañjātaṃ etesanti dukkhitā. Saddhāya
analyzed: ābādhaḥ etesam atthi iti ābādhikā dukkham sañjātam etesan ti dukkhitā saddhāya
translated: ‘The sick’ are those who have pain. ‘The afflicted’ are those in whom pain has arisen.

original: ayitabbā saddhāyikā, saddhāya pavattiṭṭhānabhūtā. Tenāha “ahaṃ tumhe”tiādi. Paccayo
analyzed: ayitabbā saddhāyikā saddhāya pavatti ṭṭhāna bhūtā tena āha aham tumhā iti ādi paccayaḥ
translated: ‘The faithful’ are those who are to be supported by faith. ‘The faithful ones’ are those in whom faith is established. Therefore he said, “I am yours,” etc. ‘The conditions’ are the means of obtaining.

original: pattiyāyanaṃ etesu atthīti paccayikā.
analyzed: pattiyāyanam etesu atthi iti paccayikā
translated: ‘The conditional’ means they have conditions.

original: Coraupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: cora upamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Simile of the Thief

original: 413. Uddisitvāti upecca dassetvā. Kammakāraṇikasattesūti nerayikānaṃ saṅghātanakasattesu.
analyzed: uddisitvā ti upecca dassetvā kamma kāraṇika sattesu iti nerayikānam saṅghātanaka sattesu
translated: ‘Having pointed out’: having pointed out, having shown. ‘Among the beings who are the makers of kamma’: among the beings in hell who are the makers of the kamma that leads to hell.

original: Kammamevāti tehi tehi nerayikehi katakammameva. Kammakāraṇaṃ karotīti āyūhanānurūpaṃ
analyzed: kammam eva ati tehi tehi nerayikehi kata kammam eva kamma kāraṇam karoti iti āyūhana anurūpam
translated: ‘The kamma itself’: the kamma itself that is made by those who are in hell. ‘He makes the kamma the reason’: he makes the reason in accordance with the accumulation .

original: taṃ taṃ kāraṇaṃ karoti, tathā dukkhaṃ uppādetīti attho. Nirayapālāti ettha iti-saddo
analyzed: tam tam kāraṇam karoti tathā dukkham uppādeti iti atthaḥ niraya pālā ti ettha iti saddaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he produces the suffering in that way. ‘The wardens of hell’: here the word iti

original: ādiattho, tena tattha sabbaṃ nirayakaṇḍapāḷiṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Evaṃ suttato nirayapālānaṃ
analyzed: ādi attho tena tattha sabbam niraya kaṇḍa pāḷim saṅgaṇhāti evam suttataḥ niraya pālānam
translated: The meaning of the first word is all the text of the Nirayakanda .

original: atthibhāvaṃ dassetvā idāni yuttitopi dassetuṃ “manussaloke”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha nerayike
analyzed: atthi bhāvam dassetvā idāni yuttitaḥ pi dassetum manussa loka itiādi vuttam tattha nerayike
translated: Having thus shown the existence of the Niraya-guardians by the Sutta, he now says “in the human world” in order to show it by reasoning.

original: niraye pālenti tato niggantuṃ appadānavasena rakkhantīti nirayapālā. Yaṃ panettha
analyzed: niraye pālenti tatas niggantum appadāna vasena rakkhanti iti niraya pālāḥ yam pana ittha
translated: Therein, the Niraya-guardians are so called because they guard the Nirayins in Niraya, because they protect them by not allowing them to escape.

original: vattabbaṃ, taṃ papañcasūdanīṭīkāyaṃ gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vattabbam tam papañcasūdanī ṭīkāyam gahetabbam
translated: But what is to be said here can be understood from the Papañcasudani Commentary.

original: Gūthakūpapurisaupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: gūtha kūpa purisa aupamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The simile of the man in the cesspit.

original: 415. Nimmajjathāti niravasesato majjatha sodhetha. Taṃ pana tassa tassa gūthassa tathā sodhanaṃ apanayanaṃ hotīti āha “apanethā”ti.
analyzed: nimmajjatha ati niravasesataḥ majjatha sodhetha tam pana tassa tassa gūthassa tathā sodhanam apanayanam hoti iti āha apanetha iti
translated: “Sink down” means: sink down without remainder, purify. But that purification, that removal of this or that excrement, is what is meant by “remove.”

original: Asucīti asuddho, so pana yasmā manavaḍḍhanako manoharo na hoti, tasmā āha “amanāpo”ti.
analyzed: asuci iti asuddho saḥ pana yasmai manoharaḥ na hoti tasmai āha amanāpaḥ iti
translated: “Filthy” means impure. But that is not delightful to the mind, because it is not a source of mental growth, and so he says “disagreeable.”

original: Asucisaṅkhātaṃ asucibhāgataṃ attano sabhāvataṃ gato pattoti asucisaṅkhātoti āha “asucikoṭṭhāsabhūto”ti.
analyzed: asuci saṅkhātam asuci bhāgatam attano sabhāva tam gato patto ti asuci saṅkhātaḥ iti āha asuci koṭṭhāsa bhūto ti
translated: “Having become” means: having attained, having reached, the state of impurity which is called “filth,” which is his own nature. Therefore he says: “having become the abode of impurity.”

original: Duggandhoti duṭṭhagandho aniṭṭhagandho, so pana na yo koci, atha kho pūtigandhoti
analyzed: duggandho ti duṭṭha gandho aniṭṭha gandho so pana na yaḥ koci atha kho pūti gandho ti
translated: Foul-smelling: stinking, of an unpleasant smell. But that is not just any kind of smell, rather it is a smell like a corpse’s.🔽The words “like a corpse’s” are said.

original: āha “kuṇapagandho”ti. Jigucchitabbayuttoti hīḷitabbayutto. Paṭikūlo ghānindriyassa🔽paṭikūlarūpo. Ubbādhatīti uparūpari bādhati. Manussānaṃ gandho…pe… bādhati ativiya
analyzed: āha kuṇapa gandhaḥ ti jigucchitabba yutto ti hīḷitabba yutto paṭikūlaḥ ghāna indriyassa  paṭikūla rūpaḥ ubbādhati iti upari upari bādhati manussānam gandhope bādhati ativiya
translated: Repulsive: repulsive to the nose faculty.🔽Oppressive: oppressive again and again.

original: asucisabhāvattā, asucimhiyeva jātasaṃvaddhanabhāvato, devānañca ghānapasādassa tikkhavisadabhāvato.
analyzed: asuci sabhāva ttā asucimhi iva jāta saṃvaddhana bhāvataḥ devānam ca ghāna pasādassa tikkha visada bhāvataḥ
translated: The smell of human beings … is oppressive because it is impure by nature, because it is born and grows in what is impure, and because the nose faculty of deities is keen and clear.

original: 416. Dūre nibbattā paranimmitavasavattiādayo.
analyzed: dūre nibbattā para nimmita vasavatti ādayaḥ
translated: Far away: the Paranimmitavasavatti deities and so on.

original: 419. Sundaradhammeti sobhanaguṇe. Sugatisukhanti sugati ceva tappariyāpannaṃ sukhañca.
analyzed: sundara dhamma iti sobhana guṇe sugati sukham ti sugati ca iva tad pariyāpannam sukham ca
translated: Beautiful things: good qualities. Happiness of the good bourn: the good bourn and the happiness included in it.

original: Gabbhinīupamāvaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Simile of the Pregnant Woman

original: 420. Puññakammato eti uppajjatīti ayo, sukhaṃ. Tappaṭipakkhato anayo, dukkhaṃ. Apakkanti
analyzed: puñña kammataḥ eti uppajjati iti ayaḥ sukham tad paṭipakkhataḥ anayaḥ dukkham
translated: It comes from kamma, thus it is good; it is happiness. It is not good, thus it is bad; it is suffering. It is not completed, not brought to an end,

original: na siddhaṃ na niṭṭhānappattaṃ. Na paripācenti na niṭṭhānaṃ pāpenti. Na upacchindanti
analyzed: na siddham na niṭṭhāna ppattam na paripācenti na niṭṭhānam pāpenti na upacchindanti
translated: it is not fulfilled, not brought to fulfilment, it is not cut off,

original: attavinipātassa sāvajjabhāvato. Āgamentīti udikkhanti. Nibbisanti yassa pana taṃ
analyzed: atta vinipātassa sāvajja bhāvataḥ āgamenti iti udikkhanti nibbisanti yassa pana tam
translated: They are “coming” in the sense of “looking up” .

original: kammaphalaṃ nibbisanto niyuñjanto, nibbisanti vā nibbesaṃ vetanaṃ paṭikaṅkhanto bhatapuriso yathā.
analyzed: kamma phalam nibbisantaḥ niyuñjantaḥ nibbisanti vā nibbesam vetanam paṭikaṅkhantaḥ bhata purisaḥ yathā
translated: “They are disappointed” : he who is disappointed in the result of his action and is engaged in it, or he who is disappointed in the sense of “seeking wages” , like a hired man.

original: 421. Ubbhinditvāti upasaggena padavaḍḍhanamattanti āha “bhinditvā”ti.
analyzed: ubbhinditvā iti upasaggena pada vaḍḍhanam attanti āha bhinditvā iti
translated: “They break up” : the prefix upa is merely a reduplication.

original: Supinakaupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: supinaka aupamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The simile of the dream

original: 422. “Nikkhamantaṃ vā pavisantaṃ vā jīva”nti idaṃ tassa ajjhāsayavasena vuttaṃ. So🔽hi “sattānaṃ supinadassanakāle attabhāvato jīvo bahi nikkhamitvā taṃtaṃārāmarāmaṇeyyakadassanādivasena
analyzed: nikkhamantam vā pavisantam vā jīvanti idam tassa ajjhāsaya vasena vuttam so  hi sattānam supina dassana kāle atta bhāvataḥ jīvaḥ bahi nikkhamitvā taṃ taṃ ārāma rāmaṇeyyaka dassana ādi vasena
translated: “The living being that is leaving or entering” : this is said with reference to his intention.🔽For he has a perverted mind, a wrong view, which proceeds thus: “At the time when living beings see dreams, the living being that is the self goes out from the body and, after seeing various things such as the beauty of a monastery, etc.,

original: ito cito ca paribbhamitvā punadeva attabhāvaṃ anupavisatī”ti evaṃ pavattamicchāgāhavipallattacitto.
analyzed: itas citas ca paribbhamitvā punar eva atta bhāvam anupavisati iti evam pavatta micchā gāha vipallatta cittaḥ
translated: it enters the body again.”

original: Athassa thero khuddakāya āṇiyā vipulaṃ āṇiṃ nīharanto viya jīvasamaññāmukhena ucchedadiṭṭhiṃ
analyzed: athassa thero khudda kāyaḥ āṇiyā vipulam āṇim nīharantaḥ viya jīva samaññā mukhena uccheda diṭṭhim
translated: Then the Elder, as if he were taking out a large rope from a small one,

original: nīharitukāmo “api nu tā tuyhaṃ jīvaṃ passanti pavisantaṃ vā nikkhamantaṃ vā”ti āha.
analyzed: nīharitu kāmaḥ api nu tā tuyham jīvam passanti pavisantam vā nikkhamantam vā iti āha
translated: He said: “Do they see your life-principle entering or leaving?”

original: Yattha pana tathārūpā jīvasamaññā, taṃ dassento “cittācāraṃ jīvanti gahetvā āhā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yattha pana tathārūpā jīva samaññā tam dassento citta ācāram jīvanti gahetvā āha ati vuttam
translated: But where there is such a designation of life-principle, he said: “They live by the mind’s activity, taking it as life-principle” .

original: 423. Veṭhetvāti vekhadānasaṅkhepena veṭhetvā. Cavanakāleti cavanassa cutiyā pattakāle,
analyzed: veṭhetvā iti vekhadāna saṅkhepena veṭhetvā cavana kāle ti cavanassa cutiyā patta kāle
translated: “Having enclosed it” : having enclosed it by the brief description of the enclosure of the gift . “At the time of death” : at the time of death, of decease.

original: na cavamānakāle. Rūpakkhandhamattamevāti katipayarūpadhammasaṅghātamattameva. Utusamuṭṭhānarūpadhammasamūhamattameva
analyzed: na cavamāna kāle rūpa kkhandha mattam eva ati katipaya rūpa dhamma saṅghāta mattam eva utu samuṭṭhāna rūpa dhamma samūha mattam eva
translated: Not at the time of dying. “Mere material form” : mere collection of a few material qualities.

original: hi tadā labbhati, matta-saddo vā visesanivattiattho, tena kammajāditisantatirūpavisesaṃ🔽nivatteti. Appavattā hontīti appavattikā honti, na upalabbhatīti attho. Viññāṇe pana
analyzed: hi tadā labbhati matta saddaḥ vā visesa nivatti atthaḥ tena kamma ja āditi santati rūpa visesam  nivatteti appavattāḥ honti iti appavattikāḥ honti na upalabbhati iti atthaḥ viññāṇe pana
translated: For only a collection of material qualities originated by temperature is found at that time. Or the word “mere” has the meaning of exclusion; thus it excludes the material qualities of the continuity that are originated by kamma, etc.

original: jīvasaññī, tasmā “viññāṇakkhandho gacchatī”ti āha, tattha anupalabbhanatoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: jīva saññī tasmā viññāṇa kkhandhaḥ gacchati iti āha tattha anupalabbhanato ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “They do not continue” : they do not continue to exist. The meaning is: they are not found. But in the case of consciousness, there is the designation of life-principle. Therefore he said: “The consciousness aggregate goes.” The intention is: because it is not found there .

original: Santattaayoguḷaupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: san tad ta ayaḥ guḷa aupamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The simile of the red-hot iron ball

original: 424. Vūpasantatejanti vigatusmaṃ.
analyzed: vūpasantatejanti
translated: “With its heat subsided” : with its flame extinguished.

original: 425. Āmatoti ettha ā-saddo āmisa-saddo viya upaḍḍhapariyāyoti āha “addhamato”ti,
analyzed: ettha āsaddaḥ āmisa saddaḥ viya upaḍḍha pariyāyo ti āha addhamatoti
translated: Herein, the prefix ā- in āmatam is as if it were āmisa; it is half-pariyāya, thus it is “addhamato” .

original: āmatoti vā īsaṃ darathena usmanā yuttamaraṇo marantoti attho. Mīyamāno hi avigatusmo🔽hoti, na mato viya vigatusmo. Tenāha “marituṃ āraddho hotī”ti. Tathā rūpassa odhunanaṃ
analyzed: vai īsam darathena usmanā yutta maraṇaḥ maranto ti atthaḥ mīyamānaḥ hi  hoti na mataḥ viya tena āha maritum āraddhaḥ hoti iti tathā rūpassa odhunanam
translated: Or alternatively, āmatam is that which is dying, which is connected with the dying-state consisting in the loss of heat in the stomach.🔽For what is dying is not without heat,🔽unlike what is dead and without heat. That is why he said “has begun to die” .🔽So too, the shaking of the material body

original: nāmassa orato parivattanamevāti āha “orato karothā”ti. Orato kātukāmassa pana saṃparivattanaṃ
analyzed: nāmassa oratas parivattanam eva ati āha oratas karotha ati oratas kātu kāmassa pana saṃparivattanam
translated: and the turning away of consciousness are called “shaking” and “turning away” .🔽But what is meant by “shaking” is the turning away of consciousness, and what is meant by “turning away” is the shaking. That is why he said “shaking” and “turning away” .

original: sandhunanaṃ, taṃ pana parato karaṇanti āha “parato karothā”ti. Paramukhaṃ katassa🔽ito cito parivattanaṃ niddhunananti āha “aparāparaṃ karothā”ti. Indriyāni aparibhinnānīti
analyzed: sandhunanam tam pana paratas karaṇanti āha paratas karotha ati para mukham katassa  itas citas parivattanam niddhunanam iti āha apara aparam karotha ati indriyāni a paribhinnāni iti
translated: What is meant by “turning away” is the turning away from the front and the turning away from the back. That is why he said “from the front” and “from the back” .

original: adhippāyena “tañcāyatanaṃ na paṭisaṃvedetī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Saṅkhadhamaupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: adhippāyena tat ca āyatanam na paṭisaṃvedeti iti vuttam 🔽saṅkha dhama aupamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The faculties are undiminished, is said with the intention that the base is not discerned.

original: 426. Saṅkhaṃ dhamati, dhamāpetīti vā saṅkhadhamo. Upalāpetvāti uparūpari saddayogavasena sallāpetvā, saddayuttaṃ katvāti attho. Taṃ pana atthato dhamanamevāti āha “dhamitvā”ti.
analyzed: saṅkham dhamati dhamāpeti iti vā saṅkhadhamaḥ upalāpetvā ati upari upari sadda yoga vasena sallāpetvā sadda yuttam katvā iti attho tam pana atthataḥ dhamanam eva ati āha dhamitvā iti
translated: He blows it or has it blown, thus he is a blower of conches. He has it blown: he has it blown by making it sound by the application of more and more sound; the meaning is, he has it sounded. But in fact he blows it himself, thus he said ‘he has it blown’ .

original: Aggikajaṭilaupamāvaṇṇanā🔽428. Āhito aggi etassa atthīti aggiko, svāssa aggikabhāvo yasmā aggihutamālāvedisampādanehi
analyzed: aggika jaṭila aupamā vaṇṇanā  āhitaḥ aggi etassa atthi iti aggikaḥ aggika bhāvaḥ yasmai aggi huta mālā vedi sampādanehi
translated: The simile of the fire-worshipper

original: ceva indhanadhūmabarihisasappitelūpaharaṇehi balipupphadhūmagandhādiupahārehi ca🔽tassa payirupāsanāya icchito, tasmā vuttaṃ “aggiparicārako”ti. Āyuṃ pāpuṇāpeyyanti
analyzed: indhana dhūma bari hisa sappi telu upaharaṇehi bali puppha dhūma gandha ādi upahārehi ca  tassa icchito tasmā vuttam aggi paricārako ti āyum pāpuṇāpeyyanti
translated: He has fire, thus he is a fire-worshipper . Now, the fact that he is a fire-worshipper is because he is desirous of worshipping him by means of the performance of the fire oblation, the fire-altar, the garland, the lamp, the hearth, the fuel, the smoke, the embers, the ashes, and by means of the offerings of flowers, incense, scents, etc.,

original: yathā cirajīvī hoti, evaṃ āyuṃ pacchimavayaṃ pāpeyyaṃ. Vaḍḍhiṃ gameyyanti sarīrāvayave,
analyzed: yathā cira jīvī hoti evam āyum pacchima vayam pāpeyyam vaḍḍhim gameyyanti sarīra avayave
translated: thus it is said ‘he who tends the sacred fire.’ He would make his life last: he would make his last life last so that he would live long. He would make it grow: he would make it grow in the component parts of the body

original: guṇāvayave ca phātiṃ pāpeyyaṃ. Araṇī yugaḷanti uttarāraṇī, adharāraṇīti araṇīdvayaṃ.
analyzed: guṇa avayave ca phātim pāpeyyam araṇī uttarāraṇī adharāraṇī iti araṇī dvayam
translated: and in the component parts of the qualities. A pair of sticks: an upper stick and a lower stick, thus a pair of sticks.

original: 429. Evanti “bālo pāyāsirājañño”tiādippakārena. Tayāti theraṃ sandhāya vadati. Vuttayuttakāraṇamakkhalakkhaṇenāti
analyzed: evam ti bālo pāyāsi rājañño ti ādi ppakārena tayā iti theram sandhāya vadati vutta yutta kāraṇa makkha lakkhaṇena ati
translated: “Thus”: in the way beginning, “The fool, Prince Payasi” . “Three”: he is referring to the Elder. “The reason for the statement, the characteristic of a trick”:

original: vuttayuttakāraṇassa makkhanasabhāvena. Yugaggāhalakkhaṇenāti samadhuraggahaṇalakkhaṇena.🔽Palāsenāti palāsetīti palāso, parassa guṇe uttaritare ḍaṃsitvā viya chaḍḍento attano
analyzed: vutta yutta kāraṇassa makkhana sabhāvena yuga ggāha lakkhaṇena ati sa madhura ggahaṇa lakkhaṇena  palāsena ati palāseti iti palāso parassa guṇe uttaritare ḍaṃsitvā viya chaḍḍento attano
translated: the reason for the statement is the nature of a trick. “The characteristic of a yoke-fellow”: the characteristic of a companion in sweet talk.

original: guṇehi same karotīti attho. Samakaraṇaraso hi palāso, tena palāsena.
analyzed: guṇehi same karoti iti attho sama karaṇa rasaḥ hi palāsaḥ tena palāsena
translated: “With a palm-leaf”: the meaning is that he makes his own qualities equal to the other’s qualities by throwing away the other’s qualities as if he were contemptuous of them. For the meaning of “palm-leaf” is “equalizer,” and it is with that that he does it.

original: Dvesatthavāhaupamāvaṇṇanā🔽430. Haritakapattanti haritabbapattaṃ, appapattanti attho. Tenāha “antamaso”tiādi.🔽Sannaddhadhanukalāpanti ettha kalāpanti tūṇīramāha, tañca sannayhato dhanunā vinā
analyzed: haritaka pattanti haritabba pattam appapattanti attho tena āha antamasā itiādi  sannaddha dhanu kalāpanti ettha kalāpanti tūṇīram āha tat ca dhanunā vinā
translated: The simile of the two charioteers🔽“A green leaf”: a leaf that is fit to be eaten, that is, a small leaf. Hence he says “at least” .

original: na sannayhatīti āha “sannaddhadhanukalāpa”nti. Āsittodakāni vaṭumānīti gamanamaggā
analyzed: na sannayhati iti āha sannaddha dhanu kalāpanti āsitta udakāni vaṭumāni iti gamana maggā
translated: “With a quiver and a bow”: here “quiver” is a quiver for arrows, and that is not slung without a bow. Hence he says “with a quiver and a bow.” “Water-drinking places and resting places”:

original: ceva taṃtaṃudakamaggā ca sammadeva devena phuṭṭhattā tahaṃ tahaṃ paggharitaudaka
analyzed: ca iva taṃ taṃ udaka maggā ca sammat eva devena taham taham paggharita odaka
translated: and the water-courses and the clefts are all filled with water, and the water overflows and spreads here and there,

original: sandamānaudakā. Tenāha “paripuṇṇasalilā maggā ca kandarā cā”ti.
analyzed: sandamāna audakā tena āha paripuṇṇa salilā maggā ca kandarā ca ati
translated: and the water-courses and the clefts are all filled with water, and the water overflows and spreads here and there,

original: Yathābhatenāti sakaṭesu yathāṭhapitena, yathā “amma ito karohī”ti vutte ṭhapesīti attho karaṇakiriyāya kiriyāsāmaññavācībhāvato. Tasmā yathāropitena, yathāgahitenāti attho vutto.
analyzed: yathā ābhatena ati sakaṭesu yathā ṭhapitena yathā amma itas karohi iti vutte ṭhapesi iti attho karaṇa kiriyāya kiriyā sāmañña vācībhāvato tasmā yathā āropitena yathā gahitena ati atthaḥ vutto
translated: “As they were loaded” means as they were placed in the carts. The meaning is that they were placed there after saying, “Put it here.” Because the word “as” expresses similarity to an action, therefore the meaning is stated as “as they were loaded,” “as they were brought.”

original: Akkhadhuttakaupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: akkhadhuttaka upamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The simile of the dice

original: 434. Parājayaguḷanti yena guḷena, yāya salākāya ṭhitāya ca parājayo hoti, taṃ adassanaṃ
analyzed: parājaya guḷanti yena guḷena yāya salākāya ṭhitāya ca parājayaḥ hoti tam a dassanam
translated: “The losing throw” is the throw of the dice, the throw of the die, by which one loses. It swallows up the other throws.

original: gamento gilati. Pajjohananti pakārehi juhanakammaṃ. Taṃ pana balidānavasena karīyatīti āha “balikamma”nti.
analyzed: gamentaḥ gilati pajjohananti pakārehi juhana kammam tam pana bali dāna vasena āha bali kamman ti
translated: “The offering” is the act of offering by means of the parts . But that is done by way of a gift of oblations. Therefore it is said, “the oblation-offering.”

original: Sāṇabhārikaupamāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sāṇabhārika aupamā vaṇṇanā
translated: The simile of the bundle of sticks

original: 436. Gāmapattanti gāmo eva hutvā āpajjitabbaṃ, suññabhāvena anāvasitabbaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: gāma pattanti gāmaḥ eva hutvā āpajjitabbam suñña bhāvena an āvasitabbam tena āha
translated: “The village-end” is that which should be reached by the village, which should not be left unoccupied by the village. Therefore it is said,

original: “vuṭṭhitagāmapadeso”ti. Gāmapadanti yathā purisassa pādanikkhittaṭṭhānaṃ adhigataparicchedaṃ
analyzed: vuṭṭhita gāma padeso ti gāma padam ti yathā purisassa pāda nikkhitta ṭṭhānam adhigata paricchedam
translated: “The village area is the place where the village is situated.” The village area is the place where the village is situated.

original: “pada”nti vuccati, evaṃ gāmavāsīhi āvasitaṭṭhānaṃ adhigatanivutthāgāraṃ “gāmapada”nti
analyzed: padanti vuccati evam gāma vāsīhi āvasita ṭṭhānam adhigata nivuttha āgāram gāma padanti
translated: The place where the village is situated is called the village area.

original: vuttaṃ. Tenāha “ayamevattho”ti. Susannaddhoti sukhena gahetvā gamanayogyatāvasena
analyzed: vuttam tena āha ayam eva attho ti su sannaddhaḥ iti sukhena gahetvā gamana yogya tā vasena
translated: Therefore it is said: “This is the meaning.” Well-tamed means well-tamed by the method of being taken and gone well.

original: suṭṭhu sajjito. Taṃ pana susajjanaṃ suṭṭhu bandhanavasenevāti āha “subaddho”ti.
analyzed: suṭṭhu sajjito tam pana su sajjanam suṭṭhu bandhana vasena iva ati āha su baddhaḥ iti
translated: But that well-taming is only by the method of well-binding. Therefore it is said: “Well-bound.”

original: Ayādīnampi lohabhāve satipi loha-saddo sāsane tambalohe niruḷhoti āha “lohanti tambaloha”nti.
analyzed: aya ādīnam pi loha bhāve sati pi loha saddo sa āsane tamba lohe niruḷhaḥ iti āha lohanti tamba lohanti
translated: Although iron and so on also have the nature of iron, the word “iron” is established in the Dispensation for refined iron. Therefore it is said: “Iron means refined iron.”

original: Saraṇagamanavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saraṇa gamana vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of Going for Refuge

original: 437. Abhiraddhoti ārādhitacitto, sāsanassa ārādhitacittatā pasīdanavasenāti āha “abhippasanno”ti.
analyzed: abhiraddho ti ārādhita citto sāsanassa ārādhita citta tā pasīdana vasena ati āha abhippasanno ti
translated: Satisfied means having a satisfied mind, and the satisfied mind of the Dispensation is by the method of being clear. Therefore it is said: “Clear.”

original: Pañhupaṭṭhānānīti pañhesu upaṭṭhānāni mayā pucchitatthesu tumhākaṃ vissajjanavasena ñāṇupaṭṭhānāni.
analyzed: pañhupaṭṭhānāni iti pañhesu upaṭṭhānāni mayā pucchita tthesu tumhākam vissajjana vasena ñāṇa upaṭṭhānāni
translated: The bases of questions means the bases of knowledge in the answers to the questions asked by me.

original: Yaññakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: yañña kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Discussion of the Sacrifice

original: 438. Saṅghātanti saṃ-saddo padavaḍḍhanamattanti āha “ghāta”nti. Vipākaphalenāti sadisaphalena.
analyzed: saṅghātanti āha ghātanti vipāka phalena ati sadisa phalena
translated: “In a group” : the word “group” is merely a plural. “In a group” is said because of the plural. “With a fruit of the same kind” : with a fruit similar to the kind of action.

original: Mahapphalo na hoti gavādipāṇaghātena upakkiliṭṭhabhāvato. Guṇānisaṃsenāti uddayaphalena.
analyzed: mahapphalaḥ na hoti gavā ādi pāṇaghātena upakkiliṭṭha bhāvataḥ guṇa ānisaṃsena ati uddaya phalena
translated: It is not “great-fruited” because of being defiled by the killing of cattle, etc. “With a fruit of excellence” : with a fruit of the opposite kind.

original: Ānubhāvajutiyāti paṭipakkhavigamanajanitena sabhāvasaṅkhātena tejena. Na mahājutiko
analyzed: ānubhāva jutiyā ti paṭipakkha vigamana janitena sabhāva saṅkhātena tejena na mahā jutikaḥ
translated: “With a radiance of influence” : with a radiance of its own nature, which is produced by the departure of its opposite. It is not “greatly radiant”

original: hoti aparisuddhabhāvato. Vipākavipphāratāyāti vipākaphalassa vipulatāya, pāripūriyāti🔽attho. Duṭṭhukhetteti usabhādidosehi dūsitakhette, taṃ pana vappābhāvato asāraṃ hotīti
analyzed: hoti a parisuddha bhāvataḥ vipāka vipphāra tāya ati vipāka phalassa vipula tāya pāripūriyā ati  attho duṭṭhu khetta iti usabha ādi dosehi dūsita khette tam pana vappa abhāvataḥ asāram hoti iti
translated: because of its impure nature. “With a great extension of the fruit of result” : with a great extension of the fruit of result, with a great fulfilment of the fruit of result is the meaning.🔽“In a bad field” : in a field that is bad because of the faults of a bull, etc. That field is “without essence” because of the absence of cultivation.

original: āha “nissārakhette”ti. Dubbhūmeti kucchitabhūmibhāge, svāssa kucchitabhāvo asāratāya
analyzed: āha nissāra khettā iti dubbhūmā iti kucchita bhūmi bhāge kucchita bhāvaḥ asāra tāya
translated: Therefore it is said, “in a field without essence.” “In a bad soil” : in a place of bad soil. Its badness is due either to its lack of essence

original: vā siyā ninnatādidosavasena vā. Tattha paṭhamo pakkho paṭhamapadena dassitoti itaraṃ
analyzed: vā siyā ninna tā ādi dosa vasena vā tattha paṭhamaḥ pakkho paṭhama padena dassito ti itaram
translated: or to its being low-lying and so on. The first alternative is shown by the first phrase. The second is shown by the second phrase.

original: dassento “visamabhūmibhāge”ti āha. Daṇḍābhighātādinā chinnabhinnāni. Pūtīnīti gomayalepadānādisukhena
analyzed: āha daṇḍa abhighāta ādinā chinna bhinnāni pūtīni iti gomaya lepa dāna ādi sukhena
translated: “Rotten” means that they have become rotten because they have not been dried by the sun well by the application of cow dung, etc.,

original: asukkhāpitattā pūtibhāvaṃ gatāni. Tāni pana yasmā sāravantāni na honti, tasmā vuttaṃ🔽“nissārānī”ti. Vātātapahatānīti vātena ca ātapena ca vinaṭṭhabījasāmatthiyāni. Tenāha
analyzed: a sukkhāpita ttā pūti bhāvam gatāni tāni pana yasmā sāravantāni na honti tasmā vuttam  nissārāni iti vāta ātapa hatāni iti vātena ca ātapena ca vinaṭṭha bīja sāmatthiyāni tena āha
translated: and so on. But since they are not heartwood, he said “without heart.”🔽“Washed away by the rain and wind” means that the potency of the seed has been destroyed by the wind and the sun. Therefore he said

original: “pariyādinnatejānī”ti. Yaṃ yathājātavīhiādigatena taṇḍulena aṅkuruppādanayogyabījasāmatthiyaṃ,
analyzed: yam yathā jāta vīhi ādi gatena taṇḍulena aṅkura uppādana yogya bīja sāmatthiyam
translated: “their potency has been destroyed.” The potency of the seed to produce a sprout by means of the grain of rice, etc., as it has arisen,

original: taṃ taṇḍulasāro, tassa ādānaṃ gahaṇaṃ tathāuppajjanameva. Etāni pana bījāni na tādisāni🔽khaṇḍādidosavantatāya. Dhārāya khette anuppavesanaṃ nāma vassanameva, taṃ paṭikkhepavasena
analyzed: tam taṇḍulasāraḥ tassa ādānam gahaṇam tathā uppajjanam eva etāni pana bījāni na tādisāni  khaṇḍa ādi dosavanta tāya dhārāya khette anuppavesanam nāma vassanam eva tam paṭikkhepa vasena
translated: is the heartwood of the rice grain, etc. The “taking” of that is the grasping of it, the arising of it in that way. But these seeds are not like that,🔽because they are damaged by being cut, etc.🔽“Not properly sown” means not sown in the field by means of a water-bearing cloud. To show the rejection of that,

original: dassento āha “na sammā vasseyyā”ti. Aṅkuramūlapattādīhīti cettha aṅkurakandādīhi
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha na sammā vasseyya ati aṅkura mūla patta ādīhi iti ca ittha aṅkura kanda ādīhi
translated: he said “not properly sown.” “By means of the sprout, the root, the leaf, etc.” means by means of the sprout, the bulb, etc.,

original: uddhaṃ vuddhiṃ, mūlajaṭādīhi heṭṭhā viruḷhiṃ, pattapupphādīhi samantato ca vepullanti yojanā.
analyzed: uddham vuddhim mūla jaṭā ādīhi heṭṭhā viruḷhim patta puppha ādīhi samantataḥ ca vepullanti yojanā
translated: The meaning is: it grows upwards by means of the roots and so on, and it spreads all round by means of the leaves, flowers, etc.🔽By the destruction of others’ crops: by obstructing others.

original: Aparūpaghātenāti paresaṃ vibādhanena. Uppannapaccayatoti nibbattitaghāsacchādanādideyyadhammato.
analyzed: apara upaghātena ati paresam vibādhanena uppanna paccayataḥ ti nibbattita ghāsa chādana ādi deyya dhammato
translated: By the supply of requisites: by the giving of food, clothing, etc., that have been produced.🔽For there the food of the recipients is also destroyed by the destruction of the cattle, etc.

original: Gavādighātenapi hi tattha paṭiggāhakānaṃ ghāso saṅkīyati. “Aparūpaghātitāyā”ti idaṃ🔽sīlavantatāya kāraṇavacanaṃ. Guṇātirekanti guṇātirittaṃ, sīlādilokuttaraguṇehi visiṭṭhanti
analyzed: go ādi ghātena api hi tattha paṭiggāhakānam ghāsaḥ saṅkīyati aparūpa ghātitāya ati idam  kāraṇa vacanam guṇa atirekanti guṇa atirittam sīla ādi lokuttara guṇehi visiṭṭhanti
translated: By the destruction of others’ crops: this is said🔽to be the reason for his virtue.

original: attho. Vipulāti saddhāsampadādivasena uḷārā.
analyzed: atthaḥ vipulā ati saddhā sampad ādi vasena uḷārā
translated: By the excellence of his special qualities: by the excess of his special qualities; the meaning is, by his being distinguished by the special qualities of virtue, etc., that are supramundane.🔽By the abundance of his special qualities: by the greatness of his special qualities consisting in the perfection of faith, etc.

original: Uttaramāṇavavatthuvaṇṇanā
analyzed: uttaramāṇava vatthu vaṇṇanā
translated: The Story of Uttara the Student

original: 439. Atha kho tehi sakuṇḍakehi taṇḍulehi siddhaṃbhattaṃ uttaṇḍulameva hotīti āha🔽“uttaṇḍulabhatta”nti. Bilaṅgaṃ vuccati āranālaṃ bilaṅgato nibbattanato, tadeva kañjiyato
analyzed: atha kho tehi sa kuṇḍakehi taṇḍulehi siddhaṃbhattam uttaṇḍulam eva hoti iti āha  uttaṇḍulabhattanti bilaṅgam vuccati āranālam bilaṅgataḥ nibbattanataḥ tat eva kañjiyataḥ
translated: Then, because the rice was cooked in the rice-gruel, the rice was said to be “with gruel.”

original: jātanti kañjiyaṃ, taṃ dutiyaṃ etassāti bilaṅgadutiyaṃ, taṃ “kañjikadutiya”nti ca
analyzed: kañjiyam tam dutiyam etassa ati bilaṅga dutiyam tam kañjika dutiyanti ca
translated: The gruel is what is called “rice-gruel.” Because it is made from rice, it is “rice-gruel.” Because it is made from that, it is “gruel-second.” It is also called “second-gruel” .

original: vuttaṃ. Dhorakānīti dhoviyāni. Yasmā thūlatarānipi “thūlānī”ti vattabbataṃ arahanti,🔽tasmā “thūlāni cā”ti vuttaṃ. Guḷadasānīti suttānaṃ thūlatāya, kañjikassa bahalatāya
analyzed: vuttam dhorakāni iti dhoviyāni yasmā thūlatarāni pi thūlāni iti vattabbatam arahanti  tasmā thūlāni ca ati vuttam guḷa dasāni iti suttānam thūla tāya kañjikassa bahala tāya
translated: “To be washed” : to be washed clean. Because even the larger ones are to be called “large,”🔽therefore it is said: “large and” . “To be cut up” : cut up into pieces by the largeness of the thread and by the thickness of the brine.

original: ca piṇḍitadasāni. Tenāha “puñjapuñja…pe… dasānī”ti. Anuddisatīti anu anu katheti.
analyzed: ca piṇḍita dasāni tena āha puñja puñjape dasāni iti anuddisati iti anu anu kathā iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “in lumps, in pieces” . “To be distributed” : to be distributed again and again.

original: 440. Asakkaccanti na sakkaccaṃ anādarakāraṃ, taṃ pana kammaphalasaddhāya abhāvena
analyzed: a sakkaccanti na sakkaccam an ādara kāram tam pana kamma phala saddhāya abhāvena
translated: “Without respect” : not with respect, not with reverence. But that is due to the absence of faith in the fruit of action.

original: hotīti āha “saddhāvirahita”nti. Acittīkatanti cittīkārapaccupaṭṭhāpanavasena na cittīkataṃ.
analyzed: hoti iti āha saddhā virahitam ti acittīkatam ti cittīkāra paccupaṭṭhāpana vasena na cittīkatam
translated: Therefore it is said: “without faith” . “Not to be remembered” : not to be remembered by the act of remembering.

original: Tenāha “cittīkāravirahita”ntiādi. Cittīkārarahitaṃ vā acittīkataṃ, yathā kataṃ paresaṃ🔽vimhayāvahaṃ hoti, tathā akataṃ. Cittassa uḷārapaṇītabhāvo pana asakkaccadāneneva
analyzed: tena āha cittīkāra virahita ntiādi cittīkāra rahitam vā acittīkatam yathā katam paresam  vimhaya āvaham hoti tathā a katam cittassa uḷāra paṇīta bhāvo pana a sakkacca dānena iva
translated: Therefore it is said: “without remembering” . Or, not to be remembered is not remembered in the way that what is done for others🔽becomes a cause of wonder. But the greatness and excellence of the mind is hindered by the giving without respect.

original: bādhito. Apaviddhanti chaḍḍanīyadhammaṃ viya apaviddhaṃ katvā, etena tasmiṃ dāne
analyzed: bādhitaḥ chaḍḍanīya dhammam viya apaviddham katvā etena tasmim dāne
translated: “To be thrown away” : having made it as if to be thrown away, as if to be discarded. By this it is shown that in that gift

original: gāravākaraṇaṃ vadati. Serīsakaṃ nāmāti “serīsaka”nti evaṃ nāmakaṃ. Tucchanti parijanaparicchedavirahato rittaṃ.
analyzed: gāravākaraṇam vadati serīsakam nāma ati evam nāmakam parijana pariccheda virahataḥ rittam
translated: He speaks of the making of respect. A Serisaka is one who has the name Serisaka. Empty means void of a retinue of attendants.

original: Pāyāsidevaputtavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pāyāsideva putta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the God Pāyasi

original: 441. Tassānubhāvenāti tassa dānassa ānubhāvena. Sirīsarukkhoti pabhassarakhandhaviṭapasākhāpalāsasampanno
analyzed: tassa anubhāvena ati tassa dānassa ānubhāvena sirīsa rukkhaḥ ti pabhassara khandha viṭapa sākhā palāsa sampannaḥ
translated: By the power of that means by the power of that giving. The tree of glory means the divine tree of glory, which is lovely to see, and which is endowed with a trunk, a top, branches, and foliage, that are made of giving, virtue, and so on.

original: manuññadassano dibbo sirīsarukkho. Aṭṭhāsīti phalassa kammasarikkhataṃ dassento vimānadvāre
analyzed: manuññadassanaḥ dibbaḥ sirīsa rukkho aṭṭhāsi iti phalassa kamma sarikkha tam dassento vimāna dvāre
translated: It stood means it stood after emerging at the door of the divine mansion, showing that the fruit is similar to the cause.

original: nibbattitvā aṭṭhāsi. Pubbāciṇṇavasenāti purimajātiyaṃ tattha nivāsaparicayanavasena.🔽Na kevalaṃ pubbāciṇṇavaseneva, atha kho utusukhumavasena pīti dassento “tattha kirassa
analyzed: nibbattitvā aṭṭhāsi pubba āciṇṇa vasena ati purima jātiyam tattha nivāsa paricayana vasena  na kevalam pubba āciṇṇa vasena iva atha kho utu sukhuma vasena pi iti dassento tattha kirassa
translated: By the force of previous practice means by the force of his previous practice of living there in a former birth.

original: utusukhaṃ hotī”ti āha.🔽Soti uttaro māṇavo. Yadi asakkaccaṃ dānaṃ datvā pāyāsi tattha nibbatto, pāyāsissa
analyzed: utu sukham hoti iti āha  saḥ ti uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ yadi asakkaccam dānam da tvā pāyāsi tattha nibbattaḥ pāyāsissa
translated: Not only by the force of previous practice, but also by the force of the pleasant season, showing his delight, he said, “It is said that there is pleasant season there.”🔽He means the brahman youth Uttara. If Pāyasi was reborn there after giving a gift without respect, how was Pāyasi’s attendant reborn there after giving a gift with respect?

original: paricārikā sakkaccaṃ dānaṃ datvā kathaṃ tattha nibbattāti āha “pāyāsissa panā”ti.
analyzed: paricārikā sakkaccam dānam da tvā katham tattha nibbattā iti āha pāyāsissa pana iti
translated: Therefore he said, “But Pāyasi’s attendant.”

original: Nikantivasenāti pāyāsimhi sāpekkhāvasena, pubbepi vā tattha nivutthapubbatāya. Disācārikavimānanti
analyzed: nikanti vasena āti pāyāsimhi sa apekkhā vasena pubbe pi vā tattha nivuttha pubba tāya disācārika vimānan ti
translated: “By way of attachment” means by way of longing for the place of rebirth, or because of having been reborn there previously. “The mansions of the world-ranging spirits” means the mansions of the spirits who range the world.

original: ākāsaṭṭhaṃ hutvā disāsu vicaraṇakavimānaṃ, na rukkhapabbatasikharādisambandhaṃ. Vaṭṭaniaṭaviyanti vimānavīthiyanti.
analyzed: ākāsaṭṭham hutvā disāsu vicaraṇaka vimānam na rukkha pabbata sikhara ādi sambandham vaṭṭa niaṭaviyanti vimāna vīthiyanti
translated: By way of attachment: by way of longing for the place of rebirth, or because of having been reborn there previously. The celestial mansion that travels through the air: the celestial mansion that moves through the air in the ten directions, not one connected with a tree, mountain peak, etc. The forest of Vattaniya: the street of celestial mansions.

original: Pāyāsirājaññasuttavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā.🔽Niṭṭhitā ca mahāvaggaṭṭhakathāya līnatthappakāsanā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca mahā vagga ṭṭhakathāya līna attha ppakāsanā
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the Sutta on the Prince Payasi is finished.🔽And the explanation of the meaning of the Sutta on the Great Forty is finished.

original: Mahāvaggaṭīkā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahā vagga ṭīkā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Great Forty is finished.
